fawn.example: vi. 阿谀奉承: fawn on one's superior 向上司谄媚
fawn.mean: vi. 阿谀奉承： to seek favor or attention by flattery and obsequious behavior

voluble.example: adj. 健谈的，话多的: The voluble gadfly ruined the party. 聚会被那个话又多又让人讨厌的人破坏了。
voluble.mean: adj. 健谈的，话多的： characterized by ready or rapid speech

gossamer.example:
n. 虚无飘渺的东西: the gossamer of youth's dreams 年少时飘渺的梦想
adj. 轻薄的: a gossamer explanation 站不住脚的解释
gossamer.mean:
n. 虚无飘渺的东西： something light, delicate, or insubstantial
adj. 轻薄的： extremely light, delicate, or tenuous

surreptitious.example: adj. 偷偷摸摸的，保密的: took a surreptitious glance at her knees 偷偷瞟了一下她的膝盖
surreptitious.mean: adj. 偷偷摸摸的，保密的： undertaken or done so as to escape being observed or known by others

circumlocution.example:
n. 绕圈子的说话: The other son of your parents’ is a circumlocution for your brother. 你父母的其他儿子是你兄弟的绕圈子的说法。
n. 冗长: your papers have to be five pages long, but that's five pages of substance, not circumlocution. 你的论文要求是5页，但是那5页都是实质内容，不是废话。
circumlocution.mean:
n. 绕圈子的说话：the use of unnecessarily wordy and indirect language, evasion in speech
n. 冗长：the use of too many words to express an idea

predestine.example: vt. 预先注定: Our victory in the tournament was seemingly predestined. 我们在锦标赛中的胜利似乎是注定好了的
predestine.mean: vt. 预先注定： to determine the fate of in advance

chaos.example:
n. 混乱 a condition or place of great disorder or confusion.
: the boy's room is in such chaos that it looks as though a tornado had struck 小男孩的房间如此得混乱以至于看起来像台风来袭
chaos.mean: n. 混乱 a condition or place of great disorder or confusion.

elegy.example: n. 哀歌（诗），挽歌（诗）: an moving elegy played at the funeral 葬礼上演奏的催人泪下的挽歌
elegy.mean: n. 哀歌（诗），挽歌（诗）： a song or poem expressing sorrow or lamentation

tenuous.example: adj. 没有实际内容的: a tenuous argument 站不住脚的论点
tenuous.mean: adj. 没有实际内容的： having little substance; flimsy

mirage.example: n. 海市蜃楼，幻想: Reunion with her husband has become a mirage. 与他丈夫重逢已是可望而不可及的幻象‖A peaceful solution proved to be a mirage. 和平解决问题是不可能的了
mirage.mean: n. 海市蜃楼，幻想： something illusory and unattainable like a mirage

integrity.example:
n. 正直: After a thorough investigation into “Climategate”, the panel concluded that the integrity of scientific community is still sound. 经过对“气候门事件”的彻底调查，专家组认为学术界的信誉和道德仍然是值得信赖的
n. 完整性: trying to maintain the integrity of the falling empire 尽力维持日趋西山的帝国的统一
integrity.mean:
n. 正直： steadfast adherence to a strict moral or ethical code, devotion to telling the truth
n. 完整性： the quality or condition of being whole or undivided

conjure.example:
vt. 请求，恳求: I conjure you to hear my plea for mercy. 请您发发慈悲吧。‖He conjured them with his dying breath to look after his children. 临终前他恳求他们照顾他的孩子。
vi. 在脑海中浮现: With certain flowers I instantly conjure up memories of our Caribbean honeymoon. 这些鲜花让我立即回想起加勒比海的蜜月之旅。
conjure.mean:
vt. 请求，恳求： to charge or entreat earnestly or solemnly
vi. 在脑海中浮现： to form a mental picture of

ingratiating.example:
adj. 讨人喜欢的: They adopted the orphan who had a most ingratiating smile. 他们收养了那名有着最惹人喜欢的笑容的孤儿
adj. 逢迎的，意在奉承的: an repulsive ingratiating smile 令人反感的阿谀奉承的微笑
ingratiating.mean:
adj. 讨人喜欢的： capable of winning favor
adj. 逢迎的，意在奉承的： intended or adopted in order to gain favor

vile.example:
adj. 丑陋的: a truly vile combination of colors 着实丑陋的混搭色调
adj. （道德上）可鄙的，卑鄙的: Nothing is so vile as intellectual dishonesty. 没什么比智力上的欺骗更为可鄙的了。
vile.mean:
adj. 丑陋的： unpleasant to look at
adj. （道德上）可鄙的，卑鄙的： morally despicable or abhorrent

remiss.example: adj. 疏忽的，不留心的: I would be remiss if I didn't tell you how much I appreciated the lovely gift. 如果我不告诉你我是多么的喜欢这个可爱的礼物的话，那我就太疏忽大意了。
remiss.mean: adj. 疏忽的，不留心的： exhibiting carelessness or slackness

excoriate.example: v. 严厉批评: She was excoriated as a racist. 她被指责是一个种族歧视者。
excoriate.mean: v. 严厉批评： to criticize harshly and usually publicly

ungainly.example: adj. 笨拙的，不雅的: ungainly movements 笨拙的动作
ungainly.mean: adj. 笨拙的，不雅的： having or showing an inability to move in a graceful manner

sinew.example: n. 活力，力量: Money is the sinew of love as well as war. 爱情和战争都要用金钱来保证。
sinew.mean: n. 活力，力量： vigorous strength; muscular power

outwit.example: v. 瞒骗，以智取胜: a plan to outwit their opponents at their own game 在擅长的领域智取对手的计划
outwit.mean: v. 瞒骗，以智取胜： to surpass in cleverness or cunning; outsmart

sweltering.example: adj. 酷热的: The air conditioning was broken, and it was sweltering in the room. 空调坏了，房间里酷热难耐。

rankle.example: vt. 激怒: It rankles me when some schools can't even afford paper and pencils for the students. 当我获悉有些学校连纸张和铅笔都无法提供给学生时，我感到十分愤怒。
rankle.mean: vt. 激怒： to cause anger, irritation, or deep bitterness

scrappy.example: adj. 好斗的，好吵架的: She was a scrappy girl despite—or, perhaps, because of—her small size. 这个妹子好打斗，但是身材娇小，不过这很可能是原因
scrappy.mean: adj. 好斗的，好吵架的： having an aggressive and determined spirit，quarrelsome

portentous.example:
adj. 预兆性的，凶兆的: an eerie and portentous stillness 阴森神秘，充满凶兆的寂静
adj. 勾起兴趣的，令人遐想的: The way in which he could bring together opposing forces was truly portentous. 他整合两股对抗势力的方法着实令人好奇
portentous.mean:
adj. 预兆性的，凶兆的： being or showing a sign of evil or calamity to come
adj. 勾起兴趣的，令人遐想的：eliciting amazement or wonder

immature.example:
adj. 未完全发展的，未发育成熟的: immature frogs are called “tadpoles” 为发育成熟的青蛙被称为“蝌蚪”
adj. （思维、举止）不够成熟的: Many high school students are still too immature to foresee the consequences of their actions. 很多高中生还是不够成熟，不能意识到他们的行为所带来的后果
immature.mean:
adj. 未完全发展的，未发育成熟的： lacking complete growth, differentiation, or development
adj. （思维、举止）不够成熟的： lacking in adult experience or maturity

verdant.example: adj. （因长满植物而）翠绿的，郁郁葱葱的: verdant fields 翠绿的田野
verdant.mean: adj. （因长满植物而）翠绿的，郁郁葱葱的： green with vegetation; covered with green growth

conjecture.example:
n. 揣测的结果: That was only a conjecture, not a fact. 那只是猜测而非事实
v. （没有依据地）认为: conjecture that this disease is caused by a defective gene 揣测这种疾病是由基因缺陷导致的
conjecture.mean:
n. 揣测的结果： a conclusion deduced by surmise or guesswork
v. 猜测，估计（大小、数量等）： to decide the size, amount, number, or distance of (something) without actual measurement
v. （没有依据地）认为： to form an opinion from little or no evidence

collaborate.example: vi. 合作: The two men collaborated on a blockbuster in 1986 which gained both of them fame. 两人在1986年合作出演了一部十分卖座的电影，由此获得了巨大的名声。
collaborate.mean: vi. 合作： to work jointly with others or together especially in an intellectual endeavor

dynamic.example: adj. 有力量的，有活力的: He has become a dynamic new challenger for the title of champion. 他成为了有望夺的有活力的新选手。‖a dynamic speech expressing her goals and values 宣扬她的目标和理念的慷慨激昂的演讲
dynamic.mean: adj. 有力量的，有活力的： marked by usually continuous and productive activity or change; energetic

intercessor.example: n. 调停者: attend the meeting as the intercessor 作为调停人出席会议
intercessor.mean: n. 调停者： one that mediates

amorphous.example:
adj. 无固定形状的having no definite form: shapeless
: an amorphous cloud mass 一团无定形的云
adj. 不可归类的being without definite character or nature : unclassifiable
: an amorphous segment of society 不可归类的社会阶段
amorphous.mean:
adj. 无固定形状的having no definite form: shapeless
adj. 不可归类的being without definite character or nature : unclassifiable

adumbrate.example:
vt. 部分地或有保留地揭露: adumbrate a plan 透露计划
vt. 预示着: The strife in Bloody Kansas adumbrated the civil war that would follow. 发生在堪萨斯州的流血冲突预示了之后的南北内战的爆发。
adumbrate.mean:
vt. 部分地或有保留地揭露： to disclose partially or guardedly.
vt. 预示着： to give a slight indication of beforehand

pigment.example:
n. 颜料: natural red pigment 天然红色染料
vt. 给…上颜色: pigmented silk 染过色的丝绸
pigment.mean:
n. 颜料： a substance that imparts black or white or a color to other materials
vt. 给…上颜色： to color with or as if with pigment

sermon.example: n. 布道，说教: sermon whose message was that we should love our neighbors as much as we love ourselves 主题是教导我们要像爱自己一样爱邻居的一次布道
sermon.mean: n. 布道，说教： public speech usually by a member of the clergy for the purpose of giving moral guidance or uplift

mania.example: n. 热衷，狂热: a mania for neatness 强烈的洁癖
mania.mean: n. 热衷，狂热： an excessively intense enthusiasm, interest, or desire; a craze

pacify.example: vt. 使平静，安慰: pacify a crying child 安抚一个哭泣的孩子
pacify.mean: vt. 使平静，安慰： to ease the anger or agitation of

anemic.example:
adj. 缺乏力量、活力、精神的: an anemic economic recovery. 毫无活力的经济复苏
adj. 缺乏力量、活力、精神的: Investors are worried about the stock's anemic performance. 投资者担心股市低迷的表现。
anemic.mean: adj. 缺乏力量、活力、精神的：lacking force, vitality, or spirit

embroider.example: v. （时常伴有夸张和想象内容）详细说明: embroider the story of his adventures in the army 细说他服役时惊险的经历
embroider.mean: v. （时常伴有夸张和想象内容）详细说明： to give an elaborate account of, often with florid language and fictitious details

indurate.example:
adj. 铁石心肠的，冷酷无情的: an indurate heart that admits no love or mercy 一颗不认可爱或仁慈的冷酷心灵
vt. 使变硬: Great heat indurates clay. 高温使黏土变硬
vt. 使习惯于: Such a brutal upbringing could only callous his soul and indurate his heart to the suffering of others. 这样一种残暴的培养方式只会让他的灵魂变得麻木，让他的心灵对于他人所受的折磨无动于衷
indurate.mean:
adj. 铁石心肠的，冷酷无情的： having or showing a lack of sympathy or tender feelings
vt. 使变硬： to become physically firm or solid
vt. 使习惯于：使习惯于，如艰苦或尴尬之境况： to make able to withstand physical hardship, strain, or exposure

grueling.example: adj. 费时间花心思的: cutting diamonds can be grueling work 切割钻石是项劳神的活儿
grueling.mean: adj. 费时间花心思的： requiring much time, effort, or careful attention

parrot.example: vt. （机械地）模仿，复制: parrot others blindly 盲目地人云亦云
parrot.mean: vt. （机械地）模仿，复制： to repeat or imitate, especially without understanding

turpitude.example: n. 卑鄙: moral turpitude 道德上的卑鄙行为
turpitude.mean: n. 卑鄙： inherent baseness: depravity

vitriolic.example: adj. （言辞）刻薄的: vitriolic criticism 刻薄的批评

voyeur.example: n. 淫窥狂: They accidentally found out that their ostensibly benign neighbor is actually a voyeur. 他们偶然间发现那个表面和善的邻居居然是一个偷窥狂。
voyeur.mean: n. 淫窥狂： one obtaining sexual gratification from observing unsuspecting individuals who are partly undressed, naked, or engaged in sexual acts

convenience.example: n. 便利，方便: the convenience of living in megacity 住在大城市的便利
convenience.mean: n. 便利，方便： fitness or suitability for performing an action or fulfilling a requirement

delegate.example:
n. 代理人，代表: The real estate developer sent a delegate to the town meeting to represent his interests. 房地产开发商派了一名能代表自己利益的代理前往镇上开会。‖the U.N. delegates from African countries 非洲国家的驻联合国代表
vt. 移交（权力，任务等）: The manager is reluctant to delegate authority to subordinates while abroad. 经理不愿意在国外期间将自己的权力转交给下级。
delegate.mean:
n. 代理人，代表： a person authorized to act as representative for another
vt. 移交（权力，任务等）： to put (something) into the possession or safekeeping of another

thick-skinned.example: adj. 冷漠无情的，不顾及他人感受的: She was so thick-skinned that she was clueless about the fact that the joke had hurt her friend's feelings. 她很少顾及他人的感受，以至于她根本没有意识到那个玩笑伤害了她朋友的感情。
thick-skinned.mean: adj. 冷漠无情的，不顾及他人感受的： largely unaffected by the needs and feelings of other people

monologue.example: n. 独白: deliver a tedious monologue 做了一个冗长的独白
monologue.mean: n. 独白：a dramatic sketch performed by one actor

deplorable.example:
adj. 可鄙的，可耻的: We will not tolerate such deplorable behavior in a house of worship. 我们绝不能容许这样一种可鄙的行为出现在礼拜堂中。
adj. 悲惨的，可悲的: Many of them work under deplorable conditions. 许多人的工作环境十分悲惨。
deplorable.mean:
adj. 可鄙的，可耻的： worthy of severe condemnation or reproach
adj. 悲惨的，可悲的： of a kind to cause great distress

illiteracy.example: n. 文盲: a nationwide campaign against illiteracy 全国扫盲运动
illiteracy.mean: n. 文盲： the condition of being unable to read and write

veritable.example: adj. 真正的，确实的: a veritable manuscript 一份原稿
veritable.mean: adj. 真正的，确实的： being in fact the thing named and not false, unreal, or imaginary

monotonous.example:
adj. （声音）单调的: a monotonous apathetic voice 单调而冷漠的声音
adj. 清一色的，无聊的: a sparkle in the monotonous background 单调背景中的一个亮点
monotonous.mean:
adj. （声音）单调的： uttered or sounded in one unvarying tone
adj. 清一色的，无聊的： tediously uniform or unvarying

concise.example: adj. 简洁的: a clear and concise account of the accident 一个清楚间断的事故描述 || Concise Design of Spacecraft Automatic System 航天器自动控制系统简要设计
concise.mean: adj. 简洁的：marked by brevity of expression or statement

preface.example: n. 序言: An informal brunch served as a preface to the three-day conference. 一顿非正式的便餐作为为期三天的会议的序曲。
preface.mean: n. 序言：a preliminary statement or essay introducing a book that explains its scope, intention, or background and is usually written by the author

shackle.example:
vt. 束缚: unwilling to shackle the dogs to the wall of the house 不愿意把狗拴在墙边
v. 限制，阻碍: shackled by poverty and ignorance 被贫穷和无知所阻碍
shackle.mean:
vt. 束缚： to deprive of freedom especially of action by means of restrictions or handicaps
v. 限制，阻碍： to create difficulty for the work or activity of

incantation.example: n. 咒语: Hovering over the sick child, the witch doctor muttered mysterious incantations. 巫医在生病的小孩子身边走来走去，嘴里念着神秘的咒语
incantation.mean: n. 咒语： a spoken word or set of words believed to have magic power

crave.example: vt. 热望: crave alcohols and cigarettes 渴望烟酒
crave.mean: vt. 热望： to have an intense desire for

fabulous.example:
adj. 传说中的: The city of Phoenix is named after a fabulous bird that every 500 years destroys itself with fire, only to rise again from its own ashes. 凤凰城的名字来源于传说中的一种鸟，它每隔500年会在火焰中毁灭，然后再从灰烬中重生。
adj. 幻想中的，不真实的: a story of a fabulous land where the people know nothing of war and live together in perfect harmony 一个有关世外桃源的故事，当地的居民不知道战争为何物，和谐融洽地生活在一起
adj. 令人惊讶的，令人称奇的: the fabulous endurance of a marathon runner 马拉松参赛者令人惊讶的耐力
adj. 极好的: We had a fabulous time on our vacation. 我们的假期赞极了。
fabulous.mean:
adj. 传说中的： based on, described in, or being a fable
adj. 幻想中的，不真实的： not real and existing only in the imagination
adj. 令人惊讶的，令人称奇的： causing wonder or astonishment
adj. 极好的： extremely pleasing or successful

valiant.example: adj. 勇敢的，英勇的: a valiant and moral knight 一个勇敢和有道德感的骑士‖Despite their valiant efforts, they lost the game. 尽管他们英勇奋战，但还是输掉了比赛。
valiant.mean: adj. 勇敢的，英勇的： possessing or acting with bravery or boldness

subordinate.example:
adj. 下级的，次要的: His contention is that environment plays a subordinate role to heredity in determining what we become. 他的观点就是：在决定我们成长的因素——环境和遗传之中，前者处于更次要的地位。
vt. 征服: It is one of the lessons of history that more powerful civilizations often subordinate weaker ones. 强大的文明往往征服弱势的文明，这是历史的教训之一。
subordinate.mean:
adj. 下级的，次要的： belonging to a lower or inferior class or rank
vt. 征服： to bring under one's control by force of arms

tether.example:
vt.（用绳，铁链）拴系，束缚: They tethered the horses in the shade. 他们把马摔在棚子里
n. 能力或忍耐力的极限: drought-stricken farmers at the end of their tether 受干旱打击的农民忍无可忍
tether.mean:
vt.（用绳，铁链）拴系，束缚： to fasten or restrain by or as if by a tether
n. 能力或忍耐力的极限： the limit of one's strength or resources

kidnap.example: vt. 绑架勒索: the child was kidnapped and held for ransom 歹徒绑架了孩子，并且向家属勒索赎金
kidnap.mean: vt. 绑架勒索： to seize and detain by unlawful force or fraud and often with a demand for ransom

decadence.example: n. 衰落，颓废: The book condemns the decadence of modern society. 该书批判了现代社会的堕落。
decadence.mean: n. 衰落，颓废： a process, condition, or period of deterioration or decline, a change to a lower state or level

gawky.example: adj. （举止）笨拙的: The pathetic gawky woman was once a lithe ballerina but got severely injured in a car accident. 这个可怜的步态笨拙的妇女本来是一名轻巧优雅的芭蕾舞女，但是在一次车祸中受了重伤。
gawky.mean: adj. （举止）笨拙的： having or showing an inability to move in a graceful manner

deliberate.example: adj. 深思熟虑的: a deliberate decision 一个慎重的决定
deliberate.mean: adj. 深思熟虑的： characterized by or resulting from careful and thorough consideration

ruthless.example: adj. 没有怜悯心的，残忍的: an office supervisor with a ruthless disregard for others’ feelings 一个从不顾及他人感情的无情领导
ruthless.mean: adj. 没有怜悯心的，残忍的： having no pity

minuscule.example: adj. 极小的: a miniscule progress 极小的进步

jocular.example: adj. 搞笑的，欢乐的: a jocular man who could make the most serious people laugh 这个搞笑的人可以使得最严肃的人都开怀大笑
jocular.mean: adj. 搞笑的，欢乐的： characterized by joking, playful

malleable.example:
adj. 可塑的: a malleable metal 有延展性的金属
dj. 易控制的: The cult leader took advantage of the malleable, compliant personalities of his followers. 这个头目利用了他的信徒们容易被控制和顺从的特征
malleable.mean:
adj. 可塑的： capable of being extended or shaped by beating with a hammer or by the pressure of rollers
dj. 易控制的： capable of being altered or controlled by outside forces or influences

decry.example: vt. 强烈反对，否定: Scientists were quick to decry the claims of the psychic. 通灵者的说法很快就遭到了科学家的反对。‖decry the excessive emphasis on sex 谴责对于性的过分重视
decry.mean: vt. 强烈反对，否定： to express strong disapproval of

apocryphal.example: adj.假的: an apocryphal story about the president's childhood 一个假的关于总统童年的故事

mischievous.example:
adj. 调皮的，调皮的: The mischievous child broke the vase. 调皮的孩子打碎了花瓶
adj. 有害的: mischievous rumors that defame him 恶意中伤他的谣言
mischievous.mean:
adj. 调皮的，调皮的： playful in a naughty or teasing way
adj. 有害的： causing harm or trouble

sunder.example: vt. 分裂，分离: a city sundered by racial conflict 一个因种族冲突而分裂的城市
sunder.mean: vt. 分裂，分离： to break apart or in two

blur.example:
v. （使）变得朦胧，（使）变得不清楚: Sorrowful tears blurred her eyes. 悲伤的眼泪模糊了她的双眼
v. 使不易理解: An article for the layman that blurs the distinction between the two kinds of cholesterol. 一篇针对业余读者的文章把两种胆固醇的区别弄得模糊不清
blur.mean:
v. （使）变得朦胧，（使）变得不清楚： to (cause sth. to) become vague or indistinct
v. 使不易理解： to make (something) unclear to the understanding

zesty.example: adj. 刺激的，开胃的: a zesty sauce 味道刺激的酱汁
zesty.mean: adj. 刺激的，开胃的： appealingly piquant or lively

jaundice.example: n. （因嫉妒或厌世而产生的）偏见: the jaundice in the eyes of the two feuding neighbors 两个有积怨的邻居之间的偏见
jaundice.mean: n. （因嫉妒或厌世而产生的）偏见： to affect with the negativity or bitterness of jaundice; bias

maverick.example:
n. 特立独行之人: Some mavericks believe that both gravity and light are electromagnetic forces. 一些特立独行的人认为，重力和光都是电磁力
adj. 标新立异的，不合常规的: a maverick view on marriage 关于婚姻的非传统看法
maverick.mean:
n. 特立独行之人： a person who does not conform to generally accepted standards or customs
adj. 标新立异的，不合常规的： deviating from commonly accepted beliefs or practices

palatial.example: adj. 宫殿般奢华的: a palatial penthouse apartment 一套豪华的顶层公寓
palatial.mean: adj. 宫殿般奢华的： of the nature of a palace, as in spaciousness or ornateness

inducement.example:
n. 动机，刺激源: offered an expensive watch as an inducement to ratify the proposal 赠送名贵手表以求计划得到批准
n.劝说，游说: He gave up smoking only after a prolonged inducement by all the other family members. 在所有家庭成员坚持不懈的劝说之下，他终于愿意戒烟了
inducement.mean:
n. 动机，刺激源： a motive or consideration that leads one to action
n.劝说，游说： the act of reasoning or pleading with someone to accept a belief or course of action

prate.example: vi. 闲聊，空谈: They have been prating on the phone for hours. 他们已经煲了几个小时的电话粥了。
prate.mean: vi. 闲聊，空谈： to talk long and idly

crouch.example: v. 蹲伏: crouched behind a rock and watched vigilantly 蹲伏石头后紧惕地观察
crouch.mean: v. 蹲伏： to lower the body stance especially by bending the legs

wilt.example:
vi. （花、植物等）萎蔫: The plants wilted after I forgot to water them for three whole days. 在我整整三天忘记浇水之后，植物们全都萎蔫了。
vi. 精神萎靡，憔悴: She had wilted a bit after walking around the hot and humid city. 在炎热潮湿的城市中行走使得她略显憔悴。‖His brain wilted from hitherto unprecedented weariness. 在前所未有的疲劳面前，他的开始变得神情憔悴。
wilt.mean:
vi. （花、植物等）萎蔫： to become limp or flaccid
vi. 精神萎靡，憔悴： to feel or exhibit the effects of fatigue or exhaustion

splinter.example:
n. 尖细条，刺: She got a splinter from the unfinished wall. 她的手被还没有装修的墙扎了一根刺。
vt. 切成细条: splintered the carrots into little sticks 把胡萝卜切成丝
splinter.mean:
n. 尖细条，刺： a sharp, slender piece, as of wood, bone, glass, or metal, split or broken off from a main body
vt. 切成细条： to split or break into sharp, slender pieces

feisty.example: adj. 好斗的，好争论的: At 66, she was as feisty as ever. 尽管已经66岁高龄，她还是一样好斗。
feisty.mean: adj. 好斗的，好争论的： having or showing a lively aggressiveness

residual.example: adj. 剩余的，残存的: residual radiation from nuclear tests 核试验所遗留下来的残余辐射
residual.mean: adj. 剩余的，残存的： of, relating to, or characteristic of a residue

metamorphose.example: vt. 变形: a science fiction story in which radiation metamorphoses people into giant bugs 一个描绘辐射将人变成了巨大虫子的科幻小说
metamorphose.mean: vt. 变形： to change into a different physical form especially by supernatural means

asymmetry.example: n. 不对称，不平衡: functional asymmetry of cerebral hemispheres 大脑两半球功能不对称性
asymmetry.mean: n. 不对称，不平衡： lack of balance or symmetry

studio.example: n. 工作室，画室，摄影室: moved to a larger studio 搬进了更大的工作室
studio.mean: n. 工作室，画室，摄影室： the working place of a painter, sculptor, or photographer

unproductive.example: adj. 徒然的，无效的: her attempts to write a novel have been unproductive 她一直想写本小说的努力只是徒然
unproductive.mean: adj. 徒然的，无效的： not productive; idle

humility.example: n. 谦卑，谦逊: Haughtiness invites disaster; humility receives benefit. 满招损，谦受益
humility.mean: n. 谦卑，谦逊： the absence of any feelings of being better than others

opprobrious.example:
adj. 辱骂的: expressing contemptuous reproach; scornful or abusive
: opprobrious language 脏话
adj. 臭名昭著的，令人鄙视的: bringing disgrace; shameful or infamous
: opprobrious conduct 令人鄙视的行为
opprobrious.mean:
adj. 辱骂的: expressing contemptuous reproach; scornful or abusive
adj. 臭名昭著的，令人鄙视的: bringing disgrace; shameful or infamous

doldrums.example:
n. 低迷，中断: August is a time of doldrums for many enterprises. 对于许多企业来说八月是一个低迷期‖The economy is in the doldrums. 经济低迷
n. 情绪不佳: The team had been in the doldrums ever since losing the championship. 整个队伍自从输了锦标赛以来一直情绪不佳
doldrums.mean:
n. 低迷，中断： a state or period of inactivity, stagnation, or slump
n. 情绪不佳：a state or spell of low spirits

connoisseur.example:
n. 鉴赏家（尤其艺术领域）: a connoisseur of wine and cigarette 烟酒鉴赏的行家
n. 专家: works that are highly prized by connoisseurs of art glass 被玻璃艺术制品专家高度赞誉的作品
connoisseur.mean:
n. 鉴赏家（尤其艺术领域）： a person who enjoys with discrimination and appreciation of subtleties and details especially in matters of culture or art
n. 专家： a person with a high level of knowledge or skill in a field

ravish.example: vt. 使陶醉，使沉迷: I was completely ravished by those marvelous pictures taken by HST. 那些哈勃太空望远镜拍摄的壮观图片让我彻底的陶醉了。
ravish.mean: vt. 使陶醉，使沉迷： to overcome with emotion (as wonder or delight)

elaborate.example:
adj. 详细的，复杂的: an elaborate manual 内容详尽的使用手册
vt. 详细阐述: The defense committee asked the PhD candidate to elaborate one critical assumption in his thesis. 答辩委员会要求答辩的博士进一步说明他毕业论文中的一个关键假设
elaborate.mean:
adj. 详细的，复杂的： marked by complexity, fullness of detail, or ornament
vt. 详细阐述： to expand something in detail

ridicule.example: vt. 嘲笑: always ridiculed everything she said 总是嘲笑她说的话‖The term “big bang theory” was originally coined to ridicule the belief that the universe was created by a giant explosion. “大爆炸理论”期初是为了嘲笑一种观点而创造的，这种观点认为宇宙源自一场巨大的爆炸。
ridicule.mean: vt. 嘲笑： to make fun of

oxymoron.example: n. 矛盾修饰法: The phrase “cruel kindness” is an oxymoron. “残酷的仁慈”就是矛盾修饰法的一个例子。|| The phrase “Broadway rock musical” is an oxymoron. Broadway doesn't have the nerve to let the really hard stuff in the house. “百老汇的摇滚音乐剧”是个反讽。百老汇才不会允许吵吵闹闹的东西在里面演出。
oxymoron.mean: n. 矛盾修饰法： a combination of contradictory or incongruous words

credit.example:
n. 信任，信赖: I give full credit to this report on the prevalence of cheating among college students today. 我非常相信这则有关大学中作弊成风的报道。
n. 表扬，赞扬: She deserves all the credit, since she did all the work. 是她完成了所有的工作，因此荣誉都应该归她所有。
credit.mean:
n. 信任，信赖： mental conviction of the truth of some statement or the reality of some being or phenomenon
n. 表扬，赞扬： public acknowledgment or admiration for an achievement

cogent.example:
adj. 令人信服的: Six Sigma is one of the most cogent methods for modern enterprises to control quality and optimizing process. “六西格玛”方法是现代企业进行质量控制和工艺优化最令人信服的方法之一。
adj. 相关的: a cogent analysis 一项相关的研究
cogent.mean:
adj. 令人信服的：appealing forcibly to the mind or reason: convincing
adj. 相关的：pertinent, relevant

kindred.example: adj. 类似的；具有相似或相近的起源，本性或性质的: finally found people who were kindred spirits when she joined the hiking club 她加入登山俱乐部的时候终于发现了志向相同的人
kindred.mean: adj. 类似的；具有相似或相近的起源，本性或性质的： having a similar or related origin, nature, or character

mentor.example:
n. 导师: not only an lecturer but also a spirit mentor 不仅是授课者，还是精神导师
vt. 教导，指导: We're looking for volunteers to mentor students in career planning. 我们在寻找能指导学生职业规划的志愿者
mentor.mean:
n. 导师： a trusted counselor or guide
vt. 教导，指导： to give advice and instruction regarding the course or process to be followed

exacting.example:
adj. 严格的，苛求的: an exacting instructor 一位严苛的导师
adj. 严格的，苛求的: exact tribute from a conquered people 从征服的人民手中强取贡品
adj. 费时间花心思的: editing and proofreading will always be an exacting task 编辑和校对是花时间花心思的工作
exacting.mean:
adj. 严格的，苛求的： making severe demands; rigorous
adj. 费时间花心思的： requiring much time, effort, or careful attention

military.example: adj. 军事的，军用的: NATO struggles with how to proceed military operation against Libya. 北约就如何延续针对利比亚的军事行动出现了内部分歧。‖an encyclopedia of modern military aircraft 现代军用飞行器百科全书
military.mean: adj. 军事的，军用的： of or relating to soldiers, arms, or war

anarchist.mean: n. 反抗权威的人：a person who rebels against any authority, established order, or ruling power

menial.example:
n. 仆人，奴仆: Immigrants to that country faced fierce prejudice and could expect to find work only as menials. 前往那个国家的移民遭到了严重的歧视，他们也许只能找到像仆人一类的工作。
adj. 卑贱的，低下的: low-paid menial jobs such as cleaning the street 一些低收入的卑贱工作，比如扫大街
menial.mean:
n. 仆人，奴仆： a servant, especially a domestic servant
adj. 卑贱的，低下的： showing, expressing, or offered in a spirit of humility or unseemly submissiveness

intrigue.example:
n. 阴谋: The intrigue was quickly discovered, and the would-be assassins were arrested. 随着阴谋的迅速识破，未得手的刺客被逮捕了
vt. 激起…的兴趣: The children are apparently intrigued by the tale. 孩子们很明显被这个传奇故事吸引了
intrigue.mean:
n. 阴谋： a secret plan for accomplishing evil or unlawful ends
vt. 激起…的兴趣： to arouse the interest, desire, or curiosity of

astute.example: adj. 机敏的，有洞察力的: Astute salesmen know how to invest emotionally. 精明的推销员知道如何进行感情投资。
astute.mean: adj. 机敏的，有洞察力的：having or showing shrewdness and perspicacity

politic.example:
adj. 精明能干的: a politic secretary 能干的秘书
adj. 合时宜的，明智的: It probably would not be politic to tell your boss that his latest idea is the worst thing you've ever heard. 不要现在去告诉你老板说他的想法是你听过的最糟的，这不是一个合时宜的做法。
politic.mean:
adj. 精明能干的： characterized by shrewdness in managing, contriving, or dealing
adj. 合时宜的，明智的： suitable for bringing about a desired result under the circumstances

punctilious.mean: adj. 注意细节的，一丝不苟的： strictly attentive to minute details of form in action or conduct.

stray.example:
adj. 漫无目的的: No stray sighting of UFO’s has been rigorously analyzed by scientists. 在无规律出现的UFO事件之中，尚未有被科学家严谨分析的案例。
vi. 离群，迷途，偏离: to stray from the main road 偏离了主干道
stray.mean:
adj. 漫无目的的： lacking a definite plan, purpose, or pattern
vi. 离群，迷途，偏离： to move away from a group, deviate from the correct course, or go beyond established limits

elude.example:
vt. 躲闪，躲避: managed to elude capture 成功躲过了追捕‖The millionaire had been eluding his fair share of taxes for years before getting caught. 在被逮捕之前，这名富翁逃税已经有若干年了。
vt. 使无法理解，使困惑: a metaphor that eluded them 一个让他们无法理解的比喻
elude.mean:
vt. 躲闪，躲避： to avoid adroitly
vt. 使无法理解，使困惑： to escape the perception, understanding, or grasp of

hobble.example:
vi. 跛行，蹒跚而行: She picked up her cane and hobbled across the room. 她拿起了一根手杖，一拐一拐地穿过了房间。
vt. 阻碍，妨碍: We were hobbled by the snowstorm from getting out to do some Christmas shopping. 暴雪阻碍了我们圣诞购物的计划。
hobble.mean:
vi. 跛行，蹒跚而行： to walk or move along haltingly or with difficulty
vt. 阻碍，妨碍： to hamper the action or progress of

remnant.example: n. 残余，剩余物: a remnant of his past glory 他辉煌过去的一丝残余‖The shop is selling remnants of cloth at half price. 商店在半价抛售剩余的衣物。
remnant.mean: n. 残余，剩余物： something left over

iconoclast.example: n. 特立独行的人: He was an iconoclast who refused to be bound by tradition. 他是个不愿被传统所束缚的叛逆者
iconoclast.mean: n. 特立独行的人： a person who does not conform to generally accepted standards or customs

labyrinthine.example: adj. 迷宫似的，复杂曲折的: The labyrinthine political situation of Middle East left us totally befuddled. 中东地区复杂迷离的政治局势让我们彻底迷惑了
labyrinthine.mean: adj. 迷宫似的，复杂曲折的： of, relating to, resembling, or constituting a labyrinth; extremely complex or tortuous in structure

circumvent.example: vt. 躲避（不遵从）: circumvent all the red tape 绕过所有官方程序繁文缛节 || He found a way to circumvent the law. 他发现了一个逃避法律的方法。
circumvent.mean: vt. 躲避（不遵从）：to avoid having to comply with (something) especially through cleverness

faultfinder.example: n. 吹毛求疵的人: No sooner had we finished decorating the church than the parish faultfinder decided that she didn't like it. 我们一完成教堂的装修工作，教区里挑剔的人就说她不喜欢
faultfinder.mean: n. 吹毛求疵的人： one who is given to petty criticism and constant complaint

idyll.example: n. 无忧无虑的生活: a summer idyll on the coast of the Mediterranean 地中海岸的悠闲夏日
idyll.mean: n. 无忧无虑的生活： a carefree episode or experience

spontaneous.example: adj. 自发的，不经思索的: Hugging a crying child is simply a spontaneous reaction. 去抱一个哭泣的小孩是很自然而然的反应。
spontaneous.mean: adj. 自发的，不经思索的： acting or activated without apparent thought or deliberation

gloss.example:
n. （欺骗性的）光鲜外表: used a computer to give her astrological predictions the gloss of real science 用计算机来给他的占星预测结果套上科学的外衣
v. 敷衍潦草做事（甚至忽略）: gloss over the problems 不怎么理会这些问题
v. 开脱（罪名）: I don't want to gloss over her misbehavior, but keep in mind that she's been under a lot of stress lately. 我不想为她的行为辩护，但是别忘了她最近压力很大
gloss.mean:
n. 简短解释： a brief explanation of a difficult or obscure word or expression
n. （欺骗性的）光鲜外表： a deceptively attractive external appearance
v. 敷衍潦草做事（甚至忽略）： to deal with (a subject or problem) too lightly or not at all
v. 开脱（罪名）： to make (something) seem less bad by offering excuses

exhort.example: vt. 敦促；力劝: The speaker exhorted the graduating students to go forth and try to make a difference in the world. 演讲者鼓励毕业生们去广阔天地有所作为。
exhort.mean: vt. 敦促；力劝： to urge by strong, often stirring argument, admonition, advice, or appeal

plod.example: v. 沉重缓慢地走: The soldiers slowly plodded across the marsh. 士兵们慢慢走过沼泽地。
plod.mean: v. 沉重缓慢地走： to walk heavily or slowly

mediate.example: vt. 调解，调停: mediate a labor-management dispute 调解劳工纠纷
mediate.mean: vt. 调解，调停： to intervene between two or more disputants in order to bring about an agreement, a settlement, or a compromise

panacea.example: n. 万能药，万灵药: a woman who seems to believe that chicken soup is a panacea for nearly everything 一个相信鸡汤是万能灵药的妇女‖Bicycles are not a panacea for the traffic problem. 自行车并不是解决交通问题的万能药。
panacea.mean: n. 万能药，万灵药： a remedy for all ills or difficulties

typo.example: n. 打字错误: make one typo on the memo 在样张上打错一个字
typo.mean: n. 打字错误： an error in typed or typeset material

strike.example:
n. 攻击: The first strike was directed at a munitions warehouse. 第一轮攻击的目标是军火仓库。
vt. 击打: angrily stuck the security guard 愤怒地殴打保安
vt. 袭击，攻击: A rattlesnake strikes its prey with lightning speed. 响尾蛇以惊人的速度攻击了它的猎物。
vt. 撞击: One bullet-train struck the other one which had been forced to stop on a viaduct due to lightning strike, resulting in huge casualties. 一辆动车撞向了另一辆因雷击而停在高架桥上的动车，造成了巨大的人员伤亡。
strike.mean:
n. 攻击： the act or action of setting upon with force or violence
vt. 铸造（奖牌）： to form by stamping, printing, or punching
vt. 击打： to aim and usually deliver a blow, stroke, or thrust (as with the hand, a weapon, or a tool)
vt. 袭击，攻击： to take sudden, violent action against
vt. 撞击： to come into usually forceful contact with something

synergic.example: adj. 合作的: synergic muscles 协同肌肉
synergic.mean: adj. 合作的： working together: cooperating

plagiarize.example: v. 剽窃，抄袭: In scientific community, plagiarizing other’s paper is a felony. 在学术界，剽窃他人的论文是一项重罪。
plagiarize.mean: v. 剽窃，抄袭：to steal and pass off (the ideas or words of another) as one's own

inchoate.example:
adj. 新生的: inchoate feelings of affection for a man 刚刚产生的好感
adj. 未完全成型的: a vague, inchoate notion 模糊而不成形的想法
inchoate.mean:
adj. 新生的： in an initial or early stage
adj. 未完全成型的： imperfectly formed or developed

bombast.example: n. 夸大的言辞: “Their eloquence is all bombast”, said Charles Kingsley. “他们的雄辩是虚张声势”，查理斯?金斯利如此说道
bombast.mean: n. 夸大的言辞： grandiloquent, pompous speech or writing

barbarous.example:
adj. 野蛮的，凶残的: insulted by barbarous language 被粗暴的语言侵犯
adj. 未开化的: some barbarous behaviors such as eating with your fingers 一些没有教养的举止，比如直接用手拿东西吃
barbarous.mean:
adj. 野蛮的，凶残的： mercilessly harsh or cruel
adj. 未开化的： uncivilized

plenitude.example:
n. 丰富，充沛: a region blessed with a plenitude of natural resources 充满着上帝赐予的丰富资源的地区
n. 大量: She has gathered a plenitude of information on the topic. 有关这个话题她收集了大量的资料。
plenitude.mean:
n. 丰富，充沛： an amount or supply more than sufficient to meet one's needs
n. 大量： a considerable amount

naive.example: adj. 天真纯朴的: a child with a na?ve charm 天真无邪的孩子
naive.mean: adj. 天真纯朴的： lacking worldly experience and understanding, simple and guileless

reign.example:
n. 统治权: A healthy nation should be governed by the reign of law and not by the will of its chief executive. 一个健康的国家应该是法制的，而非由最高领导人的意志统领。‖They accused him of carrying out a reign of terror. 他们指责他搞独裁暴政。
vi. 占统治地位或盛行: Chaos reigned in the classroom. 整个教室充满了混乱。‖Panic reigned as the fire spread. 随着大火的扩散，恐慌也迅速蔓延。
reign.mean:
n. 统治权： the right or means to command or control others
vi. 占统治地位或盛行：to be predominant or prevalent

dogma.example:
n. 教条，信条: People are beginning to question the old dogmas. 人们开始质疑旧的信条。|| The newspaper seeks to be independent of political dogma. 这份报纸力求不受政治信条影响。
n. 教条，信条: a dogmatic critic 独断的评论家
dogma.mean: n. 教条，信条： a doctrine or body of doctrines concerning faith or morals formally stated and authoritatively proclaimed by a church

frenzy.example: n. 疯狂，狂怒: She is subject to these frenzies several times a year. 她每年都要暴怒几次
frenzy.mean: n. 疯狂，狂怒： a violent mental or emotional agitation

undergird.example: vt. 加强，巩固…的底部: facts and statistics undergird his commentary 事实和数据支持了他的评论
undergird.mean: vt. 加强，巩固…的底部： to support or strengthen from beneath

adjourn.example: vi. 延期，休会: The meeting adjourned for a week. 会议延期一周。
adjourn.mean: vi. 延期，休会： to suspend a session indefinitely or to another time or place

adamant.example: adj. 固执的，不可动摇的: adamant about staying here 执意留下来
adamant.mean: adj. 固执的，不可动摇的：unshakable or insistent especially in maintaining a position or opinion, unyielding; inflexible

scribble.example: vt. 潦草地书写，乱写: Students scribbled furiously as the teacher lectured. 老师一边讲，学生们一边狂抄笔记。
scribble.mean: vt. 潦草地书写，乱写： to cover with scribbles, doodles, or meaningless marks

confound.example:
vt. 使困惑: We are all confounded by his self-contradictory claims. 我们都对他自相矛盾的言论感到困惑
v. 无法区分，混淆: I think you must have confounded astrology with astronomy. 我想你一定是把占星术和天文学搞混了
v. 证明为假，证伪: new discoveries that confounded much of what archaeologists thought they have known about the ancient Mayan civilization 一些新的发现，它们颠覆了考古学家们长期以来对于古代玛雅文明的认识
confound.mean:
vt. 使困惑： to throw into a state of mental uncertainty
v. 无法区分，混淆： to fail to differentiate (a thing) from something similar or related
v. 证明为假，证伪：to prove to be false

retouch.example: v. 润饰，改进: She was retouching her painting before the deadline. 在截止日期到来之前，她一直在润色她的画作。
retouch.mean: v. 润饰，改进： to improve or change (a photographic negative or print)

philanthropic.example: adj. 博爱的，为他人着想的: the philanthropic aims of the organization 这个机构的博爱、利他的目标
philanthropic.mean: adj. 博爱的，为他人着想的： having or showing a concern for the welfare of others

debark.example: vt. 从船或者飞机上卸货: the seasick passengers debarked as soon as the ship dropped anchor 晕船的乘客等到轮船一靠岸抛锚就立即下船
debark.mean: vt. 从船或者飞机上卸货： to unload, as from a ship or an airplane

eclipse.example:
n. 下降，衰退: the eclipse of the town from a grand seaside resort to a tacky tourist trap 从壮丽辉煌的海边旅游圣地退化成了俗气的坑人景点
vt. 使声望下降，使黯然失色: Her score eclipsed the old record. 她的分数使旧的纪录黯然失色
vt.（在数量、品质上）超越: The brilliant young pianist now eclipsed even his own mentor in musical artistry. 极富天赋的小钢琴家如今甚至已超越了他的音乐导师
eclipse.mean:
n. 下降，衰退： a change to a lower state or level
vt. 使声望下降，使黯然失色： to obscure or diminish in importance, fame, or reputation
vt.（在数量、品质上）超越： to be greater, better, or stronger than

grovel.example: vi. 卑躬屈膝: He made a groveling apology to the girl. 他放下身段，给那姑娘道歉。
grovel.mean: vi. 卑躬屈膝： to draw back or crouch down in fearful submission

immutable.example: adj. 不可变的: One of the immutable laws of television is that low ratings inevitably lead to cancellation. 电视行业中一个不变的原则就是：低收视率的节目必然会被撤掉
immutable.mean: adj. 不可变的： not capable of changing or being changed

daft.example:
adj. 神经错乱的: The king was clearly daft, talking to trees and rocks. 国王俨然已经疯了，对着树和石头说话。
adj. 不明智的: a daft plan, doomed to wretched failure and merciless ridicule 一个不明智的决定，最终难逃悲催的结局和无情的嘲讽的下场
daft.mean:
adj. 神经错乱的： having or showing a very abnormal or sick state of mind
adj. 不明智的： showing or marked by a lack of good sense or judgment

spendthrift.example:
n. 挥霍者，败家子: The spendthrift managed to blow all of his inheritance in a single year. 这个败家子只用了一年就把自己继承的遗产挥霍一空。
adj. 挥霍的，不节俭的: Spendthrift consumers amassed a mountain of debt on their credit cards. 那些爱挥霍财富的消费者们在他们的信用卡上累积了一大笔债务。
spendthrift.mean:
n. 挥霍者，败家子： a person who spends improvidently or wastefully
adj. 挥霍的，不节俭的： given to spending money freely or foolishly

salvage.example: v. （从灾难中）抢救: salvaged the torpedoed vessel 拯救被鱼雷击中的舰艇
salvage.mean: v. （从灾难中）抢救： to save from loss or destruction

transgress.example: vt. 违背，犯错: don't even think about transgressing the drug laws of that Asian country, for punishments are severe and there's nothing that our government can do to intervene 别指望违背亚洲国家的药品相关法，因为惩罚非常严厉，政府会尽全力干涉
transgress.mean: vt. 违背，犯错： to fail to keep; to commit an offense

aggrandize.example: vt. 增加、提高力量、财富、地位、声誉等: exploited the situation to aggrandize himself 借势而上使得自己地位提升、财富增长
aggrandize.mean: vt. 增加、提高力量、财富、地位、声誉等： to enhance the power, wealth, position, or reputation of

ascetic.example:
adj. 禁欲的: This is an ascetic diet of rice and beans. 这是一顿禁欲的隐私，只有米饭和豌豆。
n. 禁欲者: We normally see an ascetic meditating in a Yogic pose. 我们通常会看见一个苦行者以瑜伽的姿势来冥想。
ascetic.mean:
adj. 禁欲的：practicing strict self-denial as a measure of personal and especially spiritual discipline
n. 禁欲者：a person who renounces material comforts and leads a life of austere self-discipline, especially as an act of religious devotion.

defile.example:
n.（山间）小道: They climbed up the mountain through a defile. 他们通过一条小路爬到山上。
v. 亵渎: art conservators were careful not to do anything that might defile the holy relic 公物管理员要防止任何玷污圣迹的行为
v. 不能被使用: supplies of meat that had been defiled by maggots 肉已经生蛆了，不能再食用了
defile.mean:
n.（山间）小道： a narrow passage or gorge
v. 亵渎： to treat (a sacred place or object) shamefully or with great disrespect
v. 不能被使用： to make unfit for use by the addition of something harmful or undesirable

ingenuity.example: n. 独创性，创新性: There is little ingenuity in his articles. 他的文章鲜有独创性
ingenuity.mean: n. 独创性，创新性： inventive skill or imagination

chasm.mean: n. 分歧，意见、利益或忠诚上的明显差异： a pronounced difference of opinion, interests, or loyalty.

assent.example: vi. 同意: The general proposed a detailed plan and the president assented. 将军提出了一个细节化的计划，总统同意了该计划。
assent.mean: vi. 同意：to agree to something especially after thoughtful consideration

pandemic.example: adj. 大范围流行的: pandemic malaria 大规模的疟疾
pandemic.mean: adj. 大范围流行的： widespread; general

malign.example:
adj. 恶意的: Both parties to the divorce showed a malign desire to make each other's future life utterly miserable. 离婚双方都表露出了恶毒的愿望，希望对方未来的生活陷入彻底的悲剧之中
vt. 诽谤: the belief that it is possible to win an election without maligning anyone 一种信念，那就是要赢得一场选举就不得不诽谤他人
malign.mean:
adj. 恶意的： having or showing a desire to cause someone pain or suffering for the sheer enjoyment of it
vt. 诽谤： to utter injuriously misleading or false reports about: speak evil of

fanciful.example:
adj. 幻想中的，不真实的: a fanciful tale of a monster in the woods 一个有关栖息在丛林中的怪兽的传说故事
adj. 不切实际的，荒谬的: She harbors the fanciful notion that she has a talent for singing. 她怀着一个不切实际的空想：她有着歌唱家的天赋。
fanciful.mean:
adj. 幻想中的，不真实的： not real and existing only in the imagination
adj. 不切实际的，荒谬的： conceived or made without regard for reason or reality

want.example:
n. 短缺: There's a notable want of teachers in rural areas. 农村地区存在着值得注意的师资短缺问题
vt. 渴望: I want a new car so badly! 我太想要一辆新车了！‖She wanted more time to finish the test. 她希望能有更多的时间来完成考试。
want.mean:
n. 短缺： the condition or quality of lacking something usual or necessary
vt. 渴望： to have a strong desire for

serried.example: adj. 密集的: Flowers came up every spring in their serried ranks. 大量的鲜花在春季盛开。
serried.mean: adj. 密集的： having little space between items or parts

indifferent.example:
adj. 公平的: They believed their art teacher could offer an indifferent judgment on their works' merits. 他们相信艺术老师会对他们作品的价值做出公正的评价
adj. （质量、档次等）中规中矩的，一般的: an indifferent but drinkable cup of coffee 一杯尚可入口的咖啡
adj. 不感兴趣的，冷漠的: indifferent about the result of CET-4 对四级成绩不感兴趣
indifferent.mean:
adj. 公平的： marked by impartiality
adj. （质量、档次等）中规中矩的，一般的： of average to below average quality
adj. 不感兴趣的，冷漠的： marked by a lack of interest, enthusiasm, or concern for something

cursory.example: adj. 匆忙的，不注意细节的: a cursory glance at the headline 匆匆地瞥了一眼标题
cursory.mean: adj. 匆忙的，不注意细节的： acting or done with excessive or careless speed

minutia.example: n. 次要的细节，小事: plagued by minutiae 被不重要的细节困扰
minutia.mean: n. 次要的细节，小事： a minute or minor detail

gargantuan.example: adj. 巨大的: a gargantuan waterfall in the rainforest 热带雨林中的巨大瀑布
gargantuan.mean: adj. 巨大的： tremendous in size, volume, or degree

absolute.example:
dj. 专制的: absolute ruler 专制的统治者
dj. 无限的: absolute silence 鸦雀无声
adj. 完美的、纯净不掺杂的: absolute alcohol 无水酒精（纯酒精）
adj. 不容置疑的，确凿的: absolute proof 确凿的证据
absolute.mean:
dj. 专制的： unconstrained by constitutional or other provisions
dj. 无限的： unqualified in extent or degree; total
adj. 完美的、纯净不掺杂的： free from imperfection free or relatively; free from mixture
adj. 不容置疑的，确凿的： positive, unquestionable

obloquy.example:
n. 谩骂，诽谤: she unleashed a torrent of obloquy on her opponent 她滔滔不绝地辱骂了对手一顿
n. 恶名，耻辱: the accused murderer was condemned to live out his days in perpetual obloquy 凶手终将在骂名中度过余生
obloquy.mean:
n. 谩骂，诽谤： abusively detractive language or utterance; calumny
n. 恶名，耻辱： the state of having lost the esteem of others

collude.example: v. 串通，共谋（做坏事）: collude with competitors to control the price 与竞争者合谋以控制价格
collude.mean: v. 串通，共谋（做坏事）：to act together secretly to achieve a fraudulent, illegal, or deceitful purpose; conspire

autonomy.example:
n. 政治上的独立: The province has been granted autonomy. 这个省份被授予了自治权
n. 自我主导的自由，尤其是精神独立: a teacher who encourages individual autonomy 一个鼓励精神独立的老师
autonomy.mean:
n. 政治上的独立： the quality or state of being self-governing
n. 自我主导的自由，尤其是精神独立： self-directing freedom and especially moral independence

impassive.example: adj. 冷漠的，无感情的: She remained impassive as the officers informed her of her son's death. 她面不改色地听着警官宣读她儿子的死讯
impassive.mean: adj. 冷漠的，无感情的： giving no sign of feeling or emotion

farce.example: n. 闹剧: The enforcement of this law became a farce. 这条法律的执行过程成了一场闹剧
farce.mean:
n. （带有嘲讽元素的）滑稽戏： a light dramatic composition marked by broadly satirical comedy and improbable plot
n. 闹剧： ridiculous or empty show

stride.example: vi. 迈大步走: strode to the door and slammed it 大步走向门口，狠狠地把门摔上
stride.mean: vi. 迈大步走： to move with or as if with long steps

particularize.example: vt. 详述: particularize the rules you must observe 详述了你需要遵守的规定
particularize.mean: vt. 详述： to go into or give details or particulars

verify.example: vt. 校验，证实: We need to verify your passport. 我们需要校验阁下的护照。
verify.mean: vt. 校验，证实： to determine or test the truth or accuracy of, as by comparison, investigation, or reference

serrate.example: adj. 锯齿状的: a serrate leaf 锯齿状的叶片
serrate.mean: adj. 锯齿状的： notched or toothed on the edge

copious.example: adj.丰富的，大量的: a copious harvest 大丰收
copious.mean: adj.丰富的，大量的： large in quantity; abundant

imperishable.example:
adj. 不能被摧毁的: Energy is imperishable. 能量本身是不能被毁灭的。
adj. 不朽的，永恒的: My memories are within me, imperishable. 我的回忆已经和我融为一体，不可改变。
imperishable.mean:
adj. 不能被摧毁的： impossible to destroy; not subject to decay
adj. 不朽的，永恒的： enduring or occurring forever

mollycoddle.example: vt. 溺爱: mollycoddle his only grandson 溺爱他唯一的孙子
mollycoddle.mean: vt. 溺爱： to treat with an excessive or absurd degree of indulgence and attention

rookie.example: n. 新兵；新手；菜鸟: The rookie replaced the injured regular at first base. 这个新手代替了受伤的一垒手。
rookie.mean: n. 新兵；新手；菜鸟： recruit; novice

lionize.example: vt. 追捧，把…捧为名人: She was lionized everywhere after her novel won the Pulitzer Prize. 在她的小说获得普利策奖之后，她无论走到哪都受到追捧。
lionize.mean: vt. 追捧，把…捧为名人： to look on or treat (a person) as a celebrity

footloose.example: adj. 无拘无束的，自由的: After having been chained for so long, the suddenly footloose dog ran about the yard tirelessly. 这只长期被锁链束缚的小狗因为突然之间获得了自由，在院子里不知疲倦地奔跑
footloose.mean: adj. 无拘无束的，自由的： having no attachments or ties; free to do as one pleases

rambunctious.example: adj. 喧闹的，骚乱的: That beach is often taken over by packs of rambunctious young people, so don't go there expecting peace and quiet. 那个海滩经常被一帮吵闹的年轻人占领，所以不要指望过去能享受到平静和安宁。
rambunctious.mean: adj. 喧闹的，骚乱的： being rough or noisy in a high-spirited way

gamble.example:
vi. 赌博，孤注一掷: gambled on the train being late 赌火车晚点
vi. 使受到威胁: You don't want to gamble with your life, so buckle up. 你不会想拿命来开玩笑的，所以系好安全带
gamble.mean:
vi. 赌博，孤注一掷： to bet on an uncertain outcome, as of a contest
vi. 使受到威胁： to place in danger

raffle.example: n. 垃圾，废物: The front lawn was littered with the raffle that the workers had left behind. 前院的草坪上满是工人们丢的垃圾。
raffle.mean: n. 垃圾，废物： discarded or useless material

scion.example: n. 子孙: scion of a railroad empire 铁路大王的后代

lurk.example: vi. 潜伏: Dangers lurk in the path of wilderness. 在这条荒野的小路上隐伏着危险
lurk.mean: vi. 潜伏： to lie in wait in a place of concealment especially for an evil purpose

lag.example:
adj. 最终的，最后的: We're now in the lag end of the project. 现在我们到了项目的尾声阶段。
vi. 缓慢行走: The tired puppy was lagging behind the rest of the pack. 疲倦的小狗在队伍的后面缓缓地走着。
vi. 萎靡，失去活力: During the fourth quarter the whole team seemed to lag. 到了第四节整支队伍似乎都已经精疲力竭了。
lag.mean:
adj. 最终的，最后的： following all others of the same kind in order or time
vi. 缓慢行走： to proceed or develop with comparative slowness
vi. 萎靡，失去活力： to lose bodily strength or vigor

delicacy.example: n. （外貌、建筑、表演）精致: lace of great delicacy 精致的蕾丝
delicacy.mean: n. （外貌、建筑、表演）精致： fineness of appearance, construction, or execution; elegance

vicious.example:
adj. 凶恶的，恶毒的: vicious slander 恶意的诽谤
adj. 猛烈的: a vicious storm ripped through the region 在境内肆虐的强烈风暴
vicious.mean:
adj. 凶恶的，恶毒的： having or showing the desire to inflict severe pain and suffering on others
adj. 猛烈的： marked by violence or ferocity

demanding.example:
adj. 难取悦的，难满足的: His mother could be demanding at times. 他母亲有时候很难取悦。
adj. 费时间花心思的: the demanding assignment kept them working all night long 那项劳神的任务使得他们熬夜
demanding.mean:
adj. 难取悦的，难满足的： not easily satisfied or pleased
adj. 费时间花心思的： requiring much time, effort, or careful attention

mesh.example: v. 诱捕: Dolphins sometimes become meshed in fishnets. 有时海豚也会被渔网缠住
mesh.mean: v. 诱捕： to catch or hold as if in a net

lax.example:
adj. 松弛的，不紧的，不严格的: exercises to improve lax muscles 锻炼松弛的肌肉‖The guidelines for the essay contest were fairly lax, permitting a wide variety of topics. 本次作文大赛的要求相对比较宽松，允许写多种类型的主题。
adj. 懈怠的，漫不经心的: The university has been lax about enforcing these rules. 学校对于这些规定的施行显得漫不经心。
lax.mean:
adj. 松弛的，不紧的，不严格的： not tense, firm, or rigid
adj. 懈怠的，漫不经心的： failing to give proper care and attention

distort.example: vt. 扭曲，歪曲: A painter may exaggerate or distort shapes and forms. 画家可能夸张或扭曲形状。|| The coach's message was so distorted after passing through so many people that it was unintelligible. 教练的信息在经过许多人传递后已经被歪曲的很难看懂了。
distort.mean: vt. 扭曲，歪曲：to twist out of the true meaning or proportion

fracas.example: n. 争吵，吵闹: The police were called in to break up the fracas.警察奉命去制止骚乱
fracas.mean: n. 争吵，吵闹： a physical dispute between opposing individuals or groups; a rough and often noisy fight usually involving several people

ambivalent.example: adj. （尤指感情、态度）矛盾的: He maintained an ambivalent attitude to religion throughout his life. 他一生都对宗教抱有矛盾的心态。
ambivalent.mean: adj. （尤指感情、态度）矛盾的： having a mixture of opposing feelings

complacent.example:
adj. 自满的，自鸣得意的: a complacent junior accountant who was certain of her indispensability to the company 一个确信自己对于公司而言无可替代而自满的年轻会计
adj. 无所谓的，不关心的: We can't afford to be complacent about rural illiteracy rates. 我们不能对农村的文盲率坐视不理。
complacent.mean:
adj. 自满的，自鸣得意的： feeling or showing an often excessive or unjustified satisfaction and pleasure in one's status, possessions, or attainments
adj. 无所谓的，不关心的： having or showing a lack of interest or concern

austere.example:
adj. 朴素的，朴实无华: For the private office of the CEO of the large corporation, the room is unexpectedly austere. 出人意料的是，大公司总裁的私人办公室居然十分朴素。
adj. 严肃的，令人生畏的: an austere fortress at the top of some formidable cliffs 建立在悬崖峭壁之上的一座令人畏惧的堡垒‖In his memory his deceased grandfather is an austere, distant, cold person. 在他的记忆之中，已过世的祖父是一个严肃、冷漠而难以接近的人。
austere.mean:
adj. 朴素的，朴实无华： markedly simple or unadorned
adj. 严肃的，令人生畏的： stern and cold in appearance or manner

alienate.example:
vt. 使…疏远: His heartless treatment of their mother during the divorce proceeding has completely alienated the two children. 他在离婚过程中对妻子表现出来的残酷，已经彻底地让两个孩子与他疏远起来。
vt. 转让，让渡: A landowner has a right to alienate his right of ownership - in other words, he can sell the land if he wants to. 地主拥有转让所有权的权力——也就是说如果愿意，他可以出售他的土地。
alienate.mean:
vt. 使…疏远： to make unfriendly, hostile, or indifferent especially where attachment formerly existed
vt. 转让，让渡： to convey or transfer (as property or a right) usually by a specific act rather than the due course of law

hasty.example: adj. 轻率的: a hasty decision 轻率的决定
hasty.mean: adj. 轻率的： fast and typically superficial; acting or done with excessive or careless speed

idiosyncrasy.example: n. 独特而奇怪的习惯: His only idiosyncrasy is his inveterate wearing of sneakers, even with business suits. 他唯一的怪癖就是无时无刻都穿着运动鞋——哪怕身上是西装革履。
idiosyncrasy.mean: n. 独特而奇怪的习惯： an odd or peculiar habit

retort.example: n. （尤指机智的）回应，回答: She responded to the heckler with a scathing but hilarious retort that instantly won over the audience. 面对故意起哄捣乱的人，她那严厉但不失幽默的回答立刻得到了观众的肯定。
retort.mean: n. （尤指机智的）回应，回答： something spoken or written in reaction especially to a question, especially a quick, witty, or cutting reply

hypnotic.example: adj.催眠的: Her eyes soon grew heavy from the hypnotic rhythm of the train's wheels. 伴随着催眠的铁轨声，她很快就有了睡意
hypnotic.mean: adj.催眠的： tending to cause sleep

daredevil.example:
adj./n. 大胆鲁莽的(人): His daredevil stunts are sure to end in disaster someday. 玩火者必自焚。
adj. 不考虑后果的: a daredevil driver who thinks that racing on city streets is a harmless game 不计后果的司机认为在大街上飙车对人无害
daredevil.mean:
adj./n. 大胆鲁莽的(人)： foolishly adventurous or bold
adj. 不考虑后果的： having or showing a lack of concern for the consequences of one’s actions

fictitious.example: adj. 虚构的: His wartime exploits turned out to be entirely fictitious, as he had never even been in the military. 他吹嘘的战时英勇行为是彻底虚构的，因为他根本就没有参过军
fictitious.mean: adj. 虚构的： not real and existing only in the imagination

green.example: adj. 无经验的: lead a squad of green recruits 带领一队没有经验的新兵
green.mean: adj. 无经验的： deficient in training, knowledge, or experience

puny.example: adj. 微小的，弱小的: I wouldn't mess with him—he makes bodybuilders look puny in comparison. 我不敢招惹他——其他健身的人和他比起来都像小孩。
puny.mean: adj. 微小的，弱小的： of inferior size, strength, or significance; weak

squint.example: vt. 斜视，睥睨: The driver squinted as the sun hit his windshield. 阳光使得驾驶员不得不把眼睛偏向一边
squint.mean: vt. 斜视，睥睨： to look or glance sideways

fetter.example:
n. 枷锁，限制: a fetter that prevents us from trying something new 阻碍我们尝试新事物的枷锁
v. 束缚: be fettered by family responsibilities 被家庭责任所束缚
fetter.mean:
n. 枷锁，限制： something that limits one's freedom of action or choice
v. 束缚： to restrain from motion, action, or progress

consent.example:
n. 同意，赞同: We had to get our neighbor’s consent in order to trim the tree from his side. 想要从邻居家那边修剪树木，我们得先得到他们的同意。
vi. 同意: consent to being tested in her neurobiology experiment 同意作为被试参加神经生物学的实验‖refused to consent to the marriage 拒绝这桩婚事
consent.mean:
n. 同意，赞同： the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something
vi. 同意： to give assent or approval

misdemeanor.example: n. 轻罪: charged with several misdemeanors 被指控几项轻罪
misdemeanor.mean: n. 轻罪： a crime less serious than a felony

decant.example: vt. 轻轻倒出: The bottles were uncorked and the wine was decanted an hour before the meal. 瓶塞被打开，美酒在正餐前一小时倒出
decant.mean: vt. 轻轻倒出： to pour off (wine, for example) without disturbing the sediment

fortify.example:
vt. 加固，鼓励: This country will fortify the coastal areas. 这个国家要加强沿海地区的防御
vt. 做好心理准备: She fortified herself for the incoming tennis tournament with a series of confidence-boosting exercises. 她通过一系列练习赛来找自信，为即将到来的网球锦标赛做好心理准备
fortify.mean:
vt. 加固，鼓励： to give physical strength, courage, or endurance to
vt. 做好心理准备： to prepare (oneself) mentally or emotionally

\u00e9clat.example: n. 辉煌成就: The premier of Mozart’s Le Nozze di Figaro enjoyed a great éclat in 1786. 莫扎特歌剧《费加罗的婚礼》于1786年的首演获得了极大的成功
\u00e9clat.mean: n. 辉煌成就： brilliant or conspicuous success

fable.example:
n. 寓言故事: This classic Christmas film is essentially a fableshowing how every person's life has meaning. 这部经典的基督教电影本质上来说是一个寓言，它告诉我们每个人的生命都是有意义的
n. 神话，传说: According to an ancient fable, the waters of the mountain spring are the tears of a woman weeping for her lost children. 根据一个古老的传说，这条山中的泉水是一名失去孩子的母亲所流下的眼泪
n. 谎言: The stories of lost cities of gold may have been fables deliberately concocted by Native Americans to dupe the Spanish. 所谓的“失落的黄金之都”的故事也许只是美洲土著们杜撰出来忽悠西班牙人的
fable.mean:
n. 寓言故事： a story intended to teach a basic truth or moral about life
n. 神话，传说： a legendary story of supernatural happenings
n. 谎言： a statement known by its maker to be untrue and made in order to deceive

responsive.example: adj. 敏感的: Children are often the most responsive members of the audience. 儿童通常是观众中最为敏感的群体
responsive.mean: adj. 敏感的： quick to respond or react appropriately or sympathetically

carnal.example:
adj. 肉体的，物质的: seen with carnal eyes 用肉眼看 || carnal remains 遗体
adj. 世俗的: a carnal mind 凡心
carnal.mean:
adj. 肉体的，物质的： relating to the physical
adj. 世俗的： worldly

fidelity.example: n. 忠诚: They have never wavered in their fidelity to the cause of liberation. 他们从不动摇对于解放事业的忠诚
fidelity.mean: n. 忠诚： the quality or state of being faithful

estrange.example: vt. 使疏远，离间，使感情失和: he estranged several of his coworkers 他和好多同事疏远了
estrange.mean: vt. 使疏远，离间，使感情失和： to arouse especially mutual enmity or indifference in where there had formerly been love, affection, or friendliness

somnolence.example: n. 瞌睡，嗜睡: Somnolence is likely to be the most typical reaction to this novel. 读这部小说最典型的感受就是想睡觉。
somnolence.mean: n. 瞌睡，嗜睡： the quality or state of desiring or needing sleep

repudiate.example:
vt. 否认: She repudiated the charge that she had lied on her résumé. 她否认了她在简历中作假的指控。
vt. 拒绝接受: We didn't like the terms, so we repudiated the contract. 我们没有接受这份合同，因为我们对其中的条款表示不满。
repudiate.mean:
vt. 否认： to declare not to be true
vt. 拒绝接受： to show unwillingness to accept, do, engage in, or agree to

regress.example:
vi. 后退: To stand still is to regress.不进则退。
vi. 退化，恶化: The annual celebration has regressed to the point where it's nothing more than an excuse to get drunk. 年度的庆祝活动已经堕落成一个尽情喝醉的借口了。
regress.mean:
vi. 后退： to go back; move backward
vi. 退化，恶化： to become worse or of less value

comprehend.example:
vt. 理解，了解: the age at which children can comprehend the difference between right and wrong 一个小孩可以开始分辨是非的年龄‖With internet, television, cellphone and even radio down, we are unable to comprehend what has happened. 互联网、电视、手机乃至无线电都不起作用了，我们无法获知发生了什么。
vt. 包括，包含: Our notion of morality should comprehend much more than proper sexual behavior. 我们的道德观不应该仅仅止步于恰当的性行为。
comprehend.mean:
vt. 理解，了解： to grasp the nature, significance, or meaning of
vt. 包括，包含： to contain or hold within a total scope, significance, or amount

compelling.example:
adj. 极具说服力的: made a compelling argument against military intervention 就反对军事干预提出了很有说服力的论证‖If you can’t present any compelling evidence to prove your innocence, you will be found guilty. 如果你找不出任何能证明你清白的有力证据，你就会被定罪。
adj. 迫切的，紧迫的: There is no compelling need to raise taxes at this time. 现在没有迫切的提升税率的必要。
compelling.mean:
adj. 极具说服力的： having the power to persuade
adj. 迫切的，紧迫的： needing immediate attention

strand.example:
n. 绳、线之一股: a strand of DNA DNA中的一条链
v. 遗弃，使置于困境: The convoy was stranded in the desert. 车队被困在了沙漠之中。
strand.mean:
n. 绳、线之一股： a single filament, such as a fiber or thread, of a woven or braided material
v. 遗弃，使置于困境： to leave in a strange or an unfavorable place especially without funds or means to depart

carve.example:
vi. 雕刻: carved a statue out of rare marble 用纯的大理石雕刻了一尊雕像
v. （通过长期不懈努力）产生或导致: finally carved out a niche for the sport in the school's athletic program 在学校运动计划中寻找到了自己的定位 || carve out a way through the enemy 从敌营中杀出一条血路
carve.mean:
vi. 雕刻： to create a three-dimensional representation of (something) using solid material
v. （通过长期不懈努力）产生或导致： to produce or bring about especially by long or repeated effort

precipitate.example:
adj. 匆忙的: the army's precipitate withdrawal from the field of battle 匆忙将军队从战场上撤下
vt. 促使，导致: to precipitate an international crisis 产生国际危机
precipitate.mean:
adj. 匆忙的： acting or done with excessive or careless speed
vt. 促使，导致： to cause to happen, especially suddenly or prematurely

imperturbable.example: adj.沉着冷静的，淡定的: The chef was absolutely imperturbable—even when the kitchen caught on fire. 这个厨师可谓淡定到了极致——他连厨房着火的时候都依然沉着
imperturbable.mean: adj.沉着冷静的，淡定的： marked by extreme calm, impassivity, and steadiness

slate.example: vt. 列入名单，计划，安排: You've been slated for a three o'clock interview. 你的面试被安排在三点。
slate.mean: vt. 列入名单，计划，安排： to put (someone or something) on a list

amenable.example: adj. 顺从的，服从的: a high-spirited and rebellious girl not at all amenable to persuasion. 一个泼辣而反叛的女孩根本不听从劝告。
amenable.mean: adj. 顺从的，服从的：readily brought to yield, submit, or cooperate

protean.example: adj. 善变的，多才多艺的: He loved to show off his protean talent. 他喜欢炫耀自己多样的才华.
protean.mean: adj. 善变的，多才多艺的： displaying great diversity or variety; versatile

bane.example:
n. 祸根: Drinking was the bane of his life. 饮酒是他一生的祸根
n. 有害的物质: a plant that is believed to be the bane of the wolf 一种被认为对狼有毒害作用的植物
bane.mean:
n. 祸根：a source of harm or ruin
n. 有害的物质：a substance that by chemical action can kill or injure a living thing

rift.example:
n. 离间: a rift between two once allied nations 两个往昔盟国的决裂
vt. 使开裂: Hills were rifted by the earthquake. 地震使得山崩地裂
rift.mean:
n. 离间： a break in friendly relations
vt. 使开裂： to cause to split open or break

shirk.example: vi. 逃避，规避: shirk one’s duty 逃避责任
shirk.mean: vi. 逃避，规避： to get or keep away from (as a responsibility) through cleverness or trickery

ebullient.example: adj. 热情奔放的: The ebullient dancers left an enduring impression on us. 热情洋溢的舞者给我们留下了难以磨灭的印象
ebullient.mean: adj. 热情奔放的： zestfully enthusiastic

coronation.example: n. 加冕，加冕礼: Two different musical pieces by Mozart (a piano concerto and a mass) are both titled “Coronation”. 莫扎特两部不同的音乐作品（一部钢琴协奏曲和一部弥撒）都被称作“加冕”
coronation.mean: n. 加冕，加冕礼：the act or ceremony of crowning a sovereign or the sovereign's consort

acme.example:
n. 顶点，极点: the acme of his career 他事业的巅峰
n. 最佳典范: a movie that has come to be regarded as the acme of the Hollywood musical 这部影片被认为是好莱坞音乐剧的最佳典范
acme.mean:
n. 顶点，极点： the highest point or stage, as of achievement or development
n. 最佳典范： the most perfect type or example

inventory.example:
n. 存货清单: The dealership has an unusually large inventory of pre-owned vehicles. 销售商手中有着一份巨大的二手车库存单
n. （写有要点的）简介: They decided to offer the public an informative inventory of everything that is known about the virus at this time. 他们决定向公众提供一份极富价值的报告，它涵盖了目前为止关于这种病毒的所有认识
inventory.mean:
n. 存货清单： a detailed, itemized list, report, or record of things in one's possession, especially a periodic survey of all goods and materials in stock
n. （写有要点的）简介： a short statement of the main points

debut.example: n. 初次登台，出道: made her single debut 完成了她的处女秀
debut.mean: n. 初次登台，出道： a first public appearance

absolve.example: v. 使无罪，解除责任: absolve somebody from blame 使某人免受责备
absolve.mean: v. 使无罪，解除责任： to set free from an obligation or the consequences of guilt, exculpate

naysay.mean: vt. 拒绝，否认： to oppose, deny, or take a pessimistic or negative view of

dingy.example: adj. 昏暗的，肮脏的: A dingy room is always Dickensian image of the poor. 一个肮脏而昏暗的房间经常作为狄更斯时代的穷人形象。|| The bed sheets were pretty dingy so we threw them in the laundry pile. 床单太脏了以至于我们把它扔进了脏衣服堆。
dingy.mean: adj. 昏暗的，肮脏的： darkened with smoke and grime; dirty or discolored.

perforate.example: v. 打孔，穿透: to perforate with a pin 用针穿孔
perforate.mean: v. 打孔，穿透： to make a hole through

vessel.example:
n.管: blood vessel 血管
n. 船，舰艇: the largest military vessel afloat 最大的军用舰艇
vessel.mean:
n.管： a tube or canal (as an artery) in which a body fluid is contained and conveyed or circulated
n. 船，舰艇： a watercraft bigger than a rowboat

lofty.example:
adj. 崇高的: lofty ideals 崇高的理想
adj. 高的: lofty mountains 高耸的山峰‖the ever-increasing lofty heights of the world's skyscrapers 不断攀升的摩天大楼的高度
adj. 自大的: She acts all lofty and superior just because she went to Stanford University. 她之所以表现得这么自大和不可一世，只因为她考进了斯坦福
lofty.mean:
adj. 崇高的： elevated in character and spirit, noble
adj. 高的： rising to a great height
adj. 自大的： having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude

consolidate.example:
vt. 使联合，统一: consolidate several small school districts 合并了几个小的校区
vt. 加固，使安全: consolidate the defense line 加固防线
consolidate.mean:
vt. 使联合，统一： to join together into one whole; unite
vt. 加固，使安全： to make firm or secure; strengthen

improvise.example: v. 即兴而作: Since the award was a complete surprise, I improvised an acceptance speech. 因为那个奖项完全是个惊喜，所以我即兴发表了一个获奖演说
improvise.mean: v. 即兴而作： to invent, compose, or perform with little or no preparation

dour.example:
adj. 闷闷不乐的,死气沉沉的: The captain’s dour look depressed us all. 船长闷闷不乐的脸色使我们倍感低落
adj. 严厉的: His dour criticism made us regret having undertaken the job. 他严厉的批评让我们后悔接下这活儿了
dour.mean:
adj. 闷闷不乐的,死气沉沉的： sullen, gloomy
adj. 严厉的： harsh and threatening in manner or appearance

pliant.example:
adj. 易弯曲的: a pliant young tree 易弯曲的小树
adj. 顺从的: She’s proud and stubborn, you know, under that pliant exterior. 你知道在温顺的外表下，她骄傲而固执。
pliant.mean:
adj. 易弯曲的： easily bent or flexed
adj. 顺从的： yielding readily to influence or domination

concord.example: n．一致，和睦: No discord, no concord. 不打不成交
concord.mean: n．一致，和睦：harmony or agreement of interests or feelings; accord

garment.example: n. 衣服: pack all garments 给所有衣服打包
garment.mean: n. 衣服： an article of clothing

tatty.example: adj. 破旧的，褴褛的: a tatty shirt 破旧的衬衣
tatty.mean: adj. 破旧的，褴褛的： somewhat worn, shabby, or dilapidated

waffle.example: vi. 胡扯: This lecturer will waffle on for hours. 这个老师会胡说八道地扯几个小时。
waffle.mean: vi. 胡扯： to talk or write foolishly

lambaste.example: vt. 严厉斥责: Critics lambasted his performance. 评论家严厉斥责了他的表演
lambaste.mean: vt. 严厉斥责： to scold sharply; berate

awry.example:
adj. 弯曲或扭曲的: Her sunglass is awry. 她墨镜戴歪了
adj./adv. 走样的（地），出差错的（地）: Operation Redwing was initially launched by US special-operation troops in hopes of capturing or killing a Taliban leader but went awry. 由美军特种部队发起、代号为“红翼”的军事行动的起初目的是捕获或击杀一名塔利班头目，然而行动在执行过程中出现了差错
awry.mean:
adj. 弯曲或扭曲的： in a turned or twisted position or direction
adj./adv. 走样的（地），出差错的（地）： off the correct or expected course

ameliorate.example: vt. 改善，改进: to ameliorate the suffering of people who have lost their jobs 改善失业人员的痛苦
ameliorate.mean: vt. 改善，改进：to make or become better; improve

allay.example: vt. 减轻: allay one’s fears or doubts 减轻某人的恐惧或怀疑
allay.mean: vt. 减轻： to subdue or reduce in intensity or severity, alleviate

extract.example: n. 用力拔出: extracted a wisdom tooth 拔出一颗智齿
extract.mean: n. 用力拔出： to pull or take out forcibly

array.example:
n. 排列，阵列: a marching band’s carefully choreographed array 前进中的乐队所摆出的经过复杂编排的方针
vt. 排列，摆放: data arrayed in descending order 按照降序排列的数据‖arrayed his baseball cards in order of their rarity and consequent monetary value 把他的棒球卡按照稀有程度——也即价值排列
vt. 装饰，装修: He had already arrayed himself in his best clothes. 他已经穿上了他最好的服装。‖a door arrayed for the holidays with a beautiful evergreen wreath 被美丽的常青花环妆点的节日大门
array.mean:
n. 排列，阵列： a regular and imposing grouping or arrangement
vt. 排列，摆放： to arrange or display in or as if in an array
vt. 装饰，装修： to dress or decorate especially in splendid or impressive attire

contend.example:
vi. 竞争，争夺: two traditional rivals contending for the championship 两支争夺冠军头衔的老对手
vt. 声明，声称: contended that his opponent was wrong about practically everything 宣称对手几乎在所有问题上都犯了错误‖that the his considerable experience made him the best candidate 声称因为他见多识广，所以是最佳人选
contend.mean:
vi. 竞争，争夺： to strive or vie in contest or rivalry or against difficulties
vt. 声明，声称： to state as a fact usually forcefully

misfortune.example: n. 不幸: unable to grasp why he had been struck by such a misfortune 无法理解他为何会遇上如此不幸之事
misfortune.mean: n. 不幸： bad fortune or ill luck

nil.example: n. 不存在，零: reduced to nil 消逝殆尽
nil.mean: n. 不存在，零： nothing; zero

fraught.example:
adj. 充满的: an experience fraught with peril 充满危险的经历
adj. 令人忧虑的: a fraught relationship between the two neighboring countries 两邻国间令人担忧的关系
fraught.mean:
adj. 充满的： full of or accompanied by something
adj. 令人忧虑的： causing or characterized by emotional distress or tension

smirk.example: vi. （自鸣得意地）笑: She tried not to smirk when they announced the winner. 当他们宣布她获得了胜利时，她尽可能地保持不露出笑容。
smirk.mean: vi. （自鸣得意地）笑： to smile in an affected, often offensively self-satisfied manner

crucial.example: adj. 非常重要的，决定性的: a crucial step in his professional career 他职业生涯中具有决定性的一步
crucial.mean: adj. 非常重要的，决定性的： extremely significant or important

urbane.example: adj. 彬彬有礼的，文雅的: a gentlemanly and urbane host of elegant dinner parties 优雅晚宴的主人有绅士风度，彬彬有礼
urbane.mean: adj. 彬彬有礼的，文雅的： notably polite or finished in manner

content.example:
v. 使满足: One glass of beer every day could content him. 每天一杯啤酒就能满足他
n. 主题: Although I appreciate the poem's lyrical qualities, I don't understand its content. 虽然我很欣赏这首诗歌的节奏美，但我无法理解其主题
n. 内容，内涵: The speech was filled with fancy words but devoid of any real content. 这篇演讲辞藻华丽，但是没什么实质性内容
content.mean:
v. 使满足： to appease the desires of
n. 主题： a major object of interest or concern (as in a discussion or artistic composition)
n. 内容，内涵： the idea that is conveyed or intended to be conveyed to the mind by language, symbol, or action

remorse.example: n. 懊悔，悔恨: He felt a deep remorse for having neglected his family over the years. 他为多年来忽略家人的行为表示懊悔。
remorse.mean: n. 懊悔，悔恨： moral anguish arising from repentance for past misdeeds; bitter regret

adapt.example: vt. 修改，使适应: adapt to the change 适应变化； adapt the novel for the screen 改编小说为影视作品
adapt.mean: vt. 修改，使适应： to modify according with the changing circumstances

unkempt.example: adj. 凌乱的，无序的: unkempt hotel rooms 凌乱的酒店房间
unkempt.mean: adj. 凌乱的，无序的： lacking in order, neatness, and often cleanliness

palaver.example:
n. 对话，交流: seemingly endless palaver between the negotiating parties 谈判双方之间看似没有尽头的对话
vi. 闲聊: Mothers were palavering and drinking coffee while watching their children play. 母亲们一边看着她们的孩子玩耍，一边喝着咖啡闲谈。
palaver.mean:
n. 对话，交流： an exchange of views for the purpose of exploring a subject or deciding an issue
vi. 闲聊： to talk profusely or idly

instigate.example: vt. 煽动，激起: This incident is instigated by a small group of people with ulterior motives. 此次事件是被少数别有用心的人煽动起来的
instigate.mean: vt. 煽动，激起： to goad or urge forward; to stir up

impetuous.example:
adj. 冲动的，性急的，轻率的: He is young and impetuous. 他年轻易冲动
adj. 剧烈的，猛烈的: an impetuous wind 猛烈的风
impetuous.mean:
adj. 冲动的，性急的，轻率的： marked by impulsive vehemence or passion
adj. 剧烈的，猛烈的： marked by force and violence of movement or action

whiff.example:
n. 微风: A whiff of fresh air reinvigorated him. 一股清新的空气让他恢复了活力。
n. 细微的信号，略微痕迹: Even a whiff of appreciation for everything I've done for her would have been nice. 她哪怕是对我为她的付出流露出一丁点的感激之情也好啊。‖Humanity is unregenerable and hates the language of conformity, since conformity has a whiff of the inhuman about it. (Anthony Burgess) 人性是不能改造也无发统一的，因为一致性本身带有一点点不人道的意味。（安东尼?伯吉斯）
whiff.mean:
n. 微风： a quick puff or slight gust especially of air, odor, gas, smoke, or spray
n. 细微的信号，略微痕迹： an almost imperceptible sign of something

veto.example: n./vt. 否决，禁止: The President vetoed the bill. 总统否决了提案。‖We wanted to do a cross-country trip, but our parents vetoed it. 我们想来一次跨国旅行，但是父母不肯批准。
veto.mean: n./vt. 否决，禁止： to forbid or prohibit authoritatively

waddle.example: vi. 摇摇摆摆地走: The duck waddled back into the water. 鸭子一摇一摆地回到了水中
waddle.mean: vi. 摇摇摆摆地走： to walk with short steps that tilt the body from side to side

eternal.example: adj. 永恒的: eternal love 永恒的爱
eternal.mean: adj. 永恒的： having infinite duration; everlasting; perpetual

revenge.example:
n. 报复，复仇: Both sides were determined to get revenge for losses and showed little interest in ending the feud. 双方都下定决心要为失去的东西报仇，对于结束他们之间的世仇毫无兴趣。‖The bombing was in revenge for the assassination of their leader. 此次轰炸是对暗杀他们领袖的报复行动。
vt. 复仇: He finally revenged the death of his brother. 他终于为兄弟的死报了仇。
revenge.mean:
n. 报复，复仇： an act or instance of retaliating in order to get even
vt. 复仇： to avenge (as oneself) usually by retaliating in kind or degree

transitory.example: adj. 短暂的: most of life’s joys are transitory 尘世间的欢乐都是过眼烟云，转瞬即逝
transitory.mean: adj. 短暂的： existing or lasting only a short time; short-lived or temporary

dodder.example: vi. 蹒跚，颤巍巍地行进: He could only dodder along after the operation. 他手术后只能步履蹒跚的走。
dodder.mean: vi. 蹒跚，颤巍巍地行进：to progress feebly and unsteadily

fervid.example:
adj. 酷热的: set out when the fervid heat subsides 当酷热消散之后才出发
adj. 热情的: a fervid patriot 热情洋溢的爱国者
fervid.mean:
adj. 酷热的： having a notably high temperature
adj. 热情的： marked by great passion or zeal

dashing.example: adj. 爱好冒险的，大胆的: the dashing heroes in stories about the American West 美国西部故事中那些勇敢无畏的英雄
dashing.mean: adj. 爱好冒险的，大胆的： inclined or willing to take risks

cement.example: n./v. 粘合: justice is the cement that holds a political community together 正义是让政治个体团结的粘合剂
cement.mean: n./v. 粘合： a uniting or binding force or influence

abate.example:
v. 减轻（程度或者强度）: abate his rage/pain 平息他的愤怒/减轻痛苦
v. 减少（数量或者降低价值）: abate a tax 降低税收
v. 停止，撤销: abate a nuisance 停止伤害
abate.mean:
v. 减轻（程度或者强度）： to reduce in degree or intensity
v. 减少（数量或者降低价值）： to reduce in amount or value
v. 停止，撤销： to put an end to

entrap.example: vt. 诱骗: a string of inconsistent statements finally entrapped the witness 一系列不一致的陈述最终蒙骗了目击者
entrap.mean: vt. 诱骗： to lure into a compromising statement or act

superimpose.example: v. 添声加色，使形象、某因素或性质更加清楚: superimposed her own interpretation when she retold the story 她重复故事的时候，加入了自己的解释
superimpose.mean: v. 添声加色，使形象、某因素或性质更加清楚：to add as a distinct feature, element, or quality:

knit.example:
vt. 编织（纱线）: She knitted him a sweater for Christmas. 圣诞节她为他缝了一件毛衣
vt. 连接，联系: Sport knits the whole family close together. 体育将整个家庭紧紧地联系在一起
knit.mean:
vt. 编织（纱线）： to form by interlacing yarn or thread in a series of connected loops with needles
vt. 连接，联系： to join closely; unite securely

nondescript.example: adj. 平凡的，不吸引人的: Their performance was disappointingly nondescript. 他们的演出令人失望，味同嚼蜡。
nondescript.mean: adj. 平凡的，不吸引人的： lacking distinctive or interesting qualities

jubilant.example: adj. 喜悦的: The nominee delivered a jubilant speech before the cheering crowd. 在欢呼的人群面前，被提名人发表了充满喜悦的演说

drench.example: vt. 湿透，浸透: The thunderstorm drenched us to the skin. 雷雨把我们浇了个透
drench.mean: vt. 湿透，浸透： to wet thoroughly

connive.example:
vi. 暗中合作: They connived to take over the throne. 他们密谋篡位
v. 纵容: The guards were suspected of conniving at the prisoner's escape. 警卫人员有纵容犯人越狱的嫌疑
connive.mean:
vi. 暗中合作：to cooperate secretly or have a secret understanding; collude
v. 纵容：假装忽视或并未采取措施阻止错误： to pretend ignorance of or fail to take action against something one ought to oppose

caprice.example:
n. 一时冲动的决定: an out-of-character caprice led him to take the day off from work and go to the beach 一时冲动让他决定休假一天，去海滩度假
n. 反复无常，善变: his knack for picking racetrack winners appears to owe as much to caprice as it does to a canny assessment of horseflesh 他赌马屡赌虑赢，要归功于自己的反复无常而不是对于赛马本身独到精明的评估。
caprice.mean:
n. 一时冲动的决定： an impulsive change of mind
n. 反复无常，善变： an inclination to change one's mind impulsively.

prodigal.example:
adj. 挥霍的: prodigal outlays for her clothes 买衣服时挥金如土
n. 败家子: The million-dollar lottery winner was such a prodigal that his windfall was exhausted after only a few years. 靠彩票中了百万的赢家是个败家子，几年之内就把这笔意外之财全部花完了。
prodigal.mean:
adj. 挥霍的： recklessly spendthrift
n. 败家子： someone who spends money freely or foolishly

attune.example: vt. 使协调，使和谐: After years spent in academia, he found it difficult to attune himself to the corporate culture. 在学术圈摸爬滚打多年之后，他发现自己很难融入企业文化之中。
attune.mean: vt. 使协调，使和谐： to bring into harmony

explicate.example: vt. 解释，说明: The physicist did his best to explicate the wave theory of light for the audience of laymen. 物理学家尽其所能向一群非专业的群众解释了光的波动性理论。
explicate.mean: vt. 解释，说明： to give a detailed explanation of

unflappable.example: adj. 镇定的，从容不迫的: a unflappable general 一个镇定的将军
unflappable.mean: adj. 镇定的，从容不迫的： not easily upset or excited

penury.example:
n. 贫穷: Some have pessimistically regarded the higher education in China as an invisible and irresistible path to penury. 有人悲观地把中国的高等教育看作是一条通往贫穷的通道——无形但不可抗拒
n. 吝啬，节俭: They bitterly complained about their father's penury. 他们哀怨地抱怨父亲的节俭
penury.mean:
n. 贫穷： extreme dearth; barrenness or insufficiency
n. 吝啬，节俭： extreme and often niggardly frugality

officious.example: adj. 多管闲事的: an officious little man who was always telling everyone else how to do their jobs 一个多管闲事的人，总喜欢对他人的事情指手画脚
officious.mean: adj. 多管闲事的： thrusting oneself where one is not welcome or invited

goggle.example: v. 凝视: goggled at the characters on the stele 凝视碑文的字眼
goggle.mean: v. 凝视： to look long and hard in wonder or surprise

reassure.example: vt. 使安心，打消疑虑: I tried to reassure her that the dog would come back home by nightfall. 我尽力让她安心，说夜幕降临之前小狗一定会回家的。
reassure.mean: vt. 使安心，打消疑虑： to restore to confidence

subtle.example:
adj. 微妙的，难以感知的: subtle differences in meaning between the words 单词词义之间的细微差别
adj. 巧妙的，间接或带有欺骗性的: used subtle methods of persuasion 采用了十分巧妙的劝说方式
subtle.mean:
adj. 微妙的，难以感知的： (so slight as to be)difficult to understand or perceive
adj. 巧妙的，间接或带有欺骗性的： clever at attaining one's ends by indirect and often deceptive means

hamstring.example: vt. 使无效，使无力: the downtown development committee claims that it's hamstrung by city ordinances 城镇发展委员会声称它受到了城市法令的阻碍
hamstring.mean: vt. 使无效，使无力： to make ineffective or powerless

fantasy.example:
n. 幻想: indulge in a fantasy 沉迷于幻想
vt. 产生幻想: He regularly fantasies romantic encounters that he knows will never happen. 他会定期意淫一些永远不可能发生的浪漫邂逅
fantasy.mean:
n. 幻想： imaginative fiction featuring especially strange settings and grotesque characters
vt. 产生幻想： to form a mental picture of

guzzle.example: v. 狂饮: guzzle beer 狂饮啤酒
guzzle.mean: v. 狂饮： to drink especially liquor greedily, continually, or habitually

deplete.example: vt. 耗尽，使衰竭: miners depleted the vein of copper ore after only a few months 矿工们在短短几个月内就把一整片铜矿开采完了
deplete.mean: vt. 耗尽，使衰竭： to decrease the fullness of; to make complete use of

sober.example:
adj. 严肃的: She made a sober reply to what was only a teasing comment. 她很严肃地回复了那个恶搞的评论。‖Illness is a sober reminder of our mortality. 疾病是死亡给我们发出的严肃警告。
adj. 节制的: decided to live a sober life after bankruptcy 破产以后决定过有节制的生活
adj. 有理有据的: a sober assessment of the situation 关于局势有理有据的分析
sober.mean:
adj. 严肃的： marked by seriousness, gravity, or solemnity of conduct or character
adj. 节制的： given to or marked by restraint in the satisfaction of one's appetites
adj. 有理有据的： based on sound reasoning or information

clarity.example:
n.清晰、清楚: Clarity of diction is vital for a XDF teacher. 发音清楚对新东方老师来说是至关重要的。
n.清晰、清楚: clarify his mind 理清思路；clarify a subject 澄清某一问题
n. 清澈透明: mountain streams with water of incredible clarity 难以置信般清澈透明的山涧
clarity.mean:
n.清晰、清楚：the quality or state of being clear: lucidity
n. 清澈透明：the state or quality of being easily seen through

adventitious.example: adj. 外来的，后天的: Moral considerations are adventitious to the study of art. 道德的考量对于艺术研究来说是不必要的。
adventitious.mean: adj. 外来的，后天的： coming from another source and not inherent or innate

pragmatic.example: adj. 实用主义的，务实的: Pragmatic men of power have had no time or inclination to deal withsocial morality.(K. B. Clark) 务实的当权者不会有时间或者意向去处理社会道德的问题。——K. B. 克拉克‖a pragmatic man, not given to grand, visionary schemes 一个不迷恋花哨空想的计划，而更注重实际的人
pragmatic.mean: adj. 实用主义的，务实的： a practical approach to problems and affairs

discompose.example:
vt. 使不安: GRE does not seem to discompose Jason; on the contrary, he looked rather relaxed. GRE没有使Jason感到慌乱，正相反，他看上去很轻松。
v. 使混乱: The wind ruffled her hair and discomposed her carefully arranged papers. 风凌乱了她的头发，吹乱了她细心整理的纸张。
discompose.mean:
vt. 使不安： to disturb the composure or calm of; perturb
v. 使混乱： to undo the proper order or arrangement of

toy.example: vi. 草率或不认真地对待: That microscope is a delicate instrument, not something to be toyed with. 那个显微镜是精密仪器，不是随随便便的一个玩具。
toy.mean: vi. 草率或不认真地对待： to handle thoughtlessly, ignorantly, or mischievously

debase.example: v. 贬低，贬损: our failure to win a single game completely debased 我们一场未胜的战绩彻底让我们的形象一落千丈
debase.mean: v. 贬低，贬损： to reduce to a lower standing in one's own eyes or in others' eyes

sarcasm.example: n. 讽刺，轻蔑: a voice full of sarcasm 充满轻蔑的言论
sarcasm.mean: n. 讽刺，轻蔑： a sharp and often satirical or ironic utterance designed to cut or give pain

euphoria.example: n. 感觉极其愉快: The initial euphoria following her victory in the election has now subsided. 选举成功带来的最初的欢愉感现在已经消失。
euphoria.mean: n. 感觉极其愉快： a state of overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion

palpitation.example: n. （有节奏的）舒张收缩: a palpitation of the blood vessels 血管有节奏的舒张收缩
palpitation.mean: n. （有节奏的）舒张收缩： a rhythmic expanding and contracting

compromise.example:
v. 妥协: Eventually we reached a compromise on the number of hours per week that would be devoted to piano practice. 最后我们在每周练琴的时间上妥协了。
v. 使危险: Officials were concerned that his statements would compromise national security. 官员们认为他的言论会危害国家安全。
compromise.mean:
v. 妥协：to adjust or settle by mutual concessions
v. 使危险：to place in danger

fumble.example:
vt. 笨拙地做: fumbled in his pocket for a coin 从口袋里笨拙地摸出一枚硬币
n. （无意识的）失误: played the entire piano piece without a single fumble 完美地演绎了整首钢琴曲
fumble.mean:
vt. 笨拙地做： to make awkward attempts to do or find something
n. （无意识的）失误： an unintentional departure from truth or accuracy

hypothetical.example:
n. 假设，前提条件: He believes that predictions of the extinction of certain species as the result of global warming are based upon too many hypotheticals. 他认为所谓全球变暖会导致某些物种灭绝的说法基于过多的假设。
adj. 假定的: We talked about what we would do in various hypothetical emergencies. 我们讨论了在假定的各种紧急情况下的对策。
hypothetical.mean:
n. 假设，前提条件： something taken as being true or factual and used as a starting point for a course of action or reasoning
adj. 假定的： existing only as an assumption or speculation

analgesic.example: n. 镇痛剂: Aspirin is a kind of analgesic. 阿司匹林是一种止痛剂。
analgesic.mean: n. 镇痛剂：a medication that reduces or eliminates pain

inferno.example:
n. 大火: A raging inferno posed a serious threat to the downwind villages. 肆虐的大火给下风向的村庄带来了严重的威胁
n. 地狱: the inferno of war 地狱般的战场
inferno.mean:
n. 大火： an intense fire
n. 地狱： a place or a state that resembles or suggests hell

filibuster.example: n./v. 拖延议事: The Senator used a filibuster to stop the bill. 参议员拖延了草案的实施
filibuster.mean: n./v. 拖延议事： the use of obstructionist tactics, especially prolonged speechmaking, for the purpose of delaying legislative action

efface.example: v t. 擦掉，抹去；使不明显: efface those unpleasant memories 抹去那些不快的记忆
efface.mean: v t. 擦掉，抹去；使不明显： to eliminate or make indistinct by or as if by wearing away a surface

compunction.example: n. 焦虑: compunction of conscience 良心不安 || a brutal murderer who killed without compunction 一个野蛮没有良心的杀人犯
compunction.mean: n. 焦虑：anxiety arising from awareness of guilt

reprobate.example:
