n. 堕落者，道德败坏的人: The program rehabilitates reprobates and turns them into hard-working, law-abiding citizens. 这个项目让那些堕落的人改过自新，并将他们变成勤劳守法的好公民。
adj. 堕落的，放荡的: He is a reprobate judge who could be bribed, and often with astonishing ease. 他是一个堕落的法官，极其容易就被贿赂了。
vt. 谴责，痛斥: He reprobated his son's unconventional lifestyle. 他怒斥他儿子不遵循传统的生活习惯。
vt. 拒绝，不提供: The government will most likely reprobate the request for parole. 政府很有可能会拒绝假释的要求。
reprobate.mean:
n. 堕落者，道德败坏的人：a morally unprincipled person
adj. 堕落的，放荡的： morally corrupt
vt. 谴责，痛斥： to condemn strongly as unworthy, unacceptable, or evil
vt. 拒绝，不提供： to be unwilling to grant

paltry.example:
adj. 无价值的；微不足道的: used a paltry, underhanded scheme to get him fired 用一个微小卑鄙的手段炒了他鱿鱼
adj. 让人厌恶，让人鄙视的: a paltry, underhanded scheme to get someone fired 一个卑鄙的炒掉某人的计谋
paltry.mean:
adj. 无价值的；微不足道的： lacking in importance or worth
adj. 让人厌恶，让人鄙视的： arousing or deserving of one's loathing and disgust

collapse.example:
vi. 突然倒塌或收缩: President Bush is vowing to rebuild bridge which collapsed last year. 布什总统发誓要重建这座去年坍塌的桥梁。|| One ant-hole may cause the collapse of a thousand-li dyke. 千里之堤，毁于蚁穴。
n. 完全耗尽体力: He suffered a mental collapse under the strain of studying for his bar exam. 他在紧张的律师考试的复习下脑力消耗殆尽。
v./n. 失败 to be unsuccessful/ a falling short of one's goals
: the legal case collapsed in the face of the opposition's evidence
collapse.mean:
vi. 突然倒塌或收缩：to fall or shrink together abruptly and completely
n. 完全耗尽体力：a complete depletion of energy or strength
v./n. 失败 to be unsuccessful/ a falling short of one's goals

enthrall.example: vt. （像用魔咒般）吸引: Enthralled by the flickering aurora in the sky, we lost all track of time. 我们被夜空里变化莫测的极光深深地吸引，以至于忘却了时间。
enthrall.mean: vt. （像用魔咒般）吸引： to hold the attention of as if by a spell

offhand.example: adj. 即兴的，没有准备的: couldn't give the figures offhand
offhand.mean: adj. 即兴的，没有准备的： without premeditation or preparation

convene.example:
vt. 召开，召集: convened the members of the council for an emergency session 召集委员会的成员进入紧急议程
vi. 聚集，集合: The students convened in the auditorium to hear the principal’saddress. 学生们在大礼堂集合，聆听校长的致辞。
convene.mean:
vt. 召开，召集： to bring together in assembly by or as if by command
vi. 聚集，集合： to come together in a body

esoteric.example:
adj. 深奥难懂的: esoteric terminology 少数人知道的专业术语
adj. 少数人知道的: The actor must have had some esoteric motive for leaving stage. 该演员淡出舞台肯定有不为人知的原因。
esoteric.mean:
adj. 深奥难懂的： difficult for one of ordinary knowledge or intelligence to understand
adj. 少数人知道的： not known or meant to be known by the general populace

nirvana.example:
n. 彻底放松的状态: The spa experience was a week of pure nirvana. 去泡温泉水疗的经历真是彻底的放松。
n. 天堂，极乐世界: They believe in a continuous cycle of births and deaths until the soul is perfected and achieves nirvana. 他们相信生命会不断轮回，直到灵魂变得完美并升入天堂。
nirvana.mean:
n. 彻底放松的状态： a state of being disregardful or unconscious of one's surroundings, concerns, or obligations
n. 天堂，极乐世界： an often imaginary place or state of utter perfection and happiness

emaciate.example:
vt. 使变瘦: become emaciated by long illness 因长年累月的病痛而消瘦
vt. 使虚弱: His hesitation emaciated the force of his argument. 他的迟疑削弱了他论证的力度
emaciate.mean:
vt. 使变瘦： to cause to lose flesh so as to become very thin
vt. 使虚弱： to make feeble

stoic.example: adj. 隐忍的，冷静的: stoic resignation in the face of hunger 默默忍受着饥饿
stoic.mean: adj. 隐忍的，冷静的： seemingly indifferent to or unaffected by pleasure or pain

requisite.example:
n. 必需品: Calculus is a requisite for modern physics. 微积分是学习近代物理的必要知识。
adj. 必不可少的，必备的: Oxygen is requisite for human to survive. 氧气是维持人类生命的必要条件。
requisite.mean:
n. 必需品： something necessary, indispensable, or unavoidable
adj. 必不可少的，必备的： essential, necessary

epicure.example: n. 美食家: Thomas Jefferson was one of America's first great epicures 托马斯?杰斐逊算得上是美国早期美食家一枚
epicure.mean: n. 美食家： one with sensitive and discriminating tastes especially in food or wine

rebuff.example: vt. 严词拒绝: rebuffed an invitation from her colleagues 回绝了同事们的邀请‖She rebuffed him when he asked her for a date. 她拒绝了他约会的邀请。
rebuff.mean: vt. 严词拒绝： to reject or criticize sharply

guile.example: n. 狡猾，狡诈: a person so full of guile he can't even be trusted to give you the correct time of day 他这个人狡诈成性，说的话都不足为信
guile.mean: n. 狡猾，狡诈： the inclination or practice of misleading others through lies or trickery

hike.example: vi. 上涨: hike rents 涨租金
hike.mean: vi. 上涨： to rise up, to move from a lower to a higher place or position

immaterial.example:
adj. 非实体的: It is only possible to study immaterial forces like gravity by observing their effects on the physical world. 要研究那些非实体的作用力——例如万有引力，只能观察它们对于现实世界的影响
adj. 无关的，不重要的: While undoubtedly upsetting, that story is immaterial to the question of why you are late. 尽管那个故事的确很让人遗憾，但是和你为什么迟到没有半点关系
immaterial.mean:
adj. 非实体的： not composed of matter
adj. 无关的，不重要的： of no importance or relevance

scrutinize.example: vt. 仔细检查: I closely scrutinized my opponent's every move. 我仔细注意着对手的每一个举动。
scrutinize.mean: vt. 仔细检查： to examine or observe with great care

medley.example: adj. 大杂烩，混合物: a medley of snack foods available on the buffet table 自助餐桌上供应着各式各样的小吃
medley.mean: adj. 大杂烩，混合物： an unorganized collection or mixture of various things

project.example:
n. 方案，计划: an ambitious project to develop the city’s underground transport 一项开发城市地下交通系统的雄心勃勃的计划
vi. 凸出: Some boulders projected dangerously out above the trail. 一些巨石非常危险地在道路上凸了出来。
vt. 预测，预计: projecting next year’s expenses 预测明年的开销
project.mean:
n. 方案，计划： a specific plan or design
vi. 凸出： to extend outward beyond a usual point
vt. 预测，预计： to calculate, estimate, or predict (something in the future), based on present data or trends

idle.example:
adj. 闲置的，未使用的: The car was idle for two weeks while they went on vacation. 因为他们出去旅行了，他们的车闲置了两周。
adj. 懒散的: an idle employee who always seems to be either on break or at lunch 这个懒散的员工似乎不是在休息就是在吃饭
vi. 懒散度日，无所事事: idle the afternoon away 打发下午的时光
idle.mean:
adj. 闲置的，未使用的： not turned to normal or appropriate use
adj. 懒散的： shiftless, lazy
vi. 懒散度日，无所事事： to pass (time) without working or while avoiding work

guilt.example: n. 自责，悔恨: he was wracked with guilt after he accidentally broke his sister's antique grandfather clock
guilt.mean: n. 自责，悔恨： a feeling of responsibility for wrongdoing

espouse.example: vt. 支持；拥护: the revolutionary cause 支持革命事业
espouse.mean:
vt. 支持；拥护： to take up and support as a cause
vt. 结婚： to take in marriage; marry

exorcise.example: vt. 除去: Please exorcise that offensive word from your vocabulary. 请把那个粗鲁的词从你的字典里删掉。
exorcise.mean: vt. 除去： to get rid of (something troublesome, menacing, or oppressive)

mirth.example: n. 欢乐，欢笑: a man of little mirth 不苟言笑之人
mirth.mean: n. 欢乐，欢笑： gladness or gaiety as shown by or accompanied with laughter

hallucination.example: n. 错觉: the common hallucination that gluttony during the holiday season doesn't have consequences
hallucination.mean: n. 错觉： a false idea or belief

seminal.example: adj. 创新的: a seminal novel 新颖的小说
seminal.mean:
adj. 有发展性的： containing or contributing the seeds of later development
adj. 创新的： of, relating to, or having the power to originate; creative

coltish.example: adj. 爱开玩笑的: Off camera the actor is high-spiritedly coltish, but turns serious once the camera starts rolling. 镜头下这个演员是很喜欢开玩笑，但是当镜头开启，他就马上变得严肃了起来。
coltish.mean:
adj. 不守纪律的：not subjected to discipline
adj. 爱开玩笑的：given to good-natured joking or teasing

acclaim.example:
n. 称赞: Many people were involved in the search, but the person who actually found the missing girl got all the acclaim. 许许多多的人都参与了搜救行动，但是只有真正找到那个迷失的小女孩的人才受到称赞。
vt. 赞扬，赞颂: He was acclaimed as the country's greatest modern painter. 他被盛赞为国内最优秀的现代画家。
acclaim.mean:
n. 称赞： public acknowledgment or admiration for an achievement
vt. 赞扬，赞颂： to declare enthusiastic approval of

sequela.mean: n. 结果： a secondary consequence or result

quench.example:
vt. 熄灭: We thoroughly quenched the campfire before we headed to bed. 我们在睡前把营火完全熄灭了。
v. 使满足: this lemonade really quenches my thirst 这杯柠檬汁真是解渴
quench.mean:
vt. 熄灭： to put out (a fire, for example); extinguish.
v. 使满足： to put a complete end to (a physical need or desire)

spectrum.example: n. 范围，系列: the whole spectrum of 20th-century thought 20世纪所有不同的思潮‖A political spectrum is a way of modeling different political positions by placing them upon one or more geometric axes symbolizing independent political dimensions. 所谓的政治光谱是一种将不同的政治立场可视化的模型，它通过一根或者多根几何坐标轴来定位不同的政治态度。
spectrum.mean: n. 范围，系列： a broad sequence or range of related qualities, ideas, or activities

spent.example: adj. 精疲力竭的: After all that exertion, we were completely spent. 在完成所有的锻炼之后我们已是筋疲力尽。
spent.mean: adj. 精疲力竭的： drained of energy or effectiveness

lull.example:
n. 相对平静时期，间隙: the lull before the storm 暴风雨前的平静
vt. 使镇静，使安心: The absence of attacks for such an extended period had lulled the nation into a false sense of security. 长期以来没有遭受攻击让这个国家产生了一种错误的安全感
lull.mean:
n. 相对平静时期，间隙： a momentary halt in an activity
vt. 使镇静，使安心： to free from distress or disturbance

churl.example:
n. 粗野的人; a rude, boorish person
: By the 19th century, ‘churl’ had a new and pejorative meaning, “one inclined to uncivil or loutish behavior”. 19世纪的时候，churl有了一个新的贬义含义的意思，“一个粗鲁没有教养的人”
n. 吝啬鬼: Don't bother asking a churl for donations. 别自找麻烦向一个吝啬鬼要捐款。
churl.mean:
n. 粗野的人; a rude, boorish person
n. 吝啬鬼：a mean grasping person who is usually stingy with money

berate.example: v. （长时间）严厉指责: He berated them in public. 他公开谴责他们
berate.mean: v. （长时间）严厉指责：to scold or condemn vehemently and at length

mint.example:
n. 巨额: worth a mint 价值连城
adj. 无损坏的: a second-handed laptop in mint condition 一台几乎全新的二手笔记本电脑
mint.mean:
n. 巨额： an abundant amount, especially of money
adj. 无损坏的： unmarred as if fresh from a mint

reprieve.example:
vt. 暂缓处刑，免罪: Fourteen people, waiting to be hanged for the murder of a former prime minister, have been reprieved 十四个因为谋杀前首相而等待绞刑的人获得了缓刑。
vt. 维持运行: The library has been reprieved and will remain open for at least another year. 图书馆的状况得到了缓解，还将继续开放一年。
reprieve.mean:
vt. 暂缓处刑，免罪： to postpone or cancel the punishment of
vt. 维持运行： to prevent (something) from being closed, destroyed, etc., for a period of time

sterile.example:
adj. 贫瘠的: a sterile land which used to be a forest 曾经是森林的一块贫瘠土地
adj. 无菌的: The hospitals in the war-torn city often lack necessary drugs and sterile surgical supplies. 在这个被战争所蹂躏的城市中的医院通常缺乏必需的药物和无菌的手术用品。
sterile.mean:
adj. 贫瘠的： not productive or effective
adj. 无菌的： free from live bacteria or other microorganisms

wholesome.example: adj. 有益身心健康的: trying to eat a more wholesome diet 尽可能有更健康的饮食习惯
wholesome.mean: adj. 有益身心健康的： promoting mental, moral, or social health

quarry.example: n. 目标，猎物: a hunter relentlessly tracking his quarry 无情捕杀猎物的猎人
quarry.mean:
n. 采石场： an open excavation or pit from which stone is obtained by digging, cutting, or blasting
n. 目标，猎物： an object of pursuit

alibi.example: n. 不在场的证明；托辞，借口: He always has a very creative alibi for undone homework. 他对于不完成作业总是有各种新奇的借口。
alibi.mean: n. 不在场的证明；托辞，借口： an excuse usually intended to avert blame or punishment (as for failure or negligence)

philistine.example: n. 市侩（注重物质而鄙视智慧或艺术的人）: The philistine's critics sometime limit artists’ imagine. 市侩之人的批评有时会限制艺术家的想象力
philistine.mean: n. 市侩（注重物质而鄙视智慧或艺术的人）： a person who is guided by materialism and is usually disdainful of intellectual or artistic values

uncouth.example: adj. 粗俗的，没有品位的: the movie's uncouth humor seemed to be purposely offensive 电影里一些恶俗的幽默貌似是故意的
uncouth.mean: adj. 粗俗的，没有品位的： lacking in refinement or good taste

gripe.example:
v. 抱怨: All workers were griping about the new regulations. 所有的工人都在抱怨新规章。
v. 通过连续让人讨厌的举动激怒，惹怒: constant complaints from the customers griped her to the point where she started snapping back 顾客持续的抱怨让她也到了爆点
gripe.mean:
v. 抱怨： to express dissatisfaction, pain, or resentment usually tiresomely
v. 通过连续让人讨厌的举动激怒，惹怒： to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts

divulge.example: vt. 泄漏（秘密）: refuse to divulge details of the negotiations 拒绝透露谈判的细节内容 || We tried to make him divulge the name of the winner, but he wouldn't budge. 我们试图让他透露胜利者的名字，但是他没有那样做。
divulge.mean: vt. 泄漏（秘密）：to make known (as a confidence or secret)

impotent.example:
adj. 无生育能力的: Most mules are impotent. 绝大多数的骡子都无法生育
adj. 无力的，无能的: an impotent ruler who was just a figurehead 一个无能的傀儡统治者
impotent.mean:
adj. 无生育能力的： unable to produce fruit or offspring
adj. 无力的，无能的： lacking in power, strength, or vigor

inanimate.example: adj. 无生命的: He thinks that inanimate objects have a life of their own. 他认为无生命的事物其实也是有生命的
inanimate.mean: adj. 无生命的： not having the qualities associated with active, living organisms

rider.mean:
n. 骑马的人： one that rides
n. 附件： a clause appended to a legislative bill to secure a usually distinct object

propitious.example: adj. 吉祥的: propitious sign 吉祥的征兆
propitious.mean: adj. 吉祥的： favorably disposed: pointing toward a happy outcome

conducive.example:
adj. 有益的，有促进的: be conducive to education 于教育有利的
adj. 有益的，有促进的: The state's long-standing low tax is conducive to entrepreneurship. 政府长期的低税率有利于创业者。
conducive.mean: adj. 有益的，有促进的：tending to promote or assist

salubrious.example: adj. 有益健康的: Every year I go to Kunming to enjoy its cool and salubrious climate. 每年我都会去昆明享受它那凉爽宜人的气候。
salubrious.mean: adj. 有益健康的： favorable to or promoting health or well-being

germane.example: adj. 有关的，适当的: details not germane to the discussion 与讨论无关的细节
germane.mean: adj. 有关的，适当的： being at once relevant and appropriate

visionary.example:
adj. 空想的，不切实际的: a visionary plan for a manned flight to Mars 一个构想中的载人火星计划
adj. 幻觉的: claimed to have had visionary experiences of hell 宣称有过到达地狱的幻觉
adj. 有远见的: a visionary and legendary leader 一个有远见的传奇性领袖
visionary.mean:
adj. 空想的，不切实际的： having or marked by a tendency to be guided more by ideals than by reality
adj. 幻觉的： not real and existing only in the imagination
adj. 有远见的： having or marked by foresight and imagination

prerogative.example: n. 特权，权力: It is your prerogative to refuse to attend religious services. 你有权力不参加宗教活动。
prerogative.mean: n. 特权，权力： an exclusive or special right, power, or privilege

debonair.example:
adj. 无忧无虑的，不在乎的: His debonair dismissal of my inquiry concerning his financial situation led me to believe that nothing was wrong. 对于我有关他个人理财的问题，他表现得毫不在乎，这使我相信没有问题。
adj. 风度翩翩的: The debonair gentleman charmed all of the ladies in the room. 风度翩翩的绅士吸引了在场的所有女士。
debonair.mean:
adj. 无忧无虑的，不在乎的： having or showing freedom from worries or troubles
adj. 风度翩翩的： having or showing very polished and worldly manners

encomium.example: n. 赞颂之词: received encomiums from literary critics 受到文学评论家的好评
encomium.mean: n. 赞颂之词：glowing and warmly enthusiastic praise

disjointed.example:
adj. 机能失调的: a disjointed society 混乱的社会
adj. 不连贯的: a disjointed speech about a hodgepodge of things 关于一大堆杂事的不连贯的演讲
disjointed.mean:
adj. 机能失调的： being thrown out of orderly function
adj. 不连贯的： not clearly or logically connected

addict.example:
v. 沉溺，上瘾: be addicted to drug/ alcohol 沉溺于毒品、酒
n. 对某事上瘾的人: science-fiction addicts who eagerly await each new installment in the series 科幻小说爱好者，等待着系列的每一次更新
addict.mean:
v. 沉溺，上瘾： to devote or surrender (oneself) to something habitually or obsessively
n. 对某事上瘾的人： a person with a strong and habitual liking for something

fluster.example: v. 使慌乱: A GPA of 1.0 flusters him. 1.0的绩点让他很慌乱
fluster.mean: v. 使慌乱： to put into a state of agitated confusion

pensive.example: adj. 沉思的，（尤指）哀思的: Rainy days often put her in a pensive mood. 雨天总是让她陷入深深的思考之中
pensive.mean: adj. 沉思的，（尤指）哀思的： given to or marked by long, quiet and often musingly sadthinking

exonerate.example: vt. 免除责备: An investigation exonerated the school from any blame. 一项调查使学校免受责备。
exonerate.mean: vt. 免除责备： to free from blame

mitigate.example: vt. 减轻痛苦，使缓和: powerful drugs that mitigate pains 强力的镇痛剂
mitigate.mean: vt. 减轻痛苦，使缓和： to make less severe or painful

paradigm.example: n. 典范，模范: He was the paradigm of the successful man. 他是成功人士的典范
paradigm.mean: n. 典范，模范： one that serves as a pattern or model

don.example: vt. 穿上: donned a raincoat for his trip 为出行穿上雨衣
don.mean: vt. 穿上：to put on (an article of clothing)

calculated.example: adj. 经过计算（成败得失）的，经过深思熟虑的: He took a calculated risk and got in on the ground floor of the new enterprise. 他深思熟虑一番之后决定冒这个险，踏出了迈向新计划的第一步。
calculated.mean: adj. 经过计算（成败得失）的，经过深思熟虑的： engaged in, undertaken, or displayed after reckoning or estimating the statistical probability of success or failure

impostor.example: n. 冒充者: The man who claimed to be a prince turned out to be an impostor. 那个自称是王子的人原来是冒充的
impostor.mean: n. 冒充者： one that assumes false identity or title for the purpose of deception

nettle.example: vt. 惹怒: His pompous attitude nettled several people. 他自大的性格得罪了不少人
nettle.mean: vt. 惹怒： to arouse to sharp but transitory annoyance or anger

digress.example: v. 脱离主题: digress from her prepared subject 脱离她准备好的主题 || He digressed so often that it was hard to follow what he was saying. 他经常跑题，以至于我们很难跟上他说的内容。
digress.mean: v. 脱离主题： to turn aside especially from the main subject of attention or course of argument

consummate.example:
adj. 专业的，有造诣的: a consummate liar 一个老练的骗子
adj. 无纰漏的，完美的: The difficult aria displayed her consummate skill. 高难度的咏叹调展示了她完美的技巧
consummate.mean:
adj. 专业的，有造诣的： extremely skilled and accomplished
adj. 无纰漏的，完美的： complete in every detail; perfect
adj. 最高档次的，最大规模的： of the greatest or highest degree or quantity

parenthesis.example: n. 间断: a parenthesis in an otherwise solid marriage 在本该是完满婚姻中的一个插曲
parenthesis.mean: n. 间断： an interruption of continuity; an interval

constrict.example: vt. 压缩，压紧: lives constricted by poverty 因为贫穷而拮据的生活‖Severe migraine can be treated with a drug which constricts the blood vessels. 某些能使血管收缩的药物可用来治疗严重的偏头痛。
constrict.mean: vt. 压缩，压紧： to make smaller or narrower by or as if by binding or squeezing

scotch.example: vt. 停止: The prime minister scotched the rumors of her illness. 首相出面澄清了关于她死亡的谣言。
scotch.mean: vt. 停止： to put an abrupt end to

fussy.example:
adj. 谨慎的: a fussy actuarial problem 需要谨慎处理的保险计算问题
adj.过分雕琢的: The room, with its rococo furniture and its overabundance of knickknacks, is just too fussy for my taste. 这房间里洛可可式的家具和过量的小饰品，让我觉得装修得有点过分以至于无法接受
adj. 挑剔的: It is widely known that cats are fussy eaters. 众所周知猫对食物很挑剔
fussy.mean:
adj. 谨慎的： taking, showing, or involving great care and effort
adj.过分雕琢的： elaborately and often excessively decorated
adj. 挑剔的： hard to please

sanctuary.example: n. 避难所: In earlier times a criminal could use a church as a sanctuary. 在早期，犯罪分子可以将教堂当作避难所。
sanctuary.mean: n. 避难所： a place of refuge and protection

bait.example:
v. 逗弄，激怒: bait him with gibes about his humble origin 取笑他的平凡出身以烦扰他
v.引诱: the investment scheme baits the greedy and the unscrupulous 这份投资计划吸引贪婪者和轻信者上钩
n. 诱饵: The squad leader has finally realized that his team was a bait. 队长终于意识到他的队伍是一个诱饵
bait.mean:
v. 逗弄，激怒： to persecute or exasperate with unjust, malicious, or persistent attacks
v.引诱： to lead away from a usual or proper course by offering some pleasure or advantage
n. 诱饵： something (as food) used in luring especially to a hook or trap

probe.example: v./n. 深入调查: probe into his background 深入调查他的背景
probe.mean: v./n. 深入调查： a penetrating or critical investigation

sage.example: n. 智者: The young prince made a pilgrimage to the sage, hoping to learn the meaning of life. 年轻的王子走上了向智者取经的道路，希望能领悟到生命的真谛。
sage.mean: n. 智者： one (as a profound philosopher) distinguished for wisdom

precarious.example:
adj. 危险不稳定的: a precarious livelihood 不稳定的生计
adj. 可疑的，不明确的: His entire argument relies on a precarious assumption. 他的整篇论证都建立在一个可疑的假设之上。
precarious.mean:
adj. 危险不稳定的： dangerously lacking in security or stability
adj. 可疑的，不明确的： dependent on uncertain premises

lurch.example: v. 蹒跚: The ship lurched in the storm. 船在风暴中摇摆前行
lurch.mean: v. 蹒跚： to move forward while swaying from side to side

dupe.example:
n. 复制品，复刻: He built a dupe of the original model, which is locked in a vault. 他做了个保险柜里模型的复刻品
n. 易受骗的人: The swindler was able to escape with all of the dupe's money. 骗子成功带着受骗人的财产逃跑了
vt. 欺骗: The public is easily duped by extravagant claims in advertising. 大众极易被广告中夸大的介绍误导
dupe.mean:
n. 复制品，复刻： something that is made to look exactly like something else
n. 易受骗的人： one that is easily deceived or cheated
vt. 欺骗： to deceive (an unwary person)

runic.example: adj. 神秘的: painstaking efforts to decipher the runic inscriptions 为破解神秘的碑文付出的辛勤劳动
runic.mean: adj. 神秘的： having some secret or mysterious meaning

abstain.example: v. 自我克制，主动戒绝: abstain from smoking/voting 戒烟，弃权
abstain.mean: v. 自我克制，主动戒绝： to refrain from something by one's own choice

gauge.example:
n. 测量标准: polls as a gauge of voter satisfaction 用以衡量选民满意度的选票结果
vt. 判定: It is hard to gauge his mood. 要判断他的情绪很困难
gauge.mean:
n. 测量标准： a measurement (as of linear dimension) according to some standard or system
vt. 判定： to determine the capacity or contents of

striate.example: vt. 加条纹: The inner surface of the bark is smooth, of a pale, yellowish brown and very finely striated. 树皮的内部十分光滑，显着偏暗偏黄的棕色，并且有着十分精细的条纹。
striate.mean: vt. 加条纹： to mark with striations or striae

venal.example: adj. 容易贪污受贿的: a judge who is known for being venal and easily bought 一名因为贪污和容易收买而闻名的法官
venal.mean: adj. 容易贪污受贿的： open to corrupt influence and especially bribery

lethal.example: adj. 非常有害的，致命的: This dagger is lethal. 这把匕首是致命的武器‖launched a lethal attack 发动了致命的进攻
lethal.mean: adj. 非常有害的，致命的： extremely harmful; devastating

mingle.example:
vi. 参加社交活动: mingling at a cocktail party 在鸡尾酒会上与他人交往
vt. 混合，结合: mingle the ingredients 将调料混合‖mingle fact and fiction 糅杂了现实与幻想
mingle.mean:
vi. 参加社交活动： to take part in social activities
vt. 混合，结合： to mix so that the components become united

abreast.example:
adv. 并排地: a group of youths riding four abreast 四个一排骑着车的孩子们
adj. 熟知的: She tried to keep abreast of the latest fashion trends. 她总是尽可能地跟上时尚的潮流。
abreast.mean:
adv. 并排地： beside one another with bodies in line
adj. 熟知的： up to a particular standard or level especially of knowledge of recent developments

capitulate.example: v. 投降，默许: one side finally capitulated when it became clear that they couldn’t win the argument 意识到他们不能拿下这场辩论后，该方投降了
capitulate.mean: v. 投降，默许： to give up all resistance; acquiesce; yield

vindictive.example: adj. 复仇的（有寻仇倾向的）: vindictive hatred for his brother 对他兄弟的仇恨
vindictive.mean: adj. 复仇的（有寻仇倾向的）： disposed to seek revenge

latent.example: adj. 潜在的，不活跃的: a latent infection 潜伏性传染病‖He has a latent talent for acting that he hasn't had a chance to express yet. 他有着表演的天赋，只不过他还没有机会来表现这一才能
latent.mean: adj. 潜在的，不活跃的： present or potential but not evident or active

hoary.example: adj. 极老的: hoary legends 上古的传说故事

abjure.example:
v. 发誓放弃: abjure one’s belief 发誓放弃信仰
v. 抵制，避免: abjure extravagance 抵制铺张浪费
abjure.mean:
v. 发誓放弃： a firm and final rejecting or abandoning often made under oath
v. 抵制，避免： to resist the temptation of

turncoat.example: n. 叛徒: He was labeled as a turncoat. 他是一个叛徒。
turncoat.mean: n. 叛徒： one who switches to an opposing side or party; specifically: traitor

discretionary.example: adj. 自主决定的: In many restaurants, discretionary tipping is being replaced by a standard service charge. 在很多饭店，标准的服务价格取代了随意支付的小费。
discretionary.mean: adj. 自主决定的： left to discretion : exercised at one's own discretion

bliss.example:
n. 极度快乐: Ignorance is bliss ——The Matrix. 无知者，幸也（电影《黑客帝国》）
n. 极乐世界: the road to eternal bliss 通往永恒乐土的道路
bliss.mean:
n. 极度快乐： extreme happiness; ecstasy
n. 极乐世界： a dwelling place of perfect happiness for the soul after death

hoard.example: v. 贮藏，秘藏: he's been hoarding empty yogurt containers all winter 他整个冬天都在攒空酸奶瓶
hoard.mean: v. 贮藏，秘藏： to keep hidden or private

predecessor.example: n. 前任，先辈: a political legacy left by his predecessor 他的前任留下来的政治遗产
predecessor.mean: n. 前任，先辈： a person who has previously occupied a position or office to which another has succeeded

agape.example: adj. 急切盼望的: At the sound of the sleigh bells the children were all agape, waiting for Santa to appear. 听到雪橇铃，孩子们开始好奇地等待圣诞老人的到来。
agape.mean: adj. 急切盼望的： having or showing signs of eagerly awaiting something

ardor.example: n. 狂热: His ardor was damped. 他的热情被泼了冷水。
ardor.mean: n. 狂热：strong enthusiasm or devotion; zeal

endorse.example: vt. 公开支持，推崇: endorse a presidential candidate 公开支持一名总统候选人
endorse.mean: vt. 公开支持，推崇： to express support or approval of publicly and definitely

denounce.example:
v. 公开指责: the governor has denounced the court's decision and vows to press for a constitutional amendment 州长公开指责法庭决定不公，准备投票进行修宪
v. 道德上错误、可耻的: the church council denounced the bishop's teachings, officially declaring them to be heresy 该教理事会指责主教的布道可耻，声称它们是异端学说
denounce.mean:
v. 公开指责： to express public or formal disapproval of
v. 道德上错误、可耻的： to declare to be morally wrong or evil

baffle.example:
vt. 挫败，阻挠: baffled by the language barrier 受到语言障碍的阻挠
vt. 使疑惑: I was baffled by many of the scientific terms used in the article. 这篇文章中各种学术词汇让我很困惑。
baffle.mean:
vt. 挫败，阻挠： to frustrate or check (a person) as by confusing or perplexing
vt. 使疑惑： to throw into a state of mental uncertainty

congruent.example:
adj. 和谐一致的: a theory congruent with the known facts 一个与已知事实相一致的理论
adj. 全等的: These two triangles are congruent. 这两个三角形是全等的
congruent.mean:
adj. 和谐一致的： being in agreement, harmony, or correspondence; congruous
adj. 全等的：coinciding exactly when superimposed

bootless.example: adj. 无用的: The meeting turns out to be a bootless attempt. 这个会议被证明是一次徒劳的尝试
bootless.mean: adj. 无用的： useless, unprofitable, futile

smug.example:
adj. 自大的，自鸣得意的: The winner was so smug that he lost the support of the crowd. 胜利者过于自大，以至于失去了群众的支持。
adj. 整洁的，有序的: The suburb's smug lawns and tree-lined streets bespeak a comfortable affluence. 郊区整齐有序的草坪和种满树木的街道，代表着其间的舒适和财富。
smug.mean:
adj. 自大的，自鸣得意的： having too high an opinion of oneself
adj. 整洁的，有序的： being clean and in good order

headlong.example: adj. 鲁莽的: terrified forest creatures in a headlong retreat from the rapidly spreading fire 受惊的动物们惊慌失措地从不断蔓延的森林大火中逃离出来

relish.example:
n. 喜好，偏好: She has great relish for early morning walks, which she takes nearly every day. 她对早晨散步有格外的喜好——几乎每天早上她都会如此。
n. （愿望达成时的）高兴，满足感: He ate the bowl of ice cream with relish. 他高兴地吃着冰淇淋。
vt. 享受，喜欢: He is so hungry that he will relish even plain food. 他是如此的饥饿，以至于普通的食物也能让他满意。
relish.mean:
n. 喜好，偏好： an appetite for something; a strong appreciation or liking
n. （愿望达成时的）高兴，满足感： the feeling experienced when one's wishes are met
vt. 享受，喜欢： to take keen or zestful pleasure in

comply.example: vi. 遵从: the devices comply with industry standards 设备要遵循工业标准 || There will be penalties against individuals who fail to comply. 谁不遵从谁就会受到惩罚。
comply.mean: vi. 遵从：to conform, submit, or adapt (as to a regulation or to another's wishes) as required or requested

slack.example:
adj. 松弛的: The rope is too slack. 绳子太松了。
adj. 疏忽的，大意的: This building contractor is known mainly for his firm's slack workmanship and slipshod construction. 这个建筑承包商因其手下公司不负责任的粗糙做工和马虎建造的建筑物而闻名。
slack.mean:
adj. 松弛的： not tightly fastened, tied, or stretched
adj. 疏忽的，大意的： failing to give proper care and attention

overbearing.example:
adj. 专横傲慢的: Her husband's overbearing manner made her miserable. 她的丈夫专横傲慢，让她痛不欲生。
adj. 压倒一切的，在力量或重要性上势不可挡的；支配的，显著的: the overbearing problem in our nation's schools 我国中小学教育的最突出的问题
overbearing.mean:
adj. 专横傲慢的： domineering in manner; arrogant
adj. 压倒一切的，在力量或重要性上势不可挡的；支配的，显著的： overwhelming in power or significance; predominant, coming before all others in importance

stipulate.example: vt. 规定，特定要求: Total disarmament was stipulated in the peace treaty. 和平协约中要求彻底解除武装。
stipulate.mean: vt. 规定，特定要求： to specify or arrange in an agreement

repugnant.example:
adj. 令人厌恶的: The idea of moving again became repugnant to her. 又要搬家的想法让她感到厌恶。
adj. 不和谐的，不协调的: Technically speaking, it may not be a violation, but it is certainly repugnant to the spirit of the law. 技术上来说这还算不上违法，但是这肯定违背了法律的精神。
repugnant.mean:
adj. 令人厌恶的： arousing disgust or aversion
adj. 不和谐的，不协调的： not being in agreement or harmony

labile.example: adj. 易变的，不稳定的: labile mineral 不稳定的矿物质‖an emotionally labile person 一个多愁善感的人
labile.mean: adj. 易变的，不稳定的： continually undergoing chemical, physical, or biological change; unstable

release.example:
vt. 排放: We bought an air freshener that releases a pleasing scent into the room. 我们买了一个能向房间里释放怡人香味的空气净化机。
vt. 释放，使获得自由: The government was asked to release the prisoners immediately. 政府被要求立即释放囚犯。
vt. 解雇: They released the workers who couldn't handle the new technology. 他们解雇了所有不能掌握新技术的工人。
release.mean:
vt. 排放： to throw or give off
vt. 释放，使获得自由： to set free from restraint, confinement, or servitude
vt. 解雇： to let go from office, service, or employment

unwitting.example:
adj. 不知道的，未觉察的: Please forgive my unwitting interruption of your conversation. 请原谅我无意间打断了你们的谈话。
adj. 偶然的，并非有意的: an unwitting mistake made in copying the material 在打印过程中一个无心的过失
unwitting.mean:
adj. 不知道的，未觉察的： not knowing, unaware
adj. 偶然的，并非有意的： happening by chance; not intended

hasten.example: vt. 促进: The man’s death was hastened by alcohol abuse. 酗酒加速了老人的死亡。
hasten.mean: vt. 促进： to speed up; accelerate

automatic.example:
adj. （机器等）自动的: Will your next car be a manual or an automatic? 你下辆车是手动挡还是自动挡？‖Modern subwaysare equipped with automatic screen doors. 现代地铁都装备了自动屏蔽门。
adj. 自发的，情不自禁的: Carl’s automatic use of the brakes narrowly averted a collision. 卡尔不经意间所踩的刹车勉强避免了一场车祸。
automatic.mean:
adj. （机器等）自动的： acting or operating in a manner essentially independent of external influence or control
adj. 自发的，情不自禁的： acting or done spontaneously or unconsciously

attest.example: vt. 证实，为…作证: Her fine work attests her ability. 她的优秀作品能够证明她的能力。‖I can attest that she was at the party. 我可以为她当时在聚会上作证。
attest.mean: vt. 证实，为…作证： to give evidence or testimony to the truth or factualness of

traverse.example: vt. 横穿: The spider traversed the wall from end to end. 蜘蛛侠攀岩走壁。
traverse.mean: vt. 横穿： to travel or pass across, over, or through

erroneous.example: adj. 错误的，不正确的: The news article about the new drug was filled with much erroneous information. 有关新药的新闻报道里充斥着大量的错误信息。
erroneous.mean: adj. 错误的，不正确的： containing or characterized by error

mandatory.example: adj. 强制的: GRE test is mandatory for all students, regardless of their nationality, who wish to apply for graduate schools in the United States. GRE是每个申请美国研究生院的学生（无论国籍）所必须参加的考试
mandatory.mean: adj. 强制的： forcing one's compliance or participation

wrest.example:
vt. 拧，扭动: wrest the lid off this pickle jar 把泡菜罐的盖子拧下来
vt. 辛苦地获得: farmers who were used to wresting a living from the barren land 一度依靠贫瘠的土地恶劣度日的农民
wrest.mean:
vt. 拧，扭动： to pull, force, or move by violent wringing or twisting movements
vt. 辛苦地获得： to gain with difficulty by or as if by force, violence, or determined labor

peripheral.example:
dj. 外围的: development in the peripheral areas of megacities 大城市边缘地区的发展
dj. 辅助性的: The IT consultant suggested that we update the drivers for all of the computer's peripheral devices. IT咨询师建议我们更新电脑所有外围辅助设备的驱动程序
peripheral.mean:
dj. 外围的： related to, located in, or constituting an outer boundary or periphery
dj. 辅助性的： available to supply something extra when needed

rivulet.example: n. 小河，小溪: Dream Rivulet Diary 《梦溪笔谈》
rivulet.mean: n. 小河，小溪： a small stream

prosaic.example: adj. 单调的，常见的: prosaic advice 老掉牙的建议
prosaic.mean: adj. 单调的，常见的： being of the type that is encountered in the normal course of events

peroration.example:
n. （演讲的）结束语: He summarized his main points in his peroration. 他在结束语中总结了自己的主要观点
n.（正式的）演讲，致辞: a peroration celebrating the nation's long tradition of religious tolerance and pluralism 为庆祝该国长期以来对于宗教的容忍态度和宗教多元化所做的一个演讲
peroration.mean:
n. （演讲的）结束语： the concluding part of a discourse and especially an oration
n.（正式的）演讲，致辞： a usually formal discourse delivered to an audience

allure.example:
vt. 吸引: an alluring smile 迷人的微笑
v. 诱惑做某事: allured by the promise of big bucks, he decided to have a go at a job on the trading floor of the stock market 被赚大钱的许诺所引诱，他决定投身股票市场工作
allure.mean:
vt. 吸引： to attract or delight as if by magic
v. 诱惑做某事： to lead away from a usual or proper course by offering some pleasure or advantage

evanescent.example: adj. 逐渐消失的，短暂的: Beauty is as evanescent as a rainbow. 容颜易老，年华易逝。
evanescent.mean: adj. 逐渐消失的，短暂的： tending to vanish like vapor

nocturnal.example:
adj. 夜间的: a nocturnal raid 夜间突袭
adj. 夜间活动的: a nocturnal predator 夜间活动的捕食者
nocturnal.mean:
adj. 夜间的： of, relating to, or occurring in the night
adj. 夜间活动的： active at night

hammer.example: v. 屡次重申: the lectures all hammered away at the same points 整场讲座都是在阐述相同论点 || hammered the information into the students' heads把这条信息反复向学生们强调
hammer.mean: v. 屡次重申： to make repeated efforts especially :to reiterate an opinion or attitude.

gladiator.example: n. 角斗士: He comes to Rome as a gladiator to seek revenge. 他化成角斗士来到罗马寻求复仇
gladiator.mean:
n. 角斗士： a person engaged in a fight to the death as public entertainment for ancient Romans
n. 参与打斗或辩论的人： a person engaging in a public fight or controversy

subject.example:
n. 臣民，受支配的人: Because of the tense situation in that country, British subjects were advised to return home as soon as possible. 因为该国紧张的局势，英国公民被建议尽快返回英国国内。
adj. 取决于其他因素的: The price of seafood is subject to weather conditions. 海鲜的价格受天气影响。
subject.mean:
n. 臣民，受支配的人： one that is placed under authority or control
adj. 取决于其他因素的： contingent on or under the influence of some later action

accede.example:
v. 赞成: acceded to their pleas 同意了他们的请愿
v. 就任，就职: accede to the throne 就任国王
accede.mean:
v. 赞成： to express approval or give consent
v. 就任，就职：To arrive at or come into an office or dignity:

exponent.example:
n. 倡导者，支持者: Exponents of space exploration earnestly called for more missions to the outer reaches of the solar system. 太空探险的支持者强烈要求对太阳系的外边缘进行探索。
n. 实践者: has long reigned as the nation's leading exponent of modern dance 被认为是该国现代舞的集大成者
exponent.mean:
n. 倡导者，支持者： one that speaks for, represents, or advocates
n. 实践者： one who brings an art or science to full realization

deadpan.example: n. 不动情的言行举止，无动于衷: a deadpan comedy 一个没有笑点的喜剧
deadpan.mean: n. 不动情的言行举止，无动于衷： impassively matter-of-fact, as in style, behavior, or expression

scrap.example:
n. 废料，废物: The rest of this stuff is just scrap, so sweep it up and throw it away. 剩下的这堆东西都是没用的，把它们打扫一下就扔了吧。
vt. 抛弃: We've decided to scrap the first car. 我们决定丢弃第一辆车。
v. 终止，放弃原计划: We scrapped our plans to go to Paris, and set out the next day for Prague. 我们取消了去巴黎的计划，第二天启程奔赴布拉格。
scrap.mean:
n. 废料，废物： discarded or useless material
vt. 抛弃： to get rid of as useless or unwanted
v. 终止，放弃原计划： to put an end to (something planned or previously agreed to)

calamity.example: n. 大灾难: This latest breakdown of the car is inconvenient, but not a calamity. 最近的汽车抛锚确实带来了不便，但还不是一场灾难。‖an economic calamity 金融风暴
calamity.mean: n. 大灾难： a disastrous event marked by great loss and lasting distress and suffering

hallow.mean: vt. 尊敬，把……视为神圣： to respect or honor greatly; revere

tantamount.example: adj. 等价的，与…相等的: a relationship tantamount to marriage 到了谈婚论嫁地步的关系
tantamount.mean: adj. 等价的，与…相等的： equivalent in value, significance, or effect

startle.example: vt. 使吓一跳，使大吃一惊: They were startled at the prohibitive price. 他们被高得离谱的价格吓到了
startle.mean: vt. 使吓一跳，使大吃一惊： to frighten or surprise suddenly and usually not seriously

bracing.example: adj. 令人振奋的，给人带来活力的: a bracing news from the frontline来自前线的振奋人心的消息
bracing.mean: adj. 令人振奋的，给人带来活力的： giving strength, vigor, or freshness

arcane.example:
adj. （语言）晦涩的，隐晦的: The rebate form uses arcane language, the only purpose of which seems to be to disqualify buyers from actually getting a rebate. 折扣单上的条文晦涩难懂，这样做的唯一目的也许就是让消费者不能真正地享受到折扣。
adj. 深奥的，难以理解的: Grammatical rules seem extremely arcane to generations of students who were never taught grammar in the first place. 对那些从未学习过语法的几代学生来说，语法规则犹如天书。
arcane.mean:
adj. （语言）晦涩的，隐晦的： having an often intentionally veiled or uncertain meaning
adj. 深奥的，难以理解的： difficult for one of ordinary knowledge or intelligence to understand

vertigo.example: n. 眩晕: He had a dreadful attack of vertigo at the top of the tower. 他站在塔顶，感到一阵令人窒息的眩晕。
vertigo.mean: n. 眩晕： a dizzy confused state of mind

disprove.example: vt. 证伪，证明为假: Magellan’s circumnavigation of the globe disproved any lingering notions that the earth is flat. 麦哲伦的环球旅行彻底否认了任何残存的“地球是平的”的观念。
disprove.mean: vt. 证伪，证明为假： to prove to be false or wrong

scorn.example: vt. 轻蔑，鄙视，不屑: They were scorned as fanatics. 他们被指责为狂热分子。
scorn.mean: vt. 轻蔑，鄙视，不屑： reject or dismiss as contemptible or unworthy

drawl.example: v. 慢吞吞地说: The old woman was drawling on and on. 老太太慢吞吞地说个没完
drawl.mean: v. 慢吞吞地说： to speak slowly with vowels greatly prolonged

pirate.example:
vt. 盗版，盗用: a pirated version of the software 盗版软件
n. 海盗: little boys dreaming of sailing as pirates 梦想成为海盗的小男孩
pirate.mean:
vt. 盗版，盗用： to take or make use of under a guise of authority but without actual right
n. 海盗： a robber on the high seas

lethargic.example: adj. 没精打采的，行动迟缓的: a big nice meal always makes me feel lethargic and sleepy 一顿大餐吃完总是让我既慵懒又想睡
lethargic.mean: adj. 没精打采的，行动迟缓的： of, relating to, or characterized by lethargy, sluggish

accord.example:
n. 一致: This map doesn't seem to be in accord with the current layout of the streets. 这幅地图似乎与当前的街道情况不尽一致。
vi. 相符合，相一致: a theory that accords with the known facts 与已知事实相一致的理论‖He claims that the newspaper’s quote does not accord with what he actually said. 他声称报纸引用的他的话与原文并不相符。
vt. 授予，给予: Women were finally accorded the right to vote in 1920. 女性最终在1920年获得了投票权。
accord.mean:
n. 一致： a state of consistency
vi. 相符合，相一致： to be consistent or in harmony
vt. 授予，给予： to grant or give especially as appropriate, due, or earned

felony.example: n. 重罪: a felony punishable by life imprisonment 可被判处无期徒刑的重罪
felony.mean: n. 重罪： one of several grave crimes, such as murder, rape, or burglary, punishable by a more stringent sentence than that given for a misdemeanor

contort.example: vt. 扭曲: a contorted version of the truth 被歪曲的真相
contort.mean: vt. 扭曲： to twist, wrench, or bend severely out of shape

devout.example:
adj. （对于宗教）虔诚的: a devout Buddhist 虔诚的佛教徒
adj. 忠诚的: Devout Mavericks fans never lost faith in Nowitzki. 忠诚的小牛队球迷从来没有对诺维斯基失去信心。
devout.mean:
adj. （对于宗教）虔诚的： devoted to religion or to religious duties or exercises
adj. 忠诚的： firm in one's allegiance to someone or something

conflagration.example:
n. 大火: All the stock was destroyed in a warehouse conflagration. 仓库里所有的货物都被一场大火烧毁了。
n. 武装冲突，战争: What began as a skirmish over disputed territory erupted into a conflagration that swept the continent. 这场席卷整个大陆的战争是由之前关于有纠纷的领土的小冲突引发的。
conflagration.mean:
n. 大火： a large destructive fire
n. 武装冲突，战争： a state of armed violent struggle between states, nations, or groups

motto.example: n. 座右铭: “Semper fidelis” is the motto of US Marine Corps. “永远忠诚”是美国海军陆战队的格言
motto.mean: n. 座右铭： a short expression of a guiding principle

excavate.example: v. 挖掘，挖空: excavate soil from one area 从某处挖土出来
excavate.mean: v. 挖掘，挖空： to dig out and remove

cow.example: v. 恐吓，威胁: cow sb. into doing sth. 威吓某人做某事
cow.mean: v. 恐吓，威胁： to frighten with threats or a show of force

disdain.example: v. 轻视，鄙视: disdain that man for snobbishness 鄙视那个势利小人
disdain.mean: v. 轻视，鄙视： to look on with scorn

coy.example:
adj. 故作羞涩的: Not wanting him to know that she was interested in him, she acted very coy at the dance. 她在舞会上故意装得很娇羞的样子，不想让他知道她喜欢他。
adj. 不愿与人交往的，内向的: She was modest without being coy. 她很低调，但又不至于内向。
coy.mean:
adj. 故作羞涩的： affectedly and usually flirtatiously shy or modest
adj. 不愿与人交往的，内向的： tending to avoid people and social situations

fallacious.example:
adj. 谬误的，不合逻辑的: the once-common fallacious claim that girls just weren't any good at math 曾经广为流传的一个谬论：女孩子无论如何就是学不好数学
adj. 欺骗性的: fallacious testimony 不真实的证词
fallacious.mean:
adj. 谬误的，不合逻辑的： containing or based on a fallacy
adj. 欺骗性的： tending to deceive or mislead

estimable.example: adj. 值得尊敬的: an estimable adversary 一位值得尊敬的对手
estimable.mean: adj. 值得尊敬的： deserving of esteem; admirable

askew.example:
adj. 不成直线，歪的: The picture hung askew. 画挂歪了。
adj. 不成直线，歪的: His tie was askew. 他的领带歪了。
askew.mean: adj. 不成直线，歪的：out of line, awry

disengage.example: vt. 分开: Disengage the gears when you park the car. 当你停车的时候要把（传动）齿轮分开。|| seek to disengage myself from the embarrassing situation 试图把我自己从尴尬的气氛中解救出来
disengage.mean: vt. 分开： to set free from entanglement or difficulty

didactic.example: adj. 喜欢说教的: Parents’ speech to their kids often seems to be painfully didactic. 父母对他们孩子的话都是让人痛苦的说教。
didactic.mean: adj. 喜欢说教的： designed or intended to teach

insouciant.example: adj. 无忧虑的，不在乎的: an insouciant shrug 无所谓地耸耸肩
insouciant.mean: adj. 无忧虑的，不在乎的： free from concern, worry, or anxiety

pertinacious.example: adj. 顽固的，固执地坚持的: The pertinacious boy won’t stop crying unless his desire is satisfied. 这个固执的男孩在愿望没有满足的情况下是不会停止哭泣的
pertinacious.mean: adj. 顽固的，固执地坚持的： sticking to an opinion, purpose, or course of action in spite of reason, arguments, or persuasion

discommode.example: v. 打扰，使不便: The breakdown of her car didn't discommode her seriously. 车的故障没有给他带来很大麻烦。
discommode.mean: v. 打扰，使不便： to cause inconvenience to: trouble

variance.example: n. 不一致，不和谐: Persistent variance within the band eventually caused it to break up. 乐团中持续不断的分歧最终导致了它的解散。
variance.mean: n. 不一致，不和谐： a lack of agreement or harmony

monopolize.example: vt. 垄断，主宰: They are virtually monopolizing the market. 他们实际上已经垄断了整个市场。‖To their surprise is was the vice president who monopolized the conversation. 令他们惊讶的是，主导整个谈话的居然是副总裁。
monopolize.mean: vt. 垄断，主宰： to have complete control over

tinge.example: vt. 给…着上少量的色彩: just slightly tinge the frosting with yellow food coloring to give it a lemony look 略微在霜糖表面加一点黄色色素，有一点柠檬的感觉就可以了
tinge.mean: vt. 给…着上少量的色彩： to color with a slight shade or stain; tint

stipple.example: vt. 点刻，用点标记: They crossed a field stippled with purple lavender. 他们穿越了一片有紫色薰衣草点缀的田野。
stipple.mean: vt. 点刻，用点标记： to mark with small spots especially unevenly

exemplary.example:
adj. 榜样的，值得效仿的: as a hospital volunteer he has given exemplary service to his community 他作为医疗志愿者为社区起到了模范的作用
adj. 作为警告的: armies have traditionally used public execution as an exemplary punishment for the crime of desertion 军队通常将公开处决作为玩忽职守罪的惩罚，以儆效尤
exemplary.mean:
adj. 榜样的，值得效仿的： constituting, serving as, or worthy of being a pattern to be imitated
adj. 作为警告的： serving as or offering a warning

abbreviate.example: v. 缩写，缩短: abbreviate the word “building” as “bldg.” 将“building”缩写作“bldg”
abbreviate.mean: v. 缩写，缩短： to make briefer

condescending.example: adj. 摆出高人一等的姿态的: treat sb. in a condescending manner 以屈尊俯就的态度对待某人
condescending.mean: adj. 摆出高人一等的姿态的：displaying a patronizingly superior attitude

inquisitive.example: adj. 过分好奇的: big sunglasses to frustrate inquisitive journalists 让狗仔队企图无法得逞的大墨镜
inquisitive.mean: adj. 过分好奇的： inordinately or improperly curious about the affairs of others

maudlin.example: adj. 过于感伤的: Some naive students display an almost maudlin concern for the welfare of animals while ignoring basic social inequity. 一些幼稚的学生忽视根本的社会不公平问题，而对动物的权益表现出一种多愁善感的忧虑
maudlin.mean: adj. 过于感伤的： effusively or tearfully sentimental

infirm.example:
adj. 虚弱的: her aging, infirm husband 她上了年纪、身体虚弱的丈夫
adj. 不果断的，优柔寡断的: She has little patience with the “infirm of purpose”. 她对那些优柔寡断的人没什么耐心
infirm.mean:
adj. 虚弱的： weak in body, especially from old age or disease
adj. 不果断的，优柔寡断的： lacking firmness of will, character, or purpose

oblivious.example: adj. 不知道的，不知情的: He seemed oblivious to the fact that he had hurt her. 他似乎并不在意他伤害了她.
oblivious.mean: adj. 不知道的，不知情的： lacking conscious awareness; not informed about or aware of something

trumpet.example: v. 大声说出或宣告: The losing party lost no time in trumpeting allegations of election fraud. 落败的政党马不停蹄地开始公开宣称选举存在作假。
trumpet.mean: v. 大声说出或宣告： to make known openly or publicly

truss.example: v. 系紧，扎紧: After stuffing the turkey, the chef quickly trussed it so the forcemeat wouldn't fall out during roasting. 把填料塞进火鸡后，大厨迅速把它扎紧防止在烘烤过程中肉馅掉出来。
truss.mean: v. 系紧，扎紧： to gather into a tight mass by means of a line or cord

rend.example: vt. 撕裂，猛拉: Wolves rend a game to pieces. 狼群会把猎物撕成碎片。‖pain that rends the heart 撕心般的痛
rend.mean: vt. 撕裂，猛拉： to tear or split apart or into pieces violently

brassy.example: adj. 厚脸皮的，不知羞耻的: brassy reporters 厚颜无耻的记者
brassy.mean:
adj. 厚脸皮的，不知羞耻的： displaying or marked by rude boldness
adj. 华而不实地炫耀的： cheap and showy; flashy

petty.example: adj. 细微的，不重要的: play petty tricks 耍小聪明
petty.mean: adj. 细微的，不重要的： of small importance; trivial

regenerate.example:
vt. 使重获新生，使焕然一新: The lizard is able to regenerate its tail. 蜥蜴能够重新长出断尾。‖The whole community was regenerated thanks to a government grant for repairing all the old buildings. 多亏了政府用于维修老楼的专项拨款，整个社区焕然一新。
vi./vt. （使）洗心革面: Every time he made a mistake, he would promise to regenerate. 每次犯错他都会保证洗心革面，下次不再犯。
regenerate.mean:
vt. 使重获新生，使焕然一新： to bring back to life, practice, activity or a former condition of vigor
vi./vt. （使）洗心革面： to make better in behavior or character

tantalize.example: vt. 激起，挑逗: He was tantalized by the possibility of earning a lot of money quickly. 有人用迅速致富挑逗他。
tantalize.mean: vt. 激起，挑逗： to excite (another) by exposing something desirable while keeping it out of reach

perfervid.example: adj. 非常热情的: perfervid love letter 热情洋溢的情书
perfervid.mean: adj. 非常热情的： marked by overwrought or exaggerated emotion: excessively fervent

milieu.example: n. 环境，氛围: Young, innovative artists thrive in the freewheeling milieu that a big city offers. 在那个大都市所提供的自由氛围中，年轻而富有创造力的艺术家们的事业蓬勃发展。‖ahistorical milieu conducive to democracy 有助于民主制度的历史背景
milieu.mean: n. 环境，氛围： the physical or social setting in which something occurs or develops

advert.example: vi. 引起注意；提到: He adverted to the problem in the opening paragraph. 他开门见山地引出了问题。
advert.mean: vi. 引起注意；提到：to call attention; refer:

confident.example: adj. 有信心的，自信的: Thicker and fuller hair would make a man more confident at work. 越来越浓密的头发让男人在工作中更加自信。
confident.mean: adj. 有信心的，自信的：having or showing assurance and self-reliance

charisma.example: n. 魅力，吸引力: a movie star with unique charisma 有着独特魅力的电影明星‖The candidate was lacking in charisma. 候选人就是缺乏了点个人魅力。
charisma.mean: n. 魅力，吸引力： a special magnetic charm or appeal

replicate.example:
vt. 复制，复刻: replicated the famous painting in our art class 在艺术课上复刻一幅名画
vt. 重复，反复: I cannot replicate your results when I do the experiment myself. 我自己的实验里无法重复你的结果。
replicate.mean:
vt. 复制，复刻： to make an exact likeness of
vt. 重复，反复： to make or do again

flexible.example:
adj. 灵活的，可变的: Our schedules are highly flexible. 我们的计划是非常灵活的
adj. 易受影响的: Their boss was flexible and lenient. 他们的老板既好说话，又很仁慈
flexible.mean:
adj. 灵活的，可变的： capable of being readily changed
adj. 易受影响的： susceptible to influence or persuasion

recessive.example:
adj. （基因等）隐性的，由隐形基因控制的: a recessive disease 阴性基因控制的疾病
adj. 内向的，内敛的: For such a recessive genius, the most comfortable thing is working alone in his lab. 对于这样一个内向的天才而言，最舒服的事情就是一个人在实验室里干活。
recessive.mean:
adj. （基因等）隐性的，由隐形基因控制的： of, relating to, or designating an allele that does not produce a characteristic effect when present with a dominant allele
adj. 内向的，内敛的： not comfortable around people

lissome.example:
adj. 柔软的: Rattan is such a lissome material that it can be used for all manner of furniture and baskets. 藤是一种非常柔软而有韧性的材料，因此可以被用于形形色色的家具和篮子之中
adj. 敏捷的，轻盈的: a lissome ballerina 身姿矫捷的女芭蕾舞演员
lissome.mean:
adj. 柔软的： easily bent; supple
adj. 敏捷的，轻盈的： having the ability to move with ease; limber

fleeting.example: adj. 稍纵即逝的，短暂的: They have been waiting for more than 4 hours but caught only a fleeting glimpse of the movie star. 他们苦等了至少四个小时，却最终只短短地瞟到了电影明星一眼。
fleeting.mean: adj. 稍纵即逝的，短暂的： lasting only for a short time; passing swiftly

proclivity.example: n. 癖性，偏好: showed artistic proclivities at an early age 在很小的时候就表现除了对艺术的喜好
proclivity.mean: n. 癖性，偏好： a natural propensity or inclination; predisposition

plebeian.example: adj. 平民的，社会下层的: a man who rose to greatness but never forgot his plebeian past 一个仕途通达，但从未忘却自己平民出身的人
plebeian.mean: adj. 平民的，社会下层的： belonging to the class of people of low social or economic rank

suppress.example:
vt. 抑制（表情）: suppress a smile 忍住笑容
v. 用暴力终止，镇压: Nothing could suppress the rising tide of protest. 暴力也难以控制越来越激烈的游行示威活动。
suppress.mean:
vt. 抑制（表情）： to inhibit the expression of (an impulse, for example); check
v. 用暴力终止，镇压： to put a stop to (something) by the use of force

disgruntle.example: vt. 使发怒，使不满意: be disgruntled with sb 对某人不满
disgruntle.mean:
vt. 使发怒，使不满意：to make ill-humored or discontented
v. 使疏远，使不友好：to cause to change from friendly or loving to unfriendly or uncaring

decrepit.example: adj. 虚弱的，衰老的，破旧的: a decrepit old man 一个虚弱的老年人
decrepit.mean: adj. 虚弱的，衰老的，破旧的： weakened, worn out, impaired, or broken down by old age, illness

kudos.example:
n. 名望，名声: Employees enjoy the kudos that the job brings as much as the financial rewards. 正如同喜欢工作带来的经济回报一样，雇员们也很享受工作所带来的名声和荣誉
n. 夸奖，赞扬: The attorney did pro bono work because it was the right thing to do, and not for any future kudos that it might bring. 这名律师之所以为慈善机构和穷人所提供免费服务，是因为他觉得这是正确的事情，而非为了任何可能因此而产生的赞扬
kudos.mean:
n. 名望，名声： fame and renown resulting from an act or achievement
n. 夸奖，赞扬： acclaim or praise for exceptional achievement

demotic.example: adj. 通俗的，大众化的: demotic entertainments 大众化的娱乐
demotic.mean: adj. 通俗的，大众化的： popular, common

imbroglio.example:
n. 困境，复杂的局面: What investor would willingly become involved in this imbroglio? 怎样的投资者才会像这样明知山有虎，偏向虎山行呢？
n. 纷争: an imbroglio involving some big names in the entertainment industry 一场涉及娱乐圈数位明星的纷争
imbroglio.mean:
n. 困境，复杂的局面： an intricate or complicated situation
n. 纷争： an often noisy or angry expression of differing opinions

pejorative.example: adj. 轻蔑的，贬低的: I agree that I am ambitious, and I don't see it as a pejorative term. 我承认我“雄心勃勃”，但我并不认为这是一个贬义词
pejorative.mean: adj. 轻蔑的，贬低的： disparaging; belittling

irradicable.example: adj. 不能根除的: Smoking has become an irradicable bad habit for him. 吸烟已成了他不能根除的恶习
irradicable.mean: adj. 不能根除的： impossible to uproot or destroy

downplay.example: vt. 轻描淡写，不予重视: downplay the bad news 对坏消息轻描淡写
downplay.mean: vt. 轻描淡写，不予重视： to minimize the significance of, play down

chicanery.example: n．诡计多端，欺骗 : Well-doer never does chicanery and person who is good at chicanery does not belong well-doer. 善者不辩，辩者不善。|| He wasn't above using chicanery to win votes. 他不是用欺骗来赢得选票的。
chicanery.mean: n．诡计多端，欺骗 ：deception by artful subterfuge or sophistry

sly.example:
adj. 狡猾的: The movie pairs a sly, dissembling ex-con with an upstanding, straight-arrow cop. 电影把一个狡猾、善于骗人的出狱犯和正直、坦率的警察搭配在了一起。
adj. 隐秘的，偷偷的: took a sly look at the letter on the table 偷偷地看了一眼桌上的信
sly.mean:
adj. 狡猾的： clever or cunning, especially in the practice of deceit.
adj. 隐秘的，偷偷的： given to acting in secret and to concealing one's intentions

affirm.example: vt. 声称为真，肯定属实: He was unwilling to affirm without further study that the painting is an original Rembrandt. 在缺乏进一步研究的情况下，他不愿意声称这幅画作是出自伦布兰特的正品。
affirm.mean: vt. 声称为真，肯定属实： to assert (as a judgment or decree) as valid or confirmed

apprehension.example:
n. 忧虑，恐惧: She had a strong apprehension about her sister's health 她非常担心她姐姐的健康。
n. 逮捕: apprehension of the thief 逮捕小偷
n. 理解: a good apprehension of how computer systems work 对计算机是如何工作的有很好的理解
apprehension.mean:
n. 忧虑，恐惧：suspicion or fear especially of future evil
n. 逮捕：seizure by legal process : arrestment
n. 理解：the knowledge gained from the process of coming to know or understand something

dissect.example:
vt. 仔细分析: dissect some basic problems in mathematics analysis 仔细分析一些数学分析的基本问题 || let's dissect the plot of this thriller to see what makes it thrilling. 让我们来仔细分析一下这个恐怖电影为什么恐怖。
vt. 切成片(尤其是为了解剖研究): dissect the brain of Einstein 解剖爱因斯坦的大脑
dissect.mean:
vt. 仔细分析： to examine, analyze, or criticize in minute detail
vt. 切成片(尤其是为了解剖研究)： to cut apart or separate (tissue), especially for anatomical study

taper.example:
vt.（使）逐渐变细: taper to a point 逐渐变成为一点
v. 逐渐减少，减弱: The storm finally tapered off. 风暴逐渐平静了。
taper.mean:
vt.（使）逐渐变细： to become gradually narrower or thinner toward one end
v. 逐渐减少，减弱： to diminish or lessen gradually

pungent.example: adj. 辛辣的，讽刺的: pungent language 辛辣讽刺的语言
pungent.mean: adj. 辛辣的，讽刺的： marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings

windbag.example: n. 健谈的人: With a windbag like that, who needs a wind farm to meet our energy needs? 有了他这样一个多话的“吹风机”，谁还要风力发电厂来满足电力需求呢？
windbag.mean: n. 健谈的人： an exhaustively talkative person

outgrowth.example: n. 结果，后果: Crime is often an outgrowth of poverty. 犯罪往往可以归因于贫穷。‖A predictable outgrowth of the suburb’s ever growing population will be the need for more schools. 郊区人口攀升所导致的一个可以预见的后果就是需要更多的学校。
outgrowth.mean: n. 结果，后果： a condition or occurrence traceable to a cause

personable.example: adj. 风度翩翩的，吸引人的: apparently be attracted by a personable young man 明显被一位风度翩翩的少年迷住了
personable.mean: adj. 风度翩翩的，吸引人的： pleasing in personality or appearance; attractive

fallow.example:
adj. 休耕的: The field was lying fallow. 那田地正在休耕中
adj. 闲置的: The coal mine has been lying fallow since the drop in prices made it unprofitable. 自从煤价下跌造成亏损，这个煤矿就一直处于停工状态
fallow.mean:
adj. 休耕的： left untilled or unsown after plowing
adj. 闲置的： not being in a state of use, activity, or employment

convalesce.example: vi. 渐渐康复，渐愈: the time needed to convalesce after an operation 手术后需要用来康复的时间
convalesce.mean: vi. 渐渐康复，渐愈： to recover health and strength gradually after sickness or weakness

subjugate.example: vt. 征服，镇压: I would rather die than be subjugated. 我宁死也不愿臣服。
subjugate.mean:
vt. 征服，镇压： to bring under control and governance as a subject
vt. 剥夺自由： to make subservient

prostrate.example:
adj./v. 平躺: He was lying prostrate on the bed. 他平躺在床上。
adj./v. 衰弱的/使衰竭: illness that prostrated an entire family 将整个家庭拖垮的疾病
prostrate.mean:
adj./v. 平躺： lying flat or at full length
adj./v. 衰弱的/使衰竭： to reduce to extreme weakness or incapacitation

mangle.example:
vt. 损毁，使伤残: His body was mangled beyond recognition. 他的尸体已经被损毁到无法辨认的程度了
vt. 弄砸: The orchestra had completely mangled Bach’s music. 乐队彻底演砸了巴赫的音乐
mangle.mean:
vt. 损毁，使伤残： to injure with deep disfiguring wounds by cutting, tearing, or crushing
vt. 弄砸： to ruin or spoil through ineptitude or ignorance

pessimistic.example: adj. 悲观的: With that pessimistic attitude, it's no wonder you're depressed. 你的人生观如此悲观，难怪你会感到压抑
pessimistic.mean: adj. 悲观的： tending to stress the negative or unfavorable or to take the gloomiest possible view

preponderant.example: adj. 占优势的，更重要的: a preponderant misconception 一个影响甚广的错误概念
preponderant.mean: adj. 占优势的，更重要的： having superior weight, force, importance, or influence

preeminent.example: adj. 优秀的，重要的: The writer's style is brilliant and his command of words, preeminent. 作者的文风和用词都十分出色
preeminent.mean: adj. 优秀的，重要的：having paramount rank, dignity, or importance

recuperate.example: vi. 恢复（健康或力量），康复: He is gradually recuperating from a serious back injury. 他正渐渐地从严重的背部损伤中恢复过来。
recuperate.mean: vi. 恢复（健康或力量），康复： to recover health or strength

elicit.example: vt. 激起，唤起: The king’s speech elicited lasting cheer and applause. 国王的演讲激起了持续的欢呼和掌声
elicit.mean: vt. 激起，唤起： to draw forth or bring out

lugubrious.example: adj. （故作夸张的）悲哀的: his lugubrious tear-stained face他忧郁而带着泪痕的脸庞
lugubrious.mean: adj. （故作夸张的）悲哀的： mournful, dismal, or gloomy, especially to an exaggerated or ludicrous degree

brake.example: v. 刹车: A seagull swooped down in front of her car, causing her to slam on the brakes. 一只海鸥飞到车窗前，她猛踩刹车。
brake.mean: v. 刹车： to cause to move or proceed at a less rapid pace

jest.example: n. 轻浮的态度，戏谑: spoken in jest 戏谑地说
jest.mean: n. 轻浮的态度，戏谑： a frivolous mood or manner

indigenous.example:
adj. 土产的，本地的: the culture of the indigenous people of that country 那个国家原著民的文化
adj. 与生俱来的，先天的: The drive to create is indigenous to humanity. 人类创造的动力是与生俱来的
indigenous.mean:
adj. 土产的，本地的： originating and living or occurring naturally in an area or environment
adj. 与生俱来的，先天的： being a part of the innermost nature of a person or thing

stint.example: vi. 吝惜，节省: They never stint with their praise. 他们从不吝啬他们的赞美之词。
stint.mean: vi. 吝惜，节省： to be sparing or frugal

surcharge.example: v./n. 过高收费: The airline has added a $30 fuel surcharge on all international flights. 该航空公司对所有国际航线上涨了30美元的燃油税。
surcharge.mean: v./n. 过高收费： to charge (someone) too much for goods or services

hone.example: v. 磨快: honed the knife's blade to razor-like sharpness 把小刀磨得像剃刀一样锋利 || honed his crossword-puzzle skills by reading the dictionary 通过背字典把填词游戏的水平练得炉火纯青
hone.mean: v. 磨快： to sharpen or smooth with a whetstone

rapprochement.example: n. 和睦，友好: an era of rapprochement betweenChina and Russia 中俄两国睦邻友好关系的新纪元
rapprochement.mean: n. 和睦，友好： establishment of or state of having cordial relations

grandiose.example:
adj. 自命不凡的: grandiose words 自命不凡的话语
adj. 宏大的: a grandiose hydroelectric project 宏伟的水利工程
grandiose.mean:
adj. 自命不凡的： characterized by feigned or affected grandeur
adj. 宏大的： characterized by greatness of scope or intent

patent.example: adj. 显而易见的，明显的: Unfortunately, the patent flaw of the proposal did not deter the city council from putting it up for a vote. 不幸的是，尽管提案中有着显而易见的缺陷，市议会依然将它拿出来进行投票
patent.mean: adj. 显而易见的，明显的： readily visible or intelligible: obvious

tactile.example: adj. 有触觉的，能触知的: The thick brushstrokes give the painting a tactile quality. 粘稠的笔触给了这幅画一种厚实的感觉。
tactile.mean: adj. 有触觉的，能触知的： perceptible by touch: tangible

harass.example:
v．烦扰: The troops harrassed the defeated army throughout its retreat. 战胜的队伍在撤退过程中还不忘突袭一下败北的队伍。
v. 耗尽体力: had been visibly harassed by the demands of the presidency 总统被事务缠身，筋疲力尽
harass.mean:
v．烦扰： to irritate or torment persistently
v. 耗尽体力： to use up all the physical energy of

haphazard.example: adj. 无秩序的，无目标的: We were given a haphazard tour of the city. 我们进行了一次城市漫游。
haphazard.mean: adj. 无秩序的，无目标的： marked by lack of plan, order, or direction

descend.example:
v. 下降: the pathway descends to the river bank 通道一直向下延伸到河岸
v. 世代相传: The house has descended through four generations. 这座房子已经传了四代。a tradition descending from colonial days 殖民时期传递下来的一项传统
descend.mean:
v. 下降： to lead or extend downward
v. 世代相传： to originate or come from an ancestral stock or source, to pass by inheritance

contaminate.example: vt. 染污，掺杂: Bacteria contaminated the wound. 细菌感染了伤口
contaminate.mean: vt. 染污，掺杂： to soil, stain, corrupt, or infect by contact or association

venom.example:
n. 毒液: an antidote to snake venom 蛇毒的解药
n. 恶意，恶毒的用心: She spoke of him with venom in her voice. 她的评论怀揣着恶意。
venom.mean:
n. 毒液： poisonous matter normally secreted by some animals as snakes, scorpions, or bees
n. 恶意，恶毒的用心： the desire to cause pain for the satisfaction of doing harm

monarch.example:
n. 君主，帝王: The ruling monarch of Britain at that time was Queen Elizabeth I. 伊丽莎白一世是当时英国的君主。
n. 巨头，大亨: the reigning monarchs of the recording industry 唱片业的巨头们
monarch.mean:
n. 君主，帝王： one who rules over a people with a sole, supreme, and usually hereditary authority
n. 巨头，大亨： a person of rank, power, or influence in a particular field

demotion.example: n. 降级，降职: Anyone who objects will get a demotion. 任何胆敢反对的人都会被降职。‖received a demotion from sergeant to corporal 从中士降为下士
demotion.mean: n. 降级，降职： the act or an instance of bringing to a lower grade or rank

sodden.example:
adj. 湿透的: We stripped off our sodden clothes and wrung them dry. 我们脱下湿透了的衣服并将它们拧干。
vt. 使…湿透: Soldiers' boots were soddened by endless hours in muddy trenches. 长时间身处泥泞的战壕使得士兵的靴子湿透了。
sodden.mean:
adj. 湿透的： containing, covered with, or thoroughly penetrated by water
vt. 使…湿透： to wet thoroughly with liquid

perimeter.mean: n. 边界，界限： the line or relatively narrow space that marks the outer limit of something

jocund.example: adj. 欢快的，高兴的: old friends engaged in jocund teasing 老朋友相见，互相打趣调侃
jocund.mean: adj. 欢快的，高兴的： sprightly and lighthearted in disposition, character, or quality

chauvinistic.example: adj. 盲目爱国的: At times I have also been aggressive, chauvinistic and hot-tempered. 我曾经非常好斗，愤青，还脾气暴躁。
chauvinistic.mean: adj. 盲目爱国的： having or showing excessive favoritism towards one's own country

flippancy.example: n. 轻率，无礼: The flippancy of your answer annoyed me. 你轻率的回答让我很恼火
flippancy.mean: n. 轻率，无礼： unbecoming levity or pertness especially in respect to grave or sacred matters

rail.example: vi. 怒骂，猛烈抨击: We could hear the cook in the kitchen railing against his assistant and wondered if we'd ever get our food. 我们可以听到厨师在厨房怒斥他的助手，由此我们怀疑我们点的菜还能不能做好。
rail.mean: vi. 怒骂，猛烈抨击： to revile or scold in harsh, insolent, or abusive language

deflect.example: vt. 使偏斜，使转向: The goalie deflected the ball with his hands. 守门员用双手将球击出。‖They are trying to deflect the public attention from the troubled economy. 他们试图将公众的注意力从经济的困境中移开。
deflect.mean: vt. 使偏斜，使转向： to turn aside especially from a straight course or fixed direction

misconstrue.example: vt. 误解，曲解: An outsider might misconstrue the nature of the phenomenon. 局外者可能会曲解这个现象的本质
misconstrue.mean: vt. 误解，曲解： to mistake the meaning of

palpable.example:
adj. 摸得到的: a small but palpable lump in my neck 我脖子上有一块小但是能摸得到的肿块
adj. 明显的，易觉察的: a palpable difference 易觉察的差别
palpable.mean:
adj. 摸得到的： capable of being touched or felt
adj. 明显的，易觉察的： easily perceived; obvious

nip.example: n. 少量: I'll have just a nip of your sandwich. 我只吃一点点你的三明治
nip.mean:
n. 少量： a very small amount
vi. 小口吃喝： to sip (alcoholic liquor) in small amounts

overt.example: adj. 明显的，公开的: overt hostility 公然的敌意
overt.mean: adj. 明显的，公开的： open and observable; not hidden, concealed, or secret

ramshackle.example: adj. 摇摇欲坠的: a ramshackle cabin in the woods 树林中摇摇欲坠的小木屋
ramshackle.mean: adj. 摇摇欲坠的： appearing ready to collapse; rickety

auspicious.example: adj. 好兆头的: began the season with an auspicious win against their strongest football rival 在赛季之初就战胜了最强的对手，为整个赛季赢得了好兆头
auspicious.mean: adj. 好兆头的： pointing toward a happy outcome

humble.example:
adj. 谦逊的: a medical scientist who remained remarkably humble even after winning the Nobel Prize 获得诺贝尔奖之后仍然保持谦逊的医学家
adj. 顺从的，谦卑的: please accept my humble thanks 请接受我的卑微的感谢
humble.mean:
adj. 谦逊的： marked by meekness or modesty in behavior, attitude, or spirit; not arrogant or prideful
adj. 顺从的，谦卑的： showing, expressing, or offered in a spirit of humility or unseemly submissiveness

taint.example: vt. （品质）污损: A tendency toward conceitedness taints that athlete's status as a role model. 该运动员自负的倾向玷污了其行为模范的地位。
taint.mean: vt. （品质）污损： to affect slightly with something morally bad or undesirable

doff.example: vt. 脱下: The blazing sun soon had the men doffing their jackets. 炙热的太阳很快就让男人们脱掉了夹克。
doff.mean: vt. 脱下： to take off; remove

ragged.example:
adj. 衣衫褴褛的: A ragged coat may cover an honest man. 不能以衣著取人。
adj. 凹凸不平的，不光滑的: She cut herself on the ragged edge of the tin can's lid. 她被罐头盖的锋利边缘割伤了。
ragged.mean:
adj. 衣衫褴褛的： dressed in tattered or threadbare clothes
adj. 凹凸不平的，不光滑的： not having a level or smooth surface

approbation.example: n. 同意: The proposal met his approbation. 这项建议得到了他的同意。
approbation.mean: n. 同意：an expression of warm approval

impertinent.example:
adj. 无关紧要的: Your résumé needlessly lists extracurricular experiences that are impertinent to the PhD program for which you are applying. 你的简历里列出的一些课外活动和你申请的博士项目是毫不相关的
adj. 粗鲁无礼的，大胆的: I don't like strangers who ask impertinent questions. 我很讨厌那些问无礼问题的陌生人
adj. 不守礼节的，不为他人着想的: impertinent salesmen who telephone people during the dinner hour 在就餐时间打电话骚扰别人的无礼销售员
impertinent.mean:
adj. 无关紧要的： not having a clear decisive relevance to the matter in hand
adj. 粗鲁无礼的，大胆的： given to or characterized by insolent rudeness
adj. 不守礼节的，不为他人着想的： showing a lack of manners or consideration for others

salutary.example:
adj. 有益健康的: a salutary warning 善意的警告
adj. 有利的，利好的: The low interest rates should have a salutary effect on business. 低利率对于商业而言应该是有利的。
salutary.mean:
adj. 有益健康的： beneficial, promoting health
adj. 有利的，利好的： promoting or contributing to personal or social well-being

backhanded.example: adj. 间接的，含沙射影的, 虚情假意的: a backhanded compliment 虚情假意的恭维话
backhanded.mean: adj. 间接的，含沙射影的, 虚情假意的： indirect, devious, especially sarcastic

bonhomie.mean: n. 温和，和蔼： a pleasant and affable disposition; geniality

stringent.example: adj. 严格的: Its drug-testing procedures are the most stringent in the world. 它的药检程序是世界上最严格的
stringent.mean:
adj. 紧绷的： tight, constricted
adj. 严格的： marked by rigor, strictness, or severity especially with regard to rule or standard

aggregate.example:
n. 集合体: An empire is the aggregate of many states under one common head. 帝国是以一个共同领袖领导的若干国家的集合体。
v. 集合，聚集: aggregates content from many other sites 搜罗集合了其他网站的内容
aggregate.mean:
n. 集合体： a mass or body of units or parts somewhat loosely associated with one another
v. 集合，聚集： to collect or gather into a mass or whole

versed.example:
adj. 熟知的: versed in the latest developments in aeronautics 熟知当今航空业的发展情况
adj. 精通的: well versed in the techniques of laser surgery 精通激光手术方面的技术
versed.mean:
adj. 熟知的： having information especially as a result of study or experience
adj. 精通的： having or showing exceptional knowledge, experience, or skill in a field of endeavor

agog.example: adj. 极度感兴趣的: Children were agog over new toys. 孩子们见到了新玩具极其兴奋。
agog.mean: adj. 极度感兴趣的： showing urgent desire or interest

repose.example:
n. （劳作后的）休息: The doctor ordered a period of repose for the patient suffering from insomnia. 医生要求正在饱受失眠折磨的病人好好休息一阵。
n. 平静，宁静: We enjoyed the repose of a summer evening on a remote island. 我们在遥远的小岛上共享了夏日傍晚的片刻安宁。
vi. 休息: They have to repose on couches because all beds have been occupied. 因为所有的床都有人占了，他们不得不在沙发上休息。
vt. 放置，交给他人: The Constitution reposes the power to declare war to Congress, and to that body alone. 宪法将宣战的权力交给了国会单独保管。
repose.mean:
n. （劳作后的）休息： a state of resting after exertion or strain
n. 平静，宁静： a state of freedom from storm or disturbance
vi. 休息： to take a rest
vt. 放置，交给他人： to put (something) into the possession or safekeeping of another

rarefy.example: vt. 使稀薄: rarefy the air 使空气变得稀薄
rarefy.mean: vt. 使稀薄： to make rare, thin, porous, or less dense: to expand without the addition of matter

beset.example:
vt. 使苦恼，骚扰: He has been beset by a lack of self-confidence virtually his entire life. 事实上他的一生都在被缺乏自信所困扰。
vt. 攻击，袭击: The settlers were beset by savages. 定居者们遭到了野蛮人的袭击。‖The unsuspecting tourists were suddenly beset by robbers. 丝毫没有准备的游客遭到了歹徒的突然袭击。
beset.mean:
vt. 使苦恼，骚扰： to cause persistent suffering to
vt. 攻击，袭击： to set upon

disguise.example:
v. 伪装（防止被认出）: He always disguises his true feelings. 他经常掩饰自己的真实感受。
v. 隐藏: That investigative reporter usually does a good job of disguising her true motives for interviewing a person. 当采访时，那个调查记者经常很好地隐藏自己的真实目的
disguise.mean:
v. 伪装（防止被认出）： to modify the manner or appearance of in order to prevent recognition
v. 隐藏： to keep secret or shut off from view

incentive.example: n. 刺激，诱因: The handsome reward for the missing wallet was an incentive for me to start looking. 找到丢失钱包的可观报酬激励我展开搜寻。‖A little bonus will give employees an incentive to work harder. 一点点奖金就可以刺激雇员更加努力地工作。
incentive.mean: n. 刺激，诱因： something that incites or has a tendency to incite to determination or action

sanitary.example: adj. 健康的，清洁的: sanitary measures 保健的手段
sanitary.mean: adj. 健康的，清洁的： of or relating to health

plight.example: n. 困境: He was in a plight, trying to decide whether or not to take the job. 他处在不知道是否应该接受这份工作的困境之中。
plight.mean: n. 困境： a situation, especially a bad or unfortunate one

extol.example: v. 赞美；吹捧: extol the virtues of… 赞美……的优点
extol.mean: v. 赞美；吹捧： to praise highly; glorify

impending.example: adj. 即将发生的: an impending celebration of the 100th anniversary of the college's founding 即将来临的百年校庆
impending.mean: adj. 即将发生的： being soon to appear or take place

enlighten.example:
vt. 使知道: enlightened us about the thorny problem 启发我们思考这个棘手的问题
vt.（在道德上）进行教育: Many people around the world have been enlightened by the teachings of Gautama Buddha. 释迦摩尼的说教启迪了世界上许许多多的人的灵魂
enlighten.mean:
vt. 使知道： to give information to; inform or instruct
vt.（在道德上）进行教育： to provide (someone) with moral or spiritual understanding

nudge.example:
vt. 用肘推以引起注意: accidentally nudged me as he squeezed past 他过去的时候不小心用肘碰到了我
vt. 说服某人做某事: the car salesman nudged me into taking a test-drive 汽车销售员说服我进行试驾
nudge.mean:
vt. 用肘推以引起注意： to seek the attention of by a push of the elbow
vt. 说服某人做某事： to try to persuade (someone) through earnest appeals to follow a course of action

legion.example:
n. 大量的人，（尤指）军团: joined the French Foreign Legion 加入了法国外籍军团
adj. 大量的: The problems are legion. 问题不计其数
legion.mean:
n. 大量的人，（尤指）军团： a large body of men and women organized for land warfare
adj. 大量的：many, numerous

exalt.example: vt. 提升，提拔: popular support and media hype have exalted Super Bowl Sunday to the level of a national holiday 大众广泛的支持和媒体的大肆宣传已然将超级碗杯星期天变成了一个全民狂欢的大节日
exalt.mean:
vt. 提升，提拔： to raise in rank, character, or status; elevate
vt. 赞扬： to glorify, praise, or honor.

affinity.example:
n. 喜欢，亲切感: always had an affinity for nurturing living things 喜欢培养活物
n. 相似: a study showing an affinity between obesity and socioeconomic status 一项表现了肥胖程度和社会经济水平之间相似性的研究
affinity.mean:
n. 喜欢，亲切感： a habitual attraction to some activity or thing
n. 相似： the fact or state of having something in common

defray.example: vt. 支付: The government has committed billions toward defraying the costs of the war. 政府为战争付出了成百上千亿元的代价。‖I don’t have sufficient fund to defray the expense. 我身上的现金还不够埋单。
defray.mean: vt. 支付： to undertake the payment of

falter.example: vi. 犹豫，踌躇: Mr. Garrison never once faltered in his demand that slavery be unconditionally abolished. 盖瑞森先生从不对他废除奴隶的要求存有任何的犹豫
falter.mean:
vi. 蹒跚： to walk unsteadily
vi. 犹豫，踌躇： to be unsteady in purpose or action, as from loss of courage or confidence

designate.example:
v. 任命: he has yet to designate his successor as head of the firm 他还没有给公司选定接班人
v. 命名: he was designated Air Jordan by his fans 他被粉丝们称为飞人乔丹
designate.mean:
v. 任命： to pick (someone) by one's authority for a specific position or duty
v. 命名： to give a name to

submissive.example: adj. 服从的，顺从的，恭顺的: submissive employees 恭顺的员工‖It's not in her nature to be submissive. 服从不是她的本性。
submissive.mean: adj. 服从的，顺从的，恭顺的： submitting to others

insensitive.example:
adj. 缺乏机智圆滑的，缺乏社交技巧的: so insensitive as to laugh at someone in pain 如此缺乏社交技巧以至于嘲笑处于悲痛中的人
adj. 不敏感的，麻木的: insensitive to either criticism or commendation 对批评和表扬都不在乎
insensitive.mean:
adj. 缺乏机智圆滑的，缺乏社交技巧的： lacking tact
adj. 不敏感的，麻木的： not responsive or susceptible

rubicund.example: adj. 红润的，健康的: A rubicund complexion indicates good health. 红润的气色意味着健康的身体。
rubicund.mean: adj. 红润的，健康的： inclined to a healthy rosiness

perfunctory.example:
adj. 例行公事的，敷衍的: gave his usual perfunctory nod 例行公事地随便点了个头
adj. 不感兴趣的: She gave the list only a perfunctory glance. 她无所谓地随便瞅了名单一眼
perfunctory.mean:
adj. 例行公事的，敷衍的： characterized by routine or superficiality and often done merely as a duty
adj. 不感兴趣的： lacking in interest or enthusiasm

effulgent.example: adj. 光辉灿烂的: an effulgent sunset on the Atlantic 大西洋上壮丽辉煌的日落
effulgent.mean: adj. 光辉灿烂的：shining brilliantly; resplendent

discreet.example:
adj. （言行）谨慎的: He was very discreet, only saying what was necessary. 他是个十分谨慎的人，从来不说多余的话。
adj. 不易察觉的: With a discreet gesture, she signaled to her husband that she was ready to leave the party. 她用一个不起眼的手势向丈夫暗示准备离开聚会。‖followed at a discreet distance 远远地跟踪
discreet.mean:
adj. （言行）谨慎的： having or showing good judgment and restraint especially in conduct or speech
adj. 不易察觉的： not readily seen or noticed

incontrovertible.example: adj. 无可争议的: incontrovertible facts 无可非议的事实
incontrovertible.mean: adj. 无可争议的： not open to question

shadow.example:
vt. 偷偷尾随: shadowing the suspect to see what he was up to 尾随嫌犯行踪
vt. 偷偷尾随: He had only a shadowy idea of what they wanted him to do. 他对要做的事只有一个模糊的想法。
shadow.mean: vt. 偷偷尾随： to follow especially secretly: trail

scruple.example: n. （良心上的）不安: The survey showed that many students had few scruples about cheating on papers or exams. 调查显示很多学生对于在考试时作弊没有丝毫的愧疚。
scruple.mean: n. （良心上的）不安： an uneasy feeling about the rightness of what one is doing or going to do

sate.example: vt. 使饱足，充分满足: The information sated her curiosity. 这个消息满足了她的好奇心。
sate.mean: vt. 使饱足，充分满足： to glut; to satisfy (an appetite) fully

nauseate.example: v. （使）厌恶，（使）作呕: The malodor of the rotten meat made us nauseate. 腐肉的恶臭让我们恶心
nauseate.mean: v. （使）厌恶，（使）作呕： to feel or cause to feel loathing or disgust

insurgent.example: n. 叛乱分子: Insurgents armed with assault rifles and grenades ambushed a US convoy, resulting in heavy casualties. 持有突击步枪和手榴弹的叛乱分子偷袭了美军车队，造成重大伤亡
insurgent.mean: n. 叛乱分子： one who breaks with or opposes constituted authority or the established order

rustle.example: v. 快速地行动: The little boy rustled around enthusiastically on the first morning of the trip. 旅行的第一个早晨，小男孩充满热情地在那活蹦乱跳。
rustle.mean: v. 快速地行动： to move or act energetically or with speed; to proceed or move quickly

disinclination.example: n. 不喜欢，厌恶，不情愿: showing a marked disinclination 表现出明显的不情愿
disinclination.mean: n. 不喜欢，厌恶，不情愿： a lack of willingness or desire to do or accept something；a lack of willingness or desire to do or accept something

zeal.example: n. 热心，热诚: preaches with fanatical zeal 带着狂热进行传教
zeal.mean: n. 热心，热诚： enthusiastic devotion to a cause, ideal, or goal and tireless diligence in its furtherance

contradict.example: vt. 否认，反驳；相矛盾: contradict a rumor 反驳谣言‖Your actions contradict your words. 你的行为和你说的话自相矛盾。
contradict.mean: vt. 否认，反驳；相矛盾： to assert the contrary of; to imply the opposite or a denial of

specific.example:
adj. 特有的，独特的: We need a specific type of pen to sign the diplomas. 我们需要一种特制的笔来签署学位证书。
adj. 明确的: specific instructions regarding the interrogation of prisoners 有关如何审问犯人的明确指示
specific.mean:
adj. 特有的，独特的： of a particular or exact sort
adj. 明确的： so clearly expressed as to leave no doubt about the meaning

sparse.example: adj. 稀疏的，稀少的: Many slopes are rock fields with sparse vegetation. 许多山坡都是不长植物的石坡。
sparse.mean: adj. 稀疏的，稀少的： less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable

arbitrary.example:
adj. 专横的，独断专行的: an arbitrary piano teacher who makes all her students do the same exercises over and over again 一个让学生反复练习同一首曲子的专横的老师
adj. 独裁的，拥有无限权力的: a nation with no tradition of democracy, only a long history of arbitrary rulers 一个从来没有民主的传统，只有长期的独裁统治的国家
adj. 缺乏计划的，随意的: The order of the names of the 10 semifinalists is entirely arbitrary. 半决赛上十名上场选手的顺序完全是随机的。
arbitrary.mean:
adj. 专横的，独断专行的： having or showing a tendency to force one's will on others without any regard to fairness or necessity
adj. 独裁的，拥有无限权力的： exercising power or authority without interference by others
adj. 缺乏计划的，随意的： lacking a definite plan, purpose, or pattern

diaphanous.example:
adj. 模糊的，非实在的: only a diaphanous hope of success 只有一丝成功的希望
adj. （质地精致得）几乎透明的: The bride wore a diaphanous veil. 新娘戴着透明的面纱。
diaphanous.mean:
adj. 模糊的，非实在的： vague or insubstantial
adj. （质地精致得）几乎透明的： of such fine texture as to be transparent or translucent

augur.example:
n. 预言家: The ancient Roman augurs predicted the future by reading the flight of birds. 古罗马的预言家们通过鸟类的航线来预测未来
v. 出现好兆头: This augurs well for us. 这是一个好兆头
vt. 预言: The fortune-teller augured nothing but a series of calamities for me. 占卜人预言在我身上将会有一系列大灾难发生
augur.mean:
n. 预言家： one who predicts future events or developments
v. 出现好兆头： to show signs of a favorable or successful outcome
vt. 预言：to tell of or describe beforehand

signal.example:
adj. （在重要性、成就方面）非同寻常的: The Louisiana Purchase is cited by many historians as one of the most signal events in American history. 从法国手中购买路易斯安那被许多历史学家认为是美国历史上最重要的事件之一。‖a signal feat 一项非同寻常伟业
v. 给出信号: They signaled at me to come over to their table. 他们向我打招呼要我到他们那桌去。‖A lock on the suitcase might signal that there's something of value inside. 手提箱上的锁可能意味着其中有贵重物品。
signal.mean:
adj. （在重要性、成就方面）非同寻常的： standing above others in rank, importance, or achievement
v. 给出信号： to direct or notify by a movement or gesture

clich\u00e9.example: n./ adj. 陈词滥调（的）: Cliché is a feature of bad news. 拙劣的新闻的特征是使用陈词滥调。
clich\u00e9.mean: n./ adj. 陈词滥调（的）：a hackneyed theme, characterization, or situation

cowardice.example: n. 懦弱，不坚定: cowardice in the face of danger 面对危险时的懦弱
cowardice.mean: n. 懦弱，不坚定： lack of courage or resolution

creek.example: n. 小溪，小河: went wading in the creek 在小溪中涉水而行
creek.mean: n. 小溪，小河： a natural stream of water normally smaller than and often tributary to a river

stereotype.example: n. 成见，老套的理念: The noble savage was a stereotype that appealed to 18th-century intellectuals, who viewed European civilization as decadent and corrupt. “高贵的野蛮人”这一概念是为了迎合十八世纪的文人而提出的，他们将欧洲视作一支正在堕落和腐化的文明。
stereotype.mean: n. 成见，老套的理念： a conventional, formulaic, and oversimplified conception, opinion, or image

macabre.example: adj. 恐怖的: Impressively, Plants vs. Zombies presented a supposedly macabre themeinsuch anenjoyableway. 令人难忘的是，《植物大战僵尸》将一个本应该十分恐怖的主题用一种如此欢乐的方式呈现出来
macabre.mean: adj. 恐怖的： suggesting the horror of death and decay; gruesome

flatter.example:
vt. 拍马屁，奉承，讨好: Friends who flatter you to your face are not true friends. 当面拍你马屁的朋友都不是真正的朋友
vt. 自我感觉良好: Don't flatter yourself that no one has ever thought of that idea before.不要自欺欺人地认为别人没有考虑过那个想法
vt. 使显得更漂亮: Orange flatters those with golden skin tones. 橙色让黄肤色的人显得更漂亮
flatter.mean:
vt. 拍马屁，奉承，讨好： to praise excessively especially from motives of self-interest
vt. 自我感觉良好： to think highly of (oneself)
vt. 使显得更漂亮： to show off becomingly or advantageously

accost.example: vt. 以挑衅的形式搭讪: accosted by three gang members 被三个混混搭讪
accost.mean: vt. 以挑衅的形式搭讪： to approach and speak to often in a challenging or aggressive way

rile.example: vt. 刺激，惹怒: The new work schedules riled the employees. 新的工作时间表激怒了员工
rile.mean: vt. 刺激，惹怒： to make agitated and angry

smarmy.example: adj. 虚情假意的，过分恭维的: He is slightly smarmy and eager to impress. 他有点虚伪，急于给人留下印象。
smarmy.mean: adj. 虚情假意的，过分恭维的： hypocritically, complacently, or effusively earnest

animate.example:
adj. 活的: The lecture was about ancient worship of animate and inanimate objects. 演讲是关于对生命体和非生命体的古代崇拜。
adj. 有活力的: Animate dance will get the blood pumping. 有活力的舞蹈会让人热血沸腾。
v. 使有活力，支持: The writer's humor animates the novel. 作者的幽默使小说富有生命力。
v. 使行动，驱使: a criminal animated by greed 一个受贪婪驱使的罪犯
v. 使活灵活现，使栩栩如生:
animate.mean:
adj. 活的：having or showing life
adj. 有活力的：having much high-spirited energy and movement
v. 使有活力，支持：to give spirit and support to
v. 使行动，驱使：to move to action
v. 使活灵活现，使栩栩如生：to make or design in such a way as to create apparently spontaneous lifelike movement

archetype.example:
n.典范，榜样: an archetype of the successful entrepreneur 成功企业家的典范
n.先驱，鼻祖: The abacus is sometimes cited as the archetype of the modern digital calculator 算盘是现代计算器的鼻祖
n. 原型: “‘Frankenstein’... ‘Dracula’... ‘Dr. Jekyll and Mr. Hyde’... the archetypes that have influenced all subsequent horror stories”(New York Times) “‘弗兰肯斯坦’…‘德秋拉’…‘杰基尔博士和海德先生’影响了所有继之而来的恐怖故事的原型”(纽约时报)
archetype.mean:
n.典范，榜样：an ideal example of a type
n.先驱，鼻祖：something belonging to an earlier time from which something else was later developed
n. 原型：something from which copies are made

creep.example:
vi./n.缓慢地行进: creeping through the crowd 在人潮中缓慢前行
vi.匍匐前进: The kitten crept silently across the floor before suddenly pouncing on the mouse. 小猫静静地匍匐穿过地板，然后突然向老鼠发起猛扑
creep.mean:
vi./n.缓慢地行进： to go very slowly
vi.匍匐前进：to move slowly with the body close to the ground

prowess.example: n. 英勇，勇敢: his prowess on the football field 他在球场上过人的勇气
prowess.mean: n. 英勇，勇敢： superior strength, courage, or daring, especially in battle

cede.example: vt. （根据条约）放弃，割让: cede the island to America 把岛屿割让给了美国
cede.mean: vt. （根据条约）放弃，割让： to surrender possession of, especially by treaty

matriculate.example: vt. 入学，录取: matriculate at Princeton 在普林斯顿入学
matriculate.mean: vt. 入学，录取： to admit or be admitted into a group, especially a college or university.

humor.example:
n. 幽默，令人发笑的事物: The speech is full of wit and humor. 演讲妙趣横生
v. 迎合，迁就: Parents need to know how to humor kids when they are upset. 父母需要知道当孩子烦躁的时候怎么哄孩子
humor.mean:
n. 幽默，令人发笑的事物： something that is or is designed to be comical or amusing
v. 迎合，迁就： to comply with the wishes or ideas of

ponderable.example: adj. 有价值的，值得考虑的: Climate change has exerted a ponderable influence on world politics. 气候变化对世界政局有着不容忽视的影响。
ponderable.mean: adj. 有价值的，值得考虑的： considerable enough to be weighed or assessed

phenomenal.example: adj. 不寻常的，非凡的: the phenomenal growth that the suburb has experienced over the last decade 过去几十年间郊区所经历的令人称奇的快速发展
phenomenal.mean: adj. 不寻常的，非凡的： being out of the ordinary;extraordinary; outstanding
