flounder.example: vi. 笨拙地行动，挣扎: flounder through the desert 步履蹒跚地穿越沙漠
flounder.mean: vi. 笨拙地行动，挣扎： to proceed or act clumsily or ineffectually

germinate.example:
vi. 发芽: Some seed varieties germinate very quickly. 有一些种子的变异体能够迅速发芽。
vi. 出现: A truly marvelous proof of this theorem germinated in his mind. 这个定理的一种绝妙证明方法浮现在他的脑海之中。
germinate.mean:
vi. 发芽： to begin to grow
vi. 出现： to come into being

palatable.example: adj. 感到愉悦满足的: I always associate the palatable aroma of roasting turkey with Thanksgiving. 我总是把香喷喷的烤火鸡的味道和感恩节联系起来
palatable.mean: adj. 感到愉悦满足的： giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses

ironclad.example: adj. 非常坚固的，坚不可摧的: pride on their ironclad fleet 对他们坚不可摧的舰队感到自豪
ironclad.mean: adj. 非常坚固的，坚不可摧的： so firm or secure as to be unbreakable

jejune.example:
adj. 无趣乏味的: jejune lectures 无聊的讲座
adj. 幼稚的: an essay filled with jejune, simplistic opinions about international politics 充满着有关国际政治的幼稚、简单看法的文章
jejune.mean:
adj. 无趣乏味的： not interesting; dull
adj. 幼稚的： having or showing the annoying qualities (as silliness) associated with children

peel.example:
vt. 剥去: She can peel apples with lightning speed. 她能以飞快的速度削苹果。
vi. 脱去（衣服等）: peeled off the wet clothes 脱去湿衣服
peel.mean:
vt. 剥去： to strip off an outer layer of
vi. 脱去（衣服等）： to take off one's clothes

elucidate.example: v. 阐明: elucidate an abstruse equation in quantum mechanics 阐明一个深奥难懂的量子力学方程
elucidate.mean: v. 阐明： to make lucid especially by explanation or analysis

prologue.example: n. 序言: the burglary, which he committed while still a teen, was but a prologue to a wasted life of crime 他青少年时犯过的入室抢劫拉开了他偷盗生涯的序幕
prologue.mean: n. 序言： the preface or introduction to a literary work

enunciate.example:
vi. 清晰地说: enunciate your words, and then you won't have to repeat them so often 把话说清楚，你就不用经常重复了
v. 公开宣布，宣称: today the President enunciated a new foreign policy 总统在今天宣布了一项新的对外政策
enunciate.mean:
vi. 清晰地说： to utter articulate sounds
v. 公开宣布，宣称： to make known openly or publicly

squeamish.example: adj. 恶心的，晕船的: the rolling of the ship made the young sailor squeamish 摇晃的船只让年轻的水手感到恶心
squeamish.mean: adj. 恶心的，晕船的： affected with nausea

yoke.example: v. 连接: yoked several ideas together to propose a novel theory 将几个想法结合起来提出一个全新的理论
yoke.mean: v. 连接： to become joined or linked

peer.example:
n. 同等地位的人，同辈: stand out among peers 在同辈当中很出众
v. 好奇地凝视: peer at the variety of marine life in the aquarium's huge tank 好奇地注视着巨大水族箱中丰富多样的海洋生物
peer.mean:
n. 同等地位的人，同辈： a person who has equal standing with others
v. 好奇地凝视： to look narrowly or curiously;

peep.example:
n. 一瞥: take a peep at the new neighbors偷偷瞄了我们的新邻居一眼
n. 轻声: I haven't heard a peep out of the children for an hour.我已经一个小时没听到孩子们的声音了
peep.mean:
n. 一瞥： a brief and sometimes furtive look
n. 轻声： a slight sound or utterance

resplendent.example: adj. 华丽辉煌的: Geography teacher showed us a picture of the resplendent aurora borealis. 地理老师给我们展示了一张壮丽的北极光的照片。
resplendent.mean: adj. 华丽辉煌的： shining brilliantly

chaff.example: v. 开玩笑: a coworker who likes to chaff at others' expense, and this often results in hurt feelings 这个同事喜欢开别人玩笑，导致伤害他人感情
chaff.mean: v. 开玩笑： to make jokes

impenetrable.example:
adj. 不可渗透的，不可穿透的: The ancient temple was surrounded by vast stretches of impenetrable jungle. 包围着古老的神庙的是密不透风的灌木丛
adj. 难以理解的: The textbook's language is completely impenetrable, at least to me. 至少在我看来，这个教材就是天书
impenetrable.mean:
adj. 不可渗透的，不可穿透的： impossible to get through or into
adj. 难以理解的： incapable of being comprehended

conceal.example: v. 隐藏，隐瞒: Drunkenness reveal what soberness conceal. 酒后吐真言
conceal.mean: v. 隐藏，隐瞒：to prevent disclosure or recognition of

anomalous.example:
adj. 不普通的，不平常的 being out of the ordinary
: He is in an anomalous position as the only part-time teacher in XDF. 他和别人不一样的是，他是XDF唯一的兼职老师。
adj. 反常的，不正常的departing from some accepted standard of what is normal
: an anomalous burst of anger from this usually easygoing person 一个随和的人的一反常态的暴怒
anomalous.mean:
adj. 不普通的，不平常的 being out of the ordinary
adj. 反常的，不正常的departing from some accepted standard of what is normal

sycophant.example: n. 马屁精: When her career was riding high, the self-deluded actress often mistook sycophants for true friends. 当她的事业如日中天之时，该演员总是把一些马屁精误以为是真朋友。
sycophant.mean: n. 马屁精： a servile self-seeking flatterer

blithe.example:
adj. 愉快高兴的: Everyone loved her for her blithe spirit. 所有人都喜欢她开朗的性格
adj. 无忧无虑的: He has a blithe attitude about ever having to earn a living because he knows there's a trust fund in his future. 他对生活无忧无虑，因为他知道他的未来有信托基金可以倚靠
blithe.mean:
adj. 愉快高兴的： of a happy lighthearted character or disposition
adj. 无忧无虑的： having or showing freedom from worries or troubles

inveigh.example: vi. 激烈抗议，表示强烈不满: inveighed against the bank industry 对银行业表示强烈不满
inveigh.mean: vi. 激烈抗议，表示强烈不满： to protest or complain bitterly or vehemently

sluggard.example: n. 懒人: The teacher tried to wake up the sluggards who were still sleeping at that late hour. 老师尝试去叫醒那些还在睡觉的懒鬼们。
sluggard.mean: n. 懒人： an habitually lazy person

meddle.example: vi. 干涉，管闲事: Please stop meddling in my marriage. 请不要来干涉我的婚姻
meddle.mean: vi. 干涉，管闲事： to intrude into other people's affairs or business; interfere

nerve.example:
n. （坚强的）意志，勇气: nerves of steel 钢铁般的意志
vt. 给予勇气，鼓励: needs to nerve himself for the big game tomorrow 需要为明天的大赛给自己加油鼓劲
nerve.mean:
n. （坚强的）意志，勇气： power of endurance or control; strength of mind to carry on in spite of danger
vt. 给予勇气，鼓励： to give strength or courage to

abet.example: v. 帮助，怂恿: aid and abet (法律)协助教唆
abet.mean:
v. 帮助，怂恿： to assist or support in the achievement of a purpose
v. 鼓励： to actively encourage (as an activity or plan)

motivate.example: vt. 刺激，激发: questions that excite and motivate youth 激发青年人的问题
motivate.mean: vt. 刺激，激发： to provide with an incentive; move to action

infraction.example: n. 违背，违犯: Speeding is only a minor infraction, but vehicular homicide is a serious felony. 超速只是小的违章，但是用机动车故意杀人就是重罪了。
infraction.mean: n. 违背，违犯： a failure to uphold the requirements of law, duty, or obligation

sparing.example:
adj. 节俭的，节约的: The sparing couple are trying to save up enough for a house. 节俭的夫妻希望能够攒钱买套房。
adj. 不足的，缺乏的: Unfortunately, the explanation of the health insurance plan was somewhat sparing on details. 不幸的是，健康保险上的说明似乎不够详细。‖The map is sparing of information. 这张地图的信息量太少了。
sparing.mean:
adj. 节俭的，节约的： marked by or practicing careful restraint (as in the use of resources)
adj. 不足的，缺乏的： less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable

bound.example:
n. 界限: The language in the novel really is beyond the bounds of decency. 这本小说的语言实在太不得体了
vt. 给…设置限制: The country is bounded by river. 这个国家的领土以河水为界
adj. 投入的，坚定的: I am bound and determined to write a novel before I turn 30. 我下定决心在30岁之前要写本小说
bound.mean:
n. 界限： a real or imaginary point beyond which a person or thing cannot go
vt. 给…设置限制： to set limits or bounds to
adj. 投入的，坚定的：fully committed to achieving a goal

accommodate.example:
v. 提供所需（例如服务、借贷、寄宿）: This cruise ship was big enough to accommodate over 600 people. 该游轮可以为超过600人提供食宿。
v. 改变以适应新情况、新场景: accommodated the lectern to the height of the guest speaker 将讲台的高度调节得适合讲演者
v. 使和谐: The idea that the United States could harmoniously accommodate all was a fiction. 认为美国能够和谐一切就是幻想。
accommodate.mean:
v. 提供所需（例如服务、借贷、寄宿）： to provide with something desired, needed, or suited (as a helpful service, a loan, or lodgings)
v. 改变以适应新情况、新场景： to change (something) so as to make it suitable for a new use or situation
v. 使和谐： to bring to a state free of conflicts, inconsistencies, or differences

sop.example:
n. 安慰物: to provide with the salary raise as a sop 提高工资作为安慰
n. 贿赂，回扣: As a sop to the teachers' union for supporting his reelection campaign, the mayor promised to push for the abolition of the residency requirement. 市长答应推动废除获得绿卡的限制条件，以此作为换取选举中教师联盟支持的条件。
vt. 浸湿，湿透: My book fell in the swimming pool and was thoroughly sopped before I could fish it out. 我的书掉进了游泳池，在我把它捞出来之前已经彻底湿透了。
sop.mean:
n. 安慰物： something yielded to placate or soothe
n. 贿赂，回扣： something given or promised in order to improperly influence a person's conduct or decision
vt. 浸湿，湿透： to wet thoroughly

formidable.example:
adj. 令人害怕的: a nation that possesses formidable nuclear deterrence 一个拥有可怕核威慑力量的国家
adj. 艰难的: running a marathon is a formidable undertaking 跑马拉松是个困难的任务‖They have recently made a formidable decision. 他们最近做出了一个艰难的决定
formidable.mean:
adj. 令人害怕的： causing fear, dread, or apprehension
adj. 艰难的： requiring considerable physical or mental effort

emigrate.example: vi. 移民，移居海外: have to emigrate to the United States due to political persecution 不得不因政治迫害而移民美国
emigrate.mean: vi. 移民，移居海外： to leave one's place of residence or country to live elsewhere

munificent.example: adj. 慷慨的: The university received a munificent foundation grant. 大学收到了一笔慷慨的基金资助
munificent.mean: adj. 慷慨的： very liberal in giving

squander.example:
vt. 使分散: A single blast of the shotgun squandered the herd of deer. 猎枪的一声枪响让鹿群四处逃窜。
vt. 浪费: He squandered his inheritance on women and gambling. 他把他继承的遗产浪费在女人和赌博上。
squander.mean:
vt. 使分散： to cause (members of a group) to move widely apart
vt. 浪费： to spend wastefully or extravagantly

wan.example: adj. 苍白的，病态的: She looks a little wan after all that tiring work. 在完成那些繁重的工作之后她看起来有些虚弱。
wan.mean: adj. 苍白的，病态的： suggestive of poor health

slipshod.example: adj. 粗心的，随意的: a slipshod piece of research 一项随意的研究‖The hotel had always been run in a slipshod way. 酒店总是在以一种随意的状态运营。
slipshod.mean: adj. 粗心的，随意的： marked by carelessness or indifference to exactness, precision, and accuracy

wag.example:
n. 幽默诙谐的人: Some wag wrote a droll satire on the scandal. 一些有才的人就丑闻写了一个搞怪的讽刺。
vt. 摆动: The dog wagged its tail. 狗摆动着它的尾巴。
wag.mean:
n. 幽默诙谐的人： a humorous or droll person
vt. 摆动： to move to and fro or up and down especially with quick jerky motions

segment.example: vt./n. 分割，部分: I think I lost one segment of this model kit. 这套模型的一个零件我找不到了。
segment.mean: vt./n. 分割，部分： to separate into segments

indispensable.example: adj. 必不可少的，不可或缺的: She was becoming indispensible to him. 对他而言她逐渐变得不可替代
indispensable.mean: adj. 必不可少的，不可或缺的： impossible to do without

illustrious.example: adj. 著名的，杰出的: the most illustrious scientists of the century 本世纪最为杰出的科学家
illustrious.mean: adj. 著名的，杰出的： well known and very distinguished

corporeal.example: adj. 肉体的: corporeal suffering 肉体上的折磨
corporeal.mean:
adj. 肉体的： not spiritual
adj. 有形的，实体的： not immaterial or intangible

saunter.example: vi. 闲逛，漫步: sauntered slowly down the street 在街上闲逛
saunter.mean: vi. 闲逛，漫步： to travel by foot for exercise or pleasure

lampoon.example: n讽刺: a lampoon of the movie business at the time 对当时电影产业的一种讽刺
lampoon.mean: n讽刺： a harsh satire usually directed against an individual

counterproductive.example: adj. 反效果的，阻碍预期目标的: Violence as a means to achieve an end is counterproductive. (W. E. Brock) 用暴力来实现目标往往是事与愿违的。——W. E. 布洛克‖His uncontrollable anger is very counterproductive to his attempt at saving his marriage. 他无法自控的愤怒只会对他拯救婚姻的企图起反作用。
counterproductive.mean: adj. 反效果的，阻碍预期目标的： not producing or tending to hinder the attainment of a desired goal

overshadow.example:
vt. 使变黯淡: Large trees overshadow the yard and darken the house for much of the day. 大树为院子遮挡了阳光，并使屋子里一天之中的大多数时候都很昏暗。‖Her mother's illness overshadowed her childhood. 她母亲的疾病让她的童年缺乏亮色。
vt. （在重要性上）超越，超过: The forward’s outstanding performance should not overshadow the achievements of the rest of the team. 其他队员的贡献不应该因前锋的精彩表现而被忽略。
overshadow.mean:
vt. 使变黯淡： to make dark, dim, or indistinct
vt. （在重要性上）超越，超过： to exceed in importance

unpretentious.example:
adj. 低调的，谦逊的: an unpretentious virtuoso 一位谦虚的大师
adj. 坦诚的，自然的: a simple and unpretentious account about growing up in the rural South 一段简单坦率的关于在南部乡村成长经历的叙述
unpretentious.mean:
adj. 低调的，谦逊的： lacking pretension or affectation; modest
adj. 坦诚的，自然的： free from any intent to deceive or impress others

lurid.example:
adj. 恐怖的，令人反感的: We quickly drove past the lurid scene of the crash. 我们迅速驶过了可怕的车祸现场。
adj. 面色苍白的，病态的: The doctor was alarmed by the patient's lurid complexion. 病人惨白的面色给医生敲响了警钟。
lurid.mean:
adj. 恐怖的，令人反感的： causing horror or revulsion
adj. 面色苍白的，病态的： wan and ghastly pale in appearance

intoxicant.mean: n. 使人陶醉的东西（尤指酒精饮料）： an agent that intoxicates, especially an alcoholic beverage

abysmal.example:
adj. 极低的或极可怜的: abysmal living conditions 极可怜的生活条件
adj. （程度）很深的、极端的: abysmal ignorance 极端的无知；an abysmal cliff 深不见底的悬崖
abysmal.mean:
adj. 极低的或极可怜的： immeasurably low or wretched
adj. （程度）很深的、极端的： immeasurably great

magnificent.example: adj. 壮丽的: a magnificent cathedral 宏伟壮观的大教堂
magnificent.mean: adj. 壮丽的： strikingly beautiful or impressive

provisory.example: adj. 有附带条件的，临时的: a provisory permit to block off the street while movie scenes were being shot 一个同意在电影拍摄期间封锁道路的临时许可
provisory.mean: adj. 有附带条件的，临时的： depending on a proviso; conditional; serving in a position for the time being

vitality.example: n. 活力，生命力: Her vitality seemed to spread to everyone around her. 她的活力似乎能影响身边的每一个人
vitality.mean: n. 活力，生命力： physical or mental vigor especially when highly developed

heinous.example: adj. 可憎的，十恶不赦的: a heinous crime 十恶不赦的罪行
heinous.mean: adj. 可憎的，十恶不赦的： hatefully or shockingly evil, abominable

squalid.example:
adj. 污秽的，肮脏的: The migrants have been living in squalid conditions. 移民们一直居住在肮脏的条件下。
adj. 道德败坏的: the squalid atmosphere of intrigue and betrayal 充满了阴谋与背叛的不正之风
squalid.mean:
adj. 污秽的，肮脏的： dirty and wretched
adj. 道德败坏的： morally repulsive

restive.example:
adj. 急躁的，忧虑的: I spent a restive night worrying about the next day's exam. 我度过了忧虑的一晚，担心明天的考试。
adj. 难以管束的: Tired soldiers grew restive. 疲惫的士兵变得越来越难以管理。
restive.mean:
adj. 急躁的，忧虑的： marked by impatience or uneasiness
adj. 难以管束的： stubbornly resisting control

humiliate.example: vt. 羞辱，使丧失尊严: No student feels humiliated for not having the “right” clothes because everyone is wearing a school uniform. 因为所有学生都统一穿着学校的校服，所以没有人会因为“不正确”的衣着而感觉尊严扫地。‖He humiliated me in front of my parents and I swear to retaliate. 他在我的父母面前让我难堪，我发誓要报复他。
humiliate.mean: vt. 羞辱，使丧失尊严： to reduce to a lower position in one’s own eyes or others’ eyes

absent.example:
adj. 未出现的，缺乏的: The city's usual stir of activity was conspicuously absent due to the report of an escaped lion from the zoo. 一则动物园狮子逃跑的消息让这座城市缺少往日的繁华。
adj. 不专心的，走神的: seemed absent because he nodded but didn’t say anything 他只点了点头但没说话，看起来像是走神了
absent.mean:
adj. 未出现的，缺乏的： not present, attending or existing
adj. 不专心的，走神的： lost in thought

vagary.example: n. 不可预测的思想或行为: Recently he had been prone to strange vagaries. 最近他逐渐变得行为古怪起来。
vagary.mean: n. 不可预测的思想或行为： an erratic, unpredictable, or extravagant manifestation, action, or notion

invincible.example: adj. 不可战胜的，不可超越的: The soccer team proved to be invincible. 这支球队证明了自己是不可战胜的
invincible.mean: adj. 不可战胜的，不可超越的： incapable of being conquered, overcome, or subdued

bellwether.example: n. 领导者，带头人: Paris is a bellwether of the fashion industry. 巴黎是一座引领时尚潮流的都市
bellwether.mean: n. 领导者，带头人： one that takes the lead or initiative

bargain.example:
n. 协议: They made a bargain that one would help the other next week. 他们达成了一项协议：下周其中一人将帮助另外一人
vi. 讨价还价: bargain over the price 讨价还价
bargain.mean:
n. 协议： an agreement between parties settling what each gives or receives in a transaction
vi. 讨价还价： to negotiate over the terms of a purchase

encumber.example:
v. 阻碍；妨碍: Negotiation between the two parties were encumbered by a lack of trust 两党间的谈判因缺乏信任而受到阻碍
v. 增添负担: Don't encumber your pack animal so much that it can hardly move. 别让你的牲畜驮这么多东西，它都走不动了
encumber.mean:
v. 阻碍；妨碍： to impede or hamper the function or activity of
v. 增添负担： to place a weight or burden on

adore.example:
vt. 喜爱，感到愉悦: I adore those earrings. 我相中那对耳环了。
vt. 宠爱: adored his wife 宠爱他的妻子
adore.mean:
vt. 喜爱，感到愉悦： to take pleasure in
vt. 宠爱： to feel passion, devotion, or tenderness for

hegemony.example: n. 霸权，统治权: battled for hegemony in Asia 争夺在亚洲地区的霸权地位
hegemony.mean: n. 霸权，统治权： preponderant influence or authority over others

stouthearted.example: adj. 勇敢的: a stouthearted army officer who risked his life to save his men 为了拯救部下宁愿牺牲自己的勇敢军官
stouthearted.mean: adj. 勇敢的： having a stout heart or spirit

pontificate.example: vi. 傲慢地做或说: pontificate to show a sense of superiority 傲慢地说以显示高人一等的优越感
pontificate.mean: vi. 傲慢地做或说：to speak or express opinions in a pompous or dogmatic way

pall.example: vi. 失去兴趣: His humor began to pall on us. 他的幽默开始使我们生腻了。
pall.mean: vi. 失去兴趣： to lose in interest or attraction

certitude.example: n. 确信无疑: I believes with certitude that he is the best candidate for the job. 我确信他是这项工作的最佳人选。
certitude.mean: n. 确信无疑： the state of being or feeling certain

liberal.example:
adj. 思想前卫的: parents who take a very liberal attitude toward letting their children stay out late 思想开放，同意让他们的小孩晚归的家长们
adj. 慷慨的，大方的: a doctor who has been very liberal in dispensing low-cost care to patients who could not otherwise afford it 一个慷慨的医生，愿意帮助无法支付低额药费的病人
liberal.mean:
adj. 思想前卫的： not bound by traditional ways or beliefs
adj. 慷慨的，大方的： marked by generosity

fury.example: n. 暴怒: The gods unleashed their fury on the offending mortal. 诸神将怒火降在了对那些对神明不敬的凡人身上
fury.mean: n. 暴怒： intense, disordered, and often destructive rage

covert.example:
adj. 隐蔽的，秘密的: covert alliance 秘密联盟
n. 隐秘掩护所: set up a covert from which to watch wildlife without being detected 设立了一个隐蔽的野生动物观测点
covert.mean:
adj. 隐蔽的，秘密的： not openly shown, engaged in, or avowed
n. 隐秘掩护所： a place where a person goes to hide or to avoid others

abstract.example:
vt. 做总结，概括: abstracted the 135-page report in three short paragraphs 将一份135页的报告概括为三段话
vt. 使分心: personal problems abstracted him 私人问题让他分心
abstract.mean:
vt. 做总结，概括： to make an abstract of，summarize
vt. 使分心： to draw away the attention of

sidestep.example: vt. （通过逃避而）不遵守: The eager enlistee sidestepped the regulations by lying about his age. 急切的应募者通过谎报自己的年龄躲过了规定的限制。
sidestep.mean: vt. （通过逃避而）不遵守： to avoid having to comply with (something) especially through cleverness

molt.example: vi. 脱（羽、皮等）: Snakes molt as they grow, shedding the old skin and growing a larger new skin. 随着年龄的增长，蛇会脱去老皮，长出新皮
molt.mean: vi. 脱（羽、皮等）： to shed hair, feathers, shell, horns, or an outer layer periodically

wretched.example:
adj. 极差的: the wretched conditions of the refugee camp 难民营极恶劣的条件
adj. 沮丧的: She was wretched for weeks after breaking up with her boyfriend. 她与男友分手后郁闷了几个星期。
wretched.mean:
adj. 极差的： very poor in quality or ability
adj. 沮丧的： deeply afflicted, dejected, or distressed in body or mind

effervesce.example:
vi. 冒泡: effervescing with bubbles 冒气泡
vi. 兴奋，热情洋溢: effervescing over the news of victory 因胜利的消息而兴奋
effervesce.mean:
vi. 冒泡： to bubble, hiss, and foam as gas escapes
vi. 兴奋，热情洋溢： to show high spirits or animation

scrawl.example: vt. 乱涂，潦草地写: scrawled a quick note, stuck it in their mailbox, and hurried off 草草写了张便条，塞进他们的信箱然后匆匆跑了
scrawl.mean: vt. 乱涂，潦草地写： to write or draw awkwardly, hastily, or carelessly

apoplectic.example:
adj. 极度愤怒的: He became apoplectic about wasteful government spending. 他对于政府的浪费开销变得怒不可遏。
adj. 极度愤怒的: The coach was so apoplectic when the player missed the free throw that he threw his clipboard onto the court. 教练对球员罚篮不进非常气愤以至于把战术板扔到了球场上。
apoplectic.mean: adj. 极度愤怒的：extremely angry; furious

pedagogue.example: n. 教育者，老师: a boring pedagogue who is called “PPT reader” 一个被戏称为“幻灯片朗读机”的无聊老师
pedagogue.mean: n. 教育者，老师： a person whose occupation is to give formal instruction in a school

mediocre.example: adj. 平庸的，质量中等偏下的: Without a desire for success, life is at best mediocre. 没有对成功的强烈渴望，人生最多也就是碌碌无为
mediocre.mean: adj. 平庸的，质量中等偏下的： moderate to inferior in quality; ordinary

dent.example:
n. 凹陷，凹痕: a dent in the side of a car 汽车侧面一处凹陷
v. （数量、程度上）变小，变弱: hopefully this vacation won't dent our bank account too much 但愿这次旅行不会让我们银行存款缩水太多
dent.mean:
n. 凹陷，凹痕： a depression in a surface made by pressure or a blow
v. （数量、程度上）变小，变弱： to make smaller in amount, volume, or extent

brandish.example: vt. （带有威胁性地）挥舞: I could see that the suspect was brandishing a knife and was in no way inclined to surrender. 我可以看到嫌犯在挥舞着一把刀，完全没有要投降的倾向。
brandish.mean: vt. （带有威胁性地）挥舞： to shake or wave (as a weapon) menacingly

check.example:
vt. 突然停止，阻止: a tree finally checked the skidding car 一辆滑行的车终于被大树停止了
vt. 同意，一致: their story of what happened checks with the report of the eyewitness 他们的说法和目击者的供词一致
check.mean:
vt. 突然停止，阻止： to arrest the motion of abruptly
vt. 同意，一致： to be in agreement on every point

graft.example: vt. 移植，移接: The top layer of skin has to be grafted onto the burns. 顶层的皮肤需要被移植到烧伤的伤口上。‖graft old traditions onto the new ones 把老传统移植到新的习俗之上
graft.mean: vt. 移植，移接： to implant (living tissue) surgically or as if surgically

redolent.example: adj. 芳香的: be redolent with the aroma of baking bread 充满了烤面包的香味
redolent.mean: adj. 芳香的： having or emitting fragrance

discriminate.example:
vt. 区分: discriminate different kinds of animals 区分不同的动物
vi. 歧视: The new law discriminated against lower-paid workers. 这条新法律歧视低工资的工人。
discriminate.mean:
vt. 区分： to perceive the distinguishing features of; recognize as distinct
vi. 歧视： to make a difference in treatment or favor on a basis other than individual merit

canonize.example:
vt. 过分宠爱，过分崇拜: a singing star so canonized by his fans that they refuse to believe anything bad about him 一个受到粉丝疯狂追捧的歌星，他们不会相信任何关于他的负面新闻
vt. 使…崇高，使…神圣: Some movie buffs canonized David Fincher as today’s most preeminent director. 一些影迷把大卫?芬奇视作是当今世界上最为出色的导演。
canonize.mean:
vt. 过分宠爱，过分崇拜： to love or admire too much
vt. 使…崇高，使…神圣： to assign a high status or value to

rabid.example: adj. 狂热的，不冷静的: soccer fans whose rabid enthusiasm makes them go berserk when their team wins 不冷静的粉丝们在球队获胜以后变得很狂暴
rabid.mean: adj. 狂热的，不冷静的： extremely zealous or enthusiastic; fanatical

ambrosial.example: adj. （食物或者气味）特别美味的: The ambrosial aroma of the roast stimulated our appetites. 烤肉的美味香气刺激了我们的食欲。
ambrosial.mean: adj. （食物或者气味）特别美味的：something extremely pleasing to taste or smell

willful.example:
adj. 固执的，倔强的: Finally the parents sought professional counseling for the willful child. 最终家长不得不为倔强的小孩寻求专业咨询。
adj. 故意的: a willful attempt to cheat her siblings out of their rightful inheritance 一个想将继承权从她的姊妹手里骗过来的故意企图
willful.mean:
adj. 固执的，倔强的： obstinately and often perversely self-willed
adj. 故意的： done deliberately

bumptious.example: adj. 专横傲慢的，自以为是的: a bumptious young man whose family wealth gave him a sense of entitlement 一个傲慢的富二代 || be bumptious over one’s inferiors 对下级态度傲慢
bumptious.mean: adj. 专横傲慢的，自以为是的： having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude

desecrate.example: vt. 亵渎，玷污: desecrate the shrine 亵渎圣地
desecrate.mean: vt. 亵渎，玷污： to treat (a sacred place or object) shamefully or with great disrespect

congeal.example: v.凝固，固化: The blood had started to congeal. 血液开始凝结了
congeal.mean: v.凝固，固化： to change from a fluid to a solid state by or as if by cold

indigent.example: adj. 贫穷的: indigent people who require some outside assistance 需要外来援助的贫苦人民
indigent.mean: adj. 贫穷的： lacking money or material possessions

evasive.example: adj. 难以发现、捕捉、分离的；含糊其词的: an evasive statement 模棱两可的陈述
evasive.mean: adj. 难以发现、捕捉、分离的；含糊其词的： hard to find, capture, or isolate; equivocal

superfluous.example: adj. 多余的，过剩的: a complicated algorithm that could filter all superfluous information 一个能滤除所有的多余信息的复杂算法
superfluous.mean: adj. 多余的，过剩的： exceeding what is sufficient or necessary

shrink.example:
v. 在数量或价值方面变低；减小: His savings quickly shrank. 他的存款急剧减少。
v. 本能性地退却（如因遇到使人惊恐的某物）；退缩: shrinking back from the approaching flames 对着燃烧的火焰望而却步
v. 表示出不情愿；犹豫: shrink from making such a sacrifice 对做出这样的牺牲犹豫不决
shrink.mean:
v. 在数量或价值方面变低；减小： to become reduced in amount or value; dwindle:
v. 本能性地退却（如因遇到使人惊恐的某物）；退缩： to draw back instinctively, as from something alarming; recoil
v. 表示出不情愿；犹豫： to show reluctance; hesitate:

pseudonym.example: n. 假名，笔名: Mark Twain is the pseudonym of the American writer Samuel L. Clemens. 马克?吐温是美国作家塞缪尔?L?克莱蒙斯的笔名。
pseudonym.mean: n. 假名，笔名： a fictitious name

nuance.example: n. 细微的差异: a poem of little depth and nuance 一首没有什么深度、没有什么辨识度的诗
nuance.mean: n. 细微的差异： a subtle distinction or variation

sling.example: vi. 投掷: slinging stones at the checkpoint 朝着检查站扔石头
sling.mean: vi. 投掷： to send through the air especially with a quick forward motion of the arm

faction.example: n. 派系: affiliated with one faction 附属于某个党派‖North-Ocean Faction 北洋派
faction.mean: n. 派系： a party or group (as within a government) that is often contentious or self-seeking

palmy.example: adj. 繁荣的: the palmy days of the British drama 英国戏剧的繁荣时期
palmy.mean: adj. 繁荣的： marked by prosperity

infatuate.example: vt. 使迷恋: a na?ve girl infatuated by cajolery 被甜言蜜语冲昏头脑的天真女孩
infatuate.mean: vt. 使迷恋： to inspire with unreasoning love or attachment

assiduous.example:
adj. 勤勉的，专心仔细的: tended his garden with assiduous attention 专心仔细地照看他的花园
adj. 勤勉的，专心仔细的: The project required some assiduous planning. 项目需要细心的规划。
assiduous.mean: adj. 勤勉的，专心仔细的：marked by careful unremitting attention or persistent application; busy

trepidation.example: n. 恐惧，战栗: trepidation about starting a new career 对开创一项新事业而感到恐惧
trepidation.mean: n. 恐惧，战栗： the emotion experienced in the presence or threat of danger; apprehension

comely.example: n. 漂亮的，吸引人的: a comely young woman 年轻美丽的女人
comely.mean: n. 漂亮的，吸引人的：pleasing and wholesome in appearance; attractive

warp.example:
vt. 扭曲，变形: The heat caused the wood to warp. 高温使得木头变形了。
vt. 曲解: The faulty English translation really warps the meaning of the original Chinese text. 错误的英语翻译曲解了中文的原意。
warp.mean:
vt. 使偏向： to turn from a correct or proper course
vt. 扭曲，变形： to twist (something) out of a natural or normal shape or condition
vt. 曲解： to change so much as to create a wrong impression or alter the meaning of

dappled.example:
adj. 有斑点的，花的: a dappled fawn 一只小花鹿
adj. 色彩斑斓的: a forest that was vibrant with the dappled foliage of autumn 充满秋天的生机、色彩斑斓的森林
dappled.mean:
adj. 有斑点的，花的： marked with small spots or contrasting with the background; mottled, spotted
adj. 色彩斑斓的： having blotches of two or more colors

discharge.example:
vt. 解雇: discharge a worker/soldier 开除员工/军籍
n. 不承担责任: a full discharge from responsibility for the accident 对事故完全不负有责任
v. 释放: discharged the prisoners upon the signing of the peace treaty 根据和约释放罪犯
discharge.mean:
vt. 解雇： to dismiss from employment
n. 不承担责任： a freeing from an obligation or responsibility
v. 释放： to set free (as from slavery or confinement)

immemorial.example: adj. 古老的: a modern version of an immemorial myth 一个远古传说的现代版本
immemorial.mean: adj. 古老的： dating or surviving from the distant past

faze.example: vt. 打扰，使尴尬: Nothing can faze her. 没有什么可以使她气馁
faze.mean: vt. 打扰，使尴尬： to disturb the composure of: disconcert, dismay

verve.example: n. 活力，热情: The instrumentalists played with skill and verve. 器乐表演者们有着高超的技巧与饱满的热情
verve.mean: n. 活力，热情： vitality, liveliness

exigent.example: adj. 紧急的: exigent circumstances 紧急情况
exigent.mean: adj. 紧急的： requiring immediate aid or action

withhold.example: vt. 扣压，不给予: withhold sensitive information 限制敏感信息的传播
withhold.mean: vt. 扣压，不给予： to refrain from granting, giving, or allowing

accolade.example: n. 同意，赞赏: won virtually every accolade that the film world has to offer 赢得了电影界几乎一致的赞赏
accolade.mean:
n. 同意，赞赏： an expression of approval
v. 赞扬： to praise or honor

nomad.example: adj./n. 游牧的；居无定所的人: after college she became quite the nomad, backpacking through Europe with no particular destination 大学毕业后她开始漂泊，漫无目的地游遍欧洲
nomad.mean: adj./n. 游牧的；居无定所的人： a member of a people who have no fixed residence but move from place to place usually seasonally and within a well-defined territory

meander.example: vi. 闲逛，漫步: meander along the river 沿着河闲逛‖vagabonds meandering through life 漂泊一生的浪子
meander.mean: vi. 闲逛，漫步： to move aimlessly and idly without fixed direction

precedent.example:
n. 先例，前例: There has not been any precedent so far. 到目前为止还没有先例。‖a landmark decision that set a legal precedent 在法律上首开先河的重大决议
adj. 先前的: Her violent behaviors may be explained by some precedent events in her troubled life. 她的暴力行径或许可以由她之前苦难生活中遭遇到的一些事件来解释。
precedent.mean:
n. 先例，前例： an earlier occurrence of something similar
adj. 先前的： prior in time, order, arrangement, or significance

revoke.example: vt. 撤回，宣告无效: to revoke a will 废除遗嘱
revoke.mean: vt. 撤回，宣告无效： to annul by recalling or taking back

patina.example:
n. 外表: a superficial patina of knowledge 表面肤浅的知识
n. （由内而外散发的）氛围，气场: Although the winery is brand-new, it has been constructed and decorated to give it a patina of old-world quaintness. 尽管酿酒厂是全新建造的，但它的构造和装饰都刻意营造出一种古色古香的奇异氛围
patina.mean:
n. 外表： a superficial covering or exterior
n. （由内而外散发的）氛围，气场： an appearance or aura that is derived from association, habit, or established character

machination.example: n. 诡计: The incredibly complicated machination to assassinate the president inevitably failed. 刺杀总统的诡计极其复杂，以至于不可避免地失败了。
machination.mean: n. 诡计： a scheming or crafty action or artful design intended to accomplish some usually evil end

peruse.example: v. 细读: perused the manuscript to check for grammatical errors 细读手稿以检查语法错误
peruse.mean: v. 细读： to read or examine, typically with great care

obviate.example: vt. 排除，使不必要: The new treatment obviates the need for surgery. 新的疗法使手术不再是必须的。
obviate.mean: vt. 排除，使不必要： to anticipate and prevent (as a situation) or make unnecessary (as an action)

umbrage.example: n. 不悦，生气: He would take umbrage at the slightest suggestion of disrespect. 哪怕是一点点的不敬也会让他不悦。
umbrage.mean: n. 不悦，生气： the feeling of being offended or resentful after a slight or indignity

supplement.example: n./v.增补，补充: recommends taking a vitamin C supplement to prevent colds 建议补充维生素C来预防感冒
supplement.mean: n./v.增补，补充： something that serves to complete or make up for a deficiency in something else

jarring.example:
adj. 刺耳的: the final chord of that song is too jarring for me 那首歌最后的合声部分太刺耳了
adj. 震惊的: the jarring news that major financial institutions were on the verge of collapse 有消息称主要的几个金融机构处于倒闭的边缘，真是让人震惊
jarring.mean:
adj. 刺耳的： harsh or discordant
adj. 震惊的： causing a strong emotional reaction because of unexpectedness

yokel.example: n. 乡下人，天真纯朴的人: a lame comedy about the misadventures of yokels in the big city 描述乡下人在大都市中遭遇的不幸的劣质喜剧
yokel.mean: n. 乡下人，天真纯朴的人： a naive or gullible inhabitant of a rural areaor small town

abundant.example: adj. 大量的: a abundant land 一片富饶的土地
abundant.mean: adj. 大量的： marked by great plenty (as of resources)

recluse.example:
n. 隐士: He was sick of cities and crowds, so he decided to go live by himself in the woods as a recluse. 他厌倦了城市和拥挤的人群，因此他决定像隐士一样遁隐山林。
adj. 隐居的，不爱社交的: a recluse poet who left a large amount of literature legacies 一个留下了大量文学遗产的隐居诗人‖My neihgbor is so recluse that I only see him about once a year. 我的邻居太神秘了，一般我一年只能见他一面。
recluse.mean:
n. 隐士： a person who lives away from others
adj. 隐居的，不爱社交的： marked by withdrawal from society

milk.example: vt. 榨取（财富、信息等）: milk the workers 从工人身上榨取好处‖The interrogators milked the arrested spy, but he was dry. 审问者想尽办法套被捕间谍的话，但是无功而返
milk.mean: vt. 榨取（财富、信息等）： to draw or coerce profit or advantage from illicitly or to an extreme degree

resourceful.example: adj. 有创造力的，机智的: a resourceful man capable of dealing with difficult situations 一个能巧妙解决困局的能人
resourceful.mean: adj. 有创造力的，机智的： able to act effectively or imaginatively, especially in difficult situations

discern.example:
vt. 识别，辨别差异: discern the motives 辨识出动机 || too young to discern between right and wrong 太年轻了而辨别不了是非
vt. 识别，辨别差异: a very discerning art critic 眼光敏锐有洞察力的艺术评论家 || She has a discerning palate. 她的味觉很敏锐。
vt. 识别，辨别差异: a discernible mark 可辨别的痕迹
discern.mean: vt. 识别，辨别差异：to perceive with the eyes or intellect; detect

devoted.example:
adj. 投入的，忠诚的: Good teachers are devoted to learning. 好老师会专心学习。
adj. 示爱的，恩爱的: a devoted couple will enjoy sharing their lives with one another. 一对恩爱的情侣喜欢和对方一起度过自己的人生。
devoted.mean:
adj. 投入的，忠诚的： characterized by loyalty and devotion
adj. 示爱的，恩爱的： feeling or showing love

hidebound.example: adj. 死板的，极度保守的: the hidebound innkeeper refused to see the need for a Web site 死板的酒馆老板坚决不肯装宽带
hidebound.mean: adj. 死板的，极度保守的： tending to favor established ideas, conditions, or institutions

varnish.example:
vt. 上清漆，使有光泽: Don't sit on that chair - I've just varnished it. 不要坐在那张椅子上——我刚刚上过漆。
vt. 粉饰（令人不悦的东西）: She tried to varnish her mistakes. 她试图掩盖她的失误。
varnish.mean:
vt. 上清漆，使有光泽： to give a smooth and glossy finish to
vt. 粉饰（令人不悦的东西）： to cover or conceal (as something unpleasant) with something that gives an attractive appearance

turbid.example: adj. 混浊的: a turbid stream 一条混浊的河
turbid.mean: adj. 混浊的： deficient in clarity or purity

religion.example:
n. 宗教，信仰: The Jewish religion has followers in many parts of the globe. 犹太教在全球范围内有大量信徒。
n. （对于宗教信仰的）忠诚，虔诚: Without his religion, he would not have been able to survive all the difficulties he has faced over the years. 如果不是他的虔诚，他是不可能渡过这些年来一直面临的难关的。
religion.mean:
n. 宗教，信仰： a body of beliefs and practices regarding the supernatural and the worship of one or more deities
n. （对于宗教信仰的）忠诚，虔诚： belief and trust in and loyalty to God

indolent.example: adj. 懒惰的: The sweltering afternoon made us indolent. 炎热的午后使我们懒散不愿行动
indolent.mean: adj. 懒惰的： averse to activity, effort, or movement

vex.example: vt. 使烦恼，使恼怒: vexed by her son's failure to clean his room 因为她儿子不清理房间而恼怒
vex.mean: vt. 使烦恼，使恼怒： to bring trouble, distress, or agitation to

deject.example: vt. 使沮丧: nothing dejects a TV pundit more than the reality check that nobody cares what he thinks 没有什么比大家都漠不关心更让电视节目专家沮丧了
deject.mean: vt. 使沮丧： to lower the spirits of; dishearten

quash.example: vt. 镇压，阻止: quash a rebellion 镇压一次叛变
quash.mean: vt. 镇压，阻止： to put a stop to (something) by the use of force

avowal.example: n. 承认: With jingoism rampant, the peace candidate felt compelled to make an avowal of his patriotism. 在沙文主义肆虐的情况下，爱好和平的候选人被迫承认自己是个爱国主义者。
avowal.mean: n. 承认： a solemn and often public declaration of the truth or existence of something

gourmand.example: n. 嗜食者，大胃王: the kind of gourmand who swallows food without even pausing to taste it 不尝味道就下咽的那种嗜食者
gourmand.mean: n. 嗜食者，大胃王： one who is excessively fond of eating and drinking

terror.example: n. 极度恐惧: Many civilians fled in terror. 很多黎民百姓极度恐慌逃难去了。
terror.mean: n. 极度恐惧： a state of intense fear

analogous.example: adj. 相似的，可比较的: Bad-mouthing your sister is analogous to slapping her in the face - it's just as bad. 说你姐姐的坏话和当面扇她耳光是类似的——它们都是不好的行为。
analogous.mean: adj. 相似的，可比较的： having qualities in common

cunning.example:
adj. 狡猾的: cunning tactics 狡猾的战术
adj. （手工）灵巧的: Only the most cunning cabinetmaker could have crafted such a beautifully proportioned chest of drawers. 只有手工超凡的家具工才能打造出如此精致协调的衣柜
n. 欺诈，欺骗: used cunning and subterfuge to work her way up the corporate ladder 通过欺骗在公司中步步攀升
cunning.mean:
adj. 狡猾的： marked by or given to artful subtlety and deceptiveness
adj. （手工）灵巧的： skillful with the hands
n. 欺诈，欺骗： the inclination or practice of misleading others through lies or trickery

splutter.example: vi. 急切而不清楚地说: They begin to splutter and move restlessly about if they feel time is slipping away without some return. 当他们感到时间在悄悄流逝却一无所得时，他们便开始激动地说话，不安地走动。
splutter.mean: vi. 急切而不清楚地说： to speak hastily and incoherently, as when confused or angry

overwrought.example:
adj. 十分激动的，非常不安的: She became overwrought when she heard that her child was missing. 当她得知自己孩子失踪的消息后变得极其激动和不安。
adj. （装饰）过分华丽的: The author's prose is overwrought with purple passages and florid metaphors. 这个作者的散文里充满了词藻华丽的段落和比喻，显得有些过分。
overwrought.mean:
adj. 十分激动的，非常不安的： being in a state of increased activity or agitation
adj. （装饰）过分华丽的： elaborately and often excessively decorated

persevere.example: vi. 坚持不懈，不屈不挠: Although he was frustrated by the lack of financial resources and support, hepersevered in his scientific research. 尽管因为资金不足而受阻，但他仍坚持进行科学研究
persevere.mean: vi. 坚持不懈，不屈不挠： to persist in or remain constant to a purpose, idea, or task in the face of obstacles or discouragement

antediluvian.example:
adj. 非常古老的，过时的: He has antediluvian notions about the role of women in the workplace. 他对职场女性抱有老掉牙的看法。
adj. 非常古老的，过时的: an antediluvian automobile 古董级的汽车
n. 保守的人: an antediluvian who thought a woman without talent is virtuous 一个认为“女子无才便是德”的保守的人
antediluvian.mean:
adj. 非常古老的，过时的：extremely old and antiquated
n. 保守的人：a person with old-fashioned ideas

coop.example: vt. 监禁，困于…之中: Those restless kids were cooped up in the house on a rainy. 雨天那些好动的孩子们被困在房子里
coop.mean: vt. 监禁，困于…之中： to confine in a restricted and often crowded area

reconvene.example: v. 重新集合，重新召集: The leaders will reconvene tomorrow. 明天领导们会再次召开会议。
reconvene.mean: v. 重新集合，重新召集：to gather, call together, or summon again, especially for a formal meeting

reserved.example: adj. 内向的，缄默的: too reserved to offer a spontaneous criticism 过于缄默而不愿意发表真实的看法
reserved.mean: adj. 内向的，缄默的： restrained in words and actions

blase.example: adj. （过度放纵之后）厌倦享乐的，腻烦的: Years of extravagance has made him totally blasé. 长期的奢华生活已使他彻底麻木
blase.mean: adj. （过度放纵之后）厌倦享乐的，腻烦的： apathetic to pleasure or excitement as a result of excessive indulgence or enjoyment

spate.example: n. 大量: a spate of books about GRE 很多关于GRE的书
spate.mean:
n. 突发的洪水： sudden flood
n. 大量： a large number or amount

sloppy.example:
adj. 邋遢的，不整洁的: a sloppy child who always seems to have spilled something on his clothes 一个外表邋遢的小孩子，他的衣服似乎总被沾上了什么东西
adj. 混乱的: dumped the papers in a sloppy pile on the desk 把纸张随意地叠放在书桌上
sloppy.mean:
adj. 邋遢的，不整洁的： lacking neatness in dress or person
adj. 混乱的： lacking in order, neatness, and often cleanliness

liability.example:
n. 责任: The company is trying to reduce its liability in this case. 在这个案件中，公司试图减少他们的责任
n. 障碍，不利条件: Their chief asset has now become a considerable liability. 他们最大的优点如今已成了不可小觑的负担
liability.mean:
n. 责任： the quality or state of being liable
n. 障碍，不利条件： a feature of someone or something that creates difficulty for achieving success

figment.example: n. 虚构的事物，幻觉: Unable to find any tracks in the snow the next morning, I was forced to conclude that the shadowy figure had been a figment of my imagination. 第二天一早，我没有在雪地上发现任何足迹，由此我不得不相信昨晚幽灵一样的物体只是我的空想。‖Thus far, the invisible human being has been nothing more than a figment of fantasy writers. 到目前为止，隐形人还仅仅只是玄幻小说笔下的构想。
figment.mean: n. 虚构的事物，幻觉： something made up or contrived

convoke.example: v. 召集开会: to convoke Parliament 召开国会
convoke.mean: v. 召集开会： to bring together by or as if by summons

gloomy.example: adj. 忧郁的: feel gloomy about future career 就未来的职业生涯倍感忧心
gloomy.mean:
adj. 黯淡无光的： being without light or without much light
adj. 忧郁的： low in spirits

bustle.example:
n. 忙乱，喧闹: the hustle and bustle of the big city 熙熙攘攘的大都市‖I couldn't concentrate in all the bustle of the student lounge. 学生休息室里过于嘈杂，我无法专心。
vi. （快速地）行走: the hostess bustled about, taking care of last-minute preparations for the party. 女主人四处走着，为聚会做最后的准备。
bustle.mean:
n. 忙乱，喧闹： noisy, energetic, and often obtrusive activity
vi. （快速地）行走： to move briskly and often ostentatiously

anonymous.example:
adj. 匿名的: He made an anonymous phone call to the police. 他给警察打了一个匿名电话。
adj. 匿名的: The donor wishes to remain anonymous. 捐赠者希望保持匿名身份。
adj. 无特色的 lacking individuality, distinction, or recognizability
: the anonymous faces in the crowd大众脸
anonymous.mean:
adj. 匿名的：not named or identified
adj. 无特色的 lacking individuality, distinction, or recognizability

waylay.example: vt. 埋伏，伏击: Unsuspecting tourists are often waylaid by gangs. 不警惕的旅客们常常被犯罪团伙偷袭。‖We were waylaid by a group of protestors with rocks. 我们被一群示威者用石头偷袭了。
waylay.mean: vt. 埋伏，伏击： to lie in wait for or attack from ambush

blast.example:
n. 爆炸: blast wave of a nuclear bomb 原子弹的冲击波
n. 一阵猛烈的强风: blasts of bleak air 阵阵阴风
n. 巨响: a sharp blast of the horn startled the other driver 一声尖锐刺耳的喇叭声惊吓到了另一名司机
vt. 炸裂，爆破: The highway engineers will have to blast that hill in order to put a road through here. 为了建设一条公路，道路工程师们必须对那座山进行爆破
vt. 斥责，抨击: blasted the new governor for every little misstep 就每一个小的失误都要抨击新的执政官
blast.mean:
n. 爆炸： an explosion or violent detonation
n. 一阵猛烈的强风： a violent gust of wind
n. 巨响： a loud explosive sound
vt. 炸裂，爆破： to cause to break open or into pieces by or as if by an explosive
vt. 斥责，抨击： to criticize harshly and usually publicly

jettison.example: vt. 丢弃，投弃: a ship jettisoning wastes 投弃废物的船
jettison.mean: vt. 丢弃，投弃：to cast overboard or off

feeble.example: adj. 衰弱的: The heartbeat was feeble and irregular. 心跳虚弱而不规则
feeble.mean: adj. 衰弱的： markedly lacking in strength

minute.example:
adj. 仔细的，谨小慎微的: a minute description of the setting of the story 故事背景的详细介绍
adj. 小的，不重要的: It is not sagacious to invest excessively in minute details. 过分投入于不重要的细枝末节上是不明智的
minute.mean:
adj. 仔细的，谨小慎微的： characterized by careful scrutiny and close examination
adj. 小的，不重要的： very small or of small importance

precipitous.example:
adj. 非常陡峭的: a precipitous gorge 险峻的峡谷
adj. 匆忙的: They soon regretted their precipitous actions in international affairs 他们很快就为他们在国际事务中的匆忙举动感到后悔。
precipitous.mean:
adj. 非常陡峭的：very steep, perpendicular, or overhanging in rise or fall
adj. 匆忙的： acting or done with excessive or careless speed

din.example:
n. 喧闹声，嘈杂声: The din of the engines was deafening. 引擎的嘈杂声震耳欲聋。|| There's always a great din from the cafeteria during lunch. 午餐时间经常从咖啡店里传来很大的喧闹声。
v. 重复: Safety lessons dinned into us over and over. 我们一遍又一遍的进行安全教育。
din.mean:
n. 喧闹声，嘈杂声： a loud continued noise
v. 重复： to say or state again

prod.example: vt. 促使……行动: The strike may prod the government into action. 罢工也许会迫使政府采取行动。
prod.mean: vt. 促使……行动： to try to persuade (someone) through earnest appeals to follow a course of action

trespass.example: i. 非法侵入，违反: I consider him to be trespassing against all of us when he trespasses against any one of us. 当他冒犯我们当中一个人的时候，他就冒犯了我们全部
trespass.mean: i. 非法侵入，违反： to commit an offense

irreducible.example: adj. （数）不可约分的: irreducible integrals 质数
irreducible.mean: adj. （数）不可约分的： incapable of being factored into polynomials of lower degree with coefficients in some given field (as the rational numbers) or integral domain (as the integers)

camaraderie.example: n. 友情: There is great camaraderie among the teammates. 组员之间有着深厚的情谊。
camaraderie.mean: n. 友情： a spirit of friendly good-fellowship

voluminous.example: adj. 卷数多的，大量的，庞大的: trying to keep a track of voluminous academic database 尝试追踪数目庞大的学术数据库
voluminous.mean: adj. 卷数多的，大量的，庞大的： having great volume, fullness, size, or number

discrete.example: adj. 离散的，不连续的: a discrete variable 离散变量
discrete.mean: adj. 离散的，不连续的：constituting a separate entity

invidious.example:
adj. 惹人反感的: the invidious task of arbitration 令人反感的仲裁任务
adj. 羡慕嫉妒恨的: Inevitably, his remarkable success attracted the invidious attention of the other sales representatives. 不可避免地，他巨大的成功引来了其他销售代表羡慕嫉妒恨的眼光
invidious.mean:
adj. 惹人反感的： tending to cause discontent, animosity, or envy
adj. 羡慕嫉妒恨的： having or showing mean resentment of another's possessions or advantages

grimace.example: v./n. 因痛苦而面部扭曲: she made a grimace when she tasted the medicine 她尝了一口药，然后做了一个鬼脸
grimace.mean: v./n. 因痛苦而面部扭曲： a sharp contortion of the face expressive of pain, disgust or disapproval

stockade.example:
n. 栅栏，围栏: a heavy stockade that protected the troops 保护驻扎部队的厚厚的栅栏
n. 监狱: All POWs were kept in a remote stockade. 所有的战俘都被关在一个遥远的监狱里。
stockade.mean:
n. 栅栏，围栏： an enclosure or pen made with posts and stakes
n. 监狱： a place of confinement for persons held in lawful custody

burgeon.example: v. 迅速成长扩大，蓬勃发展: My confidence began to burgeon. 我的信心开始迅速增强。
burgeon.mean: v. 迅速成长扩大，蓬勃发展： to grow and expand rapidly; flourish

svelte.example: adj. （女人）体态苗条的，优雅的: The svelte dancer seemed to float across the stage. 苗条的舞者看起来就像在舞台上漂浮。
svelte.mean: adj. （女人）体态苗条的，优雅的： slender or graceful in figure or outline; slim.

anesthetic.example:
n. 止痛剂 : something (as a drug) that relieves pain
: The dentist waited until the anesthetic took effect. 牙医等止痛药生效。
adj. 无感觉的，麻木的: be anesthetic to their feelings 对他们的感受麻木不仁
anesthetic.mean:
n. 止痛剂 : something (as a drug) that relieves pain
adj. 无感觉的，麻木的：lacking awareness or sensitivity

aseptic.example:
adj. 消毒的，无菌的: Surgery must be in aseptic environments. 手术必须处在无菌环境下
adj. 冷漠的: aseptic essays 没有感情的文章；an aseptic smile 漠然的微笑
aseptic.mean:
adj. 消毒的，无菌的：preventing infection
adj. 缺乏活力的：lacking vitality
adj. 冷漠的：emotion, or warmth

plummet.example: v. 突然下降: Overall GPA plummeted 0.5 points. 平均学分绩骤降0.5。
plummet.mean: v. 突然下降： to decline suddenly and steeply

xenophobe.example: n. 仇视（或畏惧）外国人（或外国事物）者: But from what I know, no way could this thoroughly US-educated woman (from the age of 12) be a xenophobe. 但根据我的了解，这个从12岁起就接受彻底的美国教育的女人不可能是抵触外国事物的人。
xenophobe.mean: n. 仇视（或畏惧）外国人（或外国事物）者： one unduly fearful of what is foreign and especially of people of foreign origin

somber.example:
adj. 昏暗的，无光的: The prison's somber interrogation room has the desired effect of striking fear and despair into the prisoner. 牢房中阴暗的问讯间有着能让囚犯感到恐惧和绝望的效果。
adj. 悲伤的，不愉快的: Her death put us in a somber mood. 她的死让我们陷入了悲伤沮丧的情绪之中。
somber.mean:
adj. 昏暗的，无光的： so shaded as to be dark and gloomy
adj. 悲伤的，不愉快的： causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer

pore.example: vi. 仔细浏览，仔细研究: The committee will probably pore over the results of the study for a long time before making their decision. 在正式做决定之前，委员会或需要花很长的时间来仔细研究调查结果。
pore.mean: vi. 仔细浏览，仔细研究： to read or study attentively(usually used with over)

inconsequential.example:
adj. 不合逻辑的: an inconsequential line of argument 不合逻辑的论述
adj. 不重要的: That's an inconsequential problem compared to the other issues. 和其他问题相比，这就是个无关痛痒的小事
inconsequential.mean:
adj. 不合逻辑的： not using or following good reasoning
adj. 不重要的： of no significance

agitate.example:
v. 煽动，激起: agitate for better conditions 为得到更好的工作条件而煽动
v. 使不安: There's no need to agitate the patient about little things. 没必要因为鸡毛蒜皮的事让患者烦躁。
agitate.mean:
v. 煽动，激起： to attempt to arouse public feeling
v. 使不安： to excite and often trouble the mind or feelings of : disturb

prairie.example: n. 大草原: Canadian Prairie 加拿大大草原地区
prairie.mean: n. 大草原： an extensive area of flat or rolling, predominantly treeless grassland

ravenous.example: adj. 食量大的，贪食的: He had moderated his ravenous appetite. 他克制了自己的食欲。‖ravenous for power 渴望权力
ravenous.mean: adj. 食量大的，贪食的： having a huge appetite

sordid.example: adj. 肮脏的，不干净的: I will not let my children grow up in such a sordid environment. 我绝不会让我的孩子在这样一个肮脏的环境之中成长。
sordid.mean:
adj. 肮脏的，不干净的： not clean
adj. 卑鄙的： marked by baseness or grossness

substitute.example:
n. 取代者，替代品: If you like, you can use nuts as a substitute for coconut in that recipe. 如果您不反对，我们可以将菜单里的椰子换成坚果。
vt. 取代，替代: substituting moral power for physical force 将暴力用道德的力量代替‖BFR molecules have some atoms substituted by bromide atoms, which makes it fire-resistant. 在溴化阻燃剂的分子中，一部分原子被溴原子取代，从而使它不易燃烧。
substitute.mean:
n. 取代者，替代品： a person or thing that takes the place or function of another
vt. 取代，替代： to take the place of

acrimonious.example: adj. 刻薄的，充满仇恨的: the acrimonious debate between the two candidates 候选人之间言辞激烈的辩论
acrimonious.mean: adj. 刻薄的，充满仇恨的： having or showing deep-seated resentment

resurgence.example: n. 复兴: Let’s witness the resurgence of classical school. 让我们见证古典乐派的复兴。
resurgence.mean: n. 复兴： a restoration to use, acceptance, activity, or vigor

obsequious.example: adj. 谄媚的，奴性的: She's constantly followed by obsequious assistants who will do anything. 她总是有一群谄媚的跟班，原意为她赴汤蹈火。
obsequious.mean: adj. 谄媚的，奴性的： marked by or exhibiting a fawning attentiveness

jeopardy.example: n. 危险: the city's firefighters routinely put their lives in jeopardy 消防队员们早就把生命置之度外了
jeopardy.mean: n. 危险： risk of loss or injury; peril or danger

scads.example: n. 许多，大量: scads of people showed up for the party 参加派对的人们蜂拥而至
scads.mean: n. 许多，大量： a large number or quantity

havoc.example:
n. 大混乱: the blackout caused havoc in the city 断电造成了城市一片混乱
n. 大范围破坏: the powerful hurricane wreaked havoc all along the coast 威力巨大的飓风摧毁着沿岸的一切
havoc.mean:
n. 大混乱： a state in which everything is out of order
n. 大范围破坏： the state or fact of being rendered nonexistent, physically unsound, or useless

appeal.example:
n. 申请: A piteous appeal for help. 虔诚的请求帮助。
n. 申请: to make an appeal to the public to donate needed blood 向公众提出献血请求
n. 起诉to charge with a crime : accuse
: My lawyer said the court's decision wasn't correct and that we should file for an appeal. 我的律师说法庭的判决不对我们应该起诉。
appeal.mean:
n. 申请：an application (as to a recognized authority) for corroboration, vindication, or decision
n. 起诉to charge with a crime : accuse

providential.example: adj. 天意的，幸运的: a providential escape 幸运的逃脱
providential.mean: adj. 天意的，幸运的： happening as if through divine intervention

extemporize.example: v. 即席表现: a good talk show host has to be able to extemporize the interviews when things don't go as planned 一个好的脱口秀主持人要能够在计划之外即兴表现
extemporize.mean: v. 即席表现： to do or perform (something) without prior preparation or practice

slovenly.example: adj. 邋遢的，不整洁的: For the sake of their image, the band members transformed themselves from clean-cut lads to slovenly rockers. 为了他们自身的形象，乐队成员从健康向上的青年变成了邋遢的摇滚乐手。
slovenly.mean: adj. 邋遢的，不整洁的： lacking neatness in dress or person

blas\u00e9.example: adj. （过度放纵之后）厌倦享乐的，腻烦的: Years of extravagance has made him totally blasé. 长期的奢华生活已使他彻底麻木
blas\u00e9.mean: adj. （过度放纵之后）厌倦享乐的，腻烦的： apathetic to pleasure or excitement as a result of excessive indulgence or enjoyment

abscond.example: v. 偷偷离开: abscond from the prison 越狱
abscond.mean: v. 偷偷离开： to depart secretly and hide oneself

assertive.example: adj. 武断的，强烈自信的: You will have to make many personal judgments when being assertive. 当武断的时候你不得不做出很多个人选择。
assertive.mean: adj. 武断的，强烈自信的：inclined to bold or confident assertion; aggressively self-assured.

torpid.example:
adj. 麻木的，没有知觉的: My tongue and throat remained torpid for a time following the endoscopy. 胃镜检查之后，我的舌头和喉咙一直是麻木的。
adj. 迟钝的，行动迟缓的: a torpid sloth that refused to budge off its tree branch 趴在树枝上一动不动的树獭
torpid.mean:
adj. 麻木的，没有知觉的： lacking in sensation or feeling
adj. 迟钝的，行动迟缓的： slow to move or act

fluky.example: adj. 侥幸的: a fluky coincidence that kept me safely at home when the blizzard hit 一个偶然的巧合让我在暴风雪来袭时安全地待在家里
fluky.mean:
adj. 侥幸的： coming or happening by good luck especially unexpectedly
adj. 偶然的： happening by or depending on chance

blackmail.example: n./vi. 敲诈，勒索: It looks like these pornographic pictures were being used for blackmail. 看起来有人用这些不雅照进行敲诈勒索。
blackmail.mean: n./vi. 敲诈，勒索： extortion of money or something else of value from a person by the threat of exposing a criminal act or discreditable information

contemplate.example: vt./vi. 沉思，仔细思索: contemplate the vastness of the universe 沉思着宇宙的广袤无垠‖She contemplated the problem for several hours before reaching a decision. 她苦苦思索了几个小时的问题后才做出决定。
contemplate.mean: vt./vi. 沉思，仔细思索： to view or consider with continued attention

mellifluous.example: adj. （曲调）优美的: a mellifluous voice 甜美的嗓音
mellifluous.mean: adj. （曲调）优美的： smooth and sweet

ingenuous.example:
adj. 天真淳朴的: Photographs captured the ingenuous smiles of young children at play. 摄影家捕捉到了演出中孩子们天真无邪的笑脸
adj. 坦白的: her ingenuous thirst for knowledge 她对知识毫不掩饰的渴望
ingenuous.mean:
adj. 天真淳朴的： lacking in cunning, guile, or worldliness
adj. 坦白的： openly straightforward or frank

lustrous.example: adj. 有光泽的: lustrous black hair 乌黑光亮的头发
lustrous.mean: adj. 有光泽的： having a shiny surface or finish

splice.example: vt. 接合，叠接: He taught me to edit and splice film. 他教会我如何剪辑和叠合胶卷。
splice.mean: vt. 接合，叠接： to unite (as two ropes) by interweaving the strands, or to join (as two pieces of film) at the ends

decipher.example:
vt. 破译: we deciphered the hidden message to find out when we were supposed to meet 破解了暗语后，发现我们要碰头
v. 有清晰想法，理解，解读: a convoluted thriller, the plot of which I was never able to actually decipher 一部错综复杂的恐怖电影，情节我一直没有理解
decipher.mean:
vt. 破译： to read or interpret (ambiguous, obscure, or illegible matter).
v. 有清晰想法，理解，解读： to have a clear idea of

gorge.example:
n. 峡谷: Wenchuan earthquake is said to have no detrimental effect on Three-Gorge dam. 汶川地震据称对三峡大坝没有破坏性影响
vi. 狼吞虎咽: gorge himself at the party 在聚会上狼吞虎咽
gorge.mean:
n. 峡谷： a narrow steep-walled canyon or part of a canyon
vi. 狼吞虎咽： to eat greedily or to repletion

rue.example: n. 后悔，遗憾: With rue my heart is laden. 我的内心充满了遗憾。
rue.mean: n. 后悔，遗憾： the feeling of regret, remorse, or sorrow for

momentous.example: adj. 极重要的: Battle of Stalingrad is a momentous campaign in World War 2. 斯大林格勒之战是第二次世界大战中具有重大意义的一次战役
momentous.mean: adj. 极重要的： of utmost importance; of outstanding significance or consequence

buck.example:
v. 阻止，反对: buck the system 不遵守制度
v. 转移，交接: buck each box to the next person in line 将每一个盒子传给队伍中的后一人
buck.mean:
v. 阻止，反对： to refuse assent, to refuse to give in to
v. 转移，交接： to shift possession of (something) from one person to another

aloft.example: adv. 在空中: The balloon stayed aloft for days 气球在空中停留了很多天。
aloft.mean: adv. 在空中：in the air especially : in flight (as in an airplane)

institute.example:
vt. 创立，制定: institute a new department 创建一个新的部门
n. 机构: a research institute 研究机构
institute.mean:
vt. 创立，制定： to establish, organize, and set in operation
n. 机构： an organization for the promotion of a cause

shift.example:
vt. 改变…的位置: She shifted the vase closer to the wall so that it wouldn't get knocked over. 她把花瓶靠墙挪动了一点，从而防止它被碰倒。
vi. 改变，变化: She watched the aurora in fascination as its colors shifted from green to blue. 她着迷地看着极光的色彩从绿变成蓝。
vt. 交换: My father and I shifted seats just before takeoff so that I could sit by the window. 起飞前我和我父亲交换了座位，这样我就可以靠窗坐了。
shift.mean:
vt. 改变…的位置： to change the place or position of
vi. 改变，变化： to pass from one form, state, or level to another
vt. 交换： to give up (something) and take something else in return

disavow.example: vt. 拒绝承认，否认: disavow the rumor 否认谣言 || She disavowed the testimony that she had given earlier in the trial. 她在审判中否认了自己之前的证词。
disavow.mean: vt. 拒绝承认，否认： to disclaim knowledge of, responsibility for, or association with；to declare not to be true

somatic.example: adj. 肉体的: a somatic disorder that was once thought to be “all in the patient’s head” 曾被认为“全是病人头脑中的问题”的生理机能紊乱
somatic.mean: adj. 肉体的： of the body, especially as distinguished from a body part, the mind, or the environment

boo.example: n./v. 嘘（以表示不满或嘲笑）: boo the actor off the stage 把演员嘘下舞台
boo.mean: n./v. 嘘（以表示不满或嘲笑）： a sound uttered to show contempt, scorn, or disapproval

equable.example: adj. （脾气、性情）温和的: equable temperament 温和的性情
equable.mean: adj. （脾气、性情）温和的： not easily disturbed; serene

potable.example:
n. 饮品，尤指有酒精饮料: Potables are offered at bar counter for free. 饮料可以在吧台免费领取。
adj. 适于饮用的: Price of the potable water has soared. 饮用水价格飙升。
potable.mean:
n. 饮品，尤指有酒精饮料： a beverage, especially an alcoholic beverage
adj. 适于饮用的： suitable for drinking

influx.example: n. 涌入: They anticipated an influx of tourists next month. 他们预期下个月会有大批游客涌入
influx.mean: n. 涌入： a coming in

respite.example: n. 间歇，休息: to toil without respite 埋头苦干‖In the middle of each semester there came a short respite. 在每个学期的期中，会有一个短暂的休假。
respite.mean: n. 间歇，休息： an interval of rest or relief

insolent.example: adj. 粗野的，无礼的: an insolent child with no respect or regard for anyone 对他人不敬的无礼的小孩
insolent.mean: adj. 粗野的，无礼的： audaciously rude or disrespectful

defer.example:
v. 推迟，延期: we agreed to defer a discussion of the issue 我们决定推迟问题的讨论
vi. 遵从: defer to her father’s wishes 听从她父亲的意愿
defer.mean:
v. 推迟，延期： to put off; postpone; defer
vi. 遵从： to submit to another's wishes, opinion, or governance usually through deference or respect

careworn.example: adj. 伤心焦虑的: a careworn face 忧心忡忡的脸
careworn.mean: adj. 伤心焦虑的： showing the effect of grief or anxiety

cacophony.example: n. 刺耳的声音: the cacophony of a pet store full of animals 宠物商店里各种动物叽叽呱呱的声音
cacophony.mean: n. 刺耳的声音： loud, confused, and usually inharmonious sound

paragon.example:
n. 优秀模范: a paragon of good husband 模范好丈夫
vt. 把…比作；显示相似: paragon retreat with treachery 把撤退比作是背叛
paragon.mean:
n. 优秀模范： a model of excellence or perfection of a kind; a peerless example
vt. 把…比作；显示相似： to compare with; parallel

plumb.example:
vt. 测深度: We will plumb the bay to make sure it was deep enough for the huge vessel. 为了确证水深足够容纳这艘巨轮，我们将会测量海湾的深度。‖questions that plumb the depths of stupidity 测量智商下限的问题
v. 仔细深入地检查: plumbing the book's complexities 审阅这本书的复杂度
plumb.mean:
vt. 测深度： to measure the depth of (as a body of water) typically with a weighted line
adj. 垂直的： exactly vertical
adj. 完全的，绝对的： having no exceptions or restrictions
v. 仔细深入地检查： to examine closely or deeply

abash.example: vt. 使尴尬，使羞愧: Nothing could abash him. 没有什么可以使他感到难堪。
abash.mean: vt. 使尴尬，使羞愧： to destroy the self-possession or self-confidence of ,disconcert, embarrass

sporadic.example: adj. 偶尔的，零星发生的: On the whole, situation has significantly improved with only sporadic disturbances. 总体而言，局势得到了明显的改善，现在只有偶尔发生的骚乱。
sporadic.mean: adj. 偶尔的，零星发生的： not often occurring or repeated

surmount.example: vt. 战胜，获得胜利: an Olympic swimmer who surmounted endless obstacles to achieve her goals 一个克服重重困难最终实现目标的奥运游泳运动员
surmount.mean: vt. 战胜，获得胜利： to achieve a victory over

ossify.example: vi. 硬化，僵化: a disease that ossifies the joints 一种会使关节僵化的疾病
ossify.mean: vi. 硬化，僵化： to become hardened or conventional and opposed to change

stingy.example:
adj. 小气的，吝啬的: too stingy to tip the waiter 小气到不肯给小费
adj. 极少量的: Many people may consider this a rather stingy amount of food. 很多人都会认为这是分量比较少的食物。
stingy.mean:
adj. 小气的，吝啬的： being unwilling or showing unwillingness to share with others
adj. 极少量的： less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable

abase.example: v. 降低（地位、职位、威望或尊严）: was unwilling to abase himself by pleading guilty to a crime that he did not commit 不愿意屈就自己去承认一个莫须有的罪名
abase.mean: v. 降低（地位、职位、威望或尊严）： to lower in rank, office, prestige, or esteem

dolorous.example: adj. 忧伤的: He lifted a pair of sapphire, dolorous eyes. 他抬起了一双忧郁的蓝宝石般的眼睛
dolorous.mean: adj. 忧伤的： causing, marked by, or expressing misery or grief

impunity.example: n. 免责，免受处罚: She mistakenly believed that she could insult people with impunity. 她错误地认为她可以肆无忌惮地羞辱他人。
impunity.mean: n. 免责，免受处罚： exemption or freedom from punishment, harm, or loss

subvert.example: vt. 颠覆: an alleged plot to subvert the state 一个谣传的旨在推翻政权的阴谋
subvert.mean: vt. 颠覆： to overturn or overthrow from the foundation

licentious.example: adj. 放荡的，性欲强的: a moralist who decried what she regarded as the licentious and corrupt culture of the entertainment industry 一个公开谴责在她看来无比堕落和放荡的娱乐圈文化的道德家
licentious.mean: adj. 放荡的，性欲强的： lacking legal or moral restraints ; having a strong sexual desire

captivate.example: vt. 吸引: I was captivated by her brilliant mind. 我被她的才华横溢所吸引。
captivate.mean: vt. 吸引： to attract and hold by charm, beauty, or excellence

wane.example: vi. 减少，衰退，降低: In the evening the storm finally waned. 傍晚时分风暴终于减弱了。‖The moon waxes and then wanes. 月有阴晴圆缺。
wane.mean: vi. 减少，衰退，降低： to decrease in size, extent, or degree

preternatural.example: adj. 超乎寻常的: They exhibited preternatural courage in face of danger. 他们在危险面前显示出了超乎寻常的勇气。
preternatural.mean: adj. 超乎寻常的： surpassing the normal or usual

unctuous.example:
dj. 油嘴滑舌的，谄媚的: an unctuous appraisal of the musical talent shown by the boss's daughter 拍老板马屁，说他女儿音乐剧的才能非常卓越
adj. 夸张的，做作的: an unctuous effort to appear religious to the voters 过分做作想在选民面前表现地虔诚
unctuous.mean:
dj. 油嘴滑舌的，谄媚的： overly or insincerely flattering
adj. 夸张的，做作的： characterized by affected, exaggerated, or insincere earnestness

coalesce.example:
v.合并,融合to unite into a whole: fuse
: Different units coalesced into one army 不同的党派融合成了一支部队
coalesce.mean: v.合并,融合to unite into a whole: fuse

cherished.example: adj. 受喜爱的，珍爱的: a cherished heirloom that has been in the family for generations 在这个家族里流传了几代的为大家喜爱的纺织机‖He described the picture with his wife as his most cherished possession. 他把这张与妻子和合影看作是自己最为珍爱的财富。
cherished.mean: adj. 受喜爱的，珍爱的： granted special treatment or attention

contrite.example: adj. （因为有罪孽或过错而感到）后悔悲痛的: too late to feel contrite 现在后悔已为时已晚
contrite.mean: adj. （因为有罪孽或过错而感到）后悔悲痛的：feeling or showing sorrow and remorse for a sin or shortcoming

noisome.example:
adj. 有害的，有毒的: noisome chemical fumes 有害的化学烟雾
adj. 恶臭的: noisome garbage 恶臭的垃圾
adj. 非常令人厌恶的: noisome habits of littering 让人反感的随地乱扔垃圾的坏习惯
noisome.mean:
adj. 有害的，有毒的： noxious, harmful
adj. 恶臭的： offensive to the senses and especially to the sense of smell
adj. 非常令人厌恶的： highly obnoxious or objectionable

swagger.example:
vi. 大摇大摆地走，趾高气昂地走: The young man confidently swaggered across the room. 年轻人高傲地在房间里走来走去。
v. 自夸，吹嘘: I would swagger if I'd won first place in the bowling tournament. 如果我赢了保龄球锦标赛我肯定会自夸。
swagger.mean:
vi. 大摇大摆地走，趾高气昂地走： to conduct oneself in an arrogant or superciliously pompous manner
v. 自夸，吹嘘： boast, brag

balky.example: adj. 不服管束的，倔强的: a balky mule 犟骡子
balky.mean: adj. 不服管束的，倔强的： refusing or likely to refuse to proceed, act, or function as directed or expected

wicked.example: adj. 邪恶的: a wicked urge to steal just for the sake of stealing 纯粹为了偷盗而偷盗的邪恶冲动
wicked.mean: adj. 邪恶的： morally very bad

dismay.example:
v. 使失去勇气: The excessive homework dismayed ourselves. 过量的作业让我们失去了信心。
v. 使不安，使焦虑: Parents became increasingly dismayed by their son's GPA. 父母对他们儿子的平均成绩非常焦虑。
dismay.mean:
v. 使失去勇气： to cause to lose courage or resolution
v. 使不安，使焦虑： to trouble the mind of; to make uneasy

entrance.example:
n. 进入权，进入许可: entrance to the club is by invitation only 该俱乐部只接受受邀入会
vt. 使入迷: be entranced by the view 陶醉于景色
entrance.mean:
n. 进入权，进入许可： the means or right of entering or participating in
vt. 使入迷： to fill with delight, wonder, or enchantment

refulgent.example: adj. 辉煌的，灿烂的: Refulgent sunlight broke through the clouds, creating huge swaths of light in the valley below us. 耀眼的阳光穿透了云层，在我们脚下的峡谷中投下了一块巨大的光斑
refulgent.mean: adj. 辉煌的，灿烂的： shining radiantly; resplendent

diurnal.example:
adj. 白天发生或行动的: diurnal animals 昼行性动物
adj. 每天的: a love as constant and certain as the diurnal tides 像每天潮汐一样始终如一的爱情
adj. 期刊: A microfilm contains a collection of diurnals. 一个微缩胶片里包含很多期刊的合集。
diurnal.mean:
adj. 白天发生或行动的： occurring or active during the daytime rather than at night
adj. 每天的： occurring, done, produced, or appearing every day
adj. 期刊： a publication that appears at regular intervals

muffle.example: vt. 使消声: close the window to muffle the outside noises 关上窗户以减少外界的噪音
muffle.mean: vt. 使消声： to wrap or pad in order to deaden the sound

census.mean: n. 户口普查： an official survey of the population of a country that is carried out in order to find out how many people live there and to obtain details of such things as people's ages and jobs

beholden.example: adj. 欠他人人情的: Not wanting to be beholden to anyone, he insisted on paying his own way. 因为不想欠别人的人情，所以他坚持出自己的那一份钱。
beholden.mean: adj. 欠他人人情的： owing something, such as gratitude, to another

edible.example: adj. 可食用的: No chemicals in the laboratory is edible. 实验室中的任何化学试剂都不能食用
edible.mean: adj. 可食用的： fit to be eaten

hubris.example: n. 狂妄自大: His failure was brought on by his hubris. 就是他的狂妄自大才导致了失败。
hubris.mean: n. 狂妄自大： exaggerated pride or self-confidence

harmonious.example: adj. 和谐一致的: a harmonious arrangement of archways and doorways in the palace courtyard 宫殿的庭院，拱门和门廊排列有序协调
harmonious.mean: adj. 和谐一致的： having the parts agreeably related

unruly.example: adj. 难驾驭的，不守规矩的: an unruly child 一个不听话的孩子
unruly.mean: adj. 难驾驭的，不守规矩的： difficult or impossible to discipline, control, or rule.

stature.example:
n. 高度，身高: a man of surprisingly great stature 拥有惊人身高的人
n. 才干，水平: This club has grown in stature over the last 20 years. 二十年间这家俱乐部的水平得到了提升。
stature.mean:
n. 高度，身高： natural height (as of a person) in an upright position
n. 才干，水平： quality or status gained by growth, development, or achievement

pitfall.example:
n. 陷阱: caught in a pitfall 掉下了陷阱‖Renting a house can be full of pitfalls for the unwary. 对于那些不注意的人来说租房也是危机四伏的。
n. （不易察觉的）危害: One of the pitfalls of ignorance is that people will also assume you are stupid. 无知的一个危害就是，人们总会假设你一无所知。
pitfall.mean:
n. 陷阱： a pit flimsily covered or camouflaged and used to capture and hold animals or men
n. （不易察觉的）危害： a hidden or not easily recognized danger or difficulty

detritus.example: n. 废品，碎屑，遗骸: the detritus of war 战争的遗骸
detritus.mean: n. 废品，碎屑，遗骸： a product of disintegration, destruction, or wearing away: debris

claim.example:
v. 要求（权利）: a fragile claim to fame 对名誉不切实际的要求 || After many years had passed, he suddenly appeared to claim his inheritance. 很多年已经过去，他突然出现要求继承遗产。
v. 断言: People claim that they have been kidnapped by aliens. 人们断言称他们被外星人绑架了。
v. 剥夺生命: Cancer claims hundreds of thousands of Americans each year. 癌症每年要剥夺成千上万美国人的生命。
n. 权利: A shareholder has a claim in the business. 股东在企业有权利（收益权、选举权等）。
claim.mean:
v. 要求（权利）：to ask for especially as a right
v. 断言：to state as a fact usually forcefully
v. 剥夺生命：to deprive of life
n. 权利：a legal right to participation in the advantages, profits, and responsibility of something

nexus.example:
n. 连结: Correlativity does not sufficiently lead to causal nexus. 相关性不是因果关联的充分条件
n. 核心，最重要的地带: As the nexus for three great religions, Jerusalem has had a troubled as well as illustrious history. 作为三大宗教的圣城，耶路撒冷有着动荡而辉煌的历史
nexus.mean:
n. 连结： a means of connection
n. 核心，最重要的地带： a thing or place that is of greatest importance to an activity or interest

phlegmatic.example: adj. 冷静的，无感情的，淡漠的: a strangely phlegmatic response to what should have been happy news 对本该是一个让人开心的新闻的冷漠回复
phlegmatic.mean: adj. 冷静的，无感情的，淡漠的： having or suggesting a calm, sluggish temperament; unemotional

vicarious.example: adj. 代理的，取代的: use Internet as a vicarious form of social life 把互联网当作一种虚拟的社交生活
vicarious.mean: adj. 代理的，取代的： performed or suffered by one person as a substitute for another or to the benefit or advantage of another

intransigent.example: adj. 不妥协的，固执的: an intransigent attitude 不妥协的态度
intransigent.mean: adj. 不妥协的，固执的： characterized by refusal to compromise or to abandon an extreme position

purity.example: n. 纯净；清白，无罪: struggling to live a life of purity while surrounded by wickedness 即使周围充满邪恶，也要使自己生命纯粹、完美
purity.mean: n. 纯净；清白，无罪： the quality or state of being morally pure; the quality or state of being morally pure

serendipity.example: n. 意外发现珍奇(或称心)事物的本领: They found each other by pure serendipity. 他俩的相识属于缘分天注定。
serendipity.mean: n. 意外发现珍奇(或称心)事物的本领： the faculty of making fortunate discoveries by accident

provoke.example:
vt. 激怒: his teasing finally provoked her to anger 他的调戏最终把她激怒了
vt. 驱使，激起: rankings that are sure to provoke an argument among film critics 排名必将引发影评家们的争论
provoke.mean:
vt. 激怒： to incite to anger or resentment
vt. 驱使，激起： to stir to action or feeling

intelligible.example: adj. 可理解的: military codenames intelligible only to those high-rank commanding officers 只有高级指挥官才能理解的军事暗号
intelligible.mean: adj. 可理解的： capable of being understood

restitution.example: n. 补偿，赔偿: The victims are demanding full restitution. 受害者要求全额补偿。
restitution.mean: n. 补偿，赔偿： a making good of or giving an equivalent for some injury

bigot.example: n. 固执己见者，有偏见的人: He is a bigot, or “a slave of dogma”. 一个固执己见的人，换而言之就是——教条主义的奴隶
bigot.mean: n. 固执己见者，有偏见的人： a person obstinately devoted to his own opinions and prejudices

septic.mean: adj. 腐败的，感染的： of, relating to, or causing putrefaction

nonchalant.example: adj. 冷漠的: She was surprisingly nonchalant about winning the award. 她竟然对得奖很淡然。
nonchalant.mean: adj. 冷漠的： having an air of easy unconcern or indifference

reprove.example:
vt. 温和地责备，警告: My piano teacher often reproves me for slouching while playing, observing that good posture helps one play better. 我的钢琴老师常常会因为懒散的坐姿而批评我，他认为良好的坐姿能让我弹得更好。
vt. 不欣赏，不喜欢: The older generation has always reproved the younger generation's taste in music. 老一代的人总是不喜欢新一代的音乐品味。
reprove.mean:
vt. 温和地责备，警告： to scold or correct usually gently or with kindly intent
vt. 不欣赏，不喜欢： to hold an unfavorable opinion of

meager.example: adj. 贫乏的: meager cultural resources 贫乏的文化资源
meager.mean: adj. 贫乏的： deficient in quantity, fullness, or extent; scanty

pine.example:
vi. 渴望，奢望: pine for a lost love 渴望那段逝去的爱情
vi. 因渴望而憔悴: Separated by their families, the lovers pined away. 这对恋人因为被家人拆散而日益憔悴。
pine.mean:
vi. 渴望，奢望： to yearn intensely and persistently especially for something unattainable
vi. 因渴望而憔悴： to lose vigor, health, or flesh (as through grief)

immune.example:
adj. 不易被感染的，有免疫力的: The blood test will tell whether you are immune to the disease. 验血可以判断你是否对这种疾病免疫
adj. 不受影响的: immune to persuasion 不听劝
adj. 不受约束的: immune from taxation 免税
immune.mean:
adj. 不易被感染的，有免疫力的： of, relating to, or having resistance to infection
adj. 不受影响的： not affected by a given influence
adj. 不受约束的： not subject to an obligation imposed on others

cardinal.example: adj. 主要的，非常重要的: the cardinal rule of medicine: do no harm 药物的首要标准就是无害
cardinal.mean: adj. 主要的，非常重要的： of foremost importance; paramount

loathe.example: vt. 厌恶: I loathe having to do this. 我鄙视不得不这样做。
loathe.mean: vt. 厌恶： to dislike someone or something greatly; abhor

irascible.example: adj. 易怒的: The new boss is so irascible that several employees have resigned. 由于新老板太容易发飙，许多员工已经递交了辞呈
irascible.mean: adj. 易怒的： marked by hot temper and easily provoked anger

cavil.example: v. 挑剔，吹毛求疵: Let us not cavil too much. 让我们别太挑剔。 || caviling about the price of a cup of coffee 对一杯咖啡的价钱挑刺
cavil.mean: v. 挑剔，吹毛求疵： to find fault unnecessarily; raise trivial objections :quibble

ductile.example:
adj. 可塑的，有延展性的: Gold is a kind of ductile metal. 金是一种有延展性的金属
adj. 易受影响的: a ductile personality 易受他人影响的性格
ductile.mean:
adj. 可塑的，有延展性的： easily molded or shaped, malleable
adj. 易受影响的： easily led or influenced

paramount.example: adj. 最重要的: The paramount goal is to restore the colonial-era house with complete historical accuracy. 最重要的任务就是十分精确地依照历史重建殖民时期的建筑
paramount.mean: adj. 最重要的： of chief concern or importance

provincial.example: adj./n. 狭隘的: an artist who has been criticized for being provincial 一个被批评非常狭隘的艺术家
provincial.mean: adj./n. 狭隘的： limited in perspective; narrow and self-centered

escalate.example: vi.（战争等）升级，扩大: We don’t want to escalate the war. 我们不想使战争扩大。
escalate.mean: vi.（战争等）升级，扩大： to increase in extent, volume, number, amount, intensity, or scope

scoff.example:
vt. 嘲笑: scoffed at the idea 对这个提议不屑一顾
v. 狼吞虎咽: scoffed dinner before running off to the basketball game 风卷残云般把晚饭消灭了，就直奔向篮球场
scoff.mean:
vt. 嘲笑： to treat or address with derision: mock
v. 狼吞虎咽： to swallow or eat greedily

brazen.example:
adj. 蛮横大胆的，厚颜无耻的: a brazen disregard for the rules 蛮横大胆的对规则漠视
v. 大胆自信地去面对或从事: brazened out the crisis 沉着面对危机 || Some people prefer to brazen a thing out rather than admit defeat. 有的人不愿承认失败，而是宁肯厚着脸皮干下去。
brazen.mean:
adj. 蛮横大胆的，厚颜无耻的： marked by contemptuous boldness
v. 大胆自信地去面对或从事： to face or undergo with bold self-assurance

accessory.example:
adj. 辅助的，附属的: accessory features such as call-waiting 类似呼叫等待的附属功能
n. 帮凶: two accessories, the driver of the getaway car and the dishonest bank teller, were charged in the robbery case 两个帮凶，逃逸车辆的司机和不诚信的银行出纳，在抢劫案中被控告
accessory.mean:
adj. 辅助的，附属的： having a secondary, supplementary, or subordinate function.
n. 帮凶： one associated with another in wrongdoing

perfidy.example: n. 不忠，背信弃义: As loyalty unites lovers, so perfidy estranges friends. 忠诚是爱情的纽带，欺诈是友谊的敌人
perfidy.mean: n. 不忠，背信弃义： an act or an instance of disloyalty

primordial.example: adj. 原始的，最初的: primordial forms of life 最原始的生命形态
primordial.mean: adj. 原始的，最初的： being or happening first in sequence of time

outlandish.example: adj. 古怪的，奇异的: an outlandish costume 奇装异服
outlandish.mean: adj. 古怪的，奇异的：strikingly out of the ordinary: bizarre

vivacious.example: adj. 活泼的，快活的: a vivacious girl who became a successful sales rep 一个成为了成功销售代表的活泼女孩
vivacious.mean: adj. 活泼的，快活的： lively in temper, conduct, or spirit

hedonism.example: n. 享乐主义: their spring break trip to Mexico became an exercise in heedless hedonism 他们春季的墨西哥之行成为了一次未加注意的享乐之旅
hedonism.mean: n. 享乐主义： the doctrine that pleasure or happiness is the sole or chief good in life

coagulate.example: v. 凝结,使变稠: The blood coagulates to stop wounds bleeding. 血液会凝结以防止伤口流血。
coagulate.mean: v. 凝结,使变稠：to cause to become viscous or thickened into a coherent mass : curdle, clot

flourish.example:
vi. 茂盛；繁荣: The program will flourish once it receives adequate funding. 这个项目只要有足够的资金就能大获成功
n. 装饰: a bedroom with cute little flourishes 一间带有可爱小装饰的卧室‖Her writing style is simple and clear, without unnecessary flourishes. 她的文风很简单清新，没有那些不必要的修饰
flourish.mean:
vi. 茂盛；繁荣： to grow luxuriantly; to achieve success
n. 装饰： an embellishment or ornamentation

protocol.example: n. 正确的礼仪规范: a breach of protocol 社交礼仪的破坏
protocol.mean: n. 正确的礼仪规范： a code of correct conduct

relinquish.example:
vt. 放弃（职位、权力等）: She relinquished his position to the company's vice president with very mixed feelings. 怀着十分复杂的情感，她放弃了公司副总裁的职位。
vt. 移交，交出: The boy reluctantly relinquished the illegal fireworks to the police officer. 小男孩不情愿地把非法的焰火交给了警察。‖The court ordered him to relinquish custody of his child. 法庭要求他交出孩子的监护权。
relinquish.mean:
vt. 放弃（职位、权力等）： to give up (as a position of authority) formally
vt. 移交，交出： to give (something) over to the control or possession of another usually under duress

mangy.example: adj. 卑劣的: a mangy trick 卑鄙的手段

correlate.example: vt. 使…相关联: a demanding father who always correlated success with hard work 一个总将成功和辛勤工作关联起来的严格父亲‖In this work, we correlate the simulation in the lab and the observation in the field to examine the validity of our theory. 本文中，我们将实验室的模拟结果和场地外的观测数据联系起来以验证理论的真实性。
correlate.mean: vt. 使…相关联： to establish a mutual or reciprocal relation between

perambulate.example: v. 徒步穿越，走过: We decided to lazily perambulate the entire length of the esplanade and enjoy the fresh air. 我们决定悠哉地徒步走过滨海大道，享受清新的空气
perambulate.mean: v. 徒步穿越，走过： to travel over or through especially on foot for exercise or pleasure

facile.example:
adj.表面的，浅尝辄止的: propose a facile solution to a complex problem 给一个复杂的问题提议一个肤浅的解决方案
adj.容易的，唾手可得的: a facile victory 一场轻松易得的胜利
facile.mean:
adj.表面的，浅尝辄止的：having or showing a lack of depth of understanding or character
adj.容易的，唾手可得的： easily accomplished or attained

explicit.example:
adj. 表达清晰的: explicit instructions 表达清晰的指示说明
adj. 成熟的，完全形成的: explicit plan 成熟的计划
explicit.mean:
adj. 表达清晰的： fully revealed or expressed without vagueness, implication, or ambiguity
adj. 成熟的，完全形成的： fully developed or formulated

fluent.example:
adj. 表达流利的: a very fluent speaker who always communicates his points well 一个总能明确指出要点的流利演说家
adj. 不费力的: a fluent performance of one of the oldest magic tricks in the book 一场毫不费力的魔术，表演的是书本上最老的魔术之一
fluent.mean:
adj. 表达流利的： able to express oneself clearly and well
adj. 不费力的： involving minimal difficulty or effort

cascade.example: n. （尤指小的）瀑布: The river forms a series of cascades as it drops a total of 200 feet in elevation. 这条河前后海拔差达200余英尺，故而形成了一系列的小瀑布。
cascade.mean: n. （尤指小的）瀑布： a steep usually small fall of water

stasis.example: n. 平衡，停滞: For the time being, the populations of the national park's predators and prey remain in stasis. 目前国家公园中捕食者和猎物的数量保持着一定的平衡。‖Language is a primary element of culture,and stasis in the arts is tantamount to death. (Charles Marsh) 语言是文化当中的主要元素，艺术的停滞和平衡就等同于死亡。——查理斯?马氏
stasis.mean: n. 平衡，停滞： a condition of balance among various forces

deposit.example:
n. 自然积累，沉积: rich deposits of oil and natural gas 丰富的石油、天然气
v. 存钱: we quickly deposited the check in a bank account 我们火速把支票存入银行账户
deposit.mean:
n. 自然积累，沉积： a natural accumulation (as of iron ore, coal, or gas)
v. 存钱： to put in an account

skirmish.example: n. 小冲突，争论: They had a skirmish over the rules before the debate began. 在辩论开始之前他们就规则而吵了起来。
skirmish.mean: n. 小冲突，争论： a minor or preliminary conflict or dispute

pulchritude.mean: n. 美丽： great physical beauty and appeal

bungle.example: vt. 办糟，失败: bungle a job 搞砸了一项工作
bungle.mean: vt. 办糟，失败： to act or work clumsily and awkwardly

anterior.example:
adj. 前面的: finish the work anterior to the schedule 提早完成任务
adj. 前面的: tests anterior to the college entrance examination 高考前的考试
anterior.mean: adj. 前面的：coming before in time or development

innocuous.example:
adj. 无害的: The government enacted a more strict regulation on innocuous preservatives. 政府对无害防腐剂制定了更为严格的规定
adj. 乏味的，不会引起敌意的: He made an innocuous remark to avoid conflict. 为了避免冲突，他做了一个中庸的评价
innocuous.mean:
adj. 无害的： producing no injury
adj. 乏味的，不会引起敌意的： not likely to give offense or to arouse strong feelings or hostility

sonnet.example: n. 十四行诗: a sonnet that celebrates love 一首歌颂爱情的十四行诗
sonnet.mean: n. 十四行诗： a 14-line verse form usually having one of several conventional rhyme schemes

privation.example: n. 缺乏，穷困: the constant privation of sleep was starting to affect his work 长期以来的睡眠不足开始影响他的工作
privation.mean: n. 缺乏，穷困： lack of what is needed for existence

forfeit.example: n. 罚金: The forfeit for each baseball player involved in the brawl was $5,000. 参加打架的篮球运动员都受到了五千美元的罚款。
forfeit.mean: n. 罚金： a sum of money to be paid as a punishment

quandary.example: n. 困惑，窘境: I've had two job offers, and I'm in a real quandary about/over which one to accept. 我有两个工作机会,但实在是进退两难，不知道应该选哪一个.
quandary.mean: n. 困惑，窘境： a state of perplexity or doubt

bewitching.example: adj. 迷人的，令人着迷的: bewitching woman who has never lacked for suitors 一个从不缺乏追求者的迷人女子
bewitching.mean: adj. 迷人的，令人着迷的： having an often mysterious or magical power to attract

playful.example: adj. 爱开玩笑的，好打闹的: The little girl was lighthearted and playful. 小女孩性格很轻松愉快，喜欢和别人打闹。
playful.mean: adj. 爱开玩笑的，好打闹的： given to good-natured joking or teasing

entangle.example:
vt. 卷入，纠缠: we managed to entangle the string of lights into a hopeless mess of wires 我们将小灯泡的线纠缠成了一堆
v. 使变复杂或困难: the history of Alexander the Great is entangled by variant accounts of his exploits 亚历山大大帝的生平历史被不同版本的记录搞得很纠结
entangle.mean:
vt. 卷入，纠缠： to twist together into a usually confused mass
v. 使变复杂或困难： to make complex or difficult

canard.example: n. 谣传，误传: it's a popular canard that the actress died under scandalous circumstances 有一种广泛的说法声称女演员死于绯闻的压力
canard.mean: n. 谣传，误传： an unfounded or false, deliberately misleading story.

lyric.example:
n. （可以哼唱的）小曲: The guitarist improvised and sang a gentle lyric while playing. 吉他手在弹奏的过程中即兴创作并哼唱了一首小曲
adj. 如诗歌般流畅甜美的: The film's lyric photography really enhanced its romantic mood. 电影中如诗歌般的图像效果着实增强了浪漫的氛围
lyric.mean:
n. （可以哼唱的）小曲： a short musical composition for the human voice often with instrumental accompaniment
adj. 如诗歌般流畅甜美的： having a pleasantly flowing quality suggestive of poetry or music

dyspeptic.example: adj. 脾气坏的: The sultry day makes us dyspeptic. 闷热潮湿的天气让我们变得脾气暴躁
dyspeptic.mean:
adj. 脾气坏的：bad-tempered
adj. 消化不良的：pertaining to, subject to, or suffering from dyspepsia

solder.example: v. 连接，联合: Wires are soldered onto the circuit board. 电线被焊接在电路板上。‖The agreement soldered the factions into an alliance. 两个派系因这份协议而结成同盟。
solder.mean: v. 连接，联合： to join or unite

vocation.example: n. 职业: finally made soccer her vocation instead of just a hobby 终于将足球从爱好升级为谋生的职业
vocation.mean: n. 职业： the work in which a person is regularly employed

pointer.example:
n. （仪表上的）指针: The pointer on my bathroom scale must be stuck - I know I lost weight. 浴室磅秤里的指针肯定坏了——我知道我体重有下降的。
n. 忠告，建议: Here are a few pointers to help you make a choice. 这里有一些能帮助你抉择的建议。
pointer.mean:
n. （仪表上的）指针： a scale indicator on a watch, balance, or other measuring instrument
n. 忠告，建议： a useful suggestion or hintusually from an expert

worship.example:
n. 崇拜，敬仰: the belief in swords and the worship of force 刀剑信仰与武力崇拜
v. 崇拜，膜拜: The ancient Greeks worshipped many different gods. 古希腊人崇拜不同的神明。
worship.mean:
n. 崇拜，敬仰： extravagant respect to an object of esteem
v. 崇拜，膜拜： to offer honor or respect to (someone) as a divine power

unwonted.example: adj. 不习惯的，不寻常的: honored for the unwonted courage he showed in battle 因在战争中表现出的过人的勇气受到嘉奖
unwonted.mean: adj. 不习惯的，不寻常的： not habitual or ordinary; unusual

sacrosanct.example: adj. 极为神圣的，不可侵犯的: The teacher's book of grades is sacrosanct, and someone could be expelled for changing anything in it. 老师记录的成绩小册子是极为神圣的，任何篡改它的人可能受到被退学的惩罚。
sacrosanct.mean: adj. 极为神圣的，不可侵犯的： most sacred or holy

trifle.example:
n. 不重要的事: Let us not speak of trifles when our nation may be going to war. 战事在即，我们还是先放下这些琐事吧。
vi. 不正经地对待，玩弄: Do not trifle with me unless you mean to ask me to marry you. 如果你不是真心想和我结婚，就请不要来玩弄我的感情。
trifle.mean:
n. 不重要的事： something of little importance or value
vi. 不正经地对待，玩弄： to behave amorously without serious intent

redoubtable.example:
adj. 杰出的，值得尊敬的: a surprising discovery by one of the most redoubtable figures in Egyptian archaeology 埃及考古学领域最值得敬重的人物之一所做出的一个惊人发现
