adj. 可怕的: His next opponent would be by far the most redoubtable adversary the young boxer had ever faced. 年轻的拳击手的下一个对手将会是迄今为止他见过的最可怕的敌人
redoubtable.mean:
adj. 杰出的，值得尊敬的： worthy of respect or honor
adj. 可怕的： arousing fear or awe

avid.example:
adj. 急切渴望的: avid movie fans 急切的影迷
adj. 贪婪（钱财）的: She stared at the jewels with an avid glint in his eye. 她带着贪婪的目光注视着那些珠宝
avid.mean:
adj. 急切渴望的： marked by keen interest and enthusiasm
adj. 贪婪（钱财）的： having or marked by an eager and often selfish desire especially for material possessions

despotic.example: adj. 专制的，暴虐的: a despotic tyrant 专制的暴君
despotic.mean: adj. 专制的，暴虐的： arbitrary, autocratic, monocratic, tyrannical

acknowledge.example: vt. 承认: He refused to acknowledge the fact that her daughter has gone. 他拒绝承认女儿已经死去的事实。
acknowledge.mean: vt. 承认： to admit the existence, reality, or truth of

lackluster.example: adj. 黯淡无光泽的: lackluster hair 黯淡无光的头发
lackluster.mean: adj. 黯淡无光泽的： lacking brightness, luster, or vitality

plethora.example: n. 过量，过剩: a plethora of advice and a paucity of assistance 给出大量建议而鲜有实质性援助
plethora.mean: n. 过量，过剩： excess, superfluity

suffocate.example: vt. 使窒息: The law requires the owner of a discarded refrigerator to remove its door so that a child won't get trapped inside and suffocate. 法律要求废弃冰箱的所有者移除箱门，从而防止儿童被困其中而窒息致死。
suffocate.mean: vt. 使窒息： to deprive of oxygen

pervade.example: vt. 弥漫，充满: The mixed smell of sawdust and glue pervaded the whole factory. 锯末与胶水的味道弥漫了整个工厂‖the corruption that pervades every stratum of society 充斥在社会每个阶层中的腐败
pervade.mean: vt. 弥漫，充满： to be present throughout; permeate

antipathy.example:
n. 厌恶，反感: I feel no antipathy towards any of my opponents in the tournament. 我对锦标赛中碰到的任何对手都不存在反感。
n. 令人反感的事物: Cruelty to animals is one of my most deeply felt antipathies. 虐待动物是最让我反感的行为之一。
antipathy.mean:
n. 厌恶，反感： settled aversion or dislike
n. 令人反感的事物： an object of aversion

petition.example:
n. 请愿，正式的申请: a petition for divorce 离婚申请书
v. （尤指正式地）请求: She is petitioning to regain custody of the child. 为了重新获得孩子的监护权，她提出了正式申请
petition.mean:
n. 请愿，正式的申请： a solemn supplication or request to a superior authority; an entreaty
v. （尤指正式地）请求： to make a request, especially a formal written one

morbid.example:
adj. 病态的: exhibit a morbid fascination 展现出一种病态的迷恋
adj. 思想性格变态的: read the account of the murder with a morbid interest 怀着病态的心态读谋杀报告
morbid.mean:
adj. 病态的： affected with or induced by disease
adj. 思想性格变态的： characterized by preoccupation with unwholesome thoughts or feelings

tonic.example: dj. 滋补的，有益健康的: tonic medicine 补药
tonic.mean: dj. 滋补的，有益健康的： producing or stimulating physical, mental, or emotional vigor; beneficial to the health of body or mind

cling.example:
n. 粘结，粘合: For certain types of materials that plastic wrap has very little cling. 对于某些材料，那种塑料保鲜袋的粘性不好。
vi. 紧贴，支持: a dozen magnets clinging to the refrigerator 贴靠在冰箱门上的磁石‖continued to cling to the old ideas of child rearing long after they had gone out of fashion 仍然坚持关于抚养孩子的老观念，尽管它们已经过时
cling.mean:
n. 粘结，粘合： a physical sticking to as if by glue
vi. 紧贴，支持： to adhere as if glued firmly

disparate.example: adj. 迥然不同的: This couple of seemingly disparate topics have something in common. 这两个看似无关的主题其实有些相同之处。
disparate.mean: adj. 迥然不同的：fundamentally distinct or different in kind; entirely dissimilar

chromatic.example: adj. 彩色的: the chromatic paintings of Matisse and the other Fauvists 马蒂斯和其他野兽派画家的彩色画
chromatic.mean: adj. 彩色的： relating to colors or color

emollient.example: adj. 起缓和作用的: soothe us in our grieves with emollient words 用安慰的话语抚平我们的悲伤
emollient.mean: adj. 起缓和作用的： making less intense or harsh

hale.example:
adj. 强壮的，健壮的: a hale and hearty old lady 硬朗矍铄的老奶奶
v. 拖，拉: the fishermen haled the huge net onto the deck of the ship 渔民们将巨大的渔网拖到渔船甲板上
hale.mean:
adj. 强壮的，健壮的： free from infirmity or illness; sound
v. 拖，拉： to cause to follow by applying steady force on

willy-nilly.example:
adv. 不论是否愿意的（地）: After her boss fell sick, she willy-nilly found herself directing the project. 在她老板生病后，她发现自己不论愿不愿意，都得指导这项工程。
adj. 无秩序的，随意的: willy-nilly taxing laws 杂乱无序的税收法
willy-nilly.mean:
adv. 不论是否愿意的（地）： whether desired or not
adj. 无秩序的，随意的： without order or plan

pinnacle.example: n. 顶峰: a singer who has reached the pinnacle of career 已到达事业巅峰的歌手
pinnacle.mean: n. 顶峰： the highest point of development or achievement

erudite.example: adj. 博学的: an erudite scholar 渊博的学者
erudite.mean: adj. 博学的： characterized by erudition; learned

expedite.example: vt. 加快进程: expedite your plans 加快你的计划
expedite.mean: vt. 加快进程： to speed up the progress of; accelerate

rescind.example: vt. 废除，取消: The government refused to rescind the order of curfew. 政府拒绝撤销宵禁的决定。
rescind.mean: vt. 废除，取消： to make void

occult.example:
adj. 难以理解的: an occult reference in the text that has puzzled scholars 文章中一处晦涩的难倒了学者们的引注
v. 使隐藏或神秘: occulted their house from prying eyes by planting large trees around it 在住所周围种满大树防止别人偷窥 || the actor's private life had long been occulted by a contrived public persona 演员的私人生活被一个精心打造的公众形象所遮掩
occult.mean:
adj. 难以理解的： not easily apprehended or understood : abstruse, mysterious
v. 使隐藏或神秘： to keep secret or shut off from view

eleemosynary.example: adj. 慈善的: an eleemosynary foundation funded by the Bill Gates 由比尔?盖茨夫妇资助的慈善基金
eleemosynary.mean: adj. 慈善的： of, relating to, or supported by charity

placate.example: vt. （通过让步以）平息抚慰: The colonists implemented a new policy to placate local opposition 殖民者采取新政策以缓和当地的反抗情绪。
placate.mean: vt. （通过让步以）平息抚慰： to lessen the anger or agitation of

taut.example:
adj. 紧绷的: taut muscles 紧实的肌肉
adj. 整洁的: a taunt ship 保养得不错的船
taut.mean:
adj. 紧绷的： not loose or flabby
adj. 整洁的： kept in proper order or condition, kept in trim shape; neat and tidy

stabilize.example: vt./vi. 使稳定；变得稳定: a policy that intended to stabilize the situation in Iraq 一项旨在维护伊拉克局势稳定的政策‖The country's population has stabilized at 3.2 million. 这个国家的人口维持在三百二十万。
stabilize.mean: vt./vi. 使稳定；变得稳定： to make stable, steadfast, or firm; to become stable, steadfast, or fixed

deify.example:
v. 把…当作神来崇拜: some ancient pagans deified such objects of nature as trees and rivers 很多古代的异教徒拿一些自然事物比如树木，河流来崇拜
v. 过分喜爱: materialistic people who deify money 那些眼里只有钱的物质之人
v. 尊敬尊崇: Valentino was virtually deified by legions of female fans. 瓦伦蒂诺被大批女粉丝崇拜。
deify.mean:
v. 把…当作神来崇拜： to offer honor or respect to (someone) as a divine power
v. 过分喜爱： to love or admire too much
v. 尊敬尊崇： to assign a high status or value to

promulgate.example: vt. 正式宣布: The law was promulgated in June 1988. 法律在1988年6月出台。
promulgate.mean: vt. 正式宣布： to make known openly or publicly

valediction.example: n. 告别词: a valediction given by the college president upon his retirement 大学校长退休时的告别演说
valediction.mean:
n. 告别： an act of bidding farewell
n. 告别词： an address or statement of farewell or leave-taking

lachrymose.example: adj.催人泪下的，悲伤的: The lachrymose mourners at the funeral required a steady supply of tissues. 葬礼上多愁善感的哀悼者对纸巾提出了巨大的需求
lachrymose.mean: adj.催人泪下的，悲伤的：tending to cause tears, mournful

furtive.example: adj. 鬼鬼祟祟的；秘密的: a furtive glance at her 朝她投去的隐秘一瞥
furtive.mean: adj. 鬼鬼祟祟的；秘密的： done by stealth

quarantine.example: n. 隔离: The cows will be kept in quarantine for another two weeks. 牛群还需要被隔离观察两周。
quarantine.mean: n. 隔离： to isolate from normal relations or communication

retrieve.example: vt. 寻回，找回: I needed to retrieve the book from my friend so I could return it to the library. 我需要先把书从朋友那里拿回来才能还给图书馆。
retrieve.mean: vt. 寻回，找回： to get back again

surfeit.example: v./n. 过量，饮食过度: He surfeited himself with chocolate. 他巧克力吃多了
surfeit.mean: v./n. 过量，饮食过度： to feed or supply to excess

treacherous.example: adj. 背叛的: a treacherous ally 不忠的盟友
treacherous.mean: adj. 背叛的： marked by betrayal of fidelity, confidence, or trust

supplant.example: vt. 排挤，篡夺…的位置: Old traditions were fading away and being supplanted by modern ways. 老传统逐渐式微，被现代方式取代。
supplant.mean: vt. 排挤，篡夺…的位置： to usurp the place of, especially through intrigue or underhanded tactics

solvent.example:
adj. 有偿付能力的: They're going to have to prove that the company is now solvent. 接下来他们必须要证明公司的偿贷能力。
n. 溶剂: Some organic solvents, such as benzene, pyridine, furan, are poisonous to human’s reproductive system. 一些有机溶剂（比如苯、吡啶、呋喃）对人体的生殖系统有毒性。
solvent.mean:
adj. 有偿付能力的： able to pay all legal debts
n. 溶剂： a substance in which another substance is dissolved, forming a solution

aloof.example: adj. 孤高的，不合群的: an aloof church 一座孤零零的教堂； stood apart with aloof dignity 带着超然的尊严站在一旁
aloof.mean: adj. 孤高的，不合群的：removed or distant either physically or emotionally

summon.example:
vt. 召集，召唤: The general summoned all his troops before the operation. 行动之前，将军把所有的部队召集到了一起。
vt. 传唤（出庭、出席）: was summoned to answer charges 他被传唤出庭应对起诉
summon.mean:
vt. 召集，召唤： to call together
vt. 传唤（出庭、出席）： to command by service of a summons, especially to appear in court

propitiate.example: vt. 慰抚，劝解: the temple was built to honor the gods in times of plenty and to propitiate them in times of trouble 该庙宇的作用是，丰收之时感谢神明，有难之时安抚神明
propitiate.mean: vt. 慰抚，劝解： to conciliate (an offended power); appease

pithy.example: adj. 精练的，简洁的: The professor gave a pithy introduction to this course. 教授就这门课程做了简短的介绍。
pithy.mean: adj. 精练的，简洁的： precisely meaningful; forceful and brief

susceptibility.example: n. 易受感染的性质或状态: A weak immune system causes increased susceptibility to disease. 弱的免疫系统会增大患病的概率。
susceptibility.mean: n. 易受感染的性质或状态： the quality or state of having little resistance to some outside agent

giddy.example:
adj. 轻浮不严肃的: teach a bunch of giddy Girl Scouts how to make a fire 教一群漫不经心的女童子军如何生火
adj. 喜悦的: He's clearly giddy at the news that his ailing grandfather will be fine. 听到他祖父的病将无大恙，他的喜悦之情溢于言表
giddy.mean:
adj. 轻浮不严肃的： lacking in seriousness or maturity
adj. 喜悦的： joyfully elated

flaccid.example: adj. 不结实的，松弛的: flaccid muscles 松弛的肌肉
flaccid.mean: adj. 不结实的，松弛的： not firm or stiff; lacking normal or youthful firmness

accomplish.example: vt. 完成，实现: I don’t think we can accomplish our goal unless we cooperate. 我认为只有合作才能实现我们的目标。
accomplish.mean: vt. 完成，实现： to carry through (as a process) to completion

concur.example:
vi. 同意: concur with an excellent opinion 同意一个好的想法
v. 同一时间发生、存在: The race to the moon, the Vietnam War, and the civil rights movement all concurred in the 1960s. 登月，越战和人权运动都发生在二十世纪六十年代。
v. 团结合作: All people concurred to pass the reform legislation 所有人都联合起来使改革的法案通过。
concur.mean:
vi. 同意：to express agreement
v. 同一时间发生、存在：to occur or exist at the same time
v. 团结合作：to participate or assist in a joint effort to accomplish an end

stitch.example: n. 突然剧痛: He had to drop out of the race when the stitch in his side became too painful. 因为他突然感到剧痛，所以不得不放弃比赛。
stitch.mean: n. 突然剧痛： a sharp unpleasant sensation usually felt in some specific part of the body

jingoist.example: n. 极端爱国激进分子（通常表现为好战的对外政策）: jingoists who cry for war 叫嚣着鼓吹开战的激进分子
jingoist.mean: n. 极端爱国激进分子（通常表现为好战的对外政策）： extreme chauvinism or nationalism marked especially by a belligerent foreign policy

belligerence.example: n. 好斗，好战: Among the Native American tribes of the colonial period, the Iroquois were known for their belligerence. 在殖民时期的美洲土著部落中，易洛魁人因为他们的好战而著名。
belligerence.mean: n. 好斗，好战： an aggressive or truculent attitude, atmosphere, or disposition

condole.example: vi. 表达同情: We condole with him on the death of his father. 我们对他父亲的死向他深表同情。
condole.mean: vi. 表达同情：to express sympathetic sorrow

extrapolate.example: vt. （通过逻辑）推断: We can extrapolate from past economic recessions the probable course of the current one. 通过以往经济衰退的原因我们可以推断出本次危机的可能起源。
extrapolate.mean: vt. （通过逻辑）推断： to form an opinion or reach a conclusion through reasoning and information

nominal.example:
adj. 不重要的: His involvement was nominal. 他的参与不太重要。
adj. 名义上的: nominal head of the party 党派的名义首领
nominal.mean:
adj. 不重要的： so small or unimportant as to warrant little or no attention
adj. 名义上的： existing or being something in name or form only

imperative.example:
n. 命令: a secretary of defense who was fond of issuing harshly worded imperatives 一个很喜欢发布措辞严厉的命令的国防部长
adj. 命令的，强制性的: requests that grew more and more imperative 命令性越来越强的请求
adj. 迫切的: an imperative need for medical supplies in the earthquake-ravaged country 地震灾区国家对于医疗物资的迫切需求
adj. 必要的: Proper equipment is imperative for the success of this chemical experiment. 合适的仪器是这个化学实验成功必不可少的条件
imperative.mean:
n. 命令： a statement of what to do that must be obeyed by those concerned
adj. 命令的，强制性的：forcing one's compliance or participation by or as if by law
adj. 迫切的： needing immediate attention
adj. 必要的： impossible to do without

rational.example:
adj. 合乎逻辑的: He insisted there was a rational explanation for the strange creaking noises and that there were no such things as ghosts. 他坚持认为奇怪的咯吱声一定有一个合理的解释，而不是所谓的鬼在作怪。
adj. 理性的: Betting all of your savings on the lottery is not a rational move. 把你所有的存款赌在彩票上可不是一个理智的决定。
rational.mean:
adj. 合乎逻辑的： consistent with or based on reason; logical
adj. 理性的： based on sound reasoning or information

instate.example: vt. 任命: The new Secretary of the Treasury was instated on Monday. 新的财政部长于星期一被任命
instate.mean: vt. 任命： to set or establish in a rank or office

viable.example: adj. 可行的: a viable solution to the problem 解决问题的一个可行方案
viable.mean: adj. 可行的： capable of being done or carried out

insular.example: adj. （观念、想法等）孤立狭隘的: the insular thinking of peasant communities 农民阶级的狭隘思想
insular.mean: adj. （观念、想法等）孤立狭隘的： being, having, or reflecting a narrow provincial viewpoint

ascendant.example:
adj. 有影响力的，主宰的: This idea was in the ascendant. 这种思想处于主导地位。
adj. 上升的: The teacher told the students to write even numbers in ascendant order. 老师让学生们按升序写出偶数。
ascendant.mean:
adj. 有影响力的，主宰的：dominant in position or influence; superior.
adj. 上升的：moving upward : rising

plodder.example: n. 行走缓慢的人: The guide halted the tour group so that the plodders who had fallen behind could catch up. 导游让队伍停下来，以便那些落在后头的行动缓慢的人可以跟上。
plodder.mean: n. 行走缓慢的人： someone who moves slowly or more slowly than others

carp.example: vi. 对小事吹毛求疵，挑剔: carped about the order of names on the wedding invitations 对于婚礼请柬上的名单顺序吹毛求疵
carp.mean:
vi. 对小事吹毛求疵，挑剔： to make often peevish criticisms or objections about matters that are minor, unimportant, or irrelevant
v. 没完没了地表现不满意： to express dissatisfaction, pain, or resentment usually tiresomely

virtuoso.example:
n. 艺术鉴赏家，专家: a violin virtuoso 资深小提琴艺术家
adj. 经验丰富的，技艺精湛的: The American virtuoso cellist Lynn Harrell joins the orchestra as soloist in Shostakovich’s technically challenging Cello Concerto No 2. 来自美国的技艺精湛的大提琴家林恩?哈雷尔作为独奏者加入了乐队，共同演绎肖斯塔科维奇充满挑战的《第二大提琴协奏曲》。
virtuoso.mean:
n. 艺术鉴赏家，专家： a person with masterly skill or technique in the arts
adj. 经验丰富的，技艺精湛的： having or showing exceptional knowledge, experience, or skill in a field of endeavor

mime.example: v. 模仿: miming a dog begging for food 模仿小狗乞食
mime.mean: v. 模仿： to use (someone or something) as the model for one's speech, mannerisms, or behavior

gaffe.example:
n. （社交上）失礼，失态: A gaffe is when a politician tells the truth. —— Michael Kinsley 所谓出丑，就是政治家说真话的时候（迈克?金斯利）
n. 明显的错误，错误判断: so-called debates, which were mainly about seeing which candidate made the most gaffes 所谓的辩论，其实主要就是看哪个选手犯了最多的错误
gaffe.mean:
n. （社交上）失礼，失态： a social or diplomatic blunder
n. 明显的错误，错误判断： a blatant mistake or misjudgment

ominous.example: adj. 凶兆的: an ominous threat of war 战争来临的凶兆
ominous.mean: adj. 凶兆的： of or being an omen, especially an evil one

inevitable.example: adj. 不可避免的，必然的: The impact of the scandal on the election was inevitable. 丑闻对于选举的冲击是不可避免的
inevitable.mean: adj. 不可避免的，必然的： incapable of being avoided or evaded

vestige.example: n. 微小的遗迹，小痕迹: A few strange words carved on a stone were the only vestige of the lost civilization. 石碑上刻着的几个奇怪的字符是这个失落文明的唯一的遗迹。‖the fossilized vestige of a dinosaur that traversed that muddy landscape millions of years ago 千万年横跨那块泥泞土壤的恐龙的化石碎片
vestige.mean: n. 微小的遗迹，小痕迹： the smallest quantity or trace

homily.example: n. 冗长乏味的道德讲演或训诫: a TV movie filled with the usual hokey homilies about people triumphing over life's adversities 一档说教性质的、充满了介绍逆境中的人们如何成就自我的电视节目
homily.mean: n. 冗长乏味的道德讲演或训诫： an idea or expression that has been used by many people

acquiesce.example: v. 勉强同意；默许: acquiesce to my own fleecing 默许我的敲竹杠行为
acquiesce.mean: v. 勉强同意；默许： to accept, comply, or submit tacitly or passively

panoramic.example: adj. 全景的: a panorama of American history 美国历史总览
panoramic.mean: adj. 全景的： of an unobstructed or complete view of an area in every direction

deprivation.example: n. 匮乏: serious sleep deprivation caused by long work hours 由长时间工作导致的严重睡眠不足
deprivation.mean: n. 匮乏： the condition of being deprived; privation

clarion.example: adj. 清楚响亮的: clarion call for democracy 对民主的高声呼吁 || The Internationale is a clarion call to the labouring people of the world. 《国际歌》是唤起全世界劳动人民的响亮号角。
clarion.mean: adj. 清楚响亮的：loud and clear

initiate.example: vt. 创始，发动促进: a chain reaction initiated by UV irradiation 紫外光激发引起的连锁反应
initiate.mean:
vt. 创始，发动促进： to cause or facilitate the beginning of
n. 刚入门的新手： a person who is undergoing or has undergone an initiation

quibble.example:
vi. 吹毛求疵: she spent the entire evening quibbling about the historical inaccuracies in the television series on World War II 她一整晚都在对那个关于二战的电视剧里的历史错误吹毛求疵
n. 牵强之词: My only quibble about the trip was that it rained a lot. 我对旅行唯一的小不满就是下雨有点多。
quibble.mean:
vi. 吹毛求疵： to find fault or criticize for petty reasons; cavil
n. 牵强之词：微不足道的差别或不切中要点的异议，小反对： a minor objection or criticism

desultory.example:
adj. 无计划、无目的的: a desultory search for something of interest on TV 漫无目的的换台
adj. 令人失望的: a desultory fifth place finish 让人失望的第五名
desultory.mean:
adj. 无计划、无目的的： lacking a definite plan, purpose, or pattern
adj. 令人失望的： disappointing in progress, performance, or quality

novice.example: n. 新手，初学者: a novice chess player 象棋初学者
novice.mean: n. 新手，初学者： a person new to a field or activity

frequent.example:
v. 时常拜访: to frequent opera houses 时常造访歌剧院
adj.时常发生的，重复再现的: He used to make frequent trips to Los Angeles 他从前经常前往洛杉矶旅行
frequent.mean:
v. 时常拜访： to pay frequent visits to; be in or at often
adj.时常发生的，重复再现的：happening at short intervals; often repeated or occurring

exotic.example: adj. 外来的，不同寻常的: famous for her exotic tastes 她以有异域风情著称
exotic.mean: adj. 外来的，不同寻常的： excitingly or mysteriously unusual

feign.example: vt. 制造假象，装出…的样子: I would never feign illness just to postpone a test. 我绝不会为了缓考而装病
feign.mean: vt. 制造假象，装出…的样子： to give a false appearance of

suspend.example:
vi. 暂停，中止: suspended the trial 暂停审判
vt. 悬挂: suspended a banner proclaiming the town's “Heritage Days” from the archway 在拱门上方悬挂了一条庆祝“遗产日”的条幅
suspend.mean:
vi. 暂停，中止： to bring to a formal close for a period of time
vt. 悬挂： hang

symmetry.example: n. 对称: The building has perfect symmetry. 这栋房子是完美的对称构造。

distal.example: adj. 远离中心的，（神经）末梢的: the distal end of nerve 神经末梢
distal.mean: adj. 远离中心的，（神经）末梢的： situated away from the point of attachment or origin or a central point

petulant.example: adj. 易怒的，爱发脾气的: He is a petulant and fussy man who is always blaming everyone else for his problems. 他是一个对细节非常在意而又容易生气的人，还总是把自己的问题怪罪到别人的头上。
petulant.mean: adj. 易怒的，爱发脾气的： easily irritated or annoyed

clumsy.example:
adj. 笨拙的: turn out to be a clumsy sleight of hand 弄巧成拙
adj. 不文雅的: be clumsy on the dance floor 在舞池表现不优雅的
adj. 不精致的hastily or roughly constructed
: A clumsy mock-up of the real thing 一个粗糙的实物模型
clumsy.mean:
adj. 笨拙的：lacking or showing a lack of nimbleness in using one's hands；a lack of skill and tact
adj. 不文雅的：lacking social grace and assurance；showing an inability to move in a graceful manner
adj. 不精致的hastily or roughly constructed

chide.example: v. 责备: My wife chided me for forgetting to offer our guests some refreshments. 我妻子责备我忘记给客人们点心。
chide.mean: v. 责备：to scold mildly so as to correct or improve

periodical.mean:
n. 期刊： a publication that appears at regular intervals
adj. 周期性的，有固定间隔的： occurring or recurring at regular intervals

demote.example: vt. 降职，降级: The court-martial’s decision was to demote the officer responsible for the failed mission. 军事法庭决定对为此次失败任务负责的军官进行降职处理。
demote.mean: vt. 降职，降级： to reduce to a lower grade or rank

tame.example:
adj. 被驯化的: Every evening, a wild Canada goose is at the food trough with our tame geese. 每天傍晚的食槽边总会出现一只野生加拿大鹅和我们的饲养家鹅一起进食。
adj. 无聊的，乏味的: That action movie was so tame I fell asleep about 20 minutes into it. 那部动作片实在是太无聊了，我刚开场二十分钟就睡着了。
vt. 控制，抑制: Try to tame your language when you are in front of the kids. 在孩子面前注意一下你的措辞。
tame.mean:
adj. 被驯化的： reduced from a state of native wildness especially so as to be tractable and useful to humans
adj. 无聊的，乏味的： lacking spirit, zest, interest, or the capacity to excite
vt. 控制，抑制： to keep from exceeding a desirable degree or level (as of expression)

languish.example: vi. 变得衰弱: languishing during the prolonged heat wave 在持续的热浪下变得虚弱
languish.mean: vi. 变得衰弱： to be or become feeble, weak, or enervated

disinterested.example:
adj. 公正的，无偏见的: a disinterested decision 公正的决定
adj. 没有兴趣的: The city's philistines, naturally disinterested in art, voted to cut the museum's budget. 城市里对艺术本来就不感兴趣的俗人们，投票表决要缩进博物馆的预算。
disinterested.mean:
adj. 公正的，无偏见的： free from selfish motive or interest: unbiased
adj. 没有兴趣的： having or showing a lack of interest or concern

categorical.example: adj. 没有例外的，无条件限制的，绝对的: a categorical denial 完全的否认
categorical.mean: adj. 没有例外的，无条件限制的，绝对的： being without exception or qualification; absolute

murky.example:
adj. 黯淡的，昏暗的: I didn't like walking around the murky campground without a flashlight. 我不喜欢在没有手电的情况下在营地里走动
adj. 模糊的，晦涩的: He felt lost in the murky bureaucratic rhetoric. 他感觉自己被官僚主义的晦涩说辞弄晕了
murky.mean:
adj. 黯淡的，昏暗的： being without light or without much light
adj. 模糊的，晦涩的： lacking clarity or distinctness

callous.example: adj. 无同情心的, 冷漠的: a callous indifference to the suffering of others 对他人的痛苦的漠不关心
callous.mean: adj. 无同情心的, 冷漠的： emotionally hardened; unfeeling

insentient.example:
adj. 无感觉，无知觉的: He refused to believe that the universe as we know it evolved from the random interactions of insentient particles of matter. 他拒绝相信我们所知的宇宙是经由无生命的粒子间的相互作用演化而来的
adj. 一知半解的，略懂的: an insentient therapist who failed to see what the teenager's real problem was 一个对这名青少年的真正问题所在一知半解的医生
insentient.mean:
adj. 无感觉，无知觉的： lacking perception, consciousness, or animation
adj. 一知半解的，略懂的： not having or showing a deep understanding of something

plastic.example:
adj. 可塑的: the plastic quality of modeling clay 模型泥的可塑性质
adj. 虚假的，做作的: There's usually a plastic cordiality at these corporate events. 通常在公司的活动上都有一种虚假的热情和友好。
plastic.mean:
adj. 可塑的： susceptible of being modified in form or nature
adj. 虚假的，做作的： lacking in natural or spontaneous quality

purloin.example: vt. 偷窃: fearing that someone might attempt to purloin a copy of the script for the show's season finale 害怕该剧的完季那集剧本被盗
purloin.mean: vt. 偷窃： to steal, often in a violation of trust

brevity.example:
n. 简短，简洁: the best quality a graduation speech can have is brevity 好的毕业演讲必须简洁
n. 精炼: if brevity is the soul of wit, then that speech wasn't at all witty 如果说精炼是智慧的灵魂，那么演讲毫无智慧可言
brevity.mean:
n. 简短，简洁： shortness of duration
n. 精炼： the quality or state of being marked by or using only few words to convey much meaning

dissipate.example:
vt. 驱散: The wind finally dissipated the smoke. 风终于吹散了雾气。
vt. 浪费: dissipate too much time and effort 挥霍了太多的时间与精力
dissipate.mean:
vt. 驱散： to drive away; disperse.
vt. 浪费： to spend or expend intemperately or wastefully: squander
vi. 放纵： to indulge in the intemperate pursuit of pleasure, especially : to drink to excess

escort.example:
n. 护卫队，护送者: The mayor served as the First Lady's escort for her tour of the city. 市长陪同第一夫人参观了城市。
vt. 同行，护送: Asenior student from the college escorted my parents and me on our tour of the campus. 来自学院的一个师兄陪同我和我父母参观了校园。‖a VIP escorted by an army of bodyguards and journalists 被一群保镖和记者包围的重要人物
escort.mean:
n. 护卫队，护送者： a person or group of persons accompanying another to give protection or as a courtesy
vt. 同行，护送： to go along with in order to provide assistance, protection, or companionship

convention.example:
n. 常规，习俗: By convention, north is at the top of most maps. 按照常规，北方在大多数地图上指向上
n. 公约，协议: Under this circumstance Geneva convention does not comply. 此情形下《日内瓦公约》无效
n. 大会，集会: attended a convention of mathematicians in California 参加了加州数学家的一次集会
convention.mean:
n. 常规，习俗： general agreement on or acceptance of certain practices or attitudes
n. 公约，协议： a general agreement about basic principles or procedures
n. 大会，集会： a coming together of a number of persons for a specified purpose

daunt.example: vt. 使胆怯，吓倒: She was not at all daunted by the size of the problem. 她根本没有被问题的大小给吓倒。
daunt.mean: vt. 使胆怯，吓倒： to lessen the courage or confidence of

gaudy.example: adj. 俗丽的: gaudy movie posters 俗丽的电影海报
gaudy.mean: adj. 俗丽的： ostentatiously or tastelessly ornamented, excessively showy

blazon.example:
vt. 使知名: Their very public canoodling has pretty much blazoned the fact that they are having an affair. 他们彼此间公开的亲昵举动让他们之间的恋情大白于天下
v. 修饰，装扮: The university’s dormitory has been blazoned with banners celebrating graduation. 学校宿舍被那些庆祝毕业的横幅所装点
blazon.mean:
vt. 使知名： to make known openly or publicly
v. 修饰，装扮： to make more attractive by adding something that is beautiful or becoming

indoctrinate.example: vt. 教育，灌输思想: indoctrinate students with the notion of egalitarianism 向学生灌输平等主义的思想
indoctrinate.mean: vt. 教育，灌输思想： to instruct especially in fundamentals or rudiments

wax.example:
vt. 用蜡涂、处理或上光: wax the floor 给地板打蜡
vi. 增大，增强: The commitment of the young volunteers to the cause seems to wax. 青年志愿者们对于这项事业的投入似乎在增多。
wax.mean:
vi. 月亮渐满： to increase in phase or intensity, used chiefly of the moon, other satellites, and inferior planets
vt. 用蜡涂、处理或上光： to coat (something) with a slippery substance in order to reduce friction
vi. 增大，增强： to increase in size, numbers, strength, prosperity, or intensity

repatriate.example: vt. 遣返: As soon as the war ends, the government will start to repatriate war refugees. 只要战争一结束，政府就会开始遣返战争难民。
repatriate.mean: vt. 遣返： to restore or return to the country of origin, allegiance, or citizenship

padding.example: n. 夸张，废话: that feature writer is sometimes guilty of padding, but he keeps it from getting out of hand 这作者有时候夸夸其谈，但是保持了适度
padding.mean: n. 夸张，废话： the representation of something in terms that go beyond the facts

disabuse.example: v. 打消错误念头，纠正: disabuse sb. of the notion that… 打消某人的…观点 || I must disabuse you of your feelings of grandeur. 我必须去消除你的傲气。
disabuse.mean: v. 打消错误念头，纠正：to free from error, fallacy, or misconception

interdict.example:
vt. 禁止: Though not interdicted by law, such an action is morally wrong. 尽管这种行为不被法律所禁止，但是道德上来说是不对的
vt. 阻止: Federal agents are able to interdict only a small percentage of the narcotic shipments into the country. 联邦调查员们只能阻止一小部分流入国内的毒品
interdict.mean:
vt. 禁止： to forbid in a usually formal or authoritative manner
vt. 阻止： to stop, seize, or interrupt while in progress or on course

enigma.example: n. 难以理解或解释的事物，谜: The smile on Da Vinci’s masterpiece Mona Lisa has been an enigma for hundred years. 数百年来，达芬奇名作《蒙娜丽莎》上的微笑一直是个不解之谜
enigma.mean: n. 难以理解或解释的事物，谜： something hard to understand or explain

antic.example: adj. 滑稽可笑的: The clown came on with many antic gestures. 小丑上场表演许多滑稽动作。
antic.mean: adj. 滑稽可笑的：characterized by clownish extravagance or absurdity

peck.example:
n. 大量: Now you're in a peck of trouble. 现在你有一堆麻烦了
v. （不情愿地）小口咬: Fashion models never really eat: they just peck at small meals in expensive restaurants. 时装模特们几乎不吃东西——他们只是随便咬一口昂贵餐厅里的食物
peck.mean:
n. 大量： a considerable amount
v. （不情愿地）小口咬： to eat reluctantly and in small bites

heretical.example: adj. 异教的，异端的: the belief that women should be allowed to have careers outside the home was once considered heretical 女人应该拥有自己的事业这一观点一度被认为是异端想法
heretical.mean: adj. 异教的，异端的： departure from established beliefs or standards

infiltrate.example: vt. 秘密潜入: The intelligence staff had been infiltrated by spies. 情报工作人员已经被间谍渗透了
infiltrate.mean: vt. 秘密潜入： to enter or take up positions in gradually or surreptitiously, as for purposes of espionage or takeover

obstreperous.example:
adj. 难驾驭的，任性的: the club's president was at his wits' end with obstreperous members who refused to cooperate 俱乐部主席拿那些不合作的会员一点办法都没有
adj. 吵闹的: an obstreperous crowd protesting the government's immigration policy 一堆吵闹的民众游行抗议政府的移民政策
obstreperous.mean:
adj. 难驾驭的，任性的： stubbornly resistant to control; unruly; given to resisting authority or another's control
adj. 吵闹的： engaging in or marked by loud and insistent cries especially of protest

tangible.example: adj. 确凿的， 真实的: tangible evidence 确凿的证据
tangible.mean:
adj. 可感知的： capable of being perceived
adj. 确凿的， 真实的： possible to be treated as fact; real or concrete

depressed.example:
adj. 不开心，情绪不高的: I was depressed and didn't feel much like going to the party
adj. 生活境况悲催的: a depressed class of people whose living conditions are abominable even by third world standards 境况悲惨的一群人，即使用第三世界标准来看他们的生存条件也是很糟的
depressed.mean:
adj. 不开心，情绪不高的： feeling unhappiness
adj. 生活境况悲催的： kept from having the necessities of life or a healthful environment

cower.example: vi. 畏缩: The dog cowered under the table. 狗吓得蜷缩在桌子下面
cower.mean: vi. 畏缩： to cringe in fear

stammer.example: vi. 口吃，结巴: The frightened child started to stammer. 受惊吓的小孩开始结巴地说话。
stammer.mean: vi. 口吃，结巴： to speak with involuntary pauses or repetitions

scourge.example: n. 祸害: The sheer ubiquity of food seems to be the scourge of humanity, as evidenced by the obesity epidemic. 无所不在的食品似乎要成为人类的罪恶之源了，这一点可以从肥胖病的泛滥得以佐证。
scourge.mean: n. 祸害： a source of harm or misfortune

diplomatic.example: adj. 使用策略的，机智的: be very diplomatic with awkward clients 总是有办法对付难缠的顾客
diplomatic.mean: adj. 使用策略的，机智的： employing tact and conciliation especially in situations of stress

quotidian.example: adj. 平凡的: plagued by a quotidian coughing 每天被咳嗽困扰

distill.example:
vt. 用蒸馏法提高纯度: distill the water before pouring it in the steam iron 在把水倒到熨斗里前蒸馏一下
v. 渗出；滴下: The basement walls distill water every time it rains heavily. 地下室的墙壁每次下大雨都渗出水来。
distill.mean:
vt. 用蒸馏法提高纯度：to increase the concentration of, separate, or purify by or as if by distillation.
v. 渗出；滴下： to fall or let fall in or as if in drops

savant.example: n. 博学之士，学者: a savant in the field of medical ethics 医学伦理方面的专家
savant.mean: n. 博学之士，学者： a person of learning

sere.example: adj. 干枯的，凋萎的: a sere region that can't support agriculture 一片贫瘠不能发展农业的地区
sere.mean: adj. 干枯的，凋萎的： being dried and withered

glossy.example: adj. 平滑的，有光泽的: glossy surface of the floor 平整光亮的地板
glossy.mean: adj. 平滑的，有光泽的： having a smooth, shiny, lustrous surface

blandishment.example: n. 甜言蜜语，讨好某人的话: Our blandishment left her unmoved. 纵使甜言蜜语她也无动于衷
blandishment.mean: n. 甜言蜜语，讨好某人的话： something that tends to coax or cajole

posit.example: vt.假定，断定: The committee posited that he was qualified for the election. 委员会假定他是够格参加选举的。
posit.mean: vt.假定，断定：to assume or affirm the existence of

gobble.example: vt. 狼吞虎咽: Lions gobble their prey. 狮子狼吞虎咽地啃食它们的猎物
gobble.mean: vt. 狼吞虎咽： to swallow or eat greedily

extinguish.example:
vt. 熄灭: the fire in the skillet was quickly extinguished by slamming the lid on 平底锅的火苗很快被水浇灭了
v. 终止: a fatal blunder that extinguished all hope that the team would actually win the play-offs 一个致命的失误使得队伍赢得季后赛的希望完全破灭
extinguish.mean:
vt. 熄灭： to put out (a fire, for example); quench
v. 终止： to bring to a complete end the physical soundness, existence, or usefulness of

proofread.example: vt. 校对: She proofread the paper carefully. 她仔细把论文校对了。
proofread.mean: vt. 校对： to read (copy or proof) in order to find errors and mark corrections

oath.example: n. 誓言: an oath to defend the nation 保卫祖国的誓言
oath.mean: n. 誓言： a solemn, formal declaration or promise to fulfill a pledge

sublime.example:
adj. 崇高的，庄严的: the sublime virtue of having given all one's worldly goods to the poor 将所有财产都捐给穷人的崇高美德
adj. （因为杰出、装光、美丽等而）令人惊叹的: the sublime beauty of the canyon 峡谷令人惊叹的美丽
sublime.mean:
adj. 崇高的，庄严的： of high spiritual, moral, or intellectual worth
adj. （因为杰出、装光、美丽等而）令人惊叹的： tending to inspire awe usually because of elevated quality (as of beauty, nobility, or grandeur) or transcendent excellence

prospect.example:
vi. 探查，勘探: people had arrived in the valley to prospect it for gold 人们来到山谷淘金
n. 期待，被期望的某物: The prospect of a quiet, restful Sunday ended when our basement flooded. 对一个宁静休闲的周日的期待被地下室涨水打破了。
prospect.mean:
vi. 探查，勘探： to go into or range over for purposes of discovery
n. 期待，被期望的某物： the act or state of looking forward to some occurrence

lullaby.example:
n. 催眠曲: sang a lullaby to the baby every night 每晚都给孩子唱摇篮曲
vt. 使镇静，使安心: reclining peacefully on the deck, lullabied by the gentle motion of the ship 躺卧在甲板上，随着船轻轻的颠簸放松下来
lullaby.mean:
n. 催眠曲： a song to quiet children or lull them to sleep
vt. 使镇静，使安心： to free from distress or disturbance

contentious.example:
adj. 引起争论的: contentious contents in a movie 电影中引发争论的内容
adj. 好争论的，好战的: The Tartars were a contentious people who terrorized much of Asia and eastern Europe during the Middle Ages. 鞑靼是一个好斗的民族，他在中世纪时期统治了大片亚洲和东欧的土地
contentious.mean:
adj. 引起争论的： likely to cause contention; argumentative
adj. 好争论的，好战的：exhibiting an often perverse and wearisome tendency to quarrels and disputes

recalcitrant.example: adj. 顽抗的，不顺从的: a recalcitrant teenager 执拗的少年‖The manager worried that the recalcitrant employee would try to undermine his authority. 经理担心那些不听命的员工会削弱它的权威。
recalcitrant.mean: adj. 顽抗的，不顺从的： marked by stubborn resistance to and defiance of authority or guidance

aspersion.example: n. 诽谤，中伤: cast aspersions on my loyalty 诽谤我的忠诚
aspersion.mean: n. 诽谤，中伤：a false or misleading charge meant to harm someone's reputation

polemic.example: n. 争执: The polemic between science and religion has never ceased. 科学和宗教之间的争论从未停息。
polemic.mean: n. 争执： a controversial argument

revolt.example:
vt. 使厌恶，反感: The smell of seafood revolts him. 他对海鲜的腥味十分反感。
vi. 反叛: The revolted against the dictator by burning his palace. 他们通过焚烧宫殿来对抗独裁者。
revolt.mean:
vt. 使厌恶，反感： to fill with disgust or abhorrence
vi. 反叛： to renounce allegiance or subjection (as to a government)

argument.example:
n. 争吵，争论: The couple’s arguments were often loud enough to be heard all over the neighborhood. 这对夫妻吵架的声音往往大到能被邻居听见。
n. （逻辑上的）论证: In his argument the author committed several logical fallacies which undermined its soundness. 在作者的论述中出现了若干逻辑谬误，从而降低了它论证的力度。
n. 观点，论点: It is and will always be my argument that we have too many problems here on earth to concern ourselves with manned trips to Mars. 我现在和以后的观点都将会是：在我们解决地球上的问题之前，不应该花太多的心思考虑载人火星计划的事情。
argument.mean:
n. 争吵，争论： an often noisy or angry expression of differing opinions
n. （逻辑上的）论证： a coherent series of statements leading from a premise to a conclusion
n. 观点，论点： an idea or opinion that is put forth in a discussion or debate

nefarious.example: adj. 极坏的，邪恶的: a nefarious scheme to assassinate the archbishop 企图刺杀大主教的邪恶阴谋
nefarious.mean: adj. 极坏的，邪恶的： flagrantly wicked or impious

salutation.example:
n. 致敬，打招呼（表示欢迎和礼貌）: The veteran stepped forward, raising his hand in salutation. 老兵向前一步，举起手致敬。
n. 表扬: The speaker introduced the evening's honored guest with a lavish salutation. 主持人用大量表扬的话介绍了今晚的嘉宾。
salutation.mean:
n. 致敬，打招呼（表示欢迎和礼貌）： a polite expression of greeting or goodwill
n. 表扬： a formal expression praise

sulk.example: vi. 生气，愠怒: He would sulk for hours whenever he didn’t get what he want. 当他的愿望没被满足时，他会生几个小时的闷气
sulk.mean: vi. 生气，愠怒： to be sullenly aloof or withdrawn, as in silent resentment or protest

sap.example:
vt. 削弱: Weeks of hard work had sapped hum and left him exhausted. 连续几周辛苦工作让他筋疲力尽。
n. 健康，活力: a child full of sap and vivacity 活力满满的孩子
sap.mean:
vt. 削弱： to weaken or exhaust the energy or vitality of
n. 健康，活力： active strength of body or mind

pry.example: v. 刺探: don't go prying into other people's business 别去打探别人的事
pry.mean: v. 刺探： to look or inquire closely, curiously, or impertinently

stolid.example: adj. 无动于衷的，感情麻木的: Her face showed nothing but stolid indifference. 她的脸上只露出了麻木和冷漠。
stolid.mean: adj. 无动于衷的，感情麻木的： having or revealing little emotion or sensibility

preservative.example: n. 防腐剂: containing no chemical preservative 不含化学防腐剂
preservative.mean: n. 防腐剂： an additive used to protect against decay, discoloration, or spoilage

byzantine.example: adj. 错综复杂的: a bill to simplify the byzantine tax structure 一项试图简化繁琐税收制度的提案
byzantine.mean: adj. 错综复杂的： complicated or secretive, having many parts or aspects that are usually interrelated

squat.example: adj. 又矮又胖的: a squat but adroit craftsman 一个又胖又矮，但是手艺灵巧的工匠
squat.mean: adj. 又矮又胖的： being compact and broad in build and often short in stature

sanctimonious.example: adj. 假装虔诚的: a sickening sanctimonious smile 令人厌恶的伪善的笑容
sanctimonious.mean: adj. 假装虔诚的： hypocritically pious or devout

thrill.example:
n. 强烈的兴奋感，快感: Everyone gets a real thrill out of the Independence Day fireworks. 每个人都因独立日的焰火表演而感到无比的兴奋。
vt. 使兴奋，使激动: I was thrilled to hear that you got the promotion that you’d been so desperately wanting. 听到你终于获得了梦寐已久的升迁，我感到非常激动。
thrill.mean:
n. 强烈的兴奋感，快感： a pleasurably intense stimulation of the feelings
vt. 使兴奋，使激动： a pleasurably intense stimulation of the feelings

knead.example: vt. 揉捏，塑造: knead dough 揉面团‖kneading a painful calf muscle 给疼痛的小腿肌肉按摩
knead.mean: vt. 揉捏，塑造： to make or shape by or as if by folding, pressing, and stretching with the hands

acumen.example: n. 不同寻常的洞察力和鉴别力: the business acumen 商业方面的洞察力
acumen.mean: n. 不同寻常的洞察力和鉴别力： exceptional discernment and judgment especially in practical matters

nascent.example: adj. 新生的: The rise of the nascent middle class catalyzed a new economic boom. 新生中产阶级的崛起催生了一场新的经济繁荣
nascent.mean: adj. 新生的： coming or having recently come into existence

unavailing.example: adj. 徒劳的，无果的: an unavailing effort to avert a war 试图避免战争的徒劳尝试
unavailing.mean: adj. 徒劳的，无果的： producing no results

fracture.example:
n. 破裂: a sudden fracture of the established order 已建立起的秩序被突然打破
v. 打碎，破坏: Their happiness was fractured by an unforeseen tragedy. 他们的幸福生活被突如其来的悲剧打破了
fracture.mean:
n. 破裂： the act or process of breaking
v. 打碎，破坏： to cause to separate into pieces usually suddenly or forcibly

wanting.example:
adj. 未出现的，缺少的: Grass is almost entirely wanting in that arid wasteland. 那片荒漠几乎没有长一丝青草。
adj. 未达到要求的: He examined her work and found it wanting. 他检查了她的作业，发现不合要求。‖We tried her cooking and found it to be very wanting. 我们试了试她的厨艺，结果发现很不尽人意。
wanting.mean:
adj. 未出现的，缺少的： not present or in evidence
adj. 未达到要求的： not being up to standards or expectations

paraphrase.example: v. 转述，意译，改写: Could you please paraphrase your diagnosis of my health condition, using simpler language? 您能否用更通俗的话语转述一下您对我健康状况的诊断呢
paraphrase.mean: v. 转述，意译，改写： to express something (as a text or statement) in different words

blunt.example:
vt. 减弱（力度等）: The abrupt music blunted the effect of the movie's final tragic scene. 突兀的音乐让电影结束时悲剧场景的氛围大打折扣
adj. 直率的: He values honesty and is quite blunt about telling people what he doesn't like about them. 他重视诚实，经常直率地告诉别人他们何处使他不满
blunt.mean:
vt. 使变钝：to make less sharp or definite
vt. 减弱（力度等）：to reduce or weaken in strength or feeling
adj. 直率的：being or characterized by direct, brief, and potentially rude speech or manner

channel.example:
n. 水渠: Water was drained from the swamp through a specially constructed channel. 这块沼泽通过一条特殊建造的水渠源源不断地向外输水。
n. 海峡: the world record for swimming the channel between Alaska and Chukotskiy 横渡阿拉斯加和楚科奇之间海峡（也即白令海峡）的世界纪录
vt. 将…导向，投入: a youth who channeled all of his energy into sports 一个将毕生精力都投入体育之中的少年
channel.mean:
n. 水渠： an open man-made passageway for water
n. 海峡： a narrow body of water between two land masses
vt. 将…导向，投入： to cause to move to a central point or along a restricted pathway

dread.example: n. 恐惧: We were filled with dread when we saw the rapids we would be rafting down. 当我们看到竹筏驶向的激流时，我们的内心被恐惧所占据。
dread.mean: n. 恐惧： great fear especially in the face of impending evil

inept.example:
adj.愚笨的，荒谬的: an inept and irresponsible remark on his paper 对他文章的荒谬而不负责任的评论
adj. 不称职的，无能力的: a hopelessly inept defense attorney 严重不靠谱的辩护律师
inept.mean:
adj.愚笨的，荒谬的： displaying a lack of judgment, sense, or reason
adj.不恰当的，不合时宜的： not appropriate for a particular occasion or situation
adj. 不称职的，无能力的： generally incompetent

amiable.example: adj. 好脾气的，友好易相处的: an amiable teacher not easily annoyed 一个不易惹恼易相处的老师
amiable.mean: adj. 好脾气的，友好易相处的：being friendly, sociable, and congenial

roster.example: n. 值勤表，花名册: the roster of subscribers to the journal 杂质订阅者名册
roster.mean: n. 值勤表，花名册： a roll or list of personnel

indelible.example:
adj. （印记等）无法擦除的: indelible ink 难以擦拭的墨水
adj. 无法忘怀的: most indelible experiences 最难以磨灭的经历
indelible.mean:
adj. （印记等）无法擦除的： impossible to remove, erase, or wash away
adj. 无法忘怀的： not easily forgotten

compress.example: vt. 压缩（体积）: compress a computer file 压缩电脑文档 || The science textbook compresses a lot of information about human reproduction into a few short chapters. 科学教科书将人类的生殖知识压缩成了几个短章节。
compress.mean: vt. 压缩（体积）：to reduce in size or volume as if by squeezing

remunerate.example: vt. 支付报酬或补偿: He promptly remunerated the repair company for fixing the satellite TV. 他迅速地支付了维修公司修卫星电视所应得的酬劳。
remunerate.mean: vt. 支付报酬或补偿： to pay an equivalent to for a service, loss, or expense

rehearsal.example: n. 排练，彩排: We made a few mistakes in rehearsal, but we were pretty sure that we'd be OK on opening night. 彩排过程中我们犯了几个错误，但正式开幕式当晚我们有信心做得很好。
rehearsal.mean: n. 排练，彩排： the act of practicing in preparation for a public performance

abut.example: v. 邻接，毗邻: Our land abuts a wildlife preserve. 我们的土地靠近一片野生动物保护区。
abut.mean: v. 邻接，毗邻： to touch at one end or side; lie adjacent

barrage.example:
n. 弹幕: Troops are advancing under the shield of barrage. 部队在弹幕的掩护下前进
n. 有压倒之势的、集中的倾泻（如言语）: The announcement was met with a barrage of criticism and protests. 此公告一出，批评和抗议的声音四起
v. （同时）袭来: The athlete was barraged with requests for an autograph. 请求运动员签名的呼声如排山倒海般袭来
barrage.mean:
n. 弹幕： a heavy curtain of artillery fire directed in front of friendly troops to protect them
n. 有压倒之势的、集中的倾泻（如言语）： an overwhelming, concentrated outpouring, as of words
v. （同时）袭来： to attack with a rapid or overwhelming outpouring of many things at once

canny.example: adj. 精明的，聪明的: He is a canny card player who is good at psyching out his opponents. 他是一个善于琢磨对手心思的精明的扑克玩家。
canny.mean: adj. 精明的，聪明的： careful and shrewd, especially where one's own interests are concerned

mettle.example:
n. 勇气: troops who showed their mettle in combat 在战场上表现出坚强勇气的部队
n. 毅力，耐力: Those trucks had proved their mettle in army transport. 那些卡车通过在军队运输中的表现证明了它们的耐用性
mettle.mean:
n. 勇气： vigor and strength of spirit or temperament
n. 毅力，耐力： staying quality: stamina

conspicuous.example: adj. 显而易见的，吸引人的: a conspicuous change in her appearance 她外貌的明显改变
conspicuous.mean: adj. 显而易见的，吸引人的： obvious to the eye or mind, attracting attention

annul.example:
v. 宣告无效，取消: The marriage was annulled last month. 婚约上个月取消了。
v. 抵消 to balance with an equal force so as to make ineffective
: Unfortunately, his arrogant attitude annuls the many generous favors he does for people. 不幸的是，他傲慢的态度抵消了他之前对人民的慷慨恩惠。
annul.mean:
v. 宣告无效，取消：to declare or make legally invalid or void
v. 抵消 to balance with an equal force so as to make ineffective

enamel.mean:
v. 涂亮漆；使具有光滑或亮泽的表面： to give a glossy or brilliant surface to
v. 用亮丽的表面装饰： to adorn with a brightly colored surface

montage.example: n. 大杂烩: My memories of the childhood trip are a montage of the sights of two rivers, smells of hotpots, and sounds of light railway of Chongqing. 我孩提时代旅行的记忆就是由两江风光、火锅的香味以及重庆的轻轨声杂糅而成的
montage.mean: n. 大杂烩： an unorganized collection or mixture of various things

pernicious.example: adj. 有害的: Business may be troublesome but idleness is pernicious. 工作烦人，懒散害人
pernicious.mean: adj. 有害的： highly injurious or destructive

calcify.example: vt. 使僵化: a leg that calcified 一条麻木僵直的腿
calcify.mean: vt. 使僵化： to make inflexible or unchangeable

jitters.example: n. 紧张，不安: she suffered pre-wedding jitters 她有婚前恐惧
jitters.mean: n. 紧张，不安： a sense of panic or extreme nervousness

scowl.example: vi. 皱眉（表现出不高兴）: scowled down at the misbehaving child 对淘气的孩子皱起了眉
scowl.mean: vi. 皱眉（表现出不高兴）： to contract the brow in an expression of displeasure

glutton.example: n. 贪吃者: a glutton for work 工作狂
glutton.mean: n. 贪吃者： a person who eats or consumes immoderate amounts of food and drink

permeable.example: adj. 可渗透的: a permeable fabric that allows your body heat to escape 一种能使身体热量耗散的透气纤维
permeable.mean: adj. 可渗透的： capable of being permeated or penetrated, especially by liquids or gases

illusory.example: adj. 幻觉的，虚幻的: the illusory definition of nationhood 国家的虚幻定义
illusory.mean: adj. 幻觉的，虚幻的： produced by, based on, or having the nature of an illusion

forage.example: vi. 寻找: went foraging for change for the parking meter 寻找付停车费的零钱
forage.mean: vi. 寻找： to make a search

unassailable.example: adj. 无可争辩的，无法否认的，不可亵渎的: an unassailable article 无可争辩的文章
unassailable.mean: adj. 无可争辩的，无法否认的，不可亵渎的： not to be violated, criticized, or tampered with

infuriate.example: vt. 激怒: be infuriated by the deliberate insults 被蓄意的中伤激怒
infuriate.mean: vt. 激怒： to make furious

savory.example:
adj. 口感好的，味道好的: cedar is one of the most savory of all woods 雪松是所有树木中味道最好闻的
adj. 令人愉悦的: having to fire someone was not a task that the manager found at all savory 经理发现不得不开除某人是件非常不讨好的事
savory.mean:
adj. 口感好的，味道好的： appetizing to the taste or smell
adj. 令人愉悦的： giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses

mince.example:
vt. 切碎: I'll buy some lean meat and mince it myself. 我会买一些瘦肉然后自己切好的
vi. 小步走: The bride minced through the cathedral. 新娘踏着细小的步伐穿过教堂
mince.mean:
vt. 切碎： to cut or chop into very small pieces
vi. 小步走： to walk with very short steps or with exaggerated primness

friction.example:
n. 摩擦: lubricant that significantly reduces friction 能显著减少摩擦的润滑剂
n. 冲突，不和: There is a friction between the professor and students. 教授和学生之间存在不和
friction.mean:
n. 摩擦： the rubbing of one object or surface against another
n. 冲突，不和： the clashing between two persons or parties of opposed views

dirge.example: n. 挽歌: This funeral dirge is for the dead friend. 这首葬礼挽歌是写给故去的朋友的。
dirge.mean: n. 挽歌： a slow, solemn, and mournful piece of music

elevate.example:
vt. 道德、智力、文化水平的提升: a novel that both entertains and elevates readers 一本寓教于乐的小说
vt. 使兴奋: one of the most elevating moments in their lives 生命中最让人兴奋的时刻之一
elevate.mean:
vt. 道德、智力、文化水平的提升： to improve morally, intellectually, or culturally
vt. 使兴奋： to raise the spirits of

hack.example:
vt. 乱砍: hacking out new election districts 划分新的选区
vt. 成功完成: just couldn't hack the new job 无法搞定新工作
v. 忍受: she's not sure she can hack that miserable job much longer 她不知道还能忍受那项苦逼的工作多久
hack.mean:
n. 雇佣文人： a writer who aims solely for commercial success
vt. 乱砍： to cut or chop with repeated and irregular blows
vt. 成功完成： to deal with (something) usually skillfully or efficiently
v. 忍受： to put up with (something painful or difficult)

untold.example: adj. 数不清的，无数的: untold wealth 不知其数的财富
untold.mean: adj. 数不清的，无数的： too great or numerous to count

aggressive.example:
adj. 好斗的: aggressive behavior 具有攻击性的行为
adj. 强有力的，强烈的: an aggressive campaign to win the African-American vote 一次能够获得非裔美国人选票的强有力的竞选
aggressive.mean:
adj. 好斗的： having a quality of anger and determination that makes it ready to attack others
adj. 强有力的，强烈的： marked by or uttered with forcefulness

broach.example:
v. 开启，启封: broach a keg of beer 开一小桶酒
v. 提出讨论: broached the topic of plans for next year's parade 将明年的游行活动计划摆上讨论日程
broach.mean:
v. 开启，启封： to open for the first time
v. 提出讨论： to present or bring forward for discussion

boggle.example:
v. 因为怀疑、恐惧而犹豫: boggle at the dilemma 身处困境而犹豫不决
v. 笨拙地做: She boggled her first effort to make Christmas cookies. 她第一次尝试圣诞蛋糕做得笨手笨脚
boggle.mean:
v. 因为怀疑、恐惧而犹豫： to hesitate because of doubt, fear, or scruples
v. 笨拙地做： to make or do (something) in a clumsy or unskillful way

profligate.example:
adj./n. 挥金如土的，挥霍的: leading a profligate life 过着骄奢淫逸的生活
n. 败家子: profligate who could not really afford the grand style he maintained at Monticello, Jefferson died deeply in debt 再也支撑不了在蒙蒂塞洛之时的大手大脚的作风，败家子杰斐逊最终深陷债务危机
n. 堕落的人: a drunken profligate, he was given to wretched excess in every aspect of his life 一个喝醉的堕落的人，在生活的方方面面都日趋堕落
profligate.mean:
adj./n. 挥金如土的，挥霍的： recklessly wasteful; wildly extravagant
n. 败家子： someone who spends money freely or foolishly
n. 堕落的人： a person who has sunk below the normal moral standard

deportation.example: n. 放逐: deport all illegal immigrants 驱逐所有非法移民
deportation.mean: n. 放逐： the removal from a country of an alien whose presence is unlawful or prejudicial

safeguard.example:
n. 保护措施: legal safeguards against fraud 防止欺诈的法律措施
v. 保护: sheepdogs safeguard the flock from attacks by wolves 保护兽群免受狼群攻击的牧羊犬
safeguard.mean:
n. 保护措施： a technical contrivance to prevent accident
v. 保护： to make safe: protect

nadir.example: n. 最低点: the nadir on the curve 曲线上的最低点
nadir.mean: n. 最低点： the lowest point

gull.example: v. 欺骗: we were gulled into believing that if we answered the e-mail, we'd somehow become millionaires, but instead we just got put on a list for junk mail 我们误以为只要回复了那封邮件，就能变身百万富翁，后来发现我们只不过是群发的垃圾邮件名单上的一员而已
gull.mean: v. 欺骗： to cause to believe what is untrue

jolt.example: v. 惊吓: The sneak terrorist attack jolted the country out of its indolence and indifference. 偷偷摸摸的恐怖分子将该国从懒惰和冷漠无情中惊醒
jolt.mean:
vi. 突然移动： to move or dislodge with a sudden, hard blow
v. 惊吓： to cause an unpleasant surprise for

harangue.example: v. 发表长篇大论: She harangued us for hours about the evils of popular culture. 她向我们絮叨了好几小时，批判流行文化的堕落。
harangue.mean: v. 发表长篇大论： a long pompous speech, especially one delivered before a gathering

debunk.example:
v. 揭穿真面目: debunk a supposed miracle drug 揭穿所谓的灵丹妙药的真面目
v. 证明为假: a Web site that assiduously debunks urban legends 一个不遗余力证明假传闻的网站
debunk.mean:
v. 揭穿真面目： to reveal the true nature of
v. 证明为假： to prove to be false

fickle.example:
adj. 易变的: a fickle lover 感情善变的情人
adj. 不忠诚的: When the family's fortune disappeared, so did their fickle friends. 当这个家庭的财富消逝殆尽时，他们的那些虚伪的朋友也无影无踪了
fickle.mean:
adj. 易变的： likely to change frequently, suddenly, or unexpectedly
adj. 不忠诚的： not true in one's allegiance to someone or something

travesty.example: n./v. 拙劣的、嘲弄性模仿: a travesty of his classmate’s manner 滑稽的模仿其他同学的举止
travesty.mean: n./v. 拙劣的、嘲弄性模仿： an exaggerated or grotesque imitation, such as a parody of a literary work

deign.example: vi. （不情愿地）屈尊，俯就: I would never deign to answer that absurd accusation. 我根本不屑于去解释那样一个荒谬的指责。
deign.mean: vi. （不情愿地）屈尊，俯就： to condescend reluctantly and with a strong sense of the affront to one's superiority that is involved

enthusiasm.example: n. 热情，兴趣: in my enthusiasm to get going, I forgot to pack any foul-weather clothing 在强烈的出游热情下，我忘记带上防备坏天气的衣服了
enthusiasm.mean: n. 热情，兴趣： urgent desire or interest

malcontent.example:
n. 不满分子: The chaos was caused by a handful of malcontents. 混乱是由一小撮不满分子引起的
adj. 不满的: The film follows three malcontent teenagers around Paris. 电影围绕着三个不满现实的青少年在巴黎展开
malcontent.mean:
n. 不满分子： one who is in active opposition to an established order or government
adj. 不满的： dissatisfied with the existing state of affairs

slouch.example:
n. 懒人: is no slouch when it comes to cooking 做起饭来可一点也不懒
vt. 缓慢行走: He slouched towards the church as if going to his own funeral. 他缓缓地向教堂走去，仿佛是要去参加自己的葬礼一般。
slouch.mean:
n. 懒人： a lazy person
vt. 缓慢行走： to go or move slowly or reluctantly

plump.example:
adj. 丰满的: In Tang Dynasty, being plump was a sign of ultimate beauty. 在唐代，身材丰满是最美丽的象征。
vi. 鼎力支持，赞口不绝: We will plump for any candidate who supports stem cell research. 我们会鼎力支持那些拥护干细胞研究的候选人。
plump.mean:
adj. 丰满的： well-rounded and full in form
vi. 鼎力支持，赞口不绝： to give full support or praise

tint.example: v. 涂浅色，微染: tint with only one color 只用一种颜色染色
tint.mean: v. 涂浅色，微染： apply a usually slight or pale coloration to

loath.example: adj. 不情愿的，讨厌的: I was loath to accept the fact that he had been killed in a terrorist attack. 我很不情愿地接受了他在一场恐怖袭击中丧生的事实
loath.mean: adj. 不情愿的，讨厌的： unwilling or reluctant; disinclined

submerge.example: vt. 使淹没: The river burst its banks, submerging an entire village. 河水冲上了堤岸，淹没了整个村庄。
submerge.mean: vt. 使淹没： to put under water

badinage.example: n. 打趣，善意的玩笑: the sophisticated badinage of the characters in plays by Oscar Wilde 奥斯卡?王尔德作品中意味深长的玩笑话
badinage.mean: n. 打趣，善意的玩笑： playful repartee, banter

beseech.example: v. （急切地）恳求: They besought the military to act immediately. 他们恳求军方立即采取行动
beseech.mean: v. （急切地）恳求： to beg for urgently or anxiously

harbinger.example: n. 预言者: The October air stung my cheeks, a harbinger of winter. 十月的寒风凛冽地吹在脸上，这是冬天的预兆。
harbinger.mean: n. 预言者： one that presages or foreshadows what is to come

deprecate.example:
vt. 表达不喜欢: deprecates TV sitcoms as childish and simpleminded 批评电视情景喜剧既幼稚又脑残
vt. 贬低，轻视: deprecate the comedy as the stupidest movie of the year 认为这部喜剧是年度最傻逼电影
t. 降低重要性，低调: She deprecated her facility for languages 她不炫耀自己对于语言的天赋。
deprecate.mean:
vt. 表达不喜欢： to hold an unfavorable opinion of
vt. 贬低，轻视： to express scornfully one's low opinion of
t. 降低重要性，低调： play down, to make little of

tyro.example: n. 新手，业余爱好者: a tyro in the art of piano 钢琴界的新手
tyro.mean: n. 新手，业余爱好者： a beginner in learning: novice

obliterate.example: vt. 除去: the March snowstorm obliterated our hopes for an early spring 三月的暴风雪摧毁了我们对于一个早春的念想
obliterate.mean: vt. 除去： to remove from existence

summary.example:
n. 摘要: Many book reports choose to begin with a summary of the book. 许多书评以该书的摘要开始。
adj. 就地的，立即的: a summary trial and speedy execution 就地的判决和快速的处决
summary.mean:
n. 摘要： an abstract, abridgment, or compendium especially of a preceding discourse
adj. 就地的，立即的： done or executed on the spot and without formality

denouement.example: n.（小说的）结局: a surprising/ unexpected denouement 令人惊奇的、出人意料的结局
denouement.mean: n.（小说的）结局： the final resolution or clarification of a dramatic or narrative plot

perceptive.example:
adj. 敏锐的: Due to their ability to rotate their ears, cats are very perceptive when it comes to pinpointing the source of a sound. 由于猫能够转动它们的耳朵，所以它们能十分敏锐地确定声源的位置。
adj. 洞察力强的: A perceptive teacher was able to discover what was really troubling the youth. 一个洞察力强的老师应该能察觉真正困扰青少年是什么。
perceptive.mean:
adj. 敏锐的： able to sense slight impressions or differences
adj. 洞察力强的： having or showing deep understanding and intelligent application of knowledge

primp.example: v. 精心打扮: She primps for hours before a date. 她出门约会前要花数小时打扮。
primp.mean: v. 精心打扮： to dress, adorn, or arrange in a careful or finicky manner

myopic.example: adj. 缺乏远见的，缺乏辨别能力的: a myopic view on climate change 关于气候变化缺乏远见的观点
myopic.mean: adj. 缺乏远见的，缺乏辨别能力的： a lack of foresight or discernment

disparage.example: vt. 贬低，轻蔑地说: use the past to disparage the present 借古讽今 || Voters don't like political advertisements in which opponents disparage one another.选民不喜欢看到贬低竞争对手的政治广告。
disparage.mean: vt. 贬低，轻蔑地说： to lower in rank or reputation; to speak of in a slighting or disrespectful way; belittle

husband.example: vt. 节俭，勤俭持家: Husbanding precious resources was part of rural life. 节俭使用珍贵的资源就是农村生活的一部分
husband.mean: vt. 节俭，勤俭持家： to use sparingly or economically

morose.example: adj. 忧郁的: morose job seekers who are inured to rejection 习惯了被拒的郁郁寡欢的求职者
morose.mean: adj. 忧郁的： having a sullen and gloomy disposition

imposing.example: adj. 宏伟壮丽的: The corporation's imposing headquarters were designed by one of the nation's cutting-edge architects. 这家公司宏伟壮丽的总部是由该国最优秀的建筑师设计的
imposing.mean: adj. 宏伟壮丽的： impressive in size, bearing, dignity, or grandeur

imposter.example: n. 冒名顶替者，骗子: The man who claimed to be my townsman turned out to be an impostor. 那个自称是我老乡的人结果是个骗子。
imposter.mean: n. 冒名顶替者，骗子： one that assumes false identity or title for the purpose of deception

innovative.example: adj. 创新性的: an innovative macro-economic strategy 创新性的宏观经济战略
innovative.mean: adj. 创新性的： characterized by, tending to, or introducing innovations

whet.example: vt. 磨快: whetted the dagger with the grindstone 用磨石把匕首磨锋利
whet.mean: vt. 磨快： to sharpen by rubbing on or with something (as a stone)

immure.example: v. 监禁，禁闭: immure oneself for GRE 闭门苦读GRE
immure.mean: v. 监禁，禁闭： to confine within or as if within walls

toady.example: n./v. 马屁精，拍马屁: He criticized that I was a toady. 他批评说我是一个马屁精。
toady.mean: n./v. 马屁精，拍马屁： one who flatters in the hope of gaining favors

expiate.example: vt. 赎罪，纠正: expiate one’s sin 赎罪
expiate.mean: vt. 赎罪，纠正： to extinguish the guilt incurred by

pellucid.example:
adj. 透明的: pellucid spring water 清澈透明的泉水
adj. 清晰明确的，易懂的: Her poetry has a pellucid simplicity that betrays none of the sweat that went into writing it. 她的诗歌风格十分清新简约，丝毫没有体现出她为此付出的汗水
pellucid.mean:
adj. 透明的： admitting the passage of light
adj. 清晰明确的，易懂的： transparently clear in style or meaning

obliging.example: adj. 乐于助人的: an obliging concierge used his pull to get us reservations at the town's hottest restaurant 一个好心的看房人利用他的影响力帮我们在镇上最火爆的餐厅订到了座
obliging.mean: adj. 乐于助人的： willing to do favors

culpable.example: adj. 该受谴责的，有罪的: culpable behaviors 值得谴责的行为
culpable.mean: adj. 该受谴责的，有罪的： deserving of blame or censure as being wrong, evil, improper, or injurious

stigma.example: n. 耻辱，污名: the stigma of cowardice 由懦弱而带来的污点‖There's a social stigma attached to receiving welfare. 伴随着社会福利有一种社会耻辱感。
stigma.mean: n. 耻辱，污名： a mark of shame or discredit

asperity.example:
n. （举止、性情）粗暴: She responded with such asperity that we knew she was offended by the question. 她如此粗鲁的回答问题以至于我们知道这个问题冒犯到了她。
n.（环境）艰苦: He has encountered more than his share of asperities on the road to success. 在成功的道路上他已经遇到过比他应该承受的更多的艰辛。
asperity.mean:
n. （举止、性情）粗暴：roughness of manner or of temper
n.（环境）艰苦：rigor, severity

heterodox.example: adj. 非正统的，异端的: her heterodox approach to teaching science initially met with some resistance from her peers 她对于教学的一些非正统方法最开始受到了同辈的抵触
heterodox.mean: adj. 非正统的，异端的： holding unorthodox opinions or doctrines, not rigidly following established form, custom, or rules

steadfast.example: adj. 坚定的，忠诚的: Her comrades remained steadfast despite brutal tortures. 尽管有残酷的折磨，她的同志们都保持了忠诚。
steadfast.mean: adj. 坚定的，忠诚的： firm in belief, determination, or adherence

limber.example: adj. 可塑的，柔软的: She shaped the basket out of limber branches. 她用柔软的树枝编了一个筐
limber.mean: adj. 可塑的，柔软的： capable of being shaped: flexible

bathetic.example: adj. 平凡的，陈腐的: a bathetic funeral scene 平凡的葬礼场面
bathetic.mean: adj. 平凡的，陈腐的： characterized by exceptional commonplaceness

incite.example: vt. 煽动，激起: inciting workers to strike 煽动工人罢工
incite.mean: vt. 煽动，激起： to provoke and urge on

glaze.example: vt. 给…上釉，妆点: The storm glazed trees with ice. 暴风雨给树木镀上了一层冰装
glaze.mean:
vt. 给…上釉，妆点： to coat with or as if with a glaze
vt. 使平滑： to give a smooth glossy surface to

ostensible.example: adj. 表面上的，佯装的: It must be the ostensible reason for their visit while their actual motives may be malignant 这肯定只是他们上门拜访的表面原因，他们背后的动机说不定恶劣至极。
ostensible.mean: adj. 表面上的，佯装的： appearing to be true on the basis of evidence that may or may not be confirmed

unanimous.example: adj. 一致同意的: a unanimous vote to upgrade the school’s computer facilities 一致同意对学校的计算机设备进行升级
unanimous.mean: adj. 一致同意的： having the agreement and consent of all

presage.example:
n. 征兆: The sight of the first robin is always a welcome presage of spring. 第一只知更鸟的出现总是迎接春天到来的象征
vt. 预示，预言: The incident may presage war. 这个事件可能是战争的征兆
presage.mean:
n. 征兆： something believed to be a sign or warning of a future event
vt. 预示，预言： to foretell or predict

spartan.example: adj. 简朴的，节约的: Accommodations on the windjammer are spartan but clean and comfortable nevertheless. 帆船上的装饰十分朴素，但还是很干净和舒适。
spartan.mean: adj. 简朴的，节约的： marked by simplicity, frugality, or avoidance of luxury and comfort

forsake.example: vt. 彻底放弃，抛弃: Forsaking most of our possessions, we evacuated just before the hurricane struck. 我们抛下了绝大多数的财产，终于在海啸来袭之前撤离了。‖Her boyfriend has forsaken her. 她的男朋友将她抛弃。
forsake.mean: vt. 彻底放弃，抛弃： to renounce or turn away from entirely

pitiless.example: adj. 没有同情心的: a pitiless humiliation 毫不留情的羞辱
pitiless.mean: adj. 没有同情心的： devoid of or unmoved by pity

satiate.example: v./adj. 饱足，过分满足: A long drink of water satiated my thirst. 一顿痛饮之后我的口渴得到了缓解
satiate.mean: v./adj. 饱足，过分满足： to satisfy fully or to excess

panache.example: n. 炫耀: The BBC Symphony Orchestra played with great panache. BBC交响乐队
panache.mean: n. 炫耀： dash or flamboyance in style and action

august.example:
adj. 威严的，庄重的: Unsurprisingly, the head of the bank is an august white-haired gentleman. 不出所料的，银行的总裁是一名白发苍苍的、令人顿生敬意的绅士。
adj. 盛大的，令人印象深刻的: an august golden anniversary celebration for the company 盛大的周年庆祝会
august.mean:
adj. 威严的，庄重的： having or showing a formal and serious or reserved manner
adj. 盛大的，令人印象深刻的： large and impressive in size, grandeur, extent, or conception

foreword.example: n. 前言: The foreword of this book is co-written by Jason and Franklin. 这本书的序由Jason和Franklin共同写成
foreword.mean: n. 前言： a preface or an introductory note, as for a book, especially by a person other than the author

apparition.example: n. 鬼魂，幽灵: An eccentric claimed to have photographed an apparition in her very own house. 一个行为怪异的人声称在她的住所里拍到了一张幽灵的照片。
apparition.mean: n. 鬼魂，幽灵： a ghostly figure

screen.example:
n. 掩护物，屏障: The target will be difficult to reach as it is behind a screen of anti-aircraft batteries. 目标在防空炮火的掩护之下难以靠近。‖Please keep away from the screen door. 请不要倚靠屏蔽门。
vt. 保护，使…免受攻击: Gunships were called in to help screen the troops from further attacks. 武装直升机被呼叫对步兵进行支援，使之免受进一步的攻击。
vt. 掩护，遮蔽: Bushes screened the swimming pool from passersby on the street. 灌木丛将游泳池和外面的行人隔绝开来。
screen.mean:
n. 掩护物，屏障： something that shelters, protects, or hides
vt. 保护，使…免受攻击： to drive danger or attack away from
vt. 掩护，遮蔽： to keep secret or shut off from view

observant.example:
adj. 警惕的，警觉的: Good reporters are keenly observant of everything around them. 优秀的记者应该对身边所有的事情都保持高度的警惕。‖If you were more observant, you would perceive that something is troubling her deeply. 如果你能再警觉一些的话，你就会发现她正被某些东西困扰。
adj. 严格遵守（规章、制度或原则）的: observant of the speed limit 严格遵守速度限制‖pious and religiously observant families 虔诚而严守教规的家庭
observant.mean:
adj. 警惕的，警觉的： paying close attention usually for the purpose of anticipating approaching danger or opportunity
adj. 严格遵守（规章、制度或原则）的： diligent in observing a law, custom, duty, or principle

pluck.example:
n. 敢于面对困难的勇气: full of pluck 充满了勇气
v. 弹奏（弦乐）: pluck the harp 弹奏竖琴
pluck.mean:
n. 敢于面对困难的勇气： resourceful courage and daring in the face of difficulties
v. 弹奏（弦乐）： to sound (the strings of an instrument) by pulling and releasing them with the fingers or a plectrum

rapacious.example:
adj. 食量大的，贪食的: The manager at the buffet restaurant was apparently astonished by a team of rapacious professional basketball players. 自助餐厅的经理很明显被那一队胃口巨大的职业篮球队员们震惊到了。
adj. 过度贪婪的: Some companies is rapacious and hardly looking for the long-term value. 有些公司十分贪婪，而且不考虑长期利益。
rapacious.mean:
adj. 食量大的，贪食的： having a huge appetite
adj. 过度贪婪的： excessively grasping or covetous

countenance.example:
v. 容忍: The college administration will not countenance cheating. 大学管理部门决不容忍作弊的存在
v. 赞成，推崇: I don't countenance such behavior in children of any age. 对于任何年龄的孩子，我都不推崇那种行为
n. 沉着，冷静: The doctor’s purposeful countenance was in stark contrast to everyone else's hysteria. 医生带有目的性的沉着与他人的歇斯底里形成了巨大的反差
countenance.mean:
v. 容忍： to put up with (something painful or difficult)
v. 赞成，推崇： to have a favorable opinion of
n. 沉着，冷静： evenness of emotions or temper

concentrate.example:
v. 集中: concentrate one’s efforts 集中精力
vt. 浓缩: prolonged boiling is required to concentrate the sap when making maple syrup
v. 聚集: recent immigrants tend to concentrate in port cities. 进来的移民倾向于聚集在海港城市。
concentrate.mean:
v. 集中：to bring or direct toward a common center or objective : focus
vt. 浓缩：to make less dilute
v. 聚集：to come together in one body or place

animus.example: n. 敌意: She felt no animus toward those who had wronged her. 她对那些冤枉了她的人没有敌意。
animus.mean: n. 敌意：a usually prejudiced and often spiteful or malevolent ill will, enmity

coma.example: n. 昏迷，深度无知觉: The girl lay in a coma for three days after the accident. 那个女孩在事故之后已经昏迷了三天了。
coma.mean:
n. 昏迷，深度无知觉：a state of profound unconsciousness caused by disease, injury, or poison
n. 迟钝，冷漠： a state of mental or physical sluggishness : torpor

impromptu.example: adj. 即席的，即兴的: Our dinner guest thanked us with an impromptu song. 客人们即兴高歌一首以表达谢意
impromptu.mean:
n. 即席的表演： something, such as a speech, that is made or done extemporaneously
adj. 即席的，即兴的：composedwithout previous preparation

jaunty.example: adj. 轻快的，活泼的: a jaunty stroll 轻快的散步
jaunty.mean: adj. 轻快的，活泼的： sprightly in manner or appearance: lively

undermine.example: vt. 削弱，破坏: undermine a fortress 挖地道破坏堡垒
undermine.mean: vt. 削弱，破坏： to weaken, injure, or impair, often by degrees or imperceptibly

quack.example: n. 骗子医生，江湖郎中: don't bother to see that guy, as I've heard he's a quack with no actual training 别再找他看病了，我听说他就是个没有真才实学的江湖郎中
quack.mean: n. 骗子医生，江湖郎中： a pretender to medical skill

oust.example:
vt. 免职: be ousted from power 被赶下台
v. 驱逐: she was ousted from her job after it was proven she'd been pilfering company supplies 她贪污公司财物这事被证实后，她被驱逐了
oust.mean:
vt. 免职： to remove from a position of prominence or power (as a throne)
v. 驱逐： to drive or force out

cleave.example:
vi. 紧贴，坚持: You should resolutely cleave to the facts in your report. 你应该在报道中坚持客观的原则。
vt. 分隔，割裂: His spade cleaved the firm sand with a harsh crunch. 他的锹凿开了坚实的砂土，发出尖锐刺耳的嘎扎声。
cleave.mean:
vi. 紧贴，坚持： to adhere firmly and closely or loyally and unwaveringly
vt. 分隔，割裂： to divide by or as if by a cutting blow

puerile.example: adj. 幼稚的，不成熟的: puerile remarks 幼稚的评论
puerile.mean: adj. 幼稚的，不成熟的： immature; lacking in adult experience or maturity

rant.example:
n. （尤指长时间的）训斥，责骂: After complaining about the hotel’s lousy service, the woman went off on another rant about the condition of her room. 在抱怨完旅店差劲的服务之后，她继续对房间的条件开骂。
vi. 怒吼: The old expert ranted that nobody paid any attention to his opinion. 老专家怒气冲冲的叫嚷说没人听他的观点。
rant.mean:
n. （尤指长时间的）训斥，责骂： a long angry speech or scolding
vi. 怒吼： to speak or write in a noisy, angry or violent manner

tractable.example: adj. 易驾驭的，温顺的: a tractable horse 一匹温顺的马
tractable.mean: adj. 易驾驭的，温顺的： readily giving in to the command or authority of another

speck.example: n. 小点，少量: She writes without even a speck of humor. 她字里行间一点幽默感也没有。
speck.mean: n. 小点，少量： a very small amount: bit

diocesan.example: adj. 主教管辖区的: national or diocesan authority 国家或教区权利
diocesan.mean: adj. 主教管辖区的： of or relating to a diocese

fulminate.example: v. 大声斥责: fulminate the so-called curricular reform痛斥所谓的课程改革
fulminate.mean: v. 大声斥责： to issue a thunderous verbal attack or denunciation

contract.example:
n. 契约，合同: a billion-dollar contract from Department of Defense 来自国防部的巨额合同
v. 收缩: contract muscle 收缩肌肉
v. 感染疾病: contracted a severe cold that later turned into pneumonia 染上了重感冒，最终发展成肺炎
contract.mean:
n. 契约，合同：a binding agreement between two or more persons or parties, especially one that is written and enforceable by law
v. 收缩：to reduce in size by drawing together; shrink
v. 感染疾病：to become affected by a disease or disorder

madcap.example:
n. 热爱冒险的人: an incorrigible madcap who loves drag racing and white-water rafting 一个热爱飙车和激流竹筏的无药可救的冒险狂
adj. 大胆的，鲁莽的: They switched from one madcap scheme to another. 他们从一个鲁莽的方案换到了另一个。
madcap.mean:
n. 热爱冒险的人： a person who seeks out very dangerous or foolhardy adventures with no apparent fear
adj. 大胆的，鲁莽的： behaving or acting impulsively or rashly;foolishly adventurous or bold

belie.example:
v. 错误地描述；误述: The report belied the real severity of the aftermath. 这个报道错误地评价了后果的严重性
v. 证明…为假: Practical experience belies this theory. 实践证明这个理论是错误的
v. 掩饰: Security Council issued false assurances that belied the true gravity of the situation. 安理会发布了不真实的承诺，掩盖了局势的严重性
v. 与…相对立；与…相矛盾: At first glance, life at the boarding school seemed to belie all the bad things I had heard about it. 乍看之下，寄宿学校的生活似乎不同于我所听说的有关它的糟糕情形
belie.mean:
v. 错误地描述；误述： to picture falsely; misrepresent
v. 证明…为假： to show (something) to be false or wrong
v. 掩饰： to keep secret or shut off from view
v. 与…相对立；与…相矛盾： to be counter to; contradict

jovial.example: adj. 愉快的: a jovial host 快活的主人
jovial.mean: adj. 愉快的： markedly good-humored especially as evidenced by jollity and conviviality

tout.example: vt. 极力赞扬: to tout victory in the war 鼓吹战果
tout.mean: vt. 极力赞扬： to promote or praise energetically; publicize

dated.example: adj. 过时的: His jokes are awfully dated, referring to things that happened years ago. 他的笑话全是些关于几年前的事情的过时货。
dated.mean: adj. 过时的： having passed its time of use or usefulness; out-of-date

delirium.example: n. 精神错乱: shoppers running around in a delirium the day before Christmas 购物者在圣诞节前夕疯狂扫货
delirium.mean: n. 精神错乱： an acute mental disturbance characterized by confused thinking and disrupted attention usually accompanied by disordered speech and hallucinations

torrential.example: adj. 急流的: a torrential rain 倾盆大雨
torrential.mean: adj. 急流的： caused by or resulting from action of rapid streams

calumniate.mean: v. 诽谤，造谣，中伤： to utter maliciously false statements, charges, or imputations about

evict.example: vt. 赶出，逐出: Her landlord has threatened to evict her if she doesn't pay the rent soon. 她的房东威胁说如果再不交房租就要把她赶出去。
evict.mean: vt. 赶出，逐出： to put out (a tenant, for example) by legal process; expel.

terse.example: adj. 简洁的，简明的: dismissed me with a terse “no” 用一个简单的“不”把我打发了
terse.mean: adj. 简洁的，简明的： brief and to the point; effectively concise

glutinous.example: adj. 胶状的，粘的: glutinous liquid 胶状液体
glutinous.mean: adj. 胶状的，粘的：of the nature of or resembling glue

curt.example:
adj. 言词简略、直接（以至显得粗鲁）的: his curt reply 他简略而略显粗鲁的回答
adj. 言简意赅的: on a daily basis she e-mailed to her commanders curt reports on the situation 她每天向长官做简短汇报
curt.mean:
adj. 言词简略、直接（以至显得粗鲁）的： being or characterized by direct, brief, and potentially rude speech or manner
adj. 言简意赅的： marked by the use of few words to convey much information or meaning

dispatch.example:
n. 迅速: do sth. with dispatch 迅速的做某事
v. 发送，运输: to dispatch a messenger with urgent news 发送一个紧急消息
v. 使死亡: dispatch a criminal处决罪犯 || The man dispatched the termites with professional efficiency. 那个男人技术纯熟地杀死了白蚁。
v. 获胜: They dispatched the other team with breaking a sweat. 他们险胜其他的队。
dispatch.mean:
n. 迅速： promptness and efficiency in performance or transmission
v. 发送，运输： to cause to go or be taken from one place to another
v. 使死亡： to deprive of life
v. 获胜： to achieve a victory over

exploit.example:
n. 英雄行为: his wartime exploits 他在战争期间的英勇行为
v. 最大程度地利用: exploit your opponent's weakness 利用你对手的弱点
exploit.mean:
n. 英雄行为： a notable or heroic act
v. 最大程度地利用： to employ to the greatest possible advantage

tactless.example: adj. 不机智的，笨拙的: tactless comments 不明智的评论
tactless.mean: adj. 不机智的，笨拙的： bluntly inconsiderate or indiscreet.

leaven.example: vt. 用轻松、活泼或变更的影响力来充斥: He needs to leaven his speeches with more humor. 他需要在演讲中再加入点幽默元素。
leaven.mean: vt. 用轻松、活泼或变更的影响力来充斥： to mingle or permeate with some modifying, alleviating, or vivifying element

sentinel.example: n. 哨兵，看守: a lone sentinel kept watch over the fort 一个哨兵看守着碉堡
sentinel.mean: n. 哨兵，看守： a person or group that watches over someone or something

endeavor.example:
n. 努力，奋斗: We hope that this latest endeavor will yield much information about the atmosphere of the planet. 我们希望这最后一次的努力能够获取关于行星大气层的大量信息。
vt. 努力做…，拼搏: endeavor to improve the quality of life in the inner city 努力改善市内的生活质量‖They endeavored to create a government that truly serves its people. 他们在努力地创立一个一心为人民服务的政府。
endeavor.mean:
n. 努力，奋斗： a conscientious or concerted effort toward an end
vt. 努力做…，拼搏： to devote serious and sustained effort

secede.example: vi. 脱离，退出（组织、团体、联盟等）: They threatened to secede from the coalition. 他们以退出联盟相要挟。
secede.mean: vi. 脱离，退出（组织、团体、联盟等）： to withdraw from an organization (as a religious communion or political party or federation)

fitful.example: adj. 无规律的，缺乏周期的: He drifted off into a fitful sleep. 他慢慢地陷入了时睡时醒的状态。
fitful.mean: adj. 无规律的，缺乏周期的： having an erratic or intermittent character

caricature.example: v. 嘲笑性模仿或夸张: caricatured the supervisor's distinctive walk 模仿督导员独特的走路方式
caricature.mean:
n. 用讽刺歪曲等手法的夸张，漫画，讽刺画： exaggeration by means of often ludicrous distortion of parts or characteristics
v. 嘲笑性模仿或夸张： to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of

wobble.example:
vi. 摇晃，颤抖: The drunk stood up, wobbled for a moment, and fell forward. 醉汉站了起来，晃动了一阵，然后向前倒了下去。
vi. 犹豫不决: We cannot tolerate the government wobbling at this critical time. 我们不能容忍政府在这种关键时刻犹豫不决。
wobble.mean:
vi. 摇晃，颤抖： to move or proceed with an irregular rocking or staggering motion or unsteadily and clumsily from side to side
vi. 犹豫不决： to show uncertainty about the right course of action

repine.example:
vi. 抱怨，表达不满: There is no use repining over a love that's been long lost. 抱怨早已失去的爱情是没有用的。
vi. 渴望: During the deep cold of winter, I repine for warm tropical beaches. 在寒冬，我渴望温暖的热带海滩。
repine.mean:
vi. 抱怨，表达不满： to feel or express discontent or dejection
vi. 渴望： to long for something

concede.example:
vt. 承认: She grudgingly conceded his point. 她不情愿的承认了他的观点。
v. 停止抵抗: He conceded as soon as it became clear that he could not win. 当他明显赢不了的时候他就停止了抵抗。
concede.mean:
vt. 承认：to grant as a right or privilege
v. 停止抵抗：to cease resistance (as to another's arguments, demands, or control)

dependable.example: adj. 可靠的，值得信赖的: a dependable source of income 可靠的收入来源‖He was a good friend and a dependable companion. 他是一个值得信赖的好伙伴。
dependable.mean: adj. 可靠的，值得信赖的： capable of being depended on

prototype.example: n. 原型: The manufacturer exhaustively tested the prototype of the vehicle before approving production. 生产商在将该车型投入生产之前对其原型进行了详细的测试。
prototype.mean: n. 原型： an original model on which something is patterned

histrionic.example: adj. 戏剧的，演员的: a penchant for dish throwing, door slamming, and other histrionic displays of temper 有倾向做出一些砸盘子、摔门和其他一些电视剧里的经典生气动作
histrionic.mean: adj. 戏剧的，演员的： of or relating to actors, acting, or the theater

commonsensical.example: adj. 符合常识的，有依据的: The only commonsensical solution would be to divide the children into groups according to age. 唯一合理的解决办法就是按照年龄把孩子分成组。
commonsensical.mean: adj. 符合常识的，有依据的：displaying common sense，based on sound reasoning or information

torpor.example:
n. 缺乏兴趣: After a lifetime of setbacks, defeats, and failures, he could only greet the latest bad news with a resigned fatalism and dull torpor. 一生都充满了挫折、失败，他只能用宿命论和麻木不仁来迎接又一次的坏消息。
n. （肉体或精神上的）迟钝: Following Thanksgiving dinner, we spent the rest of the day lounging about in a contented torpor. 吃完感恩节晚餐后，我们慵懒地靠在沙发上打发剩下的时间。
torpor.mean:
n. 缺乏兴趣： lack of interest or concern
n. （肉体或精神上的）迟钝： physical or mental inertness

impugn.example: v. 责难，攻击抨击: impugn a political opponent's character 就政治对手的人品发难
impugn.mean: v. 责难，攻击抨击： to attack as false or questionable; challenge in argument

gist.example: n. 要点: the gist of the argument 论证的要点
gist.mean: n. 要点： the main point or part

favoritism.example: n. 偏爱，偏袒: Favoritism blinded the administrator to the benefits of the proposed system for distributing work. 偏袒使得经理无法意识到这一待讨论的分配系统所带来的收益。
favoritism.mean: n. 偏爱，偏袒： the showing of special favor

hodgepodge.example: n. 大杂烩: a hodgepodge of styles 混搭风格 || the exhibit was a hodgepodge of mediocre art, bad art, and really bad art 整场展览就是中庸、烂和非常烂的艺术作品的大杂烩
hodgepodge.mean: n. 大杂烩： a mixture of dissimilar ingredients; a jumble

cloudburst.example: n. 突然一场暴雨: The weatherman warned of possible cloudbursts in the afternoon. 天气预报员警告到下午可能有暴雨。
cloudburst.mean: n. 突然一场暴雨：a sudden copious rainfall

homely.example: adj. 其貌不扬的，朴素简单的: homely truth 朴素的真理
homely.mean: adj. 其貌不扬的，朴素简单的： not attractive or good-looking

rabble.example: n. 混乱的人群: the crown prince was reminded that even the rabble deserved his attention and compassion 太子应该知道即使是草民，也值得他的关注和同情
rabble.mean: n. 混乱的人群： a disorganized or disorderly crowd of people

dramatic.example: adj.显著的，惹人注意的: a dramatic drop in the temperature overnight 夜晚气温的显著下降
dramatic.mean: adj.显著的，惹人注意的： striking in appearance or effect

abject.example:
adj. 无精打采的: a man made abject by suffering 被生活折磨得无精打采的人
adj. （地位、身份）悲惨、凄凉的: abject poverty 让人绝望的贫穷
adj. 卑微的，讨好的: abject flattery 卑躬屈膝般的恭维； an abject apology 讨好般的、真心的道歉
abject.mean:
adj. 无精打采的： cast down in spirit, spiritless
adj. （地位、身份）悲惨、凄凉的： sunk to or existing in a low state or condition
adj. 卑微的，讨好的： expressing or offered in a humble and often ingratiating spirit

extant.example: adj. 现存的: the most charming writer extant 目前活着的作家中最有魅力的一位 || extant manuscripts 未毁坏的手稿
extant.mean: adj. 现存的： still in existence; not destroyed, lost, or extinct

calligraphy.example: n. （优美的）书法: she specializes in scrollwork with beautiful calligraphy 她很擅长花体字
calligraphy.mean: n. （优美的）书法： artistic, stylized, or elegant handwriting or lettering

diffuse.example:
adj. 罗嗦的: a diffuse report 冗长的报告
adj. 不集中的，扩散的: diffuse lighting 散射光
v. 扩展，散开: The photographer uses a screen to diffuse the light. 摄影师用一个屏幕来分散光线。
diffuse.mean:
adj. 罗嗦的： being at once verbose and ill-organized
adj. 不集中的，扩散的： not concentrated or localized
v. 扩展，散开： extend, scatter

pilot.example:
n. 领航员，飞行员: a jet pilot 喷气式飞机飞行员
adj. 初步的，试验性的: They carried out a pilot study before the larger, more expensive project was started 在更大规模、更为昂贵的项目开始之前，他们进行了初步研究。
vt. 带领通过: The lobbyists piloted the bill through the Senate. 游说集团使法案得到参议院的批准。
pilot.mean:
n. 领航员，飞行员： one employed to steer a ship
adj. 初步的，试验性的： serving as a tentative model for future experiment or development
vt. 带领通过： lead or conduct over a usually difficult course

sound.example:
adj. 牢固的，不可动摇的: The bridge is structurally sound. 这座大桥在结构上是稳固的。
adj. 健康的，强壮的: The horse is getting old, but still perfectly sound. 虽然在变老，但这匹马依然相当健康。
adj. （逻辑上）严谨的: Sound reasoning alone should tell you that the result is invalid. 从纯粹严谨的逻辑演绎出发，这个结论是不正确的。
sound.mean:
adj. 牢固的，不可动摇的： marked by the ability to withstand stress without structural damage or distortion
adj. 健康的，强壮的： free from injury or disease: exhibiting normal health
adj. （逻辑上）严谨的： based on valid reasoning

soothe.example:
vt. 带来慰藉，安慰: There seemed to be no words sufficient to soothethe widow. 任何话语好像都不足以安慰这个寡妇。
vt. 使镇静，使安心: He took her in his arms and soothed her. 他把她抱在怀中以让她镇静下来。
vt. 弱化，缓解: Hot tea with honey will soothe a sore throat. 加了蜂蜜的热茶可以缓解喉咙的酸痛。
soothe.mean:
vt. 带来慰藉，安慰： to bring comfort, solace, or reassurance to
vt. 使镇静，使安心： to free from distress or disturbance
vt. 弱化，缓解： to make more bearable or less severe

profane.example:
v. 亵渎: invading troops profaned the altar by playing poker on it 侵略军亵渎了祭坛，竟然在上面打扑克
v. 滥用: profaned his considerable acting talents by appearing in some wretched movies 在一些烂俗的电影里面出现简直就是浪费表演才华
profane.mean:
v. 亵渎： to treat (something sacred) with abuse, irreverence, or contempt
v. 滥用： to put to a bad or improper use

invigorate.example: vt. 使精神，使强壮，鼓舞激励: news that invigorates the public 给大众打鸡血的新闻
invigorate.mean: vt. 使精神，使强壮，鼓舞激励： to impart vigor, strength, or vitality to

slumber.example: vt. 睡着: She slumbered for hours while the train rolled on. 她在火车行进过程中睡了四个小时。
slumber.mean: vt. 睡着： to be in a state of sleep

offbeat.example: adj. 不平常的: this writer has an enjoyably offbeat sense of humor 这个作者笑点很奇特
offbeat.mean: adj. 不平常的： noticeably different from what is generally found or experienced

cast.example:
vt. 提出: cast doubt on their reliability 对它们的可靠性提出质疑
v. 抛弃: once she became rich and didn't need them anymore, she cast off all her old friends like so much junk 当她有钱了不再需要朋友了，她把老友像糟粕一样抛弃
cast.mean:
n. 演员，演员阵容： a set of characters or persons
vt. 选派（演员）： to assign (as an actor) to a role or part
vt. 提出： to put forth, give off, to place as if by throwing
v. 抛弃： to get rid of as useless or unwanted

notoriety.example:
n. （尤指因为丑闻而出名的）名人: a television show featuring notorieties from 20 years of scandals 以二十年来因各色丑闻而出名的名人为卖点的电视节目
n. 坏名声: She gained notoriety when nude photographs of her appeared in a magazine. 她的裸照出现在杂志上让她声名远播。‖His comment about the President has given him a notoriety that he enjoys very much. 他对于总统的评论让他获得了很让他满意的名声。
notoriety.mean:
n. （尤指因为丑闻而出名的）名人： a person who is widely known and usually much talked about, especially for something bad; a notorious person
n. 坏名声： the quality or condition of being notorious; ill fame

verbose.example: adj. 冗长的，啰嗦的: a verbose orator 啰嗦的演讲者‖She has a verbose writing style. 她的文风很啰嗦。
verbose.mean: adj. 冗长的，啰嗦的： containing more words than necessary

slippery.example:
adj. 光滑的: The road is slippery after rain, so drive cautiously. 雨后路滑，谨慎驾驶。
