adj. 隐秘的: a bar where a lot of slippery characters were known to hang out 一个有许多秘密人物出没的酒吧
adj. 意义不明确的: a slippery concept that we had trouble understanding 一个难以理解的模糊概念
slippery.mean:
adj. 光滑的： causing or tending to cause something to slide or fall
adj. 隐秘的： given to acting in secret and to concealing one's intentions
adj. 意义不明确的： not precise or fixed in meaning, elusive or tricky

wry.example: adj. 扭曲的: a wry smile 扭曲的笑容
wry.mean:
adj. 扭曲的： abnormally twisted or bent to one side
adj. 坚持错误的： stubborn in adherence to wrong opinion or principles

pertain.example: v. 有关联: new evidence that pertains to the accident 与事故相关的新证据
pertain.mean: v. 有关联： to have a relation or connection; relate

implacable.example: adj. 无法平息的: an implacable enemy 无法与之和解的敌人
implacable.mean:
adj. 固执的： sticking to an opinion, purpose, or course of action in spite of reason, arguments, or persuasion
adj. 无法平息的： not capable of being appeased, significantly changed, or mitigated

palliate.example: v. 平息，减轻: palliative drug 缓解剂
palliate.mean: v. 平息，减轻： to make less severe or intense; mitigate

recumbent.example: adj. 躺着的: lying recumbent on the floor 躺在地板上势
recumbent.mean: adj. 躺着的： lying down, especially in a position of comfort or rest

sincere.example: adj. 真诚的，不做作的: She offered a sincere apology for her angry outburst. 她为她先前的盛怒表示诚挚的歉意。
sincere.mean: adj. 真诚的，不做作的： being without hypocrisy or pretense; true

nautical.example: adj. 航海的: nautical mile 海里
nautical.mean: adj. 航海的： of, relating to, or characteristic of ships, shipping, sailors, or navigation on a body of water

canon.example: n. 正教，标准: the canons of polite society 文明社会的法规
canon.mean:
n. 正教，标准： a basis for judgment; a standard or criterion
n. 真经，真典： the authentic works of a writer

discrepancy.example: n. （在事实和宣称之间的）差异或矛盾: a large discrepancy between the ideal image and the reality 理想与现实之间的巨大差距
discrepancy.mean: n. （在事实和宣称之间的）差异或矛盾： divergence or disagreement, as between facts or claims

embrace.example:
vt. 乐于接受: embrace the opportunity to study further 乐于接受继续深造的机会
vt. 包围: The stone walls that embrace the monastery serve to symbolize its function as a retreat from an unquiet world. 包围着修道院的石墙是它远离喧嚣尘世的象征
embrace.mean:
vt. 乐于接受： to take up willingly or eagerly
vt. 包围：to surround or cover closely

idolatrize.example: v.（通常盲目）崇拜: Some teenagers idolatrized Hitler more than their own parents. 曾经有一些青少年崇拜希特勒超过自己的父母
idolatrize.mean: v.（通常盲目）崇拜： admires intensely and often blindly

demolition.example: n. 破坏，毁坏: the demolition of dangerous buildings 危楼的拆毁
demolition.mean: n. 破坏，毁坏： the act or process of wrecking or destroying, especially destruction by explosives.

volition.example: n. 意志，自愿选择的行为: beyond his volition or control 超出了他的意志和控制范围
volition.mean: n. 意志，自愿选择的行为： the act or power of making one's own choices or decisions

incursion.example: n.入侵: homes damaged by the incursion of floodwater 被洪水入侵破坏的房屋
incursion.mean: n.入侵： a hostile entrance into a territory

ingrained.example: adj. 本质的，根深蒂固的: ingrained prejudice against foreigners 对外国人根深蒂固的偏见
ingrained.mean: adj. 本质的，根深蒂固的： forming a part of the essence or inmost being; firmly established

harsh.example:
adj. 粗糙的，不具有美感的: the harsh lighting in the cafeteria makes the food look slightly off-color 咖啡厅劣质刺眼的灯光让食物看起来卖相不佳
adj. 严厉的: a harsh judge when it comes to drug users and especially drug dealers 对于瘾君子特别是毒贩处罚格外严厉的法官
harsh.mean:
adj. 粗糙的，不具有美感的： unpleasantly coarse and rough to the touch, disagreeable to one's aesthetic or artistic sense
adj. 严厉的： unduly exacting, given to exacting standards of discipline and self-restraint

mite.example: n. 微小的东西，很少的钱: I have only a mite left to buy lunch for the rest of the week. 我只剩下一点钱来买剩下一周几天的午饭了
mite.mean: n. 微小的东西，很少的钱： a very small object, creature, or particle, a very small sum of money

fender.example: n. 缓冲装置: a fender on the SUV 运动越野车的一个防护板
fender.mean: n. 缓冲装置： a cushioning device, such as a bundle of rope or a piece of timber, used on the side of a vessel or dock to absorb impact or friction

moratorium.example: n. 延期，暂缓施行: a moratorium on nuclear tests 暂缓核试验
moratorium.mean: n. 延期，暂缓施行： a suspension of activity

demur.example:
vi. 表示异议，反对: demur at the suggestion 反对提议
n. 犹豫: we accepted his offer to pay for our dinners without demur 我们毫不犹豫地同意了他买单
demur.mean:
vi. 表示异议，反对： to voice opposition; object
n. 犹豫： hesitation (as in doing or accepting) usually based on doubt of the acceptability of something offered or proposed; qualm

levity.example: n. 轻浮: The teachers disapprove of any displays of levity during school assemblies. 老师们不允许学生在学校聚会过程中表现出任何轻浮的态度
levity.mean: n. 轻浮： excessive or unseemly frivolity

nicety.example:
n. 准确，精确: There's a nicety of detail in his meticulously painted landscapes. 在他精心绘制的景观图中，有着十分精准翔实的细节
n. 细微之处: the niceties of table manner 餐桌礼仪的细微之处‖niceties of diplomatic protocol 外交礼节中的细节
nicety.mean:
n. 准确，精确： careful attention to details; delicate exactness
n. 细微之处： a fine point or distinction

figurine.example: n. 小雕塑: His collection of figurines includes toy soldiers from every war that America has fought. 他收藏的小雕塑包括了所有美国参与过的战争中的兵人模型
figurine.mean: n. 小雕塑： a small statue

deference.example: n. 尊崇，顺从: He is shown much deference by his colleagues. 他的同事很尊敬他。
deference.mean: n. 尊崇，顺从： a readiness or willingness to yield to the wishes of others

moth-eaten.example: adj. 过时的: dressed in a moth-eaten style 过时的衣着
moth-eaten.mean: adj. 过时的：having passed its time of use or usefulness

shifty.example: adj. （显得）狡诈的，（显得）欺诈的: shifty practices such as turning back the odometers on used cars 一些欺骗性的花招，比如把旧车的里程表调零‖He had a shifty face so I won’t trust him. 他看起来贼目鼠眼的，我不会相信他。
shifty.mean: adj. （显得）狡诈的，（显得）欺诈的： having, displaying, or suggestive of deceitful character

pan.example: v./n. 严厉批评: almost all the movie critics have panned this latest sequel in a tired series 几乎所有的影评家都批评这部最新续集，认为是狗尾续貂
pan.mean: v./n. 严厉批评： a harsh criticism

exhaust.example:
vt. 耗尽: exhausted our funds in a week 在一周内就耗尽了我们的经费
vt. 耗尽: conduct an exhaustive investigation 做详尽的调查
vt. 使筋疲力尽: exhausted by overwork 加班使得筋疲力尽
exhaust.mean:
vt. 耗尽： to consume entirely, : to make complete use of
vt. 使筋疲力尽： to wear out completely

vestigial.example: adj. 退化的，发育不全的: snake that has vestigial limbs 拥有退化四肢的蛇
vestigial.mean: adj. 退化的，发育不全的： (of certain organs or parts of organisms) having attained a simple structure and reduced size and function during the evolution of the species

deft.example: adj. 灵巧的，熟练的: He finished off the painting with a few deft strokes of the brush. 他简单熟练的几笔便完成了画作。
deft.mean: adj. 灵巧的，熟练的： characterized by facility and skill

patrician.example:
n. 贵族，名门望族: the rank of a patrician 贵族等级
adj. 贵族的，地位高的: came from a patrician family 出身贵族世家
patrician.mean:
n. 贵族，名门望族： a man or woman of high birth or social position
adj. 贵族的，地位高的： of high birth, rank, or station

defy.example: vt. 反抗，违抗: defy the court 蔑视法庭
defy.mean: vt. 反抗，违抗： to go against the commands, prohibitions, or rules of

callow.example: adj. 缺乏老练、不成熟的: callow young man 未经世事的年轻人
callow.mean: adj. 缺乏老练、不成熟的： lacking in adult experience or maturity

subterfuge.example: n. 狡计: The spy obtained the documents by subterfuge. 间谍通过狡猾的计谋获得了文件。
subterfuge.mean: n. 狡计： deception by artifice or stratagem in order to conceal, escape, or evade

detour.example:
n. 偏离正常标准: we'll regard this relapse as just a brief detour on your road to recovery from substance abuse 我们把这次旧病复发看成你戒瘾道路上的一个小偏离
v. 改变方向或者路线: we had to detour for a few miles around the section of highway under construction 我们不得不绕远几公里为了避开正在维修的高速公路路段
detour.mean:
n. 偏离正常标准： a turning away from a course or standard
v. 改变方向或者路线： to change one's course or direction

drivel.example:
n. 胡言乱语: My roommate talks in her sleep, but it's just drivel. 我的室友会说梦话，但都是些没有意义的呓语
v. 胡言乱语，说傻话: He always drivel on about his “distinguished” family. 他总是痴痴地说着他所谓的“名门”出身
drivel.mean:
n. 胡言乱语： unintelligible or meaningless talk
v. 胡言乱语，说傻话： to talk stupidly and carelessly

sullen.example: adj. 闷闷不乐的: She remained sullen amid festivities alone. 她独自一人在喜庆的气氛中闷闷不乐。‖sullen skies that matched our mood on the day of the funeral 葬礼当天与我们很搭调的沉闷天气
sullen.mean: adj. 闷闷不乐的： causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer

outmaneuver.example: vt. 以策略取胜: outmaneuvered his congressional opponent 以计谋战胜了国会的对手
outmaneuver.mean: vt. 以策略取胜： to overcome (an opponent) by artful, clever maneuvering

leer.example: vi. 一瞥，斜眼看: He gave her a leering look. 他瞥了她一眼
leer.mean: vi. 一瞥，斜眼看： to cast a sidelong glance

teetotalism.mean: n. 禁酒： the principle or practice of complete abstinence from alcoholic drinks

shopworn.example: adj. 陈旧的: the shopworn suggestion to job applicants to “just be yourself” 老掉牙的让应征者“做你自己”的提议
shopworn.mean: adj. 陈旧的： worn-out, as from overuse; trite

odium.example: n. 憎恶，讨厌: time did nothing to diminish the odium in which the traitor lived out his days 时间也没有减少大家对这个叛徒的唾弃
odium.mean: n. 憎恶，讨厌： strong dislike, contempt, or aversion

suffuse.example: vt. （色彩等）弥漫，染遍，充满: a room suffused with warm sunlight 一个充满温暖阳光的房间
suffuse.mean: vt. （色彩等）弥漫，染遍，充满： to spread through or over, as with liquid, color, or light

intermittent.example:
adj. 间歇的，断断续续的: intermittent rain in June 六月里断断续续的梅雨
adj. 不定期的: The husband’s intermittent employment put the family in a difficult position financially. 丈夫不稳定的工作使得全家陷入了经济上的困境
intermittent.mean:
adj. 间歇的，断断续续的： coming and going at intervals, not continuous
adj. 不定期的： lacking in steadiness or regularity of occurrence

minimize.example:
vt. 将…减到最少: All striking forces are told to minimize civilian casualties. 所有攻击部队被要求尽可能减少平民伤亡
vt. 刻意低估: minimize losses in our own company while maximize those of the rival 低估我方损失而高估对手损失
vt. 表示鄙夷: Sore losers minimized the other team's victory. 愤愤不平的失败者对获胜方的胜利表现出鄙夷
minimize.mean:
vt. 将…减到最少： to reduce to the smallest possible amount, extent, size, or degree
vt. 刻意低估： to underestimate intentionally
vt. 表示鄙夷： to express scornfully one's low opinion of

nonentity.example:
n. 不重要的人: she was so quiet she was almost a nonentity at the meeting 她非常沉默，在会议上是个边缘人物
n. 虚构的东西: the arctic circle is a nonentity—you won't see it on the way to the north pole 北极圈是虚构的概念，去北极的路上你不会见到那么一个圈
nonentity.mean:
n. 不重要的人： a person or thing of little consequence or significance
n. 虚构的东西： a conception or image created by the imagination and having no objective reality

melodramatic.example: adj. 感情夸张的，伤感的: Our office drama queen yet again made the melodramatic declaration that she was contemplating suicide. 我们办公室的“影后”又一次在危言耸听了：这回她说她准备自杀
melodramatic.mean: adj. 感情夸张的，伤感的： exaggeratedly emotional or sentimental; histrionic

alleviate.example: v. 缓和，减轻: alleviate pain/suffering 减轻痛苦
alleviate.mean: v. 缓和，减轻： relieve, lessen

quixotic.example: adj. 不切实际的，空想的: She had quixotic dreams about the future. 她对未来有着幻想。
quixotic.mean: adj. 不切实际的，空想的： having or marked by a tendency to be guided more by ideals than by reality

justify.example: vt. 证明…的合理性，辩解: failed to justify the need for a new expressway at this time 没能证明修建新的高速公路的合理性‖The storm warning justified his leaving early. 他的早退因为风暴预警而显得理所当然。
justify.mean: vt. 证明…的合理性，辩解： to prove or show to be just, right, or reasonable

clog.example:
n. 阻碍物: impede with a clog 用障碍物阻止
v. 阻碍: They always clog the courts. 他们一直阻挠法庭工作。
v. 堵塞: Within a few years the pipe began to clog up. 没有几年，管子就开始堵塞了。
clog.mean:
n. 阻碍物：something that makes movement or progress difficult
v. 阻碍：to create difficulty for the work or activity of
v. 堵塞：to prevent passage through by filling with something

diffident.example:
adj. 不自信的: He is diffident to express his opinions in public. 他在公共场合表达自己的观点时有点害羞
adj. 内向的: She was diffident about stating her opinion. 她很内向，表达自己的观点的时候有点害羞。
diffident.mean:
adj. 不自信的： hesitant in acting or speaking through lack of self-confidence
adj. 内向的： reserved in manner; unassertive

prowl.example: vt. 潜行，巡游以猎取食物: I prowled the shop looking for sales. 我在商店里转悠，寻找打折商品。
prowl.mean: vt. 潜行，巡游以猎取食物： to roam through stealthily, as in search of prey or plunder

poach.example: vt. 水煮: He poached an egg for breakfast. 他煮了一个荷包蛋做早饭。
poach.mean: vt. 水煮： to cook in a liquid heated to the point that it gives off steam

truculent.example:
dj. 尖酸刻薄的: a theater critic who was notorious for his titanically truculent reviews 一个以超大量尖酸刻薄言论著称的话剧评论家
dj. 好战的: in an aggressively truculent manner 以好战的，进攻性的方式
truculent.mean:
dj. 尖酸刻薄的： marked by harsh insulting language
dj. 好战的： feeling or displaying eagerness to fight

disconcert.example: vt. 使不安: We were disconcerted by the unexpected changes to the program. 我们对项目未预料到的变化感到不安。
disconcert.mean: vt. 使不安： to disturb the composure of

clot.example:
n. 密集的一群: A clot of daisies occupied one corner of the flower bed. 一簇雏菊占据了花床的一角。
v. 堵塞: Within a few years the pipe began to clog up. 没有几年，管子就开始堵塞了。
v. 凝结: Scabs form over cuts when your blood starts to clot. 当血液开始凝结的时候，伤口处会形成血痂。
clot.mean:
n. 密集的一群：a number of things considered as a unit
v. 堵塞：to prevent passage through by filling with something
v. 凝结：to turn from a liquid into a substance resembling jelly

inception.example: n. 开端，开始: This seemed like a good program at its inception, but it isn't working out as planned. 一开始这像是个不错的项目，但是它没有按照我们的预期发展
inception.mean: n. 开端，开始： an act, process, or instance of beginning

pariah.example: n. 被排斥或鄙视的人: I felt like a pariah when I wore the wrong outfit to the dinner party. 当我穿着不恰当的礼服赴宴时，我感觉自己被别人狠狠地鄙视了
pariah.mean: n. 被排斥或鄙视的人： one that is despised or rejected, outcast

fateful.example:
adj. 意义重大的: make a fateful decision to declare war 做出了宣战的重大决定
adj. 带来灾难的，毁灭性的: a fateful journey 一趟致命的旅行
fateful.mean:
adj. 意义重大的： involving momentous consequences
adj. 带来灾难的，毁灭性的： bringing death or disaster

aspect.example: n. 外表，容貌: His face had a frightening aspect. 他的脸很吓人。
aspect.mean: n. 外表，容貌：appearance to the eye or mind

piebald.example:
adj. 杂色的: a piebald horse 一匹杂色马
adj. 混合的，杂糅而成的: his piebald ethnic background 他身为混血儿的背景
piebald.mean:
adj. 杂色的： of different colors
adj. 混合的，杂糅而成的： consisting of many things of different sorts

perilous.example: adj. 危险的: perilous journey through hostile territory 穿过敌方领土的危险行程
perilous.mean: adj. 危险的： involving potential loss or injury

persiflage.example: n. 打趣: Their tongue-in-cheek persiflage is sometimes mistaken for an exchange of insults by people who don't know them. 他们半开玩笑的打趣有时候被不认识他们的人误认为是在互相对骂
persiflage.mean: n. 打趣： good-natured teasing or exchanging of clever remarks

tirade.example: n. 长篇抨击性演讲: a tirade of angry protest 一个表达愤怒的抗议的长篇抨击性演讲
tirade.mean: n. 长篇抨击性演讲： a long angry or violent speech, usually of a censorious or denunciatory nature; a diatribe

speculate.example:
vt. 推测，揣测: I speculate that someone has been using this cabin as a trysting place. 我猜测有情侣把这个小屋当做他们幽会的地方。
vi. 投机倒卖: speculating on the oil market 在石油市场上投机倒卖
speculate.mean:
vt. 推测，揣测： to take to be true on the basis of insufficient evidence
vi. 投机倒卖： to buy or sell in expectation of profiting from market fluctuations

retinue.example: n. 随行人员: The premier inspected the factory with his retinue. 总理与随同人员一起视察了工厂。
retinue.mean: n. 随行人员： a group of retainers or attendants

domicile.example:
n. 住所，住宅: an alternate domicile in emergency 紧急情况下的住所
v. 提供住处: The university domiciles students in a variety of buildings in and around its urban campus. 大学在城区校园周围为学生提供了多样化的宿舍
domicile.mean:
n. 住所，住宅： a residence; a home
v. 提供住处： to establish in or provide with a domicile

sinuous.example: adj. 蜿蜒的，迂回的: The river flowed in a sinuous path through the lush valley. 蜿蜒曲折的河流流过茂密的山谷。‖Thirty-year-old men are novel, rich in content and sinuous in plots. 三十岁的男人是小说，内容丰富，情节曲折。
sinuous.mean: adj. 蜿蜒的，迂回的： marked by a long series of irregular curves; not direct

allude.example: vi. 间接提到: He also alluded to his rival's past marital troubles. 他间接提到了对手过去的婚姻问题。
allude.mean: vi. 间接提到： to convey an idea indirectly

verse.example:
vt. 使精通，使熟悉: well versed in the theater 精通剧院‖While in prison, he versed himself in the rights of the incarcerated. 当他身处监狱时，他通过自学熟悉了囚犯所享有的权利。
n. 诗歌: composed a short verse for his father’s birthday 为他父亲的生日创作了一首小诗
verse.mean:
vt. 使精通，使熟悉： to familiarize by close association, study, or experience
n. 诗歌： a composition using rhythm and often rhyme to create a lyrical effect

pundit.example: n. 权威人士，专家: the new laptop has gotten a thumbs-up from industry pundits 新出的笔记本电脑受到了业界专家的一致好评
pundit.mean: n. 权威人士，专家： a person who gives opinions in an authoritative manner usually through the mass media

doyen.example:
n. 有经验的人，资深人士: a doyen in the industry 业界的元老
n. （加入时间较长的）高级会员: He's the doyen of the admission committee, and his opinion has considerable weight. 他是招生委员会里的老人了，所以他的话往往格外有分量
doyen.mean:
n. 有经验的人，资深人士： a person considered to be knowledgeable or uniquely skilled as a result of long experience in some field of endeavor
n. （加入时间较长的）高级会员： the senior member of a group

mournful.example: adj. 悲伤的: The mournful survivors of the disaster were faced with the grim task of burying the dead. 悲伤的幸存者面临着掩埋灾难中死者尸体的可怕任务‖Mrs. Murphy fainted at the mournful news of her son’s death. Murphy太太听到她儿子的死讯后晕了过去
mournful.mean: adj. 悲伤的： feeling or expressing sorrow or grief

momentum.example: n. 动力: Their luck began to pick up momentum. 他们的运气开始转旺
momentum.mean: n. 动力： impetus of a physical object in motion

ream.example: v. 怒斥，训斥: You are so going to get reamed out when the boss learns that you wrecked the company car. 要是老板知道你把公司的车弄坏了，你肯定会挨骂的。
ream.mean: v. 怒斥，训斥：to criticize (someone) severely or angrily especially for personal failings

grit.example: n. （面对困难时所表现出来的）毅力: She was an athlete with true grit, continuing her training despite bad weather and an injury. 她是真正一个有着惊人毅力的运动员，即便是在受了伤外加天气恶劣的情况下仍然坚持训练。
grit.mean: n. （面对困难时所表现出来的）毅力： the strength of mind that enables a person to endure pain or hardship

exult.example: vi. 感到欢喜: exult in a triumph 沉浸在胜利的喜欢当中
exult.mean: vi. 感到欢喜： to rejoice especially with feelings or display of triumph or self-satisfaction

seamy.example: adj. 肮脏的，堕落的: the seamy side of urban life 城市生活的肮脏面
seamy.mean: adj. 肮脏的，堕落的： sordid; base

dart.example:
vi. 突然移动: The dog darted across the street. 狗飞奔过马路。
n. 公开侮辱: The darts flew fast and furiously when the two former lovers bumped into each other at the party. 旧情人在party上偶遇，立马开始激烈的人身攻击。
dart.mean:
vi. 突然移动： to move suddenly and rapidly
n. 公开侮辱： an act or expression showing scorn and usually intended to hurt another's feelings

earnest.example: adj. 严肃认真的: an earnest machine operator 一丝不苟的机器操作员
earnest.mean: adj. 严肃认真的： characterized by or proceeding from an intense and serious state of mind, grave

snarl.example:
. 纠缠，纠结: You'll be awfully sorry if you snarl your fishing line. 要是你把渔网给缠在一起，你肯定会非常后悔的。‖The new regulation has succeeded in nothing but snarling up rush-hour traffic throughout the city. 新的政策只将全城高峰时期的交通变得更为复杂难解。
i. 咆哮，怒吼: She snarled at me after I kept badgering her with questions. 在我不断用问题骚扰她之后，她终于忍不住爆发了。
snarl.mean:
. 纠缠，纠结： to twist together into a usually confused mass
i. 咆哮，怒吼： to give vent to anger in surly language

detract.example:
v. 贬低: It is wrong to detract from the achievements of other people in the same field. 贬低同行是不对的。
v. 使分心: Numerous typos in the text detract the reader's attention from the novel's intricate plot. 许多打印错误把读者分心，不关注复杂的情节了。
detract.mean:
v. 贬低： to diminish the importance, value, or effectiveness of something
v. 使分心： to draw the attention or mind to something else

parody.example:
n. （以嘲笑原作作者的）模仿作品: The Back Dormitory Boys specialize in parody of Backstreet Boys. 后舍男生擅长恶搞后街男孩。
v. 模仿（以嘲弄）: parodying a public figure's mannerisms 模仿嘲弄一个公共人物的举止
parody.mean:
n. （以嘲笑原作作者的）模仿作品： a literary or musical work in which the style of an author or work is closely imitated for comic effect or in ridicule
v. 模仿（以嘲弄）： to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of

stunt.example: vt. 阻碍（成长）: The inhospitable climate had stunted all vegetation. 不佳的气候条件抑制了所有植物的生长。
stunt.mean: vt. 阻碍（成长）： to hinder the normal growth, development, or progress of

snare.example:
n. 无法逃脱的困境: Someday you'll find that your lies are a snare from which you can't escape. 总有一天你会发现，你所说过的谎话都会变成你无法逃脱的困境。‖caught in the snare of drug addiction 处于吸毒上瘾的困境之中
vt. 捕捉: They snared a rabbit earlier in the day. 今天的早些时候他们捕获了一只兔子。‖The car salesman successfully snared three potential customers. 汽车销售员成功地让三个潜在的客户上钩了。
snare.mean:
n. 无法逃脱的困境： something that catches and holds
vt. 捕捉： to capture by or as if by use of a snare

reap.example: v. 收割，收获: As you sow, so shall you reap. 唯有付出，才有回报。‖She reaped large profits from her patents. 她的专利给她带来了丰厚的回报。
reap.mean: v. 收割，收获： to collect (a crop or natural resource) or to receive as return for effort

hovel.mean: n. 茅屋： a small, wretched, and often dirty house

grin.example: vi. 咧嘴笑: The boss grinned his approval. 老板咧嘴一笑表示赞许。
grin.mean: vi. 咧嘴笑： to express an emotion (as amusement) by curving the lips upward

clan.example: n. （有共同爱好的）团体，帮派: That clan of football fans has parties every weekend on which the New England Patriots play. 只要是新英格兰爱国者队有比赛的周末，那帮球迷就会举行聚会。
clan.mean: n. （有共同爱好的）团体，帮派： a group united by a common interest or common characteristics

acute.example:
adj. 敏锐的: an acute thinker 思维敏锐的思想者
adj. 严重的，急性的: acute appendicitis 急性阑尾炎
adj. （程度、影响）极强: experiencing acute distress over the misunderstanding with her best friend 因误会她的死党陷入了深深的痛苦
acute.mean:
adj. 敏锐的： marked by keen discernment or intellectual perception especially of subtle distinctions，penetrating
adj. 严重的，急性的： needing immediate attention
adj. （程度、影响）极强： extreme in degree, or effect

proponent.example: n. 建议者，支持者: a proponent of the use of electric-powered cars 电动能源汽车的支持者
proponent.mean: n. 建议者，支持者： one who argues in support of something; an advocate

cronyism.example: n. 任人唯亲，对好朋友的偏袒: officials practicing cronyism 任人唯亲的官员
cronyism.mean: n. 任人唯亲，对好朋友的偏袒： favoritism shown to old friends without regard for their qualifications

unrequited.example: adj. 无报答的，无报酬的: unrequited love 无报答的爱
unrequited.mean: adj. 无报答的，无报酬的： not reciprocated or returned in kind

sneer.example: vt. （轻蔑地）嘲笑: They would invariably sneer every time they passed the hapless nerds. 每次经过那个不幸的书呆子身边时，他们总是会报以不变的嘲笑。
sneer.mean: vt. （轻蔑地）嘲笑： to speak in a scornful, contemptuous, or derisive manner

tardy.example:
adj. 缓慢的，迟缓的: He was tardy to work. 他做事拖拖拉拉。
adj. 延后的，迟的: a tardy arrival 迟到
tardy.mean:
adj. 缓慢的，迟缓的： moving slowly: sluggish
adj. 延后的，迟的： delayed beyond the expected or proper time

engross.example: vt. 使全神贯注: was completely engrossed in his work 全神贯注于他的工作之中
engross.mean: vt. 使全神贯注：to occupy exclusively

rigmarole.example: n. 混乱而无意义的话: The security guard gave me some kind of rigmarole about passes and authorizations. 保安不知所云地跟我说了一些关于通关和授权的话。
rigmarole.mean: n. 混乱而无意义的话： language marked by abstractions, jargon, euphemisms, and circumlocutions; confused or meaningless talk

feckless.example:
adj. 无成果的，没有价值的: years of feckless negotiations 长达数年的毫无成果的谈判
adj. 粗心不负责任的: The young man was feckless and irresponsible. 这个年轻人既粗心又没有责任感
feckless.mean:
adj. 无成果的，没有价值的： having no real worth or purpose
adj. 粗心不负责任的： careless and irresponsible

inter.example: vt. 埋葬: The infamous terrorist leader Bin Laden was interred at sea. 臭名昭著的恐怖分子本拉登被葬于海中
inter.mean: vt. 埋葬： to place in a grave or tomb

captious.example: adj. 吹毛求疵的，爱挑毛病的: a captious and cranky eater who has never met a vegetable he didn’t hate 一个古怪又挑剔的食客，从来就没有他不讨厌的蔬菜
captious.mean: adj. 吹毛求疵的，爱挑毛病的： marked by an often ill-natured inclination to stress faults and raise objections

obstruct.example:
vt. 妨碍，制造困难: He was charged with obstructing justice by lying to investigators. 他被指控向检察官说谎，妨碍司法。
vt. 阻挡: an unobstructed view 无阻碍的视野
obstruct.mean:
vt. 妨碍，制造困难： to impede, retard, or interfere with; hinder; to create difficulty for the work or activity of
vt. 阻挡： to prevent passage through by filling with something

falsehood.example: n. 谎言: Truth always rise above falsehood, as oil rise above water. 油脂水面浮，真理胜谎言
falsehood.mean: n. 谎言： a statement known by its maker to be untrue and made in order to deceive

debilitate.example: vt. 使衰弱: The virus debilitates the body's immune system. 病毒削弱了免疫系统。
debilitate.mean: vt. 使衰弱： to impair the strength of; enfeeble

conditional.example: adj. 有条件的，受制约的: a conditional offer 有条件限制的录取‖Their support is conditional on their approval of his proposals. 他只有让他的提案得到他们的同意才能得到援助。
conditional.mean: adj. 有条件的，受制约的： subject to, implying, or dependent upon a condition

interlock.example: vi. 连锁: The branches of the trees interlock to form a natural archway. 树枝相互缠绕在一起，形成了天然的拱门
interlock.mean: vi. 连锁： to become united or joined closely, as by hooking or dovetailing

sybarite.example: n. 沉于奢侈逸乐者，酒色之徒: The prince was remembered as a self-indulgent sybarite. 王子酒色之徒的名声远扬。
sybarite.mean: n. 沉于奢侈逸乐者，酒色之徒： a person devoted to pleasure and luxury; a voluptuary

tacit.example: adj. 暗示的: tacit consent 默许
tacit.mean: adj. 暗示的： implied or indicated (as by an act or by silence) but not actually expressed

extinct.example: adj. 灭绝的: extinct species 灭绝的物种
extinct.mean: adj. 灭绝的： no longer existing or living

dolt.example: n. 笨蛋: What a dolt I have been! 我是多么的愚蠢啊！
dolt.mean: n. 笨蛋： a stupid person

herald.example:
vt. 告知: herald the great tidings to all the world 将重大消息告知全世界
v. 预示，预兆: the reshuffle of the company's management heralded the sweeping changes to come 公司管理层的重新洗牌预示着即将到来的巨大变革
herald.mean:
vt. 告知： to make known openly or publicly
v. 预示，预兆： to give a slight indication of beforehand

twig.example: v. 了解: It took me a while to twig the true nature of the relationship between the two women. 我花了很久时间才搞清楚这俩女人之间的关系。
twig.mean: v. 了解： to have a clear idea of

truncate.example: v. 截短（时间，程度）: a truncated version of the 11 o'clock newscast followed the awards show, which ran over its time slot 颁奖典礼之后缩短版的11点新闻节目，已经超出了预定时长
truncate.mean: v. 截短（时间，程度）： to shorten by or as if by cutting off

renounce.example:
vt. （正式地）放弃: renounce his nationality 退出国籍
vt. 宣布与…决裂: renounce the authority of the church 宣布与教廷彻底决裂
renounce.mean:
vt. （正式地）放弃： to give up, refuse, or resign usually by formal declaration
vt. 宣布与…决裂： to refuse to follow, obey, or recognize any further

riveting.example: adj. 吸引人的，极迷人的: The riveting novel has, as previously expected, become a national best-seller. 正如先前所预料的，这本引人入胜的小说成为了畅销书
riveting.mean: adj. 吸引人的，极迷人的： wholly absorbing or engrossing one's attention

sanguine.example:
adj. 乐观的，确信的: I'm reasonably sanguine about the adoption of the latest proposal. 我非常看好最新的那项提议获得通过。
adj. 面色红润的: a baby with a sanguine complexion is more likely to leave the hospital early than a sickly-looking one 面色红润的新生儿比病怏怏的能更早出院
sanguine.mean:
adj. 乐观的，确信的： having or showing a mind free from doubt
adj. 面色红润的： having a healthy reddish skin tone

fusty.example:
adj. 过时的: fusty old carpets 过时的旧地毯
adj. 腐臭的: the fusty odor of a damp cellar 潮湿的地下室里的腐臭味道
fusty.mean:
adj. 过时的： rigidly old-fashioned or reactionary
adj. 腐臭的： saturated with dust and stale odors

conservative.example:
adj. 守旧的，不愿改变的: a conservative political stance 一个守旧的政治立场
adj. 不招摇的，低调的: dressing in conservative outfits so as to make a good impression at job interviews 身着低调得体的套装以期待在面试时留下一个好印象
adj. 谨慎小心的: He made conservative investments, and so he wasn't ruined when the market went into a free fall. 他只做了一份谨慎保守的投资，以防市场崩盘时不至于破产
conservative.mean:
adj. 守旧的，不愿改变的： favoring traditional views and values; tending to oppose change
adj. 不招摇的，低调的： not excessively showy
adj. 谨慎小心的： having or showing a close attentiveness to avoiding danger or trouble

pioneer.example:
n. 扩荒者，先驱者: the hardships that the pioneers endured while taming the wilderness 在驯服自然的过程中扩荒者所受到的种种磨难‖a pioneer in aviation 航空业的先驱
adj. 最初的，最早的: the nation's pioneer institutions for the education of African-Americans 为了非裔美国人的教育而设立的第一批教育机构
vt. 开创，创造: He single-handedly pioneered the university’s institute for medical research. 他单枪匹马创建了这所大学里的医学研究所。‖rockets that pioneered outer space 开创了外太空纪元的火箭
pioneer.mean:
n. 扩荒者，先驱者： one of the first to settle in a territory
adj. 最初的，最早的： coming before all others in time or order
vt. 开创，创造： to open up (an area) or prepare (a way)

corrosive.example:
adj. 腐蚀性的: Concentrated sulfur acid is highly corrosive. 浓硫酸有极强的腐蚀性
adj. 讽刺性的: corrosive satire 讽刺性的作品
corrosive.mean:
adj. 腐蚀性的： tending to destroy slowly by chemical action
adj. 讽刺性的： bitingly sarcastic

juggernaut.example: n. 无法阻挡的力量， 摧毁一切的强大力量: the juggernaut of industrialization 工业化无法阻挡的力量
juggernaut.mean: n. 无法阻挡的力量， 摧毁一切的强大力量： an overwhelming, advancing force that crushes everything in its path

ethos.example: n. 道德准则: Rigorous self-discipline was central to the ethos of the ancient Spartans. 严格的自律是古代斯巴达人所尊崇的核心道德准则。
ethos.mean: n. 道德准则： the code of good conduct for an individual or group

moderate.example:
vt. 使缓和: Sopranos and tenors moderates their voices to fit the size of the theater. 女高音和男高音们根据剧场的大小调节他们的声音以创造合适的效果
adj. 适度的，中庸的: The new proposals regarding defense budget were met with only moderate enthusiasm. 关于国防预算的新提案只得到了平淡的回应
moderate.mean:
vt. 使缓和： to lessen the intensity or extremeness of
adj. 适度的，中庸的： being within reasonable limits; not excessive or extreme

apocalyptic.example:
adj. 预言的，启示的: No one listened to her apocalyptic predictions. 没有人听她的预言。
adj. 重要的，转折点的 of, relating to, or being a major turning point
: the apocalyptic Battle of Stalingrad leading to the ultimate defeat of Nazi Germany 具有转折点意义的斯大林格勒战役导致了最后纳粹德国的战败
adj. 夸大的 wildly unrestrained : grandiose
: apocalyptic tone 夸大的语气
apocalyptic.mean:
adj. 预言的，启示的：of a revelatory or prophetic nature
adj. 重要的，转折点的 of, relating to, or being a major turning point
adj. 夸大的 wildly unrestrained : grandiose

squabble.example: n. 口角，小争吵: a brief squabble over what to do next 关于接下来该做什么的争吵
squabble.mean: n. 口角，小争吵： a noisy quarrel, usually about a trivial matter

intimate.example:
adj. 有紧密联系的，亲密无间的: intimate friends since childhood 孩童时期以来的密友
adj. 不为人知的: They broke up after she shared intimate information with all 500 of her closest friends. 在她把那些不为人知的消息告诉了她500个朋友之后，他们分手了
n. 密友: Usually quite aloof in public, he's actually quite relaxed with his intimates. 通常他在大众面前显得比较孤傲，但和好朋友在一起时他却是个很放松的人
v. 迂回地交流，间接地沟通: intimate a wish to leave 暗示想离开
intimate.mean:
adj. 有紧密联系的，亲密无间的： marked by very close association, contact, or familiarity
adj. 不为人知的： not known or meant to be known by the general populace
n. 密友： a person who has a strong liking for and trust in another
v. 迂回地交流，间接地沟通： to communicate delicately and indirectly

equivalent.example: adj./n. 等价的，相等的: that huge mansion is the equivalent of five ordinary houses 那栋巨大的公馆有五套一般户型的房子那么大
equivalent.mean: adj./n. 等价的，相等的： equal in force, amount, or value

ration.example:
n. 定额供应量，配给量: The meat ration was down to one pound per person per week. 肉的人均供给量降至了每周一磅。
vt. 按比例分配: The region has had to ration water during times of drought. 干旱时该地区不得不按比例分配水资源。
ration.mean:
n. 定额供应量，配给量： an amount allotted or made available especially from a limited supply
vt. 按比例分配： to give as a share or portion

squall.example:
n. （通常伴随着雨或雪的）风暴，暴风雪: A snow squall is expected tonight. 今晚预计有暴风雪。
vt. 尖叫: The baby squalled in pain. 婴儿因为疼痛而大叫。
squall.mean:
n. （通常伴随着雨或雪的）风暴，暴风雪： a brief, sudden, violent windstorm, often accompanied by rain or snow
vt. 尖叫： to scream or cry loudly and harshly

despicable.example:
adj. 令人鄙视的: even within the prison population, pedophiles are regarded as particularly despicable 即使在囚犯内部，恋童癖者也被认为极其让人鄙视的。
adj. 不荣耀的，不得体的: the cad's despicable behavior toward women 公车售票员对女性不得体的举动
despicable.mean:
adj. 令人鄙视的： arousing or deserving of one's loathing and disgust
adj. 不荣耀的，不得体的： not following or in accordance with standards of honor and decency

resign.example: vt. 辞职，放弃（职位）: resigned her position at the university 自动放弃她在大学的职位
resign.mean: vt. 辞职，放弃（职位）： to give up one's job or office

finicky.example: adj. 过分讲究的，挑剔的: have a reputation for being finicky eater 有着挑食的名声
finicky.mean: adj. 过分讲究的，挑剔的： extremely or excessively particular, exacting, or meticulous in taste or standards

vacillate.example: i. 犹豫不决: Parents vacillate between saying no and yes, but actually neither response seems satisfactory to their children. 父母总是犹豫不定，不知道是该同意还是该反对，但是事实上哪种答案对他们的孩子都不理想。
vacillate.mean:
i. 犹豫不决： to waver in mind, will, or feeling: hesitate in choice of opinions or courses
i. 摇动，摇摆： to sway from one side to the other; oscillate

cornucopia.example: n. 大量: a cornucopia of employment opportunities 大量的就业机会
cornucopia.mean: n. 大量：an overflowing store; an abundance

fringe.example: n. 边缘: “Don’t act on the fringes of the law,” warns the customs officer. 海关人员警告说：“不要打法律的擦边球”
fringe.mean:
n. 边缘： something that resembles such a border or edging
v. 接壤： to be adjacent to

acclimate.example: vt. 使适应: acclimate oneself to a nine-to-five office job 适应朝九晚五的坐班生活
acclimate.mean: vt. 使适应： to change (something) so as to make it suitable for a new use or situation

smattering.example:
n. 浅薄的知识: a smattering of Greek grammar 略懂希腊语语法
n. 少量: Only a smattering of spectators presented. 只有少数几个观看者出席了。
smattering.mean:
n. 浅薄的知识： superficialor piecemeal knowledge
n. 少量： a small scattered number or amount

remonstrance.example: n. 抗议，抱怨: She seems deaf to her son’s remonstrances. 她似乎对儿子的抗议充耳不闻。‖Aggravated by the noisy metro construction, many residents wrote letters of remonstrance to city officials. 许多被地铁建设的噪音激怒的居民向市政府投去了抗议信。
remonstrance.mean: n. 抗议，抱怨： an expression of protest, complaint, or reproof, especially a formal statement of grievances

testimony.example: n. 证词，声明: The jury heard 10 days of testimony. 陪审团进行了10天的听证。
testimony.mean: n. 证词，声明： firsthand authentication of a fact

doze.example: vi./n.小憩: He dozed off during the lecture. 他在讲座上睡着了
doze.mean: vi./n.小憩： to sleep lightly or briefly

mean.example:
adj. 卑贱的: a mean trick to play on a credulous person 耍在一个轻信别人的人身上的卑劣诡计
adj. 吝啬的: a mean child who hoarded all her toys 一个把她所有的玩具都藏了起来的小气孩子
v. 打算，怀有目的: I mean to win this race. 我一定要赢这场比赛
v. 意味着: The national anthem means various things to various people. 对于不同的人来说，国歌的意义不尽相同
mean.mean:
adj. 卑贱的： ignoble; base
adj. 吝啬的： giving or sharing as little as possible
v. 打算，怀有目的： to have in mind as a purpose or goal
v. 意味着： to serve or intend to convey, show, or indicate

provisional.example: adj. 临时的: he was appointed provisional executor of the industrialist's vast estate 他被任命为庞大工业帝国的临时执行官
provisional.mean: adj. 临时的： provided or serving only for the time being; temporary

obdurate.example:
adj. 固执的: She is known for her obdurate determination. 她以坚定不移著称。
adj. 冷酷无情的: the obdurate refusal of the crotchety old man to let the neighborhood kids retrieve their ball from his backyard 那个怪老头冷酷无情地拒绝了孩子们进他后院找球的请求
obdurate.mean:
adj. 固执的： resistant to persuasion or softening influences
adj. 冷酷无情的： having or showing a lack of sympathy or tender feelings

dilettante.example: n./ adj. 业余爱好者（对艺术或知识领域涉猎浅薄者）/ 缺乏专业技术的: Dilettante watch the scene of bustle, adept guard the entrance. 外行看热闹，内行看门道。|| Many dilettante efforts could be seen at the sidewalk art show. 街边艺术展上可以看到很多技术业余的作品
dilettante.mean: n./ adj. 业余爱好者（对艺术或知识领域涉猎浅薄者）/ 缺乏专业技术的： a person having a superficial interest in an art/ lacking or showing a lack of expert skill

perspicuity.example: n. 清晰明了: The key of modern enterprise system is the prespicuity of property right. 现代企业制度的核心是产权的明晰
perspicuity.mean: n. 清晰明了： the quality of being perspicuous; clearness and lucidity

potentiate.example: vt. 激活，加强: additives to potentiate the drug 增强药效的添加剂
potentiate.mean: vt. 激活，加强： to make effective or active, or more effective or more active

annotate.example: vt. 做注解: The advent of e-books enables user to freely annotate what they are reading without worrying about being fined by libraries. 电子书的出现使得用户可以在不用担心被图书馆处以罚金的情况下自由地在读物上作注。
annotate.mean: vt. 做注解： to furnish (a literary work) with critical commentary or explanatory notes

harness.example: vt. 利用: harness the sun's rays as a source of energy 利用阳光作为一种能源

maladroit.example: adj. 笨拙的: a maladroit movement 笨拙的动作
maladroit.mean: adj. 笨拙的： lacking or showing a lack of nimbleness in using one's hands

stoke.example:
vt. 添加燃料: She was stoking the furnace. 她正用给火炉添木头。
vt. 增大，促进: stoke workers’ commitment to the company by raising their salaries 通过加薪来提升员工对公司的忠诚度
stoke.mean:
vt. 添加燃料： supply with fuel
vt. 增大，促进： to make greater in size, amount, or number

abrogate.example:
v. 官方的正式废除: abrogate the law/ treaty 废除法律、条约
v. 无视（某事的）存在: abrogate their responsibilities 抛开、不顾他们的责任
abrogate.mean:
v. 官方的正式废除： to abolish by authoritative action, annul
v. 无视（某事的）存在： to treat as nonexistent

hew.example:
vi. 遵守: hew to tradition 遵守传统
v. 支持: no longer was able to hew to the party line and so he switched political parties 不再赞同该党的纲领，他投奔了另一个党
hew.mean:
vi. 遵守： confirm, adhere, to hold to something firmly as if by adhesion
v. 支持： to give steadfast support to

vaporize.example:
vt. 使（液体）蒸发: gasify
vt. 彻底消灭: The entire fleet was vaporized. 整个舰队都被消灭了。
vaporize.mean:
vt. 使（液体）蒸发： to convert (as by the application of heat or by spraying) into vapor
vt. 彻底消灭： to destroy by or as if by converting into vapor

inadvertent.example:
adj. 偶然发生的: an inadvertent encounter with a rattlesnake 偶遇响尾蛇
adj. 疏忽的，不留意的: The military has said it was an inadvertent error. 军方表示这是个疏忽大意的错误
inadvertent.mean:
adj. 偶然发生的： happening by chance
adj. 疏忽的，不留意的： marked by unintentional lack of care

stickler.example: n. 坚持细节的人，一丝不苟的人: a stickler for perfection 完美主义者‖a stickler for neatness 有洁癖的人
stickler.mean: n. 坚持细节的人，一丝不苟的人： one who insists on exactness or completeness in the observance of something

mar.example:
n.污点，坏点: mars on the furniture 家具上的污点
vt. 破坏，削弱: The once flatroad surface is now marred by numerous potholes. 曾经平整的路面如今被坑洞所破坏‖an election marred by sexual scandal 被性丑闻蒙上阴影的选举
mar.mean:
n.污点，坏点： something that spoils the appearance or completeness of a thing
vt. 破坏，削弱： to impair the soundness, perfection, or integrity of; spoil

decode.example:
vt. 解码: the agents worked into the night to decode the intercepted message from the enemy spy 情报人员夜以继日地破解从敌方间谍拦截的信息
v. 有清晰想法，理解,解读: a convoluted thriller, the plot of which I was never able to actually decipher 一部错综复杂的恐怖电影，情节我一直没有理解
decode.mean:
vt. 解码： to change (as a secret message) from code into ordinary language
v. 有清晰想法，理解,解读： to have a clear idea of

hangdog.example: adj. 伤心的，沮丧的: She came home with a hangdog expression on her face. 她一脸沮丧地回到了家。
hangdog.mean: adj. 伤心的，沮丧的： sad, dejected

compliant.example: adj. 顺从的: a corrupt regime aided by a compliant television station 一个在顺从的电视台帮助下的腐败政府
compliant.mean: adj. 顺从的：ready or disposed to comply: submissive

bromide.example: n. 陈词滥调: a newspaper editorial offering the timeworn bromide that people should settle their differences peacefully 报纸编辑又拿出那一套呼吁和平解决纷争的陈词滥调
bromide.mean: n. 陈词滥调： a commonplace or hackneyed statement or notion

futile.example:
adj. 无效的，无用的: It would be an undoubtedly futile effort to persuade him. 想说服他毫无疑问是徒劳的
adj. 不严肃的: the futile chatter of gossip columnists about the comings and goings of Hollywood celebrities 八卦的专栏作家们对于好莱坞名人来来往往的随意闲谈
futile.mean:
adj. 无效的，无用的： serving no useful purpose; completely ineffective
adj. 不严肃的： lacking in seriousness or maturity

galvanize.example: vt. （好似被用电击）刺激: an issue that would galvanize public opinion 激起大众评论的问题
galvanize.mean: vt. （好似被用电击）刺激： to stimulate or excite as if by an electric shock

mollify.example: vt. 平息抚慰，缓和: mollify the angry customer 平息消费者的怒气
mollify.mean: vt. 平息抚慰，缓和： to calm in temper or feeling

condone.example: vt. 宽恕，忽视: By his silence, he seemed to condone their behavior. 他的沉默流露出了他对他们行为的宽恕。|| He is too quick to condone his friend's faults. 她太快了以至于忽视了他朋友的过错。
condone.mean: vt. 宽恕，忽视：to overlook, forgive, or disregard (an offense) without protest or censure.

immaculate.example:
adj. 干净的，纯净的: an immaculate soul 一个纯净的灵魂
adj. 完美的，没有任何错误的: an immaculate rendering of the Queen of the Night ’s aria （《魔笛》中）夜后咏叹调的完美演绎
immaculate.mean:
adj. 干净的，纯净的： free from dirt or stain; free from any trace of the coarse or indecent
adj. 完美的，没有任何错误的： being entirely without fault or flaw

carouse.example: vi. 畅饮，狂饮作乐: stay at home instead of going out and carousing with friends 呆在家里而不是出去和朋友们狂饮作乐
carouse.mean: vi. 畅饮，狂饮作乐： to drink liquor freely or excessively

tycoon.example: n. 大亨，巨头: an oil tycoon who's widely considered the most powerful man in the county 被认为是郡上最有势力的一个石油大亨‖The automobile tycoon is on the verge of bankruptcy. 汽车巨头濒临破产的边缘。
tycoon.mean: n. 大亨，巨头： a person of rank, power, or influence in a particular field

gibe.example: vt. 嘲弄: gibe at the umpire 嘲弄裁判员
gibe.mean: vt. 嘲弄： to deride or tease with taunting words

verbatim.example: adv. 逐字地，一字不差地: You can't just copy the encyclopedia article verbatim for your report - that's plagiarism. 你不能一字不差地抄百科全书上的内容——这是剽窃。
verbatim.mean: adv. 逐字地，一字不差地： in the exact words

hesitance.example: n. 犹豫，不情愿: sales figures for the month were up, as consumers began to overcome their hesitance about purchasing big-ticket items 月销售额有所上涨，因为消费者对于大件商品的购买由观望转向消费
hesitance.mean: n. 犹豫，不情愿： the quality or state of being hesitant, reluctance

tranquility.example: n. 宁静，淡定: enjoyed the tranquillity of the snow-covered field at dusk 享受傍晚时分被雪覆盖的田野的静谧
tranquility.mean: n. 宁静，淡定： a state of freedom from storm or disturbance

smuggling.example: n. 走私，私运: He was arrested for smuggling drugs into the country. 他因为向境内走私毒品而被逮捕。
smuggling.mean: n. 走私，私运： secret importation or exportation contrary to the law and especially without paying duties imposed by law

fastidious.example: adj. 挑剔的，极仔细的，追求完美的: be fastidious about personal hygiene and appearance 极其注意个人卫生和外表
fastidious.mean: adj. 挑剔的，极仔细的，追求完美的： possessing or displaying careful, meticulous attention to detail

sophisticated.example:
adj. 精明的，老于世故的: On the train I met a surprisingly sophisticated and widely traveled child. 在火车上我见到了一个老练得让人惊讶的、见多识广的孩子。
adj. 复杂的: a very sophisticated machine that is a marvel of modern design 一个十分复杂的机器，是现代设计的最高成就
sophisticated.mean:
adj. 精明的，老于世故的： having acquired worldly knowledge or refinement; lacking natural simplicity or naiveté
adj. 复杂的： very complex or complicated

shroud.example:
n. 隐蔽物，可起隐藏、保护或屏护作用的某物: under a shroud of fog 在迷雾的掩护下
v. 将…从视线中隔离，遮蔽: shrouded the fact that the child had been adopted 将孩子是领养的这个事实隐藏起来
shroud.mean:
n. 隐蔽物，可起隐藏、保护或屏护作用的某物： something that conceals, protects, or screens:
v. 将…从视线中隔离，遮蔽： to shut off from sight; screen

recoil.example: vi. 退却，畏缩: recoil from the snake 因为害怕蛇而畏缩不前‖She recoiled from his touch. 她因害怕与他接触而退缩
recoil.mean: vi. 退却，畏缩： to shrink back, as under pressure or in fear or repugnance

antiquated.example: adj. 古老的，过时的: We saw an antiquated hand-cranked rope-making machine at the textiles museum. 我们在纺织博物馆里看到了一台手摇式古董制绳机。‖antiquated methods of farming 已经过时的耕种技术
antiquated.mean: adj. 古老的，过时的： outmoded or discredited by reason of age: being out of style or fashion

rouse.example:
v. 激起，煽动: He was roused to fury. 他大为光火。
v. 唤醒: The piercing siren roused her from a deep sleep 刺耳的警笛声将她从沉睡中唤醒。
rouse.mean:
v. 激起，煽动： to stir up
v. 唤醒： to cause to stop sleeping

emancipate.example: v. 解放，解除束缚: emancipate students from excessive assignments 将学生从题海中解放出来
emancipate.mean: v. 解放，解除束缚： to free from bondage, oppression, or restraint

tawdry.example: adj. 俗丽的: a tawdry attempt to smear his opponent 企图污蔑对手的下三滥的手段
tawdry.mean: adj. 俗丽的： cheap and gaudy in appearance or quality; ignoble

regimen.example: n. （政治上的）统治: A new party will have regimen over the nation and, hopefully, bring some much-needed change. 一个新的政党将要上台，希望他们能带来一些迫切的改革。
regimen.mean: n. （政治上的）统治： lawful control over the affairs of a political unit (as a nation)

flamboyant.example: adj. 艳丽夺目的，炫耀的，充满装饰的: Las Vegas showgirls wearing flamboyant headdresses 打扮花哨的拉斯维加斯舞女
flamboyant.mean: adj. 艳丽夺目的，炫耀的，充满装饰的： marked by or given to strikingly elaborate or colorful display or behavior; ornate

rage.example: n./v. 暴怒: Her rages rarely last more than a few minutes. 她的暴躁来得快去得也快。
rage.mean: n./v. 暴怒： violent and uncontrolled anger

fabricate.example:
vt. 捏造: be accused of fabricating evidence 被指控有捏造证据的行为
vt. 搭建，组建；打造: The house was essentially fabricated at the factory and then shipped to the site for assembly. 这间房屋的核心主体在工厂内建好之后，它被运往目的地直接进行组装‖All the key parts are fabricated from high quality titanium alloy. 所有的关键零件都是由上好的钛合金打造的
fabricate.mean:
vt. 捏造： to make up for the purpose of deception
vt. 搭建，组建；打造： to bring into being by combining, shaping, or transforming materials

attenuate.example: v. 使降低（数量，力量，价值）: an investment attenuated by inflation 一份因通货膨胀而贬值的投资.
attenuate.mean: v. 使降低（数量，力量，价值）： to lessen the amount, force, magnitude, or value of

excruciate.example: vt. 折磨，使痛苦: She has long been excruciated by a persistent pain in her back. 她长久以来被背痛折磨
excruciate.mean: vt. 折磨，使痛苦： to inflict severe pain on; torture

ruse.example: n. 诡计: This was a ruse to divide them. 这是一招反间计。
ruse.mean: n. 诡计： a wily subterfuge

flirt.example:
vi. 调情: The waitress at that restaurant flirts with all single male customers. 这家餐厅的女服务员对所有的男性单身顾客都暗送秋波
vi. 无规则地快速运动: lazily watched the butterflies flirting among the wildflowers 慵懒地看着蝴蝶在野花丛中乱舞
flirt.mean:
vi. 调情： to behave amorously without serious intent
vi. 无规则地快速运动： to make an irregular series of quick, sudden movements

wastrel.example: n. 肆意挥霍的人，败家子: He ended up being a wastrel and a drunkard. 他最后成了一个花天酒地的败家子。
wastrel.mean: n. 肆意挥霍的人，败家子： one who expends resources foolishly and self-indulgently

diatribe.example:
n. 长篇抨击性演讲: He was forced to sit through a long diatribe. 他被迫耐着性子听完一个长篇抨击性演讲。
n. 挖苦，讽刺的指责: The movie reviewer wrote a diatribe of the movie describing it as having excessive sex and violence. 那个影评人指责这个电影还有过多的色情和暴力。
diatribe.mean:
n. 长篇抨击性演讲： a long angry speech or scolding
n. 挖苦，讽刺的指责： ironic or satirical criticism

eschew.example: v. 刻意避开；戒绝: the minister eschews involvement in local politics, since he doesn't want to diminish his moral authority in the community 首相回避参与当地政治，因为他不想降低其道德权威
eschew.mean: v. 刻意避开；戒绝： to avoid habitually especially on moral or practical grounds

ennui.example: n. 倦怠；缺乏兴趣: the kind of ennui that comes from having too much time on one's hands and too little will to find something productive to do 倦怠来自于手上有大把时间却没有有益的事可做
ennui.mean: n. 倦怠；缺乏兴趣： listlessness and dissatisfaction resulting from lack of interest

deadlock.example: n. 僵局: The deadlock was broken with a key compromise. 一个关键性的妥协打破了僵局。
deadlock.mean:
n. 僵局： a state of inaction or neutralization resulting from the opposition of equally powerful uncompromising persons or factions
vt. 使陷入僵局，使停顿： to bring or come to a deadlock

subdue.example: vt. 征服；使顺从: subdued the native tribes after years of fighting 经过多年征战终于征服了当地的部落
subdue.mean: vt. 征服；使顺从： to conquer and bring into subjection; to bring under one's control by force of arms

gratuitous.example:
adj. 无根据的，无理由的: a dubious request based on a gratuitous assumption 基于无根据假设的可疑要求
adj. 无报酬的，免费的: a gratuitous ticket 免费的门票
gratuitous.mean:
adj. 无根据的，无理由的： unnecessary or unwarranted
adj. 无报酬的，免费的： given or granted without return or recompense
adj. 多余的： not needed by the circumstances or to accomplish an end

conundrum.example: n.无法解决的问题，迷: a difficult conundrum even for the experts 一道即便是专家也束手无策的难题
conundrum.mean: n.无法解决的问题，迷： a paradoxical, insoluble, or difficult problem; a dilemma

caustic.example:
adj. 腐蚀性的: The chemical was so caustic that it ate through the pipes. 化学性质如此具有腐蚀性，以至于把管道都腐蚀了。
adj. 挖苦讽刺的，刻薄的: caustic movie reviews 尖酸刻薄的影评
caustic.mean:
adj. 腐蚀性的： capable of destroying or eating away by chemical action : corrosive
adj. 挖苦讽刺的，刻薄的： marked by incisive sarcasm

censor.example: vt. 审查并删除不良的东西: censor the news 审查新闻
censor.mean: vt. 审查并删除不良的东西： to examine in order to suppress or delete anything considered objectionable

ineluctable.example: adj.无法逃避的，必然的: Although death is an ineluctable fate for any and every individual organism, it lays the foundation of the metabolism that perpetuates the planetary ecosystem. 尽管死亡对于任何单个的有机体而言是不可避免的宿命，但它奠定了能使整个行星生态系统永不衰竭的新陈代谢的基础
ineluctable.mean: adj.无法逃避的，必然的： not to be avoided, changed, or resisted

saturnine.example:
adj. 忧郁的，阴沉的: The men awaiting interrogation by the police shared a saturnine silence. 等待警察审问的人们脸色阴沉，沉默不语。
adj. 讥讽的: a saturnine smile 讥讽的笑容
saturnine.mean:
adj. 忧郁的，阴沉的： causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer
adj. 讥讽的： having a sardonic aspect

plangent.example:
adj. 轰鸣的: The camera man was stunned by the plangent roar of wild animals. 摄影师被野生动物发出的怒号吓得不知所措。
adj. 凄凉的，哀伤的: a plangent song about a long-ago love 一首关于往日爱情的凄凉歌曲
plangent.mean:
adj. 轰鸣的： having a loud reverberating sound
adj. 凄凉的，哀伤的： having an expressive and especially plaintive quality

tasty.example: adj. 美味的，令人愉悦的: the tasty prospect of getting his revenge 报仇成功的诱人前景
tasty.mean: adj. 美味的，令人愉悦的： giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses

scission.example: n. 切断，分离，分裂: The scission of the labor union will compromise the workers' bargaining power 工会内部的分裂会削弱工人讨价的力量
scission.mean: n. 切断，分离，分裂： a division or split in a group or union: schism

garrulous.example: adj. 啰嗦的，话多得令人厌烦的: garrulous traveling companions 多话的旅伴
garrulous.mean: adj. 啰嗦的，话多得令人厌烦的： given to excessive and often trivial or rambling talk; tiresomely talkative

encompass.example:
v. 组成，包含: a plan that encompasses multiple aims 一项包含了多个目标的计划
v. 包围: Berlin had already been encompassed by the Red Army and all Soviet soldiers were patiently waiting for the order to put a final nail in Nazi Germany’s coffin. 柏林已被红军包围，苏联士兵们静静地等待着最后的命令，彻底消灭纳粹德国
encompass.mean:
v. 组成，包含：to constitute or include
v. 包围： envelop

jargon.example: n. 行业术语: medical jargon that the layman cannot understand 外行不理解的医学术语
jargon.mean: n. 行业术语： the specialized or technical language of a trade, profession, or similar group

flock.example:
n. 人群，兽群: a flock of ill-disposed reporters at the press conference 新闻发布会上一群不怀好意的记者
vi. 聚集，集体行动: Vacationers flocked to the towns along the shore in order to escape the August heat. 度假的人们一起涌向海岸，以躲避八月里的热浪
flock.mean:
n. 人群，兽群： a great number of persons or creatures massed together
vi. 聚集，集体行动： to congregate or travel in a flock or crowd

tedious.example: adj. 冗长乏味的: a tedious public ceremony 冗长无聊的公开仪式
tedious.mean: adj. 冗长乏味的： tiresome because of length or dullness: boring

onerous.example: adj. 费时间花心思的: building the scale model of the frigate was an onerous task 建造军舰的小模型非常花时间
onerous.mean: adj. 费时间花心思的： requiring much time, effort, or careful attention

exasperate.example: vt. 激怒: I was exasperated by the flight delays. 我被飞机延误激怒了。
exasperate.mean: vt. 激怒： to excite the anger of

truant.example: adj./ n./ vi. 逃避责任的: play truant 逃学
truant.mean: adj./ n./ vi. 逃避责任的： shirking responsibility; one who shirks duty

hybrid.example:
n. 杂交品种，混合品种: a hybrid of medieval and Renaissance styles 中世纪和文艺复兴的混搭风
adj. 杂交的: a hybrid rose called “American Beauty” 一种被称为“美国丽人”的杂交玫瑰
hybrid.mean:
n. 杂交品种，混合品种： something of mixed origin or composition
adj. 杂交的： being offspring produced by parents of different races, breeds, species, or genera

plentitude.example: n. 大量: a plentitude of lumber for the current housing market 充足的家具木材供给
plentitude.mean: n. 大量： an ample amount or quantity; an abundance

slew.example: n. 大量，许多: donate a slew of books to the university library 向大学图书馆捐赠了大量的书籍
slew.mean: n. 大量，许多： a large amount or number

commingle.example: v. 充分混合: Ground waters originating in different beds commingle. 来源于不同层位的地下水相互混合。|| Fact and fiction commingle in the story. 事实和虚构混合成了故事。
commingle.mean: v. 充分混合：to blend thoroughly into a harmonious whole

valid.example: adj. 逻辑上正确的: Only further experiments will show whether your theory is valid. 只有进一步的实验才能验证你的理论是否正确。‖Your argument isn't valid because you're taking what should be the conclusion and using it as a premise. 你的论述逻辑上是错误的，因为你把本该是结论的东西当成了前提条件。
valid.mean: adj. 逻辑上正确的： logically correct

querulous.example: adj. 抱怨的，爱发牢骚的: a querulous voice 抱怨的声音
querulous.mean: adj. 抱怨的，爱发牢骚的： habitually complaining

vernacular.example:
n. 方言: phrases that occur in the common vernacular 常见方言中的词组
adj. 非正式的，口头的: writes essays in a very easy-to-read, vernacular style 用一种易懂的口头化风格写作
vernacular.mean:
n. 方言： a nonstandard language or dialect of a place, region, or country
adj. 非正式的，口头的： used in or suitable for speech and not formal writing

stalwart.example:
adj. 无所畏惧的: the stalwart soldiers in the army of Alexander the Great, who willingly followed him to the ends of the known world 亚历山大大帝军队中无所畏惧的士兵们，他们愿意跟随亚历山大奔赴世界的尽头
adj. （体魄等）强健的: a stalwart supporter of the UN 联合国的坚定支持者‖a lithe yet stalwart athlete 瘦小但结实的运动员
stalwart.mean:
adj. 无所畏惧的： feeling or displaying no fear by temperament
adj. （体魄等）强健的： marked by outstanding strength and vigor of body, mind, or spirit

euphonious.mean: adj. 悦耳的： pleasing or agreeable to the ear

brash.example:
adj. 愚勇的，鲁莽的: that brash motorcyclist likes to show off by riding on only one wheel 那个鲁莽的摩托车手喜欢炫耀单轮骑车
adj. 缺乏判断力的，不明智的: He was reprimanded for his brash comments to the media about the team's coaching staff. 他因对媒体说了一些有关教练组的不明智的评论被指责。
brash.mean:
adj. 愚勇的，鲁莽的： foolishly adventurous or bold
adj. 缺乏判断力的，不明智的： showing poor judgment especially in personal relationships or social situations

proliferate.example: vi. 快速繁殖，激增: rumors about the accident proliferated on the Internet 关于事故的小道消息在网上迅速扩散
proliferate.mean: vi. 快速繁殖，激增： to grow or multiply by rapidly producing new tissue, parts, cells, or offspring

vaccinate.example: v. 预防接种: vaccinate sb. for smallpox 为某人接种牛痘疫苗以防天花
vaccinate.mean: v. 预防接种： to inoculate with a vaccine in order to produce immunity to an infectious disease, such as diphtheria or typhus

annex.example:
n. 裙楼，副楼: The new annex that will serve as the permanent home for the school library. 新的裙楼将成为学校图书馆的永久住所。
vt. 添加，合并: plans to annex the supply room so as to make the classroom bigger 计划将工具房并入教室，从而扩充其容量
vt. 吞并，夺取（土地等）: Rome annexed the Nabatean kingdom in 106 AD. 公元前106年罗马帝国吞并了古城那巴顿。
annex.mean:
n. 裙楼，副楼： a building added on to a larger one or an auxiliary building situated near a main one
vt. 添加，合并： to join (something) to a mass, quantity, or number so as to bring about an overall increase
vt. 吞并，夺取（土地等）： to incorporate (a country or other territory) within the domain of a state

finale.example: n. 终场，结局: Didier Drogba pulled one back for Chelsea in a finale. 德罗巴在终场结束时为切尔西扳回一球。
finale.mean: n. 终场，结局： the closing part, scene, or number in a public performance

slant.example:
n. （看待问题、思考的）角度，看法: an interesting slant on the problem of underage drinking 在青少年饮酒这个问题上一个有趣的视角
adj. 倾斜的: The computer keyboard has a slightly slant surface so that typing is more comfortable for the wrists. 电脑键盘有一个微小的倾斜角，因此打字不会使手腕感到不适。
vt. 歪曲（事实等）: Reporters slanted the truth in order to push a political agenda. 为了推动政治进程，记者们歪曲了事实。
slant.mean:
n. （看待问题、思考的）角度，看法： a way of looking at or thinking about something
adj. 倾斜的： running in a slanting direction
vt. 歪曲（事实等）： to change so much as to create a wrong impression or alter the meaning of

chorale.example:
n. 赞美诗: practiced a chorale to perform in church 练习吟唱要在教堂表演的赞美诗
n. 合唱班，合唱团: a chorale that is regarded as being among the best in the state 一个被认为是国内一流的合唱班
chorale.mean:
n. 赞美诗： a hymn or psalm sung to a traditional or composed melody in church
n. 合唱班，合唱团： an organized group of singers

unexceptionable.mean: adj. 无懈可击的： not open to objection or criticism, beyond reproach

spat.example: n. （小的）争吵: Like any couple, they have their spats. 像其他夫妻一样，他们也会有争执。‖They were typical sisters, spatting one minute, playing together the next. 她们是典型的姐妹：上一分钟还在吵架，下一分钟又玩在一起了。
spat.mean: n. （小的）争吵： a brief petty quarrel or angry outburst

tackle.example: v. 着手处理: Once I clean the kitchen, I think I'll tackle the bathroom. 等我把厨房收拾干净了，就去收拾浴室。
tackle.mean: v. 着手处理： to start work on energetically

laudatory.example: adj. 表示赞扬的: a laudatory review of the new play 对新剧目的赞扬性的评论
laudatory.mean: adj. 表示赞扬的： of, relating to, or expressing praise

prudent.example: adj. 明智的: prudent advice 明智的建议
prudent.mean:
adj. 明智的： marked by wisdom or judiciousness; wise
adj. 小心谨慎的，审慎的： marked by circumspection

psychology.example:
n. 心理学: She studied psychology in college. 她大学专业是心理学。
n. 心理战术: He used poor psychology on his employer when trying to make the point. 他表达观点时，对老板用了拙劣的心理战术。
psychology.mean:
n. 心理学： the science that deals with mental processes and behavior
n. 心理战术： subtle tactical action or argument used to manipulate or influence another

delineate.example:
vt. 勾勒，用线条描绘: lights delineating the narrow streets 勾勒狭窄街道线条的路灯
vt. 描写，描绘: delineate the steps to be taken by the government 具体描述了政府所应该采取的措施‖The film does a remarkable job of delineating the emotions that immigrants feel upon their arrival in a strange country. 就描绘移民者踏上陌生国土时的心情而言，这部电影是相当成功的。
delineate.mean:
vt. 勾勒，用线条描绘： to indicate or represent by drawn or painted lines
vt. 描写，描绘： to describe, portray, or set forth with accuracy or in detail

overture.example: n. 序曲: the parade down Main Street served as the overture for a weekend of fun and festivities 主干道上的游行活动拉开了一周节日活动的序幕
overture.mean:
n. 前言： an introductory section or part, as of a poem; a prelude
n. 序曲： an instrumental composition intended especially as an introduction to an extended work, such as an opera or oratorio

grudge.example: n. 怨恨，仇恨: There has been a grudge between the two families for years. 两家之间积怨已深。‖He has had a deep grudge against her ever since she snubbed him at the dance. 自从她在舞会上对他不理不睬之后，他就对她怀有深深的怨念。
grudge.mean: n. 怨恨，仇恨： a feeling of deep-seated resentment or ill will

menace.example: vt. 威胁，使处于危险: Stockpiles of nuclear weapons that continue to menace the inhabitants of this planet. 大量的核武器持续地威胁着这个行星上的居民
menace.mean: vt. 威胁，使处于危险： to make a show of intention to harm; to place in danger

consternation.example: n. 惊愕，恐慌，恐惧: The two girls stared at each other in consternation without any idea about what to do. 两个小女孩惊恐地望着对方，显得不知所措。
consternation.mean: n. 惊愕，恐慌，恐惧： a state of paralyzing dismay

applause.example: n. 鼓掌，认可: Her appearance was greeted with applause. 她的表现赢得了认可。
applause.mean: n. 鼓掌，认可：approval publicly expressed (as by clapping the hands)

apathy.example:
n. 冷漠，缺乏情感: People have shown surprising apathy toward these important social problems. 人们对于这些重要的社会问题显示出了令人惊讶的冷漠。
n. 缺乏兴趣，不关心: She heard the story with apathy. 她毫无兴趣的听完了这个故事。
n. 缺乏兴趣，不关心: Her poor grades are proof enough of her apathy concerning all matters academic. 她可怜的分数足以证明他对所有学术问题都没兴趣。
apathy.mean:
n. 冷漠，缺乏情感：lack of feeling or emotion
n. 缺乏兴趣，不关心：lack of interest or concern

variegated.example: adj. 杂色的，斑驳的: variegated costumes of the dancers in the nightclub 夜总会舞者身上色彩斑驳的服装
variegated.mean: adj. 杂色的，斑驳的： having discrete markings of different colors

mash.example: v. 捣碎: mash potatoesbefore adding it to the mixture 在混合之前捣碎土豆
mash.mean: v. 捣碎： to cause to become a pulpy mass

fraudulent.example: adj. 欺诈的: a fraudulent interpretation of experimental data对实验数据的欺骗性解释
fraudulent.mean: adj. 欺诈的：characterized by, based on, or done by fraud

topsy-turvy.example: adj. 混乱的，不整洁的: The office is still topsy-turvy even though we moved in months ago. 尽管我们上个月就搬了进来，办公室还是混乱不堪。‖turning our ordered life topsy-turvy 把原本有序的生活彻底打乱
topsy-turvy.mean: adj. 混乱的，不整洁的： lacking in order, neatness, and often cleanliness; totally disordered

satirize.example: vt. 讽刺: The movie satirizes contemporary life. 这部电影讽刺当下生活。
satirize.mean: vt. 讽刺： to ridicule or attack by means of satire

husky.example:
adj. （尤指声音）沙哑的，粗糙的: a voice husky with emotion 富有感情的沙哑声音
adj. 高大威猛的: a very husky young man, built like a football player 一个体格像橄榄球运动员一样的高大的男孩
husky.mean:
adj. （尤指声音）沙哑的，粗糙的： hoarse or rough in quality
adj. 高大威猛的： big and muscular

original.example:
adj. 创新的: The car has a highly original design. 这车的设计很新颖
adj. 最初的，最早的: the original plan had to be discarded when the situation changed drastically 当环境发生剧烈变化时，最初的计划就该被放弃
original.mean:
adj. 创新的： independent and creative in thought or action :inventive
adj. 最初的，最早的： coming before all others in time or order

skeleton.example: n. 骨架，框架: Only the charred skeleton of the house remained after the fire. 大火过后整个房子只剩下被烧焦的骨架了。‖We saw a skeleton of the report before it was published. 在报告发表之前，我们看到了他的整体框架。
skeleton.mean: n. 骨架，框架： something forming a structural framework

founder.example:
n. 建立者: founders of the nation 国父们
vi. 完败: The theater company foundered after its corporate funding dried up. 在其基金告罄之后，这个戏剧公司彻底失败了
vi. 沉没: The ship struck a reef and foundered. 船因触礁而沉没
founder.mean:
n. 建立者： one that founds or establishes
vi. 完败： to fail utterly
vi. 沉没：to become submerged

protract.mean: vt. 延长，拖长： to draw out or lengthen in time; prolong

ad-lib.example: adj. 即兴的: not bad for an ad-lib comedy routine 对即兴喜剧表演来说已经不错了
ad-lib.mean: adj. 即兴的： made or done without previous thought or preparation

importune.example: vt. 恳求，迫切请求: beggars importuning passers-by 在恳求着过路人的乞丐
importune.mean: vt. 恳求，迫切请求： to make a request to (someone) in an earnest or urgent manner

pique.example:
vt. 使愤怒: She was greatly piqued when they refused her invitation. 他们拒绝她的邀请让她很生气。
vt. 激起，刺激: radical remarks that pique their curiosity 引起他们兴趣的激进评论
pique.mean:
vt. 使愤怒： to arouse anger or resentment in
vt. 激起，刺激： to excite or arouse especially by a provocation, challenge, or rebuff

debris.example: n. 废墟: the unsightly debris left after mining operations had ceased 采煤工程中止后留下难看的废墟
debris.mean: n. 废墟： discarded or useless material

antagonize.example:
vt. 敌对,反对: He did not mean to antagonize you. 他并没有要反对你。
vt. 敌对,反对: antagonize a bill 反对一项议案
vt. 激起敌意: His remark antagonized his friends. 他的评述激怒了他的朋友。
antagonize.mean:
vt. 敌对,反对：to act in opposition to : counteract
vt. 激起敌意：to incur or provoke the hostility of

renege.example: vt. 放弃，摒弃: She refused to renege the principles by which she had always lived her life, even if it resulted in losing her business. 尽管有可能使她失去她的事业，但她仍然拒绝放弃她在生命中所坚持的那些原则。
renege.mean: vt. 放弃，摒弃： to solemnly or formally reject or go back on (as something formerly adhered to)

partial.example:
adj. 偏袒的，偏爱的: He is partial to Maverick. 他偏爱小牛队
adj. 部分的，不完整的: a partial answer to the problem 一部分的解答
partial.mean:
adj. 偏袒的，偏爱的： inclined to favor one party more than the other: biased
adj. 部分的，不完整的： lacking some necessary part

loll.example:
vi. 懒洋洋地行动: He lolled back in his comfortable chair. 他懒洋洋地倚在他舒适的椅子上
vi. 偷懒，打发时间: Some members of the decorating committee were hard at work, and others were just lolling about. 装修队的一部分人在很努力的工作，另一些则在偷懒
loll.mean:
vi. 懒洋洋地行动： to act or move in a lax, lazy, or indolent manner
vi. 偷懒，打发时间： to spend time doing nothing

reluctant.example: adj. 不情愿的，反感的: I'm reluctant to let him borrow my CDs since he never gives back anything I lend him. 我很不愿意把我的CD借给他，因为他借了我东西从来不还。
reluctant.mean: adj. 不情愿的，反感的： feeling or showing aversion, hesitation, or unwillingness

catastrophe.example: n. 彻底的失败: the party was a catastrophe 该派对就是一个杯具
catastrophe.mean:
n. 大灾难： the final event of the dramatic action especially of a tragedy
n. 彻底的失败： utter failure : fiasco

homage.example: n. 尊敬，敬意: Homage to Catalonia 向加泰罗尼亚致敬
homage.mean: n. 尊敬，敬意： expression of high regard: respect

assuage.example:
vt. 缓和，减轻: He couldn't assuage his guilt over the divorce. 他无法减轻自己在离婚中的罪行。
vt. 平息，抚慰: Life contains sorrows that cannot be assuaged, and it is important to be honest in acknowledging this. 生活中存在着无法平息的悲伤，诚实地承认这个事实才是重要的。
vt. 使满足: assuage his thirst 消渴
vt. 使满足: That meal certainly assuaged my hunger. 那顿大餐满足了我的口腹之欲。
assuage.mean:
vt. 缓和，减轻：to lessen the intensity of
vt. 平息，抚慰：to pacify or calm
vt. 使满足：to put an end to by satisfying

insulate.example: vt. 使绝缘，使隔离: greenhouse gas that insulates ground infrared radiation 能阻碍地表红外辐射的温室气体
insulate.mean: vt. 使绝缘，使隔离： to place in a detached situation

extraneous.example:
adj. 无关的: an extraneous digression 无关的跑题
adj. 非主要因素的: the architect's streamlined modern style shuns any sort of extraneous ornamentation 建筑师流线型的现代设计避免了一切多余的装饰
extraneous.mean:
adj. 无关的： having no relevance
adj. 非主要因素的： not forming an essential or vital part

piddling.example: adj. 微不足道的: raised a piddling objection to the plan 对计划提出了一个微不足道的反对
piddling.mean: adj. 微不足道的： so trifling or trivial as to be beneath one's consideration

foster.example:
vt. 促进，鼓励: detect and foster artistic talent 发现并培养艺术天分
vt. 培养: a greathearted couple fostering two adopted children as well as their own对两个养子像自己的孩子一样培养的好心夫妇
foster.mean:
vt. 促进，鼓励： to help the growth or development of
vt. 培养： to bring to maturity through care and education

fervor.example: n. 热情，狂热: A blind patriotic fervor is called chauvinism. 盲目的爱国热情就被称为沙文主义
fervor.mean: n. 热情，狂热： great warmth and intensity of emotion

crest.example: n. 顶部，浪尖: on the crest of a wave 如日中天，非常成功
crest.mean: n. 顶部，浪尖：the top, as of a hill or wave

backslide.example: vi. （情况等）倒退，固态萌发: Keep these things in mind to help prevent you from backsliding. 牢记这些东西，他们能防止你旧病复犯。
backslide.mean: vi. （情况等）倒退，固态萌发： to revert to a worse condition

vitiate.example:
v. 削弱，损害: Too many grammatical errors can vitiate the soundness of your writing, so double-check is recommended before submission. 太多的语法错误会削弱你论证的力度，所以强烈建议交稿前检查几遍。
v. （在道德、审美上）降低，堕落: Penchant for coarse language vitiates what is otherwise a refined literary style. 使用粗俗语言的倾向使得本该是一个高雅的文体变得不堪入目。
vitiate.mean:
v. 削弱，损害： to reduce the value or impair the quality of
v. （在道德、审美上）降低，堕落： to debase in moral or aesthetic status

chameleon.example: n. 变色龙，善变的人: at the summer resort he acquired a reputation as a social chameleon—someone who could be whatever his hosts wanted him to be 在度假胜地，他解释了一个被称为社交多面手的人，那人可以变成主人想要的任何角色
chameleon.mean: n. 变色龙，善变的人：a person who dexterously and expediently changes or adopts opinions

combustible.example:
adj. 可燃的: release a combustible gas 释放出可燃性气体
adj. 容易激动的: a high-strung combustible temper 一碰就火的性格
combustible.mean:
adj. 可燃的：capable of igniting and burning
adj. 容易激动的：easily excited

facetious.example: adj. 喜欢开玩笑的，轻浮的: Stop being facetious! This is the life-and-death moment. 别开玩笑了！这可是生死攸关的时刻
facetious.mean: adj. 喜欢开玩笑的，轻浮的： joking or jesting often inappropriately

carefree.example: adj. 无忧无虑的: passengers on a luxury cruise ship enjoying a carefree vacation 在豪华游轮上享受着无忧旅途的乘客‖carefree college students on spring break 春假期间无忧无虑的大学生
carefree.mean: adj. 无忧无虑的： free from care as having no worries or troubles

parry.example: vt. 躲避（问题）: He parried the embarrassing question with a clever reply. 他以巧妙的回答躲避了这个令人尴尬的问题
parry.mean: vt. 躲避（问题）： to evade especially by an adroit answer

crestfallen.example: adj. 垂头丧气的，沮丧的: be crestfallen at the failure 因失败而垂头丧气
crestfallen.mean: adj. 垂头丧气的，沮丧的： dispirited and depressed; dejected

wiretap.example: n./vt. 偷听，窃听: This line is not clean asCIAmight have wiretapped it. 这根线路不安全，因为中情局可能已经在监听了。
wiretap.mean: n./vt. 偷听，窃听： to tap a telephone or telegraph wire in order to get information

malinger.example: vi. 装病以逃避工作: He claims he's ill, but I think he's just malingering. 他声称他病了，但我觉得他是装的
malinger.mean: vi. 装病以逃避工作： to pretend or exaggerate incapacity or illness (as to avoid duty or work)

scour.example: vt. 搜查: the police scoured the city for the criminal 警方全城搜索罪犯
scour.mean:
vt. 用力擦洗： to clean, polish, or wash by scrubbing vigorously
vt. 搜查： to look through (as a place) carefully or thoroughly in an effort to find or discover something

dapper.example: adj. 衣冠整洁的: The students all looked very dapper in their uniforms. 学生们穿着校服显得非常整洁。
dapper.mean: adj. 衣冠整洁的： being strikingly neat and trim in style or appearance

gainsay.example: vt. 反对: No one dare to gainsay him. 没人敢反驳他
gainsay.mean:
v. 否认： to declare false
vt. 反对： to oppose, especially by contradiction

fad.example: n. （短暂的）流行，时尚: Once the fad for that kind of music had passed, nobody would have been caught dead listening to it. 一旦那种流派的音乐流行风刮过之后，就没有人会来听它出丑了。
fad.mean: n. （短暂的）流行，时尚： a practice or interest that is very popular for a short time

wily.example: adj. 狡诈的，狡猾的: He is an experienced and wily old statesman. 他是一个经验丰富而狡诈的老销售员。‖His wily plan only rebounded on him. 聪明反被聪明误。
wily.mean: adj. 狡诈的，狡猾的： clever at attaining one's ends by indirect and often deceptive means

vouchsafe.example: vt. 允诺，给予: refused to vouchsafe an explanation 拒绝给出任何解释
vouchsafe.mean: vt. 允诺，给予： to grant or furnish often in a gracious or condescending manner

gangly.example: adj. 身材瘦长的: The suspect is a gangly high school boy. 嫌犯是一个瘦高的中学生
gangly.mean: adj. 身材瘦长的： awkwardly tall or long-limbed

effluvium.example:
n. 难闻的气味: Repulsive effluvia made us vomit. 这恶臭让我们作呕
n. 没用的副产品，废品: With nothing but effluvia obtained, researchers decided to abandon this method. 由于得不到目标产物，研究者们决定放弃这种手段
effluvium.mean:
n. 难闻的气味： an offensive exhalation or smell
n. 没用的副产品，废品： a by-product especially in the form of waste

dampen.example:
vt. （特指稍稍地）弄湿: dampen a paper towel with water and use it to clean up the mess 把纸巾弄湿用来清扫
vt. 抑制，压抑（感情，精力等），泼冷水: Nothing could dampen their enthusiasm. 没有什么能扼杀他们的激情。‖The oppressive heat dampened our spirits. 让人难以忍受的酷暑让我们精神不振。
dampen.mean:
vt. （特指稍稍地）弄湿： to make or become slightly or moderately wet
vt. 抑制，压抑（感情，精力等），泼冷水： to check or diminish the feeling, activity or vigor of

sluggish.example:
adj. 缓慢的，迟缓的: The sluggish pace of the project is worrisome. 项目进展缓慢让人担忧。
adj. 迟钝的，反应慢的: Reptiles are naturally sluggish at low temperatures. 在低温下爬行动物的生理机能自然会趋于迟缓。
sluggish.mean:
adj. 缓慢的，迟缓的： markedly slow in movement, flow, or growth
adj. 迟钝的，反应慢的： slow to respond (as to stimulation or treatment)

vapid.example: adj. 无趣的，乏味的: a song with vapid lyrics 一首歌词乏味的歌曲
vapid.mean: adj. 无趣的，乏味的： lacking liveliness, animation, or interest

list.example: v. 倾斜: The sudden lift of the load on the deck listed the ship badly. 甲板上货物被突然提起，船陡然倾斜
list.mean: v. 倾斜： to set or cause to be at an angle

applicable.example:
adj. 可用的，可行的: Is that Act applicable in this case where suspect is a foreigner? 那条法规适用于这个嫌犯不是本国公民的案件么？
adj. 相关的，有关的: He rarely makes comment that is applicable to our discussion. 他的评论很少和我们讨论的题目搭边。
adj. 合适的，恰当的: He has been busy in selecting the most applicable word for his PhD thesis. 他一致忙于为自己的博士论文选择最为恰当词汇。
applicable.mean:
adj. 可用的，可行的： capable of being put to use or account
adj. 相关的，有关的： having to do with the matter at hand
adj. 合适的，恰当的： meeting the requirements of a purpose or situation

pedant.example: n. 书呆子，墨守成规之人: He is a perfect type of pedant. 他是个十足的书呆子
pedant.mean: n. 书呆子，墨守成规之人： one who pays undue attention to book learning and formal rules

sand.example: vt. 磨光: Be sure to sand before you paint the shelf. 在上漆之前一定要先磨光。
sand.mean: vt. 磨光： to make smooth by friction

harry.mean: v. 不断烦扰，骚扰： to disturb or distress by or as if by repeated attacks; harass

damper.example: n. 抑制因素: Rain put a damper on our picnic plans. 下雨打破了我们的野餐计划。
damper.mean: n. 抑制因素： one that deadens, restrains, or depresses

indemnity.example: n. （损害、伤害等的）保险补偿: The widow now lives on a pension and an indemnity from her late husband's company. 这个寡妇如今依靠社保和前夫公司的保险赔偿过日
indemnity.mean: n. （损害、伤害等的）保险补偿： compensation for damage, loss, or injury suffered

vanquish.example: vt. 打败，征服: vanquished his inner fear 战胜了他内心的恐惧
vanquish.mean: vt. 打败，征服： to defeat in a conflict or contest

immanent.example: adj. 内在的: Beauty is not something imposed but something immanent. 美丽是内在的品格而非外加的东西
immanent.mean: adj. 内在的： being a part of the innermost nature of a person or thing

self-abasement.mean: n. 自卑，自谦： degradation or humiliation of oneself

methodical.example: adj. 井然有序的，有条理的: a methodical summary that included lists of points to memorize 一份包含了记忆重点的有条理的总结
methodical.mean: adj. 井然有序的，有条理的： arranged or proceeding in regular, systematic order

colossal.example: adj. 巨大的: a colossal waste of public money 对公共财产的巨大浪费
colossal.mean: adj. 巨大的：of a size, extent, or degree that elicits awe or taxes belief; immense

abridge.example:
v. 缩短，缩小: modern transportation abridges distance 现代运输方式缩短了路途
v. 在不改变本意的条件下删减词语， 缩写: an abridged edition 精简版
abridge.mean:
v. 缩短，缩小： to shorten in duration or extent
v. 在不改变本意的条件下删减词语， 缩写： to shorten by omission of words without sacrifice of sense

stigmatize.example: vt. 使蒙上污名: Urban construction workers are often stigmatized by the rest of society as lazy and dirty. 城市里的建筑工人往往被社会里的其他人污蔑为是懒惰而肮脏的。
stigmatize.mean: vt. 使蒙上污名： to characterize or brand as disgraceful or ignominious

pun.example: n. 双关语: He's a skillful pilot whose career has—no pun intended—really taken off. 她是个技术娴熟的飞行员，飞行生涯——没有别的意思——真正腾飞了。
pun.mean: n. 双关语： the usually humorous use of a word in such a way as to suggest two or more of its meanings or the meaning of another word similar in sound

preposterous.example: adj. 荒谬的，不符合常理的: a preposterous conclusion of quantum mechanics 量子力学里有悖于常理的结论
preposterous.mean: adj. 荒谬的，不符合常理的： contrary to nature, reason, or common sense

burnish.example: v. 擦亮，磨光: burnish the knife 磨光刀
burnish.mean: v. 擦亮，磨光： to make smooth or glossy usually by repeatedly applying surface pressure

pandemonium.example: n. 喧嚣，骚动: Christmas morning at our house is always marked by pandemonium 圣诞节的早上总是免不了一番吵吵闹闹
pandemonium.mean: n. 喧嚣，骚动： wild uproar or noise

canvass.example:
v. 仔细检查或详尽地讨论；审查: “The evidence had been repeatedly canvassed in American courts” 证据已在美国的法庭中反复被审查过。
v. 游说: canvass voters 拉选票
canvass.mean:
v. 仔细检查或详尽地讨论；审查： to examine carefully or discuss thoroughly; scrutinize:
v. 游说：去（一个地区）的各处或找到（个人）来拉选票或定单： to go through (a region) or go to (persons) to solicit votes or orders

affectation.example: n. 虚伪，做作: the rolling of the ship made the young sailor squeamish 摇晃的船只让年轻的水手感到恶心
affectation.mean: n. 虚伪，做作： the act of taking on or displaying an attitude or mode of behavior not natural to oneself or not genuinely felt

affable.example: adj. 和蔼的，温和的: an affable manner 随和的举止
affable.mean: adj. 和蔼的，温和的： characterized by ease and friendliness

misrepresent.example: vt. 误传，篡改: misrepresent the facts 篡改事实真相
misrepresent.mean: vt. 误传，篡改： to give an incorrect or misleading representation of

hamper.example: vt. 阻碍: Construction is hampering traffic on the highway. 高速路上的建设阻碍了正常交通。
hamper.mean: vt. 阻碍： to restrict the movement of by bonds or obstacles: impede

inert.example: adj. （人）懒惰缺乏活力的；（物品）惰性的: inert ingredients in drugs 药品中的惰性成分
inert.mean: adj. （人）懒惰缺乏活力的；（物品）惰性的： sluggish in action or motion; deficient in active properties

residue.example: n. 剩余物: In the race of nature, there is no residue left for the late. 在大自然的竞争中，总是早起的鸟儿才有虫吃。
residue.mean: n. 剩余物： something that remains after a part is taken, separated, or designated

ruminate.example: vt. 沉思: ruminated the reason past failures 沉思以往失败的原因
ruminate.mean: vt. 沉思： to go over in the mind repeatedly and often casually or slowly

refractory.example: adj. 倔强的，不顺从的: Refractory players will be ejected from the game. 不服从裁判命令的球员将会被驱逐出场。
refractory.mean: adj. 倔强的，不顺从的： resisting control or authority

skeptic.example: n. 怀疑者: You can either be a skeptic or not, but I believe it anyway. 至于你信不信，我反正信了。
skeptic.mean: n. 怀疑者： one who instinctively or habitually doubts, questions, or disagrees with assertions or generally accepted conclusions

forestall.example: vt. 预先阻止: You can often forestall skidding on the ice simply by driving more slowly. 通常你只需慢点开车就可以防止车辆在冰面上失控打滑
forestall.mean: vt. 预先阻止： to delay, hinder, or prevent by taking precautionary measures beforehand

eminent.example: adj. 杰出的: an eminent young scientist 一名杰出的青年科学家
eminent.mean: adj. 杰出的： exhibiting eminence especially in standing above others in some quality or position

thorny.example:
adj. 多刺的: Stay out of the thorny brambles unless you want a ton of scratches. 离那些荆棘丛远一点，除非你想满身都是窟窿。
adj. 棘手的: a thorny problem 棘手的问题
thorny.mean:
adj. 多刺的： full of thorns
adj. 棘手的： full of difficulties or controversial points : ticklish

tenable.example: adj. 有据可依的，无懈可击的: a tenable theory 一个站得住脚的理论 || a tenable outpost 一个守得住的前哨
tenable.mean: adj. 有据可依的，无懈可击的： capable of being held or defended; reasonable

succinct.example: adj. 简明的，简洁的: His speech is always succinct and perspicacious. 他的发言总是简洁而一针见血。
succinct.mean: adj. 简明的，简洁的： characterized by clear, precise expression in few words

bribe.example: v. 贿赂，收买: They bribed him to keep quiet about the incident. 他们收买他，希望其保持缄默。
bribe.mean: v. 贿赂，收买： to give something, such as money or a favor, offered or given to a person in a position of trust to influence that person's views or conduct.

judicious.example: adj. 明智的，慎重的: a judicious choice 明智的抉择
judicious.mean: adj. 明智的，慎重的： having or exhibiting sound judgment; prudent

tribute.example: n. 颂词: pay a high tribute to… 赞颂
tribute.mean: n. 颂词： a gift, payment, declaration, or other acknowledgment of gratitude, respect, or admiration

everlasting.example: adj. 永恒的，持久的: To his everlasting credit, he never once gave in to temptation. 他人品非常好，从来没有受到诱惑。
everlasting.mean: adj. 永恒的，持久的： lasting forever; eternal

nullification.example: n. （尤指法律条文等正式的）废除，废弃: the nullification of a treaty 废除条约
nullification.mean: n. （尤指法律条文等正式的）废除，废弃： the doing away with something by formal action

plush.example:
adj. （味道等）浓郁的: a plush, ripe wine 味道浓郁的陈年老窖
adj. 奢华的，豪华的: a plush castle filled with priceless art and antiques 一座充满了无价艺术品和古董的奢华城堡
plush.mean:
adj. （味道等）浓郁的： having an abundance of some characteristic quality (as flavor)
adj. 奢华的，豪华的： notably luxurious

movement.example: n. 运动: There appears to be some movement in the bush. 树丛中似乎有动静
movement.mean: n. 运动： the act or process of moving

turmoil.example: n. 骚动，混乱: My mind is in a turmoil. 我心里很乱。
turmoil.mean: n. 骚动，混乱： a state or condition of extreme confusion, agitation, or commotion

outgoing.example: adj. 友好的，外向的: a salesman whose aggressively outgoing personality could sometimes be overbearing 一个销售员如果过于热情会让人不能忍
outgoing.mean: adj. 友好的，外向的： openly friendly and responsive: extroverted

ferocious.example:
adj. 极端的，剧烈的: Ferocious heat wave kept people indoor. 剧烈的热浪使人不能出门。
adj. 激烈的，爆发性的: Ferocious forest fires threatened to destroy hundreds of homes in the scrubland. 肆虐的森林大火威胁着灌木丛中数百户居民的住所。
adj. 凶猛的，残暴的: captured and slaughtered by the ferocious tribesmen 被残暴的部落居民所抓获并惨遭屠杀
ferocious.mean:
adj. 极端的，剧烈的： marked by unrelenting intensity
adj. 激烈的，爆发性的： marked by bursts of destructive force or intense activity
adj. 凶猛的，残暴的： violently unfriendly or aggressive in disposition

rudimentary.example:
adj. 初始的，未发展的: The equipment of these past empire-builders was rudimentary. 过去这些帝国的建造者们使用的都是极其原始的工具。
adj. 最根本的，基础的: The dropout had only a rudimentary knowledge of science. 这个辍学的孩子对科学知识只有最基本的一些了解。
rudimentary.mean:
adj. 初始的，未发展的： being in the earliest stages of development
adj. 最根本的，基础的： consisting in first principles: fundamental

mendacious.example: adj. 撒谎的，虚假的: mendacious tales about his adventures 关于他冒险的虚假传说
mendacious.mean: adj. 撒谎的，虚假的： telling or containing lies

drudgery.example: n. 苦工；单调、卑贱或无趣的工作: get away from the drudgery of their everyday lives 摆脱每日的单调无聊
drudgery.mean: n. 苦工；单调、卑贱或无趣的工作： tedious, menial, or unpleasant work

sophism.example: n. 假推理，诡辩: Political selection is more dependent on sophism and less on economic literacy. 政治选举更多的是依靠诡辩，而非简练的文笔。
sophism.mean: n. 假推理，诡辩： deceptive or fallacious argumentation

ponderous.example:
adj. 沉重的: a ponderous machine 沉重的机器
adj. 沉闷无聊的: a ponderous sermon no one really cares 实际上无人关心的沉闷无聊的布道
ponderous.mean:
adj. 沉重的： of very great weight
adj. 沉闷无聊的： oppressively or unpleasantly dull

transfigure.example: vt. 改变外观: transfigure the AutoCAD drawings with elegant symbols 用优美的符号使AutoCAD图变得美观
transfigure.mean: vt. 改变外观： to alter the outward appearance of; transform

legend.example:
n. 传奇，传说: Some ancient civilizations had legends about spirits that inhabited trees and rocks. 许多古老的文明都有着关于寄居于树木、岩石之中的灵魂的传说
n. 图例: The legend in the science textbook indicated that the accompanying picture had been enlarged by 1000%. 科学课本上彩图的图例告诉我们这幅图片被放大了十倍
legend.mean:
n. 传奇，传说： a popular myth of recent origin
n. 图例： an explanatory list of the symbols on a map or chart

stupor.example: n. 迟钝，麻痹，无知觉: lapsed into an alcoholic stupor 陷入了无知觉的酒醉状态
stupor.mean: n. 迟钝，麻痹，无知觉： a condition of greatly dulled or completely suspended sense or sensibility

conviction.example:
n. 深信，确信: a warrior of strong conviction 一名信念坚定的战士
n. 证明有罪: evidence that led to the suspect's conviction 证明嫌疑犯有罪的证据
conviction.mean:
n. 深信，确信：the state of being convinced
n. 证明有罪：state of being found or proved guilty

enmity.example: n. 敌意: an unspoken enmity between two factions 两个派系间心照不宣的仇恨
enmity.mean: n. 敌意： positive, active, and typically mutual hatred or ill will

piquant.example:
adj. 辛辣开胃的: a piquant sauce 开胃的酱汁
adj. 令人振奋的: a piquant glance 充满挑逗的一瞥
piquant.mean:
adj. 辛辣开胃的： pleasantly pungent or tart in taste
adj. 令人振奋的： appealingly provocative
