polarize.example: vt. 使分开对立，两极分化: The controversy has polarized voters into pro-abortion and anti-abortion groups. 这个问题使得选民分化成支持堕胎和反对堕胎两个群体。
polarize.mean: vt. 使分开对立，两极分化： to break up into opposing factions or groupings

wrongheaded.example: adj. 固执己见的，坚持（错误观点）的: In spite of other’s objections, he is always wrongheaded in his opinions. 他总是不管他人的反对而坚持自己哪怕是错误的观点。
wrongheaded.mean: adj. 固执己见的，坚持（错误观点）的： stubborn in adherence to wrong opinion or principles

cessation.example: n. 终止，暂停: the cessation of the storm was a relief 暴风雪终于停了，真是让人欣慰
cessation.mean: n. 终止，暂停： the stopping of a process or activity

supplicate.example: v. 恳求，乞求: God is not just someone to be supplicated in times of trouble. 我们不应该只在困难时候才向主祷告。
supplicate.mean: v. 恳求，乞求： to make a request to (someone) in an earnest or urgent manner

raze.example: vt. 摧毁，粉碎: Excavators were began to raze old school building. 挖土机开始夷平学校的老建筑。‖An entire city block razed by a terrible fire. 大火摧毁了整个街区。
raze.mean: vt. 摧毁，粉碎： to destroy completely by or as if by knocking down or breaking to pieces

pathological.example: adj. 不正常的，病态的: She has a pathological fear of snakes. 她对蛇有一种病态的恐惧
pathological.mean: adj. 不正常的，病态的： being such to a degree that is extreme, excessive, or markedly abnormal

whimsical.example: adj. 反复无常的: It’s hard to make plans with such a whimsical friend. 和这样一个反复无常的朋友做决定是很困难的。
whimsical.mean: adj. 反复无常的： prone to sudden illogical changes of mind, ideas, or actions

motile.example: adj. 能动的: Aircraft carriers are recognized as a motile combat platform. 航空母舰是一种移动作战平台
motile.mean: adj. 能动的：exhibiting or capable of movement

abeyance.example: n. 中止，搁置: hold the plan in abeyance 使计划暂停
abeyance.mean: n. 中止，搁置： temporary inactivity

marginal.example:
adj. 边缘的: Marginal locations in the open-air market are a bit cheaper. 露天市场边缘的地段通常都要便宜些。
adj. 不重要的: regards violence as a marginal rather than a central problem 并不把暴力问题当作重要的核心问题来看
marginal.mean:
adj. 边缘的： located at or near a border
adj. 不重要的： not of central importance

solitude.example: n. 孤独，避世: He sought the kind of solitude where his thoughts would be his only companions. 他在寻找一种孤独感，只有他的思想陪伴着他。‖She wished to work on her novel in solitude. 她想一个人安静地完成小说。
solitude.mean: n. 孤独，避世： the quality or state of being alone or remote from society

fatuous.example: adj. 愚笨的: Emperor Yang in the Sui Dynasty is not only a rare fatuous tyrant but also an outstanding poet. 隋炀帝不仅仅是少有的昏暴之君，在文学上还是一位杰出的诗人
fatuous.mean: adj. 愚笨的： complacently or inanely foolish

vim.example: n. 活力，精力: A little rest should give me back some of my vim. 稍事休息一会我应该就能回复些许精力
vim.mean: n. 活力，精力： robust energy and enthusiasm

glitch.example: n.小故障: postponement due to a glitch in a spacecraft's fuel cell 宇宙飞船燃料电池故障引起的推迟发射
glitch.mean: n.小故障： a minor malfunction, mishap, or technical problem

saccharine.example:
adj. 像糖一样的，有甜味的: a powdery substance with a saccharine taste 有甜味的粉状物质
adj. 做作的，矫情的: The movie was funny, but it had a saccharine ending in which everyone lives happily ever after. 电影还是很有意思的，但是结局太做作了——所有人从此都幸福地生活在了一起。
saccharine.mean:
adj. 像糖一样的，有甜味的： of, relating to, or resembling that of sugar
adj. 做作的，矫情的： appealing to the emotions in an obvious and tiresome way

snub.example: v. 轻视，不理睬: The snob in town always snubbed anyone she thought was beneath her. 镇上那个自命不凡的人总是对那些她认为不如她的人不屑一顾。
snub.mean: v. 轻视，不理睬： to treat with contempt or neglect

sanction.example:
v. 批准，同意，认可: The President sanctioned covert operations. 总统批准了秘密行动‖The administration will sanction almost any field trip with educational value. 基本上任何有教育意义的实地考察都可以得到批准。
n. 制裁: Another trade sanction is in effect. 又一项贸易制裁生效了。
sanction.mean:
v. 批准，同意，认可： to make valid or binding usually by a formal procedure (as ratification)
n. 制裁： an economic or military coercive measure adopted usually by several nations in concert for forcing a nation violating international law to desist or yield to adjudication

theatrical.example: adj. 做作的，夸张的，矫揉造作的: assumed a theatrical pose 摆出夸张的姿势
theatrical.mean: adj. 做作的，夸张的，矫揉造作的： marked by exaggerated self-display and unnatural behavior

aberrant.example: adj. 异常的，非常规的: This behavior might be aberrant enough to draw attention. 这样的行为已经异常得足以引起人们的注意。
aberrant.mean: adj. 异常的，非常规的： deviating from the usual or natural type

pulverize.example: vt. 研磨成粉: Bits of pulverized rock filled the air. 被碾碎的岩石碎片充斥在空气里。
pulverize.mean: vt. 研磨成粉： to bring to a complete end the physical soundness, existence, or usefulness of

libertine.example: n. 放荡不羁者: The legend of Don Juan depicts him as a playboy and libertine. 有关唐璜的传说把他描绘成一个放荡不羁的花花公子
libertine.mean: n. 放荡不羁者： one who acts without moral restraint; a dissolute person

zenith.example: n. 最高点，巅峰: at the zenith of his power 位极人臣
zenith.mean: n. 最高点，巅峰： culminating point

anathema.mean: n. 诅咒：a ban or curse solemnly pronounced by ecclesiastical authority and accompanied by excommunication

irritate.example: vt. 刺激，惹恼: His rude interruptions really irritated her. 他粗鲁的打断激怒了她
irritate.mean: vt. 刺激，惹恼： to provoke impatience, anger, or displeasure in

rustic.example:
n. 乡下人，头脑简单的人: a rustic who was awed by the prices that city dwellers had to pay 一个被大城市房价所吓到的乡里人
adj. 乡村的: We went to a rustic area that is devoid of skyscrapers and shopping malls. 我们去了一个没有摩天大楼和购物中心的乡村原野。
rustic.mean:
n. 乡下人，头脑简单的人： an awkward or simple person especially from a small town or the country
adj. 乡村的：of, relating to, associated with, or typical of open areas with few buildings or people
adj. 粗俗的： lacking in social graces or polish

furor.example: n. 喧闹，激动，狂热: The decision to raise tax has caused a great furor among the working class. 提高税收的决定引起了工人阶级的强烈反响
furor.mean: n. 喧闹，激动，狂热：a state of intense excitement or ecstasy

ballad.example: n. 由简单诗节和叠句组成的民歌: a haunting ballad about loneliness 一段有关寂寞的缭绕于心的民谣
ballad.mean: n. 由简单诗节和叠句组成的民歌： a narrative poem, often of folk origin and intended to be sung, consisting of simple stanzas and usually having a refrain

flaw.example:
n. 瑕疵，缺点: The absence of flaw in beauty is itself a flaw. 完美无瑕本身就是瑕疵
v. 降低，破坏，使不完美: That crack has flawed the vase to the extent that its value in the antiques market is greatly reduced. 那道裂缝让这个花瓶在古董市场上大大地掉价
flaw.mean:
n. 瑕疵，缺点： an imperfection, often concealed, that impairs soundness
v. 降低，破坏，使不完美： to reduce the soundness, effectiveness, or perfection of

strait.example:
n. 海峡: Thousands of vessels pass through the straits annually. 每年数以千计的货轮要通过这个海峡。
n. 痛苦: in dire straits over the loss of her mother’s cherished necklace 因为丢失了母亲最珍贵的项链而陷入了极端的痛苦之中
strait.mean:
n. 海峡： a narrow channel joining two larger bodies of water
n. 痛苦： a state of great suffering of body or mind

erode.example: v. 侵蚀，慢慢减少: flooding eroded the hillside 洪水冲刷着山岭 || inflation eroding buying power 通货膨胀导致购买力下降
erode.mean: v. 侵蚀，慢慢减少： to consume or wear away gradually

peremptory.example:
adj. 不容反抗的: a peremptory order from the general 将军下达的不容反抗的命令
adj. 爱发号施令的: The peremptory secretary began telling the crowd of reporters and photographers exactly where they had to stand. 爱发号施令的秘书开始部署记者和摄影师们应该站在哪里了
adj. 傲慢的: She had such a peremptory approach to running the club that people started to avoid her. 她用一种如此傲慢自大的方式来管理俱乐部，以至于大家纷纷开始躲避她
peremptory.mean:
adj. 不容反抗的： not allowing contradiction or refusal; imperative
adj. 爱发号施令的： fond of ordering people around
adj. 傲慢的： having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude

mire.example:
n. 困境: stuck in a mire of emotional dependency 陷于感情依赖的困境中
vt. 使陷入困境，拖后腿: be mired in the past 陷于过去的回忆不能自拔
mire.mean:
n. 困境： a difficult, puzzling, or embarrassing situation from which there is no easy escape
vt. 使陷入困境，拖后腿： to hamper or hold back as if by mire

brisk.example:
adj. 充满生机，有活力的: brisk and concise response 轻快而简洁的回答
adj. 刻薄的，言辞或方式尖刻辛辣的: a brisk greeting 尖刻的祝贺
brisk.mean:
adj. 充满生机，有活力的： marked by much life, movement, or activity
adj. 刻薄的，言辞或方式尖刻辛辣的： keen or sharp in speech or manner

flag.example:
n. 旗帜，象征: We respect the flag of our fathers. 我们尊敬父辈们的旗帜
v. 变得衰弱: We flagged as we neared the end of the long mountain trail. 当我们终于快到达漫长山路的终点时，已经筋疲力尽
flag.mean:
n. 旗帜，象征： a piece of fabric that is used as a symbol (as of a nation) or as a signaling device
v. 变得衰弱： to become unsteady, feeble, or spiritless

grisly.example: adj. 令人反感的，令人恐惧的: a series grisly murders 一系列令人恐惧的谋杀
grisly.mean: adj. 令人反感的，令人恐惧的： inspiring repugnance; gruesome

dubious.example:
adj. 充满不定性的，值得怀疑的: a dubious assertion 一个值得怀疑的论调
adj. （对事实等）持怀疑态度的: dubious about a diet that claims I can eat all I want and still lose weight 对于一份声称可以一边随心所欲地吃和一边减肥的节食方案表示怀疑
adj. 迟疑不决的，不愿行动的: I'm dubious about our plan to go hang gliding without having had any training. 我对于不做任何训练就去玩滑翔感到很迟疑
dubious.mean:
adj. 充满不定性的，值得怀疑的： giving rise to uncertainty; questionable or suspect as to true nature or quality
adj. （对事实等）持怀疑态度的： not feeling sure about the truth, wisdom, or trustworthiness of someone or something
adj. 迟疑不决的，不愿行动的： slow to begin or proceed with a course of action because of doubts or uncertainty

pretense.example: n. 虚假，伪装: There is too much pretense in his piety. 他的虔诚大多都是伪装。
pretense.mean:
n. 虚假，伪装： the act of pretending; a false appearance or action intended to deceive
n. 自大，优越感： an exaggerated sense of one's importance that shows itself in the making of excessive or unjustified claims

domineer.example: vt. 专制统治: Her husband and mother-in-law tyrannize her. 她生活在她丈夫和婆婆的高压统治下。
domineer.mean: vt. 专制统治： to exercise arbitrary or overbearing control

parable.example: n. 寓言: the parable in which the repentant sinner is compared to the returning prodigal son 这个寓言故事将不愿悔过的罪人和回头的浪子进行了比较
parable.mean: n. 寓言： a story intended to teach a basic truth or moral about life

gauche.example: adj. 笨拙的，缺乏社交经验的: It would be gauche to mention the subject. 提到这个话题是很无礼的
gauche.mean: adj. 笨拙的，缺乏社交经验的： lacking social experience or grace

forbearance.example:
n. 克制；忍耐: reach the end of my forbearance 到了让我忍无可忍的地步
n. 友好仁慈的态度: The judge showed forbearance, and gave the teenaged first offender a suspended sentence. 法官网开一面，给了初犯的少年犯一个缓刑
forbearance.mean:
n. 克制；忍耐： tolerance and restraint in the face of provocation; patience
n. 友好仁慈的态度： kind, gentle, or compassionate treatment especially towards someone who is undeserving of it

caveat.example: n. 警告，告诫: a final caveat 最终的告诫
caveat.mean: n. 警告，告诫： a warning of a specific limitation of something such as information or an agreement

abandon.example:
n. 放纵: added spices to the stew with complete abandon 肆无忌惮地向炖菜里面加调料
v. 放纵: abandon oneself to emotion 感情用事，abandon herself to a life of complete idleness 放纵自己过着闲散的生活
v. 放弃: abandon the ship/homes 弃船，离家
v. 停止做某事: the bad weather forced NASA to abandon the launch 坏天气迫使NASA停止了发射
abandon.mean:
n. 放纵： carefree, freedom from constraint
v. 放纵： to give (oneself) over unrestrainedly
v. 放弃： to withdraw from often in the face of danger or encroachment
v. 停止做某事： to put an end to (something planned or previously agreed to)

supercilious.example: adj. 高傲的，傲慢的: The aristocrat reacted to their breach of etiquette with a supercilious smile. 贵族对破坏他们破坏礼节的行为报以傲慢的一笑。
supercilious.mean: adj. 高傲的，傲慢的： feeling or showing haughty disdain

aspirant.example:
n. 有抱负者, 有野心者: a bevy of ever-smiling aspirants for the Miss America title 一群想当美国小姐的少女
n. 有抱负者, 有野心者: Envy can make oneself backward, self-confidence can tells him to be a aspirant. 妒忌能使自己落后，自信能使自己上进。
adj. 想成为…的: The pilot was an aspirant astronaut. 这个飞行员想成为航天员。
aspirant.mean:
n. 有抱负者, 有野心者：one who aspires, as to advancement, honors, or a high position
adj. 想成为…的：seeking to attain a desired position or status

tenacious.example:
adj. 顽固的，不屈不挠的: a tenacious advocate of civil rights 公民权的坚定捍卫者
adj. 粘着的: You'll have enough time getting those tenacious gum off of your wool sweater. 你有足够的时候去把羊毛毛衣上面那块粘着的泡泡糖弄下来。
tenacious.mean:
adj. 顽固的，不屈不挠的： persistent in maintaining something valued or habitual
adj. 粘着的： tending to adhere to objects upon contact

rumple.example:
vt. 使皱，弄皱: The guest rumpled the antique bedspread by sitting on it. 客人坐在古董床单上把它弄皱了。
vt. 打乱，使不整齐: The aunt would invariably rumple the little boy's hair whenever she came to visit. 不论小男孩的姨妈何时摆放，她总要弄乱他的头发。
rumple.mean:
vt. 使皱，弄皱： to wrinkle or form into folds or creases
vt. 打乱，使不整齐： to undo the proper order or arrangement of

atrocious.example:
adj. 极坏的, 极其残忍的: Murder is an atrocious crime. 犯罪是一种极其恶劣的犯罪活动。
adj. 让人极为不满意的 extremely unsatisfactory
: The service on plane was atrocious. 飞机上的服务让人极为不满意。
atrocious.mean:
adj. 极坏的, 极其残忍的：extremely wicked, brutal, or cruel
adj. 让人极为不满意的 extremely unsatisfactory

buttress.example: vt. 提供支撑的证据或者信息: a mass of circumstantial evidence buttresses the prosecutor's case 大量支持起诉人案件的证据
buttress.mean:
n. 扶墙： a projecting structure for supporting or giving stability to a wall or building
vt. 提供支撑的证据或者信息： to provide evidence or information for (as a claim or idea)

virtuous.example: adj. 品德高尚的，正直的: Virtuous behavior is its own reward. 美德本身就是一种回报。‖She felt that she had made a virtuous decision by donating the money to charity. 她觉得把钱捐赠给慈善基金是一个高尚的决定。
virtuous.mean: adj. 品德高尚的，正直的： having or showing virtue, especially moral excellence

conspire.example: v. 合谋，秘谋: A group of POWs conspired to abscond. 一批战俘密谋潜逃
conspire.mean: v. 合谋，秘谋： to plan together secretly to commit an illegal or wrongful act or accomplish a legal purpose through illegal action

boycott.example: vt. 联合抵制，拒绝参与: This brand is being boycotted for damaging environment. 因为破坏环境，这个品牌正在被抵制
boycott.mean: vt. 联合抵制，拒绝参与： to engage in a concerted refusal to have dealings with (as a person, store, or organization) usually to express disapproval or to force acceptance of certain conditions

coerce.example: vt. （以武力）强制: be coerced into agreeing 被强迫同意 || A confession was coerced from the suspect by police. 罪犯被警察逼供。
coerce.mean: vt. （以武力）强制：to achieve by force or threat

revelry.example: n. 狂欢，喧闹的作乐: They were exhausted after the night of revelry. 一夜狂欢后大家都筋疲力尽
revelry.mean: n. 狂欢，喧闹的作乐： noisy partying or merrymaking

imitation.example: n. 仿制品: usually wore imitations of her costly jewels 通常只戴她那些贵重珠宝的复刻品
imitation.mean: n. 仿制品： something that is made to look exactly like something else

cultivate.example:
v. 提升: cultivate the mind 开化心智
v. 促进成长，培养: cultivate vegetables 种植蔬菜
cultivate.mean:
v. 提升： to improve by labor, care, or study
v. 促进成长，培养： to promote the growth of (a biological culture)

condemn.example: vt. 谴责（为不道德的、邪恶的）: a policy widely condemned as racist 一个被广泛谴责为种族歧视的政策‖It is a sign of human progress that slavery, which was once common, is now universally condemned. 曾经很平常的奴隶制如今却沦落到人人谴责的境地，这不能不说是人类文明的进步。
condemn.mean: vt. 谴责（为不道德的、邪恶的）： to declare to be reprehensible, wrong, or evil usually after weighing evidence and without reservation

filter.example:
v. 过滤: steep the tea and then filter it to get rid of the leaves 浸泡茶叶，再将其过滤以去除废渣
v. 去除杂质: After frying the chicken, we filtered the oil and kept it in the refrigerator to use again. 在炸完鸡肉之后，我们将滤去了杂质的油保存起来以供日后使用
filter.mean:
v. 过滤： to pass through a filter
v. 去除杂质： to remove(usually visible) impurities from

incubate.example:
vt. 孵化: The hen incubated her eggs for two weeks. 母鸡孵蛋两周
vt. 帮助，培养，促进: Hopefully, these youthful visits to the museum will incubate an enduring love of art. 我们希望年轻时参观博物馆能够培养他们对于艺术的持久热爱
incubate.mean:
vt. 孵化： to cover and warm eggs as the young inside develop
vt. 帮助，培养，促进： to cause or aid the development of

court.example: vt./n. 追求，献殷勤: court the young lady by bring her flowers every day 通过每天给年轻女孩送花追求女孩
court.mean: vt./n. 追求，献殷勤：to seek the affections of

awkward.example:
adj. 缺乏灵活性和技巧的: awkward with a needle and thread 缺乏灵巧的针线活技术
adj. （处理问题）缺乏手段和智谋的: Her awkward handling of the seating arrangements resulted in many hurt feelings. 她那缺乏智谋的座次安排伤害了许多人的感情
adj. 臃肿笨拙的，不优雅的: an awkward design 一份粗劣的设计
adj. 令人尴尬的: the awkward situation of having to listen as your host and hostess quarrel loudly in the next room 不得不听着你的主人和她太太在隔壁大声争吵的尴尬境地
adj. （因过大过重或设计问题）难以操作的: The manual can opener is too a
awkward.mean:
adj. 缺乏灵活性和技巧的： lacking dexterity or skill
adj. （处理问题）缺乏手段和智谋的： showing or marked by a lack of skill and tact (as in dealing with a situation)
adj. 臃肿笨拙的，不优雅的： lacking ease or grace (as of movement or expression)
adj. 令人尴尬的： causing embarrassment
adj. （因过大过重或设计问题）难以操作的： difficult to use or operate especially because of size, weight, or design

stymie.example: vt. 阻碍: stymied by red tape 被冗长的政策条款所阻碍
stymie.mean: vt. 阻碍： to present an obstacle to

needy.example: adj. 贫困的: As a child, she was extremely needy and had no self-confidence. 她是一个非常贫穷的小孩，因此缺乏自信
needy.mean: adj. 贫困的：being in need; impoverished, poor

irrigate.example:
vt. 灌溉: irrigate crops periodically 定期灌溉农作物
vt. 冲洗: irrigate the wound 冲洗伤口
irrigate.mean:
vt. 灌溉： to supply (dry land) with water by means of ditches, pipes, or streams; water artificially
vt. 冲洗： to flush (a body part) with a stream of liquid (as in removing a foreign body or medicating)

goad.example: vt. 刺激驱使，激发: goad someone to do something 激励某人做某事
goad.mean: vt. 刺激驱使，激发： to incite or rouse as if with a goad

rapport.example: n. 和睦，友好: His good rapport with his students was one of the reasons why the school board named him Teacher of the Year. 他和学生的关系和睦是他被提名为“年度教师”的原因之一。
rapport.mean: n. 和睦，友好： a friendly relationship marked by ready communication and mutual understanding

murmur.example:
n. 小声的话语: We could hear the murmur of the audience throughout the entire performance. 我们在整个演出当中都能听到观众的窃窃私语
v. 低声抱怨，发牢骚: We could hear the murmur of the audience throughout the entire performance. 我们在整个演出当中都能听到观众的窃窃私语
murmur.mean:
n. 小声的话语： a low, indistinct, continuous sound
v. 低声抱怨，发牢骚： to complain in low mumbling tones; grumble

cajole.example: v. 哄骗: cajoled her into doing his laundry for him 哄骗她帮他洗衣服
cajole.mean: v. 哄骗： to urge with gentle and repeated appeals, teasing, or flattery; wheedle

cloying.example: adj. 甜得发腻的，感情用事的: the cloying sentiments of so many Mother's Day cards 这么多母亲节贺卡（所蕴含）的甜蜜感情
cloying.mean: adj. 甜得发腻的，感情用事的：excessively sweet or sentimental

bawdy.example: adj. 下流的，猥亵的: a bawdy joke 黄色笑话 || bawdy house 妓院
bawdy.mean: adj. 下流的，猥亵的： boisterously or humorously indecent

ensemble.example: n. 合唱，合奏曲: The actor performed an ensemble piece. 该演员参与了合唱。
ensemble.mean: n. 合唱，合奏曲： a work for two or more vocalists or instrumentalists

gash.example:
n. 砍得很深的伤口: got a gash in his knee that required four stitches 膝盖伤得很深，需要缝针
v. 砍: Her face had been gashed by the rocks as she tumbled down the embankment. 当她从堤岸上摔下来时脸上被刮了一道口
gash.mean:
n. 砍得很深的伤口： a long deep cut
v. 砍： to make a gash in

ubiquitous.example: adj. 无所不在的，普通的: The conflict between opposites is ubiquitous. 对立的冲突无所不在。
ubiquitous.mean: adj. 无所不在的，普通的： being everywhere at the same time; often observed or encountered

abdicate.example: v. 正式放弃（权力、责任）: abdicate the throne/crown 退位
abdicate.mean: v. 正式放弃（权力、责任）： to renounce a throne，to relinquish (power or responsibility) formally

emulate.example: vt. 仿效并努力超越: a role model worthy emulating值得效仿的榜样
emulate.mean: vt. 仿效并努力超越： to strive to equal or excel, especially through imitation

reflect.example:
vt. 反射: The color of an objective is largely determined by what light it reflects. 物体的颜色很大程度上是由它能反射的光所决定的。‖Mirrors indiscriminately reflect all visible lights. 镜子不加区分地反射所有的可见光。
vt. 反映，显露: Her book clearly reflects her religious beliefs. 她的书反映了她的宗教信仰。‖Where you come fromcould be easily reflected in your accent. 你的口音可以轻易地暴露你来自哪里。
vi. 思考: I reflected on my path as an undergraduate and my future as a PhD candidate. 我思考了我作为一名本科生的成长足迹以及我读博士的未来。
reflect.mean:
vt. 反射： to prevent passage of and cause to change direction
vt. 反映，显露： to make manifest or apparent: show
vi. 思考： to think seriously

heckle.example: vt. 起哄，使难堪: a controversial player who was constantly heckled by the fans 一个时常被粉丝起哄的有争议的歌手‖Several protesters were heckling the speaker at the rally. 不少示威者在集会上起哄让发言者难堪。
heckle.mean: vt. 起哄，使难堪： to harass and try to disconcert with questions, challenges, or gibes

numb.example:
adj. 失去感觉的: I have been sitting in the same position for too long and now my feet are numb. 我一个姿势坐得太久，以至于双腿都发麻了。
adj. 麻木的，无感情的: Apparently in shock, he answered the police officer’s questions with a numb expression on his face. 她显然是受到了惊吓，以至于在回答警官的问题时一脸茫然。‖Years of physical and emotional abuse had rendered the woman numb and withdrawn. 常年累月的肉体和精神上的折磨已让她麻木而寡言。
numb.mean:
adj. 失去感觉的： devoid of sensation especially as a result of cold or anesthesia
adj. 麻木的，无感情的： devoid of emotion

ethics.example: n. 道德规范: an old-fashioned work ethic 传统的工作行为规范
ethics.mean: n. 道德规范： rules or standards governing the conduct of a person or the members of a profession

authentic.example:
adj. 真实的，非仿造的: found an authentic Native American arrowhead 发现了一支美洲土著的箭头
adj. 准确的，相符合的: an authentic reconstruction of the Parthenon 帕台农神殿的准确复刻
authentic.mean:
adj. 真实的，非仿造的： being exactly as appears or as claimed
adj. 准确的，相符合的： following an original exactly

replete.example:
adj. 彻底吃饱了的: Everyone is completely replete after the huge meal. 在大餐之后，每个人都吃撑了。
adj. 充满…的，富于…的: a scholar replete with knowledge 博学的学者
replete.mean:
adj. 彻底吃饱了的： having one's appetite completely satisfied
adj. 充满…的，富于…的： possessing or covered with great numbers or amounts of something specified

malevolent.example: adj. 恶意的，恶毒的: The novel grossly oversimplified the conflict as a struggle between relentlessly malevolent villains on one side and faultless saints on the other. 小说把这场斗争彻底简化成凶残恶毒的坏人和完美无暇的圣人间的纠纷。
malevolent.mean: adj. 恶意的，恶毒的： having, showing, or arising from intense often vicious ill will, spite, or hatred

contrived.example: adj. 不自然的，刻意的: We are bored with the contrived applause of a TV studio audience that has been told when to clap. 摄影棚中的观众会被告知什么时候鼓掌，这种经过精心指挥的掌声让我们倍感困倦。
contrived.mean: adj. 不自然的，刻意的：lacking in natural or spontaneous quality

misanthropic.example: adj. 反人类的: a solitary and misanthropic artist 一个孤立的反人类艺术家
misanthropic.mean: adj. 反人类的： having or showing a deep distrust of human beings and their motives

coax.example: vt. 哄骗: coax a child to take its medicine 哄小孩吃药
coax.mean: vt. 哄骗：to persuade or try to persuade by pleading or flattery; cajole

deluge.example: n. 大量: received a deluge of offers 收到了一大堆offer
deluge.mean:
n. 大暴雨： a drenching rain
n. 大量： a great flow of water or of something that overwhelms

votary.example: n. 崇拜者，信徒: votaries of the religious leader 宗教领袖的追随者们
votary.mean: n. 崇拜者，信徒： a person who is fervently devoted, as to a leader or ideal; a faithful follower

meticulous.example: adj. 极为谨慎的: He was so meticulous about everything. 他对所有事都一丝不苟
meticulous.mean: adj. 极为谨慎的： marked by extreme or excessive care in the consideration or treatment of details

pucker.example: vi. 撅（嘴），使收缩: pucker my lips 撅起嘴
pucker.mean: vi. 撅（嘴），使收缩： to become gathered, contracted, and wrinkled

denude.example: vt. 脱去，使赤裸: Drought has completely denuded the hills of grass. 干旱脱去了山上的草使山变得光秃秃的。
denude.mean: vt. 脱去，使赤裸： to divest of covering; make bare

blunder.example:
n. 过失: That's your second blunder today. 这是你今天犯的第二个低级错误了
v. 蹒跚: Without my glasses I blundered into the wrong room.因为没戴眼镜，所以我蹒跚地走入了错误的房间
blunder.mean:
n. 过失： a gross error or mistake resulting usually from stupidity, ignorance, or carelessness
v. 在…方面犯了很愚蠢且通常很严重的错误；糟蹋： to make a stupid, usually serious error in; botch
v. 蹒跚：to move unsteadily or confusedly

untenable.example: adj. 防守不住的，站不住脚的: an untenable position 一个站不住脚的立场
untenable.mean: adj. 防守不住的，站不住脚的： not able to be defended

curmudgeon.example: n. 脾气坏的爱抱怨的人: a terrible old curmudgeon 一个坏脾气老头
curmudgeon.mean: n. 脾气坏的爱抱怨的人： an irritable and complaining person

deterioration.example: n. 恶化；堕落: a continuing deterioration in relations between the two countries 两国关系的持续恶化
deterioration.mean: n. 恶化；堕落： a gradual sinking and wasting away of mind or body

retaliate.example: vt. 报复，反击: We swear to retaliate for our losses. 我们发誓要以牙还牙。
retaliate.mean: vt. 报复，反击： to pay back（as an injury）in kind

maneuver.example: vt. 巧妙地操纵: They maneuvered him into signing the contract. 他们巧妙地诱使他签下合同。‖The host maneuvered the conversation so as to avoid the touchy subject of her divorce. 主人巧妙地控制着对话的内容，以避免触及有关她离婚的敏感话题。
maneuver.mean: vt. 巧妙地操纵： to guide with adroitness and design or to bring about or secure as a result of skillful management

balloon.example: v. 迅速增加: The use of computers has ballooned. 电脑的使用量迅速增长
balloon.mean: v. 迅速增加： to increase rapidly

corrugated.example: adj. 褶皱的: corrugated paper 褶皱的纸
corrugated.mean: adj. 褶皱的： shaped into a series of regular folds that look like waves

underscore.example: t. 强调: underscore the value of education 强调教育的重要性
underscore.mean: t. 强调： to emphasize; stress

oblique.example: adj. 斜的: gave the eavesdropper an oblique glance 给了偷听者一个白眼
oblique.mean: adj. 斜的： inclined or twisted to one side

nugatory.example: adj. 无关紧要的: the book is entertaining, but its contributions to Shakespearean scholarship are nugatory 这本书娱乐性不错，但是对于莎士比亚研究的贡献微不足道
nugatory.mean: adj. 无关紧要的： of little or no consequence; inconsequential

reverberate.example: vi. 回荡，回响: The sound of thunder reverberated from one end of the mountain pass to the other. 打雷的声音在山间不断回荡。
reverberate.mean: vi. 回荡，回响： to continue or be repeated in a series of reflected sound waves

preempt.example:
vt. 预先占有: The naughty children had preempted front-row seats that were reserved for the guests of honor. 调皮的孩子们把前排留给贵客的座位占了。
v. 替换: The special newscast preempted the usual television program. 特别新闻取代了常规节目。
preempt.mean:
vt. 预先占有： to appropriate, seize, or take for oneself before others
v. 替换：to replace with something considered to be of greater value or priority: take precedence over

dawdle.example:
v. 闲荡，虚度光阴: dawdle the day away 闲荡一天
v. 拖拖拉拉: If you continue to dawdle, we'll be late for sure. 你要是再拖拉，我们铁定要迟到了。
dawdle.mean:
v. 闲荡，虚度光阴： to spend time idly
v. 拖拖拉拉： to move or act slowly

brim.example:
n. 边缘，边界: The brim of the teacup was banded with gold. 茶杯的边缘被镀上了金。
vi. 充满: a secondhand bookstore that was brimming with bargains 一个到处都是减价品的二手书店‖eyes brimming with tears 饱含热泪的双眼
vt. 加满，倒满: He brimmed the glass with milk, and now I’m afraid that I will spill it. 他向杯子里倒了太多牛奶，我现在担心会不会洒出来。
brim.mean:
n. 边缘，边界： an upper or outer margin
vi. 充满： to be or become full often to overflowing
vt. 加满，倒满： to put into (something) as much as can be held or contained

committed.example:
adj. 忠诚的: remain committed to one’s youthful ideal 坚持不懈地追求自己年轻时的理想
adj. 忠诚的: a noncommittal reply 一个不明确的回答
committed.mean: adj. 忠诚的： loyal to a belief, organization, or group, and willing to work hard for it

paunchy.example: adj. 大腹便便，大肚子的: a paunchy middle-aged man 一个大腹便便的中年男子
paunchy.mean: adj. 大腹便便，大肚子的： having a potbelly

ruffle.example:
vt. 使粗糙: The acid ruffled the surface of the catalyst. 酸使得催化剂的表面变得粗糙。
vt. 扰乱，打扰: The stream of minor complaints finally ruffled him into snapping, “If you don’t like the way I’m doing it, do it yourself!” 一系列的抱怨终于让他爆发：“如果你不喜欢我做事的方法，你就自己去做！”
ruffle.mean:
n. 皱褶，褶裥花边： a strip of fabric gathered or pleated on one edge
vt. 使粗糙： to destroy the smoothness or evenness of
vt. 扰乱，打扰：to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts

surveillance.example: n. 监视，监控: government surveillance of suspected terrorists 政府对于恐怖分子嫌疑人的监控
surveillance.mean: n. 监视，监控： close observation of a person or group, especially one under suspicion

prevaricate.example: vi. 支吾其词，撒谎: During the hearings the witness did his best to prevaricate. 听证会上证人在竭尽全力地支吾其词。
prevaricate.mean: vi. 支吾其词，撒谎： to stray from or evade the truth

glide.example: vt. 轻松地行动，轻松地通过: swans gliding over the lake 在湖面悠然划水的天鹅‖looking for a college course that he could just glide through 正在寻找一门很容易就能通过的课程
glide.mean: vt. 轻松地行动，轻松地通过： to move or proceedsmoothly, continuously, and effortlessly

stricture.example: n. 责难，批评: The reviewer made several strictures upon the author's style. 评论家就作者的文风发出了不少责难。
stricture.mean: n. 责难，批评： an adverse criticism

teeming.example: adj. 大量的: oceans teeming with life 孕育着无穷生命的海洋
teeming.mean: adj. 大量的： possessing or covered with great numbers or amounts of something specified

pious.example:
adj. （信仰上）虔诚的: a pious woman who decided to become a nun 一个决心成为修女的虔诚女子
adj. 忠诚的: a pious supporter of his school's athletic teams, during winning and losing seasons alike 学校体育队的忠诚支持者，不论他们是输或赢
pious.mean:
adj. （信仰上）虔诚的： marked by or showing reverence for deity and devotion to divine worship
adj. 忠诚的： firm in one's allegiance to someone or something

outmoded.example: adj. 过时的，废弃的: outmoded computers that can be recycled 可供回收的废旧电脑
outmoded.mean: adj. 过时的，废弃的： no longer acceptable, current, or usable

censorious.example: adj. 挑剔指责的: censorious comment 尖刻的评论
censorious.mean: adj. 挑剔指责的： highly critical.

clamor.example: n. 喧闹，喧哗，噪声: A clamor arose from the crowd as the prisoner was brought forward. 当犯人被带上前台时，人群中爆发出一阵骚动。‖the clamor of a dozen people practicing the trumpet at once 一群人同时练习小号时发出的噪音
clamor.mean: n. 喧闹，喧哗，噪声： loud, confused, and usually inharmonious sound

ally.example:
n.盟友，支持者: enter the war as an ally of America 以美国的同盟者身份加入战争
v. 加入联盟: several tribes allied to fend off the invaders 几个部落联合起来抵抗侵略者
ally.mean:
n.盟友，支持者：one in helpful association with another
v. 加入联盟：to enter into an alliance

tempestuous.example: adj. 突然且剧烈的变化: In terms of social change, the 1960s are generally considered the most tempestuous decade in recent American history. 就社会变革来说，20世纪60年代是近现代美国历史上最动荡的十年。
tempestuous.mean: adj. 突然且剧烈的变化： marked by sudden or violent disturbance

motley.example: adj. 混杂的，富于变化的: an arrangement of motley flowers 多种不同花束的组合
motley.mean: adj. 混杂的，富于变化的： (especially of colors) having elements of great variety or incongruity

synonymous.example: adj. 同义的: Paris has always been synonymous with elegance, luxury and style. 巴黎在人们心中就是优雅、奢侈、时尚的同义词。
synonymous.mean: adj. 同义的： having the same or a similar meaning

coeval.example: adj. 同时代的，同龄的: Two stars thought to be coeval because they have nearly the same mass and brightness. 两个星星同龄因为他们的质量和亮度几乎相同。
coeval.mean: adj. 同时代的，同龄的：of the same or equal age, antiquity, or duration

neophyte.example: n. 初学者，新手: a novice in the theater who had never even had a walk-on role 一个连龙套都没跑过的新演员
neophyte.mean: n. 初学者，新手： a beginner or novice

obedient.example: adj. 服从的，顺从的: that girl is so obedient that she does everything the first time she is asked 这个妹子如此顺从，叫她做事随叫随到
obedient.mean: adj. 服从的，顺从的： submissive to the restraint or command of authority

consign.example: vt. 转交，转移（给他人）: The record shows that the deliveryman had consigned our package to a next-door neighbor. 记录显示邮递员把我们的包裹转投给隔壁邻居了。‖a writer consigned to oblivion 湮没无闻的作家
consign.mean: vt. 转交，转移（给他人）： to give, transfer, or deliver into the hands or control of another

blight.example: v. 损害: Illness blighted his career. 伤病毁了他的职业生涯 || Cosmetics are often used to conceal facial blemishes. 化妆品常用来遮盖脸部色斑。
blight.mean:
v. （使）枯萎：to affect (as a plant) with blight
v. 损害： to impair the quality or effect of

respire.example: vi. 呼吸: unable to respire due to heart attack 因心脏病发作而无法呼吸
respire.mean: vi. 呼吸： to inhale and exhale air successively

frigid.example:
adj. 严寒的: an unusually frigid winter of Wuhan 武汉一个反常的寒冬
adj. 冷漠的: a formal but frigid welcome 一个正式但冷漠的招呼
frigid.mean:
adj. 严寒的： extremely cold
adj. 冷漠的： lacking warmth or ardor

iridescent.example: adj. 五颜六色的: an iridescent soap bubble 一个五颜六色的肥皂泡
iridescent.mean: adj. 五颜六色的： displaying a play of lustrous colors like those of the rainbow

compound.example:
n. 混和物: mixed the chemicals together to form a new compound 将化学试剂混合形成新的化合物
adj. 混合的: a compound word 复合词 || “Steamboat” is a compound noun. “汽船”是一个复合名词。
vt. 混合: the German language's propensity for compounding words 德语喜欢复合单词
v. 扩大，增多: We compounded our error by waiting too long to call for help. 我们等着不寻求帮助会增大我们的错误。
compound.mean:
n. 混和物：composed of or resulting from union of separate elements, ingredients, or parts
adj. 混合的：consisting of two or more substances, ingredients, elements, or parts
vt. 混合：to put or bring together so as to form a new and longer whole
v. 扩大，增多：to make greater in size, amount, or number

accumulate.example: i. 逐渐增长: accumulate a fortune 积攒了一笔财富
accumulate.mean: i. 逐渐增长： to increase gradually in quantity or number

detach.example: vt. 分离: Detach the white part of the application form and keep it. 撕下申请表的白色部分并予以保留。
detach.mean: vt. 分离： to separate or unfasten; disconnect

barefaced.example: adj. 公然的，厚颜无耻的: a barefaced lie 一个公然的谎言
barefaced.mean: adj. 公然的，厚颜无耻的： undisguisedly bold; brazen

harrow.example: vt. 折磨，使苦恼: the villagers were gaunt and sickly, harrowed by years of disease and starvation 村民们枯瘦如柴，体弱多病，都是被多年的疾病和饥饿折磨的
harrow.mean: vt. 折磨，使苦恼： to inflict great distress or torment on

reticent.example:
adj. 沉默不语的: He was reticent about his plans. 他对他的计划三缄其口。
adj. 不愿意的: Understandably, she's reticent about becoming involved with another religious sect. 不难理解，她不愿意被牵扯另一个宗教派别之中。
reticent.mean:
adj. 沉默不语的： inclined to be silent or uncommunicative in speech
adj. 不愿意的： slow to begin or proceed with a course of action because of doubts or uncertainty

peculiarity.example: n. 特征，特点: It is a peculiarity of the house that there is no front door. 没有大门是这座房子的一个特色。
peculiarity.mean: n. 特征，特点： a distinguishing characteristic

autocracy.example: n. 独裁政府: It signified the British rejection of autocracy by constituting the first formal restraining of the power of the monarch 英国对于独裁体制的反抗表现在它对君王权力进行的正式约束
autocracy.mean: n. 独裁政府：government in which a person possesses unlimited power

pregnant.example:
adj. 重要的，意味深长的: the pregnant phrases of the Bible 《圣经》中充满哲理的话语
adj. 怀孕的: Being pregnant represents great news, but it comes with a lot of responsibilities. 怀孕是件大好事，但是它也带来了许多的责任。
pregnant.mean:
adj. 重要的，意味深长的： weighty or significant; full of meaning
adj. 怀孕的：containing a developing embryo, fetus, or unborn offspring within the body

quell.example:
vt. 压制: quell riot 镇压骚乱
vt. 使平静，安静: quell fears 减轻害怕
quell.mean:
vt. 压制： to put down forcibly; suppress
vt. 使平静，安静： to pacify; quiet

iniquity.example: n. 邪恶，不公正: The use of illegal narcotics is not only a destroyer of personal health but also an iniquity that undermines our society. 非法的毒品不仅仅摧残着个人健康，还是一颗危害社会的毒瘤
iniquity.mean: n. 邪恶，不公正： gross immorality or injustice

debacle.example: n. 溃败: the debacle of the war 战争的彻底失败
debacle.mean: n. 溃败： a complete failure; fiasco

frivolous.example:
adj. 轻浮的: a frivolous young woman 一个举止轻浮的年轻女子
adj. 不重要的: The frivolous comment was soon forgotten. 那个不值一提的评论很快就被遗忘了
frivolous.mean:
adj. 轻浮的： marked by unbecoming levity
adj. 不重要的： of little weight or importance

boisterous.example: adj. 喧嚷的，吵闹的: a boisterous queue in front of the pavilion 场馆前喧闹的队伍 || boisterous mirth. 喧闹的欢笑
boisterous.mean: adj. 喧嚷的，吵闹的： noisily turbulent

inherent.example: adj. 内在的，本质的: a disposition inherent in human nature 人性内在的倾向
inherent.mean: adj. 内在的，本质的： involved in the constitution or essential character of something

exquisite.example:
adj. 程度强烈的: suffered exquisite pain 遭受强烈的痛感
adj. 精致精巧的: exquisite pen-and-ink drawings of city scenes 精巧的城市钢笔画
exquisite.mean:
adj. 程度强烈的： extreme in degree, power, or effect
adj. 精致精巧的： having qualities that appeal to a refined taste

forthright.example:
adj. 直率的，说话率真的: her forthright way of dealing with people 她率真的为人处事方式
adj. 直接的，不绕弯子的: was forthright in appraising the problem 直截了当地评价这个问题
forthright.mean:
adj. 直率的，说话率真的： free in expressing one's true feelings and opinions
adj. 直接的，不绕弯子的： free from ambiguity or evasiveness: going straight to the point

impuissance.example: n. 无权，虚弱: In spite of their impuissance the group remains highly active. 尽管手中无权，但这个组织仍然十分活跃
impuissance.mean: n. 无权，虚弱： lack of power or effectivenes

vicissitude.example: n. 自然变化: vicissitude of daily life 日常生活的跌宕起伏
vicissitude.mean: n. 自然变化： natural change or mutation visible in nature or in human affairs

fragile.example:
adj. 易碎的: a fragile piece of glass 一块易碎的玻璃
adj. 易受伤的，脆弱的: Babies are extremely fragile, so remember to care for them gently. 小孩子特别容易受伤，所以要记得温柔地对待他们
fragile.mean:
adj. 易碎的： easily broken or destroyed
adj. 易受伤的，脆弱的： easily injured without careful handling

restless.example: adj. 不平静的: The patient felt restless from pain. 病人因疼痛而无法平静。
restless.mean: adj. 不平静的： marked by or causing a lack of quiet, repose, or rest

dichotomy.example: n. 一分为二，分割: a dichotomy between the academic world and the industrial world 学术界和工业界的割裂
dichotomy.mean: n. 一分为二，分割： a division into two especially mutually exclusive or contradictory groups or entities

sartorial.example: adj. 裁缝匠的，裁缝的: poor sartorial taste 很烂的穿衣品位
sartorial.mean: adj. 裁缝匠的，裁缝的： of or relating to a tailor or tailored clothes

resolute.example: adj. 坚定的: We are glad to have such a resolute ally. 我们很高兴能拥有这样一个坚定的盟友。
resolute.mean: adj. 坚定的： marked by firm determination

contiguous.example: adj. 接壤，相邻的: contiguous nations at war 交战中的邻国
contiguous.mean: adj. 接壤，相邻的： sharing an edge or boundary; touching

beneficent.example:
adj. 仁慈的，好慈善的: beneficent couple who are regular volunteers at an orphan 一对在孤儿院做义工的慈善的夫妇
adj. （对个人或社会）有益的: the beneficent effect of sunshine 日光浴的益处
beneficent.mean:
adj. 仁慈的，好慈善的： characterized by or performing acts of kindness or charity
adj. （对个人或社会）有益的： promoting or contributing to personal or social well-being

maculate.example: v. 使有斑点，弄脏: Her reputation was maculated after the affair with a married man. 自从被指与一个已婚男士有染之后，她的名声受到了影响
maculate.mean: v. 使有斑点，弄脏： to spot, blemish

hard-bitten.example: adj. 顽强的，经受的住困境、压力的: hard-bitten Chinese people could endure both the scorching heat and the freezing cold 坚强勇敢的中国人民既能受得住酷暑，又能受得住严寒
hard-bitten.mean: adj. 顽强的，经受的住困境、压力的： able to withstand hardship, strain, or exposure

exorbitant.example: adj. 过度的: exorbitant prices 过高的价格
exorbitant.mean: adj. 过度的： exceeding the customary or appropriate limits in intensity, quality, amount, or size

deride.example: vt. 嘲弄，嘲笑: my brothers derided our efforts, but were forced to eat their words when we won first place 我的兄弟嘲笑我们的努力，但是当我们得了第一名以后不得不收回那些话
deride.mean: vt. 嘲弄，嘲笑： to speak of or treat with contemptuous mirth

surly.example: adj. 脾气不好的: The surly receptionist told us we would have to wait outside in the rain. 态度粗暴的服务员说我们必须在外面等——哪怕是在下雨。
surly.mean: adj. 脾气不好的： irritably sullen and churlish in mood or manner

practitioner.example: n. 职业人士: medical practitioner 医护人员，行医者
practitioner.mean: n. 职业人士： one who practices a profession

orient.example: vt. 确定方向，使熟悉或适应: orient students toward a career in medicine 指导学生从事医学的职业道路
orient.mean: vt. 确定方向，使熟悉或适应： to set or arrange in any determinate position especially in relation to the points of the compass; to make familiar with or adjusted to facts, principles, or a situation

acquisitive.example: adj. 贪婪的: Acquisitive developers are trying to tear down the ancient temple and build a shopping mall instead. 贪婪的开发商打算铲平这座古老的神庙，取而代之地建造一座购物中心。
acquisitive.mean: adj. 贪婪的： strongly desirous of acquiring and possessing

supine.example: adj. 懒散的，懒得动的、倦怠的、消极的或漠不关心的: a supine legislature that is afraid to take action 害怕采取行动的不作为的立法机关
supine.mean: adj. 懒散的，懒得动的、倦怠的、消极的或漠不关心的： showing lethargy, passivity, or blameworthy indifference

tangle.example:
n. 困惑，不解: My mind has been in a tangle ever since I learned some information about an old, deceased acquaintance. 自从我获知一些关于已故的老熟人的消息之后我就陷入了困惑之中。
vt. 纠缠，使…纠结: was at last tangled in the web of lies that he had told to everyone 最终被自己所编织的谎言缠住了
tangle.mean:
n. 困惑，不解： a state of perplexity or complete bewilderment
vt. 纠缠，使…纠结： to seize and hold in or as if in a snare

effete.example:
adj. 衰弱的: an effete monarchy 奄奄一息的君主制
adj. 缺乏信念的，懦弱的: The government is too effete to take out the powerful special interests that really ruin this state. 政府过于懦弱，不敢去摧毁那些祸害这个国家的特殊利益集团
effete.mean:
adj. 衰弱的： depleted of vitality, force, or effectiveness
adj. 缺乏信念的，懦弱的： lacking strength of will or character

foolproof.example: adj. 十分简单以至于不会失败的: Anything foolproof is impossible and what truly counts is probability. 没有万无一失的事情，真正的问题在于概率
foolproof.mean: adj. 十分简单以至于不会失败的： so simple, plain, or reliable as to leave no opportunity for error, misuse, or failure

presumptuous.example:
adj. 放肆的，冒昧的: Under such a circumstance his demand for attention was utterly presumptuous. 在那种情况下他要求被关注是极其冒昧的
adj. 傲慢的: The presumptuous doctor didn't even bother to explain to me the treatment that I would be receiving. 傲慢的医生连给我说明我会接受何种治疗的耐性都没有。
presumptuous.mean:
adj. 放肆的，冒昧的： overstepping due bounds (as of propriety or courtesy)
adj. 傲慢的： having a feeling of superiority that shows itself in an overbearing attitude

clandestine.example: adj. 隐藏的，秘密的: their clandestine love affair 他们的秘密恋情
clandestine.mean: adj. 隐藏的，秘密的：kept or done in secret, often in order to conceal an illicit or improper purpose

mockery.example:
n. 鄙视，嘲弄: Her deliberate mockery triggered a fierce fight. 她的蓄意嘲弄引起了一场激烈的打斗
n. 以嘲笑为目的的模仿: arbitrary methods that make a mockery of justice 嘲讽司法公正的仲裁体系
mockery.mean:
n. 鄙视，嘲弄： scornfully contemptuous ridicule
n. 以嘲笑为目的的模仿： a false, derisive, or impudent imitation

adhere.example:
v. 依附，粘着: adhere to the surface 附着在表面
v. 服从命令: adhere to the rules 遵守规定
v. 坚定地支持: our coach adheres to the belief that we can win this game if we just have a positive attitude 我们的教练坚定地相信，只有我们有积极的态度，我们就能拿下比赛
adhere.mean:
v. 依附，粘着： to cause to stick fast
v. 服从命令： to act according to the commands of
v. 坚定地支持： to give steadfast support to

hearken.mean: vi. 倾听，关注： to give respectful attention

paradise.example:
n. 天堂，极乐世界: an idealist who trotted the globe looking for paradise 一个奔波于全世界以寻找一片乐土的理想主义者
n. 快乐，狂喜: that early stage of a romance when lovers are in paradise 爱情初期，当恋人们都处于快乐兴奋的状态时
paradise.mean:
n. 天堂，极乐世界： an often imaginary place or state of utter perfection and happiness
n. 快乐，狂喜： a state of overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion

congenial.example:
adj. 和善的，友好的: a congenial host who invited us for a feast 一位邀请我们美餐一顿的和善主人
adj. 令人愉悦的: a couple relaxing in the congenial atmosphere of a luxury health SPA 一对沉浸在奢华水疗寓所中令人愉快气氛里的夫妻
congenial.mean:
adj. 和善的，友好的： having or marked by agreement in feeling or action
adj. 令人愉悦的： giving pleasure or contentment to the mind or senses

issue.example:
n. （有争议的）话题，议题: focused on economic and political issues 重点关注经济和政治话题
vi. 发布（期刊等）: plans to issue a monthly newsletter 计划发布新闻月刊
vi. 流出: strange sound issued from the abandoned house 废弃房中传来的奇怪声音
issue.mean:
n. （有争议的）话题，议题： a matter that is in dispute between two or more parties
vi. 发布（期刊等）： to produce and release for distribution in printed form
vi. 流出： to go, come, or flow out

proscribe.example: vt. 禁止，排斥: acts proscribed by law 被法律禁止的行为
proscribe.mean: vt. 禁止，排斥： to prohibit; forbid

turgid.example: adj. 浮夸的，过分装饰的: turgid prose 浮华的散文
turgid.mean: adj. 浮夸的，过分装饰的： excessively embellished in style or language

meteoric.example: adj. 流星般迅速而短暂的: a meteoric rise to fame 一夜成名
meteoric.mean: adj. 流星般迅速而短暂的： similar to a meteor in speed, brilliance, or brevity

foreground.example: vt. 强调，重视: He repeatedly foregrounded his experience in international affairs in the course of his campaign for the presidency. 在他竞选总统的过程中，他一再强调自己在处理国际事务方面的经验。
foreground.mean: vt. 强调，重视： to indicate the importance of by centering attention on

expansive.example:
adj. 广阔的: expansive beach 广阔的沙滩
adj. 健谈的，外向的: Wine made the guest expansive. 宾客们酒后变得话多。
expansive.mean:
adj. 广阔的： having a great expanse or extent
adj. 健谈的，外向的： open and communicative; talkative or effusive

exodus.example: vt. 大批离去: the mass exodus from the cities for the beaches on most summer weekends 在多数夏季的周末，大批都市人奔向海滩
exodus.mean: vt. 大批离去： a mass departure

bully.example:
n. 欺凌弱小者: they had to deal with the local bullies 他们要对付当地恶霸
adj. 最好的，最棒的: that's a bully idea for reviving the town's retail center 真是个重整镇上零售中心的好主意
bully.mean:
n. 欺凌弱小者： a person who habitually treats others in an overbearing or intimidating manner
adj. 最好的，最棒的： of the very best kind

roisterer.example: n. 喝酒喧闹的人: the rowdy roisterers who fill the streets of New Orleans during Mardi Gras 四旬斋前最后一天遍布新奥尔良各条街道的喧闹人群
roisterer.mean: n. 喝酒喧闹的人： one who engages in merrymaking especially in honor of a special occasion

platitude.example: n. 陈词滥调: the platitude of most political oratory 政治说辞里的陈词滥调
platitude.mean:
n. 陈词滥调： a trite or banal remark or statement, especially one expressed as if it were original or significant
n. 缺乏原创性： lack of originality

palter.example: vi. 欺骗: unwilling to palter over the price of the house 拒绝对房子漫天要价
palter.mean: vi. 欺骗： to act insincerely or deceitfully

foible.example: n. 小缺点: admired their teacher despite his foibles 尽管有些小缺点，但还是很敬佩他们的老师
foible.mean: n. 小缺点： a minor flaw or shortcoming in character or behavior

paucity.example: n. 少量，缺乏: an extreme paucity of natural resources 极度缺乏自然资源
paucity.mean: n. 少量，缺乏： smallness of number; dearth

disinfect.example: vt. 消毒，使无菌: disinfect with bleaching powder 用漂白粉消毒
disinfect.mean: vt. 消毒，使无菌：to free from infection especially by destroying harmful microorganisms

arable.example: adj. 适合耕种的: explore the west for arable land 向西探索适合耕种的土地
arable.mean: adj. 适合耕种的： fit for or used for the growing of crops

dire.example:
adj. 不吉利的，不祥的: a dire forecast of a plunge in stock prices 股市大跌不祥的预测
adj. 可怕的，恐怖的: a series of dire tremors that hinted at a volcanic eruption 一系列暗示火山爆发的恐怖的震动
adj. 迫切的: There is a dire need for food and medicine in the famine-stricken country. 在闹饥荒的国家迫切需要食物和药品。
adj. 悲惨的:
dire.mean:
adj. 不吉利的，不祥的： being or showing a sign of evil or calamity to come
adj. 可怕的，恐怖的： causing fear
adj. 迫切的：needing immediate attention; urgent
adj. 悲惨的： causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer

desiccate.example:
vt. 使（食物）脱水以保存，使干燥: add a cup of desiccated coconut to the mix 加一杯椰蓉进行搅拌
v. 缺乏活力: that historian's dryasdust prose desiccates what is actually an exciting period in European history 那位历史学家枯燥无味的散文让欧洲一段扣人心弦的历史变得乏味单调
desiccate.mean:
vt. 使（食物）脱水以保存，使干燥： to preserve (a food) by drying
v. 缺乏活力： to deprive of emotional or intellectual vitality

reproach.example:
n. 令人羞愧的事物，耻辱: a reproach to this entire school 整个学校的耻辱
vt. 批评，责备: reproached by their mother for untidiness 因为邋遢而被他们的母亲批评
reproach.mean:
n. 令人羞愧的事物，耻辱： one that causes shame, rebuke or blame
vt. 批评，责备： to express disapproval, criticism, or disappointment in (someone)

bask.example: vi. 休息，悠然自得: We blissfully basked at the seashore over the long holiday. 我们在海滩上躺着晒太阳，享受着漫长的假期。
bask.mean: vi. 休息，悠然自得： to lie or relax in a pleasant warmth or atmosphere

bash.example:
n. 猛击: He has not been the same ever since he received that bash on his head. 自从他脑袋被别人打了之后，他就变得大不一样。
vt. 攻击，用力击打: The angry child kept bashing her toy with a hammer until it broke. 愤怒的小孩用锤子不断地敲击她的玩具，直到它彻底被破坏。
vt. 抨击，严厉批评: In all of talk radio no other host seems to enjoy bashing liberals as much as he does. 在电台节目再没有像他一样热衷于抨击自由主义者的主持人了。
bash.mean:
n. 猛击： a forceful blow
vt. 攻击，用力击打： to strike violently and often repeatedly
vt. 抨击，严厉批评： to criticize harshly and usually publicly

execrate.example:
v. 谴责: leaders from all over the world execrated the terrorists responsible for the bomb blast 世界各国首脑强烈谴责对爆炸袭击负责的恐怖分子
v. 痛恨: execrates anyone who would physically abuse children or animals 痛恨那些虐待儿童和动物的人
execrate.mean:
v. 谴责： to declare to be morally wrong or evil
v. 痛恨： to dislike strongly

perceptible.example: adj. 可察觉的: You should be able to note a perceptible temperature change when you add the second reagents. 当你加入第二种试剂的时候，你应该能够察觉到明显的温度变化
perceptible.mean: adj. 可察觉的： capable of being perceived especially by the senses

ostracize.example: vt. 驱逐: He was ostracized from the scientific community for many years because of his radical political beliefs. 他因激进的政治理想被驱逐出了科学界很多年。
ostracize.mean: vt. 驱逐： to exclude from a group

probity.example: n. 正直: a person of indisputable probity should head the disciplinary panel 一个绝对正直的人应该来领导纪律委员会
probity.mean: n. 正直： faithfulness to high moral standards

retainer.example: n. 家仆: Knights are dressed for battle by their retainers. 骑士们在上战场之前是由他们的家仆帮助着装打扮的。
retainer.mean: n. 家仆： a person attached or owing service to a household

wither.example: vi. 枯萎，凋谢: Amaranth is a legendary flower that never withers. 传说中的Amaranth是一种永不凋谢的花。
wither.mean: vi. 枯萎，凋谢： to become dry and sapless

anecdote.example:
n. 短小有趣的故事: He told us all sorts of humorous anecdotes about his childhood. 他告诉了我们所有关于他童年的奇闻趣事。
n. 短小有趣的故事: He is a master raconteur with endless anecdotes. 他是讲故事的超级高手，总有讲不完的奇闻趣事。
anecdote.mean: n. 短小有趣的故事：a usually short narrative of an interesting, amusing, or biographical incident

consequence.example:
n. 结果: negative consequences of the war 战争带来的负面后果
n. 重要性，价值: a mistake of no consequence 不重要的错误
consequence.mean:
n. 结果： something produced by a cause or necessarily following from a set of conditions
n. 重要性，价值：significance; importance

constringe.example: vt. 使紧缩: A styptic pencil stopped the bleeding by constringing the small blood vessels at the site of cut. 止血笔通过挤压伤口处的血管阻止了出血
constringe.mean: vt. 使紧缩： to make narrow or draw together

trickle.example: vi. 一滴滴地流，徐徐地流: Tears trickled down her cheeks. 眼泪从她的脸上一滴一滴地流下。
trickle.mean: vi. 一滴滴地流，徐徐地流： to issue or fall in drops

euphemism.example: n. 婉言，委婉的说法: using “eliminate” as a euphemism for “kill” “杀死”的委婉说法是“灭掉”
euphemism.mean: n. 婉言，委婉的说法： the substitution of an agreeable or inoffensive expression for one that may offend or suggest something unpleasant

perturb.example: vt. 扰乱，使烦躁不安: perturbed me enough to keep me awake that night 让我烦躁到当晚失眠
perturb.mean: vt. 扰乱，使烦躁不安： to trouble the mind of; to make uneasy

belligerent.example: adj. 好斗的，好战的: The coach became quite belligerent and spit at an umpire after being thrown out of the game. 教练变得好斗起来，以至于在被罚出场外之后转身向裁判吐口水。
belligerent.mean: adj. 好斗的，好战的： inclined to or exhibiting assertiveness, hostility, or combativeness

revive.example:
vi. 恢复意识: successfully revived him with artificial respiration 用人工呼吸使成功他恢复意识
v. 再获新生: Around midnight, I usually need to revive myself with a cup of strong coffee. 在午夜时分，我需要一杯浓咖啡来提神。‖The success of the movie has revived her career. 这部电影的成功让他的事业焕发第二春。
revive.mean:
vi. 恢复意识： to return to consciousness or life, become flourishing again
v. 再获新生： become active or flourishing again

sequester.example:
vt. 使隔绝，分离: sequester a jury 让陪审团分开讨论
vt. 使隐退: She was sequestered in her room. 她深居简出。
sequester.mean:
vt. 使隔绝，分离： to set apart: segregate
vt. 使隐退： to cause to withdraw into seclusion

ethereal.example:
adj. 轻巧精致的: the bakery's scrumptious pastries have a wonderfully ethereal consistency 面包师可口的糕点有着一种奇妙的蓬松轻巧的质感
adj. 天国的: a land of ethereal beauty and tranquility 具有缥缈的美感和宁静的一片土地
adj. 非物质的，精神（上）的: that ethereal attribute that every performer should have—charisma 每位演奏者都应该具有一种精神上的特质——那就是个人魅力
ethereal.mean:
adj. 轻巧精致的： resembling air in lightness, highly refined; delicate
adj. 天国的： of, relating to, or suggesting heaven
adj. 非物质的，精神（上）的： not of this world; spiritual; not composed of matter

bland.example:
adj. 味道平淡的: stick to bland diet to lose weight 坚持清淡的饮食以减肥
adj. 无趣的: a bland story with na?ve plot 一个情节幼稚的无聊故事
adj. 温和的，和蔼的: bland food that was good for babies and invalids 对婴儿和病患有益的温和的食物
bland.mean:
adj. 味道平淡的： not irritating or stimulating; soothing
adj. 无趣的： dull, insipid
adj. 温和的，和蔼的： not harsh or stern especially in nature or effect

jabber.example: vi. 快而不清楚地说: monkeys jabbering at each other in their cages 在笼子里唧唧歪歪的猴子
jabber.mean: vi. 快而不清楚地说： to talk rapidly, indistinctly, or unintelligibly

laborious.example:
adj. 勤奋的: The volunteers have been commendably laborious in their cleanup of the beach. 清理海滩的志愿者们的勤奋努力值得赞扬‖He was gentle and kindly, living a laborious life in his Paris flat. 他是一个温柔、好心的人，住在巴黎的公寓里过着勤奋的生活
adj. 费力的: the laborious task of cleaning up the oil spill 清除泄露石油的艰苦工作
laborious.mean:
adj. 勤奋的： hard-working; industrious
adj. 费力的： marked by or requiring long, hard work

inure.example:
vt. 使习惯接受不好的东西: children inured to violence 习惯了暴力的孩子们
vt. 使坚强: The hardship of army training inured her to the rigors of desert warfare. 军营里的艰苦训练把她打造成了能适应沙漠艰苦战事的女兵
inure.mean:
vt. 使习惯接受不好的东西： to accustom to accept something undesirable
vt. 使坚强： to make able to withstand physical hardship, strain, or exposure

scathing.example: adj. 尖酸刻薄的: a scathing review of the book 尖刻的书评
scathing.mean: adj. 尖酸刻薄的： marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings

indulgent.example: adj. （对己）放纵的，（对他人）纵容的: indulgent aristocrats 生活放纵的贵族
indulgent.mean: adj. （对己）放纵的，（对他人）纵容的： showing, characterized by, or given to indulgence

gourmet.example: n. 美食家: a gourmet of Chinese food 中餐美食家
gourmet.mean: n. 美食家： a connoisseur of food and drink

purvey.example: v.（大量）供给，供应: a little shop purveying handmade merchandise 出售手工商品的小店
purvey.mean: v.（大量）供给，供应： to supply (food, for example); furnish.

construct.example:
v. 建造，建立: construct a new library 建一座新图书馆
v. 创造，想出: He managed to construct a theory that fits all the facts. 他成功提出了一个与所有事实相吻合的理论
construct.mean:
v. 建造，建立： to form by assembling or combining parts
v. 创造，想出： to create or think of by clever use of the imagination

obligatory.example:
adj. 强制性的: obligatory military service 强制性的服军役
adj. （见得多以至于）无聊的: the obligatory cliff-hanger endings for season finales of TV shows 电视剧总是以恶俗的惊心动魄的结局作为完季
obligatory.mean:
adj. 强制性的： of the nature of an obligation; compulsory
adj. （见得多以至于）无聊的：used or heard so often as to be dull

zealot.example: n. 狂热者: a religious zealot calling for another Crusade 呼唤下一场十字军东征的宗教狂热者
zealot.mean: n. 狂热者： a zealous person; especially: a fanatical partisan

aver.example:
v. 声称为真: was tearfully averring his innocence 涕泪俱下地声明他的清白
v. （态度强硬而明确地）声明: She averred that she didn't need any help choosing her own clothes. 她态度强硬地声明：在买衣服的问题上不需要别人指手画脚
aver.mean:
v. 声称为真： to state as a fact usually forcefully
v. （态度强硬而明确地）声明： to state clearly and strongly

bumble.example:
vi. 含糊不清地说，杂乱无章地说: Overcome with stage fright, I could only bumble through the speech. 由于怯场，我结结巴巴地说完了演讲稿。
vi. 笨拙地行动: I sort of bumbled through the dance number, hoping that it would soon end. 我笨拙地跟着曲子舞蹈，心里指望着它快点结束。
bumble.mean:
vi. 含糊不清地说，杂乱无章地说： to speak rapidly, inarticulately, and usually unintelligibly
vi. 笨拙地行动： to move, act, or proceed clumsily

travail.example: n./v. 辛苦劳动: writer’s literary travail 作家辛勤的文学创作 || Labor Day is the day on which we recognize those men and women who daily travail with little appreciation or compensation. 劳动节是我们向那些平日辛勤劳作但是很少受到大家关注和补偿的工人致敬的日子。
travail.mean: n./v. 辛苦劳动： work, especially when arduous or involving painful effort

discombobulate.example: v. 使不安，使混乱: invent cool new ways to discombobulate the old order 发明新的好方法打乱了旧秩序
discombobulate.mean: v. 使不安，使混乱： upset, confuse

obsolete.example: adj. 过时的，被淘汰的: I was told my old printer is obsolete and I can't get replacement parts. 我被告知我的打印机已经被淘汰了，因此无法更换配件。‖an obsolete word 一个已经废弃不用的单词
obsolete.mean: adj. 过时的，被淘汰的： no longer in use or no longer useful

tangy.example: adj. 刺激的: a tangy sauce with a strong aftertaste 味道很刺激的酱料，回味无穷
tangy.mean: adj. 刺激的： having a powerfully stimulating odor or flavor

adulate.example: v. 极度谄媚: incompetent assistants who spend all their time adulating her 成天恭维她的不称职的下属
adulate.mean: v. 极度谄媚： to praise too much

dissemble.example: v. 用假象隐藏真相，掩饰: dissemble fear with a smile 用微笑来掩饰恐惧 || He dissembled happiness at the news that his ex-girlfriend was getting married to someone else. 他对其他人假装高兴听到前女友结婚的消息。
dissemble.mean: v. 用假象隐藏真相，掩饰： to put on a false appearance

subside.example: vi. 下陷，下沉，减弱: Local officials say the flood waters have subsided. 当地官员表示洪水已经退去。‖As the noise of the siren subsided, I was able to fall back to sleep. 随着警笛声的减弱，我可以再次睡着了。‖The pain will subside in a couple of hours. 几个小时之内疼痛感就会退去的。
subside.mean: vi. 下陷，下沉，减弱： to tend downward

prodigious.example:
adj. 巨大的: a prodigious supply of canned food kept in the basement 地下室贮存着大量罐头食品
adj. 惊人的，了不起的: stage magicians performing prodigious feats for rapt audiences 舞台魔术师在全神贯注的观众们面前表演
prodigious.mean:
adj. 巨大的： impressively great in size, force, or extent; enormous
adj. 惊人的，了不起的： causing wonder or astonishment

consonant.example: adj. 和谐一致的: His performance was rarely consonant with his reputation. 他的表现与名气大不相符
consonant.mean: adj. 和谐一致的：being in agreement or harmony; free from elements making for discord

stifle.example: vt. 抑制（声音、呼吸等）: to stifle free expression 限制言论自由
stifle.mean: vt. 抑制（声音、呼吸等）： to keep in or hold back

rampant.example:
adj. （植物）生长茂盛的: a rampant growth of weeds in the neglected yard 被遗忘的院子里杂草疯长
adj. 猖獗的，不受限制的: Mayor promised to put a stop to the rampant crime that plagued the city. 市长承诺要采取措施，消灭那些扰乱城市治安的猖獗的犯罪活动。‖rampant corruption in city government 市政府中猖獗的腐败
rampant.mean:
adj. （植物）生长茂盛的： growing thickly and vigorously
adj. 猖獗的，不受限制的： occurring without restraint and frequently, widely, or menacingly

postulate.example:
n. 前提条件: One of the postulates that the true agnostic rejects is the assumption that it is even possible for us to know whether God exists. 我们无法知道上帝是否存在——这是一个真正的不可知论者所反对的假设。
v. 假定为真: postulate a causal relationship 假定存在因果关系
postulate.mean:
n. 前提条件： something taken as being true or factual and used as a starting point for a course of action or reasoning
v. 假定为真： to assume or claim as true, existent, or necessary

oscillate.mean:
vi. 振动，摇晃： to swing backward and forward like a pendulum
v. 犹豫，变化： vary between opposing beliefs, feelings, or theories

commiserate.example: vi. 表示怜悯，同情: commiserated over their failure 对他们的失败表示同情‖We commiserated with him but there was little we could do to make the situation better. 我们很同情他的遭遇，但是也只能表示无能为力。
commiserate.mean: vi. 表示怜悯，同情： to feel or express sympathy

lament.example:
n. 悼词: her lament for her grandmother 她为她祖母写的悼词
n. 抱怨: the career woman's lament that there aren't any good men left 职场女性的抱怨：好男人都死光了
vi. 哀悼，表达痛苦或遗憾: lament an innocent death 为无辜的死者而悲痛
lament.mean:
n. 悼词： a composition expressing one's grief over a loss
n. 抱怨： an expression of dissatisfaction, pain, or resentment
vi. 哀悼，表达痛苦或遗憾： to express sorrow or regret; mourn

testy.example: adj. 易怒的，暴躁的: That coworker would be easier to get along with if she weren't so testy all the time. 如果那个同伴不是一直那么暴怒的话，她还是挺好相处的。
testy.mean: adj. 易怒的，暴躁的： easily annoyed: irritable

obfuscate.example: vt. 使困惑，使模糊: obfuscate the reader 让读者困惑
obfuscate.mean: vt. 使困惑，使模糊： to make so confused or opaque as to be difficult to perceive or understand

dank.example: adj. 阴湿的: vegetables tended to go bad quickly in the dank cellar 蔬菜在潮湿的地下室很容易变坏
dank.mean: adj. 阴湿的： slightly or moderately wet

uncanny.example: adj. 离奇的，奇异的: The silence was uncanny. 静得出奇
uncanny.mean: adj. 离奇的，奇异的： being so extraordinary or abnormal as to suggest powers which violate the laws of nature

sedate.example: adj. 淡定的，安静的: She remained sedate under pressure. 她在压力下仍保持镇静。
sedate.mean: adj. 淡定的，安静的： free from emotional or mental agitation

kindle.example: vt. 点燃: kindle interest 激发兴趣
kindle.mean: vt. 点燃： to build or fuel (a fire); to set fire to; ignite

garble.example:
vt. 曲解，篡改，混淆（以至使无法理解）: The summary totally garbles the results of the investigation. 这份摘要完全曲解了调查的结果
vt. 筛选，除杂: Garbled spices are less likely to contaminate a recipe. 经过筛选的香料应该就不会影响食谱了
garble.mean:
vt. 曲解，篡改，混淆（以至使无法理解）： to mix up or distort to such an extent as to make misleading or incomprehensible
vt. 筛选，除杂： to remove usually visible impurities from

mutate.example: v. （使）改变，（使）变异: Some chromosomes started to mutate after exposure to X-Ray. 经X光照射之后部分染色体发生了变异
mutate.mean: v. （使）改变，（使）变异： to undergo or cause to undergo mutation

swerve.example: vi. 突然改变方向: The car swerved sharply to avoid the squirrel in the road. 为了避开路中的松鼠，汽车猛地转向。
swerve.mean: vi. 突然改变方向： to turn aside abruptly from a straight line or course

talisman.example: n. 护身符: A pendant of white nephrite jade is often worn by Indians as a talisman to ward off heart disease. 印度人通常戴一串软玉项链防止心脏病发作。
talisman.mean: n. 护身符： something worn or kept to bring good luck or keep away evil

shrewd.example:
adj. 精明的，机敏的: He's shrewd about his investments. 他是个精明的投资人。
adj. 刺骨的，强烈的: She pulled her coat tighter against the shrewd breeze whipping down the alley. 巷子里挂着刺骨的风，她拉紧了大衣。
shrewd.mean:
adj. 精明的，机敏的： having or showing a practical cleverness or judgment
adj. 刺骨的，强烈的： causing intense discomfort to one's skin

decadent.example:
adj. 堕落的，腐败的: Opponents of gambling casinos claim that gambling is a decadent form of entertainment. 赌场的反对者们宣称赌博是一种堕落腐化的娱乐形式。
n. 放纵的人: a decadent who squandered her once considerable family fortune 一个挥霍了大量的家族财富的人
n. 道德上堕落的人: avant-garde artists who were scorned by the bourgeoisie as talentless decadents 被中产阶级鄙视为没有才华的堕落者的前卫艺术家
decadent.mean:
adj. 堕落的，腐败的： having or showing lowered moral character or standards
n. 放纵的人： a person whose life is devoted to luxury and sensual pleasures
n. 道德上堕落的人： a person in a condition or process of mental or moral decay

pedestrian.example:
n. 行人: a lane reserved for pedestrians 行人专用道
adj. 平庸无奇的，令人厌倦的: His style is so pedestrian that the book becomes a real bore. 他的风格是如此平庸以至于整本书显得非常无聊
pedestrian.mean:
n. 行人： a person traveling on foot
adj. 平庸无奇的，令人厌倦的： causing weariness, restlessness, or lack of interest

substantial.example:
adj. 物质的: a world of dreams, even less substantial than a rainbow 一个梦想中的世界，甚至比彩虹还虚无缥缈
adj. 有重大意义的: made a substantial progress 取得了实质性的进展
substantial.mean:
adj. 物质的： of, relating to, or having substance
adj. 有重大意义的： considerable in importance, value, degree, amount, or extent

unimpeachable.example: adj. 无可置疑的: An unimpeachable evidence 无可置疑的证据
unimpeachable.mean: adj. 无可置疑的： beyond doubt; unquestionable

cognizant.example: adj. 知道的，意识到的: We are cognizant of the problem. 我们已经意识到了问题。
cognizant.mean: adj. 知道的，意识到的：fully informed; conscious; aware

protrude.example: vi. 突出: a handkerchief protruding from his breast pocket 手帕从他的上衣口袋里突出出来
protrude.mean: vi. 突出： to jut out; project; bulge

gall.example:
vt.（使）焦躁，激怒: The sarcastic applause from the audience galled her. 观众反讽的掌声激怒了她
n.深深的敌意: Her kindly feelings turned to gall when she found out her nephew only wanted her money. 当她发现她的侄子只想要钱时，她之前友好的感情变成了憎恨与厌恶
n.大胆，无耻: I can't believe he had the gall to ask me how much I weigh. 我不敢相信他居然胆敢问我有多重
gall.mean:
vt.（使）焦躁，激怒： irritate, vex
n.深深的敌意： a deep-seated ill will
n.大胆，无耻： shameless boldness

cumbersome.example: adj. 笨重的，难处理的: a cumbersome piece of machinery 一件笨重的机器
cumbersome.mean: adj. 笨重的，难处理的： difficult to handle because of weight or bulk

mawkish.example: adj. 过度伤感的: a mawkish love story 令人伤感的爱情故事
mawkish.mean: adj. 过度伤感的： excessively and objectionably sentimental

remodel.example: vt. 改造，改变结构: We decided to remodel the warehouse into a museum displaying the products of the company. 我们决定把仓库改造成展览我们公司产品的博物馆。
remodel.mean: vt. 改造，改变结构： to alter the structure of

vulnerable.example: adj. 易受攻击的，脆弱的: The troops were deployed in a vulnerable position. 部队被部署在了一个容易遭受攻击的位置。‖The fort was undefended and vulnerable. 堡垒没有设防，十分脆弱。
vulnerable.mean: adj. 易受攻击的，脆弱的： open to attack or damage

refute.example:
vt. 否认: While the speak woman was publicly refuting rumors of a merger, behind the scenes the CEO was working to effect that very outcome. 尽管女发言人一再公开否认合并的谣言，首席执行官却在幕后为这一目标而努力。
vt. 证明为假，证伪: The triumph of Chinese athlete Liu Xiang in the 2004 Olympics effectively refuted the views that Asians are physically inferior to others. 中国运动员刘翔在2004年雅典奥运会上的胜利有效地驳斥了亚洲人在体格上不如其他人种的观点。
refute.mean:
vt. 否认： to declare not to be true
vt. 证明为假，证伪： to prove wrong by argument or evidence: show to be false or erroneous

tarnish.example: vt. 玷污: an arrest for shoplifting tarnished her reputation 因在商店行窃被捕玷污了她的声望
tarnish.mean: vt. 玷污： to affect slightly with something morally bad or undesirable

commotion.example: n. 骚乱: The commotion was created when the nation's top rock band arrived in town. 当顶级摇滚乐队来到小镇时，人们骚乱了。

severe.example:
adj. 严厉的，要求严格的: a severe, uncompromising teacher 一位严厉、不妥协的老师
adj. 难以承受的，艰难的: a severe winter that was among the coldest on record 有记录的最寒冷的冬天之一
severe.mean:
adj. 严厉的，要求严格的： given to exacting standards of discipline and self-restraint
adj. 难以承受的，艰难的： difficult to endure

camouflage.example: n. 伪装: the soldiers must wear protective jungle camouflage while on patrol 士兵们在巡逻的时候必须穿上迷彩服来保护自身安全
camouflage.mean: n. 伪装： behavior or artifice designed to deceive or hide

onset.example:
n. 攻击，进攻: withstand the onset of the army 抵挡住了敌人军队的进攻
n. 起始，开始: If you take enough vitamin C at the onset of a cold, you'll probably recover faster. 如果你感冒刚一开始就服用足量的维他命C，你可能会康复得更快。
onset.mean:
n. 攻击，进攻： attack, assault
n. 起始，开始： the point at which something begins

upbraid.example: vt.（严厉地）谴责，责骂: upbraid sb. with his ingratitude 责备某人忘恩负义
upbraid.mean: vt.（严厉地）谴责，责骂： to reproach severely

frail.example:
adj. 虚弱的: Working for three days without any sleep made him extremely frail. 连续三天的彻夜工作使他极为虚弱
adj. （意志）薄弱的: frail and pathetic humanity 容易误入歧途的可悲人性
adj. （希望）渺茫的: a frail hope of success 成功的机会渺茫
frail.mean:
adj. 虚弱的： physically weak
adj. （意志）薄弱的： easily led astray; morally weak
adj. （希望）渺茫的： slight, unsubstantial

ancillary.example:
adj. 次要的: The company hopes to boost its sales through ancillary products. 公司想通过辅助产品来增加销量。
adj. 辅助的，补充的 : auxiliary, supplementary
: the need for ancillary evidence 对补充证据的需要
adj. 辅助的，补充的 : auxiliary, supplementary
: Some practice in the deft use of words may well be ancillary to the study of natural science. 熟练使用文字的练习对于自然科学的研究也是有帮助的。
ancillary.mean:
adj. 次要的：of secondary importance
adj. 辅助的，补充的 : auxiliary, supplementary

donor.example: n. 捐赠人，给体: donors of funds to research foundations 研究基金的捐赠人
donor.mean: n. 捐赠人，给体： one that gives, donates, or presents something

chary.example: adj. 非常谨慎的: chary investors who weren't burned by the dot-com bust 那些没有受到互联网萧条影响的谨慎投资者们
chary.mean: adj. 非常谨慎的： very cautious

hymn.example:
n. 赞歌，赞美诗: They sang a hymn of praise to God. 他们唱赞歌赞美上帝
v. 赞美: During the honeymoon following the inauguration, newspaper articles seemed to hymn the president's every move. 在上任后的“蜜月期”之中，报纸新闻似乎在赞美总统的每一项措施
hymn.mean:
n. 赞歌，赞美诗： a song of praise or joy
v. 赞美： to proclaim the glory of

serene.example:
adj. 安静的: a serene vacation spot 一处宁谧的度假胜地
adj. 稳重的，镇静的: a serene man who was everyone's source of support 一个沉着镇静的男人，他是所有人的精神支柱
serene.mean:
adj. 安静的： free from disturbing noise or uproar
adj. 稳重的，镇静的： unaffected by disturbance; calm and unruffled

bravura.example: adj/n. 优秀演技: a truly bravura performance of the ballet 一场极其精彩的芭蕾舞演出
bravura.mean: adj/n. 优秀演技： brilliant technique or style in performance

gild.example: vt. （带欺骗性地）修改，润色: Any further retouch would be gilding the lily. 任何形式的润色都会是画蛇添足
gild.mean: vt. （带欺骗性地）修改，润色： to give an often deceptively attractive or improved appearance to

quota.example: n. 配额，限额: The department set new sales quotas in May. 部门设定了五月的销售定额。
quota.mean: n. 配额，限额： a proportional part or share

subsidy.example: n. 补助金，津贴: a subsidy to manufacturers during the war 战争期间对制造商的补贴金
subsidy.mean: n. 补助金，津贴： monetary assistance granted by a government to a person or group in support of an enterprise regarded as being in the public interest

confluence.example: n. 汇合，混合: a happy confluence of beautiful weather and spectacular scenery during our vacation 旅途中美好的天气和壮丽的景色令人欣喜的汇合
confluence.mean: n. 汇合，混合：the coming together of two or more things to the same point

miserly.example: adj. 吝啬的: a miserly couple devoid of social conscience and responsibility 一对没有社会良心和责任感的吝啬夫妻
miserly.mean: adj. 吝啬的： marked by grasping meanness and penuriousness

bridle.example: v. 限制: try to bridle your criticism next time so that it is helpful and not hurtful 下回控制好批评的语气，让其既顺耳又有益
bridle.mean: v. 限制： to keep from exceeding a desirable degree or level (as of expression)

off-key.example: adj. 不寻常的，不合适的: a high-flown, off-key speech by a newcomer 来自于新手的颇有野心、不寻常的一次演讲
off-key.mean: adj. 不寻常的，不合适的： being out of accord with what is considered normal or appropriate

prestige.example: n. 声望，威望: The prestige of the university has been irrevocably impaired by the plagiarism scandal. 这所大学的声望已经因剽窃丑闻而受到了不可挽回的损失。
prestige.mean: n. 声望，威望： the level of respect at which one is regarded by others

gregarious.example: adj. 群居的: ecologically define human as gregarious carnivore 从生态学上将人类定义为群居类肉食动物
gregarious.mean:
adj. 爱社交的：likely to seek or enjoy the company of others
adj. 群居的： tending to group with others of the same kind

apposite.example:
adj. 相关的，合适的highly pertinent or appropriate: apt
: to enrich his essay with some very apposite quotations from famous people 用名人名言来丰富他的文章
apposite.mean: adj. 相关的，合适的highly pertinent or appropriate: apt

pliable.example:
adj. 易弯曲的，柔软的: pliable optical fiber 柔软的光纤
adj. 易受影响的，温顺的: He took advantage of the pliable mind of youth. 他利用了年轻人容易受他人教唆的特点。
pliable.mean:
adj. 易弯曲的，柔软的： supple enough to bend freely or repeatedly without breaking
adj. 易受影响的，温顺的： easily influenced, persuaded, or swayed

sturdy.example: adj. 强健的，结实的: sturdy young athletes 年轻有力的运动员‖Remember to wear sturdy boots because we will be going over sharp rocks and uneven terrain. 别忘了穿一双靠谱的靴子，因为我们要在锋利的岩石和不平的地形上行走。
sturdy.mean: adj. 强健的，结实的： marked by or reflecting physical strength or vigor; substantially made or built

mobile.example:
adj. 可移动的: a mobile missile launcher 可移动导弹发射装置
adj. 可变的: a highly mobile face 善变的面孔
mobile.mean:
adj. 可移动的： capable of moving or being moved
adj. 可变的： changeable in appearance, mood, or purpose

opaque.example: adj. 晦涩的: opaque prose 晦涩的诗歌
opaque.mean:
adj. 不透光的：impenetrable by light; neither transparent nor translucent
adj. 晦涩的：so obscure as to be unintelligible

panegyric.example: n. 赞颂之词: wrote a panegyric on the centennial of the Nobel laureate's birth 为诺贝尔获得者百年诞辰纪念日写了一篇溢美之词
panegyric.mean: n. 赞颂之词： a eulogistic oration or writing

divestiture.example: n. 剥夺: Melodramas were popular because they offered the audience a divestiture of neutrality. 情节剧之所有受到欢迎是因为他们给观众一个缺乏中立的（世界）。
divestiture.mean: n. 剥夺：the act of taking away from a person

cramped.example: n. 狭促的: a cramped cubbyhole in an office 办公室里狭小的隔间
cramped.mean: n. 狭促的： uncomfortably small or restricted

barren.example:
adj. 不育的: a poor, barren woman 一名可怜的不孕女子
adj. 不产生结果的，无效的: That line of investigation proved barren, so the police tried other avenues. 那个方向的调查已经被证明是没有结果的了，所以警察开始尝试其他的途径
adj. 贫瘠的: barren deserts and wastelands 贫瘠的沙漠和荒野
adj. 极度匮乏的: Their proposal for revitalizing the downtown business district is utterly barren of practical methods. 他们意图重振中心商业区的计划缺乏能够起效的方法
barren.mean:
adj. 不育的： incapable of producing offspring
adj. 不产生结果的，无效的： producing no results; unproductive
adj. 贫瘠的： deficient in production of vegetation and especially crops
adj. 极度匮乏的： utterly lacking in something needed, wanted, or expected

notch.example: v. 通过努力获得: a stunning performance that notched up a second Academy Award for the actor 出色的表演为该演员拿到了第二座小金人
notch.mean:
n. 刻痕： a V-shaped cut. Such a cut used for keeping a record
v. 通过努力获得： to obtain (as a goal) through effort

favorable.example:
adj. 赞许的: Favorable reviews for the movie were few . 关于电影的正面评价极少
adj. 有利的: mild climate favorable to his health 有利于他健康的温和气候
favorable.mean:
adj. 赞许的：expressing approval
adj. 有利的：tending to promote or facilitate

rakish.example: adj. 放荡的，行为不检点的: He wore his hat at a rakish angle. 他帽子戴得吊儿郎当的。
rakish.mean: adj. 放荡的，行为不检点的： having or showing lowered moral character or standards; dissolute

despise.example: vt. 极其不喜欢: I despise anchovies on pizza, and I refuse to eat them. 我鄙视在披萨上的凤尾鱼，所以从来不吃。
despise.mean: vt. 极其不喜欢： to dislike strongly

ennoble.example: vt. 使尊贵: Her skill and talent ennoble her profession. 技能和天赋使她成为业界领军人物。
ennoble.mean: vt. 使尊贵： to make noble

languid.example: adj. 没精打采的，虚弱的: be languid for weeks after surgery 术后的几周都无精打采的
languid.mean: adj. 没精打采的，虚弱的： lacking energy or vitality; weak

barter.example: v. 以物换物: barter wheat for cotton 以小麦换棉花
barter.mean: v. 以物换物： to trade (goods or services) without the exchange of money

exterminate.example: vt. 根除，消灭: We hope that the fumigant exterminates the whole colony of cockroaches, for any survivors may be resistant to any poison. 我们希望所有的蟑螂都能被杀虫剂根除，因为任何幸存者都可能产生抗药性。
exterminate.mean: vt. 根除，消灭： to get rid of completely usually by killing off

agonize.example:
vt. 折磨，使痛苦: She got into more trouble, further agonizing her poor mother. 她惹上了更多的麻烦，进一步加剧了她可怜的母亲所遭受的痛苦。
vi. 感到痛苦: She agonized for days over the moral issues involved. 一连几天她都为被卷入的道德纠纷而感到痛苦。
agonize.mean:
vt. 折磨，使痛苦： to cause to suffer agony
vi. 感到痛苦： to suffer agony, torture, or anguish

affix.example: vt. 粘合: affix a stamp to a letter 把邮票贴在信封上
affix.mean: vt. 粘合： to attach physically

converge.example: v.汇集，交汇于一点: the main streets converge on a central square 众主干道在中央广场交汇
converge.mean: v.汇集，交汇于一点： tending to move toward one point or one another

malignant.example: adj. 恶毒的，邪恶的: She has a malignant wish to poison everyone who was smarter, richer, or better-looking than she was. 她有着一个恶毒的愿望，那就是毒死所有比她聪明、有钱或者是比她更漂亮的人。
malignant.mean: adj. 恶毒的，邪恶的： having or showing a desire to cause someone pain or suffering for the sheer enjoyment of it; disposed to do evil

underdog.example: n. 受害者，输家: She always supports for the underdog. 她经常支持受害者。
underdog.mean: n. 受害者，输家： a loser/ victim or predicted loser in a struggle or contest

friable.example: adj. 易碎的: friable mineral rock 易碎的矿石
friable.mean: adj. 易碎的： easily crumbled or pulverized

succor.example: vt. 救援，援助: We see it as our duty to succor anyone in need. 我们视帮助他人为自己的职责
succor.mean: vt. 救援，援助： to go to the aid of

saturate.example: v./adj. 使饱和，浸透: Saturate the sponge with water. 将海绵浸透
saturate.mean: v./adj. 使饱和，浸透： to wet thoroughly with liquid

aggravate.example:
vt. 加重，恶化: Stress and lack of sleep could aggravate the situation. 压力和睡眠不足使情况恶化。
v. 使不爽: it really aggravates me when I arrive 10 minutes before the stated closing time, and the store's closed already 我在号称的打烊时间前10分钟到达，但发现商店已经关门了，让我很不爽
aggravate.mean:
vt. 加重，恶化： to make worse, more serious, or more severe
v. 使不爽： to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts

paranoid.example: adj. 多疑的，对他人极端恐惧和怀疑的: a paranoid suspicion that the phone might be bugged 疑神疑鬼地担心电话被窃听了
paranoid.mean: adj. 多疑的，对他人极端恐惧和怀疑的： exhibiting or characterized by extreme and irrational fear or distrust of others

ratify.example: vt. （官方地）认可，批准: Lincoln's home state of Illinois was the first to ratify the 13th Amendment to the U.S. Constitution, which provided for the abolition of slavery. 林肯的老家——伊利诺伊是美国第一个通过《宪法第十三修正案》的州，该决案提供了废除奴隶制的法律基础。
ratify.mean: vt. （官方地）认可，批准： to give official acceptance of as satisfactory

grotesque.example: adj. 难看的: that bloody Halloween mask is grotesque 那个血腥的万圣节面具丑死了
grotesque.mean: adj. 难看的： unpleasant to look at

penalty.example: n. （对罪行的）处罚: The maximum penalty is 7 years’ imprisonment. 最为严厉的惩罚是七年的有期徒刑
penalty.mean: n. （对罪行的）处罚： a punishment established by law or authority for a crime or offense

abiding.example: vt. 永久的: an abiding love of Espanol 对西班牙语持久的热爱
abiding.mean: vt. 永久的： lasting for a long time; enduring

grandiloquent.example: adj. （语言等）浮夸的: feel disgusted with his grandiloquent speech 对他浮夸的演讲表示厌恶
grandiloquent.mean: adj. （语言等）浮夸的： a lofty, extravagantly colorful, pompous, or bombastic style, manner, or quality especially in language

convoluted.example: adj. 复杂的，费解的: a convoluted way of describing a simple mechanism 用令人费解的方法解释一个简单的原理
convoluted.mean: adj. 复杂的，费解的： complicated; intricate

snobbish.example: adj. 谄上傲下的，自大的: I expected her to be snobbish but she was warm and friendly. 我本以为她会是个自大的人，结果她非常热心和友好。
snobbish.mean: adj. 谄上傲下的，自大的： being or characteristic of a person who has an offensive air of superiority and tends to ignore or disdain anyone regarded as inferior

equity.example: n. 不偏不倚，公平: the lower wages paid to women for equal work violated the notion of equity 同等工作付给女性更低的报酬违背了公平的理念
equity.mean: n. 不偏不倚，公平： lack of favoritism toward one side or another

override.example: vt. 不顾: The Congress overrode the President’s veto and passed the law. 国会不顾总统的否决，强行通过了那项法令。‖He overrode all opposition to his plans. 他对所有的反对意见不闻不问。
override.mean: vt. 不顾： to set aside

dominant.example: adj. 起支配地位的: the dominant culture 主流文化
dominant.mean:
adj. 起支配地位的： commanding, controlling, or prevailing over all others
adj. （基因）显性的： of, relating to, or exerting ecological or genetic dominance

downpour.example: n. 倾盆大雨: power failure due to the downpour 暴雨导致的电力中断
downpour.mean: n. 倾盆大雨： a heavy fall of rain

babble.example:
v. 发出含糊无意义的嘟囔声，胡乱说: Babies babble before they can talk. 婴儿在会说话以前含糊不清地发音
v. 闲聊: The little girls babbled contentedly for the whole ride home. 两个小姑娘在回家的路上高兴地闲聊
babble.mean:
v. 发出含糊无意义的嘟囔声，胡乱说： to utter a meaningless confusion of words or sounds
v. 闲聊： to engage in casual or rambling conversation

secular.example: adj. 世俗的，尘世的: That’s an issue for the secular authorities, not the church. 这个问题和宗教无关，是一个世俗事务。
secular.mean: adj. 世俗的，尘世的： of or relating to the worldly or temporal

strut.example: vi. 趾高气扬地走: A pompous general strutted off the parade ground. 盛气凌人的将军从阅兵场上趾高气扬的走过
strut.mean:
vi. 趾高气扬地走： to walk with a pompous and affected air
n. 支柱，压杆： a structural element used to brace or strengthen a framework by resisting longitudinal compression

pristine.example: adj. 纯净的，质朴的，未被文明腐蚀的: a pristine forest 一片未被文明影响的森林
pristine.mean: adj. 纯净的，质朴的，未被文明腐蚀的： remaining in a pure state; uncorrupted by civilization. remaining free from dirt or decay; clean

avarice.example: n. 贪财，贪婪: The bank official's embezzlement was motivated by pure avarice. 银行官员盗用公款纯粹是出于贪婪
avarice.mean: n. 贪财，贪婪： excessive or insatiable desire for wealth or gain

hie.example: vi. 匆匆忙忙: we had best hie home before the rain gets worse 我们最好在雨下大之前赶快回家
hie.mean: vi. 匆匆忙忙： to go quickly, hasten

replenish.example: vt. 补充: He went to replenish her glass. 他去续杯了。
replenish.mean: vt. 补充： to fill or make complete again; add a new stock or supply to

interminable.example: adj. 无尽头的: A large audience fell asleep during the interminable sermon. 许多观众都在冗长的布道演说上睡着了
interminable.mean: adj. 无尽头的： having or seeming to have no end

inaugurate.example:
vt. 使就职: A new leader will be inaugurated soon. 新的领导即将就职
vt. 开始: inaugurate a new immigration policy 实施新的移民政策
inaugurate.mean:
vt. 使就职： to induct into an office by a formal ceremony
vt. 开始： to cause to begin, especially officially or formally

intensify.example: vt. 加强，激化: Both companies intensified their efforts to win the contract. 为了获得这份合同，两家公司都加大了投入
intensify.mean: vt. 加强，激化： to make intense or more intensive

winsome.example: adj. 迷人的，漂亮的: fascinated by her winsome smile 为她动人一笑所倾倒
winsome.mean: adj. 迷人的，漂亮的： generally pleasing and engaging often because of a childlike charm and innocence

amalgamate.example: v. 合并，混合: to amalgamate with an American company 与一家美国公司合并
amalgamate.mean: v. 合并，混合：to combine into a unified or integrated whole; unite

commensurate.example:
adj. 同样大小的: Five yards is commensurate with fifteen feet. 5码等于15英尺。
adj. 相称的，相当的: a job commensurate with her abilities 一份与她能力相称的工作
commensurate.mean:
adj. 同样大小的：equal in measure or extent
adj. 相称的，相当的：corresponding in size or degree; proportionate

contagious.example:
adj. 传染的: contagious diseases 传染病
adj. （情绪等）唤起共鸣的: The enthusiasm of the new club members was contagious. 新成员的热情具有很强的感染力
contagious.mean:
adj. 传染的： communicable by contact; catching
adj. （情绪等）唤起共鸣的：exciting a similar feeling or reaction in others

lavish.example:
adj. 奢侈大量的: lavish buffet 奢侈的自助餐
v. 挥霍，浪费: a great actor who lavished his talent in lousy movies 将才华浪费在低劣电影上的影星
lavish.mean:
adj. 奢侈大量的： characterized by or produced with extravagance and profusion
v. 挥霍，浪费： to give readily and in large quantities; to use up carelessly

tumult.example: n. 骚动，暴动: His mind was in a tumult. 他心烦意乱。
tumult.mean: n. 骚动，暴动： a disorderly commotion or disturbance, a riot

full-bodied.example:
adj. 重要的: a full-bodied study of genetic engineering 一项基因工程的重要研究
adj. 味道浓烈的: full-bodied perfume in the cabin 车厢内浓郁的香水味
full-bodied.mean:
adj. 重要的： having importance, significance, or meaningfulness
adj. 味道浓烈的： having richness and intensity of flavor or aroma

proclaim.example: vt. 宣告，使…公之于众: wearing a button that proclaimed my choice for president 身上挂着一个纽扣，它能够彰显我支持谁当总统‖He launched a coup and proclaimed himself president. 他发动了一场政变，然后宣称自己已成为总统。
proclaim.mean: vt. 宣告，使…公之于众： to declare publicly, typically insistently, proudly, or defiantly and in either speech or writing

disjunctive.example: adj. 分离的: a disjunctive narrative sequence 分散的叙述顺序
disjunctive.mean: adj. 分离的： marked by breaks or disunity

baroque.example:
adj. 华丽装饰的，过分雕琢，复杂的: a baroque prose 一篇辞藻华丽的散文
adj. （程度）过分的: Eventually even the movie seems bored by its baroque violence. 到最后这电影也因为其中过度的暴力元素而显得让人厌烦
baroque.mean:
