adj. 华丽装饰的，过分雕琢，复杂的： characterized by extravagance, complexity, or flamboyance
adj. （程度）过分的： going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount

doctrinaire.example: adj. 教条主义的，照本宣科的: A doctrinaire conservative, the columnist takes special delight in baiting liberals. 这个专栏作家是个谨遵教条的顽固保守主义者，他很享受挑衅那些自由主义者。
doctrinaire.mean: adj. 教条主义的，照本宣科的： given to or marked by the forceful expression of strongly held opinions

courteous.example: adj. 礼貌的，恭谦有礼的: Their customer service department always gives courteous responses, even to rude people. 哪怕是对粗鲁的消费者，他们的客服部门总是用一种非常有礼貌的态度回复。
courteous.mean: adj. 礼貌的，恭谦有礼的： marked by polished manners, gallantry, or ceremonial usage of a court

relentless.example:
adj. 残酷的，无情的: He was the most teacher enemy I have ever known. 他是我所知的最狠的老师。
adj. 固执的，不肯妥协的: The team's offense was relentless in trying to score. 进攻球员毫不妥协地努力得分。
relentless.mean:
adj. 残酷的，无情的： showing or promising no abatement of severity, intensity, strength, or pace
adj. 固执的，不肯妥协的： showing no signs of slackening or yielding in one's purpose

insensible.example:
adj. 无知觉的: The security guard was knocked insensible by a sudden blow. 保安被突如其来的一击敲晕了
adj. 漠不关心的: insensible to workers’ requests对工人的要求无动于衷
adj. 粗俗的，没品味的: She married an insensible brute upon whom the niceties of life were completely lost.她嫁给了一个毫无品味的凡夫俗子，从此她的生活再无任何情趣
insensible.mean:
adj. 无知觉的： having lost consciousness, especially temporarily
adj. 漠不关心的： not emotionally responsive
adj. 粗俗的，没品味的： lacking in refinement or good taste

staunch.example: adj. 忠诚的，坚定的: a staunch believer in the democratic system 民主制度的坚定拥护者‖No matter what happens I will be your staunchest supporters. 不论发生什么，我都会是你最忠诚的支持者。
staunch.mean: adj. 忠诚的，坚定的： steadfast in loyalty or principle

largesse.example:
n. 捐赠物: The alumna's huge bequest was an unexpected largess. 校友们的巨额遗赠是一笔意料之外的财富
n. 慷慨: be noted for his largesse 因慷慨而闻名
largesse.mean:
n. 捐赠物： something given to someone without expectation of a return
n. 慷慨： liberality in giving or willingness to give

intemperate.example: adj. 无节制的，极端的，不温和的: The tone of the article is very intemperate. 文章的论调很极端
intemperate.mean: adj. 无节制的，极端的，不温和的： not temperate or moderate

nibble.example: vt. 小口咬: waves nibbling the shore 缓慢侵蚀海岸的浪
nibble.mean: vt. 小口咬： to eat with small, quick bites or in small morsels

plausible.example: adj. 看似有理的: a plausible argument 看起来头头是道的说理
plausible.mean: adj. 看似有理的： superficially fair, reasonable, or valuable but often specious

venerate.example: vt. 尊敬: She is venerated by the public as a saint. 她被当作圣人，受万众景仰。
venerate.mean: vt. 尊敬： to regard with reverential respect or with admiring deference

barb.example: n. 尖锐而严厉的批评: delivered one last barb to his ex-girlfriend as he stalked away 在他转身离去之前，给他前女友留下了最后一句尖锐的批评
barb.mean: n. 尖锐而严厉的批评： a biting or pointedly critical remark or comment

backfire.example: vi. 产生相反的结果，事与愿违: My plan to throw her a surprise party backfired when she ended up sobbing that everyone had forgotten her birthday. 我本想给她的生日开一个聚会作为惊喜，但没想到事与愿违：她啜泣着说所有人都忘记了她的生日。
backfire.mean: vi. 产生相反的结果，事与愿违： to have the reverse of the desired or expected effect

parsimonious.example: n. 过度节俭的，吝啬的: the stereotype of the dour and parsimonious Scotsman 严肃而吝啬的苏格兰人的典型代表
parsimonious.mean: n. 过度节俭的，吝啬的： frugal to the point of stinginess

tender.example:
vt. 正式提出: tender a letter of resignation 正式提交辞职信
adj. 考虑周到的，关心同情的: an especially tender teacher who loves having kids with special educational needs in her class 特别无微不至的老师，爱着那些需要特别教育的孩子们
tender.mean:
vt. 正式提出： to offer formally
adj. 考虑周到的，关心同情的： having or marked by sympathy and consideration for others

petrify.example: v. 使僵化，失去活力: Pressure from family has petrified his once innovative mind. 家庭的压力使他的头脑失去了往日的创造力
petrify.mean: v. 使僵化，失去活力： to cause to become stiff or stone-like; deaden

bifurcate.example: vi./vt. （使）分成两支: Their visions of the company’s future slowly began to bifurcate. 我们关于公司未来的构想慢慢出现分歧
bifurcate.mean: vi./vt. （使）分成两支： (to cause) to divide into two branches or parts

efficacious.example: adj. 有效的: Taking break with a cup of coffee while studying is one of the most efficacious ways of rejuvenating the mind that I have ever discovered. 在紧张的学习中休息一会，喝杯咖啡，是我发现的最能提神的方法之一。
efficacious.mean: adj. 有效的： having the power to produce a desired effect

blurt.example: vt. 突然说出，冲动地说: blurt out the secret 脱口说出了秘密
blurt.mean: vt. 突然说出，冲动地说： to utter abruptly and impulsively

distinctive.example:
adj. 完全不同的: She seems to alternate between two distinctive hairstyles. 她的发型似乎在两种截然不同的样式中交替。
adj. 特征性的，典型的: She seems to alternate between two distinctive hairstyles. 她的发型似乎在两种截然不同的样式中交替。
distinctive.mean:
adj. 完全不同的： being not of the same kind
adj. 特征性的，典型的： serving to identify as belonging to an individual or group

equivocate.example: vi. （带有欺骗目的地）模棱两可地说，说谎话: When asked about his tax plan, the candidate didn't equivocate. 当被问到税收方案时，候选人直言不讳。
equivocate.mean: vi. （带有欺骗目的地）模棱两可地说，说谎话： to use equivocal language especially with intent to deceive

timeworn.example: adj. 陈腐的: timeworn jokes 老掉牙的笑话

premeditate.example: vt. 预谋: carefully premeditating each step of his plan of campaign 仔细地计划着竞选计划中的每一个步骤
premeditate.mean: vt. 预谋： to think about and revolve in the mind beforehand

myriad.example: adj. 无限的，大量的: the myriad stars of a summer night 夏日夜空中的无尽繁星
myriad.mean: adj. 无限的，大量的： constituting a very large, indefinite number

abrade.example: v. 磨损，精神上折磨: My skin was abraded. 我的皮肤被磨损了。
abrade.mean: v. 磨损，精神上折磨： to rub or wear away especially by friction; wear down spiritually

ineffable.example: adj. 难以表达的: ineffable ecstasy 无法用语言表达的狂喜
ineffable.mean: adj. 难以表达的： incapable of being expressed

distraught.example: adj. 精神狂乱的，极疯狂的: Her distraught mother had spent all night waiting by the phone. 她母亲忧心如焚，在电话旁守了一个晚上。
distraught.mean: adj. 精神狂乱的，极疯狂的： deeply agitated, as from emotional conflict; insane

rite.example: n. 惯例，仪式: the marriage rites 婚礼仪式的章程
rite.mean: n. 惯例，仪式： a prescribed form or manner governing the words or actions for a ceremony

hauteur.example: n．傲慢，自大: he looked at her with the hauteur of someone who is accustomed to being instantly obeyed 他看着她，带着向来被顺从惯了的傲慢。
hauteur.mean: n．傲慢，自大： haughtiness in bearing and attitude; arrogance

compliment.example:
n./ vt. 称赞，恭维: a man meriting the compliments and homage of his fellows 一个值得他的伙伴们尊敬和称赞的人
n. 敬意，免费赠送的礼物: How about a delicious dessert then, with our compliment? 给您上点甜点怎么样，算是我们小小的敬意。
compliment.mean:
n./ vt. 称赞，恭维：an expression of praise, admiration, or congratulation
n. 敬意，免费赠送的礼物：formal and respectful recognition : honor

concatenate.example: v. 连结，混合: The movie actually concatenates several episodes from various books into one extended narrative. 这部电影把很多书中的片段混合成了一个故事。
concatenate.mean: v. 连结，混合：to put or bring together so as to form a new and longer whole

candor.example: n. 坦白，直率，诚挚: the members of the rock band speak with candor about their recent squabbling 摇滚乐队成员对于他们最近的内讧直言不讳
candor.mean: n. 坦白，直率，诚挚： unreserved, honest, or sincere expression

dullard.mean: n. 笨蛋：a stupid or unimaginative person

aggrieve.example: vt. 使苦恼,悲痛: a line of aggrieved ticket-holders, demanding a refund for the cancelled play 一队怨念的购票者，为取消的话剧要求退款
aggrieve.mean: vt. 使苦恼,悲痛： to give pain or trouble to, distress

baleful.example:
adj. 有害的: a policy with baleful effects 一个带来不良后果的政策
adj. 凶兆的: a baleful look 面露凶色
adj. 致命的: a medicine that is beneficial in small doses but baleful in large 是药三分毒
baleful.mean:
adj. 有害的： harmful or malignant in intent or effect
adj. 凶兆的： foreboding or threatening evil
adj. 致命的： likely to cause or capable of causing death

inimitable.example: adj. 无法仿效的，独特的: her own inimitable style 她特立独行的作风
inimitable.mean: adj. 无法仿效的，独特的： not capable of being imitated

dally.example:
vi. 虚度时光: I kept dallying at my desk until I couldn't put off doing my work any longer. 我一直浪费时间直到作业不能再拖了。
v. 玩乐: he spent his college years dallying, seemingly determined to acquire as little knowledge as possible 他在大学里面尽情玩乐，不学习
v. 慢吞吞，磨磨蹭蹭: don't dally on the way to the interview 别在去面试的路上磨磨蹭蹭
dally.mean:
vi. 虚度时光： to spend time doing nothing
v. 玩乐： to engage in activity for amusement
v. 慢吞吞，磨磨蹭蹭： to move or act slowly

threadbare.example:
adj. 陈腐的: a novel filled with nothing but threadbare clichés 一部满是陈词滥调的小说
adj. 贫穷的: never knew that she had so many threadbare relatives until she won the lottery 赢了彩票之后才知道她有这么多穷亲戚
adj. 破烂的: I loved that threadbare shirt, but after 10 years of wear, it was time to throw it away. 我很喜欢那件旧旧的衬衣，但是已经穿了10年了，是该扔了。
threadbare.mean:
adj. 陈腐的： overused to the point of being worn out; hackneyed
adj. 贫穷的： lacking money or material possessions
adj. 破烂的： worn or torn into or as if into rags

terminus.example: n. 终点，终点站: Stockholm is the terminus for the southbound train. 斯德哥尔摩是南向去的列车的终点站。
terminus.mean: n. 终点，终点站： the final point; the end

cryptic.example:
adj. 秘密的: cryptic message 秘密的信息
adj. 含义模糊的: The senator made some cryptic explanations about the military operations. 参议员就军事行动给出了含糊其辞的解释
adj. 超出理解能力的: puzzled by the cryptic e-mail message left on his computer 被他电脑里让人费解的电子邮件而迷惑
cryptic.mean:
adj. 秘密的： secret or occult
adj. 含义模糊的： having or seeming to have a hidden or ambiguous meaning
adj. 超出理解能力的： being beyond one's powers to know, understand, or explain

ignominy.example: n. 耻辱: He spent the remainder of his life in ignominy after being involved in a bribery scandal. 因为卷入了受贿丑闻当中，他在耻辱中度过余生
ignominy.mean: n. 耻辱： the state of having lost the esteem of others

license.example:
n. 许可，认可: The company is seeking license to operate several more power plants in the state. 公司正在寻求在国内建造更多电厂的许可。‖A restaurant owner has to get a license to serve food and drink. 餐厅营业者必须要获得食物和饮品的销售许可。
n. 自由: Military commanders on the ground must be granted considerable license, as wars cannot be micromanaged by people back in Washington. 战地指挥官应该被赋予相当大的自由，因为一场战争只靠华盛顿的人是不可能打赢的。
n. 放荡: a night of drinking and license at the nightclub 夜店里放纵饮酒取乐的一夜
license.mean:
n. 许可，认可： the approval by someone in authority for the doing of something
n. 自由： the right to act or move freely
n. 放荡： disregard for standards of personal conduct
vt. 准许，授权使用： to permit

hermetic.example: adj. 深奥的: wrote hermetic poetry 写晦涩难懂的诗歌
hermetic.mean: adj. 深奥的： relating to or characterized by occultism or abstruseness

interrogate.example: vt. 质问，审问: interrogate the prisoner of war for valuable intelligence 审问战俘以获取有价值的情报
interrogate.mean: vt. 质问，审问： to question formally and systematically

timorous.example: adj. 胆小的: be as timorous as a rabbit 像兔子一样胆小
timorous.mean: adj. 胆小的： of a timid disposition: fearful

sensitive.example: adj. 敏感的: he's very sensitive to the sun and will burn if he's outside for any amount of time 他的皮肤对日光非常敏感，在外时间长了就会烧灼
sensitive.mean: adj. 敏感的： susceptible to the attitudes, feelings, or circumstances of others

lash.example:
n. 击打: suddenly felt the lash of her drunken husband's hand on her cheek 突然感觉到脸颊被醉酒的丈夫扇了一耳光
v. 猛击，撞击: All night long a barrage of rain lashed the windows. 倾盆大雨整夜敲击着窗户
vt. 捆扎: Secure the anchor by lashing it to the rail. 通过将锚绑在栏杆上使其稳固。
lash.mean:
n. 击打： a hard strike with a part of the body or an instrument
v. 猛击，撞击： to strike against with force or violence
vt. 捆扎： to bind with or as if with a line

tangent.example: n. / adj. 离题（的），不相关（的）: tangent remarks 不相关的评论
tangent.mean: n. / adj. 离题（的），不相关（的）： diverging from an original purpose of course: irrelevant

fail-safe.example:
n. 保险措施: There are so many fail-safes built into the system that a highly unlikely series of mistakes would have to be made before failure could occur. 系统中嵌入了大量的保险措施，因此在系统崩溃之前，必须要发生一系列几乎不可能出现的错误
adj. 万无一失的: a fail-safe device 自动防故障装置‖Men have traditionally regarded flowers as the fail-safe gift for Valentine's Day. 男士们长期以来认为鲜花是情人节永远不会错的礼物
fail-safe.mean:
n. 保险措施： a measure taken to preclude loss or injury
adj. 万无一失的： having no chance of failure

secrete.example: vt. 隐藏: The police found the weapon secreted under the driver's seat of the getaway car. 警方在逃逸车辆驾驶座下发现了隐藏的武器。
secrete.mean:
vt. 隐藏： to conceal in a hiding place; cache
vt. 分泌： to generate and separate (a substance) from cells or bodily fluids

cynic.example: n. 愤世嫉俗者: A cynic might think that the governor visited the hospital just to gain votes. 一个愤青认为州长去医院探视仅仅是为了拉票。
cynic.mean: n. 愤世嫉俗者： a person who believes all people are motivated by selfishness.

sloth.example: n. 怠惰，懒惰: Sloth is the mother of poverty. 懒惰是贫穷的原因。
sloth.mean: n. 怠惰，懒惰： disinclination to action or labor: indolence

duplicity.example: n. 欺骗，口是心非: accidentally reveal their duplicity 不经意间暴露了他们的口是心非
duplicity.mean: n. 欺骗，口是心非： deliberate deceptiveness in behavior or speech

dwindle.example: vi. 逐渐减少: His vast fortune is dwindling away. 他的巨额财富正慢慢缩水
dwindle.mean: vi. 逐渐减少： to become gradually less until little remains

allegiance.example: n. 忠诚: They swore their allegiance to the USA. 他们宣誓效忠美国。
allegiance.mean: n. 忠诚： devotion or loyalty to a person, group, or cause

frosty.example:
adj. 寒冷的: a frosty autumn that was a sign of the brutal winter that followed 一个极为寒冷的秋天，它象征着随之而来的、可能更加残暴的冬季
adj. 无强烈感情的，冷淡的: She gave the telemarketer on the phone a frosty “No, thank you” and hung up. 她向电话那头的推销员冷冷地说了一句“不，谢谢”之后就挂掉了电话。
frosty.mean:
adj. 寒冷的： having a low or subnormal temperature
adj. 无强烈感情的，冷淡的： lacking in friendliness or warmth of feeling

rave.example:
vi. 狂热赞扬: Critics raved about the new play. 新剧得到了评论家们的热烈赞扬。
vi. （发疯般地）怒吼: a man standing outside the city hall,raving like a lunatic about his tax bill 站在市政大厅外、像疯子一样叫嚷着自己税单的人
rave.mean:
vi. 狂热赞扬： to make an exaggerated display of affection or enthusiasm
vi. （发疯般地）怒吼： to talk irrationally and wildly in or as if in delirium

supple.example: adj. 易弯曲的，柔软的: supple limbs 柔软的四肢 || a supple mind 灵活的头脑
supple.mean: adj. 易弯曲的，柔软的： readily bent; pliant

acrid.example:
adj. 辛辣的，刺鼻的: acrid smell of tobacco 烟草刺鼻的味道
dj. 刻薄的: acrid temper 刻薄的性情
acrid.mean:
adj. 辛辣的，刺鼻的： sharp and harsh or unpleasantly pungent in taste or odor : irritating
dj. 刻薄的： marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings

bolster.example:
n./v. 支持: pillows that bolster the building 支撑房屋的柱子
v. 鼓励，使有精力: news that bolsters the morale of the troops鼓舞军队士气的消息
bolster.mean:
n./v. 支持： a structural part designed to eliminate friction or provide support or bearing
v. 鼓励，使有精力： to give a boost to

appall.example: vt. 使惊恐: He felt appalled by the whole idea of marriage so we broke up. 结婚使他恐惧，因此我们分手了。
appall.mean: vt. 使惊恐：to overcome with consternation, shock, or dismay

implicit.example:
adj. 不言而喻的，心照不宣的: The implicit agreement among members of the outing club is that everyone pays his or her own way on all trips. 野外俱乐部成员之间一条心照不宣的约定就是：沿途所有开销都AA。
adj. 无疑问的，无保留的: Members of the expedition must have implicit trust in their leaders. 远征的队员必须百分之百地信任他们的领队。
implicit.mean:
adj. 不言而喻的，心照不宣的： capable of being understood from something else though unexpressed
adj. 无疑问的，无保留的： being without doubt or reserve

temporize.example: v. 行动躲躲闪闪以争取时间、躲避争论等: “Colonial officials . . . ordered to enforce unpopular enactments, tended to temporize, to find excuses for evasion”(J.H. Parry) “被命令来执行不受欢迎法案的殖民地官员们倾向于敷衍了事，去寻找逃避的理由”(J.H.帕里)
temporize.mean: v. 行动躲躲闪闪以争取时间、躲避争论等： to act evasively in order to gain time, avoid argument, or postpone a decision

reciprocate.example:
vi. 往复运动: According to Marx’s economic principle, the average price of a certain product should be reciprocating over its value. 根据马克思的经济学理论，商品的平均价格应该在它的价值周边波动。
vt. 报答，回报: reciprocated the favor by driving their neighbor to the airport 开车送邻居去机场以还人情
reciprocate.mean:
vi. 往复运动： to move forward and backward alternately
vt. 报答，回报： to return in kind or degree

damn.example:
vt. （在道德上）谴责: a cleric who damned gambling and strong drink 一个严厉谴责赌博和酗酒的牧师
adv. 非常地，极其地: Let's have a damn good party. 让我们尽情享乐狂欢吧。
damn.mean:
vt. （在道德上）谴责： to declare to be morally wrong or evil
adv. 非常地，极其地： to a great degree

coarse.example:
adj. 粗糙的，表面不平整的: the coarse surface of the sandpaper 砂纸的粗糙表面
adj. （声音）刺耳的: a coarse laugh from the living room 客厅里传来的一阵刺耳笑声
adj. 粗俗的: They don't know how to behave, and are coarse and insulting. 他们不知道平常的行为礼节，因此显得粗俗而冒犯。
adj. （质量）低劣的: coarse imitations of quality merchandise 高级商品的粗劣仿制品
coarse.mean:
adj. 粗糙的，表面不平整的： not having a level or smooth surface
adj. （声音）刺耳的： harsh, raucous, or rough in tone
adj. 粗俗的： lacking in delicacy or refinement
adj. （质量）低劣的： of low, common, or inferior quality

omniscient.example: adj. 无所不知的: an omniscient deity 无所不知的神
omniscient.mean: adj. 无所不知的： possessed of universal or complete knowledge

veneer.mean:
n. 薄木板，用以贴在家具外面的饰面板： a thin surface layer, as of finely grained wood, glued to a base of inferior material
vt. 粉饰（不好的东西）： to cover over with a veneer; especially to conceal (as a defect of character) under a superficial and deceptive attractiveness

exculpate.example: vt. 声明无罪；开脱，使无罪: I have gathered evidence that will exculpate my client. 我已经搜集到能够证明委托人无罪的证据了。
exculpate.mean: vt. 声明无罪；开脱，使无罪： to clear from alleged fault or guilt

referee.example:
n. 仲裁者；裁判员: served as the unofficial referee in disputes over the family business 作为一个非官方协调员，解决家庭事务中的纠纷
vt. （就纠纷或争议）给出意见: Their father usually ends up refereeing any disputes concerning use of the big TV. 最后往往是他们的父亲决定该看什么电视频道，从而解决了相关争执。
referee.mean:
n. 仲裁者；裁判员： a person who impartially decides or resolves a dispute or controversy
vt. （就纠纷或争议）给出意见： to give an opinion about (something at issue or in dispute)

champion.example: vt. 支持 / n. 支持者: to champion the cause of civil rights 支持民权事业
champion.mean: vt. 支持 / n. 支持者： to fight for, defend, or support as a champion

incinerate.example: vi. 烧成灰烬: The government is trying to stop farmers incinerating their own waste. 政府开始阻止农民们焚烧垃圾的行为
incinerate.mean: vi. 烧成灰烬： to cause to burn to ashes

deter.example:
vt. 吓住，威慑: wouldn’t be deterred by threats 不被威胁吓住
vt. 吓住，威慑: deterrent weapons 威慑性武器; a deterrent to theft 对偷窃的威慑
deter.mean: vt. 吓住，威慑： to prevent or discourage from acting, as by means of fear or doubt

repertoire.example: n. （技术、设备或原料等的）详单: The chef's repertoire of specialties seems to be limited, with several of the dishes appearing over and over again in slightly varied guises. 这个厨师的所有拿手好戏看来是很有限的，因为上来的几盘菜看起来只是稍微换了一下装饰而已。
repertoire.mean: n. （技术、设备或原料等的）详单： the complete list or supply of skills, devices, or ingredients used in a particular field, occupation, or practice

waft.example: vt. 飘荡，漂浮: Heavenly aromas wafted from the kitchen. 令人欣悦的香气从厨房飘出。‖A feather wafted past us and settled on the grass. 一片羽毛飘过我们身边，落在草地上。
waft.mean: vt. 飘荡，漂浮： to float easily and gently, as on the air

misbehaving.example: adj. 调皮的，行为不端的: a new approach for disciplining a chronically misbehaving child 一个教育调皮小孩的新方法
misbehaving.mean: adj. 调皮的，行为不端的： engaging in or marked by childish misbehavior

fretful.example: adj. 易怒的，烦躁的: Adolescence is the most fretful stages of human development. 青春期是人类发展过程中最恼人的阶段
fretful.mean: adj. 易怒的，烦躁的： inclined to be vexed or troubled

rupture.example: v. 打破；打碎: Jealousy ruptured our friendly relationship. 嫉妒心破坏了我们的友谊。
rupture.mean: v. 打破；打碎： to part by violence

inclement.example: adj. （天气等）恶劣的: inclement weather conditions 恶劣的气象条件
inclement.mean:
adj. （天气等）恶劣的： lacking mildness
adj. 无情的，严酷的： showing no clemency; unmerciful

solid.example:
adj. 固态的，坚固的: The ice cream is too solid to scoop right now. 冰淇淋现在太硬了，根本舀不动。
adj. 有理有据的: the only solid conclusion that the jury could have reached 陪审团唯一可能做出的合理结论
adj. 坚定的，不迟疑的: Some people see a solid handshake as a sign of strong character. 有人认为握手毫不迟疑的人有着很强势的性格。
solid.mean:
adj. 固态的，坚固的： having a consistency that does not easily yield to pressure
adj. 有理有据的： based on sound reasoning or information
adj. 坚定的，不迟疑的： not showing weakness or uncertainty

viscous.example: adj. 粘稠的，粘的: viscous syrup that takes forever to pour from a narrow-neck bottle 不知要花多久才能从窄口瓶中倒出来的粘稠糖浆
viscous.mean: adj. 粘稠的，粘的： viscid; sticky

civility.example: n. 彬彬有礼: They greeted us with civility. 他们有礼貌地招呼我们。
civility.mean: n. 彬彬有礼：courteous behavior; politeness

batch.example:
n. 一批次的量: a batch of cookies 一批次烘烤的饼干
n. 一小群人: Show the next batch of applicants in, please. 请带下一批申请人进来
batch.mean:
n. 一批次的量： a number of things considered as a unit
n. 一小群人： a usually small number of persons considered as a unit

crutch.example: n./v. 支撑，支柱: a crutch for local economy 当地的经济支柱
crutch.mean: n./v. 支撑，支柱： something that supports or sustains

precursor.example: n. 先驱者，先导: 18th-century lyric poets like Robert Burns were precursors of the Romantics. 十八世纪的抒情诗人（如罗伯特?彭斯）是浪漫主义的先驱。
precursor.mean: n. 先驱者，先导： one that precedes and indicates the approach of another

clout.example: n. 权力，影响力: The queen may have privilege but she has no real political clout. 女王有特权, 但无真正的政治影响力。

barricade.example:
n. 障碍物: The police put up barricades to block off the parade route. 警察设立了路障来阻挡游行的队伍
v. 用障碍物阻止通过: streets have been barricaded by authorities 街道被当局封锁了
barricade.mean:
n. 障碍物： an obstruction or rampart thrown up across a way or passage
v. 用障碍物阻止通过： to prevent access to by means of a barricade

smart.example:
adj. 反应敏捷的，聪颖的: a smart child who could do well in school 一个能在学校取得良好成绩的聪明孩子
adj. 整洁的: Dressed in their smart new uniforms, the cadets proudly paraded around the grounds of the military school. 穿着整洁的制服，军校的学员们骄傲地在训练场上游行。
vi. 感到疼痛，感到痛苦: The injection only smarted for a moment. 打针只会痛一小会儿。‖He is still smarting over criticism of his clumsy performance. 那些对他笨拙表演的批评仍然让他感到痛苦。
smart.mean:
adj. 反应敏捷的，聪颖的： characterized by sharp quick thought
adj. 整洁的： being strikingly neat and trim in style or appearance
vi. 感到疼痛，感到痛苦： to suffer acutely, as from mental distress, wounded feelings, or remorse

succumb.example:
vi. 屈服: refused to succumb to her fears and defiantly walked through the dark cemetery 拒绝向自己的恐惧屈服，而是倔强地走过了幽暗的墓地
vi. 死亡: The patient lay so still and pale that everyone thought he had succumbed, and then he opened his eyes. 面色惨白的病人静静地躺在床上，正当所有人都怀疑他已经过逝时，他突然睁开了眼睛。‖The doctor worked tirelessly until finally he, too, succumbed to the plague. 医生不知劳累地工作，直至最后，他也死于瘟疫。
succumb.mean:
vi. 屈服： to yield to superior strength or force or overpowering appeal or desire
vi. 死亡： to be brought to an end (as death) by the effect of destructive or disruptive forces

fleet.example:
n. 舰队，车队: fleet of the Royal Navy 皇家海军的舰队
adj. 迅速的: He was fleet as a deer. 他如小鹿般敏捷
fleet.mean:
n. 舰队，车队： a group of vehicles traveling together or under one management
adj. 迅速的： moving, proceeding, or acting with great speed
vi. 快速通过： to move or pass swiftly

mordant.example: adj. 尖酸刻薄的: feel embarrassed about the mordant satire of the critics 对评论家刻薄的讽刺感到尴尬
mordant.mean: adj. 尖酸刻薄的： biting and caustic in thought, manner, or style

secluded.example: adj. 隐僻的，隐蔽的: secluded monks 隐居的僧人
secluded.mean: adj. 隐僻的，隐蔽的： screened or hidden from view

credence.example: n. 坚信: give credence to gossip 相信绯闻
credence.mean: n. 坚信： firm belief in the integrity, ability, effectiveness, or genuineness of someone or something

forebear.example: n. 祖先: The son of Abrahamis traditionally considered to be the forebear of the Arabs. 亚伯拉罕之子传统上被认为是阿拉伯人的祖先
forebear.mean: n. 祖先：a person from whom one is descended; an ancestor

rancor.example: n. 敌意，深仇: A good man terminates a friendship without rancor. 君子绝交不记仇。
rancor.mean: n. 敌意，深仇： a bitter deep-seated ill will

hoax.example: n./v. 欺骗: a skilled forger who hoaxed the art world into believing that the paintings were long-lost Vermeers 一个老道的骗子成功让艺术界相信那些画作是遗失多年的维米尔的真迹
hoax.mean: n./v. 欺骗： to cause to believe what is untrue

ecstasy.example:
n. 无法自控的情绪: an ecstasy of rage 无法自控的愤怒
n. 狂喜: be in ecstasy over the offer from Harvard University 因被哈佛的录取而欣喜如狂
ecstasy.mean:
n. 无法自控的情绪： a state of being beyond reason and self-control
n. 狂喜： intense joy or delight

sectarianism.example: n. 宗派主义，顽固: An ideological sectarianism prevented the political party from ever being anything more than a fringe group. 意识形态上的顽固和保守使得这个政党只能成为一个边缘团体。
sectarianism.mean: n. 宗派主义，顽固： stubborn or intolerant adherence to one's opinions or prejudices

cadge.example: v. 乞讨，乞求: cadge a free cup of coffee 讨到一杯免费的咖啡
cadge.mean: v. 乞讨，乞求： beg, sponge

quail.example: vi. 胆怯，畏缩: She quailed at the thought of seeing him again. 她想到还要再见他就害怕。
quail.mean: vi. 胆怯，畏缩： to shrink back in fear; cower

enervate.example:
vt. 使衰弱: His constitution was enervated by lustful lifestyle. 他荒淫无度的生活习惯已使他身体虚弱
vt. 使麻木: A lifetime of working in dreary jobs had enervated his very soul. 一生忙于无聊的工作让他变得无比麻木
enervate.mean:
vt. 使衰弱： to weaken or destroy the strength or vitality of
vt. 使麻木： to deprive of emotional or intellectual vitality

hyperbole.example: n. 夸张: The debate was carried on with increasing rhetorical hyperbole. 随着辩论的进行，双方修辞当中的夸张越来越多
hyperbole.mean: n. 夸张： a figure of speech in which exaggeration is used for emphasis or effect

seduce.example: vt. 劝说（使不忠，使不服从），诱…误入歧途: The other firm seduced him with a better offer. 另一家公司用更高的待遇想挖他墙脚。
seduce.mean: vt. 劝说（使不忠，使不服从），诱…误入歧途： to attract or persuade to disobedience or disloyalty

subliminal.example: adj. 下意识的，潜在意识的: subliminal advertising in movies 电影中的潜意识广告
subliminal.mean: adj. 下意识的，潜在意识的： below the threshold of conscious perception

benign.example:
adj. 好心的，仁慈的: a benign coach 一名仁慈的教练
adj. 无害的: Don’t worry; his eccentricities are entirely benign. 别担心，他那些古怪行为不会给人带来伤害
benign.mean:
adj. 好心的，仁慈的：showing kindness and gentleness
adj. 无害的： not causing or being capable of causing injury or hurt

discredit.example:
v. 羞辱，使丧失名誉: discredit his opponents 羞辱他的对手
v. 怀疑，不相信: I discredit the story that the old house is haunted. 我怀疑那个房子闹鬼不是真的。
discredit.mean:
v. 羞辱，使丧失名誉： to damage in reputation; disgrace.
v. 怀疑，不相信： to think not to be true or real

bristle.example:
v. 怒不可遏，咆哮: bristle at the suggestion of gay marriage 对基情怒不可遏
v. 供应充足: starting a new life in New York city bristling with possibilities 在有着无限机会的纽约开始新生活
bristle.mean:
v. 怒不可遏，咆哮： to express one's anger usually violently
v. 供应充足： to be copiously supplied

lenient.example: adj. 宽大仁慈的: the lenient sentences 仁慈的审判
lenient.mean: adj. 宽大仁慈的： inclined not to be harsh or strict; merciful, generous, or indulgent

impious.example: adj.不敬神的: made impious remarks about the church 对教会做出不敬的评论
impious.mean: adj.不敬神的： lacking reverence for holy or sacred matters

prerequisite.example: n. 先决条件，前提: Competence is prerequisite to promotion. 能力是提升的必要条件。‖I don’t think a large dwelling place is a prerequisite for a happy life. 我并不认为大的住所就能带来幸福的生活。
prerequisite.mean: n. 先决条件，前提： something that is necessary to an end or to the carrying out of a function

sham.example:
n. 欺瞒: condemned the rigged election as a total sham 指责这次有作弊的选举是彻头彻尾的骗局
v. 掩饰，假装: shammed a most unconvincing limp just to get sympathy 非常拙劣地假装自己腿脚不便，以博得同情
adj. 虚假的: street vendors selling sham designer handbags to gullible tourists 街头小贩向易上当的游客兜售山寨的设计师手包
sham.mean:
n. 欺瞒： the quality of deceitfulness; empty pretense
v. 掩饰，假装： to present a false appearance of
adj. 虚假的： not genuine; fake

contravene.example: v. 违反，反对: contravene the proposal with no reservation 毫无保留地反对这一提案
contravene.mean: v. 违反，反对：to violate, to oppose in argument: contradict

covetous.example: adj. 贪婪的，渴求财富的: cast covetous eyes on their neighbors’ fields 对他邻居的土地垂涎
covetous.mean: adj. 贪婪的，渴求财富的：marked by inordinate desire for wealth or possessions or for another's possessions

sapient.example: adj. 聪明的，有洞察力的: a man who is always good for valuable insights and some sapient advice 一个以见解深刻、建议明智著称的男人
sapient.mean: adj. 聪明的，有洞察力的： having or showing deep understanding and intelligent application of knowledge

teeter.example:
vi. 蹒跚，不稳定的行走: She teetered down the street in her high heels. 她穿着高跟鞋，在街上摇摇欲坠。
v. 犹豫不决: was teetering on the brink of making a decision about college
teeter.mean:
vi. 蹒跚，不稳定的行走： to move unsteadily: wobble
v. 犹豫不决： to show uncertainty about the right course of action

banter.example: n./v. 幽默、打趣的（地）谈话: banter with someone 和某人调侃
banter.mean: n./v. 幽默、打趣的（地）谈话： good-humored, playful conversation

prude.example: n. 过分正经的人: the racy sitcom frequently satirizes exactly the sort of prude who would like to see the show taken off the air
prude.mean: n. 过分正经的人：一个过分关心自己是否是或显得得体、谦逊或正确的人： a person who is greatly concerned with seemly behavior and morality especially regarding sexual matters

epithet.example: n. 外号，绰号: King Richard I of England was given the very laudatory epithet “the Lion-Hearted” 英王理查一世因英勇大胆被赞誉为“狮心理查”
epithet.mean: n. 外号，绰号： a descriptive or familiar name given instead of or in addition to the one belonging to an individual ；a disparaging or abusive word or phrase

negotiate.example:
vi. 商量，谈判: negotiate the term of truce 共商停战事宜
vi. 谋划: The prisoners negotiated their escape by using Morse code to tap messages to each other through the walls. 犯人们通过敲击墙壁来传达莫尔斯电码，从而密谋了他们的逃跑计划
negotiate.mean:
vi. 商量，谈判： to arrange or settle by discussion and mutual agreement
vi. 谋划： plan out usually with subtle skill or care

censure.example: v. 公开表示反对，谴责: He was censured by the committee for his failure to report the problem. 他因为未上报事故受到了委员会的指责。
censure.mean: v. 公开表示反对，谴责： to express public or formal disapproval of

simpleton.example: n. （缺乏常识的）笨蛋: His silly antics at office parties have earned him a reputation as a simpleton. 他在办公室聚会上愚蠢的古怪行为让他被人认为是个蠢货。
simpleton.mean: n. （缺乏常识的）笨蛋： a person lacking in common sense; a stupid person

strength.example:
n. 力量: We are facing an army of great strength. 我们面对的是一支强大的军队。
n. （抵抗攻击、压力的）强度: This cheap shelve unit doesn't have the strength to hold all those books. 这个廉价的书架不足以支撑所有的书本。
strength.mean:
n. 力量： the ability to exert effort for the accomplishment of a task
n. （抵抗攻击、压力的）强度： the ability to withstand force or stress without being distorted, dislodged, or damaged

impede.example: v. 妨碍，阻碍: Storms at sea impeded our expedition. 海上的风暴阻碍了我们的远征
impede.mean: v. 妨碍，阻碍： to interfere with or slow the progress of

appreciable.example:
adj. 可感知的,明显的: the appreciable changes in temperature 气温明显的变化
adj. 可感知的,明显的: There doesn't seem to be any appreciable difference between this piece and that one. 这个和那个看上去没什么差别。
appreciable.mean: adj. 可感知的,明显的：capable of being perceived or measured; perceptible

ceremonious.example: adj. 讲究礼节的，庄重的: A century ago everyday life was much more ceremonious than in our anything-goes era. 一个世纪之前的生活和我们现在这个随便怎么都无所谓的年代相比，多出了许多要讲究的礼节。
ceremonious.mean: adj. 讲究礼节的，庄重的： marked by or showing careful attention to set forms and details

robust.example: adj. 精力充沛的，强壮的，健康的: a robust older man who still bicycles 10 miles a day 一个每天骑行10英里的充满活力的老人
robust.mean: adj. 精力充沛的，强壮的，健康的： full of health and strength

knack.example: n. 诀窍，聪明的做法: She's tried every knack in Cupid's book to get her guy to marry her. 她试过了所有爱情三十六计，希望那男人娶她
knack.mean: n. 诀窍，聪明的做法： a clever trick or stratagem; a clever way of doing something

timid.example: adj. 胆小的，不自信的: He gave her a timid smile. 他给了她一个羞赧的微笑。
timid.mean: adj. 胆小的，不自信的： lacking in courage or self-confidence

infamous.example: adj. 臭名昭著的: an infamous city for smuggling and prostitution 因走私而和卖淫而臭名昭著的城市
infamous.mean: adj. 臭名昭著的： having an extremely and deservedly bad reputation

perquisite.example: n. 额外的好处: give the movers a perquisite if they do a good job 如果搬家工人做得好就会获得一定的小费‖The use of a company car is one perquisite of the job. 能使用公司的汽车是这项工作的附加好处之一。
perquisite.mean: n. 额外的好处： something given in addition to what is ordinarily expected or owed

perspicacious.example: adj. 极敏锐的，有洞察力的: an impartial and perspicacious judge一个明镜高悬的法官
perspicacious.mean: adj. 极敏锐的，有洞察力的： having or showing penetrating mental discernment; clear-sighted

finesse.example:
n. 娴熟技巧: The musician shows wonderful finesse. 那位音乐家展现出了非凡的技艺
v. 精心策划: finesse the schedule 精心安排日程
v.（巧妙地）躲避: He tried to finesse the blame for the foreign policy fiasco, even though he was secretary of state at the time. 他竭尽所能躲避因失败的对外政策而可能遭到的指责，尽管他是时任国务卿
finesse.mean:
n. 娴熟技巧： mental skill or quickness
v. 精心策划： to plan out usually with subtle skill or care
v.（巧妙地）躲避： to get or keep away from (as a responsibility) through cleverness or trickery

supersede.example: vt. 取代，替代: That edition of the dictionary that you have has been superseded by a more recent one. 你买的那一版的字典已经被最近新出的版本取代了。
supersede.mean: vt. 取代，替代： to displace in favor of another

solemnity.example: n. 严肃: Solemnity is a trick of the body to hide the fault of the mind. 一本正经的态度，是肉体为了掩饰精神上的缺陷而耍的花招。‖The coronation ceremony requires absolute solemnity. 加冕典礼需要绝对的庄严肃穆。
solemnity.mean: n. 严肃： the quality or condition of being solemn

craven.example: adj. 非常懦弱的，因胆小令人鄙视的: a craven deserter 一个懦弱的逃兵
craven.mean: adj. 非常懦弱的，因胆小令人鄙视的：lacking the least bit of courage; contemptibly fainthearted

half-baked.example: adj. 不明智的: a half-baked scheme 不明智的计划
half-baked.mean: adj. 不明智的： showing or marked by a lack of good sense or judgment

concrete.example:
adj. 实体的，实在的: concrete objects like rocks and trees 像石头、树这一类的实物
adj. 事实性的，明确的: Concrete evidence, and not just a theory, must be presented at a trial. 在法庭上需要出示确凿的证据，而非臆测。
concrete.mean:
adj. 实体的，实在的： relating to or composed of matter
adj. 事实性的，明确的： existing in fact and not merely as a possibility

synopsis.example: n. 摘要，概要: Just give me a synopsis of the movie. 把电影的大致情节给我说说就行。
synopsis.mean: n. 摘要，概要： a brief outline or general view; an abstract or a summary.

withdraw.example: vi. 撤退: The army was forced to withdraw from the frontline. 部队被迫从前线撤回
withdraw.mean: vi. 撤退： to take back or away

savvy.example:
n. 老练，机智: political savvy 政治上的老脸精明
v. 明确了解: The man growled, “Don't ever date my daughter again—you savvy?” 那男人咆哮道，“你丫以后不准再见我女儿，你的明白？”
adj. 有见识，精明能干的: a particularly savvy investor, he was among the first to see the potential in tech stocks 一个有卓识远见的投资者，是第一批看到科技类股票升值潜力的人
savvy.mean:
n. 老练，机智： knowledge gained by actually doing or living through something
v. 明确了解： to have a clear idea of
adj. 有见识，精明能干的： having or showing a practical cleverness or judgment

recant.example: vt. 撤回，放弃，改变: The man has refused after torture to recant his heresy. 这个人在受折磨后依旧拒绝放弃他的异教信仰。
recant.mean: vt. 撤回，放弃，改变： to withdraw or repudiate (a statement or belief) formally and publicly

chord.example: vi. 和谐一致；符合: The revised system chords perfectly with the original goals. 新版的系统非常符合最初的目标。
chord.mean: vi. 和谐一致；符合：to be in accord; agree.

pillory.example: vt. 被示众嘲弄: The candidate mercilessly pilloried his opponent. 候选人在大众面前无情地羞辱他的对手。‖He resigned after being pilloried by the press. 在遭到媒体嘲弄之后他愤然辞职。
pillory.mean: vt. 被示众嘲弄： to expose to public contempt, ridicule, or scorn

egoistic.example: adj. 利己的，以自我为中心的: egoistic behaviors others detest 令他人厌恶的利己行为
egoistic.mean: adj. 利己的，以自我为中心的： being centered in or preoccupied with oneself and the gratification of one's own desires

migratory.example: adj. 迁移的: migratory birds heading south for the winter 为了越冬而往南飞的候鸟
migratory.mean: adj. 迁移的： having a way of life that involves moving from one region to another typically on a seasonal basis

scrupulous.example:
adj. 正直的: Less scrupulous companies find ways to evade the law. 道德程度略低的公司钻法律的空子。
adj. 一丝不苟的: The task requires scrupulous attention to detail. 这项任务需要对细节一丝不苟。
scrupulous.mean:
adj. 正直的： guided by or in accordance with one's sense of right and wrong; principled
adj. 一丝不苟的： taking, showing, or involving great care and effort

ludicrous.example: adj. 荒唐的，可笑的: He made a ludicrous and easily detected attempt to forge his father’s signature on a note to school. 他试图在要上交学校的纸条上伪造父亲的签名，这实在是既可笑又容易被发现的花招。
ludicrous.mean: adj. 荒唐的，可笑的： meriting derisive laughter or scorn as absurdly inept, false, or foolish

salve.example: v. 减轻，缓解: The company give him a raise in salary to salve his feelings. 公司决定给他加薪以安抚他的感情
salve.mean: v. 减轻，缓解： quiet, assuage

belabor.example:
v.（当众）严厉批评: It’s not wise to belabor other people's flaws when you're hardly perfect yourself. 如果你自己还做不到完美，去指责他人是不明智的
v. 就…作过度的说明，喋喋不休: belabor the obvious 就显而易见的问题喋喋不休
belabor.mean:
v.（当众）严厉批评： to criticize harshly and usually publicly
v. 就…作过度的说明，喋喋不休： to explain or insist on excessively

vigilant.example: adj. 警醒的，警惕的: Police warned the public to be vigilant and report anything suspicious. 警方要求公众保持警惕，并上报任何有嫌疑的人或事。‖When traveling through the city, tourists should be extra vigilant. 在这个城市旅行的游客应该保持格外的警惕。
vigilant.mean: adj. 警醒的，警惕的： alertly watchful especially to avoid danger

recondite.example: adj. 深奥的，难解的: I think Quantum Mechanics and Random Process arethe two most recondite courses in our curriculum this semester. 我觉得量子力学和随机过程是这学期课表中最难的两门课程
recondite.mean: adj. 深奥的，难解的： difficult or impossible for one of ordinary understanding or knowledge to comprehend

superficial.example: adj. 表面的，肤浅的: The official’s superficial report on the situation provoked wide blame on the Internet. 官员对于情况敷衍般的描述激起了网络上的广泛谴责。
superficial.mean: adj. 表面的，肤浅的： lacking in depth, solidity, and comprehensiveness

offish.example: adj. 冷淡的: consistently surly and offish with the would-be suitors who came calling 对于追求者总是阴沉并且冷淡
offish.mean: adj. 冷淡的： Inclined to be distant and reserved; aloof

abstemious.example: adj. （吃喝等）有节制的，节俭的: an abstemious diet 有节制的饮食， abstemious meals 节俭的晚餐
abstemious.mean: adj. （吃喝等）有节制的，节俭的： marked by restraint especially in the consumption of food or alcohol, sparring

disseminate.example: vt. 散播，传播: disseminate Marxism-Leninism 传播马列主义 || The Internet allows us to disseminate information faster. 互联网允许我们更快的传播信息。
disseminate.mean: vt. 散播，传播： to spread abroad; promulgate

interregnum.example: n. 过渡期: The democratic regime proved to be a short-lived interregnum between dictatorships. 这个民主政权被证明只不过是两个独裁政权之间的短暂过渡罢了
interregnum.mean: n. 过渡期： break in continuity

vague.example:
adj. 表达不清的: The diplomat gave as vague a reply as he could at the press conference. 外交官在记者招待会上尽其所能来含糊其辞。
adj. 轮廓不清晰的: the vague outline of a building through the dense fog 浓雾中建筑物模糊的轮廓
vague.mean:
adj. 表达不清的： not clearly expressed
adj. 轮廓不清晰的： lacking definite shape, form, or character

exhilarate.example: vt. 使高兴；使兴奋: be exhilarated by her success 为她的成功感到兴奋
exhilarate.mean: vt. 使高兴；使兴奋： to make cheerful and excited

prudish.example: adj. 过分守礼的: By the prudish standards of the 19th century, any depiction of the nude was scandalous. 根据19世纪的保守标准，任何对裸露的刻画描述都是下流无耻的。
prudish.mean: adj. 过分守礼的： marked by prudery

plateau.example:
n. 高原: Qinghai-Tibetan Plateau 青藏高原
n. 稳定时期，平台期: reached a plateau of development 达到了发展的稳定期
plateau.mean:
n. 高原： a usually extensive level land area raised sharply above adjacent land on at least one side
n. 稳定时期，平台期： a relatively stable level, period, or state

depravity.example: n. 道德败坏: He was sinking into a life of utter depravity. 他自甘堕落。
depravity.mean: n. 道德败坏： immoral conduct or practices harmful or offensive to society

reproof.example: n. 批评，反对: The head teacher speaks in tones of gentle reproof. 校长的话语中带有隐晦的批评。
reproof.mean: n. 批评，反对： criticism for a fault, rebuke

narcissism.example: n. 自恋: In his narcissism, he just assumed that everyone else wanted to hear the tiny details of his day. 在他自恋的眼中，所有人仿佛都想要听他日常生活里的细枝末节
narcissism.mean: n. 自恋： excessive love or admiration of oneself

cordon.example:
n. 警戒线: a cordon of police 警察围成的警戒线
v. 围城一道防线: cordoned off the area around the explosion scene 在爆炸现场周边设置警戒线
cordon.mean:
n. 警戒线： a line or ring of police, soldiers, or vehicles preventing people from entering an area
v. 围城一道防线： to form a protective or restrictive cordon around

soliloquy.example: n. （尤指自言自语的）独白: A soliloquy always reveals the character’s thoughts and feeling. 一段独白经常反映出人物的思想和感情。
soliloquy.mean: n. （尤指自言自语的）独白： a dramatic or literary form of discourse in which a character talks to himself or herself or reveals his or her thoughts without addressing a listener

vendor.example: n. 小贩，商贩: We're thinking of making a deal with that other software vendor. 我们在考虑和那个软件供应商的交易。
vendor.mean: n. 小贩，商贩： one that sells or vends

vindicate.example:
vt. 为…平反，为…辩护，使无罪: The evidence would completely vindicate him. 这个证据将彻底证明他的清白。
vt. 证明，证实: Recent discoveries have generally vindicated the physicist's theories. 近期的发现整体上证明了物理学家的理论。
vindicate.mean:
vt. 为…平反，为…辩护，使无罪： to free from allegation or blame
vt. 证明，证实：to give evidence or testimony to the truth or factualness of

advocate.example: vt. 支持，提倡: advocates traditional teaching methods 提倡传统教学方法
advocate.mean: vt. 支持，提倡： to speak, plead, or argue in favor of; support

redeem.example:
vt. 实践，履行（诺言等）: The coach redeemed his promise to take the players out for ice cream if they improved their fielding over the season. 教练履行了他的诺言，那就是如果球员们能够在赛季中提升防守能力的话，他就请他们吃冰淇淋。
vt. 改过自新: The unfaithful husband made a determined effort to redeem himself in the eyes of his wife and children. 在妻子和孩子的监督下，不忠的丈夫下定决心要改过自新。
redeem.mean:
vt. 实践，履行（诺言等）： to do what is required by the terms of
vt. 改过自新： to make better in behavior or character

jibe.example: vi. 意见一致: Your figures jibe with mine. 你的数据与我的一致。
jibe.mean: vi. 意见一致： to be in accord: agree

extricate.example: vt. 使解脱，救出: extricate himself from financial difficulties 使他摆脱财政困境
extricate.mean: vt. 使解脱，救出： to free or remove from an entanglement or difficulty

precipitation.example:
n. 沉积物，尤指降水: The storm brought several inches of precipitation. 风暴带来的降水量高达数英尺。
n. 仓促: I fear that I may have acted with some precipitation on this matter, so I would like to reconsider. 我害怕自己在这个事情上考虑得太仓促了，因此我想再想想。
precipitation.mean:
n. 沉积物，尤指降水： something precipitated as a deposit on the earth of hail, mist, rain, sleet, or snow
n. 仓促： excited and often showy or disorderly speed

translucent.example: adj. 透明的: translucent dewdrop 透明的露珠
translucent.mean: adj. 透明的： permitting the passage of light: clear, transparent

renegade.example: n. 背教者，叛徒: A band of renegades who had deserted their infantry units were making their way to Mexico. 一支背叛了他们所属的步兵编队的士兵朝着墨西哥前进。
renegade.mean: n. 背教者，叛徒： one who rejects a religion, cause, allegiance, or group for another; a deserter

blemish.example:
n. 缺点，污点: The first LCD had several blemishes on its surface, so we took it back to the store. 第一块液晶显示屏有许多坏点，所以我们拿回商场去退货了
v. 损害，降低: A scratch blemished the finish on the car. 一道刮痕破坏了车子表面的涂层
blemish.mean:
n. 缺点，污点： a noticeable imperfection
v. 损害，降低： to reduce the soundness, effectiveness, or perfection of

pertinent.example: adj. 相关的，恰当的: He impressed the jury with his concise, pertinent answers to the attorney's questions. 他对律师提出的问题的简洁而恰当的回答给陪审团留下了深刻的印象
pertinent.mean: adj. 相关的，恰当的： having a clear decisive relevance to the matter in hand

miff.example: vt. 使恼怒: be miffed by her son’s disobedience 被她儿子的叛逆惹恼
miff.mean: vt. 使恼怒： to cause to become offended or annoyed

bruit.example: vt. （未经证实地）散播消息: It’s been bruited that… 到处传播……
bruit.mean: vt. （未经证实地）散播消息： to make (as a piece of information) the subject of common talk without any authority or confirmation of accuracy

confront.example: vt. 直接对抗，直面: You must confront your fear in order to conquer it. 要战胜你的恐惧，就必须首先敢于面对
confront.mean: vt. 直接对抗，直面： to come face to face with, especially with defiance or hostility

pillar.example:
n. 柱子: stone pillars that supported the hall 支撑大厅的石柱
n. （物质、精神等方面的）支柱: My father has been my pillar throughout this crisis. 整场危机之中我父亲都是我的支柱。
pillar.mean:
n. 柱子： a firm upright support for a superstructure
n. （物质、精神等方面的）支柱： something or someone to which one looks for support

manifest.example:
adj. 显然的，明显易懂的: He is a manifest poseur. 他显然是个装模作样的人
v. 显现，显露: His frustration is often manifested by a minor facial tic. 他的沮丧通常会从脸部的细微抽搐中表现出来
manifest.mean:
adj. 显然的，明显易懂的： clearly apparent to the sight or understanding; obvious
v. 显现，显露： to make evident or certain by showing or displaying

consensus.example: n. 一致同意: The board has finally reached a consensus. 董事会最终达成了一致
consensus.mean: n. 一致同意： general agreement; unanimity

deleterious.example: adj. 有害的: deleterious to health 对健康有害的
deleterious.mean: adj. 有害的： harmful often in a subtle or unexpected way

spiny.example:
adj. 多刺的: low spiny bushes of sage 低矮多刺的长满鼠尾草的灌木丛
adj. 棘手的，麻烦的: This promises to be a spiny problem to negotiate. 这有可能成为谈判过程中棘手的问题。
spiny.mean:
adj. 多刺的： bearingspines, prickles, or thorns
adj. 棘手的，麻烦的： requiring exceptional skill or caution in performance or handling

entice.example: vt. 诱使: entice sb into doing sth 诱使某人做某事
entice.mean: vt. 诱使： to attract artfully or adroitly or by arousing hope or desire: tempt; lure

imprudent.example: adj. 不明智的: an imprudent investment ha made many years ago 他许多年前做的一笔不明智的投资
imprudent.mean: adj. 不明智的： lacking discretion, wisdom, or good judgment

terminology.example: n. 专业术语: the terminology favored by sportscasters 体育节目转播员喜欢用的那些术语 || medical terminology that can be hard for the patient to understand 那些病人们难以理解的医学术语
terminology.mean: n. 专业术语： the special terms or expressions of a particular group or field

crescendo.example:
n./v.（声音）渐强: The movement begins with a crescendo of a clarinet. 乐章伴随着渐强的单簧管奏响
n. （渐强之后到达的）顶峰: complaints about stifling smog conditions reach a crescendo 对于让人窒息的烟雾的抱怨到达了顶峰
crescendo.mean:
n./v.（声音）渐强： a gradual increase in volume of a musical passage
n. （渐强之后到达的）顶峰：the peak of a gradual increase

hallmark.example: n. 典型的特征: the dramatic flourishes are the hallmark of the trial lawyer 一头夸张的假发是辩护律师的标志装扮
hallmark.mean: n. 典型的特征： a conspicuous feature or characteristic

goldbrick.example: vi. 逃避工作和责任: goldbrick his duty as a citizen 逃避他作为公民的义务
goldbrick.mean: vi. 逃避工作和责任： to shirk one's assigned duties or responsibilities

defuse.example: vt. 抚慰，减轻: defuse the crisis 平息危机
defuse.mean: vt. 抚慰，减轻：to make less dangerous, tense, or hostile

incriminate.example: vt. 归罪于: incriminate innocent people 诬陷好人
incriminate.mean: vt. 归罪于： to accuse of a crime or other wrongful act

catalyze.example:
vt. 成为导火索，导致: a reinstitution of the draft would catalyze protests around the country 草案的提出会激发全国范围的抗议
vt. 成为导火索，导致: a catalyst for change of lifestyle 生活方式变化的催化剂
catalyze.mean: vt. 成为导火索，导致： to be the cause of (a situation, action, or state of mind)

accelerate.example:
v. 加速: accelerate his steps 加快脚步
v. 使提前发生: accelerate their departure 提前离开
v. 变大，变多: toy purchases accelerate dramatically during the Christmas season 玩具销售量在圣诞期间暴涨
accelerate.mean:
v. 加速： to cause to move faster
v. 使提前发生： to bring about at an earlier time
v. 变大，变多： to become greater in size, extent, volume, amount, or number

sprightly.example: adj. 活泼的，充满活力的: He was deeply impressed by the sprightly Gypsy dance. 活力四射的吉普赛舞蹈给他留下了深刻印象。
sprightly.mean: adj. 活泼的，充满活力的： full of spirit and vitality

eclat.example: n. 辉煌成就: The premier of Mozart’s Le Nozze di Figaro enjoyed a great éclat in 1786. 莫扎特歌剧《费加罗的婚礼》于1786年的首演获得了极大的成功
eclat.mean: n. 辉煌成就： brilliant or conspicuous success

amicable.example: adj. 友善的: maintain amicable relations 保持友好关系；an amicable divorce 和平离婚
amicable.mean: adj. 友善的：characterized by friendly goodwill; amiable

synthesis.example: n. 合成，综合: a philosophy that is a kind of synthesis of several schools of Western and Eastern thought 哲学史东西方很多流派思想的综合
synthesis.mean: n. 合成，综合： the combination of parts or elements so as to form a whole

wanderlust.example: n. 旅行癖: His wanderlust would not allow him to stay long in one spot. 他对旅行的渴望让他不可能在一处久待。
wanderlust.mean: n. 旅行癖： a very strong or irresistible impulse to travel

proficient.example: adj. 熟练的，精通的: proficient in translating foreign languages 精通外语翻译
proficient.mean: adj. 熟练的，精通的： having or marked by an advanced degree of competence, as in an art, vocation, profession, or branch of learning

potentate.example: n. 有权的人: a son of a potentate 官二代
potentate.mean: n. 有权的人： one who has the power and position to rule over others

pen.example:
n. 监狱: spent six years in a federal pen 在联邦监狱中度过了六年
v. 关押，监禁: remember to pen up the dogs when visitors come over 客人来的时候别忘了把狗给关起来
pen.mean:
n. 监狱： a place of confinement for persons held in lawful custody
v. 关押，监禁： to close or shut in by or as if by barriers

bogus.example:
adj. 伪造的，假冒的: The evidence turned out to be completely bogus and the suspect may be innocent. 由于证据被发现是彻底伪造的，嫌犯很有可能是无辜的。
adj. 虚伪的，做作的: There was often a lot of bogus conviviality at the company’s parties. 公司的聚会上往往有着虚伪的欢乐。
bogus.mean:
adj. 伪造的，假冒的： being such in appearance only and made or manufactured with the intention of committing fraud
adj. 虚伪的，做作的： lacking in natural or spontaneous quality

epic.example: adj. 宏大的，超凡脱俗的: his genius was epic 他聪明过人
epic.mean: adj. 宏大的，超凡脱俗的： surpassing the usual or ordinary, particularly in scope or size

rectitude.example: n. 正直: The principal encouraged the graduates to go on to live lives of rectitude. 校长鼓励毕业生们在今后的生活中做一个正直的人。
rectitude.mean: n. 正直： the quality or state of being straight; moral integrity

inimical.example:
adj. 带有敌意的: a cold, inimical voice 冰冷而不友好的声音
adj. 危及某人利益的，不利的: Laws were designed to enhance national security but some regard as inimical to cherished freedoms. 法律旨在维护国家安全，但有人认为它危及了人们最为珍贵的权力——自由
inimical.mean:
adj. 带有敌意的： reflecting or indicating hostility
adj. 危及某人利益的，不利的： opposed to one's interests

dehydrate.example:
vt. 去除水分，（使）干燥: bought a dehumidifier in order to dehydrate the damp basement 买了一个减湿器来给地下室除湿
v. 使失去活力或者味道: years of being trapped in a loveless marriage had dehydrated his spirit 多年不幸的婚姻消磨了他的活力
dehydrate.mean:
vt. 去除水分，（使）干燥： to remove water from; make anhydrous
v. 使失去活力或者味道： to deprive of vitality or savor

run.example: n. （不间断的）连续演出: The play had a long run. 此剧一口气演了很长时间
run.mean: n. （不间断的）连续演出： an unbroken course of performances or showings

taxing.example: adj. 繁重的，费力的: The journey proved to be very taxing. 旅途很艰辛。
taxing.mean: adj. 繁重的，费力的： requiring much time, effort, or careful attention

wayward.example: adj. 刚愎自用的，不服管束的: had always been the most wayward of their three children 总是三个小孩里最不听话的一个‖wayward children with a history of behavioral problems 过去行为上有些问题的调皮小孩
wayward.mean: adj. 刚愎自用的，不服管束的： following one's own capricious, wanton, or depraved inclinations

hypocritical.example: adj. 虚伪的: It's hypocritical to say mean things behind someone's back, and then to act nice when you want something from her. 这种在背后说别人坏话、而有求于人时又装出另一副样子的人就是虚伪
hypocritical.mean: adj. 虚伪的： not being or expressing what one appears to be or express

meretricious.example: adj. 艳俗的，俗气的: The paradise they found was no more than a meretricious wasteland of casinos and bars. 他们所发现的所谓“天堂”只不过是一块有着赌场和酒吧的俗气不堪的荒漠罢了。
meretricious.mean: adj. 艳俗的，俗气的： attracting attention in a vulgar manner

conversant.example: adj. 熟悉的: conversant with the accounting system 熟知会计系统
conversant.mean: adj. 熟悉的： having frequent or familiar association

effusive.example: adj. 感情泛滥溢于言表的；感情表达不节制和过度的；过分多情的: The principal delivered an effusive address at the commencement ceremony. 校长在毕业典礼上做了充满感情的演讲
effusive.mean: adj. 感情泛滥溢于言表的；感情表达不节制和过度的；过分多情的： unrestrained or excessive in emotional expression

tinker.example: vi. 乱修，乱调整: tinkering with the engine 胡乱调整发动机
tinker.mean: vi. 乱修，乱调整： to handle thoughtlessly, ignorantly, or mischievously

prohibitive.example: adj. （价格高得）抑制购买的: prohibitive prices 抑制购买的高价
prohibitive.mean:
adj. 禁止的；阻止的： tending to prohibit or restrain
adj. （价格高得）抑制购买的： so high or burdensome as to discourage purchase or use

dormant.example:
adj. 静止的，不活跃的: volcanoes which have been dormant for thousand years 休眠了上千年的火山
adj. （动物）冬眠的: The bears lay dormant in their den during the winter. 在冬季，熊在他们的穴里冬眠
dormant.mean:
adj. 静止的，不活跃的： in a state of rest or inactivity; inoperative; in abeyance
adj. （动物）冬眠的： having biological activity suspended

react.example: vt. 做出反应: didn't know how to react to the cheers of the crowd 不知如何对人群的欢呼声做出回应
react.mean: vt. 做出反应： to act or behave in response (as to a stimulus or influence)

hackneyed.example: adj. 陈腐的，缺乏创新的: hackneyed slogans 老掉牙的口号
hackneyed.mean: adj. 陈腐的，缺乏创新的： lacking in freshness or originality

tortuous.example: adj. 转弯抹角的: a tortuous path 一条蜿蜒的道路
tortuous.mean: adj. 转弯抹角的： marked by devious or indirect tactics: crooked, tricky

surrender.example:
vt. 交出，放弃，投降: surrender a contractual right 放弃契约上规定的一项权利
v. 沉溺于: surrendered himself to grief 沉湎于悲伤
surrender.mean:
vt. 交出，放弃，投降： to give (something) over to the control or possession of another usually under duress
v. 沉溺于： to give (oneself) over to something especially unrestrainedly

ordeal.example: n. 严峻的考验: The hikers were finally rescued after a three-day ordeal in the wilderness. 在野外度过了三天的严峻考验之后，登山者终于获救了。
ordeal.mean: n. 严峻的考验： a severe trial or experience

stonewall.example: v. 拒绝（合作），阻挠: lobbying efforts to stonewall passage of the legislation 意在阻止法律通过的游说行动
stonewall.mean: v. 拒绝（合作），阻挠： to be uncooperative, obstructive, or evasive

mesmeric.example: adj. 令人着迷的，难以抗拒的: the mesmeric recital 迷人的独奏
mesmeric.mean:
adj. 催眠的，催眠术的： of, relating to, or induced by mesmerism
adj. 令人着迷的，难以抗拒的： attracting and holding interest as if by a spell

paroxysm.example:
n. （感情、动作的）突发: a paroxysm of coughing 突然一阵咳嗽
n. （政治、社会领域的）大动荡: Darwin's introduction of the theory of evolution created paroxysms in both religion and science that are still being felt today. 达尔文提出的进化论给宗教界和科学界都带来了巨大的冲击，时至今日我们仍然可以感觉到
paroxysm.mean:
n. （感情、动作的）突发：a sudden outburst of emotion or action
n. （政治、社会领域的）大动荡：a violent disturbance (as of the political or social order)

therapeutic.example: adj. 治疗的: Gentle exercise can be therapeutic for hospital patients. 适量的运动对病人恢复有好处。
therapeutic.mean: adj. 治疗的： of or relating to the treatment of disease or disorders by remedial agents or methods

bluster.example:
v. 狂妄自大地大声说: He was blustering alone in the meeting, which triggered wide dissatisfaction. 他一人在会议上夸夸其谈，引得众人不满。
n. 喧闹的状态: a mayor who got things done without a lot of bluster 一个能把事情低调解决的市长
bluster.mean:
v. 狂妄自大地大声说： to speak in a loudly arrogant or bullying manner
n. 大声吹嘘或恐吓： loudly boastful or threatening speech
n. 喧闹的状态： a state of noisy, confused activity

credible.example: adj. 可信的，值得信赖的: It’s not perfect, but is at least a credible explanation. 尽管还不算完美，但这好歹也算是可信的解释了。‖a credible account of an accident 事故的可靠报道
credible.mean: adj. 可信的，值得信赖的： worthy of being accepted as true or reasonable

maelstrom.example:
n. 漩涡: Their raft got caught in a maelstrom. 他们的筏被一个漩涡卷住了
n. 混乱、动荡的局势: the maelstrom of war 战争带来的乱世
maelstrom.mean:
n. 漩涡： a powerful often violent whirlpool sucking in objects within a given radius
n. 混乱、动荡的局势： a violent or turbulent situation

shipshape.example: adj. 井然有序的: I like to keep my car shipshape. 我喜欢打理我的车。
shipshape.mean: adj. 井然有序的： marked by meticulous order and neatness

parity.example: n. 相称，同等，平等: to achieve parity with our commercial competitors 取得与我们的商业竞争对手同等的地位
parity.mean: n. 相称，同等，平等： the quality or state of being equal or equivalent

depose.example:
vt. 发誓作证: he was nervous when the time to depose before the jury finally arrived 他很紧张，在陪审团面前作证的时刻终于到来了
v. 废黜，罢免: a military junta deposed the dictator after he had bankrupted the country 军阀罢黜了将国家分崩离析的独裁者
v. 摆放: deposed her fan and gloves on the dressing table 把她的扇子和手套放在梳妆台上
depose.mean:
vt. 发誓作证： to testify to under oath or by affidavit
v. 废黜，罢免： to remove from a throne or other high position
v. 摆放： to arrange something in a certain spot or position

tiff.example: n./v. 小争吵: got into a little tiff about what color sheets to buy for their bed 对于买什么颜色的床单争吵
tiff.mean: n./v. 小争吵： a petty quarrel

integral.example:
adj. 构成整体所必需的: an integral part of the undergraduate curriculum 本科生课程的必修部分
adj. 完整的: the belief that athletics are essential to an integral life 坚信运动是完整的人生所不可或缺的一部分
integral.mean:
adj. 构成整体所必需的： essential to completeness
adj. 完整的： not lacking any part or member that properly belongs to it

nonsense.example: n. 无意义的话，废话: Many of the words in the poem are nonsense. 这首诗歌当中很多词都是废话。
nonsense.mean: n. 无意义的话，废话： words or language having no meaning or conveying no intelligible ideas

ensue.example: vi. 紧随其后: A brief but embarrassing silence ensued. 一阵短暂且令人尴尬的沉默随之而来。
ensue.mean: vi. 紧随其后： take place afterward or as a result

appropriate.example:
v. 私自挪用to take possession of or make use of exclusively for oneself, often without permission
: to appropriate private property 盗用私人财产
v. 私自挪用to take possession of or make use of exclusively for oneself, often without permission
: The economy has been weakened by corrupt officials who have appropriated the country's resources for their own use. 经济因为腐败的官员们私自挪用国家资源而被削弱了。
adj. 适当的: Red wine is a more appropriate choice with the meal. 红酒更适合这顿饭。
adj. 适当的: I don't think jeans and a T-shirt are appropriate attire for a wedding. 我觉得穿牛仔和T恤去婚礼不太得体。
appropriate.mean:
v. 私自挪用to take possession of or make use of exclusively for oneself, often without permission
adj. 适当的：especially suitable or compatible: fitting

conscientious.example:
adj. 仔细的，一丝不苟的: a conscientious researcher 一丝不苟的研究者
adj. 有良心的，正直的: a conscientious police officer 一名有良心的警察
conscientious.mean:
adj. 仔细的，一丝不苟的： taking, showing, or involving great care and effort
adj. 有良心的，正直的： governed by or conforming to the dictates of conscience

verisimilar.example: adj. 似乎真实的: a verisimilar tale 一个似乎为真的传奇
verisimilar.mean: adj. 似乎真实的： appearing to be true or real

convulsion.example:
n. 痉挛（强烈的、无法控制的肌肉收缩）: Convulsions are usually accompanied by loss of consciousness. 痉挛常常伴随着失去意识
n. 骚乱: a regime in convulsion 动荡中的政权
convulsion.mean:
n. 痉挛（强烈的、无法控制的肌肉收缩）： an abnormal violent and involuntary contraction of the muscles
n. 骚乱： a violent disturbance

resilience.example: n. 恢复能力: Her mental resilience helped her promptly walk out of the shadow of her father’s death. 她的精神恢复能力让她迅速地走出了父亲去世的阴影当中。
resilience.mean:
n. 弹力： the property of a material that enables it to resume its original shape or position after being bent, stretched, or compressed
n. 恢复能力： the ability to recover quickly from illness, change, or misfortune

martinet.example: n. 纪律严明之人: He's a retired lieutenant and a bit of a martinet. 他是一个退役的中尉，并且是一个有点纪律严明的人
martinet.mean: n. 纪律严明之人： a strict disciplinarian

stench.example: n. 臭气，恶臭: We finally discovered the dead rat that was causing the stench in the living room. 我们终于发现是死老鼠带来了卧室里的恶臭。
stench.mean: n. 臭气，恶臭： a strong, foul odor

procrastinate.example: vi. （因为懒散）拖延: She procrastinated and missed the submission deadline. 她一直拖拖拉拉，导致错过了截止日期。
procrastinate.mean: vi. （因为懒散）拖延： to put off doing something, especially out of habitual carelessness or laziness

featureless.example: adj. 缺乏特征的: the featureless landscape of the steppe 大草原上缺乏特色的地貌
featureless.mean: adj. 缺乏特征的： lacking distinguishing characteristics or features

fluctuate.example: vi. 波动，无规则地变动: Stock prices fluctuate wildly.股票价格大幅波动‖Samples of ice cores collected from Antarctica suggested that the atmospheric concentration of carbon dioxide has been fluctuating periodically. 南极冰芯样本表明，大气中的二氧化碳浓度存在周期性的涨落
fluctuate.mean: vi. 波动，无规则地变动： to shift back and forth uncertainly

pallid.example:
adj. 无生气的，缺乏活力的: The movie is a pallid version of the classic novel. 这部经典小说改编的电影很苍白无力。
adj. 苍白无血色的: a pallid girl who looked as though she'd never seen the sun 一个面色苍白的姑娘，仿佛从来没有晒过太阳
pallid.mean:
adj. 无生气的，缺乏活力的： lacking in radiance or vitality; dull
adj. 苍白无血色的： having an abnormally pale or wan complexion

swill.example: vt. 痛饮，大口地吃: Considering the way she swills carbonated drinks, she ought to own stock in Pepsi company. 鉴于她对碳酸饮料消费的贡献，百事公司应该给她分点股份。
swill.mean: vt. 痛饮，大口地吃： to drink greedily, to eat greedily or to excess

fast.example:
n. 绝食；斋戒: fast to death 绝食而死
adj. 快速的: The fast pace of construction resulted in our new house being done ahead of schedule. 极快的施工使得我们的新房提前竣工
adj. 忠诚的: The two girls soon became fast and inseparable friends. 这两个女孩子很快成为了忠于彼此的形影不离的好伙伴
adj. 稳固的，难以拆卸的: The rusty, old screws are so fast in the fitting that there's no hope of getting them out. 这颗生锈的老铁钉已经钉得太死了，根本不可能将其取出
fast.mean:
n. 绝食；斋戒： an act of abstaining from food
adj. 快速的： characterized by quick motion, operation, or effect
adj. 忠诚的： firm in one's allegiance to someone or something
adj. 稳固的，难以拆卸的： firmly positioned in place and difficult to dislodge

syllabus.example: n. 提纲，摘要: Have you got next year’s syllabus? 你拿到明年的教学大纲了吗？
syllabus.mean: n. 提纲，摘要：课文、演讲或研究课题的要点的概要或提纲： an outline or a summary of the main points of a text, lecture, or course of study

shoal.example: adj. 浅的: shoal waters of the bay 海湾附近的浅水区
shoal.mean: adj. 浅的： having little depth ; shallow.

lithe.example:
adj. 敏捷的，轻盈的: lithe dancers 灵活优雅的舞者
adj. 柔软的: lithe branches 柔软的枝条
lithe.mean:
adj. 敏捷的，轻盈的： characterized by easy flexibility and grace
adj. 柔软的： easily bent or flexed

douse.example:
vt. 熄灭: douse a fire with water 用水熄灭火焰
n. 弄湿: The heavy rains thoroughly doused the tourists. 大雨把游客淋得透湿
douse.mean:
vt. 熄灭： to put out (a light or fire)
n. 弄湿：to make wet

droll.example: adj. 古怪有趣的，离奇可笑的: a droll man with a strong dialect 带着浓郁口音的有意思的人
droll.mean: adj. 古怪有趣的，离奇可笑的： amusingly odd or whimsically comical

etch.example:
v. 蚀刻: the artist etched his landscape on a copper plate 艺术家将风景画刻在铜盘上
v. 留下深刻印象，铭记: in just a few pages the writer etched an unforgettable portrait of one of the more remarkable First Ladies 仅用数页，作者刻画出了一位杰出的第一夫人令人难忘的形象
etch.mean:
v. 蚀刻： to produce (as a pattern or design) on a hard material by eating into the material's surface (as by acid or laser beam)
v. 留下深刻印象，铭记： to produce a vivid impression of

rhetorical.example:
adj. 语言上的，文字上的: The next war that those two nations fight won't be rhetorical - it will be with bombs and bullets. 两国之间的下一场战争可不会是斗嘴皮了——他们会来真格的。
adj. 言辞华丽（却往往无内涵的）: You can skip over the rhetorical passages and still get the gist of the essay. 你可以跳过那些词藻华丽的段落，直接获取文本的主旨。‖The new governor delivered a long rhetorical speech about our state's bright future but laid out no specific programs for ensuring it. 新的执政官发表了词藻华丽的演说，畅谈国家的美好未来，但却没有提出实现这一目标的具体措施。
rhetorical.mean:
adj. 语言上的，文字上的： of or relating to words or language
adj. 言辞华丽（却往往无内涵的）： full of fine words and fancy expressionsbut mostly meaningless words and phrases

errant.example:
adj. 居无定所的: the errant gunslinger as a standard character in western novels 在西部题材小说中，叛逆的持枪歹徒是经典形象
adj. 误入歧途的，犯错误的: errant youngsters 误入歧途的青少年
errant.mean:
adj. 居无定所的： traveling from place to place
adj. 误入歧途的，犯错误的： straying from the proper course or standards

blueprint.example:
n. 蓝图，详细计划: a blueprint for the new library 新图书馆的建造蓝图
v. 事先计划: blueprinted the schedule of events for the festival right down to the last detail 把节日的活动的每一个细节都事先安排好了
blueprint.mean:
n. 蓝图，详细计划： a photographic print used especially for architects’ plans
v. 事先计划： to work out the details of (something) in advance

mundane.example:
adj. 尘世的，世俗化的: As for opera, I prefer mundane to religious themes. 与宗教主题相比，我更喜欢世俗主题的歌剧
adj. 平凡的: mundane concerns of day-to-day life 关于日常生活的一般顾虑
mundane.mean:
adj. 尘世的，世俗化的： of, relating to, or typical of this world
adj. 平凡的： relating to, characteristic of, or concerned with commonplaces

plunge.example:
vi. 突然下降: stock’s value plunged 股票价值骤然下降
vt. 插入，刺入: plunged the dagger into his chest 把匕首刺入他的胸膛
plunge.mean:
vi. 突然下降： to descend or dip suddenly
vt. 插入，刺入： to cause to penetrate or enter quickly and forcibly into something

impudent.example: adj. 放肆大胆的，无礼的: Some children were well behaved, while others were impudent. 一些孩子表现得很得体，另一些则很无礼
impudent.mean: adj. 放肆大胆的，无礼的： marked by contemptuous or cocky boldness or disregard of others

frothy.example:
adj. 用轻薄材料制作的: a frothy laptop made of carbon fiber and alloys 碳纤维以及合金制造的轻薄型笔记本电脑
adj. （内容等）欢乐轻佻、不严肃的: a frothy movie 一部有喜感的电影
frothy.mean:
adj. 用轻薄材料制作的：made of light thin material
adj. （内容等）欢乐轻佻、不严肃的： gaily frivolous or light in content or treatment

bore.example:
n. 令人厌烦的人或事物: For once, the graduation speaker wasn't a real bore. 就这一次毕业演讲者不是那么令人厌倦。
vt. 使厌倦，使厌烦: The professor's lifeless and unimaginative teaching style bored the students to death. 教授毫无生气和想象力的说教方式让学生厌倦至极。
bore.mean:
n. 令人厌烦的人或事物： one that causes boredom
vt. 使厌倦，使厌烦： to make weary by being dull, repetitive, or tedious

audacious.example:
adj. 大胆的，（但往往）愚勇的: an audacious plan 一个冒进的计划
adj. 乐于冒险的: audacious adventurers risking everything they had for a shot at glory 为了荣誉而孤注一掷的冒险家们
adj. 大胆创新的: an audacious interpretation of two dramas 对两部戏剧的创造性阐述
audacious.mean:
adj. 大胆的，（但往往）愚勇的： fearlessly, often recklessly daring; bold
adj. 蔑视（法律、礼节）的，无礼的： contemptuous of law, religion, or decorum
adj. 乐于冒险的： inclined or willing to take risks
adj. 大胆创新的： marked by originality and verve

archaic.example: adj. 过时的，久远的: archaic laws 过时的法律
archaic.mean: adj. 过时的，久远的：no longer current or applicable; antiquated

quiescent.example: adj. 平静的，静止的: a group of quiescent loungers 一群平静懒散的流浪汉
quiescent.mean: adj. 平静的，静止的： being quiet, still, or at rest; inactive

usurp.example: vt. 篡夺，篡位: usurp the throne 篡夺王位
usurp.mean: vt. 篡夺，篡位： to seize and hold (the power or rights of another, for example) by force and without legal authority

subsidiary.example:
adj. 次要的: The river has several subsidiary streams. 这条河拥有数条支流。
adj. 起辅助作用的: Attached are subsidiary materials. 附件当中的是辅助资料。
subsidiary.mean:
adj. 次要的： of secondary importance
adj. 起辅助作用的： furnishing aid or support

reel.example:
vi. 感到眩晕: My head reeled with the facts and figures. 我的头脑被这些事实和数据给弄晕了。‖His mind reeled upon hearing the news that his employer had been indicted for fraud. 当他听到雇主因为欺诈而被起诉时，他顿觉天旋地转。
vi. 蹒跚地走路: The drunkard reeled down the alley. 醉汉蹒跚地沿着小巷走去
reel.mean:
vi. 感到眩晕： to be in a confused state as if from being twirled around
vi. 蹒跚地走路： to move forward while swaying from side to side

considerable.example:
adj. （数量上）可观（而值得注意）的: a considerable amount of fortune 一笔可观的财富
adj. 值得考虑的，重要的: a considerable artist 一位举足轻重的艺术家
considerable.mean:
adj. （数量上）可观（而值得注意）的： sufficiently large in size, amount, or number to merit attention
adj. 值得考虑的，重要的：worth consideration; significant

discomfit.example:
v. 使尴尬: He was discomfited by the awkward situation of having his ex-girlfriend meet his current one. 他的前女友看到他现任女友的情况让他很尴尬。
v. 阻碍: Constant interruptions discomfited her in her attempt to finish the speech. 经常的打断她讲话使她无法完成演讲。
discomfit.mean:
v. 使尴尬： to put into a state of perplexity and embarrassment
v. 阻碍： to prevent from achieving a goal

patriot.example: n. 爱国者: The USA PATRIOT Act has generated a great deal of controversy since its enactment. 自实施之日起，美国的《爱国者法案》就产生了大量的争议‖a fanatical patriot 狂热的爱国者
patriot.mean: n. 爱国者： one who loves his or her country and supports its authority and interests

intuitive.example: adj. 直觉的: The twins have an intuitive awareness of each other's feelings. 这对双胞胎天生就能感知彼此的感受
intuitive.mean: adj. 直觉的： knowing or perceiving by intuition

malodorous.example: adj. 恶臭的: American musteline will eject amalodorous fluid when startled. 美洲鼬科动物受惊吓时会喷出有恶臭味的液体
malodorous.mean: adj. 恶臭的： having an unpleasant smell

limpid.example:
adj. 透明清澈的: limpid streams 清澈的小溪
adj. 镇定的，淡定的: the limpid outlook of a man who is at peace with himself as he awaits death 一个人在平静等待死亡的过程当中所体现出来的淡然的世界观
limpid.mean:
adj. 透明清澈的： characterized by transparent clearness
adj. 镇定的，淡定的： free from emotional or mental agitation

condign.example: adj. 应得的，恰当的: condign punishment 应得的惩罚 || A suspension without pay is condign punishment for breaking the company's code of business ethics 停职是违反公司商业道德准则应得的惩罚。
condign.mean: adj. 应得的，恰当的：deserved, appropriate

halfhearted.example: adj. 不感兴趣的，不热情的: a halfhearted attempt to clean the house before the arrival of the in-laws 在亲家到来前草草地收拾房间了事
halfhearted.mean: adj. 不感兴趣的，不热情的： lacking heart, spirit, or interest

aversion.example:
n. 非常讨厌，极厌恶: a natural aversion toward insects 天生对昆虫的反感
n. 令人厌恶的事物: Clichés should be the aversion of every good writer. 陈词滥调应该是让每个优秀的作家都感到厌恶的
aversion.mean:
n. 非常讨厌，极厌恶：a dislike so strong as to cause stomach upset or queasiness
n. 令人厌恶的事物：something or someone that is hated

groove.example: v. 享受，极其满意，过得快活: thrill-seekers who groove on skiing will love snowboarding 那些乐在滑雪中的追求刺激的人们也会喜欢滑雪板的 || just sitting around, grooving on the music 随便坐坐，在音乐中享受一下
groove.mean: v. 享受，极其满意，过得快活： to take pleasure in

skittish.example:
adj. 容易受到惊吓的，胆小的: The kitty is skittish around people she doesn't know. 小猫看到不认识的人就会显得特别胆小害怕。
adj. 容易激动的: The skittish colt leapt up when we approached. 一看到我们靠近，小马驹就激动地猛跳起来。
adj. 善变的，多变的: The skittish housing market had both buyers and sellers on edge. 变幻莫测的房市让买家和卖家都坐立不安。
skittish.mean:
adj. 容易受到惊吓的，胆小的： easily frightened
adj. 容易激动的： easily excited by nature
adj. 善变的，多变的： likely to change frequently, suddenly, or unexpectedly

repulse.example: vt. （使）厌恶，排斥: The scenes of violence in the film may repulse some viewers. 电影中某些暴力场景可能会使观众反感。
repulse.mean: vt. （使）厌恶，排斥： to rebuff or reject with rudeness, coldness, or denial

genial.example:
adj. 和蔼亲切的: a genial host who makes a point of speaking personally to each and every guest 一个强调与每个客人私下交流的亲切的主人
adj. 温暖的: genial sunshine in winter 冬日的暖阳
genial.mean:
adj. 和蔼亲切的： having an easygoing and pleasing manner especially in social situations
adj. 友好的，热心的： having or showing kindly feeling and sincere interest
adj. 温暖的： marked by temperatures that are neither too high nor too low

inch.example:
n. 少量，很短的距离: give them aninch, and they'll take a mile 得寸进尺‖Inch by inch, we're making progress toward our fund-raising goal. 我们在慢慢地接近筹款的目标
v. 慢慢移动: The car inched carefully across the snow-covered bridge. 汽车慢慢地通过被大雪覆盖的桥梁
inch.mean:
n. 少量，很短的距离： a very small distance or degree
v. 慢慢移动： to move or cause to move slowly or by small degrees

slake.example: vt. 使满足: Mountain climbing has largely slaked my desire for adventure. 登山很大程度上满足了我对探险的渴望。
slake.mean: vt. 使满足： to satisfy (a craving); quench

reconcile.example: vt. 使和解，协调: Historians have never been able to reconcile the two eyewitness accounts of the battle. 历史学家们一直以来都无法协调这场战役两种记载之间的矛盾。
reconcile.mean: vt. 使和解，协调： to restore to friendship or harmony

expedition.example: n. 动作迅速: deal with the order with the greatest possible expedition 以可能的最快的速度处理订单
expedition.mean: n. 动作迅速： speed in performance; promptness

convex.example: adj. 凸起的: A convex function has the property that a line joining any two points on its graph lies on or above the graph. 凸函数具有如下的性质：其图像上任何两点连线的任何部分都不低于连结两点的函数曲线
convex.mean: adj. 凸起的： having a surface or boundary that curves or bulges outward, as the exterior of a sphere

haunt.example:
vt. 常去拜访: haunt the movie theater 常去影院
vt. 不断地想起，萦绕心头: a riddle that haunted me all morning 整个早上萦绕在我心头的谜
haunt.mean:
vt. 常去拜访： to visit often; frequent
vt. 不断地想起，萦绕心头： to come to mind continually; obsess

prescience.example: n. 预知，先见: Most believers would probably agree that complete prescience is one of God's attributes. 所有的信徒大概都会同意上帝能够预见未来
prescience.mean: n. 预知，先见： knowledge of actions or events before they occur

apropos.example:
adj.相关的: The actor announced to reporters that he would only answer to apropos questions about the movie. 演员向记者表示，他只回答那些和电影有关的问题。
prep. 关于，有关: to make a number of telling observations apropos the current political situation 做了很多关于当前政治形势有力的观察
apropos.mean:
adj.相关的：being both relevant and opportune
prep. 关于，有关：having to do with

obtuse.example: adj. 愚钝的: Are you being deliberately obtuse? 你是故意装笨吗?
obtuse.mean: adj. 愚钝的： not having or showing an ability to absorb ideas readily

prevail.example: vi. 盛行，战胜: a custom that still prevails 依然盛行的传统
prevail.mean: vi. 盛行，战胜： to be greater in strength or influence

surmise.example:
n. （根据不足的）推测，揣测: My surmise is that the couple’s “good news” is the announcement that they are going to have a baby. 我猜那对夫妻说的“好消息”就是他们要有小孩了。
vt. 推测: From his tone I surmised that he was unhappy. 从他的语气中我猜测他并不高兴。
surmise.mean:
n. （根据不足的）推测，揣测： a thought or idea based on scanty evidence
vt. 推测： to form a notion of from scanty evidence

truce.example: n. 休战，休战协定: truce agreement 休战协议
truce.mean: n. 休战，休战协定： a suspension of fighting especially of considerable duration by agreement of opposing forces

intrepid.example: adj. 无畏的: an intrepid explorer 无畏的探险家
intrepid.mean: adj. 无畏的： characterized by resolute fearlessness, fortitude, and endurance

paradox.example: n. 表面矛盾实际可能正确的话，悖论: The paradox is that fishermen would catch more fish if they fished less. 存在的一个悖论就是：如果渔民减少捕鱼量的话，他们将会捕到更多的鱼
paradox.mean: n. 表面矛盾实际可能正确的话，悖论： a statement that is seemingly contradictory or opposed to common sense and yet is perhaps true

riot.example: n. 喧闹，暴乱: Special police units equipped with riot shields quickly arrived at the airport. 装备有防暴盾牌的特警们迅速抵达了飞机场。
riot.mean: n. 喧闹，暴乱： public violence, tumult, or disorder

adjudicate.example: vt. 裁决，判定: When my wife and I asked the salesclerk to adjudicate our disagreement, she agreed with me that the white shoes looked better. 我和我妻子要求售货员来裁决我们之间的争论，最后她还是同意了我的观点，认为白色的鞋子看起来更漂亮。
adjudicate.mean: vt. 裁决，判定： to hear and settlea case, dispute or conflict

tentative.example: adj. 暂时性的，尝试的: Our plans are only tentative at this point and will depend on whether you can come. 我们的计划只是暂时性的，具体还要看你能否前来。
tentative.mean: adj. 暂时性的，尝试的： not fully worked out or developed

malicious.example: adj. 恶意的: spread malicious gossips 散播恶意的流言蜚语
malicious.mean: adj. 恶意的： given to, marked by, or arising from malice; deliberately harmful

cohesive.example: adj. 有粘性的，有凝聚力的: a cohesive social unit 有凝聚力的社会个体‖cohesive soils 有粘性的土壤
cohesive.mean: adj. 有粘性的，有凝聚力的： exhibiting or producing cohesion or coherence

forebode.example: vi. 预示，预兆: That police car parked outside the house doesn’t forebode well. 门外停着的那辆警车可不是什么好兆头。
forebode.mean: vi. 预示，预兆： to show signs of a favorable or successful outcome

excrete.example: vt. 排泄: excrete sweat 排汗
excrete.mean: vt. 排泄： to separate and discharge (waste matter) from the blood, tissues, or organs

disenchant.example: vt. 使清醒: If you thought that you could pass this course without doing any work, let me be the first to disenchant you. 如果你觉得你不做任何功课也能及格，那就让我做第一个让你清醒的人。
disenchant.mean: vt. 使清醒： to free from illusion

forge.example:
v. 伪造: The boy forged his father’s signature on his transcript. 小男孩在他的成绩单上伪造了父亲的签名
v. 锻造，铸就: a real man forged by adversity 一个经磨难考验而成的纯爷们‖They agreed to forge closer economic and political ties. 他们就打造双边的紧密政治经济联系达成了共识
forge.mean:
v. 伪造： to make or imitate falsely especially with intent to defraud
v. 锻造，铸就： to form (as metal) by or as if by heating and hammering

confine.example:
vt. 禁闭，监禁: The thief was confined in a prison. 小偷被关在监狱里。
v. 限制: Please confine yourself to the subject 请不要离题。
confine.mean:
vt. 禁闭，监禁：to shut or keep in, especially to imprison
v. 限制：to keep within limits

quaff.example: vt. 大口地喝: He stopped at a bar and quaffed a few beers. 他在酒吧停下来，痛饮了几杯啤酒。
quaff.mean: vt. 大口地喝： to drink (a beverage) heartily

lacerate.example: vt. 使非常痛苦: He was born into a family already lacerated with tensions and divisions. 他出生在一个已经被冲突和分裂折磨不堪的家庭当中
lacerate.mean: vt. 使非常痛苦： to cause deep emotional pain to; distress

accidental.example:
adj. 意外发生的，偶然的: The discovery of gold was entirely accidental. 黄金的发现纯属偶然。
adj. 附带的，不重要的: Its commercial value was accidental. 它的商业价值微乎其微。
accidental.mean:
adj. 意外发生的，偶然的： occurring unexpectedly or by chance
adj. 附带的，不重要的： not being a vital part of or belonging to something

vehement.example: adj. （情感）强烈的，热情的: a vehement defender of the rights of minorities 一个立场强烈的少数民族维权者
vehement.mean: adj. （情感）强烈的，热情的： having or expressing great depth of feeling

vociferous.example: adj. 喧哗的，大叫大嚷的: Vociferous opponents of the bill protested angrily outside the Congress. 议案的反对者在国会外愤怒地举行了声势浩大的抗议活动
vociferous.mean: adj. 喧哗的，大叫大嚷的： making, given to, or marked by noisy and vehement outcry

lucid.example:
adj. 有光亮的: Those lucid bands that spread across the arctic sky are known as aurora borealis, or the northern lights. 那些蔓延在北极的天空中光带就是北极光
adj. 神志清醒的: decided to make out her will while she was still lucid 决定趁着她神志还清醒，列出她的遗愿
adj. 表达清晰的, 简单易懂的: The teaching assistant tried to make his instructions as lucid as possible so that everyone would understand what to do. 助教努力使自己的指令容易理解，从而让所有人都知道应该要干什么
lucid.mean:
adj. 有光亮的： suffused with light
adj. 神志清醒的： having full use of one's mind and control over one's actions
adj. 表达清晰的, 简单易懂的： easily understood

prosecution.example: n. 实行，执行: oversaw the prosecution of the president's foreign policy 监督总统对外政策的执行情况
prosecution.mean: n. 实行，执行： the doing of an action

bravado.example:
n. 假装勇敢: I remembered his youthful bravado. 我还记得他的年少鲁莽。
n. 虚张声势: strove to prevent our courage from turning into bravado 努力阻止我们的勇气蜕变成虚张声势
bravado.mean:
n. 假装勇敢： a pretense of bravery
n. 虚张声势： blustering swaggering conduct

luxurious.example:
adj. 豪华的: The luxurious apartment was filled with the latest electronic gadgets and fine works of art. 豪华的公寓里充斥着最新式的电子产品和精美的艺术作品
adj. 奢侈的: squandered his family fortune in the relentless satisfaction of his luxurious tastes 为满足他奢侈的品味而挥霍家族的财产
luxurious.mean:
adj. 豪华的： showing obvious signs of wealth and comfort
adj. 奢侈的： given to or marked by excessive gratification of one's desires

inflame.example:
v. 点燃: A carelessly tossed cigarette inflamed the papers in the trash can. 一只被随意丢弃的香烟点燃了垃圾桶中的纸
v. 使加剧: Retaliation served only to inflame the feud. 冤冤相报何时了
inflame.mean:
v. 点燃： to set on fire
v. 使加剧：to make more violent

drab.example: adj. 单调的，无聊的: The new city hall turned out to be another drab pile of masonry for the town. 新的市政大厅结果又是城镇里一座单调无趣的砖瓦堆积物。
drab.mean: adj. 单调的，无聊的： characterized by dullness and monotony

macerate.example: vt. 浸泡（以软化）: macerate the sample in ethanol 用乙醇浸软试样
macerate.mean: vt. 浸泡（以软化）： to make soft by soaking or steeping in a liquid

profundity.example: n. 深奥，深刻: His books are a mixture of playfulness and profundity. 他的作品都是搞笑和深刻的结合体。
profundity.mean: n. 深奥，深刻： something profound or abstruse

effrontery.example: n. 厚颜无耻，放肆大胆: had the effrontery to insult her father 胆敢辱骂她的父亲
effrontery.mean: n. 厚颜无耻，放肆大胆： flagrant disregard of courtesy or propriety and an arrogant assumption of privilege

demagogue.example: n. 蛊惑民心的政客: that politician is just a demagogue who preys upon people's fears and prejudices 那就是一个蛊惑民心的政客，利用民众的害怕和偏见来欺骗
demagogue.mean: n. 蛊惑民心的政客： a leader who makes use of popular prejudices and false claims and promises in order to gain power

lank.example:
adj. 细长瘦弱的: a woman with long, lank hair 有着长而稀疏头发的女子
adj. 不僵硬的，柔软松弛的: Right after a shower, her lank hair hung down to her shoulders. 刚出浴的她柔软的头发搭在她的肩上
lank.mean:
adj. 细长瘦弱的： long, straight, and limp; not stiff in structure
adj. 不僵硬的，柔软松弛的： not stiff in structure

indecorous.example: adj. 不合乎礼节的，不得体的: How can you make such an indecorous joke for a solemn moment in the marriage ceremony ? 你怎么能在庄严肃穆的结婚典礼上开那样一个不得体的玩笑呢？
indecorous.mean: adj. 不合乎礼节的，不得体的： conflicting with accepted standards of good conduct or good taste

crease.example: n. 折痕: flatten the creases of the map 抚平地图上的折痕
crease.mean: n. 折痕： a line made by pressing, folding, or wrinkling

dispassionate.example: adj. 客观公正的，不易被情绪或偏见影响的: Journalists should aim to be dispassionate observers. 记者们应该朝着成为一个公正的观察者努力。
dispassionate.mean: adj. 客观公正的，不易被情绪或偏见影响的：devoid of or unaffected by passion, emotion, or bias

summit.example: n. 顶点: the summit of his ambition 他雄心壮志的顶点
summit.mean: n. 顶点： the highest point

wary.example: adj. 小心的，机警的，谨慎的: kept a wary eye out for signs of the enemy 对敌人出现的征兆保持警惕
wary.mean: adj. 小心的，机警的，谨慎的： marked by keen caution, cunning, and watchfulness

distain.example: v. 弄脏: hands distained with blood 被血弄脏的手
distain.mean:
v. 贬损，伤害名誉： loss of honor, respect, or reputation
v. 弄脏： to make dirty

marvel.mean:
n. 令人惊奇的事物： one that evokes surprise, admiration, or wonder
v.（因为壮观、美丽等而）表示惊讶： to feel amazement or bewilderment at or about

imprecise.example: adj. 不精确的: incomplete and imprecise satellite data 既不完整又不精确的卫星数据
imprecise.mean: adj. 不精确的： not precise

dogged.example:
adj. 坚持的，坚决的: gain respect through sheer dogged determination 凭借单纯的坚决赢得了尊重 || A madman who spent his life in dogged pursuit of power 一个一生都坚持追求权力的疯子
adj. 固执的，任性的: Your dogged adherence to a really lame argument is embarrassing. 你固执的坚持一个站不住脚的观点令人很尴尬。
dogged.mean:
adj. 坚持的，坚决的： continuing despite difficulties, opposition, or discouragement；showing no signs of slackening or yielding in one's purpose
adj. 固执的，任性的： sticking to an opinion, purpose, or course of action in spite of reason, arguments, or persuasion

coda.example: n. 终曲: A song includes prelude, loud song and coda. 一首歌包括前奏，高潮和尾声。
coda.mean: n. 终曲：the concluding passage of a movement or composition

rapscallion.example: n. 流氓，恶棍: an unsafe place frequented by drunkards and rapscallions 一个酒鬼和流氓经常造访的不安全的地方
rapscallion.mean: n. 流氓，恶棍：a mean, evil, or unprincipled person

wrangle.example:
n. 纷争，争端: There was a bit of a wrangle over how much money to give the high school for its sports programs. 这个高中应该获得多少体育项目的拨款引起了一阵纷争。
vi. 争吵: Local residents wrangled for hours about property taxes. 当地居民就房产税的问题争吵不休。
wrangle.mean:
n. 纷争，争端： an often noisy or angry expression of differing opinions
vi. 争吵： to quarrel noisily or angrily
