windy.example: adj. 冗长的: a windy saleswoman who told us a lot more than we wanted to know about vacuum cleaners 一个啰嗦的女销售员，一个劲地说着我们不想知道的关于吸尘器的细节
windy.mean: adj. 冗长的： characterized by wearisome verbosity

fecund.example: adj. 多产的，肥沃的: fecund black soil 肥沃的黑土地
fecund.mean: adj. 多产的，肥沃的： fruitful in offspring or vegetation

emboss.example: vt. 以浮雕效果妆点，装饰: embossed with a design of Shanghai skyline 刻有上海城市轮廓的浮雕图案
emboss.mean: vt. 以浮雕效果妆点，装饰： to raise the surface of into bosses; especially to ornament with raised work

compose.example:
v. 使镇定: She took a deep breath and composed herself. 她做了一个深呼吸，控制住了自己的情绪。
v. 组成，构成: composed of many ingredients 有很多配料组成
compose.mean:
v. 使镇定：to free from agitation: calm
v. 组成，构成：to form the substance of : constitute

acerbic.example: adj. 酸涩的心情、心境或者语调: acerbic commentary 尖酸的评论
acerbic.mean: adj. 酸涩的心情、心境或者语调： marked by the use of wit that is intended to cause hurt feelings

uphold.example: vt. 支持，赞成: determined to uphold her views in the face of all challenges 下定决心支持她的观点，尽管全世界都反对她
uphold.mean: vt. 支持，赞成： to give support to

behoove.example: vt. 对…有利的: It behooves you at least to try. 你至少也应该尝试一下。
behoove.mean: vt. 对…有利的： to be necessary, proper or advantageous for

vacuous.example: adj. 茫然的，愚蠢的: a movie that was derided for its vacuous dialogue 一部因为对白十分愚蠢而被嘲讽的电影
vacuous.mean: adj. 茫然的，愚蠢的： marked by lack of ideas or intelligence

welter.example: n. 混乱；动乱: There was a welter of pushing and shoving. 到处是推搡和拥挤的混乱局面。‖The troop withdrawal would plunge the country into a welter of anarchy and endless civil war. 撤军会使得这个国家陷入无政府的动乱和无尽的内战中。
welter.mean: n. 混乱；动乱： a state of wild disorder

mosque.example: n. 清真寺: a deadly suicide attack at the mosque 在清真寺发生的致命自杀性袭击
mosque.mean: n. 清真寺： a building used for public worship by Muslim

arid.example:
adj. 干燥的: arid wastelands unfit for human habitation 不适合人类居住的干燥荒原
adj. 无趣的，无聊的: arid wastelands unfit for human habitation 不适合人类居住的干燥荒原
arid.mean:
adj. 干燥的： marked by little or no precipitation or humidity
adj. 无趣的，无聊的： causing weariness, restlessness, or lack of interest

arrogance.example: n．傲慢，自大: Her arrogance has earned her a lot of enemies. 她的傲慢给她带来了很多敌人。

obstinate.example:
adj. 固执的: obstinate resistance to change 坚决抵制改变
adj. 难于减轻或治愈的: obstinate fever 高烧不退 || an obstinate headache 难以治愈的头痛
obstinate.mean:
adj. 固执的： perversely adhering to an opinion, purpose, or course in spite of reason, arguments, or persuasion
adj. 难于减轻或治愈的： not easily subdued, remedied, or removed

weather.example: vt. 安全渡过（危机等），经受住: We haveve weathered worse crises, and so we'll survive this one. 更为严重的危机我们都闯过了，这个也不会有问题的。‖They weathered a terrible storm while at sea. 他们在海上平安渡过了一场巨大的风暴。
weather.mean: vt. 安全渡过（危机等），经受住： to come through (something) safely

breach.example:
n. 对伦理、法律准则的破坏: cheating on the exam was a serious breach of the military academy's honor code 考试作弊是对军校的荣誉准则的严重破坏
v. 违背: a builder being sued by a homeowner for breaching a contract 建筑商因违约被房主起诉
breach.mean:
n. 对伦理、法律准则的破坏： a breaking of a moral or legal code
v. 违背： to fail to keep

dandy.example:
n. 纨绔子弟，爱打扮的人: That was a dandy of a game. 那是纨绔子弟的游戏。
adj. 最佳最好的: that's a dandy new racing bike 真是辆最好的比赛用自行车
dandy.mean:
n. 纨绔子弟，爱打扮的人： a man who gives exaggerated attention to personal appearance
adj. 最佳最好的： of the very best kind

random.example:
adj. 随机的，随意的: We received several answers and picked one at random. 我们收到了若干答案，并随机抽取了一个。
adj. 随机的，随意的: aimless, arbitrary, desultory, erratic, haphazard, scattered, slapdash, stray
random.mean: adj. 随机的，随意的： lacking a definite plan, purpose, or pattern

moribund.example:
adj. 即将结束的，垂死的: The nation’s banking industry was moribund. 这个国家的银行业危在旦夕
adj. 即将过时的: Some social conventions have been rendered moribund in face of modernization. 不少传统习俗在现代化的影响下变得岌岌可危
moribund.mean:
adj. 即将结束的，垂死的： approaching death; about to die
adj. 即将过时的： on the verge of becoming obsolete

nonplus.example: vt.迷惑，困惑: I was nonplussed by his openly expressed admiration of me. 我被她公开表现的仰慕弄得很窘迫。
nonplus.mean: vt.迷惑，困惑： use to be at a loss as to what to say, think, or do: perplex

ticklish.example: adj. 易怒的: ticklish about his baldness 大家一提起他的秃头，他就暴怒adj. 棘手的，对技巧要求高的: Trying to tell him that his zipper is down without embarrassing him will be a ticklish task. 如何体面得体地提醒他拉链没关好是一个技巧活儿。
ticklish.mean:
adj. 易怒的： easily offended or upset; touchy
adj. 棘手的，对技巧要求高的： requiring exceptional skill or caution in performance or handling

disinter.example: v. （从墓地里）掘出 : The Egyptian mummy was carefully disinterred in hopes that it would yield secrets about the Old Kingdom. 那个埃及木乃伊被小心地挖掘出来，人们希望它可以告诉我们关于这个古老王国的一些秘密。
disinter.mean: v. （从墓地里）掘出 ：to take out of the grave or tomb

cellular.example: adj. 多孔的: the cellular construction of a beehive 蜂巢的多孔结构
cellular.mean: adj. 多孔的： containing cavities; having a porous texture

resonant.example: adj. （声音）洪亮的，共鸣的: A deep resonant voice rang out. 传来了洪亮的声音。
resonant.mean: adj. （声音）洪亮的，共鸣的： strong and deep in tone

subservient.mean: adj. 奉承的，屈从的： obsequiously submissive

spoof.example:
n. 轻松幽默的模仿，小恶搞: Many viewers thought that the spoof of a television newscast was the real thing. 许多观众认为这则新闻报道被恶搞之后的作品才是真实的东西。
v. 诱骗，诱使相信: The public was spoofed by a supposedly plausible report of a UFO encounter.一个听起来真实的UFO遭遇报告欺骗了大众。
spoof.mean:
n. 轻松幽默的模仿，小恶搞： a work that imitates and exaggerates another work for comic effect
v. 诱骗，诱使相信： to cause to believe what is untrue

clement.example:
adj. 宽容的，善良的: Clement judge reduced the sentence. 仁慈的法官减轻了刑罚。
adj. 气候温和的: Hawaii is known for its delightfully clement climate. 夏威夷以它宜人的温和气候著称。
clement.mean:
adj. 宽容的，善良的：tolerant and kind in the judgment of and expectations for others
adj. 气候温和的：marked by temperatures that are neither too high nor too low

posture.example:
n. 姿势，姿态: A good upright posture will prevent backaches. 良好的站姿可以预防背痛。
vi. 故作姿态，装模作样: postured to impress 故作姿态以给别人留下印象
posture.mean:
n. 姿势，姿态： a general way of holding the body
vi. 故作姿态，装模作样： to assume an artificial or pretended attitude

timely.example:
adj. 及时的，无拖延的: When I order a pizza, I expect it to be delivered in a timely manner. 当我在外面点了披萨饼，我就希望它能按时送到。
adj. 恰到好处的，合乎适宜的: Timely invitation to lunch that came just as I was starting to feel hungry. 正当我开始感到饥饿的时候，就有人适时地邀请我吃午饭了。
timely.mean:
adj. 及时的，无拖延的： done, carried out, or given without delay
adj. 恰到好处的，合乎适宜的： appropriate or adapted to the times or the occasion

bedeck.example: vt. 装饰，点缀: flag bedecking the balcony 在阳台上用以装饰的旗子 || bedeck with jewels 用珠宝装饰
bedeck.mean: vt. 装饰，点缀： to make more attractive by adding something that is beautiful or becoming

homogenize.example: v. 使统一化: plans to homogenize the science curriculum in public high schools throughout the state 计划将全州的公立高中的课程安排统一化
homogenize.mean: v. 使统一化： to make agree with a single established standard or model

stodgy.example:
adj. 平庸的，乏味的: The sitcom was offbeat and interesting in its first season, but has since become predictable and stodgy. 这部情景喜剧在第一季是离奇而有趣的，但是近来变得老套和乏味。
adj. 非常守旧的: Without notice she received a letter from his stodgy father. 她毫无征兆地收到了一封来自她保守父亲的信。
stodgy.mean:
adj. 平庸的，乏味的： dull, unimaginative, and commonplace
adj. 非常守旧的： extremely old-fashioned

stiff.example:
adj. 僵硬的，无法弯曲的: a stiff cardboard packing box 不易弯折的硬纸板盒‖When I got out of bed this morning my back was stiff as a board. 今早起床时我的背和木板一样僵硬。
adj. （在社交场合）缺乏优雅的，不自在的: She always felt stiff and ill-at-ease whenever she was introduced to her father's friends. 只要她被介绍给父亲的朋友，她就会感到不自在和浑身不舒服。
adj. 过分的，过高的: Don't you think that's a pretty stiff fine for such a minor infraction? 你难道不觉得对于这么小的一个错误，罚款实在太高了么？
stiff.mean:
adj. 僵硬的，无法弯曲的： lacking in suppleness or flexibility
adj. （在社交场合）缺乏优雅的，不自在的： lacking social grace and assurance
adj. 过分的，过高的： going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount
adj. 艰苦的，费力的： requiring consid

harbor.example:
vt. 提供住处，隐匿: harbor a fugitive 隐匿逃亡者
v. 认为，牢记: he had long harbored a grudge against his old employer, who had fired him without cause 他对他的前老板一直耿耿于怀，无缘无故炒了他
harbor.mean:
vt. 提供住处，隐匿： to provide a place, home, or habitat for
v. 认为，牢记： to keep in one's mind or heart

mercurial.example: adj. （情绪）善变的: his mercurial temperament 他善变的脾气
mercurial.mean: adj. （情绪）善变的： characterized by rapid and unpredictable changeableness of mood

extenuate.example: vt. 减轻罪过: try to extenuate their vandalism with the old refrain of “Boys will be boys” 企图用“江山易改本性难移”的俗语为他们的暴行开脱
extenuate.mean: vt. 减轻罪过： to lessen or to try to lessen the seriousness or extent of by making partial excuses

anachronistic.example: adj. 时代错误的: Despite the occasional anachronistic word or concept, he has a good feel for the period. 尽管有时会犯一些词汇和概念上的时代性错误，但他对于那个时代的整体把握还是不错的。
anachronistic.mean: adj. 时代错误的： chronologically misplaced

hive.example: n. 忙碌之地: The house was a hive of activity as we prepared for the party. 我们筹备派对时，房子里很是熙熙攘攘。
hive.mean:
n. 忙碌之地： a place swarming with activity
v. 储备，积累： to store up; accumulate

racy.example: adj. 活泼生动的: vivid writing and a racy plot that keeps readers turning the pages 栩栩如生的手法和生动新鲜的情节让读者手不释卷
racy.mean: adj. 活泼生动的： vigorous; lively

gullible.example: adj. 易受骗的，易被利用的: They sell overpriced souvenirs to gullible tourists. 他们卖高价纪念品给易上当的旅客们。
gullible.mean: adj. 易受骗的，易被利用的： easily duped or cheated, readily taken advantage of

trite.example: adj. 陈腐的，陈词滥调的: “You win some, you lose some” is a trite expression. “有得必有失”是老生常谈了。
trite.mean: adj. 陈腐的，陈词滥调的： hackneyed or boring from much use, not fresh or original

insubordinate.example: adj. 不服从权威的: Insubordinate soldiers are court-martialed. 抗命的士兵被送上了军事法庭
insubordinate.mean: adj. 不服从权威的： not submissiveto authority

scuff.example:
vt. 磨损: a countertop that won't scuff 一块不易磨损的厨房台面
v. 脚步拖沓: The miners scuffed past in heavy boots. 矿工们脚着厚重的靴子，步履蹒跚。
scuff.mean:
vt. 磨损： to become scratched, chipped, or roughened by wear
v. 脚步拖沓： to move heavily or clumsily

raspy.example:
adj. 声音刺耳的: The dying man was speaking in a raspy and barely discernible voice. 将死的人在用一种沙哑刺耳且难以听清的语调说话。
adj. 容易生气的: Overwork tends to make him raspy. 过度的工作让他变得烦躁易怒。
raspy.mean:
adj. 声音刺耳的： harsh and dry in sound
adj. 容易生气的： easily irritated or annoyed

stratify.example: vt. 使分成各种等级: Income distribution often stratifies a society. 收入分配往往将社会分层
stratify.mean: vt. 使分成各种等级： to divide into classes, castes, or social strata

dilute.example:
v. 稀释: dilute a color 稀释色彩 || a dilute acid that's safe to handle in the classroom 稀释了的可以安全在教室处理的酸
vt. 削弱: The hiring of the new CEO diluted the power of the company's president. 新的CEO削弱了董事长的权力。
dilute.mean:
v. 稀释： to make thinner or less concentrated by adding a liquid such as water/ of relatively low strength or concentration
vt. 削弱： to diminish the strength, flavor, or brilliance of by admixture

crow.example:
vi. 感到高兴: Being the home of the new Super Bowl champs was the first thing that city residents had to crow about in a very long time. 当地的队伍获得超级碗冠军队伍是这个城市居民长期以来得以感到高兴的第一件事情。
vi. 自鸣得意: He is already crowing over his victory. 他已经在那里为自己的胜利而自鸣得意了。
crow.mean:
vi. 感到高兴： to feel or express joy or triumph
vi. 自鸣得意： to praise or express pride in one's own possessions, qualities, or accomplishments often to excess

sensation.example:
n. 感觉，知觉: We felt just the smallest sensation of warmth when we leaned against the radiator. 当我们靠着取暖器的时候，我们也仅仅感到了一点点的温度。
n. 轰动事件: the rookie hitting sensation of the American League 这个菜鸟的表现轰动了整个全美大联盟
sensation.mean:
n. 感觉，知觉： a perception associated with stimulation of a sense organ or with a specific body condition
n. 轰动事件： a state of intense public interest and excitement

mishap.example: n. 不幸之事: Mishap followed wherever he went. 不论他走到哪里，厄运总是形影相随
mishap.mean: n. 不幸之事： an unfortunate accident

crook.example: v. 使弯曲: crook your finger to pull the trigger 弯曲你的手指来扣动扳机
crook.mean: v. 使弯曲： to cause to turn away from a straight line

croon.example: v. 低声歌唱或说话: croon mellow tunes 低声唱柔和的调子
croon.mean: v. 低声歌唱或说话： to sing or speak in a gentle murmuring manner

exuberant.example:
adj. 非常高兴的，热情洋溢的: Exuberant crowds rushed to greet the returning national champions. 激动的人群争先恐后地向凯旋归来的全国冠军表示问候
adj. 大量的，充分的: an exuberant imagination 丰富的想象力
exuberant.mean:
adj. 非常高兴的，热情洋溢的： joyously unrestrained and enthusiastic
adj. 大量的，充分的： produced in extreme abundance

languor.example:
n. 懒惰: He enjoyed the languor brought on by a hot summer afternoon. 他很享受夏日午后的慵懒
n. 衰弱: The tropical heat sapped our strength, leaving us in a state of unaccustomed languor. 热带的炎热气候消磨着我们的力量，让我们感到一阵虚弱的不适
languor.mean:
n. 懒惰： physical or mental inertness
n. 衰弱： weakness or weariness of body or mind

inveterate.example: adj. 积习的: the inveterate tendency to overlook the obvious 总是忽视显而易见事物的习惯
inveterate.mean: adj. 积习的： firmly established by long persistence

pittance.example: n. 少量津贴: The internship offers only a pittance for a salary, but it is a great opportunity to gain experience. 实习所能挣到的报酬是很少的，但是它提供了获得经验的绝佳机会。
pittance.mean: n. 少量津贴：a small portion, amount, or allowance

aboveboard.example: adj. 无欺诈的，光明正大的: This transaction was totally aboveboard, so there was no reason to question it. 这项交易完全公开公正，没有必要质疑。
aboveboard.mean: adj. 无欺诈的，光明正大的： free from all traces of deceit or duplicity

ribald.example: adj. 举止、言语下流粗俗的: entertained the guests with ribald jokes 用荤段子来取悦客人
ribald.mean: adj. 举止、言语下流粗俗的： characterized by or indulging in vulgar, lewd humor

edifice.example:
n. 大厦；大建筑物: The Capitol is one of the most impressive edifices in the United States. 国会山是美国最令人印象深刻的建筑之一
n. 基础，基本构架: The edifice of the argument is quite simple, once you get past the fancy language. 只要你看透了表面花哨的语言，你会发现这段论证的基本构架是非常简单的
edifice.mean:
n. 大厦；大建筑物： a large or massive structure
n. 基础，基本构架： the arrangement of parts that gives something its basic form

exacerbate.example: vt. 使加剧, 使恶化: a heavy rainfall that exacerbated the flood problems 大雨恶化了洪水问题
exacerbate.mean: vt. 使加剧, 使恶化： to make more violent, bitter, or severe

volatile.example: adj. 多变的: a boss of volatile moods 一个性情多变的老板‖The stock market can be very volatile. 股市瞬息万变。
volatile.mean: adj. 多变的： characterized by or subject to rapid or unexpected change

oration.mean: n. （颇有野心、自高自大的）演说： a speech delivered in a high-flown or pompous manner

proffer.example: v./n. 献出，提供: proffered her assistance in helping the two sides reach a compromise 她在斡旋双方达成妥协过程中尽了力
proffer.mean: v./n. 献出，提供： to offer for acceptance; tender

infuse.example:
vt. 灌输，使…充满: New members infused enthusiasm into the club. 新队员为俱乐部注入了激情
vt. 鼓舞: a sense of purpose that infuses scientific researchers 给科学研究者打鸡血一般的使命感
infuse.mean:
vt. 灌输，使…充满： to fill or cause to be filled with something
vt. 鼓舞： inspire, animate

charade.example: n. 装模作样: His concern was a charade. 他的关心只是装模作样。
charade.mean:
n. 装模作样： a display of emotion or behavior that is insincere or intended to deceive
n. 动作字谜： a game in which words or phrases are represented in pantomime

nitpick.example: v. 吹毛求疵: a peevish critic always ready to quibble 一个总是吹毛求疵的古怪评论家
nitpick.mean: v. 吹毛求疵： to criticize by nit-picking

cosset.mean: v. 宠爱： to treat as a pet; pamper

misgiving.example: n. 担忧，疑虑: No one can dispel his misgiving. 没有人能打消他的疑虑
misgiving.mean: n. 担忧，疑虑： a feeling of doubt or suspicion especially concerning a future event

peripatetic.mean: adj. 巡游的，四处游历的： walking about or from place to place

puckish.example: adj. 淘气的，顽皮的: She had a puckish smile on her face. 她脸上挂着顽皮的笑容。
puckish.mean: adj. 淘气的，顽皮的： mischievous; impish

gloat.example: vi. 自鸣得意: gloat over his enemy's misfortune 为敌人的不幸而自鸣得意
gloat.mean: vi. 自鸣得意： a feeling of great, often malicious, pleasure or self-satisfaction

unremitting.example: adj. 连续不断的: Unremitting rain lasted for six days. 连续下了六天的雨。
unremitting.mean: adj. 连续不断的： going on and on without any interruptions

dissuade.example: vt. 劝阻,反对: dissuade sb. from (doing) sth 劝阻/反对某人做某事 || Her parents tried to dissuade her from her intention to drop out of college. 她的父母劝她不要退学。
dissuade.mean: vt. 劝阻,反对： to deter (a person) from a course of action or a purpose by persuasion or exhortation

abnegate.example:
v. 否认: abnegated the idea of freedom 放弃自由的观念
v. 投降，放弃，交出（权力等）: abnegated her powers 交出她拥有的权力
abnegate.mean:
v. 否认： deny, renounce
v. 投降，放弃，交出（权力等）：surrender, relinquish

adulterate.example: vt. 掺杂，加入低等成分: adulterate its products with cheap additives 在产品中掺杂廉价的添加剂
adulterate.mean: vt. 掺杂，加入低等成分： to corrupt, debase, or make impure by the addition of a foreign or inferior substance or element

voracious.example:
adj. 有很大食量的，贪吃的: He has a voracious appetite. 他的食量惊人。
adj. 贪婪的，如饥似渴的: a voracious reader who locked himself up in the study 一个把自己锁在书房的贪婪的读者
voracious.mean:
adj. 有很大食量的，贪吃的： having a huge appetite
adj. 贪婪的，如饥似渴的： having or marked by an insatiable appetite for an activity or pursuit

convert.example:
vt.使改变信仰: European missionaries converted thousands to Christianity. 欧洲传教士使成百上千的人改信了基督教
vt. 改变，转化: convert water into ice 将水转化成冰
convert.mean:
n. 被改变宗教信仰的人： one that is converted
vt.使改变信仰： to bring over from one belief, view, or party to another
vt. 改变，转化： to alter the physical or chemical nature or properties of especially in manufacturing

resurrect.example: vt. 使重生，使复苏: believed that his body would be resurrected 相信他的身体将会复活‖Attempts are being made by both parties to resurrect the stalled arms negotiations. 双方正在努力重启受阻的武装谈判。
resurrect.mean: vt. 使重生，使复苏： to bring back to life, practice, or activity

repel.example:
vt. 抵制: Self-discipline ensures that you can repel the things that induce you. 自律可以保证你抵制那些诱惑你的事物。‖I repelled the temptation to stay out late and call in sick the next day. 我抵住了晚上玩通宵然后第二天谎称生病的诱惑。
vt. 使厌恶: Evil odors always repel me. 臭味总是让我恶心。
repel.mean:
vt. 抵制： to fight against; resist
vt. 使厌恶： to cause aversion in: disgust

requite.example:
vt. 酬谢，报答: requited her love with hatred 恩将仇报
vt. 报仇: The future writer would later requite the abuse he suffered at the hands of his classmates by creating scathing portraits of them in his novels. 未来的作家会把在同学那受的委屈的帐算清的——他会在小说中把他们描绘成恶人。
requite.mean:
vt. 酬谢，报答： to make repayment or return for
vt. 报仇： to punish in kind the wrongdoer responsible for

implement.example:
n. 工具: gardening implements such as hoes, spades, and pruners 诸如锄头、铲子和修枝剪一类的园艺工具
v. 执行，实施: implement the new online application procedures 实行新的网申程序
implement.mean:
n. 工具： a device used in the performance of a task
v. 执行，实施： to put into practical effect; carry out

vaunt.example: vi. 吹嘘: vaunted his country’s military might 吹嘘他的国家的军事实力
vaunt.mean: vi. 吹嘘： to speak boastfully

vigorous.example:
adj. 精力旺盛的: He remains vigorous despite being over 80 years old. 尽管他已80高龄，但仍活力不减
adj. 强健的: vigorous and sturdy little sheep bred to live in mountainous regions 在山区喂养的健壮的小羊
vigorous.mean:
adj. 精力旺盛的： having active strength of body or mind
adj. 强健的： able to withstand hardship, strain, or exposure

rive.example: vt. 撕开: Lightning rived the tree. 闪电把树劈裂了
rive.mean: vt. 撕开： to wrench open or tear apart or to pieces

abominate.example: v. 憎恶: We abominate jokes that make fun of people who have physical disabilities. 我们鄙视对有生理缺陷的人开玩笑。
abominate.mean: v. 憎恶： to hate or loathe intensely, abhor

dissolute.example: adj. 放荡的，无节制的: lead a dissolute life 过着放荡无节制的生活
dissolute.mean: adj. 放荡的，无节制的： lacking moral restraint; indulging in sensual pleasures or vices.

miscreant.example: n. 恶棍，罪犯: robbed by a bunch of miscreants 遭到了一伙歹徒的抢劫
miscreant.mean: n. 恶棍，罪犯： one who behaves criminally or viciously

limp.example:
adj. 柔软的，松散的: Her hair hung limp about her shoulders. 她的头发软沓沓地垂在肩上
adj. 软弱的，没有精神的: The team's limp performance has many people calling for the head coach's resignation. 队伍不给力的表现让许多人呼吁教练下课
limp.mean:
adj. 柔软的，松散的： lacking firm texture, substance, or structure
adj. 软弱的，没有精神的： lacking strength or firmness; weak or spiritless
vi. 跛行，艰难地行走： to move or proceed haltingly or unsteadily

apprehensive.example:
adj. 知晓的，理解的: I am fully apprehensive of the options, I assure you. 我向你保证这些观点我都理解了。
adj. 恐惧的，害怕的: People apparently haven’t recovered from the devastating terrorist attack and are still terribly apprehensive about the future. 人们显然没有从那场严重的恐怖袭击中恢复过来，对于未来仍然充满了恐惧。
apprehensive.mean:
adj. 知晓的，理解的： having specified facts or feelings actively impressed on the mind
adj. 恐惧的，害怕的： anxious or fearful about the future

apt.example:
adj. 恰当的,合适的: apt remark/ choice/ description 恰当的评述、选择、描述
adj. 有…倾向的，可能的: He is apt to fly out in rage. 他容易发脾气。
adj. 聪明的keenly intelligent and responsive
: an apt pupil 一个聪明的小学生
adj. 聪明的keenly intelligent and responsive
: He is apt at mathematics. 他擅长数学。
apt.mean:
adj. 恰当的,合适的：exactly suitable; appropriate
adj. 有…倾向的，可能的：having a tendency : likely
adj. 聪明的keenly intelligent and responsive

hardy.example:
adj. 顽强的: chrysanthemums are hardy enough to survive a light frost 菊花能够经受霜打
adj. 愿意冒风险的: hardy souls who pioneered new paths into outer space 那些愿意冒险探索外太空的先驱们
hardy.mean:
adj. 顽强的： able to withstand hardship, strain, or exposure
adj. 愿意冒风险的： inclined or willing to take risks

wit.example:
n. 机智，智慧: lacked the wit to judge 缺乏判断的智慧
n. 智者，有智慧的人: a man who fancied himself as a great wit 一个把自己想象成智慧的化身的男子
wit.mean:
n. 机智，智慧： the natural ability to perceive and understand
n. 智者，有智慧的人： a person of exceptional intelligence

circumscribe.example:
vt. 限制: Teammates circumscribed his enthusiasm so as not to make the losing side feel worse. 队友们抑制了他的热情为了不让失败者更难过。
vt. 包围，围绕: fields circumscribed by tall trees 被高树包围的地方 || Circumscribe a circle around a square. 画正方形的外接圆。
circumscribe.mean:
vt. 限制：to limit narrowly; restrict
vt. 包围，围绕：to surround by or as if by a boundary

manipulate.example:
vt. 巧妙操作: manipulate a foreign language 熟练地掌握外语
vt. 暗中操控: He manipulated public opinion in his favor. 他巧妙地将大众观点导向了有利于他的一边
manipulate.mean:
vt. 巧妙操作： to move, arrange, operate, or control by the hands or by mechanical means, especially in a skillful manner
vt. 暗中操控： to influence or manage shrewdly or deviously

sacrilege.example: n. 亵渎圣物: To play Mozart's music on a kazoo is sacrilege. 用小木笛演奏莫扎特的音乐是对它的一种亵渎。
sacrilege.mean: n. 亵渎圣物： desecration, profanation, misuse, or theft of something sacred

dissonance.example: n．不和谐，刺耳: cognitive dissonance认识上的分歧 || Dissonance among the three partners doomed the project. 三个股东间的不调和注定了那计划的失败。
dissonance.mean: n．不和谐，刺耳： a harsh, disagreeable combination of sounds; discord

doodle.example:
vi. （无目的地）乱画: I often doodle when I'm on the phone. 打电话时我经常乱写乱画
vi. 漫无目的地打发时光: I plan to spend the entire vacation just doodling. 我打算整个假期就随便做点事打发时间
doodle.mean:
vi. （无目的地）乱画： to scribble aimlessly, especially when preoccupied
vi. 漫无目的地打发时光： to spend time in aimless activity

pusillanimous.example: adj. 懦弱的，胆小得令人鄙视的: pusillanimous politicians who vote according to whichever way the political wind is blowing 胆小懦弱的政客，舆论风向倒向谁就投票给谁
pusillanimous.mean: adj. 懦弱的，胆小得令人鄙视的： lacking courage and resolution : marked by contemptible timidity

pedagogical.example: adj. 教学的，教师的: I have no brow of such a pedagogical tone. 我一点也不喜欢这种说教的口吻。
pedagogical.mean: adj. 教学的，教师的： of, relating to, or befitting a teacher or education

figurative.example: adj. 比喻的: The word here is used in its figurative sense. 这个词在这里取它的比喻义
figurative.mean: adj. 比喻的： expressing one thing in terms normally denoting another with which it may be regarded as analogous

modicum.example: n. 少量: a modicum of food quota 极少量的食物配额
modicum.mean: n. 少量： a small portion; a limited quantity

duplicate.example:
n. 复制品: a duplicate of a house key 房间钥匙的复制品‖Your computer is almost a duplicate of mine. 你的电脑和我的几乎一模一样。
vt. 复制: A cell duplicates itself when it divides. 当一个细胞分裂时，它会完全按着自己的样子复制。‖Art students are trying to duplicate paintings in the museum’s collection as part of their training. 艺术生们努力地复刻博物馆中的作品，由此作为他们的训练。
vt. 重复，反复: We were unable to duplicate the experiment with the same result in our own lab, so we’re suspicious. 我们不能在自己的实验室中重复之前的实验并得到相同的结果，因此我们很怀疑。
duplicate.mean:
n. 复制品： either of two things exactly alike and usually produced at the same time or by the same process
vt. 复制： to make a copy of
vt. 重复，反复： to do over or again often needlessly

agreeable.example:
adj. 令人愉悦的: Would you mind putting on some agreeable music for dinner ? 你介意为晚饭放一些令人愉快的音乐吗？‖the agreeable melancholy resulting from a sense of the transitoriness of natural beauty 因为感慨自然之美稍纵即逝而产生的令人愉悦的忧伤
adj. 随和的: I have an agreeable art teacher who lets me do pretty much whatever I want. 我的艺术老师性格非常好，总是允许我去做我想做的事情。
adj. 相一致的: These new security measures
agreeable.mean:
adj. 令人愉悦的： pleasing to the mind or senses especially as according well with one's tastes or needs
adj. 随和的： having an easygoing and pleasing manner especially in social situations
adj. 相一致的： being in harmony

circuitous.example:
adj. 不直接的: We took a circuitous route to the airport so as to avoid the massive traffic jam. 我们走了一条迂回的路线去机场来躲避堵车。
adj. 冗长的: a circuitous explanation for what seems like a fairly basic concept 对一个非常基本的概念的冗长的解释
circuitous.mean:
adj. 不直接的：not being forthright or direct in language or action
adj. 冗长的：using or containing more words than necessary to express an idea

depreciate.example:
vt. 贬低价值: New cars start to depreciate as soon as they are on the road. 新车一上路便开始贬值。
vt. 轻视: dared to depreciate Shakespeare, saying his works have no relevance for modern audiences 胆敢贬低莎大人，说他的作品对于现代观众来说没有意义
depreciate.mean:
vt. 贬低价值： to lower the price or estimated value of
vt. 轻视：to lower in estimation or esteem

reconnoiter.example: vt. 侦察，勘查: The wide utilization of unmanned aerial vehicles makes it much less risky to reconnoiter a certain area. 无人飞行器的广泛运用大大减少了军事侦察的风险
reconnoiter.mean: vt. 侦察，勘查： to make a preliminary inspection of, especially in order to gather military information

levelheaded.example: adj. 明智的: a levelheaded assessment of the problem 对于问题的一个明智的评估
levelheaded.mean: adj. 明智的： characteristically self-composed and sensible

engender.example:
vt. 引起，使发展: Her latest book has engendered a lot of controversy. 她的新书引发了很多争议
vt. 产生，出现: Feelings of confidence and independence that were only just beginning to engender within her. 她的自信和独立的感觉才刚刚产生
engender.mean:
vt. 引起，使发展： to cause to exist or to develop
vt. 产生，出现： to come into existence

credulous.example: adj. 轻信的，易受骗的: accused of swindling credulous investors 被控欺骗轻信的投资者
credulous.mean: adj. 轻信的，易受骗的： disposed to believe too readily; gullible

understudy.example: n. 替补演员: be an understudy to sb 作为某人的替补
understudy.mean: n. 替补演员： one who is prepared to act another's part or take over another's duties

transient.example: adj. 短暂的，瞬时的: transient pleasure 短暂的快乐
transient.mean: adj. 短暂的，瞬时的： passing with time; transitory

annoy.example:
vt. 不断烦扰: Mosquitoes annoy us in the summer. 夏天蚊子总是不断烦扰我们。
vt. 不断烦扰: The sound of footsteps on the bare floor annoyed the downstairs neighbors. 楼上地板的脚步声吵得楼下住户心烦。
annoy.mean: vt. 不断烦扰：to disturb or irritate especially by repeated acts

meek.example:
adj. 谦恭的: He was a meek, mild-mannered fellow. 他是个谦逊、温文尔雅的的人
adj. 顺从的: He may be self-effacing, but he certainly isn't meek. 他可能是个很低调的人，但他绝非软骨头
meek.mean:
adj. 谦恭的： showing patience and humility; gentle
adj. 顺从的： easily imposed on; submissive

pout.example: vi. （特别是撅嘴）表示不悦: She pouted and didn't say a word to anyone all morning. 她整个早上都闷闷不乐，没和别人说一句话。
pout.mean: vi. （特别是撅嘴）表示不悦： to show displeasure, especially by thrusting out the lips or wearing a sullen expression

lapse.example:
n. 小过失: a lapse in table manner 餐桌礼仪的小过错
v. 结束，终止: The contract will lapse at the end of the year. 合同将于年底到期
lapse.mean:
n. 小过失： a slight error typically due to forgetfulness or inattention
v. 结束，终止： to come to an end

saddle.example: vt. 使某人负担: He has saddled himself with a houseful of impecunious relatives. 一屋子的穷亲戚成了他的负担
saddle.mean: vt. 使某人负担： to load or burden

cherubic.example: adj. 天使般可爱的: A representation of Cupid as a naked, cherubic boy usually is used as a symbol of love. 丘比特作为小天使般的少年裸体画像被用作爱的象征
cherubic.mean: adj. 天使般可爱的：innocent-looking usually chubby and rosy

lumber.example:
n. 木材: A huge amount of lumber will be needed to build the house. 建这栋房子需要大量的木材
vi. 笨拙地行动: The elephant lumbered through the jungle. 大象缓缓地穿越丛林
vi. 使负担（从而拖累）: lumber the expedition with unnecessary equipment and supplies 不必要的仪器和补给品给此次远征徒增了许多负担
lumber.mean:
n. 木材： tree logs as prepared for human use
vi. 笨拙地行动： to walk or move with heavy clumsiness
vi. 使负担（从而拖累）： to place a weight or burden on

meet.example: adj. 合适的: In this case, splitting the winnings of the contested lottery ticket seems like a meetsolution. 在这种情况下，平分有争议的彩票奖金或许是个合适的解决方案
meet.mean: adj. 合适的： precisely adapted to a particular situation, need, or circumstance: very proper

nurture.example:
vt. 提供营养: nurtured her children through the winters with home-cooked soup 一整个冬天都给孩子们喂自制的汤
t. 培育，培养: he feels that his lifelong practice of reading the Bible daily has nurtured him in ways he cannot describe 一生中每天都阅读圣经在潜移默化中影响了他
nurture.mean:
vt. 提供营养： to supply with nourishment
t. 培育，培养： to provide (someone) with moral or spiritual understanding

poseur.example: n. 故作姿态、不真诚的人: She is such a poseur and you will never know if she is really crying or pretending. 她就是个爱装的人，你从不知道她是真的在哭还是只是假装而已。
poseur.mean: n. 故作姿态、不真诚的人：an affected or insincere person

dissolve.example:
v. 溶解，融化: Sugar dissolves in the water. 糖在水中溶解
v. 消失: The mist dissolved in the morning sun. 雾消失在朝阳中。
v. 废除，撤销: The king dissolved parliament. 国王废除了议会
dissolve.mean:
v. 溶解，融化： to cause to pass into solution; to reduce (solid matter) to liquid form; melt
vt. 解散： to break into component parts; disintegrate
v. 消失： to cease to be visible; to cease to exist
v. 废除，撤销： to put an end to by formal action

refine.example:
vt. 提纯，精炼: Oil is refined so as to remove naturally occurring impurities. 原油通过精炼可去除其中天然存在的杂质。
vt. 改善，改进: You’d better refine your backhand before the big tennis match if you want to throne. 如果你想获得冠军的话，你最好在网球大赛开赛前再提升一下反手的技术。
refine.mean:
vt. 提纯，精炼：to free (as metal, sugar, or oil) from impurities or unwanted material
vt. 改善，改进： to improve or perfect by pruning or polishing

proprietary.example: adj. 私营的: a proprietary hospital 私人医院
proprietary.mean:
n. 所有权： ownership
adj. 私营的： privately owned and managed and run as a profit-making organization

beleaguer.example:
vt. 包围，围攻: beleaguered the castle for months 围攻堡垒长达数月
vt. 使困扰，使烦恼，使消沉: We are still beleaguered by the very problem. 我们仍然就为这一个问题而感到困扰
beleaguer.mean:
vt. 包围，围攻： to surround (as a fortified place) with armed forces for the purpose of capturing or preventing commerce and communication
vt. 使困扰，使烦恼，使消沉： trouble, harass, beset

chase.example: v. 驱赶: chase the cat out of the garden 把猫赶出园子
chase.mean:
v. 镂雕（金属）以装饰： to decorate (metal) by engraving or embossing.
v. 驱赶： to drive or force out

rapt.example:
adj. 狂喜的: a rock band that still attracts rapt crowds 一个仍然拥有者狂热粉丝的乐队
adj. 全神贯注的: With a mixture of delight and awe, the rapt children stared at the chick in the incubator breaking out of its shell. 怀着愉快和敬畏的复杂心理，孩子们全神贯注地盯着孵化箱中的小鸡破壳而出。
rapt.mean:
adj. 狂喜的： experiencing or marked by overwhelming usually pleasurable emotion
adj. 全神贯注的：deeply absorbed; engrossed

atone.example:
v. 赎罪，弥补: Blood must atone for blood. 以命抵命。
v. 赎罪，弥补: Even death cannot atone for the offence. 罪不容诛。
atone.mean: v. 赎罪，弥补：to make amends, as for a sin or fault

wizen.mean:
vt. （使）凋谢，（使）枯萎： to become dry, shrunken, and wrinkled often as a result of aging or of failing vitality
adj. 凋谢的, 枯萎的： shriveled or dried up

antedate.example: vt. 比…早，早于: The church antedates the village itself. 这座教堂甚至在村庄之前就存在了。‖Dinosaurs antedate cavemen by millions of years. 恐龙比穴居人要早几百万年出现。
antedate.mean: vt. 比…早，早于： to be of an earlier date than

antithetical.example: adj. 完全对立的，相反的: Spiritual ideals seem antithetical to the materialism embraced by modern society. 精神上的理想境界往往同当代社会所推崇的唯物主义相抵触。
antithetical.mean: adj. 完全对立的，相反的： being in direct and unequivocal opposition

preen.example:
vt. 打扮修饰: She always preen herself in an elaborate suit before going to the opera. 她去听歌剧之前总要精心打扮一番，穿上最豪华的服装。
vt. 自满: He always preen himself on his ancestry. 他总是因为他的血统而洋洋得意
preen.mean:
vt. 整理（羽毛）：to smooth or clean (feathers) with the beak or bill
vt. 打扮修饰： to dress or groom (oneself) with elaborate care
vt. 自满： to take pride or satisfaction in (oneself)

skirt.example:
n. 界限，边界: an old shack on the skirts of the town 城镇边界上的一座老房子
vt. 绕行，避开: skirted the construction zone 绕开建筑工地‖The new bill would make it harder for companies toskirt environmental regulations. 新的规定会增加公司逃脱环境监管的难度。
skirt.mean:
n. 界限，边界： the line or relatively narrow space that marks the outer limit of something
vt. 绕行，避开： to go around or keep away from in order to avoid danger or discovery

contempt.example: n. 蔑视，鄙视: my undying contempt for people who abuse animals 我对于虐待动物者的无尽鄙视‖Her contempt for illiterate was obvious. 你可以很明显地看出她对文盲的鄙夷。
contempt.mean: n. 蔑视，鄙视： open dislike for someone or something considered unworthy of one's concern or respect

counterfeit.example:
adj. 仿制的，假冒的: counterfeit money 假币
vt. 仿制: counterfeit the signature 仿造签名
vt. 伪装成: to counterfeit a happy expression while visiting a sick friend 在看望患病的朋友时装出一副高兴的样子
counterfeit.mean:
adj. 仿制的，假冒的： made in imitation of something else with intent to deceive
vt. 仿制： to make a fraudulent replica of
vt. 伪装成：to present a false appearance of

sip.example: vt. （尤指小口地）喝: slowly sipping the hot soup 慢慢地喝着热汤‖She sipped her coffee while she watched the sun rise. 她一边看着日出，一边喝着她的咖啡。
sip.mean: vt. （尤指小口地）喝： to swallow in liquid form, especially in small quantities

invoke.example:
vt. 实施: New train timetable has been invoked. 新的火车时刻表已经生效
vt. 产生，造成: We should be prepared for the possibility that any solution may invoke another set of problems. 我们必须要为这样一种可能做好心理准备：任何解决方案都可能带来一系列新的问题
invoke.mean:
vt. 实施： to put into effect or operation
vt. 产生，造成： to be the cause of (a situation, action, or state of mind)

jape.example: v. 嘲弄: The characters in Oscar Wilde's plays jape with a sophistication that is rarely encountered in real life. 奥斯卡?王尔德戏剧作品中的角色用一种十分世故的态度进行嘲讽，而这种态度在真实生活当中是很少见的
jape.mean: v. 嘲弄： to say or do something jokingly or mockingly

buoyant.example:
adj. 有浮力的: a buoyant balloon 一个能浮起来的气球
adj. 心情好的: in a buoyant mood 轻松快乐的心情
buoyant.mean:
adj. 有浮力的： capable of floating
adj. 心情好的： having or showing a good mood or disposition

negation.example: n. 否定: issued specific negations of all of the charges against her 发表了明确的声明，否定了所有对她的指控
negation.mean: n. 否定： the opposite or absence of something regarded as actual, positive, or affirmative

patronize.example:
t. 赞助: a company that loyally patronizes the arts 一个一直以来坚持赞助艺术界的公司
. 以高人一等的态度对待: a director with an unpleasant habit of patronizing even his most gifted actors 一个有着令人讨厌习惯的导演，他即便是对手下最有才华的演员也傲慢地对待
patronize.mean:
t. 赞助： provide aid or support for
. 以高人一等的态度对待：to adopt an air of condescension toward : treat haughtily or coolly

spurious.example: adj. 假的，伪造的: In statistics, a spurious relationship is a mathematical relationship in which two events or variables have no direct causal connection, but it may be wrongly inferred that they do, due to either coincidence or the presence of a certain third, unseen factor. 在统计学中，“伪相关关系”是两个不存在因果关联的事件或变量，因为巧合或是不可见的第三方因素，而被误判为存在因果联系的关系。
spurious.mean: adj. 假的，伪造的： lacking authenticity or validity in essence or origin; not genuine

warmonger.example: n. 好战者: Fortunately, the warmongers met with overwhelming opposition. 幸运的是，好战者们碰到了巨大的阻力。
warmonger.mean: n. 好战者： one who urges or attempts to stir up war

elliptical.example: adj. 含糊不清的: give an elliptical response to the inquiry 就问题给出一个含糊其辞的回答
elliptical.mean:
adj. 含糊不清的： of or relating to deliberate obscurity (as of literary or conversational style)
adj. 椭圆的：of, relating to, or shaped like an ellipse

deplore.example: vt. 哀悼: a statement from the bishops deploring the loss of life in the war overseas 一份来自大主教的声明，对海外战争中遇难的生命表示沉痛哀悼
deplore.mean: vt. 哀悼： to feel or express sorrow for

sin.example: n. 罪恶的事: It's a sin to waste food when people are starving. 当有人还在挨饿时浪费食物是一种罪过。
sin.mean: n. 罪恶的事： an action that is or is felt to be highly reprehensible; morally unacceptable

beige.example: adj. 缺乏特征的: Some food critics have dismissed that chef's version of French cuisine as beige and boring. 一些美食评论家认为那名厨师所做的法国菜平凡无奇，令人厌倦。
beige.mean: adj. 缺乏特征的： lacking distinction

incongruent.example: adj. 不一致的: Two triangles are incongruent. 两个三角形不全等。
incongruent.mean: adj. 不一致的： not conforming to the circumstances or requirements of a situation

servile.example: adj. 低下的，卑屈的: had always maintained a servile attitude around people with money 对有钱人卑躬屈膝
servile.mean: adj. 低下的，卑屈的： meanly or cravenly submissive: abject

tact.example: n. 机敏，精明，不冒犯: She talked to her neighbor with supreme tact. 她和邻居说话语调十分圆滑。
tact.mean: n. 机敏，精明，不冒犯： a keen sense of what to do or say in order to maintain good relations with others or avoid offense

impenitent.example: adj. 不悔悟的: remain impenitent about her criminal past 对她过去所犯罪行执迷不悟
impenitent.mean: adj. 不悔悟的： not feeling or expressing humble or regretful pain or sorrow for sins or offenses

abuse.example:
v. 辱骂抨击: He alleged that he was verbally abused by his colleagues. 他声称受到了同事的言语攻击。
v. 不正当不合理使用: abuse a privilege 滥用特权； abuse alcohol 酗酒
abuse.mean:
v. 辱骂抨击： language that condemns or vilifies usually unjustly, intemperately, and angrily
v. 不正当不合理使用： to put to a wrong or improper use; 过分过量使用：to use excessively

fatigue.example:
n. 疲惫: The day-long battle against the blaze left firefighters in a state of utter fatigue. 与大火一整天的斗争使得消防员们处于极度疲惫的状态
n. （让人厌倦的）苦差事: Although he had joined the army for action and adventure, much of his day seemed to be devoted to mindless fatigues. 尽管当初参军是为了上战场冒险的，但我生活的大部分时间似乎都耗费在了没意思的苦差上
fatigue.mean:
n. 疲惫： weariness or exhaustion from labor, exertion, or stress
n. （让人厌倦的）苦差事： something, such as tiring effort or activity, that causes weariness

bluff.example:
adj. 直率的，（说话）直截了当的: Frankly speaking, he is a bluff but good-hearted teacher. 老实说，这个老师说话很直率，但是心地善良。
vt. 欺骗: I successfully bluffed the interviewer into believing that I could really speak French and thus would be the perfect person to serve in the newspaper’s Paris bureau. 我成功地欺骗了面试官，让他相信我会法语，从而成为报社在巴黎办事处的不二人选。
bluff.mean:
adj. 直率的，（说话）直截了当的： being or characterized by direct, brief, and potentially rude speech or manner
vt. 欺骗： to cause to believe what is untrue; deceive

prolix.example: adj. 罗嗦的，冗长的: habitually transforms brief anecdotes into prolix sagas that exhaust his listeners 总是将简短的小趣事变成冗长的传说故事，让听众很疲倦
prolix.mean: adj. 罗嗦的，冗长的： tending to speak or write at excessive length

impecunious.example: adj. 贫穷的: They were so impecunious that they couldn't afford to give one another even token Christmas gifts. 他们穷到了连象征性的圣诞礼物都互送不起的地步
impecunious.mean: adj. 贫穷的： having very little or no money

foment.example: vt. 助长，煽动: He was accused of fomenting violence. 他被指控煽动暴力行为
foment.mean: vt. 助长，煽动： to promote the growth or development of

ambiguous.example: adj.有多种理解方式的；不确定的: Students have ambiguous feelings about their role in the world. 学生们为他们在世界中的角色感到迷茫。Frustrated by ambiguous instructions因为不明确的指示而受挫
ambiguous.mean: adj.有多种理解方式的；不确定的：open to more than one interpretation；doubtful or uncertain

scurvy.example: adj. 下流，让人鄙视的: She was beset by a whole scurvy swarm of con artists. 她被一群下流的骗子艺术家蜂拥围攻。
scurvy.mean: adj. 下流，让人鄙视的： mean; contemptible

embark.example:
vi. 上船: With all cargos embarked, the ship weighed the anchor. 所有货物都上船了，货船拔锚起航
vi. 开始从事: embark on a world tour 开始了环游世界的旅程
embark.mean:
vi. 上船： to go aboard a vessel or aircraft, as at the start of a journey
vi. 开始从事： to make a start

arduous.example:
adj. 难以做到，费劲的: a long and arduous undertaking 一项长期艰苦的任务
adj. 难以做到，费劲的: an arduous journey across miles of desert 艰苦的沙漠之旅
arduous.mean: adj. 难以做到，费劲的：hard to accomplish or achieve: difficult

redundant.example: adj. 多余的，冗余的: This area is already chockablock with shopping malls; another one would be redundant. 这个地区已经是商场扎堆了，再建一个完全是多此一举。
redundant.mean: adj. 多余的，冗余的： exceeding what is necessary or normal

budge.example:
vi. 改变立场或态度: Nothing would budge him. 没有什么可以改变他的主意。
v. 停止抵抗，屈服: despite hours of intense pressure, she refused to budge from her position 尽管被连续施压几小时，她仍旧不肯改变立场
budge.mean:
vi. 改变立场或态度： to alter a position or attitude
v. 停止抵抗，屈服： to cease resistance (as to another’s arguments, demands, or control)

tendentious.example: adj. 有偏见的: He made some extremely tendentious remarks. 他有些评论颇具偏向性。
tendentious.mean: adj. 有偏见的： marked by a tendency in favor of a particular point of view: biased

meditate.example: vt. 思索，沉思: meditated a visit to her professor 思索着去拜访她的导师‖I have been meditating a career change for months. 我花了几个月的时间在考虑换一个工作。
meditate.mean: vt. 思索，沉思： to focus one’s thoughts on

tamper.example:
vi. 恶意窜改，损害: tamper with tradition 坏了规矩
v. 玩弄: Don't tamper with my feelings. 不要玩弄我的感情。
tamper.mean:
vi. 恶意窜改，损害： to handle thoughtlessly, ignorantly, or mischievously
v. 玩弄： to tinker with rashly or foolishly

alloy.example:
n. 合金，混合物: Brass is an alloy, consisting of copper and zinc. 黄铜是一种由铜和锌组成的合金。‖Television news has always been an alloy of journalism and show business. 电视新闻一直以来都是新闻界和演艺圈的混合体。
vt. 掺杂，降低纯度: idealism that was alloyed with political skill 因为掺入了政治技能而被削弱理想主义
alloy.mean:
n. 合金，混合物： a distinct entity formed by the combining of two or more different things
vt. 掺杂，降低纯度： to debase by the addition of an inferior element

ignite.example:
vt.点燃: The bombs ignited a fire which destroyed some 60 houses. 炸弹引发的大火摧毁了大约60间房屋
vt. 激起，唤起（感情等）: The insults ignited my anger. 那些侮辱让我倍感愤怒
ignite.mean:
vt.点燃： to cause to burn; to set fire to
vt. 激起，唤起（感情等）： to arouse the passions of

incogitant.example: adj. 考虑不周的，不体谅的: an incogitant litterbug 不体谅人的乱扔垃圾者
incogitant.mean: adj. 考虑不周的，不体谅的： thoughtless; inconsiderate

understate.example: vt. 保守陈述: understate a problem 低调处理问题
understate.mean: vt. 保守陈述： to state or present with restraint especially for effect

infelicitous.example:
adj. 不愉快的，不幸的: an infelicitous moment 不幸的时刻
adj. 不适当的，不合时宜的: made a very infelicitous remark 做出极不恰当的评价
infelicitous.mean:
adj. 不愉快的，不幸的： not happy; unfortunate
adj. 不适当的，不合时宜的： not appropriate or well-timed

mute.example:
adj. 不说话的，缄默的: He always remained mute no matter how much we pleaded for an answer 不论我们怎么恳求回答，他总是保持沉默
vt. 使颜色、音调等柔和: mute a color 对颜色进行柔化
mute.mean:
adj. 不说话的，缄默的： deliberately refraining from speech
vt. 使颜色、音调等柔和： to soften the tone, color, shade, or hue of
vt. 减弱声音： to soften or muffle the sound of

insight.example: n. 深刻的理解: an insight into the global-scale environmental problems 对于全球性环境问题的深刻理解
insight.mean: n. 深刻的理解： an instance of apprehending the true nature of a thing, especially through intuitive understanding

disarm.example:
vi. 解除武装: disarm the captured soldiers 解除被捕士兵的武装 || The defeated nation was disarmed so that it would never again be a threat to international order. 战败国被解除武装，这样一来它就不会再对国际秩序造成威胁了。
vt. 使息怒，平息抚慰: Her future father-in-law was totally disarmed by her words. 她未来的继父听了她的话彻底没脾气了。
v. 使无害: disarm a bomb 拆除炸弹
disarm.mean:
vi. 解除武装： to give up or reduce armed forces
vt. 使息怒，平息抚慰： to lessen the anger or agitation of
v. 使无害： to make harmless

sedulous.example: adj. 勤奋认真的: a sedulous student 一个勤奋地学生
sedulous.mean: adj. 勤奋认真的：involving or accomplished with careful perseverance

parch.example: vi. 烤干: parch a surface from exposure to sun 通过太阳照射烤干一个面
parch.mean: vi. 烤干： to make extremely dry, especially by exposure to heat

alacrity.example: n. 反应迅速，乐意: accepted the invitation with alacrity 欣喜地接受了邀请
alacrity.mean: n. 反应迅速，乐意： promptness in response : cheerful readiness

epigram.example: n. 机智的短诗，警句: Benjamin Franklin's most famous epigram, “Remember that time is money” 本杰明?富兰克林最著名的警句就是，时间就是金钱
epigram.mean: n. 机智的短诗，警句： a short, witty poem expressing a single thought or observation

tyrant.example: n. 暴君: The people universally feared the tyrant, who was notorious for his frequent use of torture. 人们非常恐惧这个暴君，因为他有着经常折磨犯人的臭名。
tyrant.mean: n. 暴君： a ruler who exercises absolute power oppressively or brutally

abstruse.example: adj. 难以理解的: the abstruse calculations 复杂深奥的计算
abstruse.mean: adj. 难以理解的： difficult to comprehend : recondite

embezzle.example: vt. 盗用: limitations on the right of the state to embezzle private property 限制政府挪用私人财产的权利
embezzle.mean: vt. 盗用： to appropriate (as property entrusted to one's care) fraudulently to one's own use

accrete.example: v. 逐渐增长: silt accreting at the mouth of the river 泥沙在河口淤积
accrete.mean: v. 逐渐增长： to grow or increase gradually, as by addition

brittle.example:
adj. 易碎的，脆弱的，易坏的: as brittle as glass 像玻璃一样脆弱
adj. 不热心的，不真心的: a brittle apology that was anything but heartfelt 一个毫不真诚的道歉
brittle.mean:
adj. 易碎的，脆弱的，易坏的： easily broken, cracked, or snapped
adj. 不热心的，不真心的： lacking in friendliness or warmth of feeling

badger.example: vt. 不断纠缠或骚扰: badger him into purchasing 不断地骚扰劝说他购买
badger.mean: vt. 不断纠缠或骚扰： to harass or annoy persistently

obeisance.example: n. 敬礼，尊重: makes obeisance to her mentors 向她的导师们致敬
obeisance.mean: n. 敬礼，尊重： a movement of the body made in token of respect or submission

industrious.example: adj. 勤勉的: The industrious PhD spends all his summer holiday in the laboratory. 勤奋的博士整个暑假都在做实验
industrious.mean: adj. 勤勉的： constantly, regularly, or habitually occupied, diligent

complicate.example: vt. 使复杂化: Don’t complicate matters by getting the parents involved. 不要把父母牵扯进来，这会让问题更复杂。
complicate.mean: vt. 使复杂化： to make complex or difficult

decorum.example:
n. 礼仪，得体: high standards of decorum are usually required when attending the opera 去听歌剧的时候需要遵守高标准的礼节
n. 礼仪，得体: decorous behavior 得体的举止
decorum.mean: n. 礼仪，得体： appropriateness of behavior or conduct; propriety

brook.example:
v. 忍受，容许: brook no inference with his plans 不能容忍别人对于他计划的干涉
n. 小溪流: there are tiny fish and frogs in that brook 那条小溪里有小鱼还有小青蛙
brook.mean:
v. 忍受，容许： to stand for, tolerate
n. 小溪流： a natural stream of water normally smaller than and often tributary to a river: creek

nostalgia.example:
n. 思乡之情: Overwhelmed by nostalgia, she started to cry. 被思乡之情淹没的她开始啜泣。
n. 怀旧，怀念: He felt a wave of nostalgia for the life he had left behind him. 他开始怀念往昔的时光。
nostalgia.mean:
n. 思乡之情： the state of being homesick
n. 怀旧，怀念： a wistful or excessively sentimental yearning for return to or of some past period or irrecoverable condition

sedentary.example: adj. 固定不动的: a sedentary lifestyle 很宅的生活方式
sedentary.mean: adj. 固定不动的： not migratory: settled

seemly.example: adv. 得体的，遵守礼节的: a young lady of seemly appearance, robust health, and keen intelligence 一个打扮得体、身体健康、头脑敏锐的姑娘
seemly.mean: adv. 得体的，遵守礼节的： following the established traditions of refined society and good taste

sinecure.example: n. 美差: a lucrative sinecure in a big law firm 在大法律公司高报酬的美差
sinecure.mean: n. 美差： an office or position that requires little or no work and that usually provides an income

blatant.example:
adj. 大声喧哗的: blatant radios 喧闹恼人的电台
adj. （让人生厌地）惹人注目的: a blatant lie 明目张胆的谎言 || a blatant error in simple addition 简单的加法运算中的一个明显错误
blatant.mean:
adj. 大声喧哗的： noisy, especially in a vulgar or offensive manner
adj. （让人生厌地）惹人注目的： very noticeable especially for being incorrect or bad

marsh.example: n. 沼泽，湿地: The marshes along the coast support a remarkable profusion of plants and animals. 沿着海岸线一带的沼泽为大量的动植物提供了栖息所
marsh.mean: n. 沼泽，湿地： an area of soft, wet, low-lying land

misapprehension.example:
n. 错误的理解: tried to eliminate all misapprehensions about the planned riverfront development 尽可能消除所有关于河流沿岸发展计划的误解
n. 错误的判断: a common misapprehension about how our language functions 有关我们的语言如何运作的常见误判
misapprehension.mean:
n. 错误的理解： a failure to understand correctly
n. 错误的判断： a wrong judgement

latitude.example: n. （行动或言论）自由: Students are allowed considerable latitude in choosing courses. 学生在选课时被给予相当大的自由度
latitude.mean: n. （行动或言论）自由： freedom from normal restraints, limitations, or regulations

choleric.example:
adj. 易怒的，暴躁的: choleric disposition 易怒的性情 || men of the choleric type take to kicking and smashing易怒的人喜欢踢和打碎东西
adj. 生气的: I absolutely get choleric when a salesman calls during the dinner hour. 当一个推销员午休时间打来电话的时候我彻底愤怒了。
choleric.mean:
adj. 易怒的，暴躁的：easily angered; bad-tempered.
adj. 生气的：feeling or showing anger: angry, irate

derelict.example:
adj. 玩忽职守的, 不认真的: the guards were judged derelict in their duty 守卫们被判玩忽职守罪
n. 被社会遗弃的人: a section of the city that seemed to be frequented mostly by derelicts 流浪汉的集中区
derelict.mean:
adj. 玩忽职守的, 不认真的： lacking a sense of duty; marked by a carelessly easy manner
n. 被社会遗弃的人： a destitute homeless social misfit

demoralize.example:
vt. 使士气低落: demoralize the staff 使员工士气低落
v. 贬低，堕落: we refused to be demoralized by our humiliating defeat 我们拒绝由于这场屈辱的战败而被贬低
demoralize.mean:
vt. 使士气低落： to undermine the confidence or morale of; dishearten
v. 贬低，堕落： to lower in character, dignity, or quality

impervious.example:
adj. 不可渗透的，不可穿透的: The material for this coat is supposed to be impervious to rain. 这件大衣的材料应该是能防雨的
adj. 不能被破坏的: a carpet impervious to rough treatment 耐用的地毯
adj. 不为所动的: These sailors are impervious to fear. 这些水手无所畏惧
impervious.mean:
adj. 不可渗透的，不可穿透的： not allowing entrance or passage
adj. 不能被破坏的： not capable of being damaged or harmed
adj. 不为所动的： not capable of being affected or disturbed

orthodox.example: adj. 传统的: He believes in the benefits of both orthodox medicine and alternative medicine. 他既相信传统药物又相信替代药物的效用。
orthodox.mean: adj. 传统的： following or agreeing with established form, custom, or rules

trenchant.example:
dj. 锐利的: Even the most trenchant sword could not sever the bonds of loyalty between them. 即使最锋利的刀剑也不能切断他们的忠诚。
dj. （言辞）一针见血的: trenchant criticisms 一针见血的批评
trenchant.mean:
dj. 锐利的： keen, sharp
dj. （言辞）一针见血的： vigorously effective and articulate

dike.example:
n. 堤坝，水坝: An elaborate system of dikes was built to protect the lowlands from the relentless onslaught of the sea. 建立了一套精密复杂的堤坝系统，使低地不再受到海水的无情侵袭。
n. 水沟，水渠: Water flowed along the dike to the small pond. 水沿着沟渠流入小池塘。
dike.mean:
n. 堤坝，水坝： a bank usually of earth constructed to control or confine water
n. 水沟，水渠： a long narrow channel dug in the earth

denigrate.example: vt. 诋毁，污蔑: denigrate one's opponents 诋毁某人的对手
denigrate.mean: vt. 诋毁，污蔑： to express scornfully one's low opinion of

flout.example: n./v. 嘲弄性不理会，蔑视: flout the academic norm by plagiarizing 通过抄袭来蔑视学术规范
flout.mean: n./v. 嘲弄性不理会，蔑视： to treat with contemptuous disregard

negligent.example: adj. 疏忽大意的: negligent in taking care of the children 粗心大意地照顾孩子
negligent.mean: adj. 疏忽大意的： failing to give proper attention or care

sumptuous.example: adj. 豪华的，奢侈的: The hotel claims to offer sumptuous furnishings and exquisitely prepared cuisine. 酒店宣称有奢华的装潢和精心准备的食物。
sumptuous.mean: adj. 豪华的，奢侈的： extremely costly, rich, luxurious, or magnificent

fallible.example: adj. 可能出错的: They are only human and all too fallible. 他们都是人类，因此难免犯错。‖a hasty, fallible generalization 有可能出错的匆促总结
fallible.mean: adj. 可能出错的： tending or likely to be erroneous or capable of making an error

asymmetrical.example: adj. 不平衡的,不对称的: the asymmetrical construction 非对称的建筑
asymmetrical.mean: adj. 不平衡的,不对称的：having no balance or symmetry

dexterous.example: adj. 动作灵活的: a dexterous surgeon 技术娴熟的外科医生 || The dexterous watchmaker was able to repair the antique watch's delicate gears and parts. 手巧的手表匠能够修理古董手表的精密的齿轮和部件。
dexterous.mean:
adj. 动作灵活的： ready and skilled in physical movements
adj. 头脑灵活的： mentally adroit and skillful: clever

pompous.example:
adj. 浮夸的: The candidate was given to windy rhetorical speeches. 听众们听了一场冗长而浮夸的演讲。
adj. 傲慢的: a pompous politician who insisted on boarding the plane first 一个坚持要求优先登机的傲慢政客
pompous.mean:
adj. 浮夸的： excessively elevated or ornate
adj. 傲慢的： having or exhibiting self-importance

diabolic.example: adj. 恶魔一般的: The police quickly mobilized to track down the diabolical serial killer. 警察迅速调动起来来追查出这个恶魔般的连环杀人狂。
diabolic.mean: adj. 恶魔一般的： of, relating to, or characteristic of the devil

crass.example: adj. 粗俗的，愚钝的: crass receptionist 粗俗的招待员
crass.mean: adj. 粗俗的，愚钝的：so crude and unrefined as to be lacking in discrimination and sensibility

viscid.example: adj. 有粘性的: viscid tree resin 粘性的树脂
viscid.mean: adj. 有粘性的： having a glutinous consistency

renovate.example:
vt. 修复，维修: We will have to renovate the house extensively before we can move in. 在入住之前我们必须大规模翻修一下这栋房子。
vt. 使重获新生，使焕然一新: The church was renovated by a new ecumenical spirit. 新的宗教领袖的到来让教堂焕发新生。
renovate.mean:
vt. 修复，维修： to restore to a former better state (as by cleaning, repairing, or rebuilding)
vt. 使重获新生，使焕然一新：to bring back to life, practice, activity or a former condition of vigor

measly.example: adj. 少得可怜的，微不足道的: gave the parking attendant a measly tip给了停车保安少得可怜的小费
measly.mean: adj. 少得可怜的，微不足道的： so small or unimportant as to warrant little or no attention

laconic.example: adj. 简洁（以至于显得粗鲁或难以理解）的: His mentor’s comment tends to be laconic but very much to the point. 他导师的点评很简短，但是却总能说到点子上
laconic.mean: adj. 简洁（以至于显得粗鲁或难以理解）的： using or involving the use of a minimum of words: concise to the point of seeming rude or mysterious

opine.example: vt. 表达观点: You can opine about any subject you like. 你可以畅所欲言。
opine.mean: vt. 表达观点： to express opinions

preclude.example:
vt. 预先阻止: Age alone will not preclude him from standing as a candidate. 年龄并没有阻止他成为候选人。
vt. 排斥 : He refused to preclude the subject from discussion . 他拒绝将这个话题排出讨论范围。
preclude.mean:
vt. 预先阻止： to make impossible, as by action taken in advance
vt. 排斥 ：to exclude or prevent (someone) from a given condition or activity

concave.example: adj. 凹的: a concave lens 凹透镜
concave.mean: adj. 凹的：curved like the inner surface of a sphere

commodious.example:
adj. 宽敞舒适的comfortably or conveniently spacious: roomy
: a commodious closet 宽敞的衣橱
commodious.mean: adj. 宽敞舒适的comfortably or conveniently spacious: roomy

virulent.example:
adj. 有毒的: virulent bacteria 有毒的细菌
adj. 凶残的: a virulent look on her face 面露凶色
virulent.mean:
adj. 有毒的： extremely poisonous or venomous
adj. 凶残的： marked by a rapid, severe, and destructive course

disregard.example:
vt. 漠视，不关注: disregard the advice of his executives 漠视执行管理者的建议
n. 缺乏兴趣，缺乏关心: Revelers fired guns in the air with complete disregard for the possible consequences. 饮酒狂欢者一点也不关心后果的开枪。
disregard.mean:
vt. 漠视，不关注： to pay no attention to
n. 缺乏兴趣，缺乏关心： lack of interest or concern

stock.example:
n. 库存，储备: This type of product is currently out of stock. 这种商品已经脱销。
adj. 普通的，常备的: the stock answers to sensitive questions 对于敏感问题的常备回答
stock.mean:
n. 库存，储备： the inventory of goods of a merchant or manufacturer
adj. 普通的，常备的： commonly used or brought forward

erratic.example:
adj. 善变的: business at the fast-food restaurant has been so erratic lately that the manager never knows how much staff to have on hand 快餐店的生意最近非常起伏以至于经理也不清楚需要多少人手

erratic.mean:
adj. 善变的： not staying constant
adj. 异常的，不同寻常的： different from the ordinary in a way that causes curiosity or suspicion

scorch.example: vt. 炙烤，烘干: scorching sun 火辣辣的太阳
scorch.mean: vt. 炙烤，烘干： to burn on the surface; to make dry

illuminate.example:
vt. 照明: to illuminate with a spotlight 用聚光灯照亮
vt. 阐明: Roosevelt′s New Deal illuminates what the role of government is in Keynesian Economics. 罗斯福新政阐明了在凯恩斯主义中政府的作用
vt. 启迪，启发: how man is illuminated by a higher spirit 人们是如何被更高境界的思想开化的
illuminate.mean:
vt. 照明： to make luminous or shining
vt. 阐明： to make plain or understandable
vt. 启迪，启发： to provide (someone) with moral or spiritual understanding

illuminati.example: n. 精英: a book launching party to which only New York's cultural illuminati were invited 一个只邀请了纽约上层文化精英的新书发布会
illuminati.mean:
n. 智者： persons who claim to be unusually enlightened
n. 精英： individuals carefully selected as being the best of a class

tepid.example: adj. 不太热心的: a tepid response 冷漠的回应 || the tepid conservatism of the fifties 五十年代那种温和的保守主义
tepid.mean: adj. 不太热心的： showing little or no interest or enthusiasm

strip.example: vt. 脱衣，剥去: Guards stripped and start to search the prisoners. 守卫剥光了犯人，开始搜身。
strip.mean: vt. 脱衣，剥去： to remove clothing, covering, or surface matter from

constitute.example:
vt. 指派，任命: He was constituted manager. 他被任命为经理
v. 构成: Water constitutes the greater part of the human body. 人体中包含着大量的水分
constitute.mean:
vt. 指派，任命： to appoint to an office, function, or dignity
v. 构成： make up, form, compose

deficiency.example: n. 缺乏，不足: there is a deficiency of fresh food in the diet of many of the working poor 很多劳工阶层的饮食都缺乏新鲜食物
deficiency.mean: n. 缺乏，不足： the quality or state of being deficient: inadequate

intangible.example: adj. 无法感知的，无形的: intangible value of a good reputation 良好声誉的无形价值
intangible.mean: adj. 无法感知的，无形的： incapable of being perceived by the senses

static.example:
adj. 静态的，停滞的: Both your pictures are of static subjects. 你的两张照片都是静物。‖a static economy 停滞不前的经济
adj. 无改变的: a static population 没有变化的人口
static.mean:
adj. 静态的，停滞的： characterized by a lack of movement, animation, or progression
adj. 无改变的： showing little change

castigate.example:
v. 强烈（公开）指责: The author castigated the prime minister as an ineffective leader. 作者谴责首相行政无作为。
v. 惩罚: a judge who believes in castigating criminals to the full extent of the law 法官认为应该最大程度地惩罚罪犯

v. 强烈（公开）指责： to criticize harshly and usually publicly
v. 惩罚： to inflict a penalty on for a fault or crime

resuscitate.example: vt. 使复活，使苏醒: resuscitated by the kiss of the prince 因王子的吻而苏醒
resuscitate.mean: vt. 使复活，使苏醒： to restore consciousness, vigor, or life to

banal.example: adj. 非原创的，陈腐的: The slogan is too banal. 这口号已是陈词滥调了
banal.mean: adj. 非原创的，陈腐的： lacking originality, freshness, or novelty; trite

gallant.example:

adj. 高贵的，慷慨的: The members of that service club are known for their gallant service to the community. 那个服务社的成员因为他们对社区的慷慨贡献而为人所知

adj. 英勇的： brave, spirited; nobly chivalrous and often self-sacrificing

loquacious.example: adj. 话多的: Sometimes the loquacious talk show host barely lets her guests get a word in. 有时候多话的脱口秀主持人让她的客人一句话都插不进来

shallow.example: adj. 浅显的，浅薄的: shallow generalizations 一个浅显的概览
shallow.mean: adj. 浅显的，浅薄的： having or showing a lack of depth of understanding or character

disarray.example:
n. 混乱，无秩序: The room was in disarray. 房间一片混乱。
v. 使混乱: Changing offices disarrayed my papers completely. 办公室搬迁，使我的文件全部乱套了.
disarray.mean:
n. 混乱，无秩序： a lack of order or sequence
v. 使混乱： to undo the proper order or arrangement of

fathom.example:
vt. 测量（深度）: The pilot had to continually fathom the river, which drought conditions had lowered to unprecedented levels. 舵手不得不时刻注意河水深度，因为干旱已经使水深下降到了前所未有的程度
vt. 彻底理解，弄懂: unable to fathom the what he was talking about 无法弄懂他在说什么
fathom.mean:
vt. 测量（深度）： to measure the depth of (as a body of water) typically with a weighted line
vt. 彻底理解，弄懂： to penetrate and come to understand

repress.example:
vt. 镇压: Military quickly repressed the rebellion in the city and restored order. 军方迅速平息了市内的暴乱，恢复了秩序。
vt. 阻止（正常的表达、活动或发展等）: You can't repress your feelings forever, so tell her that you love her. 你不可能永远压抑自己的感受，所以大胆地跟她表白吧。
repress.mean:
vt. 镇压： to put down by force, usually before total control has been lost; quell
vt. 阻止（正常的表达、活动或发展等）： to prevent the natural or normal expression, activity, or development of

transcend.example: vt. 超越，超过极限: a person who believes that any true understanding of God transcends human intelligence 认为对上帝的真正理解是超越人类智商极限的人
transcend.mean: vt. 超越，超过极限： to rise above or go beyond the limits of

ratiocination.example: n. 推理: As an expert in ratiocination, the detective Sherlock Holmes has few rivals. 作为推理专家，大侦探福尔摩斯可谓无人能及。
ratiocination.mean: n. 推理： the thought processes that have been established as leading to valid solutions to problems

invective.example: adj. 侮辱性的: invective comments on female activists 对女权主义者的侮辱性评论
invective.mean: adj. 侮辱性的： of, relating to, or characterized by insult or abuse

hilarious.example: adj. 非常好笑的: hilarious cartoons that the whole family can enjoy 适合全家观看的搞笑动画片
hilarious.mean: adj. 非常好笑的： marked by or causing hilarity: extremely funny

obsess.example: vt. 迷住，使困扰: The war obsesses her—she talks about nothing else. 她被战争彻底迷住了，张口闭口都谈这个。
obsess.mean: vt. 迷住，使困扰： to haunt or excessively preoccupy the mind of

perish.example: vi. 死亡，消亡: thrive in calamity and perish in soft living 生于忧患，死于安乐‖adapt or perish 适应或是消亡
perish.mean: vi. 死亡，消亡： to become destroyed or ruined: cease to exist

expurgate.example: v. 净化，删去不当处: an expurgated edition of the letters 信件的删减版
expurgate.mean: v. 净化，删去不当处： to remove erroneous, vulgar, obscene, or otherwise objectionable material from (a book, for example) before publication

hanker.example: v./n. 向往，渴望: hankering for adventure 渴望冒险
hanker.mean: v./n. 向往，渴望： to have a strong or persistent desire: yearn

provident.example:
adj. 节俭的: it is possible to be provident without being miserly 人可以做到节俭但不吝啬
adj. 有远见的: her provident measures kept us safe while we waited out the hurricane 她之前有远见的准备让我等待飓风结束的期间安全无恙
provident.mean:
adj. 节俭的： frugal; economical
adj. 有远见的： having or showing awareness of and preparation for the future

enfranchise.example:
vt. 给予权利（例如选举权）: Slaves in US were emancipated in 1863 but were not enfranchised until the Fifteenth Amendment went into effect in 1870. 尽管在美国奴隶于1863年就获得了解放，但他们直到1870年《第五修正案》正式生效才获得选举权
vt. 解放: In a way, modern labor-saving appliances enfranchised people, giving them much more leisure time. 从某种意义上来说，那些节省劳动力的现代设备将人们解放出来，给予更多的休闲时间
enfranchise.mean:
vt. 给予权利（例如选举权）： to endow with the rights of citizenship, especially the right to vote
vt. 解放：to set free (as from slavery)

implode.example: v. 剧烈收缩，坍缩，内爆: The flask imploded during the vacuum distilling. 做低压蒸馏的时候烧瓶发生了内爆
implode.mean: v. 剧烈收缩，坍缩，内爆： to collapse inward violently

shun.example: vt. 避开，避免: After his divorce he found himself being shunned by many of his former friends. 自从他离婚以来，他发现许多曾经的朋友都刻意躲着他。
shun.mean: vt. 避开，避免： to avoid deliberately; keep away from

embarrass.example:
vt. 使尴尬: bawdy jokes that embarrassed her 让她尴尬的荤段子
vt. 阻挠，制造障碍: A lot of this paperwork is unnecessary and just embarrasses the organization. 这些文案工作很多都是多余的，只会妨碍组织的工作
embarrass.mean:
vt. 使尴尬： to cause to experience a state of self-conscious distress
vt. 阻挠，制造障碍： to create difficulty for the work or activity of

countermand.example: vt. 取消，撤销: countermand an order 撤销命令
countermand.mean: vt. 取消，撤销： to revoke (a command) by a contrary order

obscure.example:
adj. 含义模糊的: a fantasy writer who likes to put lots of obscure references in her tales of wizards and warlocks 一个喜欢在巫师故事中添加很多含义模糊的引用的魔幻小说作家
dj. 平凡的，不知名的: an obscure poet 无名的诗人
v. 使模糊: when it isn't obscured by smog, the view of the city from the observatory can be spectacular 如果在晴朗的天气，从天文台看出去的城市全景非常赞
obscure.mean:
adj. 含义模糊的： not clearly understood or expressed; having an often intentionally veiled or uncertain meaning
dj. 平凡的，不知名的： not prominent or famous
v. 使模糊： to make dark, dim, or indistinct

rehabilitate.example:
vt. 使复原，使康复: new policies in hopes of rehabilitating the national economy 被指望能振兴国家经济的新政策‖She decided to undergo physical therapy to help rehabilitate her broken elbow. 她决定采取理疗来治疗受伤的手肘。
vi./vt. （使）洗心革面: an organization that rehabilitates criminals so they can reenter society 一个让罪犯洗心革面的机构，以便让他们能重返社会
rehabilitate.mean:
vt. 使复原，使康复： to restore to a former state (as of efficiency, good management, or solvency) or a healthy condition
vi./vt. （使）洗心革面： to make better in behavior or character

retract.example: vt. 收回，否认: The newspaper had to retract its allegations against the mayor. 报纸不得不收回针对市长的谣言。
retract.mean: vt. 收回，否认： to take back

peeve.example: vt. 打扰，惹恼: be constantly peeved by his affected flattery 总是被他做作的谄媚所惹恼
peeve.mean: vt. 打扰，惹恼： to disturb the peace of mind of (someone) especially by repeated disagreeable acts

substantiate.example:
vt. 证实: There is little scientific evidence to substantiate the claims. 现在还缺乏足够的科学证据来证实这种言论。
vt 使实体化: The artist's intense feelings are substantiated by his paintings' bold colors and broad brush strokes. 画家强烈的情感通过他画作中鲜艳的色彩和很宽的笔画体现出来。
substantiate.mean:
vt. 证实： to support with proof or evidence
vt 使实体化： to give material form to

counterpart.example: n. （地位、功能）对等的人或物: She worked with her counterpart in the other office to get the job done. 她与另一个办公室的同职人员一起努力完成这项工作。‖U.S. presidents and his British counterpart 美国总统和英国首相
counterpart.mean: n. （地位、功能）对等的人或物： one having the same function or characteristics as another

noxious.example:
adj. 有害的，有毒的: noxious waste 有害的废弃物
adj. 产生强烈厌恶的: a noxious new breed of horror movie in which graphic depictions of torture are presented as entertainment 在一部新的恐怖电影中，对于酷刑生动的描述被当做是娱乐
noxious.mean:
adj. 有害的，有毒的： harmful to living things; injurious to health
adj. 产生强烈厌恶的： causing intense displeasure, disgust, or resentment

shred.example: n. 少量: He struggled to retain a shred of his dignity. 他勉强挽救了一点尊严。
shred.mean: n. 少量： a small amount; a particle

manumit.example: v. 解放（奴隶）: Though he was an outspoken defender of liberty, this son of Virginia did not manumit his own slaves until he was on his deathbed. 尽管这位维吉尼亚之子公开地支持自由，但他直到临死才释放自己的奴隶
manumit.mean: v. 解放（奴隶）： to release from slavery or bondage

facilitate.example: vt. 使变容易，促进: The new airport will facilitate the development of tourism. 新建机场促进了旅游业的发展。
facilitate.mean: vt. 使变容易，促进： to make easy or easier

wistful.example: adj. （带着忧伤而）渴望的，怀念的: There was a wistful look in his eyes when he spoke of his childhood. 当他谈起他的童年时，眼眶中不禁流露出一种带有忧伤的怀念之情。
wistful.mean: adj. （带着忧伤而）渴望的，怀念的： full of yearning or desire tinged with melancholy

incarnate.example:
adj. 化身的，人体化的: He referred to her as devil incarnate. 他把她视作恶魔的化身
v. （思想、理论的）具化，体现: the general view that Hitler incarnated extreme egotism 通常认为希特勒代表了极端的以自我为中心
incarnate.mean:
adj. 化身的，人体化的： invested with bodily nature and form
v. （思想、理论的）具化，体现： to constitute an embodiment or type of

manuscript.example: n. 手稿: beautiful Latin manuscript on the school's diplomas 学校毕业证书上美丽的手写拉丁文
manuscript.mean: n. 手稿： a book, document, or other composition written by hand

affliction.example: n. 痛苦，悲伤，折磨: She listened with deep affliction as her daughter told her about the latest trouble she was in. 她怀着巨大的痛苦聆听着女儿告诉她目前艰难的处境。
affliction.mean: n. 痛苦，悲伤，折磨： a state of great suffering of body or mind

endemic.example: adj. 地方性的: an endemic disease 地方性疾病
endemic.mean: adj. 地方性的： prevalent in or peculiar to a particular locality, region, or people

opportune.example: adj. 合适的，适当的: an opportune moment 方便的时机
opportune.mean: adj. 合适的，适当的： suitable or convenient for a particular occurrence

salient.example: adj. 显著的，最突出的: The most salient feature of the book is its papyrus cover. 该书最明显的特点就是莎草纸的封面。
salient.mean: adj. 显著的，最突出的： standing out conspicuously

glisten.example: vi. 闪光: The calm sea glistened in the sunlight. 日光下平静的海面波光粼粼
glisten.mean: vi. 闪光： to shine by reflection with a sparkling luster

dilapidate.example: v. 使荒废: The house has been dilapidated by neglect. 由于没人照看，这个房子已经要荒废了。
dilapidate.mean: v. 使荒废： to bring into a condition of decay or partial ruin

vulgar.example:
adj. 粗俗的，无教养的: He is a vulgar man but his music is quite divine. 虽然他是一个粗俗的人，但他的音乐却十分神圣。
adj. 口头的，非正式的: Latin was once the language of scholars, and English the vulgar language used by the common people. 很久以前拉丁语才是学术界的官方语言，而英语是普通百姓所使用的。
vulgar.mean:
adj. 粗俗的，无教养的： morally crude, undeveloped, or unregenerate
adj. 口头的，非正式的： used in or suitable for speech and not formal writing

stealth.example:
n. 秘密行动: Both sides advanced by stealth. 双方都隐秘地行军。
adj. 秘密的: The SWAT team carried out a stealth raid on the house, which was believed to be harboring a terrorist cell. 特警们对这间被认为是恐怖分子老巢的房屋进行了秘密的突袭。
stealth.mean:
n. 秘密行动： the act or action of proceeding furtively, secretly, or imperceptibly
adj. 秘密的： intended not to attract attention

lamentable.example: adj. 值得惋惜的，悲哀的: The lamentable cries of the women for their lost sons were heard throughout the village. 女人们由于丧子之痛的哀嚎响彻整个山谷
lamentable.mean: adj. 值得惋惜的，悲哀的： inspiring or deserving of lament or regret; deplorable or pitiable; mournful

overwhelm.example:
vt. 淹没: That spring the massive runoff from melting snows overwhelmed the valley. 那个春天，整个村庄被融雪形成的洪流吞没了。
vt. （感情上、精神上）使无所适从，使难以承受: Just the thought of how much work there is to do overwhelms me. 仅仅是想想还有多少工作没完成就几乎让我喘不过气了。
overwhelm.mean:
vt. 淹没： to cover with or as if with a flood
vt. （感情上、精神上）使无所适从，使难以承受： to subject to incapacitating emotional or mental stress

inalienable.example: adj.不可剥夺的，不能让与的: inalienable rights of the citizen 公民不可予夺的权利
inalienable.mean: adj.不可剥夺的，不能让与的： cannot be transferred to another or others

heartrending.example: adj. 令人心碎的: a heartrending choice between saving his mother or his wife 先救老妈还是先救老婆的纠结选择
heartrending.mean: adj. 令人心碎的： causing intense sorrow or distress

scant.example: adj. 不足的，缺乏的: jobs for teenagers were scant that summer 那年暑假适合青少年们做的工作很少
scant.mean: adj. 不足的，缺乏的： barely or scarcely sufficient

trifling.example: adj. 细微的，不重要的: Deciding what you want to do for a living is no trifling matter. 决定维持生计的行当可不是一件小事。‖trifling differences between the theatrical and DVD versions of the movie 影院版和DVD版电影当中的细微区别
trifling.mean: adj. 细微的，不重要的： lacking in significance or solid worth

tightfisted.example: adj. 吝啬的: The company is pretty tightfisted when it comes to bonuses. 这个公司分红的时候很吝啬。

natty.example: adj. 整洁的，时髦的: a natty young woman 整洁漂亮的年轻女子
natty.mean: adj. 整洁的，时髦的： trimly neat and tidy

symbiosis.example: n. 共生关系: The bird lives in symbiosis with the hippopotamus. 这种鸟和河马是共生关系。
symbiosis.mean: n. 共生关系： the living together in more or less intimate association or close union of two dissimilar

temperate.example:
adj. 言行举止有分寸的: rather temperate in his appraisal of the movie, calling it good but not great 对于电影的赞赏很适度，说其“还好”而不是“很棒”
adj. 有节制的: a soft-spoken, serious-minded person of temperate habits 一个说话温和、认真严肃的人，兴趣爱好都很适度
temperate.mean:
adj. 言行举止有分寸的： avoiding extremes in behavior or expression
adj. 有节制的： given to or marked by restraint in the satisfaction of one's appetites

agility.example: n. （身手）敏捷: His agility on the parallel bars has won him several medals. 他在双杠上的矫捷身姿助他赢得了数枚奖牌。
agility.mean: n. （身手）敏捷： ease and grace in physical activity

stomach.example: v. 容忍: I can't stomach his bragging. 我受不了他自吹自擂了。
stomach.mean: v. 容忍： to bear without overt reaction or resentment

gear.example: v. 调整（以配合）: geared the speech towards a conservative audience 调整演讲以适应保守的观众
gear.mean: v. 调整（以配合）： to adjust or adapt so as to make suitable

eavesdrop.example: v. 偷听: eavesdropping on the conversation 偷听谈话
eavesdrop.mean: v. 偷听： to listen secretly to the private conversation of others

chagrin.example: n. 沮丧，懊恼: He thought for a minute, anger and chagrin mixing with the embarrassment on his face. 他考虑了一会儿，脸上出现了愤怒、懊恼和尴尬的复杂表情。
chagrin.mean: n. 沮丧，懊恼： disquietude or distress of mind caused by humiliation, disappointment, or failure

argot.example: n. 隐语，黑话，行话: groups communicating in their own secret argots 用他们秘密的行话交流的团体
argot.mean: n. 隐语，黑话，行话：a specialized vocabulary or set of idioms used by a particular group

retrench.example: vi. 削减开支: Declining business forced the company to retrench. 衰减的业务迫使公司削减开支。
retrench.mean: vi. 削减开支： to curtail expenses

acquire.example: vt. 获取，获得: bacteria that acquire tolerance to antibiotics 产生了抗药性的细菌‖I have never acquired a taste for wine. 我从来就不具备对葡萄酒酒的品味能力。
acquire.mean: vt. 获取，获得： to get as one’s own

dreary.example:
adj. 单调乏味的: The day is cold, rainy, and dreary. 天气寒冷，阴暗而沉闷
adj.令人不悦的: decided to see a professional counselor in order to save their dreary marriage 决定咨询专业人士以拯救他们悲剧式的婚姻
dreary.mean:
adj. 单调乏味的：having nothing likely to provide cheer, comfort, or interest
adj.令人不悦的： causing unhappiness

burlesque.example: v. 夸张滑稽地模仿以嘲弄他人的文学艺术作品，恶搞: burlesquing the teacher's nervous tic isn't very nice 恶搞老师紧张的痉挛不是好的行为
burlesque.mean: v. 夸张滑稽地模仿以嘲弄他人的文学艺术作品，恶搞： to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of

vouch.example: vi. 担保，声称为真: willing to vouch for her integrity 愿意担保她的人格
vouch.mean: vi. 担保，声称为真： to declare (something) to be true or genuine; to give a guarantee

simulate.example:
v. 假装，模仿: cosmetics that simulate a suntan 用来模仿晒黑效果的化妆品
v. 模拟: carrying out an experiment to simulate weightlessness 进行了模拟失重状态的实验
simulate.mean:
v. 假装，模仿： to have or take on the appearance, form, or sound of; imitate
v. 模拟： to create a representation or model of (a physical system or particular situation)

diminish.example:
v. 变小，减少: diminish an army's strength 削弱军队力量 || The sound of the train diminished as our distance from it increased. 当我们距离火车的越远时，火车的声音就越小。
v. 轻视，贬低: diminish a rival's accomplishments 贬低对手的成就
diminish.mean:
v. 变小，减少： to become smaller or less
v. 轻视，贬低： to lessen the authority, dignity, or reputation of : belittle

haven.example: n. 安全的地方: a haven for artists 艺术家们的圣地
haven.mean: n. 安全的地方： a place of safety

spurn.example: vt. 摈弃，拒绝: spurned his recommendation 拒绝了他的推荐‖Fiercely independent, the elderly couple spurned all offers of financial help. 这对老夫妻极其独立，回绝了所有经济上援助。
spurn.mean: vt. 摈弃，拒绝： to reject with disdain or contempt

prune.example: vt. 修剪: The students were asked to prune their essays. 学生们被要求修改文章。
prune.mean:
n. 梅干： a plum dried or capable of drying without fermentation
vt. 修剪： to cut off or remove dead or living parts or branches of (a plant, for example) to improve shape or growth

comity.example: n. 友好，社会和谐: group activities promoting comity 促进和谐氛围的团队活动 || comity of nations 国际礼节
comity.mean: n. 友好，社会和谐：friendly social atmosphere ：social harmony

measured.example: adj. 深思熟虑的，审慎的: a measured response to the terrorist attack 就恐怖袭击做出的深思熟虑的反应
measured.mean: adj. 深思熟虑的，审慎的： deliberated, calculated

frugal.example: adj. 节约的: be frugal in her expenditures 节约她的开销
frugal.mean: adj. 节约的： characterized by or reflecting economy in the use of resources

appealing.example:
adj. 吸引人的 attractive, inviting
: The large salary made Goldman Sachs’s offer more appealing to him. 高薪使高盛的工作对他更有吸引力。
appealing.mean: adj. 吸引人的 attractive, inviting

halcyon.example: adj. 繁荣的，丰富的: halcyon years 丰年
halcyon.mean:
adj. 宁静的，平静的： free from storms or physical disturbance
adj. 繁荣的，丰富的： prosperous, affluent, vigorous growth and well-being especially economically

circumspect.example: adj. 谨慎的；小心的: The banks should have been more circumspect in their dealings. 银行本应该在它们的交易当中更加谨慎。
circumspect.mean: adj. 谨慎的；小心的：careful to consider all circumstances and possible consequences: prudent

amble.example: vi. / n. 漫步，闲逛: Every evening, they ambled along the bank. 他们每晚沿河边散步。
amble.mean: vi. / n. 漫步，闲逛：to walk slowly or leisurely; stroll

gambol.example: vi. 欢跳，雀跃: young lambs gamboling in the meadow 小羊羔在原野里欢快地跳跃
gambol.mean: vi. 欢跳，雀跃： to leap about playfully

ingenious.example: adj. 聪明的，有创造才能的: Ingenious designers soon came up with a solution to the battery problem. 聪明的设计者们很快便提出了电池问题的解决方案
ingenious.mean: adj. 聪明的，有创造才能的： marked by originality, resourcefulness, and cleverness in conception or execution

earsplitting.example: adj. 震耳欲聋的: earsplitting noise of airplane engines 飞机引擎的巨大噪音
earsplitting.mean: adj. 震耳欲聋的：distressingly loud or shrill

neutralize.example:
vt. 中和: industrial exhaust neutralized by lime 被石灰中和的工业废气
vt. 破坏，使无效: influenced by the kind of propaganda that is difficult to neutralize 被一种难以消除的宣传攻势所影响
neutralize.mean:
vt. 中和： to cause (an acid or base) to undergo neutralization
vt. 破坏，使无效： to make inoperative or ineffective usually by means of an opposite force, influence, or effect

chivalrous.example: adj. 有骑士风度的，（尤指对女性）彬彬有礼的: still engages in chivalrous behavior, such as opening doors for people 仍然坚持着有风度的行为，比如帮别人开门
chivalrous.mean: adj. 有骑士风度的，（尤指对女性）彬彬有礼的： marked by gracious courtesy and high-minded consideration(especially to women)

victimize.example: vt. 使受骗: victimized by a confidence man with a slick story 被一个骗子用圆滑的故事欺骗
victimize.mean: vt. 使受骗： to subject to deception or fraud

prophetic.example: adj. 预言的，预示的: those lower-than-expected sales numbers were a prophetic indicator of the financial trouble the company would soon be in 那些低于预期的销售数字就是公司即将陷入的金融危机的先兆
prophetic.mean: adj. 预言的，预示的： foretelling events：predictive

persecute.example: vt. 迫害，折磨: people who were persecuted simply for practicing their religious faith 因为实践宗教信仰而惨遭迫害的人
persecute.mean: vt. 迫害，折磨： to cause persistent suffering to

dictate.example:
n. 指令，命令: followed the dictates of my conscience 遵从我的良心准则‖The army must abide by the dictates of the new government. 军队必须服从新政府的命令。
vt. （仗着地位、权力）下令: The general dictated that the terms of surrender be negotiated by his senior staff. 将军要求投降书中的若干条款交付手下的高级将领进行讨论。
dictate.mean:
n. 指令，命令： a command by one in authority
vt. （仗着地位、权力）下令： to request the doing of by virtue of one’s authority

cosmopolitan.example: adj. 有世界性眼光的，包容的: a cosmopolitan traveler 云游四海的旅行者
cosmopolitan.mean: adj. 有世界性眼光的，包容的： having worldwide rather than limited or provincial scope or bearing

proselytize.example: v. 改变信仰: The efforts of early missionaries to proselytize the Native Americans of Minnesota were largely unproductive. 早期传教士对于明尼苏达的土著人的改变信仰的努力大多无功而返。
proselytize.mean: v. 改变信仰： to persuade to change to one's religious faith

catholic.example: adj. 普遍的，包容的: a catholic taste in music 对于音乐的兼容并包的品味
catholic.mean: adj. 普遍的，包容的： not limited or specialized in application or purpose

conflate.example: vt. 混合: The movie conflates documentary footage and dramatized reenactments so seamlessly and ingeniously that viewers may not know what is real and what is not. 电影将纪实档案和娱乐性的夸张如此巧妙无缝地糅合起来，以至于观众不知道哪一部分是真实的，哪一部分是虚构的。
conflate.mean: vt. 混合： to turn into a single mass or entity that is more or less the same throughout

soak.example: vt. 使…湿透: That downpour soaked my hair, and now I look like a sight. 那场大雨把我的头发淋湿了，所以我现在看起来格外滑稽。‖We ran for home as soon as the rain started, but our clothes still ended up soaked. 我们一发觉下雨就开始往家里跑，但我们的衣服还是湿透了。
soak.mean: vt. 使…湿透： to make thoroughly wet or saturated by or as if by placing in liquid

propriety.example:
n. 礼节: When attending a wedding, there are certain proprieties that must be followed. 参加婚礼时，有一些礼节需要遵守。
n. 适当得体: I'm not sure about the propriety of serving champagne in these glasses. 我不确定在这种杯子里倒香槟是否得体。
propriety.mean:
n. 礼节： conformity to what is socially acceptable in conduct or speech
n. 适当得体： the quality or state of being especially suitable or fitting

florid.example:
adj. 辞藻华丽的，花哨的: gave a florid speech to attract attention 做了个辞藻华丽的演说以吸引眼球
adj. 装饰华丽的: a florid architectural style 华丽的建筑风格
florid.mean:
adj. 辞藻华丽的，花哨的： full of fine words and fancy expressions
adj. 装饰华丽的： elaborately and often excessively decorated

ham-handed.example: adj. 笨手笨脚的: too ham-handed to use one of those tiny cell phones 手指太不灵活了，用不了那种迷你型手机
ham-handed.mean: adj. 笨手笨脚的： lacking dexterity or grace

fanatic.example:
n. 狂热者: a soccer fanatic 一个足球迷
adj. 狂热的；盲信的: They are fanatic about sadomasochism. 他们对SM十分狂热
fanatic.mean:
n. 狂热者： a person marked or motivated by an extreme, unreasoning enthusiasm, as for a cause.
adj. 狂热的；盲信的： marked by excessive enthusiasm and often intense uncritical devotion

ephemeral.example: adj. 短暂的: ephemeral pleasures 暂时的压力
ephemeral.mean: adj. 短暂的： lasting a very short time

apprise.example: v. 通知，告知: apprise him of the danger that may be involved 告知他可能涉及的危险
apprise.mean: v. 通知，告知：to give notice to; inform

ecumenical.example: adj. 世界范围的，普遍性的: an ecumenical scope 国际视野
ecumenical.mean:
adj. 全球基督教会的： of, relating to, or representing the whole of a body of churches
adj. 世界范围的，普遍性的： worldwide or general in extent, influence, or application

precipice.example: n. 悬崖峭壁: a precipice too steep to climb 过于陡峭而无法攀爬的悬崖
precipice.mean: n. 悬崖峭壁： a very steep or overhanging place

adjunct.example: n. 附属物，非必须部分: Massage therapy can be used as an adjunct along with the medication. 按摩治疗可以作为药物治疗的补充疗法。
adjunct.mean: n. 附属物，非必须部分： something joined or added to another thing but not essentially a part of it

pivotal.example: adj. 最关键的，最为重要的: The report was missing a pivotal piece of information. 报告遗漏了最为重要的信息。
pivotal.mean: adj. 最关键的，最为重要的： of the greatest possible importance

singe.example: vt. 轻微烧焦: The iron is too hot, and you'll singe the nightdress. 熨斗太烫了，你会把睡衣烫坏的。‖The marshmallows got a bit singed over the campfire, but we like them that way. 棉花糖因为营火而有些许烧焦，但我们还是很喜欢它的味道。
singe.mean: vt. 轻微烧焦： to burn superficially or lightly

divert.example:
vt. 使转向: divert traffic to a side street 使交通转至辅路
v. 使消遣: A light comedy divert the tired business executive 一个轻松的喜剧让疲惫的企业主管人员得到了放松。
v. 使分心: divert one’s attention 转移某人注意力 || The parents tried to divert the child with a toy while the doctor was giving her a shot. 当医生要给那个孩子打针的时候，孩子父母试图用玩具转移孩子的注意力。
divert.mean:
vt. 使转向：to turn from one course or use to another: deflect
v. 使消遣：to cause (someone) to pass the time agreeably occupied
v. 使分心：to draw the attention or mind to something else
