cozen.example: v. 诱骗: The salesman cozened the old lady into buying his goods. 推销员诱使老太太买下了他的东西
cozen.mean: v. 诱骗： to mislead by means of a petty trick or fraud; deceive

mongrel.example: adj. 杂种的，混血儿的: homeless mongrel dogs on the streets 街上的流浪杂种狗
mongrel.mean: adj. 杂种的，混血儿的： of mixed origin or character

persistence.mean: n. 坚持，持续： uninterrupted or lasting existence

sequel.example: n. 结果: Higher prices are a logical sequel to higher costs for manufacturers. 从逻辑上来说，更高的价格是更高的生产成本的结果。
sequel.mean: n. 结果： a result or consequence

axiomatic.example:
adj. 公理的: Euclidean geometry is based on five axiomatic principles. 欧几里得几何学是在五条公理的基础上建立的
adj. 不言自明的: an axiomatic truth 一个不言而明的真理
axiomatic.mean:
adj. 公理的： based on or involving an axiom or system of axioms
adj. 不言自明的： taken for granted, self-evident

deploy.example: v.（有目的地）展开；调度: deploy a sales force 展开部署销售力量
deploy.mean: v.（有目的地）展开；调度： to spread out, utilize, or arrange for a deliberate purpose

disgorge.example:
v. 呕吐出: He cannot disgorge a fish bone without the doctor’s assistant. 没有医生的帮助他吐不出鱼刺来。|| The volcano disgorged lava. 火山喷出岩浆。
v. 放弃: The corrupt officials refused to disgorge his ill-gotten gains. 贪官们拒绝放弃赃款。
disgorge.mean:
v. 呕吐出： to discharge by the throat and mouth; vomit
v. 放弃： to give up on request or under pressure

procure.example: vt. 获得，取得: procured the prisoner's release 得到了释放囚犯的许可
procure.mean: vt. 获得，取得： to get possession of

mutter.example: vi. 低声抱怨: mutter about the difficult assignment 抱怨作业太难
mutter.mean: vi. 低声抱怨： to murmur complainingly or angrily

cipher.example:
n. 无影响或无价值的人: The intern is a mere cipher in the company. 这个实习生在公司里是个无足轻重的小人物。
v. 计算（价值）: We were surprised by how much we had spent on the cruise after we had ciphered out the grand total. 当我们算出我们沉船游览的总花费时，我们都惊呆了。
n. 密码: convert their messages into cipher 把他们的信息转换成密码
cipher.mean:
n. 无影响或无价值的人：a person of no importance or influence
v. 计算（价值）：to determine (a value) by doing the necessary mathematical operations
n. 密码： a method of transforming a text in order to conceal its meaning

propagate.example:
v. 繁殖: the dams along the river are interfering with the salmon's ability to propagate 河上的大坝影响了大马哈鱼的繁殖
vt. 传播，宣传: the various ways in which churches can propagate the faith 不同的宣传教义的方法
propagate.mean:
v. 繁殖： to cause to continue or increase by sexual or asexual reproduction
vt. 传播，宣传： to cause to spread out and affect a greater number or greater area: extend

delve.example: vt. vi. 探究，钻研: The book delves into the latest research. 这本书深入探究了最近的研究。
delve.mean: vt. vi. 探究，钻研： to make a careful or detailed search for information

awe.example: n./v. 敬畏: She gazed in awe at the great stone. 她敬畏地凝视着那块巨石
awe.mean: n./v. 敬畏： an emotion variously combining dread, veneration, and wonder that is inspired by authority or by the sacred or sublime

hoodwink.example: vt. 欺骗: Don't let yourself be hoodwinked into buying things you don't need. 别被忽悠着去买用不着的东西。
hoodwink.mean: vt. 欺骗： to take in by deceptive means; deceive

intrinsic.example: adj. 固有的，内在的: the intrinsic worth of a gem 宝石的内在价值
intrinsic.mean: adj. 固有的，内在的： of or relating to the essential nature of a thing

fervent.example: adj. 充满感情的，热情洋溢的: a fervent speech that called for tolerance and compassion for those who are physically challenged 一个充满感情的演说，它呼吁人们对残疾人持有一颗包容和同情的心
fervent.mean: adj. 充满感情的，热情洋溢的： exhibiting or marked by great intensity of feeling

clasp.example: n./v. 紧握: Be careful that your clasp on the cat isn't too tight, or she could get hurt. 注意别抓那只猫太紧，否则她会受伤的。
clasp.mean: n./v. 紧握：the act or manner of holding

inexorable.example: adj. 无法劝阻的，不为所动的: the seemingly inexorable rise in unemployment 看起来无法阻止其高攀的失业率
inexorable.mean: adj. 无法劝阻的，不为所动的： not to be persuaded, moved, or stopped

refreshing.example: adj. 令人心身振奋的，提神的: A glass of cold water is very refreshing on such a hot day. 大热天里的一杯冰水真是让人心旷神怡。‖It is refreshing to hear some good news about him. 能听到他的好消息真是让人振奋。
refreshing.mean: adj. 令人心身振奋的，提神的： having a renewing effect on the state of the body or mind

spleen.example: n. 怒气，怨恨: She vented her spleen on her boyfriend and felt much better for having done so. 在她把怒气一股脑地倾泻到她男朋友身上之后，她感觉好多了。
spleen.mean: n. 怒气，怨恨： feelings of anger or ill will often suppressed

metaphysical.example:
adj. 哲学上的，理论上的: a work that deals with such metaphysical questions as the very nature of knowledge 一部探讨诸如“知识的本性是什么”的理论问题的著作
adj. 非尘世的: a metaphysical world beyond the one in which we live 在我们居住的世界之上的“超然世界”
metaphysical.mean:
adj. 哲学上的，理论上的： dealing with or expressing a quality or idea
adj. 非尘世的： of, relating to, or being part of a reality beyond the observable physical universe

crumple.example:
v. 弄皱: crumple a piece of paper 弄皱一张纸
v. （因外力挤压而）垮塌: The box crumpled when I accidentally dropped a brick on it. 我不小心扔了块石头在箱子上，它就倒塌了
crumple.mean:
v. 弄皱： to press, bend, or crush out of shape
v. （因外力挤压而）垮塌： to fall down or in as a result of physical pressure

penitent.example: adj. 悔过的: a penitentbusinessman who had come to ask for forgiveness 一个来寻求宽恕的决定悔过自新的商人
penitent.mean: adj. 悔过的： feeling or expressing humble or regretful pain or sorrow for sins or offenses

discursive.example: adj. （谈话内容）杂乱的: a long, discursive article 冗长杂乱的文章 || The speaker's discursive style made it difficult to understand his point. 演讲者讲话杂乱，很难让人理解他的观点。
discursive.mean: adj. （谈话内容）杂乱的： moving from topic to topic without order

suture.example: n./v. 缝合: The doctor cleaned, sutured, and bandaged the wound. 医生将伤口清洗、缝合、包扎。
suture.mean: n./v. 缝合： the process of joining two surfaces or edges together along a line by or as if by sewing

absurd.example: adj. 不合理的: an absurd argument 无稽之谈
absurd.mean: adj. 不合理的：ridiculously unreasonable, unsound, or incongruous

fiasco.example: n. 大失败: The Hitler's plot ended in a fiasco. 希特勒的阴谋最终以失败告终
fiasco.mean: n. 大失败： a complete failure

constrain.example:
v. 限制: Low temperature constrains the chemical reactivity. 低温降低了化学反应活性
v. 使人屈服于（压力、感情等）: constrained by his conscience to tell the truth 受他良心的驱使而说实话
constrain.mean:
v. 限制：to force by imposed stricture, restriction, or limitation
v. 使人屈服于（压力、感情等）：to cause (a person) to give in to pressure

inane.example: adj. 空洞的: inane comments 空洞的评论
inane.mean: adj. 空洞的： lacking significance, meaning, or point

spindly.example: adj. 细长纤弱的: I prefer having rather spindly legs. 我更希望有一双细腿。
spindly.mean: adj. 细长纤弱的： frail or flimsy in appearance or structure

telling.example: adj. 有效的，显著的: the most telling evidence 最有力的证据
telling.mean: adj. 有效的，显著的： effective, expressive

utter.example:
t. 出声，说话: She tried not to utter a sound as the doctor gave her a flu shot. 她克制自己不在打针的时候喊出来。
dj. 完全的，绝对的: be at an utter loss what to do 完全不知道怎样才好
utter.mean:
t. 出声，说话： to articulate (words); pronounce or speak
dj. 完全的，绝对的： complete; absolute; entire

asylum.example:
n. 收容所/ 保护所: an insane asylum 疯人院
n. 收容所/ 保护所: The embassy serves as an asylum for that country's nationals in need of help. 大使馆作为那国需要帮助的公民的保护所。
asylum.mean: n. 收容所/ 保护所：an inviolable place of refuge and protection giving shelter to criminals and debtors/ something (as a building) that offers cover from the weather or protection from danger

trivial.example: adj. 琐碎的，无足轻重的: why spend so much time on trivial decisions, like whether the cola should be regular or diet? 为什么花这么多时间在这种琐碎的决定上，比如可乐要喝一般的还是健怡？
trivial.mean: adj. 琐碎的，无足轻重的： of little worth or importance

self-absorbed.example: adj. 自恋的，自私的: a self-absorbed man who seems utterly oblivious to the social problems of his own urban neighborhood 一个超级自私的人，对于街坊的事情完全视而不见
self-absorbed.mean: adj. 自恋的，自私的： absorbed in one's own thoughts, activities, or interests

principal.example: adj. 主要的，重要的: The region's principal city is getting hammered by a series of terrorist attacks. 该地区的中心城市正在被一系列恐怖袭击攻击。
principal.mean: adj. 主要的，重要的： first, highest, or foremost in importance, rank, worth, or degree

cavort.example: vi. 欢快地蹦跳或行走，雀跃: Children are cavorting in the sand. 孩子们在沙子中嬉戏。
cavort.mean: vi. 欢快地蹦跳或行走，雀跃： to bound or prance about in a sprightly manner; caper

frowsy.example:
adj. 邋遢的: frowsy hair 邋遢的头发
adj. 味道难闻的: The abandoned house was dank and frowsy and barely fit for human habitation. 这座废房子光线又暗，气味又难闻，几乎无法供人居住
frowsy.mean:
adj. 邋遢的： having a slovenly or uncared-for appearance
adj. 味道难闻的： having an unpleasant smell

conciliate.example:
v. 平息，抚慰: A principal trying to conciliate the parents who did not receive their tickets to the graduation ceremonies. 校长试着平息这对没有收到他们的毕业晚会门票的家长的气愤情绪。
vt. 调解: It will be hard to conciliate the views of labor and management regarding health benefits. 调解劳资双方对于健康保险金的观点很难。
conciliate.mean:
v. 平息，抚慰：to lessen the anger or agitation of
vt. 调解：to make compatible : reconcile

cache.example:
n. 囤货，藏货: maintain a cache of food in case of emergencies 保存着食物的隐藏处以防万一
v. 隐藏: cached the fugitive slaves in their cellar until they could make their way to Canada 将奴隶们藏匿在房间的地下室直到他们能够顺利逃去加拿大
cache.mean:
n. 囤货，藏货： a supply stored up and often hidden away
v. 隐藏： to put into a hiding place

scurrilous.example: adj. 说粗话的: scurrilous attacks on the senator 对参议院粗俗的攻击
scurrilous.mean: adj. 说粗话的： given to the use of vulgar, coarse, or abusive language

rash.example: adj. 草率的，仓促的: That was too rash a move: for now you've lost your bishop and probably the whole chess game. 那一招棋着实是太草率了，现在你丢掉了象，很有可能会输掉整场比赛。
rash.mean: adj. 草率的，仓促的： marked by or proceeding from undue haste or lack of deliberation or caution

loutish.example: adj. 粗鲁的: a boy with a loutish air 一个举止粗鲁的男孩
loutish.mean: adj. 粗鲁的： having the characteristics of a lout; awkward, stupid, and boorish

prolong.example: vt. 延长，拖延: Additives are used to prolong the shelf life of packaged food. 添加剂被用来延长包装食品的保存期限。
prolong.mean: vt. 延长，拖延： to lengthen in extent, scope, or range

irk.example:
n. 令人烦恼的事物: One of the prof's major irks is a cell phone that rings during a lecture. 课堂上突然响起的手机铃声是最让教授火大的事情之一
v. 使烦恼，使厌倦: She irked her friends by chewing her gum loudly during the movie. 她因为看电影时嚼口香糖弄出声响而惹怒了她的朋友们
irk.mean:
n. 令人烦恼的事物： something that is a source of irritation
v. 使烦恼，使厌倦： to be irritating, wearisome, or vexing to

solicitous.example:
adj. 为他人操心的，体谅他人的: The solicitous husband had already cleaned the house and cooked dinner by the time his wife returned home from work. 这个十分体谅妻子的好丈夫在他妻子回家之前就把家里清理干净，还把晚餐都做好了。
adj. 迫切的，渴望的: The family is solicitous to put this whole unfortunate affair behind them and to move on with their lives. 这个家庭迫切希望能忘记那些不幸的事情，开始崭新的生活。
solicitous.mean:
adj. 为他人操心的，体谅他人的： given to or made with heedful anticipation of the needs and happiness of others
adj. 迫切的，渴望的： showing urgent desire or interest

flinch.example: vi. 畏缩；退缩: He met my gaze without flinching. 他毫不畏缩地与我对视
flinch.mean: vi. 畏缩；退缩： to draw back in fear, pain, or disgust

equilibrium.example:
n. 均势，平衡: We must find an equilibrium between commercial development and conservation of our natural treasures. 我们必须在发展经济和保护自然资源之间找到一个平衡点。
n. （感情上的）平静: That stunning insult left me speechless, and several minutes passed before I recovered my equilibrium. 那个令人震惊的侮辱弄得我哑口无言，我花了好几分钟才使心情得以平静。
equilibrium.mean:
n. 均势，平衡： a condition in which opposing forces are equal to one another
n. （感情上的）平静： evenness of emotions or temper

dodge.example: v. 躲避: dodge a storm of bullets 躲避枪林弹雨 || He dodged the first punch but was hit by the second. 他躲过了第一次打击但是没有躲过第二次。
dodge.mean: v. 躲避： to avoid (a blow, for example) by moving or shifting quickly aside

gratify.example: vt. 使满足: gratify her curiosity 满足她的好奇心‖Her praise will gratify all who worked so hard to earn it. 他的表扬会使所有辛勤工作的人们高兴
gratify.mean: vt. 使满足： to give what is desired to, to please or satisfy

recidivate.example: vi. 回到原先的习惯，尤指重新犯罪: The suspect has recidivated for several times. 这个嫌犯是个惯犯了
recidivate.mean: vi. 回到原先的习惯，尤指重新犯罪： to return to a previous pattern of behavior, especially to return to criminal habits

aphorism.example: n. 短小有智慧的格言: When decorating, remember the familiar aphorism, “less is more.” 装修时需要记住的一句格言是“少即是多”。
aphorism.mean: n. 短小有智慧的格言：a short witty sentence which expresses a general truth or comment

skimp.example:
adj. 缺乏的，不足的: The dieter complained about skimp meals that were served at the fat farm. 这个节食者抱怨说减肥疗养地的伙食少得可怜。
vi. 节省花费，吝啬: We must skimp and save if we are going to afford a vacation this summer. 要是我们这个夏天要出去旅行，那么就得开始节省出一些钱了。
skimp.mean:
adj. 缺乏的，不足的： less plentiful than what is normal, necessary, or desirable
vi. 节省花费，吝啬： to give insufficient or barely sufficient attention or effort to or funds for

exceptional.example: adj. 例外的，特别的，非凡的: exceptional bravery 非凡的勇敢
exceptional.mean: adj. 例外的，特别的，非凡的： being an exception; uncommon; extraordinary

arrhythmic.example: adj. 不规律的: arrhythmic pulse 不规律的脉搏
arrhythmic.mean: adj. 不规律的：lacking rhythm or regularity

schism.example: n. 不一致: a schism between political parties 党派间的冲突
schism.mean: n. 不一致： a lack of agreement or harmony

malaise.example: n. 不舒服: He complained of depression, headaches and malaise. 他抱怨说感到沮丧、头痛和身体不适
malaise.mean: n. 不舒服： a vague feeling of bodily discomfort, as at the beginning of an illness

stratagem.example: n. 谋略，策略: a stratagem to secure customer loyalty 用来稳固客户忠诚度的计谋
stratagem.mean: n. 谋略，策略： an artifice or trick in war for deceiving and outwitting the enemy

spur.example:
n. 刺激物: The threat of losing its only sports franchise was the spur the city council needed to finally do something about the rising crime rate. 有可能失去唯一的体育赛事举办权带来的威胁，成为了刺激市政府决定就攀升的犯罪率采取相关措施的因素。
n. 支撑物: a weak wall that might need a spur 一面或许需要支撑的墙
vt. 刺激，激励: Appreciation spurred his ambition. 赞扬激起了他的雄心壮志。
spur.mean:
n. 刺激物： something that arouses action or activity
n. 支撑物： a structure that holds up or serves as a foundation for something else
vt. 刺激，激励： to incite or stimulate

syllogism.example: n. 由一般到个别的推理；演绎: The syllogism was at the core of traditional deductive reasoning, where facts are determined by combining existing statements, in contrast to inductive reasoning where facts are determined by repeated observations. 从一般到个别的推理是传统演绎推理的核心由结合现存状态所确定，而归纳推理则由重复观测来确认。
syllogism.mean: n. 由一般到个别的推理；演绎： reasoning from the general to the specific; deduction

swindle.example: vt. 欺骗，骗取: Hundreds of people were swindled out of their savings 几百人都被骗去了存款。
swindle.mean: vt. 欺骗，骗取： to cheat or defraud of money or property

conservatory.example:
n. 温室: The college's conservatory is entirely devoted to cultivating and displaying orchids. 学校的温室几乎全部用于兰花的种植和观赏了
n. 艺术学院: an opera conservatory 歌剧学院
conservatory.mean:
n. 温室： a greenhouse for growing or displaying plants
n. 艺术学院： a school specializing in one of the fine arts

instill.example:
v. 慢慢滴入: instill medication into the infected eye 将药物滴入患者受感染的眼中
v. 灌输: instill a sense of responsibility to the young 向年轻人灌输一种责任感
instill.mean:
v. 慢慢滴入： to cause to enter drop by drop
v. 灌输： to impart gradually

dishearten.example: vt. 使沮丧，使失去信心: We were greatly disheartened by the news that our grandmother was seriously ill. 听到祖母病重的消息，我们都很沮丧。
dishearten.mean: vt. 使沮丧，使失去信心： to cause to lose spirit or morale

gust.example: n. 情感爆发: the stressed-out coworker cried out with a gust of emotion 压力巨大的同事开始嚎啕大哭
gust.mean: n. 情感爆发： a sudden intense expression of strong feeling

imperious.example:
adj. 爱发号施令的: an imperious little boy who liked to tell the other scouts what to do 一个爱发号施令的小男孩，总是喜欢指挥别的童子军做事
adj. 傲慢的，专横的: an imperious movie star who thinks she's some sort of goddess 一个把自己当成某种女神的傲慢的影星
adj. 迫切的: As war casualties mounted, the need for trained nurses became imperious. 随着战争伤亡人数的攀升，对于受训护士的需求变得愈发迫切
imperious.mean:
adj. 爱发号施令的： fond of ordering people around
adj. 傲慢的，专横的： arrogantly domineering or overbearing
adj. 迫切的： intensely compelling

watershed.example: n. 重要关头，分水岭: a watershed moment in her life 她命运的分水岭
watershed.mean: n. 重要关头，分水岭： a crucial dividing point: turning point

affluent.example: adj. 富裕的: affluent society 富裕的社会
affluent.mean: adj. 富裕的： having a generously sufficient and typically increasing supply of material possessions

default.example: v. 拖欠(债务): default on a loan 拖欠贷款
default.mean: v. 拖欠(债务)： to fail to pay financial debts, the nonperformance of an assigned or expected action

genteel.example: adj. 有教养的，不粗俗的: Her genteel behaviors at the ball make others conjecture that she must come from a distinguished noble family. 舞会上她极有教养的举止让他人纷纷猜测她一定来自名门望族
genteel.mean: adj. 有教养的，不粗俗的： free from vulgarity or rudeness

gush.example:
v. 大量涌出: water gushing from the hydrant 水从消防栓中喷出
vi. 感情强烈外溢: an aunt gushing over the baby 对着婴儿母爱泛滥的姑姑
gush.mean:
v. 大量涌出： to flow forth suddenly in great volume
vi. 感情强烈外溢： to make an exaggerated display of affection or enthusiasm

substantive.example: adj. 本质的，关键的: The substantive information is their political stance. 关键的信息是他们的政治立场。
substantive.mean: adj. 本质的，关键的： of or relating to the essence or substance

cachet.example: n. 威望，声望: Federal courts have a certain cachet which state courts lack. 联邦法院拥有州立法院所不具备的威信。
cachet.mean: n. 威望，声望： a mark or quality, as of distinction, individuality, or authenticity

relapse.example: vi. 故态复萌，再犯: The patient wondered whether his illness would relapse. 病人想知道他的病会不会复发。
relapse.mean: vi. 故态复萌，再犯： to slip or fall back into a former worse state

rein.example:
n. 抑制，限制: The oversight committee called on the corporation to keep a much tighter rein on the activities of its contractors. 监督委员会要求这个公司对其承包商的行为采取更为严格的管控。
vi. 抑制，控制: A good man knows how to rein in his temper. 君子知道如何按捺住火气。
rein.mean:
n. 抑制，限制： the act or practice of keeping something (as an activity) within certain boundaries
vi. 抑制，控制： to keep from exceeding a desirable degree or level (as of expression)

exude.example: vi. 分泌，流出: a sticky resin exuded from the bark 从树皮中分泌出来的带有恶臭的树脂
exude.mean: vi. 分泌，流出：to flow forth slowly through small openings

preach.example: vi. 传道，布道: a minister who loves to preach 一个爱布道的牧师
preach.mean: vi. 传道，布道： to deliver a sermon

monochromatic.example:
adj. 单色的: monochromatic filter 单色滤光片
adj. 单调无聊的: a monochromatic article eulogizing a hero 一个无聊的赞颂英雄的文章
monochromatic.mean:
adj. 单色的： having or consisting of one color or hue
adj. 单调无聊的： lacking variety, creativity, or excitement

conform.example:
vt. 使协调: We have to conform this new rule with existing policy regarding student-run organizations on campus. 我们必须要让这些新规定与现行的校园学生社团的政策相协调。
vt. 调整（以适应）: I can be funny or serious, for I always conform my behavior to the situation. 我会根据情况调整举止，因此我有时候会很活泼，有时候会很严肃。
vi. 遵照，遵从: an independent-minded person who refuses to conform to another’s wishes 一个思想独立的拒绝遵照他人的意愿行动的人
conform.mean:
vt. 使协调： bring into harmony or accord
vt. 调整（以适应）： to change (something) so as to make it suitable for a new use or situation
vi. 遵照，遵从： to be obedient or compliant

chaperone.example: vt. 同行，护送: Three parents will chaperone the students on the school trip. 本次班级旅行将有三名家长同行。
chaperone.mean: vt. 同行，护送： to go along with in order to provide assistance, protection, or companionship

groggy.example:
adj. 虚弱的，（走路）不稳的: She was feeling a bit groggy when I saw her. 当我看到她的时候她显得有些走路不稳。
adj. 无法思考的，头脑不清的: I'm still a little groggy from my nap. 我还没完全从睡梦中清醒过来。‖The medicine sometimes makes patients groggy. 这种药偶尔会让病人产生醉酒一样的麻醉感。
groggy.mean:
adj. 虚弱的，（走路）不稳的： weak and unsteady on the feet or in action
adj. 无法思考的，头脑不清的： not able to think or move normally because of being tired, sick, etc.

turbulent.example:
adj. 动荡的: a turbulent period in history 历史上动荡时期
adj. 湍急的，汹涌的: the turbulent rapids of the river were certainly daunting to those of us who were new to river rafting 湍急的流水必定让那些初玩漂流的人们吓得不轻
turbulent.mean:
adj. 动荡的： marked by sudden or violent disturbance
adj. 湍急的，汹涌的： marked by turmoil or disturbance especially of natural elements

reiterate.example: v. 重申: Let me reiterate our stance. 让我来重述我们的立场。‖I want to reiterate that under no circumstances are you to leave the house. 我想再次重申：无论如何你都不能离开这间房子。
reiterate.mean: v. 重申： to say or state again

inkling.example:
n. 轻微暗示，小提示: They hadn't given us an inkling of what was going to happen. 他们不给我们任何暗示将会发生什么
n. 略知: not have even the faintest inkling of what the project was all about 对这个项目与什么有关毫不知情
inkling.mean:
n. 轻微暗示，小提示： a slight indication or suggestion
n. 略知： a slight knowledge or vague notion

legacy.example: n. 遗产: the legacy of the ancient philosophers 古代哲学家们的思想遗产
legacy.mean: n. 遗产： something handed down from an ancestor or a predecessor or from the past

ill-bred.example: adj. 没有教养的，没有礼貌的: Only an ill-bred, conceited person would demand that everyone cater to their whims. 只有一个没有教养、狂妄自大的人才会要求所有人都去迎合他的想法。
ill-bred.mean: adj. 没有教养的，没有礼貌的： badly brought up or showing bad upbringing: impolite

desperate.example: adj. 绝望的: a desperate spirit crying for relief 一个渴望宽慰的绝望的灵魂
desperate.mean: adj. 绝望的： feeling or showing no hope

luminous.example:
adj. 发光的，有光泽的: The luminous moon bathed the snow-covered fields with a pearly glow. 在明亮的月光下，雪地仿佛被罩上了一层珍珠般的光晕。
adj. 杰出的，重要的: some of the most luminous writers in the nation’s history 该国历史上最杰出的一批作家
luminous.mean:
adj. 发光的，有光泽的： emitting or reflecting usually steady, suffused, or glowing light
adj. 杰出的，重要的： standing above others in rank, importance, or achievement

liken.example: vt. 显示相似，比较: Life is often likened to a journey. 生活经常被比作一次旅行
liken.mean: vt. 显示相似，比较： to see, mention, or show as similar; compare

vilify.example: vt. 诽谤，辱骂: be vilified by the press because of her radical views 因为她激进的观点而被媒体抨击
vilify.mean: vt. 诽谤，辱骂： to utter slanderous and abusive statements against

partisan.example:
n. 跟随者，信徒: Partisans of the charismatic leader refuse to tolerate any criticism of him at all. 跟随者们不允许任何有关他们富有魅力的领导的负面言论
n. （狂热、坚定的）拥护者，支持者: a partisan of the revolution who was even willing to give her life for it 一个愿意为了革命献出自己生命的坚定拥护者
adj. 偏袒的: a shamelessly partisan news report 一篇无耻的、有倾向性的新闻报道
partisan.mean:
n. 跟随者，信徒： one who follows the opinions or teachings of another
n. （狂热、坚定的）拥护者，支持者： one who is intensely or excessively devoted to a cause
adj. 偏袒的： inclined to favor one side over another

complementary.example: adj. 互补的: The complementary contributions of the cooking and cleanup committees were essential to the success of the barbecue. 负责食物和卫生的两个小组之间的相互配合是野炊成功的关键。
complementary.mean: adj. 互补的： mutually supplying each other’s lack

diverge.example:
v. 改变方向: The deer abruptly diverged from its intended path the moment it spied the waiting lion. 当那只鹿发现潜伏的狮子的时候就突然改变了自己原来的路线。
vt. 散开: At that point the road and the railroad tracks diverge. 公路和铁路在那个点分叉了。
diverge.mean:
v. 改变方向： to change one's course or direction
vt. 散开： to go or move in different directions from a central point
v. 分歧： to become or be different in character or form: differ in opinion
vt. 离题： to depart from a set course or norm; deviate

lug.example:
vt. 拖动，拉动: lugged the lawn mower out into the backyard 把割草机拖进院子
vt. 费力搬运: I don't understand why he's always lugging all of his books around when his locker is right over there. 我真搞不懂为什么他总是明明在有锁柜的情况下还随身扛着所有的书
lug.mean:
vt. 拖动，拉动： to cause to follow by applying steady force on
vt. 费力搬运： to carry laboriously

sabotage.example:
n. 妨害，破坏: sabotage of the project by government officials 被政府官员阻止的项目
vt. 从事破坏活动，阻止: He sabotaged his opponent's campaign with rumors. 他用谣言来破坏对手的竞选活动。‖My ex-wife deliberately sabotages my access to the children. 我的前妻故意想方设法阻止我和我的孩子们见面。
sabotage.mean:
n. 妨害，破坏： treacherous action to defeat or hinder a cause or an endeavor; deliberate subversion
vt. 从事破坏活动，阻止：to practice sabotage on

browbeat.example: vt. 恐吓: They would often browbeat the younger child until he cried. 他们总是把小朋友欺负到哭为止。
browbeat.mean: vt. 恐吓： to intimidate by a stern manner or arrogant speech: bully

retentive.example: adj. 记性好的: Her retentive memory helped her sail through the history test. 她的好记性帮助她顺利通过了历史考试。
retentive.mean: adj. 记性好的： having the ability or capacity to retain knowledge or information with ease

ken.example: n. 视野范围: abstract words that are beyond the ken of children 那些孩子们不能理解的抽象字词
ken.mean:
n. 视野范围： the range of vision
vt. 知道、了解（人或物）： to know (a person or thing)

jot.example: vt .简要记录: jot down an address 简要地记下地址
jot.mean: vt .简要记录： to write briefly or hurriedly

grumble.example: vi. （尤指低声地）抱怨，埋怨: The governed will always find something to grumble about. (Crane Brinton) 被统治者总能找到发牢骚的理由。——瑞恩?布林顿
grumble.mean: vi. （尤指低声地）抱怨，埋怨： to complain in a surly manner; mutter discontentedly

specious.example: adj. 似是而非的，欺骗性的: a specious argument that really does not stand up under close examination 一段经不起仔细推敲的论证
specious.mean: adj. 似是而非的，欺骗性的： having a false look of truth or genuineness

jog.example: vi. 唤起: an old photo that might jog your memory 一张也许会唤起你回忆的老照片
jog.mean:
n. 慢跑： a movement, pace, or instance of jogging (as for exercise)
vi. 唤起： to rouse or stimulate

mulish.example: adj. 固执的: a mulish determination to act on his own 铁了心要单打独斗
mulish.mean: adj. 固执的： unreasonably and inflexibly obstinate

embed.example: vt. 嵌入: The thorn was embedded in her thumb. 刺扎入了她的拇指
embed.mean: vt. 嵌入： to enclose closely in or as if in a matrix

solace.example:
n. 安慰: The kind words brought a little solace to the grieving widow. 这些同情的话语给痛苦的寡妇带来了些许安慰。
vt. 安慰，安抚: I did their my to solace those bereaved children. 我尽力去安抚那些失去双亲的孩子们。
solace.mean:
n. 安慰： comfort in sorrow, misfortune, or distress
vt. 安慰，安抚： to comfort, cheer, or console, as in trouble or sorrow

tantrum.example: n. 勃然大怒，发脾气: had a tantrum 大发脾气
tantrum.mean: n. 勃然大怒，发脾气： a fit of bad temper

charlatan.example: n. 骗子: the famed broker turned out to be a charlatan 一位有声望的经纪人结果是个骗子
charlatan.mean: n. 骗子： a person who makes elaborate, fraudulent, and often voluble claims to skill or knowledge; a quack or fraud.

inundate.example: vt. 淹没: inundated with trash e-mails 被垃圾邮件所淹没
inundate.mean: vt. 淹没： to cover with or as if with flood

asunder.example:
adv. 分离成多部分或多片: broken asunder 打碎
adv. 分离成多部分或多片: Buildings were burst asunder. 建筑物已经被炸成碎片了。
adv. 分离: A quite conscience sleeps in thunder, but rest and guilt live far asunder. 平静的良心能在雷声中入睡，而安宁和负罪则无法毗邻。
adv. 分离: Our opinions are wide as the poles asunder. 我们的意见完全相反。
asunder.mean:
adv. 分离成多部分或多片：into separate parts or pieces
adv. 分离：apart from each other in position

diligent.example: adj. 勤勉的，辛勤的: A new bride is diligent for three days. 新娶媳妇三日勤。|| a student who has been unceasingly diligent in pursuit of a degree in mathematics. 一个不断勤奋追求数学学位的学生
diligent.mean: adj. 勤勉的，辛勤的： characterized by steady, earnest, and energetic effort: painstaking

roil.example:
vt. 搅浑，使混乱: He roiled the brook with his wood stick. 他用他的木棍将溪水搅浑。‖Financial markets have been roiled by the banking crisis. 银行业的危机搅乱了金融市场的秩序。
vt. 激怒: Some of his roommate’s habits began to roil him. 他室友的某些习惯开始让他恼火。
roil.mean:
vt. 搅浑，使混乱： to stir up; disorder
vt. 激怒： to displease or disturb

diehard.example: adj. 顽固的，保守的/ n. 顽固的人，保守的人: Some diehard smokers belied the doctors’ suggestion. 一些顽固的烟民违背了医生们的建议。
diehard.mean: adj. 顽固的，保守的/ n. 顽固的人，保守的人： strongly or fanatically determined or devoted/ someone who opposes change and refuses to accept new ideas

careen.example:
vi. 蹒跚而行，不稳地行走: He careened unsteadily to the couch after hitting his head. 在撞到头以后，他摇摇摆摆地走向沙发。
vi. 狂奔，快速运动: Sounding its siren, an ambulance careened through the intersection. 救护车响着警笛飞驰通过十字路口。
careen.mean:
vi. 蹒跚而行，不稳地行走： to lurch or swerve while in motion
vi. 狂奔，快速运动： to rush headlong or carelessly

retrograde.example:
adj. 倒退的: This is a retrograde step and you will regret it. 这是后退的一步，你以后肯定会后悔的。
v. 退步，退化: The Dark Ages is the period following the fall of the Roman Empire when Western civilization seriously retrograded. “黑暗时代”指的是罗马帝国崩溃之后，西方文明严重退步的一个历史时期。
retrograde.mean:
adj. 倒退的： moving or tending backward
v. 退步，退化： to decline to a worse condition

smother.example:
vt. 使窒息: Children should never be leftin cars alone because they could become trapped and smothered. 小孩子不应该被单独留在车中，因为他们很容易因而被困并且窒息死亡。
vt. 抑制（表达、说出），压制: He quickly smothered his inappropriate laughter at the funeral ceremony. 他很快就控制住了自己在葬礼上不适当的笑声。‖Management smothered the true facts of the case. 管理层隐瞒了案件的真相。
smother.mean:
vt. 使窒息： to be or cause to be killed by lack of breathable air
vt. 抑制（表达、说出），压制： to refrain from openly showing or uttering

placebo.example: n. 安慰性的事物: Candies are often adopted as the placebo for the dying patients. 糖果通常作为安慰剂给重症患者服用。
placebo.mean: n. 安慰性的事物： something of no intrinsic remedial value that is used to appease or reassure another

temporal.example: adj. 世俗的，尘世的: The master told his disciples not to worry about temporal concerns, but instead focus on spiritual matters. 大师要弟子们不要为尘世间的纷争而苦恼，而是将精神集中于灵魂上的思考。
temporal.mean: adj. 世俗的，尘世的： of or relating to earthly life

reconstitute.example: vt. 重建，（尤其是通过加水）使复原: reconstitute dried coffee powder冲咖啡‖Slowly Jewish communities ravaged by Nazi Germany were reconstituted and life began anew.被纳粹德国摧残的犹太人社区慢慢得以重建，新的生活开始了。
reconstitute.mean: vt. 重建，（尤其是通过加水）使复原： to constitute again or anew; to restore to a former condition, especiallyby adding water

fester.example: v. 感染溃烂，腐烂: A dirty wound will probably fester. 伤口弄脏了有可能会化脓
fester.mean: v. 感染溃烂，腐烂： to infect, inflame, or corrupt

relevant.example: adj. 有关系的，重要的: Make sure your answers during the interview are short and relevant. 确保你在面试时的回答简短而恰当。‖You need to bring all the relevant certificates with you. 你需要携带所有的相关证明。
relevant.mean: adj. 有关系的，重要的： having a bearing on or connection with the matter at hand

deracinate.mean: vt. 根除： to pull out by the roots; uproot

dispose.example:
vt. 使倾向: faulty diet disposes one to sickness 营养不全面导致疾病
vt. 使倾向: not feel disposed to argue with her 不喜欢与她争执
vi. 处理掉（与of连用，dispose of）: the permanent disposal of radioactive wastes 对放射性废物的永久处理
v. 布置有序: Dispose the surgical instruments in the exact order in which they would be needed. 把手术仪器按他们被需要的顺序放置。
dispose.mean:
vt. 使倾向： to give a tendency to: incline
vi. 处理掉（与of连用，dispose of）： to get rid of; throw out
v. 布置有序： to place, distribute, or arrange especially in an orderly way

commend.example:
vt. 赞扬: Jason commended his students' studious attitude. Jason表扬了他的学生的用功的态度。
vt. 委托保管: I commend my fate into your hands. 我的命运就拜托给你了。
vt. 推荐: I commend this book to anyone interested in learning more about American history. 我把这本书推荐给所有对美国历史感兴趣的人。
commend.mean:
vt. 赞扬：to mention with approbation: praise
vt. 委托保管：to entrust for care or preservation
vt. 推荐：to recommend as worthy of confidence or notice

surrogate.example: n. 替代品: For some people, Google Earth is never a justified surrogate for actual travel. 对于一部分人而言，谷歌地球决不是旅行的合理替代品。
surrogate.mean: n. 替代品： one that takes the place of another

indict.example: vt. 起诉，控告: indict the mayor for fraud and embezzlement. 起诉市长受贿和挪用公款
indict.mean: vt. 起诉，控告： to accuse of wrongdoing; charge

worldly.example:
adj. 世间的，世俗的: preoccupied with worldly concerns 纠缠于世俗的忧虑‖It is time you woke up and focused your thoughts on more worldly matters. 现在你应该停止做梦然后把自己的精力集中在更现实的问题上了。
adj. 老练的: My little sister was worldly and sophisticated, quite unlike me. 与我截然不同的是，我的妹妹在为人处世方面非常老练。
worldly.mean:
adj. 世间的，世俗的： of this world rather than spiritual or religion affairs
adj. 老练的： experienced in human affairs

sprawl.example: vt. 杂乱无序地发展: The city sprawls down the whole coast. 城市顺着整条海岸线蔓延。
sprawl.mean: vt. 杂乱无序地发展： to grow, develop, or spread irregularly and without apparent design or plan

scrimp.example: vi. 节俭: They had to scrimp and save for years in order to be able to afford a house. 他们不得不节俭度日才能攒够钱买房。
scrimp.mean: vi. 节俭： to avoid unnecessary waste or expense

muddy.example:
adj. 不干净的: got muddy after playing outside 在外面玩弄得很脏
adj. 浑浊的，不清晰的: a muddy recording 嘈杂不清的纪录
v. 使难以理解: That point is irrelevant and will just muddy the issue we're trying to resolve. 那个观点和讨论我们的问题毫不相干，它只会妨碍我们对于问题的理解
muddy.mean:
adj. 不干净的： not clean
adj. 浑浊的，不清晰的： lacking in clarity or brightness
v. 使难以理解： to make (something) unclear to the understanding

quaver.example: vt. 发颤音: His voice quavered during the speech. 整个演讲过程中，他的声音都是颤抖的。
quaver.mean: vt. 发颤音： to speak in a quivering voice; utter a quivering sound

permanent.example: adj. 永恒的: A temporary compromise has been accepted until a more permanent solution can be agreed upon. 在更为持久的决案被通过之前，一个暂时性的妥协方案被接受了
permanent.mean: adj. 永恒的： continuing or enduring without fundamental or marked change; lasting forever

stentorian.example: adj. 声音洪亮的: an tenor with a stentorian voice 拥有洪亮声音的男高音‖The professor's stentorian voice was enough to keep even the drowsiest student awake. 教授洪亮的声音足以使最困的学生保持清醒。
stentorian.mean: adj. 声音洪亮的： extremely loud

qualify.example:
vt. 限定: qualified support 有限的支持
v. 使有资格，有能力: raising five children has qualified her to be an advice columnist on parenting 抚养五个孩子的经历让她成为了育儿板块的专栏作家
qualify.mean:
vt. 限定： to reduce from a general to a particular or restricted form
v. 使有资格，有能力： to make competent (as by training, skill, or ability) for a particular office or function

restrain.example: vt. 限制，控制: The old lady restrained the child from picking the flowers. 老妇人不准孩子们采摘花朵。
restrain.mean: vt. 限制，控制： to limit, restrict, or keep under control

curtail.example: vt. 缩短，削减: curtail your holiday 缩短你的假期
curtail.mean: vt. 缩短，削减： to make less in extent or duration

protuberant.example: adj. 隆起的，凸出的: protuberant eyes 暴鱼眼
protuberant.mean: adj. 隆起的，凸出的： thrusting out from a surrounding or adjacent surface often as a rounded mass

diversity.example:
n. 多样性: the diversity of species 物种的多样性
n. 分歧，不同点: There is no fundamental diversity between the two ideologies. 这两种思想意识之间并没有根本的分歧。
diversity.mean:
n. 多样性： variety or multiformity
n. 分歧，不同点：the quality or state of being different

retrospective.example: adj. 回顾的: a retrospective glance at my youth 朝我少年时代投去的回顾性一瞥
retrospective.mean: adj. 回顾的： looking back on, contemplating, or directed to the past

sepulchral.example: adj.阴沉的，丧葬的: the decrepit mansion had a sepulchral tone that gave everybody a chill 破旧的公馆有着一种坟墓的气息，让人皆为之一颤
sepulchral.mean: adj.阴沉的，丧葬的： causing or marked by an atmosphere lacking in cheer; funereal

jaded.example:
adj. 疲惫的: After that long bar exam, I'm too jaded for anything but a nap. 律师资格考试结束后，我累得只想睡觉
adj. 厌倦的，没兴趣没热情的: Even jaded sci-fi fans are finding this new space adventure fresh and exciting. 即使是见多识广、口味很挑的科幻小说忠粉也觉得这次的太空探险非常新鲜有趣
jaded.mean:
adj. 疲惫的： depleted in strength, energy, or freshness
adj. 厌倦的，没兴趣没热情的： having one's patience, interest, or pleasure exhausted

assert.example:
vt. 断言，肯定地说出: asserted one’s innocence.坚称自己无罪
vt. 断言，肯定地说出: He asserted that there were corrupt officials in the government. 他断言道政府里面一定存在腐败的官员。
assert.mean: vt. 断言，肯定地说出：to state or declare positively and often forcefully or aggressively

veteran.example:
n. 老兵，有丰富经验的人: As a veteran of overseas travel, she offered us solid advice about planning our trip. 作为一名资深的旅行家，她给了我们提供了许多关于旅行规划的中肯建议。
adj. 经验丰富的，资深的: She is a veteran teacher who can mentor new teachers. 她的教师资历都老到可以教新教师了。
veteran.mean:
n. 老兵，有丰富经验的人： one having knowledge or ability gained through long experience
adj. 经验丰富的，资深的： having or showing exceptional knowledge, experience, or skill in a field of endeavor

shiftless.example: adj. 胸无大志，懒惰的: shiftless spongers who never thought to do anything for themselves 无志气的弃民们，从来没有想过改变自己
shiftless.mean: adj. 胸无大志，懒惰的： lacking in ambition or incentive: lazy

derivative.example: adj. 非原创的: their dull, derivative debut album 他们毫无新义的首张专辑
derivative.mean: adj. 非原创的： lacking originality: banal

prescription.mean: n. 规定，传统的规矩： something prescribed as a rule; especially an inherited or established way of thinking, feeling, or doing

altruism.example: n. 利他主义: Ambition that is masked as altruism. 在利他主义掩盖下的野心。
altruism.mean: n. 利他主义：unselfish regard for or devotion to the welfare of others

banish.example:
vt. 驱逐出境: Since the diplomatic relation between the two nations has been broken, diplomats were all banished. 随着两国外交关系的断裂，所有的外交人员都被驱逐出境
vt. 赶出: permanently banished the troublemakers from the youth recreational center 永久剥夺肇事者进入青年娱乐中心的权力
banish.mean:
vt. 驱逐出境：to require by authority to leave a country
vt. 赶出：to drive or force out

novel.example: adj. 新奇的: a novel scheme to collect money 一种新颖的筹钱手段
novel.mean: adj. 新奇的： strikingly new, unusual, or different

veer.example: v. 转向，改变航线: He veered the car abruptly to the right to avoid a collision. 他向右猛打方向盘以避免撞击
veer.mean: v. 转向，改变航线： to change direction or course

sanctify.example: vt. 使神圣，敬为神: The Constitution sanctified the rights of the people. 宪法认为人权是至高无上的。
sanctify.mean: vt. 使神圣，敬为神： to make holy

intimidate.example: vt. 威吓: refused to be intimidated by the manager 对经理的恐吓不为所动
intimidate.mean: vt. 威吓： to make timid or fearful, frighten

steep.example:
vt. 浸泡: steep the tea for five minutes 浸泡茶叶五分钟
adj. 陡峭的: a very steep rock face that is nearly impossible to climb 一面非常陡峭以至于不可能攀爬的岩石
adj. 过分的，过高的: We would like to hire him, but his salary demands are just too steep. 我们很想雇用他，可是他对于薪水的要求实在是太高了。
steep.mean:
vt. 浸泡： to make thoroughly wet
adj. 陡峭的： having an incline approaching the perpendicular
adj. 过分的，过高的： going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount

align.example:
vt. 排成一行: align the cars with the curb 使车与路缘对齐
vt. 调准，校准: align the wheels of the truck 调整卡车的轮子
align.mean:
vt. 排成一行： to bring into line or alignment
vt. 调准，校准： to adjust to produce a proper relationship or orientation

ripen.example: v. 使成熟，成熟: Age ripens a good wine. 时间酿出好酒
ripen.mean: v. 使成熟，成熟： to make or become ripe or riper

irate.example: adj. 极其愤怒的: an irate taxpayer 极为愤怒的纳税人
irate.mean: adj. 极其愤怒的： extremely angry

ensconce.example:
vt. 安置: ensconce in a new job 在一个新职位安定下来
v. 隐藏: ensconced the spare house key in a place where no thief would think to look 把备用钥匙藏在小偷根本不会注意的地方
ensconce.mean:
vt. 安置： to settle (oneself) securely or comfortably
v. 隐藏： to put in a hiding place

excursive.example: adj. 离题的；散漫的: an excursive story line that some readers of Melville's novel find very rewarding 一些梅尔维尔小说的读者非常喜欢松散的故事主线
excursive.mean: adj. 离题的；散漫的： passing from one topic to another

lassitude.example: n. 乏力，没精打采: Symptoms of anaemia include general fatigue and lassitude. 贫血的通常症状包括体虚和乏力
lassitude.mean: n. 乏力，没精打采： a state or feeling of weariness, diminished energy, or listlessness

amenity.example:
n. （环境，设备等的）舒适，人性化: the amenity of the new surroundings 新环境的宜人之处
n. 融洽，和谐: a discussion conducted in perfect amenity 在和谐融洽的气氛中进行的讨论
amenity.mean:
n. （环境，设备等的）舒适，人性化：something that conduces to comfort, convenience, or enjoyment
n. 融洽，和谐：the quality of being pleasant or agreeable

concerted.example: adj. 共同完成的: The ITER project, commendable though it is, should be merely a component of a concerted effort. “国际热核聚变实验堆”计划虽然是值得称赞的，但是它仅仅是（人类）齐心协力的一部分。|| A victory results from the concerted effort of the entire team. 一项成功来自于整个团队的齐心协力。
concerted.mean: adj. 共同完成的：planned or accomplished together

dissent.example:
v. 持异议，不同意: I dissent from what you said. 我不同意你说的话。|| Anyone who dissented was encouraged to speak out while they had the chance. 谁有异议得到机会都可以发言。
n. 反对正统: The church reacted to any form of dissent by promptly excommunicating its proponents. 教堂会立即开除任何反对正统教义的人。
dissent.mean:
v. 持异议，不同意： to differ in opinion
n. 反对正统： departure from a generally accepted theory, opinion, or practice
n. 不和谐： a lack of agreement or harmony

delusion.example: n. 错觉: This was not optimism, it was delusion. 那不是乐观主义，那是错觉。
delusion.mean: n. 错觉： a false idea

lush.example:
adj. 茂盛的: lush grass 茂盛的草
adj. 多产的: His lush fields were the envy of neighboring farmers. 他富饶多产的土地让邻居羡慕嫉妒恨
adj. （声音、味道）优美的，令人愉悦的: the lush sounds of the orchestra 管弦乐队奏出的悦耳声音
lush.mean:
adj. 茂盛的： growing vigorously especially with luxuriant foliage
adj. 多产的： producing abundantly
adj. （声音、味道）优美的，令人愉悦的： appealing to the senses

hearten.example: vt. 给予鼓励，鼓舞: thinking we were hopelessly lost, we were heartened by the sight of a familiar farmhouse 悲催地以为我们完全迷路了，前方一座熟悉的农场给了我们新的希望
hearten.mean: vt. 给予鼓励，鼓舞： to give strength, courage, or hope to; encourage

incense.example:
n. 芳香: the heavenly incense of spring flowers 春天花朵发出的美妙芳香
vt. 激怒: This proposal will certainly incense female activists. 这个提案肯定会激怒女权主义者
incense.mean:
n. 芳香： a sweet or pleasant smell
vt. 激怒： to cause to be extremely angry

conserve.example: vt. 保存，避免浪费: conserve natural resources 保护自然资源
conserve.mean: vt. 保存，避免浪费： to keep in a safe or sound state, especially to avoid wasteful or destructive use

ostentatious.example: adj. 炫耀卖弄的: wears an ostentatious diamond ring on her finger 她手指上戴着一枚巨大的钻戒
ostentatious.mean: adj. 炫耀卖弄的： marked by or fond of conspicuous or vainglorious and sometimes pretentious display

dilate.example:
vt. 使膨胀，扩大: The cat dilated its eyes in the darkness. 猫在黑暗中睁大眼睛。|| The drug dilates the blood vessels. 药使血管膨胀。
v. 详细表达: He refused to dilate upon his plan for improving the economy in the event that he won the election. 他拒绝在他赢得选举的情况下透露更多关于振兴经济计划的细节。
dilate.mean:
vt. 使膨胀，扩大： to enlarge or expand in bulk or extent；to become wide
v. 详细表达： to express more fully and in greater detail

untoward.example:
adj. 倒霉的，不吉利的: an untoward incident 不幸的事故
adj. 难以驯服的，难以驾驭的: a program for untoward teenagers that is designed to give them the kind of discipline that their parents were unable or unwilling to administer 一个以任性、桀骜不驯青少年为对象的项目，旨在弥补家长管教不周之处
untoward.mean:
adj. 倒霉的，不吉利的： not favorable, unpropitious
adj. 难以驯服的，难以驾驭的： given to resisting control or discipline by others

eulogize.example: vt. 称赞；颂扬: He was eulogized at his funeral as a caring husband and a good father. 他在悼词中被称赞为一个好丈夫、一个好爸爸。
eulogize.mean: vt. 称赞；颂扬： to speak or write in high praise of

propensity.example: n. 倾向，癖好: a neighbor who has an unfortunate propensity for snooping 好管闲事的邻居
propensity.mean: n. 倾向，癖好： an often intense natural inclination or preference

painstaking.example: adj. 煞费苦心的: It took months of painstaking research to write the book. 这本书的写作耗费了几个月的苦心研究。
painstaking.mean: adj. 煞费苦心的： taking pains: expending, showing, or involving diligent care and effort

squelch.example:
vt. 压制，镇压（运动）: The authority tried to squelch the workers’ protest. 政府试图镇压工人的游行。
vt. 击溃，使无言以对: His irritated glare squelched any other potential objectors. 他怒目而视，使得其他的反对者都不敢说话。
squelch.mean:
vt. 压制，镇压（运动）： to put a stop to (something) by the use of force
vt. 击溃，使无言以对： to put down or silence, as with a crushing retort

incumbent.example: adj. 义不容辞的，必须的: It is incumbent upon individuals to sacrifice for their country when it is in danger. 当国家受难时，个人应该义不容辞地为国做出牺牲。‖It is incumbent upon the press to act not in its own best interests, but in society's best interests. 对于媒体来说，为社会的利益（而非自身利益）服务是其应尽的义务。
incumbent.mean: adj. 义不容辞的，必须的： imposed as an obligation or duty

eclectic.example: adj. 混合的，多元化的: The museum’s eclectic collection has everything from a giraffe skeleton to medieval musical instruments. 博物馆里的展品丰富多样，从长颈鹿的骨架到中世纪的乐器都有。
eclectic.mean: adj. 混合的，多元化的： composed of elements drawn from various sources

disciple.example: n. 信徒，追随者: A circle of dedicated disciples who conscientiously wrote down everything the prophet said. 一圈忠实的信徒认真的记下了先知所说的话。
disciple.mean: n. 信徒，追随者： one who accepts and assists in spreading the doctrines of another, follower

grandeur.example: n. 高尚，重要: the glory that was Greece and the grandeur that was Rome 希腊的荣耀和罗马的辉煌
grandeur.mean: n. 高尚，重要： nobility or greatness of character

garish.example: adj. 过于鲜艳的，过于张扬的: With garish makeup on, she looks exceedingly frivolous. 浓妆艳抹之下的她显得格外轻佻
garish.mean: adj. 过于鲜艳的，过于张扬的： marked by strident color or excessive ornamentation

balm.example:
n. 香油，止痛膏，安慰物: Friendship is the finest balm in need. 危难关头，友情是最好的安慰
n. 香气: The balm of the restaurant's backyard garden enhances the aura of romance. 餐馆后院传来的阵阵芳香增加了浪漫的情调
balm.mean:
n. 香油，止痛膏，安慰物： a sweet-smelling oil that heals wounds or reduce pain
n. 香气： a sweet or pleasant smell

balk.example: v. 不愿接受，拒绝: She balked at the very idea of compromise. 她固执地拒绝妥协的想法
balk.mean:
v. 阻碍： to check or stop by or as if by an obstacle
v. 不愿接受，拒绝： to show unwillingness to accept, do, engage in, or agree to

reactionary.example: dj. 反对变革的，极保守的: reactionary rulers 保守的统治者
reactionary.mean: dj. 反对变革的，极保守的： characterized by reaction, especially opposition to progress or liberalism; extremely conservative

eccentric.example: adj. 行为出格的，不循规蹈矩的: an eccentric millionaire 行为怪异的百万富翁
eccentric.mean: adj. 行为出格的，不循规蹈矩的： deviating from conventional or accepted usage or conduct

bale.example: n. 痛苦，悲哀: relieve spirit from the bale 从悲痛中解脱
bale.mean: n. 痛苦，悲哀： woe, sorrow

synchronous.example: adj 同时期的，同相的: The synchronous arrival of a baby sister and loss of a beloved grandmother strongly affected the girl. 妹妹的出生和奶奶的去世同时发生，给小姑娘造成了巨大的影响
synchronous.mean: adj 同时期的，同相的： having identical period and phase

stygian.example: adj. 极黑暗的: the stygian blackness of the cave 山洞里令人恐惧的黑暗
stygian.mean: adj. 极黑暗的： extremely dark, gloomy, or forbidding

grandstand.example: vi. 为了给人留下印象而表演，哗众取宠: to grandstand on the stage 在舞台上哗众取宠
grandstand.mean: vi. 为了给人留下印象而表演，哗众取宠： to play or act so as to impress onlookers

vault.example:
vi. 跳起，跳跃: The horse vaulted over the obstacle with ease. 骏马轻松地跃过障碍物。
vi. 一跃而至: She vaulted into a position of wealth. 她一夜暴富。
vault.mean:
vi. 跳起，跳跃： to propel oneself upward or forward into the air
vi. 一跃而至： to accomplish something as if by leaping suddenly or vigorously

infinite.example: adj. 无尽的，无限的: the idea of an infinite universe 无限宇宙的概念
infinite.mean: adj. 无尽的，无限的： having no boundaries or limits

impeccable.example:
adj. 无罪的: the belief that there can be no such thing as an impeccable soul 不相信存在无罪的灵魂
adj. 无瑕的，无可挑剔的: She had impeccable taste in clothes. 她有着无可挑剔的穿衣品味
impeccable.mean:
adj. 无罪的： free from sin, guilt or blame
adj. 无瑕的，无可挑剔的： free from fault or blame

mosaic.example: n. 综合物，马赛克般的东西: a mosaic of testimony from various witnesses 从不同证人中得来的综合证词
mosaic.mean: n. 综合物，马赛克般的东西： an unorganized collection or mixture of various things

besmirch.example:
v. 弄脏，弄污: besmirched the white bed sheets with their dirty hands 用他们的脏手把白床单弄脏了
v. 诽谤，玷污: besmirch your reputation by fabricating scandals 通过捏造丑闻来玷污你的名声
besmirch.mean:
v. 弄脏，弄污： to make dirty; soil
v. 诽谤，玷污： to detract from the honor or luster of

compendium.example:
n. 摘要: a compendium of information 资料概要
n. 摘要: his compendious knowledge of this subject 他关于这一学科全面的知识
目录: Compendium of Materia Medica 《本草纲目》
compendium.mean:
n. 摘要：a brief summary of a larger work or of a field of knowledge: abstract
目录：各种项目的列表或集合：a list or collection of various items.

retard.example: vt. 减速，延迟: Language barriers retarded their negotiating progress. 语言障碍让谈判进程受阻。
retard.mean: vt. 减速，延迟： to cause to move or proceed slowly; delay or impede

partition.example: n. 分割，划分: the partition of Czechoslovakia into the Czech Republic and Slovakia 捷克斯洛伐克被分裂成捷克共和国和斯洛伐克
partition.mean: n. 分割，划分： the act or process of dividing something into parts

fascinate.example: vt. 强列吸引，使入迷: toys that fascinate infants 吸引婴儿们的玩具
fascinate.mean: vt. 强列吸引，使入迷： to hold an intense interest or attraction for

trudge.example: vi. 吃力而笨拙地走: trudge over hill 翻山越岭
trudge.mean: vi. 吃力而笨拙地走： to move heavily or clumsily

glower.example: vi. 怒目而视: Baseball fans glowering at their TVs as they watched their favorite team lose. 看着他们支持的球队输球，棒球迷们恶狠狠地盯着电视屏幕。‖He just glowered without speaking. 他一言不发地怒视着我。
glower.mean: vi. 怒目而视： to look or stare with sullen annoyance or anger

enamored.example: adj. 迷恋的，热爱的: Many teenage girls became enamored of the movie idol for her boyish good looks. 很多年轻的女孩子因为影星男性化的帅气面庞而对她深深迷恋。
enamored.mean: adj. 迷恋的，热爱的： filled with an intense or excessive love for

nebulous.example: adj. 模糊的: a nebulous description of the topic 对于主题的模糊描述

rife.example: adj. 丰富的，普遍的: a video game rife with violence and abuse 充满暴力与虐待的电子游戏
rife.mean: adj. 丰富的，普遍的： possessing or covered with great numbers or amounts of something specified

contumacious.example: adj. 不服从的，倔强的: Contumacious insurgents refuse to talk. 不愿服从命令的叛军拒绝对话
contumacious.mean: adj. 不服从的，倔强的： stubbornly disobedient; rebellious

drone.example:
vt. 单调地说: droning bees 嗡嗡作响的蜜蜂
n.（昆虫振翅般）单调的声音: heard the drone of an helicopter overhead 听到了头顶直升机单调的声音
v. 混日子: Instead of getting a job, he preferred to drone and live off his parents. 相对于找个工作来说，他更喜欢什么也不做，依靠他的父母过日子
drone.mean:
vt. 单调地说： to talk in a persistently dull or monotonous tone
n.（昆虫振翅般）单调的声音： a monotonous sound like that of an insect in motion
v. 混日子： to spend time doing nothing

spectator.example: n. 观众，目击者，旁观者: join the organization as temporary spectator 作为短期观察员加入该组织‖The accident attracted a large crowd of spectators. 事故引来了大量的围观群众。
spectator.mean: n. 观众，目击者，旁观者： one who looks on or watches

mottle.example: vt. 标记上杂色斑点: a black horse mottled with white 身上带有白色斑点的黑马
mottle.mean: vt. 标记上杂色斑点： to mark with spots or blotches of different shades or colors

awning.example: n. 雨篷，遮阳篷: stayed under the awning outside the Starbucks during the rainstorm 在星巴克外面的遮阳棚里躲雨
awning.mean: n. 雨篷，遮阳篷： a piece of material attached to a caravan or building which provides shelter from the rain or sun

knotty.example: adj. 多结的，复杂的，困难的: The candidates cautiously gave their views on an array of knotty issues. 候选人就一系列的困难问题谨慎地给出了自己的看法
knotty.mean: adj. 多结的，复杂的，困难的：marked by or full of knots especially: so full of difficulties and complications as to be likely to defy solution

simile.example: n. 明喻: Even though both similes and metaphors are forms of comparison, similes indirectly compare the two ideas and allow them to remain distinct in spite of their similarities, whereas metaphors compare two things directly. For instance, a simile that compares a person with a bullet would go as follows: "Chris was a record-setting runner as fast as a speeding bullet." A metaphor might read something like, "When Chris ran, he was a speeding bullet racing along the track." 尽管明喻和暗喻都是比喻的手法，明喻会间接地对两个对象进行比较，同时允许差异的存在，而暗喻则直接对两者进行比较。比如说，用明喻来把一个人比作子弹会这样说：“克里斯是一个不断打破记录的选手，他跑得就和高速子弹一样快。”而暗喻可能会说：“当克里斯奔跑的时候，他就是一颗在赛场上高速飞行的子弹。”
simile.mean: n. 明喻： a figure of speech comparing two unlike things that is often introduced by like or as

draconian.example: adj. 极其残酷的；十分严厉的: abolish a draconian legal code 废除一部严酷的法典
draconian.mean: adj. 极其残酷的；十分严厉的： exceedingly harsh; very severe

placid.example:
adj. 宁静的，风平浪静的: a vacation in the placid lake community 在宁静的湖区度过的假日
adj. 冷静的，淡定的: I know an exceptionally placid mother who was rarely upset by her six children 我认识一个异常淡定的母亲，她几乎从未因为自己的六个孩子而烦恼过。
placid.mean:
adj. 宁静的，风平浪静的： free from storms or physical disturbance
adj. 冷静的，淡定的： free from emotional or mental agitation

cameo.example:
n. 栩栩如生的描绘: a literary cameo 文学描写
v. 客串: She cameoed as Anne Boleyn in A Man for All Seasons. 在所有季节的人中她客串安妮?波列思。
cameo.mean:
n. 栩栩如生的描绘： 一种简洁的、生动的描述或刻画： a brief, vivid portrayal or depiction
v. 客串： to make a brief but dramatic appearance, as in a film

discord.example: n. 意见不一致，不和谐: No discord, no concord. 不打不成交。
discord.mean: n. 意见不一致，不和谐： lack of agreement or harmony (as between persons, things, or ideas)

humdrum.example:
n. 千篇一律，单调: She has been loathing the humdrum of daily life in a small town for a long time. 一直以来她很反感于小城镇里一成不变的生活。
adj. 无聊的，乏味的: trapped in a humdrum but well-paid job 陷于无聊但是收入可观的工作之中
humdrum.mean:
n. 千篇一律，单调： a tedious lack of variety
adj. 无聊的，乏味的： lacking variety or excitement

glut.example: v. 使过量，使充满: glut himself with Sushi 吃寿司吃撑了
glut.mean: v. 使过量，使充满： to fill beyond capacity, especially with food

inveigle.example: vt. 诱骗: inveigle consumers into buying the item 诱骗顾客购买商品
inveigle.mean: vt. 诱骗： to win over by coaxing, flattery, or artful talk

evince.example: vt. 表明: evince a strong desire 明显地表现出强烈的欲望
evince.mean: vt. 表明： to make known (something abstract) through outward signs

interim.example:
n. 中间过渡时期，间隔: Richard Wagner’s operas usually require an interim of more than 30 minutes for performers to have a break. 理查德?瓦格纳的歌剧通常需要长达30多分钟的幕间休息时间以供演员调整
adj. 暂时的: an interim government to maintain social stability 维持社会稳定的临时政府
interim.mean:
n. 中间过渡时期，间隔： an interval of time between one event, process, or period and another
adj. 暂时的： serving in a position for the time being

surpass.example:
vt. 超越，强于: She always tried to surpass her older brother at anything he did, which results in his diffidence. 她在任何一个方面都要比她哥哥优秀，由此导致了他自信心的匮乏。
vt. 突破（界限，纪录等）: The sales of the band's newest CD have surpassed the combined sales of its last two albums. 乐队新专辑的发售量甚至超过了前两张销售量的总和。
surpass.mean:
vt. 超越，强于： to become better, greater, or stronger than
vt. 突破（界限，纪录等）： to go beyond the limit of

apostasy.example:
n. 放弃宗教信仰: Some people completely abandon the faith after apostasy. 有些人在放弃自己的宗教信仰后就再也不相信任何其他宗教信仰了。
n. 变节，背叛: He was looked down upon for apostasy. 他因为背叛而受到鄙视。
apostasy.mean:
n. 放弃宗教信仰：renunciation of a religious faith
n. 变节，背叛：abandonment of a previous loyalty : defection

dais.example: n. 主席台， 嘉宾席: the speaker took his place at the front of the dais 演讲者在主席台就坐
dais.mean: n. 主席台， 嘉宾席： a raised platform, as in a lecture hall, for speakers or honored guests.

earshot.example: n. 听力所及的范围: wait until he was out of earshot 等到他听不见的时候
earshot.mean: n. 听力所及的范围： the range within which one may hear a person's unaided voice

distend.example: v. 膨胀: The stomachs of starving people often distend. 饥民的肚子经常涨起来。
distend.mean: v. 膨胀：to swell out or expand from or as if from internal pressure

temerity.example: n. 鲁莽，冒失: She was punished for his temerity. 她因冒失迟到了苦头。
temerity.mean: n. 鲁莽，冒失： foolhardy disregard of danger; recklessness

penchant.example: n. 强烈嗜好，迷恋: a penchant for Champaign 非常喜爱香槟
penchant.mean: n. 强烈嗜好，迷恋： a strong and continued inclination

console.example: vt. 安慰，藉慰: Only her children could console her when her husband died. 只有她的孩子们才能安抚她失去丈夫的悲痛
console.mean: vt. 安慰，藉慰： to alleviate the grief, sense of loss, or trouble of; comfort

reprehend.example: vt. 谴责，责难，批评: Without exception, book reviewers reprehended the novel's trite plot. 毫无例外的，小说缺乏新意的故事情节收到了评论家们的责难。
reprehend.mean: vt. 谴责，责难，批评： to express one's unfavorable opinion of the worth or quality of

transparent.example: dj. 没有歧义，清晰易懂的: His meaning in leaving the conversation is transparent: he doesn't want to talk about his combat experiences. 他结束这个话题的意图很明显：不想谈论当年参战的事。
transparent.mean:
dj. 透明的： capable of transmitting light
dj. 没有歧义，清晰易懂的： not subject to misinterpretation or more than one interpretation

arresting.example: adj. 吸引人的: an arresting spectacle 吸引人的奇观
arresting.mean: adj. 吸引人的：attracting and holding the attention; striking

arrest.example:
vt. 使不活跃: arrest the growth of the tumor 抑制肿瘤生长
n/v. 停止: Science cannot yet arrest the process of aging. 科学不能阻止衰老。
v. 逮捕: She was charged with resisting arrest. 她因为拘捕受到起诉。
v. 吸引注意力: The behavior of the daredevil arrested pedestrians. 冒失鬼的行为吸引了行人们的注意力。
arrest.mean:
vt. 使不活跃：to make inactive
n/v. 停止：the stopping of a process or activity; to bring to a standstill
v. 逮捕：to take or keep under one's control by authority of law
v. 吸引注意力：to hold the attention of as if by a spell

exempt.example: vt. 使免除: a man exempted from military service 免服军役的人
exempt.mean: vt. 使免除： to release or deliver from some liability or requirement to which others are subject

mannered.example: adj. 不自然的，做作的: a mannered speech 做作的演讲
mannered.mean: adj. 不自然的，做作的： having an artificial or stilted character

serpentine.example: adj. 弯曲的: the country inn lies at the end of a rather serpentine road 乡村小酒吧坐落在一条非常蜿蜒的道路的尽头
serpentine.mean: adj. 弯曲的： winding or turning one way and another

warrant.example:
vt. 承诺: The computer company unconditionally warrants all of its products for one full year. 这个电脑公司对所有的产品提供为期一年的质量保证。
vt. 批准，认可: The law warrants these measures. 法律允许这些措施。
warrant.mean:
vt. 承诺： to assume responsibility for the satisfactory quality or performance of
vt. 批准，认可： to give official acceptance of as satisfactory

ravel.example:
vt. 解开，松开: Since the sweater is too small, you could ravel the yarnout and make something else with it. 既然这个毛衣太大，你可以把它拆了然后织些新的东西。
vt. 使纠缠，使复杂化: a ravelled story 一个复杂的故事
ravel.mean:
vt. 解开，松开： to separate the various strands of
vt. 阐明： to clarify by separating the aspects of
vt. 使纠缠，使复杂化： to tangle or complicate

enact.example: vt.制定颁布法律: Congress enacted the tax reform bill. 国会颁布了税法改革案
enact.mean: vt.制定颁布法律： to establish by legal and authoritative act

supposition.example: n. 猜想，推测: It's pure supposition on your part that there's something illegal going on next door. 你说隔壁在进行非法勾当纯属猜测。
supposition.mean: n. 猜想，推测： an opinion or judgment based on little or no evidence

minatory.example: adj. 带来威胁的，有凶兆的: The novel's protagonist is haunted by a minatory black specter. 小说的主人公被不详的黑色幽灵所骚扰
minatory.mean: adj. 带来威胁的，有凶兆的： being or showing a sign of evil or calamity to come

masquerade.example:
n. 面具，伪装: Although she was deeply bored, she maintained a masquerade of polite interest as her guest droned on. 尽管她早已对客人滔滔不绝的话感到厌倦，但她还是装出了一幅饶有兴致的样子以示礼貌
v. 伪装，掩饰: masquerade as a policeman化装成警察
masquerade.mean:
n. 面具，伪装： a display of emotion or behavior that is insincere or intended to deceive
v. 伪装，掩饰： to disguise oneself

taunt.example: vt. 嘲弄性质疑，挑衅: The boys continually taunted each other. 男孩子们互相挑衅。
taunt.mean: vt. 嘲弄性质疑，挑衅： to reproach or challenge in a mocking or insulting manner: jeer at

gadfly.example: n. 令人反感的人: a tactless gadfly during post-game interviews with the losing team 在赛后采访败北方时一个令人讨厌的不懂人情世故的人
gadfly.mean:
n. 刺激物： one that acts as a provocative stimulus
n. 令人反感的人： a person who stimulates or annoys especially by persistent criticism

crux.example: n. 中心，关键点: the crux of the problem 问题的核心所在
crux.mean: n. 中心，关键点： the basic, central, or critical point or feature

royalty.example: n. 版税: charge KTV owners royalty fee 向KTV索取版权费
royalty.mean:
n. 皇家身份： regal character or bearing
n. 版税： a payment to an author or composer for each copy of a work sold or to an inventor for each item sold under a patent

repute.example: n. （尤指好的）名声，名誉: Before his national bestseller, he was a writer of little repute. 在他的畅销书出来之前，他是个没什么名声的作家。
repute.mean: n. （尤指好的）名声，名誉： a good reputation

atrophy.example: vi. 萎缩，衰退: The years following the closing of the last textile mill, the town atrophied. 随着最后一家纺织厂的倒闭，整个城镇开始衰退。
atrophy.mean: vi. 萎缩，衰退： to waste away; wither or deteriorate

incessant.example: adj. 无间断的: The incessant noise from an outside repair crew was a real distraction during the test. 窗外维修工发出的持续不断的噪音着实让人在考试里分心
incessant.mean: adj. 无间断的：continuing or following without interruption

descendant.example: n. 后代: They are descendants of the original English and Scottish settlers. 他们是最早一批英格兰和苏格兰定居者的后裔。
descendant.mean: n. 后代： one deriving directly from a precursor or prototype

feral.example:
adj. 野生的: Animal experts discourage homeowners from trying to adopt feral animals as pets. 动物专家们不建议户主们将野生动物收养为宠物
adj. 动物性的: The movie reveals just how thin the veneer of civilization is and how feral we are at bottom. 这部电影展示了所谓文明只不过是薄薄的一层纱，而内心深处我们仍然是野兽
feral.mean:
adj. 野生的： not domesticated or cultivated
adj. 动物性的：having or showing the nature and appetites of a lower animal

bulge.example:
n. 凸起: bulging eyes 暴鱼眼
n. 比赛中的优势地位: somehow she got the bulge on him in the race for the statehouse 她在州议员竞选中领先了他
n. 暴涨，突增，在数目或数量上突然而且是临时性的增加: The baby boom created a bulge in school enrollment. 生育高峰造成学校入学人数的暴涨。
v. 充满: this guidebook to San Francisco positively bulges with useful information 这本对旧金山的指南包含了很多有用信息
bulge.mean:
n. 凸起： a protuberant or swollen part or place
n. 比赛中的优势地位： the more favorable condition or position in a competition
n. 暴涨，突增，在数目或数量上突然而且是临时性的增加： a sudden, usually temporary increase in number or quantity
v. 充满： to be copiously supplied

perpetual.example: adj. 永恒的，不断的: perpetual motion machine 永动机
perpetual.mean: adj. 永恒的，不断的： continuing forever：everlasting

porous.example: adj. 多孔可渗透的: Lava rock has a porous structure which makes the material lightweight and highly moisture-retentive. 火山岩的多孔结构使得它密度很小，同时有很高的吸湿性。
porous.mean: adj. 多孔可渗透的： admitting the passage of gas or liquid through pores or interstices

incendiary.example:
n. 煽动者: behind-the-scenes incendiaries who were intending to overthrow the government 企图推翻政府的幕后煽动者
adj. 煽动性的: an incendiary speech 煽动性的演说
incendiary.mean:
n. 煽动者： a person who stirs up public feelings especially of discontent
adj. 煽动性的： tending to inflame

mastery.example: n. 技艺超群，精通: She has mastery of several languages. 她熟练掌握多种语言
mastery.mean: n. 技艺超群，精通： possession or display of great skill or technique

raffish.example: adj. 低俗的: the dowager cringed at the thought of raffish tourists tromping all over her Persian rugs 寡妇一想到低俗的游客践踏她的波斯地毯就痛苦不已
raffish.mean: adj. 低俗的： marked by or suggestive of flashy vulgarity or crudeness

preoccupation.example: n. 非常关心，全神贯注: He kept sinking back into gloomy preoccupation. 他陷入了深深的忧虑之中。
preoccupation.mean: n. 非常关心，全神贯注： extreme or excessive concern with something

adversity.example: n. 厄运，逆境: The fire is the test of gold, adversity of strong man.(Martha Graham) 烈火试真金，逆境炼勇士。——玛莎?葛兰姆‖finally overcame all the adversities of the Great Depression and rebuilt their fortunes 终于度过了大萧条的困境，开始重新创造他们的财富
adversity.mean: n. 厄运，逆境： a state, condition, or instance of serious or continued difficulty or adverse fortune

incandescent.example:
adj. 明亮灿烂的: incandescent light bulbs 明亮的灯泡
adj. 热情饱满的: It makes me incandescent with fury. 它让我愤怒不已
incandescent.mean:
adj. 明亮灿烂的： strikingly bright, radiant, or clear
adj. 热情饱满的： characterized by glowing zeal

accessible.example:
adj. 可以到达的: the town accessible by rail 有铁路通达的城镇
adj. 可理解的: The information ought to be made more accessible. 信息应该更清晰易懂。
adj. 能够获得的: The data is not currently accessible. 数据目前还不可用。
accessible.mean:
adj. 可以到达的： situated within easy reach
adj. 可理解的： capable of being understood or appreciated
adj. 能够获得的： possible to get

awash.example:
adj. 被淹没的: The streets were awash from the heavy rains. 街道因为大雨被水淹没了
adj. （如洪水般）泛滥的: The program is currently awash in submissions and will not be accepting any more until next term. 该项目的申请人数过多，因此下一轮之前不会再接受任何申请
awash.mean:
adj. 被淹没的： containing, covered with, or thoroughly penetrated by water
adj. （如洪水般）泛滥的： filled, covered, or completely overrun as if by a flood

repartee.example:
n. 机智的回答: That repartee to the reporter's question drew laughs from the bystanders. 对记者问题的那个机智回答引来了旁观者的笑声。
n. 打趣，善意的玩笑: Repartee is harder to do with text messaging. 用短信开起玩笑来困难多了。
repartee.mean:
n. 机智的回答： a quick witty response
n. 打趣，善意的玩笑： good-natured teasing or exchanging of clever remarks

authority.example:
n. （某领域的）权威人士: a leading authority on neural anatomy 一名神经解剖学领域的权威人士
n. 管辖权，控制: The sheriff had authority over the whole county. 郡守对于整个郡都有管辖权
n. 影响力: He speaks with a persuasive authority on matters of public health. 他就公共健康事务发表了带有影响力的、令人信服的评论
n. （管束他人的）权力: By the authority vested in me, I now pronounce you married. 依我所拥有的权力，我宣布你们成为夫妻
n. 根据，理由: On what authority do you make such a claim? 你的指控有何理由？
authority.mean:
n. （某领域的）权威人士： a person with a high level of knowledge or skill in a field
n. 管辖权，控制： lawful control over the affairs of a political unit (as a nation)
n. 影响力： the power to direct the thinking or behavior of others usually indirectly
n. （管束他人的）权力： the right or means to command or control others
n. 根据，理由： a warrant for action

corroborate.example:
vt. 用证据或权威证实: new evidence to corroborate the defendant's story 能证实被告的故事的新证据
vt. 提供证据，支持: My personal experience does not corroborate your faith in the essential goodness of people . 我的经历可不赞同你关于“人性本善”的信念
corroborate.mean:
vt. 用证据或权威证实： to support with evidence or authority; make more certain
vt. 提供证据，支持：to provide evidence or information for (as a claim or idea)

husk.example:
n.（果类或谷物的）外壳: a grey squirrel nibbling on a peanut husk 一个啃着花生壳的灰松鼠
v. 剥去: the tedious task of husking coconuts 无聊的任务——剥花生
husk.mean:
n.（果类或谷物的）外壳： a usually dry or membranous outer covering (as a pod or one composed of bracts) of various seeds and fruits (as barley and corn)
v. 剥去： to remove the natural covering of

convey.example:
vt. 运输: goods conveyed by sea 海路运输的货物
v. 传递，交流: struggling to convey his feelings 挣扎着表达他的情感
convey.mean:
vt. 运输： to take or carry from one place to another; transport
v. 传递，交流： to impart or communicate by statement, suggestion, gesture, or appearance

flush.example:
adj. 富有的: She's very flush now that she has her inheritance. 自从继承了那份遗产，她变得十分富有
adj. 大量的: a field flush with flowers 充满了鲜花的原野
vi. 冲洗: flush a wound with iodine 用碘酒冲洗伤口
flush.mean:
adj. （肤色）健康红润的： having a healthy reddish skin tone
adj. 富有的： having goods, property, or money in abundance
adj. 大量的： marked by abundance
vi. 冲洗： to pour liquid over or through in order to cleanse

elephantine.example:
adj. 巨大的: an elephantine meteor crate 巨大的陨石坑
adj. 笨拙的: elephantine movements 笨拙的行动
elephantine.mean:
adj. 巨大的： having enormous size or strength
adj. 笨拙的： clumsy, ponderous

leery.example: adj. 怀疑的，不信任的: be leery of strangers 对陌生人的怀疑
leery.mean: adj. 怀疑的，不信任的： suspicious or distrustful; wary

drizzle.example: vi./n. （下）细小、轻柔、似雾的雨，毛毛雨: The intermittent drizzle was just heavy enough to spoil all of our outdoor activities. 断断续续的小雨恰好大岛让我们所有的户外活动都泡汤
drizzle.mean: vi./n. （下）细小、轻柔、似雾的雨，毛毛雨： a fine misty rain

shrug.example:
v. 轻视，忽略: The administration was willing to shrug off the problem. 当局有意忽略这个问题。
v. 脱下（衣物等）: She shrugged off her coat and hung it up neatly. 她脱下了她的大衣，将其整齐地挂好。
shrug.mean:
v. 轻视，忽略： to dismiss as of little importance
v. 脱下（衣物等）： to rid oneself of (a garment)

pinpoint.example:
adj. 非常精确的: The commander demanded the pinpoint location of artillery fire. 指挥官需要火炮攻击的精确位置。
v. 精确定位或确认: pinpoint the target by tracking calls from his cellphone 通过跟踪手机信号精确定位了目标‖pinpoint the cause of failure 准确找出失败的原因
pinpoint.mean:
adj. 非常精确的： located, fixed, or directed with extreme precision
v. 精确定位或确认： to locate, fix, determine, or identify with precision

mumble.example: v. 说话含糊: He mumbled an apology reluctantly. 他不情愿地咕哝了句抱歉
mumble.mean: v. 说话含糊： to utter words in a low confused indistinct manner

hurricane.example:
n. 飓风: The hurricane struck the coast early today. 飓风今晨袭击了海岸
n. 飓风般的事物，引起动荡的事物: economic news that unleashed a hurricane on the trading floor 在交易大厅掀起轩然大波的经济新闻
hurricane.mean:
n. 飓风： a violent rotating storm or system of winds
n. 飓风般的事物，引起动荡的事物： something resembling a hurricane especially in its turmoil

gasification.example: n. 气化: gasification of coals 煤的气化
gasification.mean: n. 气化： conversion into gas

overlap.example: vt. 重叠，重复: Baseball season overlaps football season in September. 棒球赛季和橄榄球赛季在九月有时间重合。
overlap.mean: vt. 重叠，重复： to occupy the same area in part

magnitude.example:
n. 重要，重大: The magnitude of the issue is severely underestimated. 这个事件的重要性被严重低估了。
n. 巨大: The mountain's sheer magnitude usually leaves tourists speechless. 巨大的山脉往往让旅游者哑口无言。
magnitude.mean:
n. 重要，重大： greatness in significance or influence
n. 巨大： greatness in size or extent

discretion.example:
n. 谨慎: You must show discretion in choosing your teammates. 你选择队友时必须慎重。
n. 谨慎: resign because of financial indiscretions 因为财政方面的不检点而辞职
n. 自制，节制: In that job you'll be expected to show discretion and act like a professional at all times. 那项工作要求你时刻自制节制，表现得像一个专业人士。
discretion.mean:
n. 谨慎： the quality of being discreet; circumspection
n. 自制，节制： the checking of one's true feelings and impulses when dealing with others

glacial.example:
adj. 极冷的: The air from the sea felt glacial. 海上的空气冷极了。
adj. 冷漠的，无感情的: The Duchess gave him a glacial look and moved on. 公爵夫人冷冷地看了他一眼，然后就继续上路了。
glacial.mean:
adj. 极冷的：extremely cold
adj. 冷漠的，无感情的： devoid of warmth and cordiality

scrutable.example: adj. 可以理解的: Her machinations and motives are all too scrutable to us who know her. 她的阴谋和动机对于了解她的我们来说非常昭然若揭
scrutable.mean: adj. 可以理解的： capable of being understood through study and observation; comprehensible.

pilfer.example: v. 偷窃: pilfer the commercial document 偷窃商业文件
pilfer.mean: v. 偷窃： to steal stealthily in small amounts

voluptuous.example: adj. 奢侈逸乐的，沉溺酒色的: They spent a long and voluptuous holiday in Venice. 他们在威尼斯度过了一个漫长而奢华的假期。
voluptuous.mean: adj. 奢侈逸乐的，沉溺酒色的： given to or spent in enjoyments of luxury, pleasure, or sensual gratifications

slight.example:
adj. 不重要的: a slight comedy that did nothing to further her career 一个并没有帮助她事业发展的小喜剧
dj. 轻微的: only a slight chance of success 只有很小的成功概率‖If you have even the slightest doubt, then don't do it. 只要你有一点点疑惑，那就不要去做了。
vt. 轻蔑，看不起: Those snobbish music critics slight any style of music that doesn't fit their personal taste. 那帮自命不凡的音乐评论家看不起所有不符合他们个人口味的音乐。
vt. 忽略，疏忽: She slighted several major authors in her survey of 20th-century fiction. 她在调查20世纪幻想文学时中忽略了几个重要的作家。
slight.mean:
adj. 不重要的： deficient in weight, importance
dj. 轻微的： small in degree
vt. 轻蔑，看不起： to treat with disdain or indifference
vt. 忽略，疏忽： to fail to give proper attention to

slur.example:
n. 耻辱: Your drunken behavior at the wedding has cast a slur on this family. 你在婚礼上醉酒后的行为给整个家族都带来了耻辱。
vt. 含糊地发音: If you slur your words, the visa officer will have a hard time following you. 如果你说话含糊不清，签证官就很难听懂你的话。
v. 疏忽，忽略: This documentary slurs over certain important facts as it offers a very biased case for a conspiracy theory. 这部纪录片忽略了许多重要的客观事实，而只给出了带有偏见的阴谋论解释。
slur.mean:
n. 耻辱： a mark of guilt or disgrace
vt. 含糊地发音： to pronounce indistinctly
v. 疏忽，忽略： to slide or slip over without due mention, consideration, or emphasis

astounding.example: adj. 令人吃惊的，出乎意料的: The richness and variety of the undersea environment are astounding．富饶而多样的海底环境是令人惊奇的。
astounding.mean: adj. 令人吃惊的，出乎意料的：causing astonishment or amazement

maven.example: n. 专家: As an investment maven, he was doing well even when the market was doing poorly. 作为一名投资高手，他在市场不景气的时候也能赚钱
maven.mean: n. 专家： one who is experienced or knowledgeable: expert

predilection.example: n. 爱好，偏袒: a predilection for travel 热爱旅行
predilection.mean: n. 爱好，偏袒：a partiality or disposition in favor of something

expire.example:
v. 断气，死亡: The patient expired early this morning. 病人今早逝世了。
v. 到期: My membership in the club has expired. 我的会员资格到期了。
expire.mean:
v. 断气，死亡： to breathe one's last breath; die
v. 到期： to come to an end

vignette.example: n. 简介短文: The general's memoirs are filled with revealing vignettes of some of the war’s most compelling personalities. 将军的回忆录里充满了短小的文章，它们揭露了战争中最引人注意的人物。
vignette.mean: n. 简介短文： a vivid representation in words of someone or something

fetid.example: adj. 恶臭的: Ammonia has a fetid odor that sickened the people. 氨气有着令人作呕的气味
fetid.mean: adj. 恶臭的： having a heavy offensive smell

adversary.example: n. 敌手，对手: political adversary 政敌
adversary.mean: n. 敌手，对手： one that contends with, opposes, or resists : enemy

retribution.example: n. 报偿，报应: The neighborhood is being torn apart by an endless cycle of gang violence and retribution. 这个社区正在被帮派间斗争和仇恨的恶性循环割裂。
retribution.mean: n. 报偿，报应： the dispensing or receiving of reward or punishment especially in the hereafter

throng.example: vi./n. 大量聚集: commuters thronging the MTR platform 持月票的乘客拥向地铁站
throng.mean: vi./n. 大量聚集： to crowd together in great numbers

linger.example: vi. 磨蹭，闲荡: fans lingered outside the door 粉丝们在门外徘徊
linger.mean: vi. 磨蹭，闲荡： to proceed slowly; saunter

complaisance.example:
n. 愿意顺从，讨好，彬彬有礼: She speaks with complaisance. 说话彬彬有礼。|| The complaisance of his girlfriend is such that she meekly goes along with everything he says. 他的女朋友讨好他，对他言听计从。
n. 愿意顺从，讨好，彬彬有礼:
complaisance.mean: n. 愿意顺从，讨好，彬彬有礼：disposition to please or comply: affability

ingest.example: vt. 摄入，咽下: claims that the average person ingests considerably more calories than is necessary or desirable 宣称每个人平均摄取的卡路里大大超出了所需或者适当的范围
ingest.mean: vt. 摄入，咽下： to take into the body by the mouth for digestion or absorption

merited.example: adj. 应得的，理所当然的: a merited bonus 应得的奖金‖The punishment, although harsh, was entirely merited. 虽然惩罚很严厉，但的确是应得的
merited.mean: adj. 应得的，理所当然的： being what is called for by accepted standards of right and wrong

compatible.example: adj. 一致的，能共存的: I don’t think that they could be compatible as roommates. 我不觉得他们做了室友之后生活会很和谐。‖a theory that is compatible with what we already know about early man 一个与对远古人类的已有知识不存在矛盾的理论
compatible.mean: adj. 一致的，能共存的： capable of existing together in harmony

swear.example:
vi. 咒骂: no one is allowed to swear in this house 这个房间里禁止说脏话
v. 宣誓: He swore his oath of allegiance to the queen. 他宣誓效忠女王
swear.mean:
vi. 咒骂： to use profane or obscene language: curse
v. 宣誓： to promise or pledge with a solemn oath; vow

evoke.example: vt. 唤起，引发: evoke memories 唤起回忆
evoke.mean: vt. 唤起，引发： to call forth or up

epitomize.example:
v. 摘要: his personal code of behavior on the playing field is epitomized by his favorite saying, Nice guys finish last. 他在赛场上的座右铭是：好男坚持到底。
v. 代表，体现，是…的典型范例: the Parthenon in Athens epitomizes the ancient Greek ideal of architectural beauty 雅典的巴特农神庙体现了古希腊对于建筑美感的理念 || behavior that epitomizes selfishness 典型的自私行为
epitomize.mean:
v. 摘要： to make into a short statement of the main points (as of a report)
v. 代表，体现，是…的典型范例： to represent in visible form, to be a typical example of

revise.example: vt. 更改，修正: There are many problems involved in revising a dictionary. 修正字典会牵涉到诸多问题。‖With the snow, we'll need to revise our travel plans. 因为下雪了，我们不得不更改旅游计划。
revise.mean: vt. 更改，修正： to look over again in order to correct or improve

revere.example: vt. （尤指对神的）尊崇，尊敬: He is revered for his valor. 他因为他的英勇而受到尊敬。‖In some cultures people revere their ancestors, even leaving food offerings for them. 在一些文化当中，人们非常敬重先人，甚至将一些食物留下来供他们享用。
revere.mean: vt. （尤指对神的）尊崇，尊敬： to offer honor or respect to (someone) as a divine power

outset.example: n. 开端，开始: I wish you'd mentioned this problem at the outset. 我希望你开门见山就提到这个问题。
outset.mean: n. 开端，开始： beginning, start

polished.example:
adj. 有教养的: He maintained a very polished tone in his correspondences. 他在通信中保持着一种极有教养的口吻。
adj. 擦亮的: She could see her face reflected in the polished hood of the car. 她可以通过引擎盖光亮的表面看到自己的脸。
polished.mean:
adj. 有教养的： showing a high degree of refinement and the assurance that comes from wide social experience
adj. 擦亮的： having a shiny surface or finish

dulcet.example: adj. 悦耳的，令人愉悦的: dulcet tones from harps and flutes 竖琴和长笛发出的悦耳音调
dulcet.mean: adj. 悦耳的，令人愉悦的： pleasing to the ear; melodious; generally pleasing or agreeable

stultify.example: vt. 使无效，抑制: The accident stultified his previous efforts. 这场意外使他过去的努力都白费了。
stultify.mean: vt. 使无效，抑制： to deprive of vitality and render futile especially by enfeebling or repressive influences

satire.example: n. 讽刺诗，讽剌文学: a satire about the music industry in which a handsome but untalented youth is turned into a rock star 一部关于一个长得帅却没才华的年轻人如何被打造成一个摇滚巨星的讽刺文学作品
satire.mean: n. 讽刺诗，讽剌文学： a literary work holding up human vices and follies to ridicule or scorn

commitment.example:
n. 致力，投入: a commitment to a cause 投身于某项事业
n. 承诺，表态: He made a commitment to pay the rent on time. 他承诺按时交房租。
commitment.mean:
n. 致力，投入：the state or an instance of being obligated or emotionally impelled
n. 确信：a strong belief in something
n. 承诺，表态：the act of revealing one’s view of

articulate.example:
v. 清晰地表达: He cannot articulate his thoughts. 他不能清楚地表达他的想法。
v. 清晰地表达: a theory first articulated by ancient philosophers 被古时哲学家阐明的理论
adj. 表达清晰的: The television crew covering the science fair were looking for photogenic and articulate students to explain their projects on the air
articulate.mean:
v. 清晰地表达：to utter clearly and distinctly
adj. 表达清晰的：able to express oneself clearly and well

vituperate.example: vt. 谩骂，责骂: was vituperated for betraying his friends 因为背叛他的朋友而被责骂
vituperate.mean: vt. 谩骂，责骂： to abuse or censure severely or abusively

assess.example:
v. 评估重要性、尺寸、价值等: We need to assess whether or not the system is working. 我们需要评估这个系统是否工作。
v. 评估重要性、尺寸、价值等: Damage to the boat was assessed at $5,000. 船的损失是$5,000。
v. 征收费用（如罚款）: The utility company will assess a fee if your payment is late. 如果你付款晚了，公共事业公司会罚款。
assess.mean:
v. 评估重要性、尺寸、价值等：to determine the importance, size, or value of
v. 征收费用（如罚款）：to establish or apply as a charge or penalty

chronic.example:
adj. 经常发生的，复发的: chronic disease 慢性病
adj. 习惯性的，不可能改变的: a chronic smoker who has quit many times 一个戒了很多次烟的老烟民
chronic.mean:
adj. 经常发生的，复发的：marked by long duration or frequent recurrence
adj. 习惯性的，不可能改变的：being such by habit and not likely to change

disaffected.example: adj. 不满的，叛逆的: gangs of disaffected teenagers 一群叛逆的年轻人 || The soldiers were disaffected toward the government. 那些士兵对政府不满.
disaffected.mean: adj. 不满的，叛逆的： discontented and resentful especially against authority; rebellious

esteem.example: n./v. 尊重: be held in high esteem 被高度敬仰
esteem.mean: n./v. 尊重： to regard with respect; prize

thwart.example: vt. 阻挠: She did all she could to thwart his plans. 她竭尽所能阻挠他的计划。
thwart.mean: vt. 阻挠： to oppose successfully

hideous.example: adj. 非常丑陋的: wearing a hideous Halloween mask that made the kids all jump with fright 戴着一个丑陋的万圣节面具把小孩子全都吓跑了
hideous.mean: adj. 非常丑陋的： exceedingly ugly

puissance.example: n. 权力: the president pledged to put the full puissance of the nation into the war effort 总统下令全国进入战争状态

prepossessing.example: adj. 给人好感的: He was fascinated by her prepossessing appearance at first sight. 他第一眼就被她迷人的外表吸引了。
prepossessing.mean: adj. 给人好感的：serving to impress favorably

repeal.example:
vt. 撤销，废除（法律等）: The company called the furniture store to repeal the order for six new desks. 公司要求家具店撤销六张新桌子的订单。‖In 1933, Congress passed the 21st Amendment which repealed the Prohibition Amendment of 1919, thus making the sale, distribution, and use of alcohol legal once again. 1933年，国会通过了《第二十一修正案》，该法案废除了于1919年制订的《禁酒法》，从而使得酒的买卖、配送和使用再次合法化。
vt. 宣布与…决裂: If I find that you have been lying about this, I'll instantly repeal every promise I made to you. 只要我发现在这个问题上你对我撒了谎，那我们之间的承诺就彻底断裂了。
repeal.mean:
vt. 撤销，废除（法律等）： to rescind or annul by authoritative act
vt. 宣布与…决裂： to refuse to follow, obey, or recognize any further

rejoice.example: vi. 欣喜，喜悦: We rejoiced over our unexpected victory on the soccer field. 我们为预料之外的足球胜利而感到欢喜。
rejoice.mean: vi. 欣喜，喜悦： to feel joy or great delight

elastic.example:
adj. 有弹性的: elastic rubber band 弹性橡胶圈
adj. 能（迅速从伤痛中）恢复的: owe her success to an elastic optimistic nature 将她的成功归因于能迅速走出悲伤的乐观品质
elastic.mean:
adj. 有弹性的： easily resuming original shape after being stretched or expanded
adj. 能（迅速从伤痛中）恢复的： capable of recovering quickly especially from depression or disappointment

extraction.example: n. 血统: a family of French extraction 有法国血统的家族
extraction.mean: n. 血统： origin; lineage; ancestry

egalitarian.example: adj. 平等主义的: the egalitarian principle guiding his endeavor 引导他奋斗的平等主义原则
egalitarian.mean: adj. 平等主义的： affirming, promoting, or characterized by belief in equal political, economic, social, and civil rights for all people

incipient.example: adj. 起初的，初现的: an incipient economic recovery 刚刚出现的经济复苏
incipient.mean: adj. 起初的，初现的： beginning to come into being or to become apparent

luminary.example: n. 杰出人物: Buddhist luminary 佛学大师‖Luminaries from the worlds of sports, entertainment, and politics were at the gala. 全球体育界、娱乐圈和政界的名人都出席了此次盛会
luminary.mean: n. 杰出人物： a person who has achieved eminence in a specific field

imperial.example:
adj. 帝国的，帝王的: Imperial College London 帝国理工学院
adj. 巨大的，令人惊叹的: envisioned an imperial city that would rival the capitals of Europe for beauty and magnificence 幻想着一个比欧洲各国首都更为动人和壮丽的巨大城市
imperial.mean:
adj. 帝国的，帝王的： of, relating to, or suggestive of an empire or a sovereign, especially an emperor or empress
adj. 巨大的，令人惊叹的： large and impressive in size, grandeur, extent, or conception

stamina.example: n. 耐力: A marathon challenges a runner's stamina. 马拉松挑战参赛者的耐力。
stamina.mean: n. 耐力： physical or moral strength to resist or withstand illness, fatigue, or hardship

imbibe.example: v. 喝水，摄取水分: Plants can imbibe water through their roots. 植物可以通过它们的根摄取水分
imbibe.mean: v. 喝水，摄取水分： to take in (something liquid) through small openings

heresy.example: n. 异教，和普遍观点相悖: the heresy of asserting that Shakespeare was not a great writer 声称莎士比亚不是伟大作家的非主流观点
heresy.mean: n. 异教，和普遍观点相悖： a controversial or unorthodox opinion or doctrine, departure from a generally accepted theory, opinion, or practice

extravagant.example:
adj. 挥霍的: has always been extravagant with her money 挥金如土
adj. 过度的，不必要的: the book doesn't quite merit the extravagant praise that it has received 这本书被盛赞过度
extravagant.mean:
adj. 挥霍的： given to spending money freely or foolishly
adj. 过度的，不必要的： going beyond a normal or acceptable limit in degree or amount

rostrum.example: n. 讲坛，演讲坛: He finally stood on the winner's rostrum. 他终于站在了胜利者的领奖台上。
rostrum.mean: n. 讲坛，演讲坛： a stage for public speaking

purlieu.example:
n. 常去的地方: The restaurant, the preferred purlieu of the theatergoing crowd, is always packed an hour or two before showtime. 观剧的人群经常去的那间餐厅，总是在演出开始前1-2小时爆满。
