n. 临近的地区: We stopped at one of the several pubs in the purlieus of the stadium. 我们在体育馆附近的一间酒吧停下来。
purlieu.mean:
n. 常去的地方： a place for spending time or for socializing
n. 临近的地区： an adjoining region or space

glib.example:
adj. 流利圆滑的（常含有不真诚或欺诈的成分），油腔滑调的: a glib politician 油嘴滑舌的政客
adj. 缺乏深度的，肤浅的: glib solutions to the knotty problem 对复杂难解问题的肤浅的解决方案
glib.mean:
adj. 流利圆滑的（常含有不真诚或欺诈的成分），油腔滑调的： marked by ease and fluency in speaking or writing often to the point of being insincere or deceitful
adj. 缺乏深度的，肤浅的： lacking depth and substance

nourish.example:
vt. 养育，抚养: He willingly nourished a child that was not his own. 他主动地抚养了一名不是他亲生的孩子。
vt. 培养，促进: a friendship nourished by trust 在信任的基础之上开出的友谊之花
nourish.mean:
vt. 养育，抚养： to provide with food or other substances necessary for life and growth
vt. 培养，促进： to help the growth or development of

elate.example: v. 使开心，使自豪: The phenomenal sales record elated him. 卓越的业绩让他高兴不已
elate.mean: v. 使开心，使自豪： to fill with joy or pride

complacency.example: n. 自满，无忧患意识: Complacency is the enemy of study. 自满乃学习之敌。|| A momentary complacency that was quickly dispelled by the shock of cold reality. 短暂的自满很快就被残酷的现实赶跑了。
complacency.mean: n. 自满，无忧患意识：a feeling of self-satisfaction, coupled with an unawareness of trouble

baffling.example: adj. 令人疑惑的，难以理解的: I was constantly ill, with a baffling array of symptoms. 我常常生病，而且有着一系列令人困惑的症状。
baffling.mean: adj. 令人疑惑的，难以理解的： making great mental demands; hard to comprehend or solve

amity.example: n.友好, 亲善和睦关系: live in amity with his neighbors 与邻居和谐相处；They parted in amity. 他们很友好地分别了。
amity.mean: n.友好, 亲善和睦关系：friendship; especially: friendly relations between nations

taciturn.example: adj. 沉默寡言的，话少的: A taciturn man never initiates a conversation. 一个寡言的男人从不主动和人说话。
taciturn.mean: adj. 沉默寡言的，话少的： temperamentally disinclined to talk

dabble.example:
v. 浅尝辄止: dabble in arts 对艺术稍有涉猎
v. 浅尝辄止: He's not a dedicated musician, just a dabbler. 他并不是专门的音乐家, 只不过是个业馀爱好者
dabble.mean: v. 浅尝辄止： to work or involve oneself superficially or intermittently especially in a secondary interest

evacuate.example:
vt. 撤空: were ordered to evacuate the building 被命令搬出大楼
vt. 撤退: During World War II, children were evacuated from London to the country. 二战期间，伦敦市的儿童被撤离到郊区。
evacuate.mean:
vt. 撤空： to empty or remove the contents of
vt. 撤退： to remove especially from a military zone or dangerous area

admonish.example:
v. 建议: admonished the patient to eat more healthy foods 建议患者多吃健康食品
v. 责备: admonished her for littering 责备她乱扔垃圾
admonish.mean:
v. 建议： to give advice to
v. 责备： to reprove gently but earnestly.

hierarchical.example: adj. 分等级的，等级制的: the traditional hierarchical system of military organization 军队中传统的等级制度
hierarchical.mean: adj. 分等级的，等级制的： classified according to various criteria into successive levels or layers

wince.example: vi. 畏缩: winced at the horrible corpses 在令人恐惧的尸体面前畏缩
wince.mean: vi. 畏缩： to shrink back involuntarily as from pain

grate.example:
vt. 刮擦（以发出刺耳的声音）: The sled grated along the bare pavement. 雪橇与裸露的路面刮擦发出刺耳声
vt. 骚扰，惹恼: a noise that grates on one's nerves 使人烦躁的噪音
grate.mean:
vt. 刮擦（以发出刺耳的声音）： to make a rasping sound
vt. 骚扰，惹恼：to irritate or annoy persistently

assail.example:
vt. 抨击，严厉批评: The union organizers assailed the chemical company for failing to provide a safe working environment. 工会主席因为这家化工企业不能为员工提供安全的生产环境而对其进行了严厉的抨击。
vt. 攻击，猛攻: He was assailed by a young man with a knife. 他被一个持刀的年轻人揍了一顿。
assail.mean:
vt. 抨击，严厉批评： to criticize harshly and usually publicly
vt. 攻击，猛攻： to take sudden, violent action against

strident.example: adj. 刺耳的: plagued by the strident noise 被刺耳的噪声所折磨
strident.mean: adj. 刺耳的： characterized by harsh, insistent, and discordant sound

versatile.example:
adj. 多才多艺的，全能的: We have found a versatile baseball player who can play any position. 我们发现了一个能打任何位置的全能型球员。
adj. 易改变的: a versatile disposition 多变的性格
versatile.mean:
adj. 多才多艺的，全能的： able to do many different kinds of things
adj. 易改变的： changing or fluctuating readily

embargo.example: n. 贸易禁止令: a trade embargo on luxuries 对奢侈品的禁运令
embargo.mean: n. 贸易禁止令： a legal prohibition on commerce

paean.example: n. 欢乐颂: her retirement party featured many paeans for her long years of service to the company 她的退休派对满是对她多年在公司辛勤工作的赞颂
paean.mean: n. 欢乐颂： a joyous song or hymn of praise, tribute, thanksgiving, or triumph

flit.example: vi. 快速或突然地经过: Memories of the evening flitted through her mind. 关于那一晚的记忆在她脑海中一掠而过。
flit.mean: vi. 快速或突然地经过：to pass quickly or abruptly from one place or condition to another

embolden.example: v. 鼓励，使大胆: be emboldened by the wine 借酒壮胆
embolden.mean: v. 鼓励，使大胆： to instill with boldness or courage

grieve.example: vt. 感到悲伤: we all grieved over the lost cat 看到他这副样子真让我痛苦
grieve.mean: vt. 感到悲伤： to feel deep sadness or mental pain

distract.example:
vt. 转移兴趣，使分心: be distracted by a sudden noise 被突然的噪音分心
vt. 使焦虑，使不安: The students are easily distracted before the exam. 学生们在考试前很容易焦虑不安。
distract.mean:
vt. 转移兴趣，使分心：to draw or direct (as one's attention) to a different object
vt. 使焦虑，使不安：to trouble the mind of; to make uneasy
adj. 疯狂的：insane, mad

demonstrate.example:
v. （通过证据）证明，表明: the paleontologist hopes to demonstrate that dinosaurs once existed in central Peru by unearthing the fossil evidence 通过发掘化石，古生物学家试图证明恐龙曾经在秘鲁中部生活过
v. 使明白易懂: a few striking facts should demonstrate the complex nature of our topic 一些显著的事实可以使我们话题的复杂本质变得好懂
v. 表现，表露: the babysitter's actions during the emergency demonstrate beyond doubt her general dependability 保姆在紧急情况下的表现毋庸置疑地展示了她一贯的可靠性
demonstrate.mean:
v. （通过证据）证明，表明： to show or make clear by using examples
v. 使明白易懂： to make plain or understandable
v. 表现，表露： to make known (something abstract) through outward signs

rickety.example: adj. 不稳的: The rickety coalition may break at any moment. 脆弱的联盟随时都可能破裂。
rickety.mean: adj. 不稳的： lacking stability or firmness

profusion.example:
n. 丰富，大量: snow falling in profusion 雪量很大
n. 挥霍，浪费: in giving gifts to his girlfriend, he was generous to the point of profusion 对于给女朋友的礼物支出一项，他慷慨到了几乎奢侈的地步
profusion.mean:
n. 丰富，大量： the state of being profuse; abundance
n. 挥霍，浪费： the quality or fact of being free or wasteful in the expenditure of money

calibrate.example: vt. 校准，调校: We need to calibrate the sextants navigation. 我们要为航行校准六分仪。
calibrate.mean: vt. 校准，调校： to check, adjust, or determine by comparison with a standard (the graduations of a quantitative measuring instrument)

dearth.example: n. 供应不足: a dearth of evidence 证据不足
dearth.mean: n. 供应不足： an inadequate supply

wheedle.example: vt. （用花言巧语）诱惑，哄骗: wheedled him into working for them 哄骗他为他们工作‖She pleaded and wheedled, but I wouldn't be swayed. 她软磨硬泡地求我，但我仍不动摇。
wheedle.mean: vt. （用花言巧语）诱惑，哄骗： to persuade or attempt to persuade by flattery or guile

pastiche.example:
n. （带嘲讽的）模仿: a pastiche of Botticelli's Birth of Venus 波提且利画作《维纳斯的诞生》的仿品
n. 大杂烩: a pastiche of dishes from many countries 来自众多国家的饮食杂烩
pastiche.mean:
n. （带嘲讽的）模仿： a literary, artistic, musical, or architectural work that imitates the style of previous work, often with satirical intent
n. 大杂烩： a pasticcio of incongruous parts; a hodgepodge

veracious.example:
adj. 诚实的，说实话的: a veracious witness 诚实的证人‖He has a reputation for being veracious, so people generally take his word for things. 他诚实的名声让其他人通常都相信他说的话
adj. 精确的，准确的: a novel that presents a fairly veracious and unvarnished picture of the lives of affluent suburbanites 一部准确而不加修饰地描述郊区富人生活的小说
veracious.mean:
adj. 诚实的，说实话的： being in the habit of telling the truth
adj. 精确的，准确的： precise, accurate

oaf.example: n. 愚蠢的人: Anyone who took him for an oaf and tried to cheat him would be in for a nasty surprise. 任何把他当成傻子然后想借机欺骗他的人就等着大吃一惊吧。
oaf.mean: n. 愚蠢的人： a stupid person

lopsided.example:
adj. 歪的，倾斜的: The portrait in the foyer was lopsided. 门厅里的画像挂歪了
adj.不平衡的，不协调的: The arrangement of the furniture was lopsided. 家具的摆放太不协调了‖a lopsided score of 4-0 四比零的压倒比分
lopsided.mean:
adj. 歪的，倾斜的： leaning to one side
adj.不平衡的，不协调的： lacking in balance, symmetry, or proportion

prosperous.example: adj. 成功的，繁盛的: The company had a prosperous year. 公司今年业绩斐然。
prosperous.mean: adj. 成功的，繁盛的： marked by vigorous growth and well-being especially economically

soporific.example:
n. 安眠药: Alcohol is a poor hypnotic because it disturbs sleep patterns, and so can worsen sleep disorders. 酒精是一种欠佳的安眠药，因为它会干扰睡眠的固定模式，从而恶化睡眠紊乱的情况。
adj. 催眠的: This medication is soporific, so do not drive after taking it. 这种药物是催眠的，服用之后切忌开车。‖the soporific heat of summer 夏日里催人欲睡的阳光
adj. 慵懒的，困倦的: A big lunch always makes me soporific in the afternoon. 中午一顿大餐总是让我下午感到困倦。
soporific.mean:
n. 安眠药： a drug or other substance that induces sleep
adj. 催眠的： causing or tending to cause sleep
adj. 慵懒的，困倦的： of, relating to, or marked by sleepiness or lethargy

dilatory.example: adj. 拖延的，磨蹭的: dilatory tactics 拖延战术 || The homeowner is claiming that local firefighters were dilatory in responding to the call. 业主声称本地的消防队员对（火警）电话的有拖延。
dilatory.mean: adj. 拖延的，磨蹭的： tending or intended to cause delay, characterized by procrastination

boor.example: n. 粗鲁的人，不敏感的人: acting like boor 表现得很粗鲁
boor.mean: n. 粗鲁的人，不敏感的人： a rude or insensitive person

venial.example: adj. 可宽恕的: Taking the restaurant's menu as a souvenir seems like a venial offense. 把餐厅的菜单当成纪念品带走似乎是一个可以宽恕的罪行。
venial.mean: adj. 可宽恕的： easily excused or forgiven

mimic.example:
adj. 仿真的，仿造的: Police were concerned that the mimic gun, although intended only as a toy, might be confused with the real thing in certain situations. 尽管仿真枪只是玩具，但警方担忧在某些情况下它会被误认为是真枪
v. 做滑稽的模仿（以取笑）: The comedian was famous for mimicking the President's distinctive lisp. 这个演员因能滑稽地模仿总统特有的口齿不清而闻名
v. 模仿: began to learn their language by mimicking the sounds they made 通过模仿发音来学习语言
mimic.mean:
adj. 仿真的，仿造的： being such in appearance only and made with or manufactured from usually cheaper materia
v. 做滑稽的模仿（以取笑）： to copy or exaggerate (someone or something) in order to make fun of
v. 模仿： to use (someone or something) as the model for one's speech, mannerisms, or behavior

detain.example: v. 拘留: detained by the police for questioning 被警察扣留下问讯
detain.mean: v. 拘留： to hold or keep in or as if in custody

boon.example: n. 恩惠，福利: The new solar battery booster is a boon for photographers. 这个光伏充电器是摄影家的福音
boon.mean:
n. 恩惠，福利： benefit, favor
adj. 喜欢集体行动的： likely to seek or enjoy the company of others

unlettered.example: adj. 未受教育的，文盲的: unlettered sector of society 未受教育的地区
unlettered.mean: adj. 未受教育的，文盲的： not adept at reading and writing; deficient in the knowledge that can be acquired from books. illiterate

fledgling.example: n. 新手: At hockey he's still a fledgling and needs to work on his basic skating skills. 在冰球场上他还是一个菜鸟，还需要在基本的滑冰技术上加强练习
fledgling.mean: n. 新手： a person who is just starting out in a field of activity

incorrigible.example:
adj. 不可救药的，积习难改的: an incorrigible criminal deserving death penalty 一个应该被判死刑的恶习难改的罪犯
adj. 无法管制的: an incorrigible, spoiled child 被宠坏了的难管的孩子
incorrigible.mean:
adj. 不可救药的，积习难改的： incapable of being corrected or amended
adj. 无法管制的： difficult or impossible to control or manage

reckless.example: adj. 不考虑后果的，大胆鲁莽的: His reckless driving accounted for the accident. 他鲁莽的开车行为导致了这场事故。
reckless.mean: adj. 不考虑后果的，大胆鲁莽的： careless of consequences; foolishly adventurous or bold

lance.example:
n. 长矛，标枪: The lance struck squarely on the knight's shield, knocking him from his horse. 标枪正中盾牌，将骑士掀于马下。
vt. 刺穿，刺破: Doctors used to lance infected sores, so that they could drain clean. 以前医生会刺破受感染的疮，从而使脓液流出。
lance.mean:
n. 长矛，标枪： a weapon with a long straight handle and sharp head or blade
vt. 刺穿，刺破： to penetrate or hold (something) with a pointed object

dismantle.example: vt. 分解，分拆: dismantle a machine 分拆机器
dismantle.mean: vt. 分解，分拆：to take to pieces also : to destroy the integrity or functioning of

lubricate.example: vt. 使润滑: lubricate the gears 给齿轮打润滑油
lubricate.mean: vt. 使润滑： to coat (something) with a slippery substance in order to reduce friction

frustrate.example:
vt. 挫败，阻挠: frustrated their scheme in time 及时挫败了他们的阴谋
vt. 使沮丧: frustrated by his failure 为他的失败感到沮丧
frustrate.mean:
vt. 挫败，阻挠： to prevent from accomplishing a purpose or fulfilling a desire
vt. 使沮丧： to lessen the courage or confidence of

foil.example: v. 挫败: foil her enemy by pulling some strings 通过一些关系和手段挫败了她的对手
foil.mean: v. 挫败： to prevent from being successful; defeat

airtight.example:
adj. 无瑕疵的: an airtight argument 滴水不漏、无懈可击的论断
adj. 密封的，不透气的: an airtight seal 不透气的封口
airtight.mean:
adj. 无瑕疵的： having no noticeable weakness, flaw, or loophole
adj. 密封的，不透气的：impermeable to air or nearly so

scintillate.example:
vi. 闪耀: diamond ring scintillated in the sunlight 钻戒在阳光下闪闪发光
vi. 闪耀: a scintillating conversation
scintillate.mean: vi. 闪耀： to emit sparks

dissension.example: n. 意见不合: Although we have dissension, we are friend all the same. 虽然我们意见不和，但我们还是朋友。|| There is a continued dissension among historians on the exact spot of Columbus's first landing. 关于哥伦布第一次的准确登陆地点这个问题，总是存在分歧。
dissension.mean: n. 意见不合：difference of opinion; disagreement

epilogue.mean:
n. 文学作品的结局： a concluding section that rounds out the design of a literary work
n. 戏剧的收场白： the final scene of a play that comments on or summarizes the main action

extort.example: v. 勒索: The criminals extorted large sums of money from their victims. 绑匪向受害者勒索大笔钱财。
extort.mean: v. 勒索： to obtain from a person by force, intimidation, or undue or illegal power

ramble.example:
vi. 漫步，漫游: rambling under the starlight 在星光下漫步‖rambling around Beijing for a week 在北京四处漫游一周
vi. 漫谈；长篇大论（并经常离题）地说或写: rambling on about dating, homework, movies, and the local football team 扯了一些关于约会、作业、电影以及本地橄榄球队的闲谈
ramble.mean:
vi. 漫步，漫游： to move aimlessly from place to place
vi. 漫谈；长篇大论（并经常离题）地说或写： to talk at length without sticking to a topic or getting to a point

prevalent.example: adj. 流行的，普遍的: The kinds of accidents are frequently seen in places where snowmobiles are prevalent. 这种类型的事故在摩托雪橇盛行的地区是很常见的。
prevalent.mean: adj. 流行的，普遍的： widely or commonly occurring, existing, accepted, or practiced

insipid.example:
adj. （食品）清淡无味的: a rather insipid soup 味道清淡的汤
adj. 平淡的，无聊的: an insipid story of the prince and the princess一个关于王子和公主的无聊故事
insipid.mean:
adj. （食品）清淡无味的： lacking flavor or zest; not tasty
adj. 平淡的，无聊的： lacking in qualities that interest, stimulate, or challenge

fertilize.example: vt. 使肥沃，使多产: Reading will fertilize vocabulary. 阅读丰富词汇
fertilize.mean: vt. 使肥沃，使多产： to make fertile

coquette.example:
n. 调情的女子: A coquette though she might appear to be at first, Violetta from Verdi’s La Traviata is actually yearning for true love. 乍看之下，威尔第歌剧《茶花女》中的薇奥莱塔是一个轻浮的女子，但实际上她渴望真爱
v. 不认真对待: interested only in coquetting with her, not marrying her 只想与她保持暧昧关系，而不结婚
coquette.mean:
n. 调情的女子： a woman who makes teasing sexual or romantic overtures; a flirt
v. 不认真对待： to deal with something playfully rather than seriously

abhor.example: vt. 深恶痛绝，极度厌恶: He abhors the way people leave their trash at the picnic sites in the park. 他很厌恶人们把垃圾留在公园的野餐点。
abhor.mean: vt. 深恶痛绝，极度厌恶： to regard with extreme repugnance

entreat.example: vt. 恳求: entreated his boss for another chance 恳求老板再给一次机会
entreat.mean: vt. 恳求： to plead with especially in order to persuade, ask urgently

mercenary.example:
n. 雇佣军: hire a mercenary army to protect the VIP 雇佣了一支佣兵来保护重要人物
adj. 唯利是图的，贪婪的: Virtue flies from the heart of a mercenary man. 唯利是图的人没有美德可言
mercenary.mean:
n. 雇佣军： a professional soldier hired for service in a foreign army
adj. 唯利是图的，贪婪的： motivated solely by a desire for monetary or material gain

torrid.example:
adj. 酷热的: the dry, torrid summers in southern Arizona 南亚利桑那州干燥、炎热的夏天
adj. 热情的，情感深厚的: torrid love affair 炙热的爱
torrid.mean:
adj. 酷热的： intensely hot
adj. 热情的，情感深厚的： having or expressing great depth of feeling

commencement.example:
n. 开始: There was a large turnout at the commencement of the conference, but the numbers dwindled as it progressed. 在会议开始的时候，有很多人出席。但是随着会议的发展，人慢慢变少了。
n. 毕业典礼the ceremonies or the day for conferring degrees or diplomas
: The purpose of a commencement speaker is to dispense wisdom. 毕业典礼的演讲者的目的是传播智慧。
commencement.mean:
n. 开始：a beginning; a start.
n. 毕业典礼the ceremonies or the day for conferring degrees or diplomas

buoy.example: vt. 使充满勇气和力量，使振作: the sudden improvement in his health buoyed him up 身体的突然好转让他很振奋
buoy.mean: vt. 使充满勇气和力量，使振作： to fill with courage or strength of purpose
